review_title: We have used destinology for 4 of our‚Ä¶
review_text: We have used destinology for 4 of our holidays now.We're amazing when our last holiday got cancelled. Kept us informed about the vouchers and refunds.

review_title: I would like to say that Beth Higson‚Ä¶
review_text: I would like to say that Beth Higson was so helpful and orofessional - she went out of her way to help and always called me back when she said. I have used Destinology on numerous occasions and would recommend them to family and friends

Sophie was truly MAGNIFICENT at arranging my Southampton to NYC sailing crossing, transfers, hotel and return flight. It was a complicated order and she dealt with in a calm processional manner, keeping me fully informed all the way! I am truly grateful and so impressed by her. I cannot thank her enough. Sh is a credit to the company she works for. Thank you. Sonya x

review_title: Booking a vacation in the Maldives
review_text: We found Faisal very responsive to our  enquiry. He provided us with what we wanted with a good selection to work with. He was not continuously chasing us to make a decision but allowed us time to review his proposals. The sequencing was good too- he reserved the chosen holiday but then made sure we could book our flights before finalising the booking.Good job

Durin the whole process, from considering where to go all the way up to payment of the deposit, Keith was helpful and gave good advice. He was happy to get all sorts of quotes for us, catering to our constant mind changing! As a result we have booked a holiday, safe in the knowledge that should the pandemic get in the way, we will be able to move it to another date risk free. Thank you Keith for your patience and help.

review_title: Adam was brilliant made everything so‚Ä¶
review_text: Adam was brilliant made everything so easy and totally understood our requirements from the initial call. Will definitely be using Destinology again can't wait to go on the holiday now.

review_title: We have been overwhelmed by the service‚Ä¶
review_text: We have been overwhelmed by the service provided by Destinology and in particular, Amy. You can judge a company by how they deal with their clients during uncertain times.  We booked a long haul luxury holiday and during the pandemic we were kept fully updated to the changing situation. Unfortunately when our destination hit the red list we were swiftly phoned by Amy to inform us, a couple of days later the confirmation email arrived informing us of our refund. Needless to say, we will now use Destinology for all our travel needs. Apart from how they dealt with our cancellation, the actual booking of the holiday and knowledge of the resorts as well as suggestions made by Amy makes the whole process enjoyable. Many thanks to Destinology and hope to deal with you again soon Amy,

review_title: Beth Higson went above and beyond‚Ä¶
review_text: Beth Higson went above and beyond helping us book our dream honeymoon. We looked into a couple different travel agents and the service from Beth made our decision easy.She was quick to get back to us and was not fazed by our indecisiveness. Beth was also happy to jump on a video call when needed, which was a really nice touch.We can now relax knowing the honeymoon is in hand.Thanks,Luke and Heather

Fantastic company that was recommended to me by family who have used them numerous times. A big thank you to Kirsty who took the hassle out of finding our perfect holiday. Unfortunately, we was unable to go due to lockdown, but Kirsty was very informative and always received fast replies. The refund process was painless, having experienced problems last year with another company I was a little worried, however it was extremely fast to receive our refund and was updated along the way. We will be using the company to book (fingers crossed) next year to the Maldives as originally planned. Thank you Kirsty for all of your help and will be in touch after our jabs!

Beth Higson was absolutely amazing! Professional, friendly and extremely helpful. She went over everything clearly and nothing was too much trouble......she got us a great deal too and we‚Äôll be using her for all our holiday needs from now on!

review_title: I always find the holiday I‚Äôm looking for at Destinology travel
review_text: I always find Destinology travel advisers really helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Last summer Chris booked a last minute holiday to Costa Navarino for us and made sure he followed up with me when we returned to check everything was ok as he knew I was a bit concerned about travelling with the government advice changing weekly. I have also just booked a holiday with Kirsty who was really helpful and made sure she explained all the current cancellation and refund policies to me to give me peace of mind to book during the current uncertainty.
Great help and advice from Craig at Destinology. Would not hesitate to recommend!
Couldn‚Äôt be easier to book a holiday, all at the best price, call Craig, very efficient and knowledgeable.

We have been dealing with Asher Floyd at Destinology to book our holiday, we had previously booked for last year but had to cancel due to COVID-19. We had such good service from Asher that we went straight back to book again!  Asher has brilliant knowledge and understanding of the holidays she sells, and has taken time to listen and advise us on our choice of location and accommodation. Would definitely  recommend using Destinology and in particular Asher to book your holiday.

Have used Destinology a few times now over the years and they have never failed to impress. First class service and always willing to go out of their way to put the customer first! Would highly recommend!

I've booked with Destinology several times over the years and their website and service is outstanding. They have been excellent through the Covid disruption and have worked quickly and proactively to resolve issues. My contact, Craig Robinson, is a credit to Destinology and his service is peronal and second to none. Don't hesitate to book through Destinology!

Just a quick note to say what a pleasure it was using Destinology.Unlike other travel operators we‚Äôve used in the past they really did make everything very very easy and stress free. Their representative, a lovely lady called Jane, helped us find the ideal location and accommodation as we hadn‚Äôt fully made up our minds but felt we may have been venturing into the unknown. My wife Julie and I were about to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary and Julie had her mind set on going to Mauritius, As Julie wears the trousers in our relationship our minds were made up.Jane had a great knowledge of Mauritius and easily put our minds at rest with a few of our minor reservations.Everything from the booking, flights, transfers, to the checking in at our gorgeous hotel went very smoothly.We would definitely recommend Destinology to anyone about to book their holiday, we wish we'd found them sooner.Thanks again Destinology Kind RegardsMr & Mrs Hurley

review_title: Thank you Destinology,  holiday of a lifetime!
review_text: Cant thank the staff at Destinology enough. From start to finish they were helpful and respectful of our plans for the holiday of a life time. Well done Jane!

We have been booking holidays with Craig at DESTINOLOGY for years now and have always been very happy. Last December Craig proved to be amazingly effective at organising a complex last minute schedule to Antigua with different members of the family arriving at different dates from different continents. Also he did well to change our return flights due to the imminent lockdown. Craig is always extremely responsive including out of hours. Our travel agent of choice!Nick & Christine

review_title: We book every holiday with Craig
review_text: We book every holiday with Craig.  He never fails to deliver a range of options when we are looking for where to go next and very importantly he and his team are always available for any help or questions when we are away.

review_title: Booked a holiday this year with Kirsty‚Ä¶
review_text: Booked a holiday this year with Kirsty Ralphson as I did also last year but couldn‚Äôt go. We got full refunds for the holidays we didn‚Äôt get to go on due to Covid, so I completely trust Kirsty when I book all holidays in the future. Her customer service is amazing, she is so patient and friendly. I will continue to book holidays with Kirsty as she always gives competitive prices too.

review_title: We‚Äôve been booking holidays with Craig‚Ä¶
review_text: We‚Äôve been booking holidays with Craig at Destinology for years now. The service is spot on and goes well beyond any other travel agency we have ever used, plus there‚Äôs that magical personal touch to the whole experience. I would never go to any other business to sort out the big annual family holiday, nor the special little ones in-between. Travel agencies are all about knowledge and expertise and Craig (I‚Äôm sure all the other advisers too) knows what he‚Äôs offering, from first hand experience and market intelligence. Very importantly, we were unfortunate to have lost a big holiday booking during COVID in early March 2020. The holiday was cancelled early March and we were reimbursed in full within a few weeks if not sooner, while we watched the news of other big name providers stalling for months with their refunds. I cannot fault them as a business and we‚Äôve already booked holidays for 2020 and looking at 2021 knowing that our money is safe and we have a direct line to our own personal travel expert. Don‚Äôt go elsewhere!

review_title: Booked my first Destinology holiday via‚Ä¶
review_text: Booked my first Destinology holiday via Craig. He was extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Looking forward to booking the next one.

I have now used Destinology 4 times to book luxury holidays in January, seeking winter sun.  Two to Oman, one to the Seychelles and one to the Caribbean (for this January).   The fact that I have gone back to use them (and in particular Craig Robinson) so many times is testimony to care and attention I feel I have received from them.  I have encountered only problem with the arrangements (which was weather-driven) and then Destinology sorted it out for me, quickly and without hassle.  This year of course I have had to cancel the trip to the Caribbean.  Again, Destinology have been marvellous.  Craig R spelled out the position to me, including the risks, fully and helpfully and when the holiday had to be cancelled, arranged for a full refund, again quickly and without hassle.  As soon as circumstances permit I shall be back on to Destinology to book my next holiday.
Excellent service, Craig always goes the extra mile to find flight times and accommodation to suit our family, responsive, good value.

review_title: professional, knowledgeable and courteous and a delight to work with work with.
review_text: I have been using Destinology for about 5 years now and in that time have liaised with them on both corporate and personal trips to destinations including Miami, Fuertaventura, Mexico and Far East. Sadly our corporate trip to Mexico had to be rearranged due to the Thomas Cook situation then finally cancelled due to Covid-19 at which point our company received a full refund. During this time Keith was in constant contact with me and kept me fully informed at all times. I have dealt with numerous travel companies but the levels of service I have received from various people at Destinology including Keith, and more recently Kirsty, has been at the highest level. They are professional, knowledgeable and courteous and a complete delight to work with.  I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone.

I feel it is important to give credit where credit is due - Destinology has organised several holidays over the years for my family and always given great service. Following the sad but necessary cancellation of our most recent trip to Costa Rica last month however, I was particularly impressed with the genuine care and consideration that was given to me to ensure that a plan was put in place in plenty of time and we were kept fully informed at all times of details regarding the cancellation of our trip.    Our deposit was refunded in full within a few days and at no time did I feel the need to query any decision.  Well done Destinology and thank you for all your support.  We will without question re-book our holiday as soon as we are able.

We have used destinology about 4 times now for our holidays, from the flights to the hotel and any extras that we need. Their service has been amazing every time and they go above and beyond. Nothing is ever too much trouble and the hotels that they recommend have been some of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in. I would not use any other travel company again!

review_title: 5 stars is not enough: Alex is a star in her own right!
review_text: I have had a lot of incredible experiences booking with Destinology, always with the brilliant Alexandra Dale!Alex always ensures our holidays are stress free, exciting and fun! She is always on hand with help and advice and the trips themselves (many to America and to Naples) have always be fantastic. 5 stars is not enough.
This company gives a superb personalized service throughout, the contact is superb especially throughout this covid epidemic. They cannot do enough for you a quality experience throughout,

review_title: 1st class service from a 1st class company
review_text: Due to the obvious uncertainty around travel, it was important for me to go with a company I could trust.As I have always received 1st class service from Destinology, they were my first call now I‚Äôm ready to book my next break. They did not disappoint and have made the process a smooth transaction. The customer services reps are always fantastic and friendly and make it fun and really gets you in the holiday mood.Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a long over due break!

review_title: An amazing holiday in Dubai and Maldives.        We have just got back from Dubai and
review_text: We have just got back from Dubai and the Maldives and have to say that it was due to the amazing organisation of Destinology and Nikkie Prince in particular that everything went off so well. It was not just the pre-booking and in-house arrangements that Nikkie took care of but all the transfers and arrangements that are all so important. A wonderful unforgettable holiday.

I've used Craig at Destinology several times now to book our holidays. Craig has always provided a great service and we have had no issues with Destinology. Nothing seems too much trouble.Always seem to deliver a great deal aswell compared to booking direct.I Wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.

In the past I've always booked my holidays by myself which has been fine but with a myriad of new terms and conditions I thought I'd give a few travel agents a shot at showing me where they can perhaps add value to our experience.In fairness, we didn't pay any less than if we booked direct with the hotel, but, the service we received from Destinology, especially our consultant, Amy.Amy's taken the time to explain all of the new terms and conditions to us and given us reassurance with a few 'what if' scenarios which has given us the confidence to make our booking now for later in the year.Whilst it's frustrating that we can't get away just yet - it's nice to know we have something to look forward to towards the end of the year.

review_title: First and last time I'll book with Destinology
review_text: Poor attitude and poor customer service. This is an agent/operator that prefers to hide behind policies and procedures rather than empathetic customer service. Refused refund despite airline in liquidation and Covid-19 anxiety. First time I've ever booked with them and will definitely be the last. Stay clear of these guys - there are much better and much more customer focussed operators out there.

This is the first TrustPilot review I have written however I felt compelled to do so due to my recent dealings with Destinology. I know how important these reviews are to companies and especially in the current turbulent economic uncertainty. We had a holiday planned and paid for in September and also in the process of starting our Honeymoon arrangements. Throughout, Destinology and more specifically Phillip Munro has maintaned consistant contact with ourselves, updating us with available options and providing very sound advice. In the honeymoon planning we have far from been easy customers.....changing plans, destintations, options, budgets....everything! But Phillip has never got frustrated and always provided exactly what we were looking for. 1st class service which you don't get that often.We had historically been Trailfinders customers but I will find it very difficult to look at another travel company in the future. Thanks Phillip & Destinology! keep going guys, doing a great job!! Martin Foster

review_title: poor customer service and bad attitude
review_text: We have booked with Destinology a number of times and they have been fine. However we returned from the Maldives in February and received appalling customer service. They use a ground agent in the Maldives who operate a little scam if you miss a sea plane. Seemingly we were one of many who missed our sea plane due to extra COVID checks at the airport. Rather than give you a refund or put you up in a nice Hotel on the first night they dump you in a back packers accommodation owned by the ground agent. Which you have to pay extra for ! Destinology response go and talk to your insurance company. We have probably spent over 50k with Destinology over the years but not any more ! We even asked to go into their Wilmslow branch to talk to someone when we returned. Response don‚Äôt do that as manager will not talk to you.

This is the first time I have used any sort of travel agent for my travels, but as this was for my honeymoon, I thought I would give Destinology ago and I do not regret this one bit. Mark was my consultant and he was extremely helpful and prompt with all responses. Where they really did shine is whilst I was on my honeymoon in a resort in the Maldives and me and my wife got stuck due to a coronavirus lockdown on the resort. Someone else got in touch with me proactively and once lockdown was lifted, they provided so much amazing assistance we got back safe and sound. Thank you so much and will definitely be using you again in the future :)

review_title: Due to the Coronavirus I was told by‚Ä¶
review_text: Due to the Coronavirus I was told by the staff that I am unable to get a refund for my hotel.I have three young children and one of my children has asthma.They did not consider the fact that my child is more at risk and had the audacity to say they could offer me to change my date of travel.I am very disappointed as a customer as I would have thought they would be considerate towards their customers and not selfish.I am very upset due to losing a huge amount of money and Destinology did not consider my son and what kind of impact it would have On his health as he suffers from asthma.

review_title: Great price, great products, great service
review_text: I used Destinology to book a holiday to Mauritius in December.  They were by far the best value option on the market and we ended up getting an unbelievable price for our package - had we booked directly with the hotel, the cost would have been over ¬£1000 more. Their online portal was really user friendly and enabled us to log on and pay / check details etc.  A good function to have!Jenny was out point of contact, she was helpful, informative, gave me good guidance to enable me to confirm what I wanted.  She was quick to respond if I had any queries, which were minimal and I had a follow up call to check how everything went after the holiday which makes me feel that customer feedback and service is important to them. Destinology and Jenny will be the first company I contact next time I am booking a holiday and I have already recommended them to friends.

Excellent service..  After searching for hours online for a cruise to celebrate my partners 60th birthday I turned to Destinology.   They managed to beat every price I had found online!  Great customer service before and after the holiday.  We had a small issue where our pre-paid transport didn't turn up to take us from the cruise port to the airport (we had to pay our own taxi), we were refunded this promptly by Destinology on our return.  Will definitely use again :)

review_title: Take your money then leave you stranded
review_text: Having used Destinology many times in the past we was extremely unhappy with how they have dealt with a complaint we have regarding a 5* hotel we are staying at. We had issues with a room being unclean, asked management to move us but they were unhelpful and informed us that we had been over charged by our agents and we would have to pay extra for a room that was cheaper than what we paid! We have moved hotels, #destinology informed us that they can not refund anything and tried to sell us another hotel that we have now found at under half of what they quoted us and that‚Äôs them dealing with a complaint üò°Will never use this company again, there good until something goes wrong, then your on your own!

We booked our honeymoon through Destinology to Corfu. There was a deal at a 5 star luxury hotel and our booking was swift and easy.Our flight, hotel and transfer details all came through quickly and the hotel really was absolutely amazing!Only error on their part however, I had to email two different members of staff as two dealt with my booking so I emailed both the same question. One member of staff sent a slightly brash email that was meant for her colleague to me, and the email was about me! Luckily it wasn‚Äôt anything too rude so I waved it off, but very embarrassing for her! Apart from that, they were great!

Only interested in your money and nothing else.This company has been the least helpful of any company I have had to deal with.We booked an expensive holiday to a 5* plus boutique hotel in Mykonos and the booking was not as described by their representative when arranging the booking.When we arrived there were various discrepancies and on calling Destinology and writing various e mails, they would not accept any responsibility and more or less left us without any comeback.The only saving grace was the hotel, who went out of their way to help us although none of the problem was theirs.I can only say if you wish to book a holiday without problems, avoid Destinology.

review_title: No after Sales what so ever...... Be warned.......
review_text: A friend recommended Destinology to us.  At first all seemed great, until they had taken our money - There is no after service - The Staff that we spoke to before we booked were friendly and helpful - We spoke to Bruce but as soon as payment was made.  No reply to emails - constant out of Office replies and no follow up at all on Staff return.  Was shouted at my a member of Staff called Clare so much so I asked to speak to another member of Staff.  To be honest I would not use this Company again.  You are better off booking yourself or someone like Abercromble & Kent.  So disappointed with this Company - feel very let down.

A truly amazing experience!From first contact when searching for Dubai vacation online to experience with Destinology partners over in Dubai it has been truly stress free, easy going and enjoyable experience.Kirsty has been an absolute professional and more like a friend that advised you on somewhere they‚Äôd been and sincerely wanting you to enjoy the experience. She was timely in her responses, carried out a number of various searches and re-worked the quote as we explored options. She kept in touch long after the booking was processed, calling me again just before the trip to ensure all was in order. It was our first time in Dubai therefore having someone who knows destination very well firsthand was reassuring. We picked Atlantis because of my daughter and we couldn‚Äôt have made a better choice. Even locals commented to us if you come to stay at the Palm ‚Äì Atlantis is the best place to stay. It was so family oriented, families  from all over the world, an amazing place to stay. We got lucky and were able to check in at 11am shortly upon arrival. Per Kirsty‚Äôs advice we have selected half-board, which worked really well, there was so much food, we couldn‚Äôt actually finish our meals as they want you to pick from each option for dinner and it ended up being a lot, drinks were included as well, which seems only Destinology had that Platinum deal going.We used Destinology‚Äôs local partner Alpha tours, which seems to be a prominent operator in Dubai. Agent was very helpful, didn‚Äôt push us to purchase any deals, but we did get booked for Desert Safari ad Burj Khalifa which came with free tickets for Aquarium and Underwater zoo. That alone with variety of experiences available to be booked at Atlantis itself, we were busy until our departure. Safari was amazing and surprisingly there was quite a big dinner which all of us didn‚Äôt expect based on the price of the ticket, plus entertainment. It was an absolute joy.  We met another family from UK, who stayed at Jumeirah at the Palm and they were planning a day trip to Atlantis. They were also very happy with Destinology and had a few experiences booked in addition to safari.All in all a 5 star experience with Destinology, I am now considering future family trips to be sourced with them.

review_title: Rung to book a last minute holiday
review_text: Rung to book a last minute holiday. Explained given it's last minute we are very open minded to the destination... only criteria is somewhere on the beach with a warm sea to swim in. Lady seemed very disinterested and when I told her my budget was ¬£5- ¬£6k for 7 day break, immediately told me she would not be able to find a holiday for that budget. This contradicts the Destinology website, false advertising, or lazy customer service??? On the phone for less than a minute, so at least didn't waste any time. Having booked a holiday with them last year to Dubai I did vow never to use them, but decided to try again.... Never again.

review_title: Went to this company to get a quote
review_text: Went to this company to get a quote, was about to book to find out girl had lied about actual cost to member of staff and had to complain to manager  who then listened to actual phone call and confirmed the original price quoted by sales rep was correct and quote sent for increased amount was incorrect. I decided to go to Sandals direct and pay more as was unsure of what other items sales rep has lied about.

review_title: This is an addition to an my earlier review
review_text: This is an addition to an my earlier review about Destinology and our October 2018 Safari holiday.Destinology (Laura Simpson) said she would investigate and get back to me. After 12 days I had heard nothing. All of a sudden when I threatened to involve Board Directors, she came to life and advised me that according to Package Holiday regulations, they had 28 days to respond to a written complaint.So it means that if you have a complaint (or a problem I presume) that is when you can expect to hear from Destinology.What sort of Company is that ?

Purely by chance I stumbled across Destinology, very fortunately I made contact with a superb ‚ÄòJenny‚Äô, I gave her a near impossible brief for my wife‚Äôs and I 40th wedding anniversary. Jenny came up with a recommendation that was absolutely perfect, how she did that given the challenge set is honestly beyond me. We had one of our best holidays ever, on this occasion in Italy. All of our contacts at Destinology were professional and extremely helpful, all documentation was well presented accurate and helpful. Given the importance of the occasion before finding Destinology I did speak to another market leader, an award winning regional travel agent and a couple of others, none came close to proposing what proved to be the perfect choice, thank you Jenny and Destinology.

We have just come back from an eight night holiday to the Seychelles, booked through Destinology.It was for our 50th Wedding Anniversary and we were taking the whole family, a total of 9, ages from 4 to 73.Destinology were fantastic, hubby and I travel extensively and are used to arranging our own travel but being a special occasion and so many of us, we thought it best to go through a company.I became a real nuisance with all my requests and requirements, I was constantly checking and asking questions and reassure about the arrangements, eg ground floor rooms, connecting doors, early access to rooms etc.  Hollie was my first and main contact, althrough other agents also helped me with some of my many questions.  They handled everything I requested with calm, reassurance and patience.  Also giving personal experience and recommendations.Thank you Destinology for helping to make it a fabulous holiday.  The hotel you recommended was also perfect.
amazing holiday and excellent service from Destinolgy a professional team and looked after from start to finish.Would recommend to all my friends and family

review_title: Fantastic service as always - faithful customer of 10 years!
review_text: We've now used Destinology for over 10 years for the majority of our trips. I'm amazed to read some of the reviews below because we have never had any issues whatsoever with them. They've arranged our trips to Kuredu, Mauritius, Far East, USA, Dubai, Barbados, St Lucia and we've just booked a 31 day trip to Australia with them too. I can highly recommend the travel consultants, Heather Gibbons, Mark Hathaway and Christine Langrose.  We've always received a highly professional, personal and courteous service from them all. They always offer an excellent choice of hotels and resorts at reasonable prices and will price match where they can. Holidays can go wrong very easily.... the reason we keep going back to Destinology is.... ours don't!Thanks Destinology!
Most amazing service, listen to our needs and took great care to organise the perfect holidays. We've booked 2 with Destinology so far, hope to book more in the future.

review_title: Booked a holiday to Thailand.  All very well arranged
review_text: Booked a holiday to Thailand with them.   Everything was arranged  fantastically.  Even as I am here, they assisted getting my return seats changed.  Melanie was exceptionally good.  Thank you

We tried to book our honeymoon through Destinology. Whilst at first they appeared friendly. The first inclination that things might go wrong, was when the first quote referred to names in the wrong sex. Once we had decided on the holiday we were happy with. Anthony and Paul were inconsistent in sending over the correct quotes as required. On a few occasions the quotes were sent for the wrong hotel. In addition they can't just email you. You have to follow a link. The company seems to be a sausage factory with little thought for the customer. The staff are slap dash and have little pride. Once we managed to find what we wanted and struck a deal with Anthony for a price that was agreeable. Upon booking we were advised this was incorrect. Email evidence was provided. We were given a 'best price'. However a quick search online and we found plenty of other providers cheaper. We booked through Virgin in the end. We gave Destinology every chance to offer a competitive price. Little interest. If your looking to spend 6k+ on a holiday. There are plenty of other providers that will treat you better. My advice is don't waste your time with this firm. It will only cost you money.

Destinology have ruined our family holiday to the us  they didn't give us enough information or guidance about visas.  I was told I didn't have to worry about them till we was ready to go now my husband needs an intervie. They were not helpful looking for an alternative or change the names on the flight .  I feel that there is no customer care  and no one gives you any information or keep you up to date . I was even told I was going to get a call back and no one did I was so upset. I advise anyone not book their holiday with them.

What a dreadful company, I would not trust them with a bargepole even if you paid me.  They actually lied, they went for weeks without any updates even when requested.  They will not be there for you in the event of things going wrong and we all know holidays can go wrong.   A deceitful and dishonest company.Be aware and stay away.

review_title: Dishonest & very poor service which meant our insurance claims were refused '‚Ä¶
review_text: Dishonest & very poor service which meant our insurance claims were refused '  The service provided by Destinology on our last holiday was appaling.  We went to Australia and spent an awful lot of money (my identical twin sister has terminal lung cancer and so we were going all out to give her the best time)Unfortunately on the day we were supposed to leave we were subject to Cyclone Debbie, winds 238 miles per hour, airport closed, no phone, electricity, internet, water and confined to our rooms.This resulted in staying longer than we would have liked and incurring extra costs, and missed flights and hotels.Once home we asked for a breakdown of our holiday costs for our insurance companies.  They refused stating that ATOL regulations did not allow this but said would liase with our ins. companies.  Our insurance companies refused to speak to a third party.It took them two months to issue a statement from their legal department saying due to the terms and conditions of ATOL licensing, we are unable to provide a breakdown of costs.  It then took a further month to confirm they would not give us a breakdown and only because we gave them a deadline.We asked ATOL if this was the case and they said it was rubbish.  Also Destinology were prepared to talk to our ins. companies but not us!Our insurance companies will not pay because we do not know what sums we talking about

Really don't know why anyone pays over the odds with this lazy company. From the outside they look great, great website, good high street stores with suitably impressive store fit outs. But don't let that fool you into thinking they go above and beyond because they do the bare minimum to make your booking feel special. Went into the Wilmslow store, explained that I was looking to make a honey moon booking that it needed to be extra special. They emailed over some good choices, the email looks great, really slick and professional. Turns out tho they are charging ¬£800-¬£1000 more than if you book direct through the operator itself (we checked after unfortunately!!)They booked us flights, but then it turned out, we need to log into and pay extra if we wanted to reserve seats together (being a honeymoon this year was a pretty essential requirement) Anyway long story short, arrived at our 5star hotel and they had no record that it was our honeymoon. When I emailed our agent I was told it was a computer glitch that was the fault. So what does ¬£800 more get you........excuses and sod all difference than if you booked it direct yourself. Although we did get a nice leather folder that our boarding passes went into, maybe that's where the money goes, because it is not customer service. Would never ever ever use destinology again. Go direct or go to a smaller agent that actually does something for their add on fee or cares about you having a great experience

I would not trust this site. Every time I tried to speak with a consultant about holiday in Dubai via chat they would end the chat as soon as I ask the question about their deals (which btw look too good to be true!). Customer service does not seem professional at all and this makes me worried that what they advertise is not what they can deliver. Based on my experience and other reviews I've seen, I would not recommend using them at all. Go with someone like Kuoni or Abercrombie&Kent whose customer service is impeccable and holidays are truly amazing!!
outstanding service from destinology, had my holidays in 2014 with them , no regret - perfect service ...

In the past we have booked our holidays through a large High Street Travel Agent.  We had always felt that to actually speak to someone personally was the best way.    We had been recommended to various other companies and thought we would give one of them a try .... Destinology won!   We were sceptical to use an Internet based company but we can honestly say that all questions asked were dealt with and various telephone conversations were made between ourselves and our very helpful contact there .. Asher.  Our trip was well planned with everything in place and absolutely no hic-cups.  We are now looking forward to discussing another trip with them.

I return to Destinology every year as know I will receive excellent service, Louise always listens to my brief and delivers each time. We've just had the most perfect holiday in The Maldives and Louise arranged for us to stay in Abu Dhabi on the outward journey, everything was arranged with no issues whatsoever and our accommodation in both locations just stunning.Thank you Destinology, I'm in contact with you again right now to discuss this years plan!

We booked a trip to Bali through Destinology and they were excellent, I dealt with Lauren and she was always very helpful and willing to answer my numerous questions! Good price too.I would recommend!

I booked a honeymoon with Destinology a few months ago as they beat a quote i had initially got and no one seemed to be able to beat their price. Having looked at the awards they won and the reviews, I felt secure booking with them.Initially they were great and responded quickly and politely to everything before i booked. I had booked the holiday months in advance so after I was booked, there was no contact for a while. This is where I had an issue. I wasn't hearing anything back so closer to the time I got in touch with destinology asking about my documents and seats etc. The person I was dealing with told me that she had tried to call me a couple of months earlier to ask about our seating requirements but that she couldnt get through. She said she had left a voice message, which is untrue as I didnt have one. What annoyed me is that she didnt try to call again and the fact that she could have e-mailed me. Because I had apparently missed the opportunity to discuss this, I had missed out on a chance to select any good seats left and was left to choose whatever was available. But selecting from those seats were pointless too, as we never got what we wanted on any of the flights. I got past that, and had other queries and noticed other errors on the itinerary. I had kept e-mailing the consultant i was dealing with, but never seemed to get a response. I was often told i'd get a call, but never did. The only time I got any answers was when I had to call up myself. Would have been nice to get replies to the e-mails I had sent. At one point i got fed up and wrote an e-mail of complaint which also seemed a waste as the response I got ignored all I had to say and just asked what my queries were. Also one of my flights had changed to a day later but the only reason I knew about this was because I called her for something else, otherwise I probably wouldnt have even been notified and new itinerary sent! Whilst I feel that the customer service before flying was very poor, I do appreciate the consultant sorting the whole thing out for us. Everything was ok, there was a problem with one of the transfers not turning up to pick us up from the hotel but that was the fault of the pick up company and not destinology. I was reimbursed for it with no problems.  Overall a good experience as everything went ok with the holiday, it was just the customer service beforehand that I was disappointed with. As it was my honeymoon, I wanted everything to go smoothly so would have appreciated quicker responses and more reassurance.
We booked a hotel and transfer in Thailand with this company. So far I have to say very fast service! Nice contact! Great deal!Thank you!

review_title: Attention to detail and perfectly organised
review_text: I asked Amy to put together a three island trip to Tahiti (Moorea, Huahine, Bora Bora).   It involved booking hotel packages, transfers and domestic flights. Amy was very helpful in finding out details about how to get from A-B and what was available where.  She was excellent at getting back to me about every detail.  Everything went perfectly and it was the best holiday ever! I will definitely use Destinology again.

review_title: Great service if you're prepared to haggle.
review_text: Booked holiday to Mauritius in March. Website excellent and agents prepared to give you just what you ask for. Was able to haggle and pricematch on price and saved 20% on an expensive 5* All Inclusive 9 day break. Would definitely recommend. Will use again.

review_title: Personal service from an online travel company
review_text: I've used Destinology for 2 years now.  Basically I find a cheap flight or holiday, then ring up or email the person I deal with at Destinology, and they have always succeeded in finding a cheaper deal for me. That's impressive given the lengths I go to, to find the best deal in the first place. The person I speak with gives excellent personal service at all hours of the day and at weekends.  If he's not a work, he sometimes still emails. Personal service and deal finding like this are hard to find these days.
This drink is amazing, quite subtle. I mix it with ginger beer. Gives a real lift yet calming.

review_title: I have been ordering Feragaia for‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been ordering Feragaia for years. Big fan and feels more special than just drinking a regular alcohol free drink. Great taste!

review_title: Watch out for special offers before placing full price order!
review_text: One day after I placed my order an offer appeared of a case of Ginger Ale with any order.Then an offer of old style bottles made available on Amazon at reduced rate.Not amused.
As always great product, recyclable packaging delivered promptly
Arrived quickly. Loving this as a non-alcoholic option, really hits the spot at the end of a long day.
IGNORE TEXT
For a non-alcohol drink, this really has a delicious flavour.   Have not tried variations of mixes as yet - but that joy is to come.

review_title: A great find for those seeking a good non alcoholic alternative- Feragaia
review_text: As someone who made the decision to not drink alcohol, I wanted to explore non alcoholic alternatives, I was not disappointed when I found Feragaia.With spicy sweet notes that paired well with mixers, I felt that I could enjoy social drinking with friends etc. The taste is comparable with a whiskey with a unique flavour that is balanced and happy!
Love this product. Great alcohol free mixer - good to be able to find something tasty.Excellent transaction - updated on progress of my order. Good communication throughout

review_title: Trying Feragaia for the first time
review_text: Trying Feragaia for the first time. The bottle was well protected for delivery with a good cardboard insert in the box for added protection.Feragaia tastes as explained in the tasting notes. Slightly 'soft' on the palate due to there being no alcohol present. Have only tried neat so far which is pleasant to sip away at. Looking forward to trying with various mixers.Overall a good product, well delivered, which doesn't pretend to be anything other than the pleasant drink it is.

My first taste of Feragaia was at Balgove night market. It was so lovely, light and refreshing and alcohol free.I bought a bottle for my other half who is tea total. However it‚Äôs me that‚Äôs ended up drinking it so much so I bought a 2nd bottle online for Father‚Äôs Day. Definitely recommend. X

So to begin, I came across this beauty at the Cupar Farmers Market.  I enquired about it due to being interested in Non alcoholic spirits.  Now this is in a league of its own.  From its beautiful name (I'm totally in love with it and it's meaning 'wild earth') to its distinct taste I just adore everything about it.  Ive tried it with tonic and an orange slice and irs my new go to when on driving duty. 10/10 for everything with this including top notch customer service. Thank you!

I love single malts, but after reading the description of and reviews on Feragaia I set my mind to expect not a substitute but an unrelated and novel experience. It is a very splendid drink. Tried it with ginger ale, but I am sure there is a lot of experimenting to be done. I started with the taster bottle, but will be back for more when that's run out. Thank you also for the swift delivery.

review_title: This is an alcohol free distilled‚Ä¶
review_text: This is an alcohol free distilled spirit and it is totally delicious! I started drinking  less alcohol but mainly stick to beer because I'm not a fan of soft drinks, so Feragaia is a revelation - it's fragrant and refreshing. I can go alcohol free and still feel like I'm having a grown up drink - cheers guys!

Unique taste but not a favourite for me. Clean fresh and bright. Has green tea and chilly in so a little worried it is stimulating for someone who doesn't take much caffeine and wants an evening drink. Plastic cork a disappointment but good recyclable packaging. Packaging quite oversized but good presentation box. Quick delivery. Overall a good product great if you want a pickup and can take your caffeine. There was no chilly tingle the moulded tastes which much cleaner than that.

review_title: Can't  get enough of this Feragaia,
review_text: I'm loving this Feragaia! It tastes alcoholic, but it's not! My doctor told me in order to protect my kidneys, I shouldn't drink spirits, but I like a short, so when my Nephew bought me a bottle of Feragaia for Christmas, I was over the moon! Now I can still have a couple of beers and finish the night with a couple of Feragaia's! I've already ordered my next bottle!

Hello I am trying to give up alcohol !!!enjoyed your feragaia But not enough to order more I have managed 1 month with no alcoholand are now drinking 1 vodka lemonade a day Wishing upon wishing for a clean and healthy alternative Please keep me informed Good luck !!! Maureen Ps Would love to work with you on a blend and bottle I have worked on product design for Issey Miyake for 30 years the last being his first perfume leu de Issey

Having read some of the negative reviews on here, I am shocked that anyone would ever suggest that this tastes like whisky in the first place - perhaps you guys need a new marketing department! Never the less, I am a massive fan of Feragaia, we have been buying it as a supplier now since the beginning, and I will continue to tell all my mates about it - it has saved me from many a boozy evening! Delicious with tonic water (schweppes rather than fever tree). Keep up the good work.

Excellent service, the product arrived quickly and in recyclable packaging that kept it protected. I was eager to try this and while the flavour was intriguing and pleasant enough and mercifully free of the overly sweet taste of many non alcoholic drinks, I was expecting something with a bit more 'bite'. Maybe I am comparing it to something like gin or whisky when it is not really comparable. For what I consider to be a very high price I felt distinctly underwhelmed and would probably not buy this again unless heavily discounted.

review_title: The process to purchase and the‚Ä¶
review_text: The process to purchase and the delivery times were excellent.However the drink is not for me, it was not at all what I had imagined and in my opinion not a whisky substitute.I have been drinking non alcoholic beers and  wines fpr ten years now and this is nothing like I have tasted before.I am sorry but I shall not be purchasing again.

I just wanted to say that my bottle arrived on Friday and I tried some of the drink over the weekend. I really appreciated the taste and feel of the drink. I stopped drinking alcohol many years ago but recently have appreciated the non alcoholic beers and ciders. I was waiting for somebody to create a real gentleman's drink and in my humble opinion, you have certainly gone some way to recreating that experience.

This was truly vile. I was taken in by the hype and advertising - and purchased a bottle. You would achieve a similar taste making a tea using potting compost. Don‚Äôt be like me and get taken in by the hype. I bares NO relationship to anything you have drunk before. It is NOT an alcohol free whiskey. It is (horrible) flavored water.

review_title: A wonderful drink with many layers and‚Ä¶
review_text: A wonderful drink with many layers and deapth of flavours which changes with many different mixes.  Alcohol and sugar free, allowing me to enjoy a drink and feel a belonging with friends and family and not like a child having to drink cola.  I gave up drinking some time back for health and medical reasons and now find alcoholic beverages bitter.  Feragaia changes the whole field of opportunities.  Thank you
I enjoy having a subscription and look forward to my bottles arriving each month. As the days draw in and the evenings are  cooler this warming comforting spirit with ginger ale is restorative.
Great introductory offer for new canned drinks. Delivered quickly. Great and unique taste and super alternative to alcoholic alternatives.

Hi BoysYou have a very efficient service and I absolutely loved the presentation box.  I think it makes a very lovely gift for friends so I might be back.  Haven't tasted your product yet but will let you know when I do.  I also likes the little book with recipes for non-alcoholic cocktails (or mocktails as they call them nowadays).  Coincidentally, the chap that makes the Cooshiedoo Tonic Water lives along the road from us and we use his products.  Marion Marshall

Didn't like the taste at all. Delivery, packaging etc was second to none though.Hi Jamie, I tried it neat, over ice, with fever tree tonic and with a bay leaf as suggested. I shall keep trying various mixers until its finished but at present can't see me re-ordering.

review_title: Lovely bottle, interesting suggested mixes but not great taste!
review_text: This was delivered on time, carefully boxed so no problem, however, the flavour is not what I had expected and not altogether pleasant (it has a touch of disinfectant about it when I had expected something more reminiscent of whisky or brandy!) So a bit disappointing and I won‚Äôt get it again, I‚Äôm afraid.

Great service from the company. Really really wanted to love this as think the concept is ideal. It smelled amazing but the taste was a bit disappointing, it was a bit washed out and lacking in flavour. Tasted better with grapefruit tonic than standard fever free tonic and had to use a large measure.

review_title: To be savoured. The only gulp is the price
review_text: I was very sceptical that a non alcoholic drink could replace the siren call of gin martini. This does. Not all the time, because I will always have a place for a martini in my life, but Feragaia introduces much needed breaks in my routine. I do like it a lot. Packaging is beautiful and indulgent. Still a bit taken aback at the price of these alcohol free ‚Äòspirits‚Äô given no duty is levied on them. Maybe I‚Äôll have to start a wee side fund for a regular purchase, however it is very good.

Great service and love the fact its a Scottish brand. Marketing very good indeed. As for the drink itself, it is probably an acquired taste based on some reviews, however paired with Ginger Ale it does produce a satisfying non alcoholic drink, that over a few glasses starts to build a distinct taste. OK its not my preferred tipple of a Single Malt, but for dry January and times when you want to stay away from alcohol its definitely worthy of a place in my cabinet.  I would recommend you give a go, bur over a few glasses initially before writing it off.

Sadly this drink has been an utter disappointment, to myself and all my friends who dared trying it. Nothing reminiscent to whisky taste, acidic, dull and an unpleasant detergent like after taste. A product built 99% on marketing -- certainly a good looking gift item though.

Really enjoyed this product, if you are looking for a non-alcoholic tipple would recommend trying it. Taste was different to my expectations but in a good way. Very nice with the ginger beer supplied but I also found it was very pleaseant with elderflower tonic.

Deep and complex flavour profile. Wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect but it could be used as a good rum or whisky replacement, also reminded me of Strathearn Heather Rose gin. So as mentioned, versatile. Also a big fan of the sustainable packaging committing to lower carbon footprint.Well accomplished product.

Service fabulous, arrived quickly, beautifully packaged.Unfortunately I hate the taste - there‚Äôs a woody element in this spirit that I just don‚Äôt like!Perhaps you will bring out another version at some point.Disappointed I didn‚Äôt start with a small bottle, as it will all be wasted üò¨

review_title: A lovely kick and zing experience
review_text: I was hesitant when I first received the item, I opened it to smell the aroma and it wasn't what I was expecting. However, when I had a glass later that evening with tonic it was delicious with a slight kick and zing to it. I am very pleased and will be purchasing more üòÄ

I'm amazed, I love the taste, its tantalising to the taste buds which surprises me since its alcohol free and only a few calories which is a big bonus. I tried the smaller bottle but will certainly be buying the full sized one in the future.

I got this as part of a subscription box and I love it! I have been trying alcohol free drinks for nearly two years now searching for one I like. I had got to the point where I was hesitant to buy botanicals because after shelling out ¬£20-¬£30 per bottle I‚Äôd find I didn‚Äôt like it. Many of them are so weak they become tasteless when mixed, others are strong and can taste like cough syrup. This one is one of the strong tasting ones, and it‚Äôs lovely! It‚Äôs the first one I‚Äôve liked. It‚Äôs very refreshing, great with ginger ale, and it doesn‚Äôt come across as trying to mimic any type of spirit. I‚Äôll definitely be buying more.

review_title: I bought Feragaia as a house warming‚Ä¶
review_text: I bought Feragaia as a house warming gift for my son who has been dry for over three years. Unfortunately because of unforeseen circumstances he has yet to receive the gift. The gift box alone is very impressive, as is the bottle. I am looking forward to tasting when we meet.

Excellent drink, mixed mine with ice, orange segments and Mediterranean Tonic (Fever Tree). It‚Äôs full of complex flavours, herby with a salty background. It has a brilliant taste. Goes exceedingly well with tapenade on bruschetta, Greek salad, tzatziki and salt and pepper squid.

review_title: Not to my taste at all
review_text: Beautiful packaging, fast delivery and slick, expensive advertising. Unfortunately, i thought the drink was awful and, after trying on the rocks, with ginger ale and with tonic, it went down the sink. Each to their own but definitely not for me.

Feragaia is a special drink and a great addition to our social gathers and the relaxing evenings. A lot of non-alcoholic distilled drinks are highly caffeinated so I‚Äôm pleased this one isn‚Äôt. I enjoy this drink with ice, lime and dry tonic.

This drink is delicious. This is my second bottle and I can totally recommend. I've only had it with tonic water so far, but I'm looking forward to trying other mixers too. I've been inspired by the little booklet of drink suggestions that came with the bottle. Delicious!

This tastes great, both on it‚Äôs own and with a mixer. Just the right balance of flavours to provide an adult tasting alternative to alcohol. I love the bottle, the service and delivery was excellent and the company ethos sits well with me too. Great brand and product.

I just love this stuff. Can't get enough of this. It has an unusual taste, slightly bitter, it reminds me a little bit like campari. I'm not keen on anything that is too sweet and this just hits the spot for me. Prefer it with tonic, not keen on with ginger ale.

review_title: This is the most incredible discovery‚Ä¶
review_text: This is the most incredible discovery and the answer to cutting out alcohol. At last a drink that actually tastes like you might be drinking. This is wonderfully alcoholic-tasting whilst being entirely 0% alchohol. It's also remarkably delicious with an interesting, earthy, peaty, astringent flavour. I've tried it with bay leaves - this adds to the peatiness - and with orange peel - refreshingly different. I love the versatility of this drink and how it can change just by the way you choose serve it. I'm now well into my second bottle with a third on standby and I'm introducing all my friends to it....

Ordered this out of interest. It arrived swiftly and well packaged. Have just tried it - with ice, tonic  and orange. It's nice -  will probably try one with ginger ale soon - the flavour tastes like it would lend itself better to that.

Awesome flavour profile that really makes you relish and savour every sip! Had it for the first time at a drinks party and it definitely made me feel part of a special experience. Already ordered a bottle for an after work/ weekend treat!

review_title: Great cocktail. But where's the sun
review_text: Delivery was prompt. The packaging first rate.- Colourful and original.The taste unique. I mixed it with Orange Juice and Tonic Water (Fever Tree - Mediterranean) it was refreshing and complimented by olives and nuts.Good luck with the project

review_title: Feragaia and TryDry App- I‚Äôm alcohol free now.
review_text: Love Feragaia, I may have trouble spelling it but I have no trouble drinking it!  It was the first alcohol free spirit I bought when I decide to cut down on my alcohol intake after brain surgery, and is now my ‚ÄòFriday Favourite‚Äô and my special AF drink. I wish it was available in more pubs locally, they literally offer fizzy drinks (am I 10?!) or AF lager (never been into lager). It feels like I‚Äôm treating myself to a nice drink, like a G & T, but it has its own distinctive kick. I planned on cutting down on alcohol, I was a social drinker but after surgery took so long to recover from even a couple of large wines,  but I‚Äôm now alcohol free and thriving thanks to Feragaia and the TryDry App. Thank you!

This is the best non alcoholic drink I have tried - so good I have made a regular order - it is delicious and  exiting -  mixers  ginger ale or tonic works well for me - tried a splash on its own over crushed ice again yum

Really good product, as it should be for the price! But you get what you‚Äôve paid for. Overlaid botanical flavours, and very pleasing astringency. Quite distinctive, in no sense a ‚Äúnon-alcoholic gin (or rum) substitute‚Äù; it is its own thing.

review_title: I‚Äôve got pretty broad tastes and do‚Ä¶
review_text: I‚Äôve got pretty broad tastes and do like all sorts of weird and wonderful food and drink: but I have to say neat this mings hard. However it is improved dramatically by addition of tonic or dry ginger but on its own it‚Äôs best avoided.

Feragaia is unlike any other non alcoholic drinks I've tried. It's so full of flavour and changes depending on what you add. It's not sugary so is perfect for all types of mocktail, or even on its own.Delicious!

I‚Äôve tried a few non  alcoholic drinks and had really wanted this one to be different It is beautifully presented and packaged and the service impeccable. However the taste does not suit my palate I‚Äôm afraid.

Bought for a cocktail night.  Was a complex flavour to pair mixers with, but the cocktail booklet that came with the bottle had some fantastic recommendations.  I'll try a few more cocktails before I decide to buy another bottle.

I have only just started to experiment with non alcoholic spirits and I‚Äôm very pleasantly surprised.  I didn‚Äôt know what to expect because it was an impulse buy but the taste is complex and strangely moreish.  It‚Äôs a better substitute for a whisky and I‚Äôm more of a gin drinker but it tasted powerful and had a lasting finish on the palate.  I will experiment with other recipes and think it will taste great with ginger ale.  I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve had the best of this yet.  Another bonus is the calorie content which is very low. I do 16:8 fasting and life gets a bit boring in the evening so I can have a treat and still stick with the fast. Well worth it.

review_title: I like the product very much
review_text: I like the product very much, 50mm in a highball glass with ice and topped up with slim tonic makes a very nice drink. Only observation is it's more expensive than the competition which is roughly the same price for 70cl.

review_title: This is a drink you can call ‚Äòa drink‚Äô
review_text: Have tried many alcohol alternatives and they all try and replicate alcohol or contain alcohol. Feragaia doesn‚Äôt it acts with confidence and is a true alternative. Bravo Feragaia I really get this and think you‚Äôve cracked it

I find it a tasty non-alcoholic alternative to a G & T. First tried, and then purchased, at a Country Fair, and then when all that ran out treated myself to a couple more bottles to start me off on a dry January.

review_title: I love that it is low carb and low‚Ä¶
review_text: I love that it is low carb and low calorie and hasn't got the piles of chemicals in it that most other alcohol free spirits have. Just found the flavour a bit too medicinal for me sadly. I will experiment with mixers.
Delicious! Thank you for swift delivery too

review_title: So easy to order and delivery very‚Ä¶
review_text: So easy to order and delivery very quick!The most delicious non-alcoholic drink which goes so well with so many different kinds of mixers.

I just could not bear smell and the taste was worse but it‚Äôs obviously a very personal choice as so many people love it.Following my review the company contacted me to offer a partial refund so clearly care about their customers experience. This is a personal opinion and there were many amazing reviews which made me try it in the first place.So I decided to revisit and got lots of glasses out and tried with various mixers and I liked bitter lemon and ginger ale the best but think I might try cranberry juice tonight. It‚Äôs definitely an acquired taste but I think in a tall glass over ice with a good mixer it‚Äôs certainly an alternative to just tonic water when you have to drive.

Excellent service, great packaging and interesting information on the company.  Feragaia has an interesting taste, but the earthy, smoky notes were a little too strong for me. Great with tonic and oranges though.

Delivery was a little slow, but the drink is so impressive. With very spicy ginger it tastes like rum & ginger beer. The most 'real drink' tasting and of the non alcoholic beverages I have tried so far.
Prompt delivery. Delicious drink.

review_title: A taste of the Scottish countryside in‚Ä¶
review_text: A taste of the Scottish countryside in a glass. An adult taste..slightly woody..No sugar or sweeteners ! It mixes well with ginger beer or other mixers. The taste  has grown on me and I like it more and more !

review_title: Feragaia is delicious and very much‚Ä¶
review_text: Feragaia is delicious and very much like having a whisky/brandy with ginger ale. I was sure someone must be going to develop a proper non alcoholic drink ie not like a coke, and you have done it! Thank you!

The whole buy experience with Feragaia is very easy and a pleasure.  The delivery was excellent.  The packaging is good.We have not yet tasted the drink so cannot comment on that, but recommend trying it.
A sophisticated, versatile drink. I haven‚Äôt had an alcoholic drink since I discovered Feragaia. The beauty of Scotland unlocked in its taste. Great service with fast and efficient delivery.

review_title: I can't fault this as such

review_text: Bought a bottle to try I find it very drinkable and refreshing. Have only had the ginger ale mix so far but planning to try with soda water. Very happy with the purchase

review_title: Great idea, great company sadly wrong taste
review_text: Excellent service from ordering to delivery. All packed very secure. Treat for husband as he can not longer drink, sadly he found it too herby, too many botanicals in it for his liking.
Simple, smooth, easy and fast delivery. Fabulous product. Love the new packaging.

I received my delivery yesterday. I‚Äôm sitting drinking a glass with ginger ale at the moment. I‚Äôve tried a few different alcohol free spirits. The ones that are based on existing spirit drinks like Gin, whiskey ect. Taste like a watered down version of those spirits. Not a good taste at all. A few brands like yourselves make a spirit drink that‚Äôs it‚Äôs own taste. Most of these go for ginger. So it‚Äôs just like a ginger cordial. Feragaia has a completely different taste. It‚Äôs strong enough to cut through the ginger ale mixer, and has a unique and distinctive flavour. Out of all the alcohol free spirits I‚Äôve tried, yours is by far the best. It‚Äôs so refreshing to have something different, that just tastes great. Thank you for creating this fantastic drink. I‚Äôll definitely be getting more in the future.
This is now my 3rd purchase it‚Äôs so nice to find a non alcoholic spirit that can be taken neat over ice or mixed with fever tree ginger ale which tastes devine or used as a base for cocktails.

review_title: This is probably the best non alcoholic‚Ä¶

review_title: Out-of-this-world drinking experience and fantastic customer service!
review_text: Whenever I was hanging out with friends and they were having a drink or two, I would always just drink boring, non-alcoholic drinks because I don't like alcohol. I never had a good alternative to alcoholic drinks. This is why I was instantaneously excited when, by chance, I came across Feragaia. Straightaway, I went to their website wanting to order a bottle but then was bitterly disappointed that the only option was UK shipping. Still totally thrilled by my discovery, I gave it a try and contacted the Feragaia team directly. The founders responded immediately and without further ado made fast and reliable shipping to Germany possible. Just ten days after discovering Feragaia, I held a bottle of it in my hands and had a first try. Feragaia not only met my expectations but exceeded them. With only a drop of Feragaia, every plain soft drink becomes a drink worth remembering. Since then, I have tried many non-alcoholic cocktails with Feragaia and loved every one of them. By now, my first bottle is almost empty and I'm very sure it won't be my last one. Thank you Bill and Jamie for this great invention! I'm a huge fan! Sl√°inte!

review_text: I have tried to like this and have tried drinking it neat, with ice and a slice and with ginger ale. But I really do not like it at all. Neither the smell nor the taste. I‚Äôm afraid I really did not.

review_title: I was surprised by my initial taste of‚Ä¶
review_text: I was surprised by my initial taste of Faragaia which I tasted neat. I was expecting something less subtle and stronger tasting. However I don‚Äôt think it is meant to be embibed neat and it does enhance tonic, ice and lemon or even lime cordial. It has a lovely ginger aftertaste.

review_title: Not quite what I was expecting
review_text: Not quite what I was expecting! Definitely best with a mixer or as I did, a little filtered water over slices of fresh root ginger, which I  chewed on after each sip...yes I'm definitely different lol!

I've tried a few non-alcoholic spirits recently, and while this is definitely not as undrinkable as some... It is still really minging.  I tried it in several ways, and with mixers... Still minging.   It is is difficult to describe, but the smell and taste reminds me of some kind of poultice or topical herbal medicine (not in a good way like underberg or jagermeister though).  I really wanted to like it, but the search for an enjoyable booze free spirit must continue.    The service/delivery was fine, but I felt the need to post this review when I realised Feragaia are removing and blocking any non-positive comments under their facebook adverts... Which ain't very honest.Reply to the Reply:  Thanks for getting in touch Jamie.  There is no need for a refund, I bought your product - and you supplied it - so all is good there.  I just really didn't like it. (Btw, having no sugar or sweetener was agreat selling point for me - and I'm pretty sure a sweeter version would not have appealed to more).   The one star I gave is fair mirror of my experience though.    And by the way - someone blocked me from being able to post a comment under your adverts - and all I said was that I found the taste minging - even with mixers - nothing more negative than that.  On the day I did that several other people had said the same thing, the next day I was blocked from commenting and both my and other peoples 'negative' comments were definitely all gone - with the same positive comments I'd seen the day before still there.... - So someone is cleaning up the comments on your facebook posts.

review_title: Really enjoying this drink.So nice with‚Ä¶
review_text: Really enjoying this drink.So nice with This nice and ice .Will definitely be ordering more!
Great product . Very marmite as in really like or really dislike
Excellent service from Feragaia. Website clear and ordering process straight forward. My bottle arrived beautifully wrapped and on time. The product did not disappoint.

I read about Feragaia in an Economist article about alcohol-free drink options and decided to try it. I bought a Pioneer Pack - a small bottle that comes with a little cocktail recipe book. It arrived quickly and was all presented beautifully. The taste initially came as a surprise. It wasn‚Äôt like anything I‚Äôd tasted before - bitter but also fresh and lemony/peppery. The closest thing I can compare it to is white Martini. I‚Äôve tried three of the cocktail/serving suggestions so far and they‚Äôve all been delicious. They‚Äôve all tasted very different too which is nice - it‚Äôs a very versatile drink.

review_title: Service is a 5 star but the product‚Ä¶
review_text: Service is a 5 star but the product itself is just a 3, the taste is definitely an acquired one and I have had to drink it with mixers, ginger and lime seem to work best for me. It's a personal preference thing of course and I appreciate the work that goes into making it but the taste is not for me, particularly neat

Discovered this through the OH silver arrow magazine. We don‚Äôt drink alcohol much so have really enjoyed the new alcohol free ‚Äúspirits‚Äù that have appeared in recent years. So thought we give this a go and keen to support a new business. Really easy to order and delivery prompt. Just bought the small bottle. First sniff did not raise our hopes, and we thought this was going to bomber! how wrong we were. We only had elderflower tonic and a tangerine to hand- but the combination was delicious. So different to seedlip and other botanical drinks we enjoy. So well done Team Feragaia. Splendid stuff. We‚Äôve already ordered 2 more bottles. Thoroughly recommended.

Arrived promptly and we'll packaged. Tastes unlike any other drink. Quite refreshing. Complex. I got the starter pack which includes some cocktail recipes. I have only tried it with ginger beer and lime so far. I think this will grow on me. It's expensive but it beats alcohol and I enjoy making an occasion of it.
Excellent service and a beautifully refreshing non alcoholic drink which is also sugar free.

I have become a really big fan of Feragaia. It has a really unique aroma that evokes a sense of well being on just opening the bottle.I prefer to mix mine with ginger ale, I think aromatics work really well together with the ginger.I call it my smug drink as if feels so indulgent but has hardly any calories.It doesn't feel like it is trying to be a fake alcoholic drink but is quite individual in being a really nice alternative to alcohol plus a much nicer change to other soft drinks. I hope the local pub starts stocking it when we can eventually go out, what a refreshing change that would be.

review_title: Everything first class but the flavour wasn't originally for me......
review_text: Everything, customer service, packaging, marketing etc was first class EXCEPT for the actual flavour of the product...which was, for me at least, horrible to BEGIN with.I had high expectations based on all I read and am looking for something to drink during the week instead of whisky. I realise it will not taste like whisky but hoped for the warming complexity and viscous mouthfeel of a decent speyside or lowland whisky. I originally described this as tasting like the back of a really old dusty cupboard and is too thin. I tried adding ginger ale and tonic which improved it but not enough to make me want to drink it.That said I seem to be in the minority as most people writing reviews seem to love it.I was pleasantly surprised that the boss at Feragaia got in touch with me and asked how he could make things better. We chatted by email and he made some suggestions for mixers which, to be fair, considerably improved things as far as taste was concerned.He suggested some citrus based cocktails and additions and some ways of sweetening the product to my taste and I ended up quite enjoying the suggestions.I will stick with it because it's growing on me and because the company was so helpful I feel like they deserve a chance in difficult times.I do think it's really expensive for what it is since it has no alcohol duty to pay. BUT again it was explained that currently they are selling small quantities so in reality expensive ingredients coupled with all the costs of getting started will inevitably make it seem dear. I would imagine it will shift downwards as it becomes much more popular.I have changed this review from 1 star to 4 stars because I feel like the extra information helped me to enjoy the product BUT most importantly the customer service was outstanding.
Product arrived yesterday and I had a little drink with ice and orange when I got home from my long shift at the hospital. Very nice. Looking forward to trying the cocktails

review_title: I wasn't sure whether I would like this‚Ä¶
review_text: I wasn't sure whether I would like this although the flavours appealed, so I just ordered a half bottle. But, it is delicious, especially with tonic and a twist of orange. Very adult so you don't feel you are missing out if we ever get back to drinking socially again.
I ordered a bottle for a Christmas gift and when delivery was delayed, Feragaia delivered a replacement which was excellent service! More importantly, my daughter-in-law really enjoyed the product

review_title: At Last a grown up drink for those that don‚Äôt drink
review_text: For many years, I have been invited to dinner at the Whiskey Society in Edinburgh. I would smell the very high quality whiskey my clients would be drinking. A little envious as I don‚Äôt drink because I am a Muslim. Then Feragia came on the market as a game changer for non drinkers. The smell of seaweed is a little strong. However you can taste the different layers of flavour as the drink passes through your mouth. You can taste the effort and skill the distillery has put into making this product. I prefer mine with a clementine tonic water over ice. I look forward to any new product this company releases in the future.

review_title: Received my first order and the drink is delicious!
review_text: Received my first order and the drink is delicious! Have tried it on its own with ice and again with a little ginger beer. I like it because it doesn‚Äôt taste alcoholic or try to resemble alcoholic drinks, it‚Äôs in a class of its own.
Quick and efficient delivery. Well packaged, good quality product. It is a gift for a friend, so I haven‚Äôt tasted it yet, but my friend has had it before and loves it! X

UPDATED REVIEW: I do applaud the care and work that has gone into this but when I first tasted Feragaia (without any mixers as I wanted to know it's pure taste), I found it was not really to my palate. And personally, I do feel that while there is to me, a welcome slightly smokey element, I find that the botanicals also give a bit of a medicinal tang.That said, Feragaia do offer a number of mixer and mocktail suggestions and I was a little hasty in my judgement. I have now tried it with slices of clementine, some of the juice squeezed in, and topped up with tonic and lots of ice in a long glass. My tastebuds were very happy - I was pleasantly surprised to find that it felt like I was having a "real" drink at the end of the day. The benefit was I had two of them while cooking dinner on a week night without feeling a little fuzzy - nice. On a weekend, with a bit more time, I might yet venture into some mocktail making. I may even try mix it with some alcohol on occasion (sorry Jamie!). But for an alcohol-free day option, I'll be hitting the Feragaia & clementine tonic option again.
