Not even worth one star. Booked Turkey for the second time in 3months to look at properties booked all inclusive and supposed to be a good star rating after delays in flight got in at 3am went to room toilet over running all the time air con not working room no resemblance to pictures morning hair dryer not working fell to pieces lights not working feet black from walking on floor complained hairdryer repaired masking tape lights partially fixed one air con worked hairdryer then overheated almost burning wife's hand. Complained again asked room change advised return after 3. Lunch inedable cold no flavour to the bar no beer sorry so no chance drowning sorrows another time no vodka no raki again no beer adults pool kids jumping in from family side paid nearly ¬£1400 complained many times had to eat and drink out again no room change rooms pool side resterunt ( very loose description).so what has all of this got to do with gallexyhollidays well the first day sent email no response second again third.dqy we will contact the provider then nothing my wife's comments would not put a dog here rang true but being a the weather's nice people lovely scenery lovely kinda guy took the ear ache and humiliation of not being able to sort return from Turkey composed email on plane and sent early hours followed up.immediatly Monday to complain "a supervisor will be in touch" Tuesday same after 3calls Wednesday again but am email also saying again would be in touch with room provider Friday again nothing insisted again speak to a supervisor again nill. Monday lost the plot got in touch bank who advised section 75 sent email advusing that would have to do suprise 10 minutes later supervisor on phone saying will sort not to do section 75 2 days later nothing so have filled in await responce nill 2 weeks on but all I can advise us DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY and like all we all have had holidays that do not meet expectations but call centres that do not help take money and vertualy say what you going to do please go elsewhere

I went on a holiday with a company called Galaxy Holidays last June and we paid for transfers however they just did not turn up either way as in when we arrived and when we departed. We spoke to their rep at the resort and we‚Äôre brushed off by a rude member of staff. We have raised a complaint with them and they keep saying although we paid them everything as a package they are stating the problem lies with a third party contractor they work with for the transfers. Referring to the failures we were caused a great deal of inconvenience and distress as we spend all of our spending money on paying for the transfers that should have been provided. I was devastated with the situation and get helpless in a foreign country not knowing anybody and for my partner who suffers from anxiety and depression this was a welcome break that should have been a relaxing and fruitful experience. I‚Äôm any case we saw that Galaxy has an Abta membership and tried raising a complaint with Abta but galaxy is not coming up when you have to declare the name of the company in your complaint. We have tried calling in numerous occasions and keep being told that the current person a manager by the name of Kevin who is dealing with our complaint is very busy, cannot talk and will respond in due course as he is inundated. They seem to have a fair number of agents in the complaint section who all seem to be under the kosh so it is alarming and I wonder how many people are suffering as a result of their failures. From what I see on social media where I have contacted them also they will constantly upload new posts and the complaint messages are usually deleted. Thanks for reading guys and please avoid these guys like the plague they are incompetent and unapologetic and do not communicate.FURTHER NOTE AS OF 31/10/22 :So they have replied and said they will contact us ‚Äúaccordingly.‚Äù Still no contact from them it has been over 6 months clearly they do not care about resolving genuine customer complaints.

review_title: We booked a dream holiday which turned‚Ä¶
review_text: We booked a dream holiday which turned into a nightmare. 3 days before we were to leave. We were told the flights they had 'booked' for us were cancelled by Turkish Airlines with our 30kg baggage allowance for our 2week holiday. Initially told us we could go from Manchester and we would have to pay an extra ¬£400 for the privilege and get it our own way to the airport 200 miles away from our original booking. Ended up being emotionally blackmailed into accepting very poor flights as our holiday was imminent. Also told that the other elements of our holiday were non refundable and we should claim on our travel insurance if we couldn't accept the flights.This resulted in having to go via Prague on the way to Egypt and on the return having to get our own way between Milan airports for an extra out of pocket ¬£140 as they booked it as a self transfer even though the flights was coming in late at night and there were little options to get there on time for a flight when the last train left before we could get to Milan Central and we had to fork out for a taxi or potentially miss the flight home as Milan airports are 90 km aoart. The other major problem is that we were sold the holiday on the basis of the itinerary on the cruise ship. But they had not booked us on any of the trips, some trips were down as optional extras which we enquired about before we left and told the optional ones were extra. But not told that the trips in the supposed itinerary were not included either. Ziya deserves a special mention for his awfulness in making what should have been a well earned holiday very stressful. We feel we have been scammed out of our money as the Airline had a responsibility to book us on alternative flights as to not disrupt our trip but Galaxy did not help us get decent flights. These original flights were either never booked out Galaxy don't know their clients consumer. We have no reason to ever use Galaxy again. And are concerned that they can advertise in The Metro as though they are a legitimate company. Use anyone else. They don't deserve the one star but that is the lowest I can go

Firstly, If I could give a No Star rating, I would of done exactly that.Secondly, I wished I'd read the reviews before I picked up the phone to book a holiday from Hell with Galaxy Holidays. Thirdly, This Company are a Scam artists. Why are  they still allowed to operate as a company,  I'll never understand. I should of known when I was speaking with what sounded like an Asian man with a name of Kevin Jeffries. I have had to make other calls to them for one reason or another, the same thing. Asians but with English names. I should of smelled the üêÄ there and then.Right!!! Where to start but the beginning. I saw Galaxy Holidays advertised in the Metro paper. I thought with everything we'd been through with the Pandemic and all, I thought I deserved an holiday.The Agent that answered my call was Kevjn Jeffries.  Of course he was friendly and chirpy, that was so he could rob me blind.I explained to him that we were Two pensioners don't worry he said, I'll look after you. Yeah Right!!! Look after yourself more like. There were a few holidays he mentioned which sounded nice and would not break the piggy bank. This was the bait.We managed to find and agree on a holiday we could begin to work on. Now this is the 1st catch, after deciding  and we were now to pay, all of a sudden, there was an admin charge of ¬£36 per person. We swallowed that. As pensioners, he guaranteed us nothing above the 4th floor, he made out he had put in a speciaal request for us. My Foot!!! we ended up on the 11th floor.Also knowing that we were a couple of pensioners, he did not mention that the apartment was situated at the top of a Steep Hill.Whilst trying to sell us this holiday he  mentioned that there was WiFi and all the mod cons that usually comes with an holiday. That was not the case.He knew he was booking us a holiday with a late flight, that was not the problem, what he and the rest of the team did not tell us, was that we needed to travel from our apartment to an unknown destination at 1am to go and pick up the keys as no one will be there to welcome us. It was either a 30 minute walk or a taxi ride of ‚Ç¨10 there and another ‚Ç¨10 back to the apartment we had settled for. Bearing in mind, we had our luggage with us.They also forgot to mention that we had to pay a deposit of ‚Ç¨150 before they could hand over the keys.On getting back and had gained access to the apartment,  we found out there was no remote control to operate the TV. fine, there was nothing we could do but to wait for the office to open later that morning.10am, we were down at the office, this was were the nightmare began to unravel.They were asking for us to pay ‚Ç¨45 to access the Internet for 2 weeks and another ‚Ç¨25 for the remote control for the television.Non Refundable We could not argue with them as the Guy, did not care and was not interested. He kept pointing to his stupid sign on the wall with a notice on it that said, that a fee is needed for WiFi and TV and basically wanted us to go and leave him alone as we were wasting his time. A Very Rude Man he was. We decide to pay for the WiFi but said no to the stupid remote control. It took 2 more days to finally get Internet after we had paid him the ‚Ç¨45. The apartment was not that great, they had not cleaned the apartment. It was filthy and had the smell of sweat, urine and alcolhol from the previous tenants I'm guessing. All the blankets was filthy and smelt. After complaining, ( I must admit they came with a load of clean and fresh bankets)The sofa which can be use as a sofa bed in the living room also smelled of sweat, urine and alcohol.As we do, we cleaned the apartment out for our own sake this was after we had to go to the supermarket to get the toiletries needed along with plenty of air freshners. Just so we could make the most of the rest of our holiday, making me a cleaner for a company that mislead us.But yet; Galaxy Holidays were quick to hound us by telephoning me the following day after we had booked the holiday for the balance even after I had a deadline date which was still a week away. Yet everytime I called them up for one thing or another, it was always " Someone will call you back, which they Never". In all the years I have been traveling,  I have never come across a bunch of thieves and liars calling themselves a "Travel Agent".This will not put me off traveling  but as taught me a Valuable Lesson. And what they said was that on the day we leave, it is down to us to take the keys back to the agents knowing we have an early transfer at 10:35am, yet the agent opens at 10am now leaving one person with the luggage outside the apartment whilst the other had to run down that hill, 10 mins walk round to the seafront to give back the keys and get back our deposit of ‚Ç¨150 then have to rush back up that hill to catch the Transfer that is, if I haven't had an heart attack by then. To be continued......

Awful experience.Never again to be used or recommended.Took full payment without my bank's authorisation code.Charged ¬£325 extra for rebooking due to test positive covid 19 case.Did cancel our accommodation without telling us.Left on our own at 23:05 in Tenerife, agent answers the phone, telling us ring tomorrow, our office is shut now???Stay away.

review_title: I rang galaxy holidays to book a‚Ä¶Very disapointed
review_text: I rang galaxy holidays to book a holiday for me and my friend to go to benidorm on 22.06.2022. When we reached our destination we were very disappointed as we were miles away from Benidorm. Galaxy holidays had booked us into a hotel in Guardamar. The hotel was very isolated there were no restaurants, bars or even a nearby shop for necessities. On the second day we booked a second holiday in Benidorm and relocated. I emailed galaxy on the 2nd day of our holiday, and have sent more emails since and galaxy have not had the decency to respond. I would never use galaxy holidays again and I certainly would not recommend them.

We booked what turned out to be a horrendous holiday with Delta Holidays, part of Galaxy Holidays. The supposed 4* hotel was more like 2* and full of hundreds of teenagers. It was like staying in a large secondary school with no staff! We had NO sleep due to constant shouting, screaming and slamming of doors throughout the nights. We even had an intruder in our room and felt very intimidated by all this. We requested help from Delta on several occasions after complaining to the hotel and getting no help. Despite Delta saying they would relocate us and call us back, they never did. In the end we had no choice but to abandon our holiday and still Delta are unwilling to help. Note that Delta Holidays are part of Galaxy Holidays, so avoid both like the plague. DO NOT TRUST. If Delta or Galaxy reply to this and say that they will sort this out, do not believe that they have resolved this unless my one star rating changes. If the matter is resolved, I will update the star rating.

I would highly recommend this company to anyone looking for a good deal. A special thank you to Sam for making the whole process so seamless and easy, while getting me a great deal on my bookings. My flight, transfer and hotel stay was very comfortable . He was very patient and kind during all of our calls, despite my countless queries.

I too had the same issue but can I please recommend that if you have any issues you call a guy called Eric in customer support.Eric is the manager for customer support just give your all the heads up :-)Eric sorted my problems out very quickly when I returned from holiday. you may say this problem shouldn't have happened? Maybe, I can't change what happened as this is in the past but Eric did resolve my issue swiftly. . We loved the hotel we was in, the food was okay as this was a budget holiday. They is that saying you get what you paid for and what we paid for was fantastic.We did get frustrated in regard to our transfers being messed up so thank you Eric for the for sorting this promptly.I am currently looking for a holiday for next year and will be using GalaxyIf the deal is right :-)

I regret ever going through  them for rhis holiday o am planning..it is frustrating. You cant tell who u spoke with thw last time from their voices. They all sound alike and they always tell you only the last peraon you spoke to can answer your query ..the worse part of it is that you are not even sure if the person that is talking to you is even the peron u want to talk to.. please avoid them like plaque. They do not deserve 1star..   29/05/2022,  I tried to leave another review but it wont let me so i decided to edit the old review. About Galaxy travel agency. After I dropped my review yesterday, one of their agents by the name Ziya Dakni contacted me and dealt absolutely well with my situation.  We ended up having  a good laugh. The whole point of leaving a review is to help others to navigate their search properly when searching and also to  let the company know how they are doing in terms of customer service . If there is need for improvement then they should change. I am happy to say that Ziya took care of the situation  and I hope they are able to improve on their customer service. Hopefully they won't be letting me down again. Thanks Ziya. I will therefore increase the star to 4 stars.

Booked a holiday through Wowcher. Had a call later that day from Galaxy Holidays to arrange my flights. Was impressed by the speed. The customer service ended there. I was told my son and I would have a 3 hour transfer in Amsterdam to our holiday in Turkey. I found this ridiculous. I wasn‚Äôt going to Asia. I was told I could fly direct for ¬£69 pp. he said these were ¬£200 flights with Whizz Air. I checked on their website that were in fact ¬£150 so he lied to me. I said you cannot advertise a holiday like this with flights from London without saying there will be a transfer involved. I called back the next day to speak to a manager. I was told that this would happen when their shift starts. This never happened. I called back twice and each time was told 2 minutes I would get a call back. Never happened. I sent an email and filled in their contact form and this has not had a response 10 days later. Wowcher service has been equally appalling. They now say they will arrange a refund but I think my best hope is my credit card company.

Saw an advertisement for a holiday to Crete for ¬£199pp as a last minute get away, enquired about it and spoke with a lady called Cynthia. I asked her a couple of questions about the holiday and she was extremely pressuring for me to book. I explained I would have to speak with another family member first, after speaking with a family member to book I rang back and she lied saying the holiday price had gone up, I said that I no longer wanted to continue and she said oh no wait we can do it for that price. We then went through passenger details and close to taking the deposit for the holiday when she informed me last minute she would have to upgrade my room and add extra ¬£ per night pp or when we got there they would charge ¬£150pp, I was a little confused and knew this wasn‚Äôt normal procedure due to having extensive travel and tourism qualifications and working in the travel industry myself. I told her I no longer wanted to continue with the booking as I felt like she was money grabbing and trying to get as much money off me as she could. I put the phone down then harassed me with 15 phone calls and voicemails threatening to take payment.I have never experienced anything like it, I have been in touch with my bank and they have not tried to take any payments so Cynthia was just trying to scaremong me into booking- god knows how many other customers she‚Äôs done this to-unprofessional

Drank loads of weather was lovely and sunny,  temperature not to high in low 20 deg but nevertheless shorts and T-shirt‚Äôs weather still tanned but pools very cold , when we left the transfer was timed at 06:20 but only arrived at 7:20 we were up at 5 in morning could‚Äôve used an hour extra sleep in made the airport on time in Benidorm morning  rush hour and the hotel prepared a picnic for us as we missed our all inclusive breakfast made the return flight back to Stansted and drove home thanks to purple parking prepaid , a great break for some winter sun Thanks again Keith and Paul for a job well done

review_title: Nice holiday, shame about the agency. And the price.
review_text: While the flight, the hotel and the transfer were all fine - excellent, even - the booking process was NOT.Advertised at ¬£304 full board per person, all inclusive, this escalated by very nearly 50% by the time the booking was confirmed. Imagine my anger, therefore, when 20 minutes after responding to the confirmation email, the firm rang back to say that the holiday was not available unless we came home a day earlier, at INCREASED cost.After some discussion, the date stayed, but the package was cut to bed and breakfast only at the hotel. As the hotel was quite happy to upgrade us (at extra cost), this was clearly a financial manoeuvre on hte part of Galaxy. Sharp practice? I think so, and I won't be returning to the firm, though I will be using Jet2, and the Beatriz Costa again, very happily.

review_title: Second purchase of this amazing whisky
review_text: Second purchase of this amazing whisky. It was a gift for a friend, who declared it was one of the best she'd ever tasted, and she knows her malts!
Bought as gifts arrived packaged beautifully.Also lots of information on packaging really interesting.

Have purchased a number of bottles from Isle of Raasay now, not always been successful in the lottery for some of the releases but it's a fair way to distribute.Very good communication from them as there's often a long lead time between ordering and shipping.Well packaged to prevent damage, good looking product, made an impressive present for one whisky enthusiast. Will certainly be ordering more in the future.
The whiskey is a gift but it looks good and was delivered earlier than I expected.

Lovely gin, beautifully packaged and they managed to get it to arrive on time despite post strikesOnly downside is there didn't appear to be anywhere to write a message to say who its from when sending as a gift although that might be me missing it

I haven't yet tried this special bottling, so all I can discuss is the ordering and delivery. Ordering is as simple and seamless as any on line shop can be - I'd always rather make any purchase face to face, but it's quite a hike to Raasay, and these special bottlings don't make it into retail.I had some special delivery requirements, and these worked out exactly as planned.I look forward to trying this 'special' before long. Meanwhile I will continue to enjoy the standard release, which is a first class dram at a fair price.
Very pleased with the Whisky, candle and glass, well worth the money.
Having previously visited the distillery and tasted the product I know that it is very good. The delivery time from Northern Scotland to the South West of England was very quick.

review_title: I booked a whiskey, gin and chocolate tasting
review_text: I booked a whiskey, gin and chocolate tour and tasting.We were guided by a young women, who gave us a lot of goodinformation about the Distillery, the island of Raasay and its history. Though she had been only about 2 month on Raasay and the Distillery by then she was very passionate and you could feel the tight connection of the employees to the island and the community.The whiskey and gin were really good, rich and full bodied and although not so old (only a few years) can surely match with other and older whiskeys from the big distilleries.I only wished for some more advise on how to taste the spirits in combination with chocolate.I would definitely recommend others to visit this great Distillery!best wishes,Sascha

Wonderful tour and tasting, fantastic whisky and gin. Ended up staying another 90mins in the bar, because the cocktails were so good. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough.
Ordered as gift, arrived exceptionally quick and was well packaged

Lovely gin delivered quickly. Nice tasting glasses too. Will definitely buy again

I was so sad, I thought I'd lost my Raasay Distillery Beany - that I bought at the distillery when visiting with a friend from the States - in Glenbrittle forest. As it was new and was part of my memories with my friend. I was therefore, particularly unhappy about this. So I ordered a new one as I couldn't believe that I would find my hat along the forest track - its quite popular with dog walkers. However I did find my hat but the new one arrived in excellent time. Now I have 2 beanies and a cap (that I ordered as well - very tempting) for the summer. The cap is lovely I love the logo. Artistic without being obvious. Can't wait for summer now.

That was a very nice overall experience, I'm very curious where this little distillery is heading to :)+ Great cocktails on the bar+ Very friendly and down to earth people all around+ Interesting and informative tour- I would have liked to see the casks
Ordered on the 4/12, still not received on 12/12.

Staff were very helpful and exchanged my accommodation voucher for one I could use in the online shop. My order was processed very quickly and arrived ahead of the expected date and I am delighted with my purchases.

I never win anything, or so I will tell people! I won the opportunity to buy one of these limited-edition whiskies (mine was the Unpeated Chinkapin) and after convincing myself it WAS a good Xmas present to myself, the order was duly made. The website, order and dispatch confirmations were excellent and the delivery service likewise. I am of course now faced with the unenviable task of deciding, once I am allowed to open the box on Xmas day, do I drink or hold on to it? Definitely a first world issue there! I am intrigued by this comparatively small distillery and will follow their story with interest, buying their wares when I can.

review_title: Beautiful Location. Great email communication. In person service left wanting.
review_text: We had been in touch with the distillery on mail and the response was prompt, efficient and helpful. The location is beautiful. The views were breathtaking. We got quite a few great pictures. The place looked new and was fantastic. However, there was a girl / woman at the store who was dismissive and rude and made us feel uncomfortable. Unfortunately didn't catch her name. She marred the overall experience by quite a bit. Else, absolutely must go.
After a wee mistake and phone call to fix the staff were uick to send my purchase on its way.Looking forward to opening the bottle when I've earned it .many thanks

review_title: Prompt and well packaged gifts following our distillery tour
review_text: After a wonderful tour of the distillery with Katy we decided to order our purchases on line so we didn‚Äôt have to carry them on our flight home. We had a very prompt delivery and were pleased it was packaged in a sustainable way and well protected. We are very happy with our purchases and are enjoying a little bit of the magic of Raasay in the comfort of our own home, thank you.

review_title: Visit of the distillery and online purchase.
review_text: We visited the distillery back in July. It's a small operation, where care is clearly taken to produce great quality products. The tour and tasting were very informative. We also enjoyed some cocktails at the bar made by Lou. Her recipes were delicious and the cocktails were made masterfully. It was a great experience at the distillery, only made better by the beautiful location. We bought some of their gin and the flagship whisky to take home to France. We are being very disciplined to not drink it too fast. I also recently bought the gin and whisky as a gift for some family members. They really love it also.

review_title: Easy to order- easy to drink.
review_text: Easy to order. Fantastic delivery service. Great products.

Prices were very fair, views from the bar area where we awaited out time slot for the tour were stunning! Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable. We were offered tasters of 2 types of tasty whisky and one of their gin, then rolled down the hill smiling to catch the nearby ferry back to Skye. A great day out.

Brilliant distillery, really contemporary looking.Definitely need to visit in person if you are looking for exclusive single cask series, Unpeated Ex-Red wine, Unpeated Ex-Rye and Unpeated Chinkapin whisky only available at their shop,üòâ

review_title: I have tried the whiskey and gin from‚Ä¶
review_text: I have tried the whiskey and gin from Raasay Distillery as gifts. Extremely good quality and a very lovely drink.  The gin is great on its own with ice or with a good tonic.This time I decided to order two bottles of whiskey as gifts. It was easy to do and the whiskey arrived with a day. Great service and well packed.
Very nice whisky. Delivery was slightly slower than usual but I would still buy their whisky.

review_title: A little trouble but worth the wait!
review_text: I had to resubmit my order because there was a miscommunication on the distillery end the first time.  They showed it to have been filled, but it was never sent out to me.  Once I contacted them to let them know, they immediately shipped out my order and it arrived in great shape and in a timely manner.
Post office absolutely destroyed a bottle of whisky I had ordered from Raasay and the customer service from the distillery was excellent. Also the whisky is delicious!!

review_title: Item arrived when you said it would
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Ferry was suspended due to technical‚Ä¶
review_text: Ferry was suspended due to technical problem. On Raasay for the day with my wife and dog, with my wife booked in for the Distillery Tour. With the Ferry service suspended, we could not get off the Island and had nowhere to stay. The tour guide offered us a sofa bed as all bed and breakfast were fully booked. Then she came up and offered us the last room in the Distillery Hotel, as the people who were booked could not get to the Island because there were no Ferry crossings. We were allowed to have our dog in the room. The food was excellent and all staff very polite and professional. Considering the circumstances,  we could not have wished for a better experience.
Used you before.Quick , efficient service.Thank you.
Great product, Great Service. Love the company ethos.

Managed to get a bottle of a limited release and the package arrived damaged, it was a gift for a family member, the great folk at Isle of Raasay Distillery, without hesitation, sent me a new box free of any charge.

review_title: I liked the room I was in but it would‚Ä¶
review_text: I liked the room I was in but it would have been nicer if it had a window - not possible given the location in the building. It was well decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent. I look forward to the time when lunch can be served at the Distillery as the room and views are stunning. The staff were very courteous and helpful.

I had a lovely afternoon learning the history of one of the newest distilleries in Scotland. The building has been delightfully designed using the islands natural stone for the inside designs and a 'natural' wall with the flora and fauna. Looking forward to many more whiskeys and gins from Rassay distillery. Tasted 2 whiskeys and their gin along with a chocolate to compliment the drink.

review_title: I requested 4-6 day free delivery as we‚Ä¶
review_text: I requested 4-6 day free delivery as we were in Scotland and driving back home to Cornwall in a couple of days. Guess what? The delivery was made before the specified 4 working days! Apparently, after three attempts with intervals of 10 minutes.. the whisky was sent back! Awaiting further development!!!!!
My 5th order now and just find the whole experience and product superb. The different malts are sublime and just can‚Äôt get enough. Would recommend to anyone. Just dying to visit in person one day.

This was a great distillery tour. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Even though it is a newer distillery the tasting selection was excellent. The host was great. We would have liked to spend more time on the island exploring as it was beautiful.
Delivery time affected by post strike but nothing to do with the distillery. Communication was good and tracking available from Royal Mail.Whisky isn't bad either

Very welcoming and beautiful building so close to the pier that there is no need to bring the car over from Skye. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The guided tour with tasting was great. The guide, very knowledgeable and engaging, not only talked about the whisky (and gin) but gave us background information about the island's history and geology, which made us understand how the whisky/gin are part of the community and the island itself. Highly recommended! The whisky is great despite being relatively new!!! slainte ;)

Hi there, when we received our parcel, it was damaged and the Royal Mail team had to repackage it.  Fortunately the bottle was intact.  Please take better care with future deliveries.  This was very disappointing.
Kept informed of progress in an efficient way, and made to feel valued as a customer!
Correct traders, fast communication

The distillery tour was excellent, the building was beautiful, and the local ethos was compelling! The tour started with a very informative talk which was clear and accessible (much better than other tours!). I very much appreciated getting to try the unpeated rye special and to buy the peated miniature!Recommendations: sell the chocolates from the tour - they‚Äôre available over in Raasay House! Also, make the six miniatures more obviously available.

We went on a whisky tasting and tour of the distillery. That was excellent, but we were also told a lot about the island and it‚Äôs history, all of which put the present day situation into perspective. A thoroughly enjoyable and informative day
Bought another bottle of whisky . Taste really good. Arrived in good time. Packaging environmentally good.
IGNORE TEXT

We've been to Raasay some days ago and really enjoyed the day. The distillery itself is a modern and beautiful building. The people are super friendly and welcoming. We had a distillery tour and sadly the really distillery part was undergoing deep cleaning so we couldn't enter. However, we saw the stills from the outside and heard interesting explications and very nice stories from the isle of raasay and the distillery.

review_title: The Isle of Raasay Distilery is a place to visit.
review_text: The Isle of Raasay Distilery is a place to enjoy the ferry ride, the whisky and gin tastings and the relaxation. Our guide was entertaining and knowledgeable, not bad for a English woman.The first time I visited solo and in July I bought a group. Their whisky is enjoying glowing reviews and the botanical gin is refreshing.  Take some home. I suggest popping in at the hotel after to continue tasting or tea and cake.

review_title: We only heard about this lovely little‚Ä¶
review_text: We only heard about this lovely little distillery through our bed and breakfast hosts while we were staying on Skye, but it was a lovely place to visit. We went on a Sunday when the distillery was not operational, so we didn't see everything in action which was a little disappointing. I would have liked a little bit more information about the science of making the whisky, but it was an interesting tour. I was driving so didn't taste the whiskey, but my husband seemed very happy with it!

Had a very fun and informative tour.  Whiskeys were all excellent, bought a few bottles. The building and interior design of the distillery was gorgeous, great place to hang out,  have a drink, and watch the boats go by!
Ordered and sent out promptly. Sadly cannot comment on the product itself as it is a Christmas present.

Interesting distillery, nice idea of working together with most of the inhabitants of the island. For me it was a little bit to clean, to modern. I was missing a little bit of emotion in the buildung. The guide during the tour was great. So, 4 1/2 stars would be my rating :D

review_title: I had an excellent stay at the‚Ä¶
review_text: I had an excellent stay at the distillery for my 60th Birthday was well looked after by the staff. We had a tour round the distillery and a drive round the island.The food in the restaurant was excellent and would well recommend the visit.I have purchased both from the distillery shop while staying there as a quest and placed more orders since arriving back home.
The delivery service is second to none. However, what is most important to me is the actual product. Raasay is producing some of the best whisky around at the moment

review_title: We did a great distillery tour and‚Ä¶
review_text: We did a great distillery tour and tasted all the whiskies made on sight. I‚Äôve done a dozen distillery tours at least and this one was very personable and accessible for a group with a range of experience.Highly recommend visiting and I will definitely return next time I am in the area.

Great tasting experience with a lot of information. About the whiskytasting in general, about the Isle of Raasay whisky‚Äôs en about the history en culture of the island itself. Too bad the distillery itself was closed for a closer look inside, due to a deep cleaning process. Nontheless a great experience and a tasty afternoon

Great place to visit. the tour was informative, as was the tasting. The tour group size was small and very personalized. Lots of information about the founders, the history of the island, and of course the magic behind making whiskey and gin! Well worth it, plus it's a fun ferry ride over!

review_title: I bought a bottle for a friends 60th‚Ä¶
review_text: I bought a bottle for a friends 60th birthday and got it posted direct to them, unfortunately there was nothing to tell them who it was from. It would be a useful tool to have the ability to put in a birthday , anniversary‚Äôs ,or thank you note. In with the postal orders. Makes good business sense.

review_title: Very easy purchasing and quick delivery‚Ä¶
review_text: Very easy purchasing and quick delivery of my gift to friends! They were delighted with it and enjoyed the whisky

Excellent tasting session and tour. Informative guide. Great weather allowed us to have our drinks al fresco. Good insight into how the island community was involved in both the development and subsequent employment in the distillery.

We had the most informative and enthralling distillery tour we have ever had! Steve kept the whole group engaged and his level of knowledge and passion for the whole project meant you were carried along by his enthusiasm. It was fascinating to get a close up view of how the whisky is made and, although the group was a large one, everyone had a chance to get involved. Great whisky and gins to taste too, and the chocolates were a great addition to the whole experience. The whole tour was exceptional not just because of the location and beautiful building, but the delivery of  information  by an exceptional guide. Would highly recommend.

review_title: Prompt service and the whisky was just‚Ä¶
review_text: Prompt service and the whisky was just as excellent as the last 3 bottles were!

We really enjoyed our stay at your distillery, although we knew nothing about whiskey before. Sometimes we had small difficulties with the translation but only because of the lack of vocabulary not because of the accent.Thank you very much for your efforts!

review_title: I ordered my raasay whisky as a retirement gift for a friend.
review_text: I ordered my raasay whisky as a retirement gift for a friend who lived on Raasay in her childhood. I am looking forward to a dram (which was promised at the retirement celebration). I assume it is good as I am still waiting for a taste.
Brilliant timely delivery, ordered on the Tuesday and arrived Wednesday so what more can be said and that was during the postal strikes!!! Thank you again üíì

review_title: Very good but little bit rushed.
review_text: We thought it was an interesting tour and nice to see how the whiskey and gin are made. Our only gripe was it seemed to be a bit rushed and not much time to ask questions while going round. Would have been nice to also see the bottling area.
Great whisky. Easy purchase from good website. Delivered well packaged and very promptly.
IGNORE TEXT

Amazing customer service and phenomenal packaging for all my online orders. Products are shipped from Scotland to San Diego, California and it always comes perfectly packaged. Love supporting this distillery!!

review_title: It was a disappointment that I couldn't‚Ä¶
review_text: It was a disappointment that I couldn't get a cup of coffee when I arrived half an hour before my tour.   The distillery seems to make no attempt  to bring the Gaelic Heritage of Raasay alive. The reception area is designed like a modern urban yuppie pub.  The tour itself was good though a lot of emphasis was given to  gin rather than whisky.  It's a pity that new distilleries seem forced to do this, presumably for economic reasons.  The whisky is pretty expensive for a product that is good but not outstanding.  The emphasis and pride in the design of the bottle says a lot - but then I am a bit old-fashioned!

Absolutely delighted with the way Raasay distillery handled my online order. Very professional and prompt service. Securely packaged and arrived well within the estimated delivery period. Well done guys, will definitely be ordering again.
Unfortunately one of the boxes delivered contained a broken bottle of tonic. The box containing the gin was also damaged. It was for a gift so it was a shame we had to remove the bottle from the box.

A thousand stars. Briefly considered applying for a job and moving there because it was so beautiful. Very entertaining and knowledgeable tour guide. Even if whisky is not normally your bag, there's gin and chocolates for drivers/youngsters.
Bottle was well packaged, with recyclable packaging. The delivery was very quick, arrived within a few days, so no complaints whatsoever üôÇ
Great whisky ; efficient fast delivery thanks

review_title: The bottle I ordered was despatched‚Ä¶
review_text: The bottle I ordered was despatched quickly and arrived early. A wonderful distillery, producing a great product.

review_title: Short Tour. But well worth it.
review_text: Our Tour was short due to cleaning of the distillery. That part sucked. But the Scotch was extraordinary. The grounds are one of the most beautiful places I have ever seen. Worth the trip even if you can‚Äôt do the tour.

The tour was fantastic. Even our kids enjoyed the tour and could understand everything. (We are from Holland)Nice to hear something about the history of the Isle also. The whisky and gin tastend great

review_title: Great view location and content. Exceptional guide to really deliver the passion of the distillery and the people of Raasay. Highly recommended. Whisky not too shabby either. Well done to all
review_text: An excellent tour. The ferry, Raasay, the views, the whisky all if it combined in the passion of our guide. Excellent tour, highly recommended. Tasting wasn‚Äôt too bad either
Made a mistake with the day of booking, very quick to respond to offer a refund when by all rights it was my mistake. Very much looking forward to seeing the distillery.
IGNORE TEXT
As a returning customer, I ordered a bottle as a gift for my son, then, when offered a discount on my next purchase, immediately ordered another for myself. Both arrived the next day!
Surprisingly fast delivery, thank you so much!Wasn‚Äôt expecting it untill a couple of days later! Thank you.
We got great customer service, they kept in touch, sent a beautiful bottle of the gin with the new packaging and it was delicious! 1000% recommend.  Really impressed with how friendly everyone is!

Excellent, easy to order, beautiful new bottle. Looking forward to trying contents again. Good packaging. Excellent delivery time  very quick. Altogether a pleasant experience.  Well done. John Blake.
IGNORE TEXT
I really enjoyed the visit at the distillery. It was informative and I liked that we could see actual working people in the distillery. The tasting was also good.

review_title: As a miniature collector they're the‚Ä¶
review_text: As a miniature collector they're the only distillery that has went above and beyond on their 50ml/5cl bottles.The best bottles on the market,and the whisky makes them even better.üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å≥Û†Å£Û†Å¥Û†Åø

review_title: Very good Whiskey from a very beautiful‚Ä¶
review_text: Very good Whiskey from a very beautiful island. I can see myself sat at the base of Brock Castle drinking this. The whiskey is as warm as the wonderful people on the Isle of Raasay.
I'm a trade customer with Raasay Distillery and couldn't be happier. The whisky and gin are exceptional and the customer service second to none. Brilliant.
Lovely dram, arrived toute de suite.Have only just been introduced to Raasay, what a great experience.
We had a fabulous time visiting the distillery, the young girl was very knowledgeable. We purchased gin and the whiskey, we have visited many distilleries and this one was excellent.
Most beautiful views while learning about whisky production. Very informative, both about the local scotch/gin production and the history of the island.

review_title: Order the 2nd Release as a Christmas‚Ä¶
review_text: Order the 2nd Release as a Christmas present and it arrived with a couple of days. Great service.

review_title: They make everything so simple and‚Ä¶
review_text: They make everything so simple and open. They always keep their promises re prices and delivery.

review_title: Ordered on line & received the packages‚Ä¶
review_text: Ordered on line & received the packages quicker than I expected. A nicely flavoured gin along with the 6 bottles of Fever Tree tonic per bottle of gin at a very reasonable price.

review_title: I Would like to see the process since‚Ä¶
review_text: I Would like to see the process since it‚Äôs start, the grains etc. And I would like to see the process of the whiskey and the process of the gin separately in the same visit.

review_title: First order from Rassay.......and not the last!
review_text: I ordered a bottle of whisky and a bottle of gin and both were delivered in 3 days. An excellent and prompt service.And both the whisky and the gin are absolutely delicious!
Excellent Whiskey and Gin , efficient friendly informative service and speedy delivery . A wonderful edition to about for me the only Scottish treasure that remains .
made my order ok. Now awaiting my goods !!.
Well documented easy to follow procedures with good customer service

review_title: Ordered whisky for a friend‚Äôs birthday‚Ä¶
review_text: Ordered whisky for a friend‚Äôs birthday - fabulous dram from a great distillery.Very prompt dispatch and delivery on designated day.Excellent service.

review_title: The tour was excellent; Tasting with chocolate
review_text: The tour was excellent with not only the distilling process explained but, some history of the island as well. Certainly ask for chocolate samples with the tasting.
As titled High class service Would recommend this Distillery And the people who work here For an experience you will remember
Great customer service. I had an issue with slight damage to packaging which was resolved very swiftly and satisfactorily.
Buying whisky & gin from the Isle of Raasay website was nice & easy. Delivery was very prompt, & the bottles were well packed. Thank you.
Easy website to navigate through ,efficient postal and packaging service.Top quality dram .
Fantastic whisky from Raasay.Customer service always excellent

review_title: Easy to use website and speedy service
review_text: Easy to use website and speedy, and well packaged  delivery
We loved our tour!  Steve was amazing. More than just the whisky, he told us the history of the isle. Would highly recommend it!
Excellent product and excellent service! Isle of Raasay gin is my favourite gin and loving the new bottle! Easy to order, fast delivery and well packaged.
Excellent service. Purchased 2 small whisky glasses for guests to use and they are gorgeous.Superbly packed & arrived quickly. Definitely recommend
Seamless process with no glitches. Keep up the good work.
Beautifully made from the bottles, to the packaging to the taste and depth of flavour. I love the small isle concept and the quick shipping.
Tour guide was really nice, content really interesting, tasting superb. Would get 5 stars if there would be more time for asking questions.

review_title: Deliverd on time a Braw happy fifeur
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Swift service, easy to order, rapid delivery...and of course a great taste!
Great whiskey, and I have always loved the design of the glass bottle, Which was very well packaged.
The bottle of gin and candle were birthday presents, and the person who received them was delighted!

review_title: Delivery of the Raasay whisky exceeded‚Ä¶
review_text: Delivery of the Raasay whisky exceeded their promise. All the better for me as it is one of my favourites.
Great island, nice tour, extraordinary people and very good tasting whisky. But I want to see barrels for five stars üòÅ
Really enjoyed the tour. Brilliant setting. Good value. Make sure you have extra time to explore the Isle of Raasay.
Great whisky. Great customer service. Love them.

Nice Guide, very interesting information on our tour at the Distillery, tasteful Whisky, Gin and chocolate.
Fantastic experience beautiful distillery very passionate staff well worth a visit
As usual everyone at the distillery was first class and the gin, whisky and food was excellent.We'll be back!!
Excellent service and vey prompt delivery
Excellent informative tour by knowledgeable guide. Beautiful setting and liked the drams and gin as well !!
Very good and efficient service.  Thanks

Excellent tour very informative on the distilling process and the island we visited 24/08/2022

quick delivery and beautifully packaged. very happy. the whisky itself is delicious.

Fine. No problems.
Why the 5 star!? 'Cos its lighty peated and easy to drink! Definitely getting another one!!
Excellent experience, friendly and informative. A really great alternative for an afternoon or morning trip from Skye.Very lovely drams!

review_title: Best Gin in my gin cupboard!
review_text: This is at least my 3rd and 4th bottle of Raasay Gin - my favourite by a country mile, excellent botanics and extremely palatable!

Fantastic experience from start to finish!

review_title: The tour was excellent with loads of‚Ä¶

review_title: An excellent product delivered to us‚Ä¶
review_text: An excellent product delivered to us less than 48 hours after ordering. Well done Raasay Distillery & Royal Mail.

review_title: Speedy delivery of a very nice whisky
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

The talk before the tour was first class and was delivered by a gentleman who knew not only whisky but the history of the island as well. I enjoyed this immensely. The tour itself was great with the process of the making whisky explained in some fine detail, very interesting. We were then taken back for the tasting and were given two lovely whisky's to try along with Raasay Gin, all of which were excellent.This was an excellent visit and value for money, the ferry trip across was enjoyed as part of the adventure.Well done Raasay distillery and all of the staff we met, next time I am back in Skye I will definitely visit again.For those planning a visit, the Sherry casked whisky (Special Edition) which, considering it's young age, is superb.
Excellent service & packaged! Thank you !

review_title: We were left awestruck upon learning‚Ä¶
review_text: We were left awestruck upon learning what goes into producing a whisky and gin. More so with the history of 'Raasay' and the way it was related to us by our guide and friendly coach. He kept us informed and entertained, both at the same time. Of course, the proof is in the eating and I, for one, enjoyed the single malt and it's after effects very much. Thank you for this 'Heady' experience.
An excellent tour with a knowledgeable guide

The tour was a bit of a disappointment because the distillery wasn‚Äôt actually operating.I don‚Äôt understand why a tour was organised whilst it was not operating. Having said that, the guide was very knowledgable and entertaining, so he gets my two stars.
A really easy ordering experience. The team replied quickly when we had a query about bringing our baby. We're excited for our visit!
Husband is over the moon with the samples of whiskey he received for his birthday. Only problem is choosing a favourite as his 'proper' birthday present.

review_title: I supplied my 2 bottles to the whisky‚Ä¶
review_text: I supplied my 2 bottles to the whisky club for a tasting session. We scored all between 8/10 so very well there are 12 of us so 70cl. Was very tight however we managed. Be expecting a few new members and orders. It was a very interesting whisky.

We visited the distillery at the end of June 2022. The talk in the gathering room beforehand was really interesting. On the day we visited, the distillery was making gin instead of whisky. But it didn't matter, as we still got to hear about the process of both and saw the copper stills. The staff were making up big bouquet garnies of botanicals for the gin whilst we were there!We had never been to a whisky tasting/distillery before although we are malt whisky drinkers on occasion. It was good to find out how to appreciate whisky properly and the samples were generous. The tour was good value for money considering what you would pay for a private whisky tasting on the Ilse of Skye.

Brilliant Distillery and tour. Staff we are very friendly and our tour guide Sophie did a great job of explaining everything and showing us around the site. Would definitely recommend going and will definitely be back for another visit.

Amazing whisky . Beautiful presentation box and bottle. Such a special buy.I love it.Sweet , delicate and tasty. Dont pass this one by.Well worth the price.

review_title: Great place, great staff, the tour could improve
review_text: The setting is wonderful. The waiting area and tasting room were very nice and comfortable. The staff were friendly, enthusiastic, and approachable. They were able to answer questions about the island (Raasay) too.We did the distillery tour. This was the more disappointing part. There seemed a missed opportunity to go into more detail about the whisky making process and ingredients. Some history of the distillery too.We also missed bits of what our guide said. After following them from one area to the next, they started talking before all the tour had caught up to them. Adding some of those elements above would make you feel you had a thorough tour rather than what seemed a whistlestop tour.

A fascinating and unexpected visit to this new and impressively high-tech distillery! Excellent guide, and lovely free samples of the end product. We were also impressed that the bottles that should have gone to Russia were being sold for the benefit of Ukraine; well done them!! The short ferry-ride to the island was an added bonus. I'm sure this will become an essential part of the 'Skye' experience for those like us who are not privileged to live on the island.
Excellent gin and excellent service!

The distillery itself was beautiful, with a lovely mix of modern and historic. Our tour guide Julian was friendly, open, and informative, as were all of the staff we interacted with. We ended up staying for an hour afterward, chatting with the bartender and daydreaming about staying permanently! To top it all off, both the whiskey and the gin are delicious, and we brought some back home to the states with us. Really excited to see this distillery arrive on such a beautiful island, and for it to be excellent in so many ways.

This is a wonderful whisky, full of flavour and very smooth. It can send me to sleep anytime!!

Raasay is an extremely interesting newcomer on the Scottish Whiskey stage. They strongly connect to their heritage as a 'local' Whisky, combined with a highly sympathetic'small but excellent' approach. Yep, Raasay Whisky is very drinkable and by the way, their fulfilment and logistics are reliable and on the spot. And...frankly spoken I like their marketing, it's decent, informative and absolutely clich√© free. Well done Black Island people!
Honestly couldn‚Äôt believe how easy it was to order from the US for UK relatives. They do a much better job than many huge distilleries. Great example of a small place doing it right.
It was a nice experience but I would have loved to see the bottelary also

I placed my order on 15th May and received my bottles within the week. The bottles came well packaged so no risk of damage.As for the whiskey this is a great tasting dram which I am enjoying along with my bottle of the first release so tend to have a dram out of each bottle just to keep comparing the two. So am now looking forward to the next release.I absolutely love the whiskey's from Rassay and the area around Skye.

Myself, my partner Ian and another couple had booked a tour of the Distillery as Ian loves whisky and wanted to buy a couple of bottles. We were staying on Skye for the week and popped across to Raasay on the Ferry.The tour was conducted by a lovely guy called Steve who had spent many holidays on the Island when his kids were young and loved it so much that he had retired there and had been working at the distillery for a few years.He was extremely knowledgeable about the Island and the Distillery and we were all fascinated by the History of both. All of the staff at the Distillery were very friendly and helpful.The distillery buildings are beautiful and a work of art in themselves, everything has been completed to a very high standard and we were all very impressed.The Distillery employs over 30 people on the Island and has given the locals  more choices for employment which can only be good thing.When we left we bought a few bottles of whisky (which had originally been bound for Russia before it invaded Ukraine) and our friends bought some of the Gin that they also make. We very much enjoyed the tour and the Isle of Raasay itself is gorgeous and I look forward to exploring it further on our next trip to Skye.

I am a keen fan of whisky and like to sample different distilleries. I came across Rasaay on my visit to the Isle of Skye so thought I would give it a try. I was not disappointed. This whisky is absolutely top notch. Just the right amount of peat and is smoother than Barry White. It is fair to say I was surprised by how good it really is (not sure why but the review said be honest). I would recommend any whisky fan gives this a go, you will not regret it. Also on the plus side, delivery advised 6-8 days, I received mine in 3! So a top class service too.

review_title: Great final resolution after initial confusing response
review_text: I needed to cancel a reservation because of a family medical emergency.  The hotel said I could not cancel through them because I had made the reservation through Smith.   I was initially unable to reach any human being to assist by phone or email and big charges were pending.  The next day the Smiths notified me that they worked with the hotel and made the cancellation.   I‚Äôm very grateful for their help and only wish the initial phone and e-mail communications had been more responsive.   The end result was great, but the interim was anxiety inducing.

I always feel supported my Mr & Mrs Smith, especially in the covid travel chaos they have helped make sure we are reimbursed and also are always friendly and quick at responding. So great customer service, as well as lovely hotel choices.

review_title: The booking went through without any‚Ä¶
review_text: The booking went through without any issue. Unfortunately, Mr and Mrs Smith advertised that the room would be amendable up until the day before arrival. Having spoken to the hotel since, this is not the case.

It is always the same story with them. Massive delays in response, couple of people dealing with your inquiry thus resulting in complete lack of communication between the employees thus making an unnecessary turmoil with your booking. They are suppose to be a luxury service but its nothing close to it. In around 2018 the hype fore them was unreal resulting in massive crowdfunding for the company but they do not offer anything more then booking.com. If you want to be better off and have a hustle free booking experience of your vacation go straight to booking.com. This is a typical over-hyped company resulting in humongous profits for the owners without offering anything to the clients. Trust me you do not wish to be their client.

review_text: Always love your choice of hotels. BrilliantWe have booked 8 hotels with you this year‚Ä¶..all fantastic. Thank you the dream team! Here‚Äôs to more Mr and Mrs Smith trips next year!

review_title: Lovely venue but all closed up Monday - Wednesday so room only
review_text: We booked through mr & mrs smith as a treat since our honeymoon flight was cancelled. We expected a lovely hotel, location and general ambiance. The room was lovely but the restaurant was completely shut and we were the only guests. The whole vibe was poor and unlocking doors to enter an empty building is definitely not what we imagined. To make it worse the only reason we knew the restaurant was shut was as we emailed requesting a table for dinner and they replied saying they were shut and we would need to pick up keys from the restaurant up the road. If we had not emailed there is no way we would have this information. The final straw is the fact we booked a b&b experience‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ because the restaurant was shut Monday-Wednesday we again told to go to the restaurant up the road. However they did not open till 9 so the advert saying ‚Äòearly birds could get fruit, yogurt, pastries etc‚Äô was not true. As you can imagine we were very let down by the whole experience and could have stayed somewhere else. Another problem was the fact the tiny town we were in has most shops closed on a Monday! We arrived assuming an afternoon browsing the local shops and ended up in tescos and boots. Highly disappointed and expected much more. The only reason it is not 1* is because the gentlemen who helped us book last minute was very helpful and friendly on the phone.

review_title: Easy to book and beautiful choice of‚Ä¶

Much to my surprise i received an email from Jack Boyes whom i called and found to be professional and delightful to deal with, all issues were resolved quickly & efficiently a great recovery all round. thank you. I would recommend Mr &Mrs Smith hence the 5 star review.

review_title: Alila Oman is one a kind and we had a‚Ä¶
review_text: Alila Oman is one a kind and we had a wonderful experience there last weekend (3 days, 2 nights)! The hotel treated us well, but -especially given their high prices- also needs to drastically invest in a better ‚Äòbalancing act‚Äô:Location is extremely awesome. Not many hotels in the world beat this view, surroundings, secludedness. Staff is super nice, warm, accommodating (host Irene is a blast)! Wellness quality/massage team is great! (Bath)Rooms & balconies are spacious, beds really comfortable! Lots to do, chilling in beautiful swimming pool area, or interesting (but expensive) activitiesüëçüèº BUT, furniture is rather old (fashioned). Tables, chairs, accessories, etc. is NOT up to date at all. It wobbles, is not comfortable, paint is chipped off, etc. Also design-wise, it does not blend in nicely with the light, serene surroundings (you‚Äôd expect natural, desert-like colours, etc). Simple things like logical lightning in the room, mosquito nets (so you can sleep with the delicious fresh air), etc. are all not in place. But a huge old fashioned TV screen and an old fashioned wooden desk is in the room? In such a grandeur hotel & location, we‚Äôd expect more eye for proper furniture, accessories & design. Also, staff is supernice but come across as a young, rather unexperienced team: they are clearly still learning/new, do not offer smooth 5-star experience. They are from all over the place and it felt no one could tell us a thing about Oman/local culture/food/the mountains/etc. Also, simple  questions about wine, food, etc. were answered (always very nice but) inappropriately. They just need (more/better) educationüí™üèºThe activities (& 4x4 transport) could be either more complementary or better priced. We booked high quality excursions via external guide, Alila asks >3 times the regular tour guide prices (we did quite some research here:)Shortly: huge potential, execution long way to go! Meanwhile, we realize fixing those points takes time in services industry, Alila should work on giving guests back more value‚Ä¶

review_title: Website error corrected at the second attempt. Good CS
review_text: I spotted that a 'stay for 3 nights, pay for 2' hotel deal wasn't showing the price correctly (a 3 night stay was being charged at triple the one night rate!) and reported the problem. Customer service's initial response what 'there isn't an error'. I went back with the correctly calculated  price shown alongside the website calculations. Customer service then came back quickly to agree there was actually an error and offered me a discount as a thank you, which was much appreciated. I didn't have time to make the booking straight away, but CS made a follow up call the same day to check I was now happy, and arranged the booking over the phone. As a Goldsmith member, it would be good to see more clearly and obviously what benefits will accrue for actual bookings, over and above 'blacksmith' benefits such as half a bottle of champagne and some chocolates (and a lower cashback rate), which I believe are applied to all bookings.As Mr & Mrs Smith is now part of IHG, I wonder if bookings made directly with Mr & Mrs Smith should automatically show up in 'future stays' in one's IHG account? This doesn't appear to happen currently.

review_title: Issue with taking payments up front
review_text: Exclusive offer on hotel is good and they beat all other providers and direct prices on our stay. However, on booking, website clearly states no money due up front but this is incompatible with ApplePay which takes full balance up front. Clearly with hotel stays worth ¬£thousands, having a full balance charged unexpectedly is unwelcome and can create unintended effects. Should be very clearly stated on the website if this is the case, or Apple Pay shouldn‚Äôt be offered. Phoned Mr&Mrs Smith and was helpfully resolved quickly but this is the second time I‚Äôve had this issue and it should not be happening. Note our stay has not yet happened so no comment on that.

review_title: So helpful over the phone and booked‚Ä¶

TOTAL scammers.  Do NOT TRUST them with your CREDIT CARD details.  They fraudulently ran mine through for E4,500!If you cancel a booking with a hotel booked through them (for health reasons in my case) you may lose the deposit - this is par for the course.  Mr & Mrs Smith will promise to help try to recover it though so don't worry.  BEWARE! Their 'help' consisted of:1.  Asking for my credit card details again but then, far from refunding the deposit (E4,500) to the card they took PAYMENT OF THE BALANCE (another E4,500).  Absolute fraudsters!  Fortunately my bank spotted their fraud and denied payment.  When asked to explain themselves - they simply avoided the question.2. They had said they'd help try to resell the suite.  I checked on their website and the suite had indeed been resold.  Yippee.  The only 3 bedroom suite this hotel had (Mougins Luxury Retreat) was showing 'unavailable' - and I reasonably deduced this was because they'd resold it. Later the 'Smith Team' explained this apparent rebooking was no such thing, but was actually 'a technical glitch' with their website.  That 'technical glitch' dissuaded me from offering this non-refundable booking (10 days in a 'luxury' hotel) to a friend/family member.  When asked for a refund, they refused.The next step for me is issuing a summons against them in the County Court.  If you'd like to follow my progress - or add your own experiences of them - I have purchased a URL with their name, and the word 'Scam'.  Please give me a week or so to populate it, then Google it.  Use this firm at your PERIL!

review_title: I booked 2 ocean view rooms at this‚Ä¶
review_text: I booked 2 ocean view rooms at this hotel for my family. Someone at the front desk called me to ask if I needed the rooms to be together because there was limited availability and they wanted to accommodate my needs. I called them back multiple times, no answer. So I left a message. I also sent an email explaining that the second room was for young kids and even if I split up with my husband, I needed him close as he just had open heart surgery a few weeks ago and we were planning a short getaway as he recovers. It took them 3 days to reply and when they finally did, they said they didn‚Äôt have availability to accommodate. This is super frustrating as I know they HAD availability when I initially called them back. So I reached out again asking what was available in the same building? And no response.  We haven‚Äôt even arrived yet and I can already tell that the service is terrible. I hope when we arrive that they rod this - The rate is not cheap. And I am wondering if the reason for the mistake in the first place is because we booked it through your company.

review_title: Not a great experience with Mr & Mrs Smith
review_text: Not great! We booked a 'mrandmrssmith' hotels via BA Holidays. However, when we checked in we were told that Mr & Mrs Smith hadn't paid for the reservation and that the full balance was due. We called the BA duty office who informed us that we had paid the full balance, and that Mr & Mrs Smith were liable for the full costs of the reservation. However, when phoning Mr & Mrs Smith they personally told me that they hadn't recieved a penny and it wasn't their problem. So I contacted BA again who followed this up with Mr & Mrs Smith, who eventually agreed that the reservation should have been paid for. A very stressful experience, and had the worry on holiday that i'd have to pay an extra ¬£1000! Beware!

review_text: I went to the Artist s residence Oxfordshire with my teenage daughter. We loved our stay in the barn Suite. review_title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith Came to the Rescue
review_text: Three weeks ago, my husband and I were turned away from a Princess cruise departing from Southhampton for the Baltic because we tested positive for Covid.  Having no symptoms we were stunned.  We confined ourselves to an airport hotel until testing negative two days later. While in confinement we spent our days figuring out a replacement itinerary that would not break the bank and that would make the long trip across the pond worthwhile.  My daughter-in-law recommended Mr. & Mrs. Smith.  Armed with our cell phones, the Mr. & Mrs. Smith ap was thorough in description and easy to use.  Additionally they have live people available to give live phone assistance.  We got home last night and agree that the hotels we found using the Mr. & Mrs. Smith curated recommendations salvaged our vacation time in Europe.

I have been using and trusting the Mr and Mrs Smith website for years now. Whenever we book a trip, I always start my hotel research with this website because I love the well curated list of hotels I find, with very detailed reviews of the properties. Every time I book a hotel through this website, I‚Äôm confident we‚Äôre staying in a great quality and well designed boutique hotel.
Great customer service!  Continually assisted in making my reservation perfect.

Properties are not as described, both bookings I made via the website were run down properties with sub-par amenities. Customer service is good and resolved issues promptly and courteously, but curation and partner selection needs attention.

review_title: Beautiful building in a hill town in‚Ä¶
review_text: Beautiful building in a hill town in Corsica, with clean modern but tasteful newly appointed rooms.  Bathroom particularly well designed with plenty of space.  As everyone says, the pool is heavenly.  The food in the restaurant was amongst the best we had in Corsica.
I could not be more pleased. My agent Anna was so helpful in educating me about France and the areas we are visiting. I am now very excited about our trip!

review_text: We had a fantastic time at the Sextantio hotel in Matera. It was truly memorable experience and one which will be treasured. The facilities were perfectly in keeping with the Sextantio project and it‚Äôs unique heritage. We found the staff very helpful at all times from providing tips on where to visit, to where to eat etc. Talking of eating, the breakfast buffet at the Sextantio was excellent. Don‚Äôt miss this unique hotel. We loved it!

Checked into room, stains all over carpets , rooms really really tatty over looking a car park. Hotel was reluctant to move us rooms saying if we moved we would need to pay extra , after a lengthy phone call from staff phoning manager , manager agreed we could move rooms .... our stay went from bad to worse. I made a reservation for a very expensive hotel in Italy via the Mr & Mrs Smith website. I cancelled it 2 days later (well within the cancellation window). A few days later I noticed the hotel had charged me for one night. I called customer service and they told me the cancellation period listed on their site was incorrect but because it was their mistake I would be refunded right away. 6 weeks and 4 phone calls later (plus a total of at least 2 hours on hold) I have still not been refunded. Today I was told that it's pending a meeting with "the seniors". I suggest "the seniors" also take some time at their meeting to discuss how to improve their customer service. In the mean time I will be filing a claim with my credit card company - adding to the ridiculous amount of time I have had to spend trying to correct their mistake. Needless to say, I will not be using Mr & Mrs Smith to book hotel reservations ever again.

We recently stayed for 8 nights at the Don Ferrante Hotel in Puglia, a lovely 5 star. We had a really nice time and the hotel was lovely. We stayed in the Carlos V suite which was fabulously located about 150 meters along the harbour. It was really well appointed with its own roof terrace and we would recommend. I would however say there were some little niggles that could have made things better. The breakfast was nice but the same every day with no variety. We only found out on the last day they did freshly squeezed orange juice if you asked - I would expect a 5 star to offer. It also took time to get tea and coffee which was frustrating. If this happened once it would not be worth mentioning but it was every day. They just needed to better organised with more staff. The hotel run a shuttle to a local beach which is lovely. There is a charge but it is only when you get there you realise there are different levels of cost with the hotel charging for the best rather than telling you the various options so you can make your own mind up. The most expensive option is just not worth it and you can pay 50 euros, half the price of the most expensive option. The final niggle was in the hotels roof terrace and pool area. If you wanted a drink or snack you had to go and find a member of staff. They never came round to ask. Whilst they would bring it to the lounger, they then never came  and cleared away. As I say, these are niggles but in a 5 star, expensive hotel, these can become irritating. Overall, it is lovely, really quirky, beautifully located, the staff are lovely and I would recommend.

Other than that, the descriptions of the hotels are very good and I really like the Smith bonuses offered, and the various extra information about what to wear, etc.

review_text: All is great with Mr and Mrs Smith when things go to plan. Unfortunately we had to cancel our booking on the day due to testing positive with Covid. As per the terms and conditions, we were charged in full for late notice cancellation.This is where Mr and Mrs Smith advised:'however, it is the hotel's prerogative whether the booking can be rearranged, and after having spoken to them, we were told it was not possible'All I can say is disappointment and frustration and after an email an offer of ¬£25 on a future booking after being charged over ¬£300. Not the best birthday experience.From a customer experience, it has left a bitter taste.Going forwards we will be looking to book direct with the hotel as Mr and Mrs don't offer any additional protection.

review_title: Mr & Mrs Smith messed up my honeymoon and made me pay for it.
review_text: I booked my honeymoon through Mr & Mrs Smith in November 2021, six months prior to our wedding.  I had specifically been looking for a hotel in the Lake District with an outdoor hot tub that was dog friendly and close to amenities.  In February, Mr & Mrs Smith got in touch with me to explain that the room description on their site was incorrect, and my room did not have an outdoor hot tub.  They offered my three, useless, alternatives (i) change the dates (not an option as the purpose of the honeymoon is to have a break immediately after your wedding); (ii) change room to a bigger room with an indoor bathtub (a bath tub is not, in my view, an alternative for a hot tub.  I can have a bath at home); or (iii) cancel the booking, leaving me without any accommodation for my honeymoon.  I explained that none of these options presented a very satisfactory solution, and so was offered a fourth alternative - pay an extra ¬£200 a night for an alternative room at the same hotel with an outdoor hot tub.  Quite frankly, I am not sure why I should bear the cost of Mr & Mrs Smiths' or the Hotel's incompetence (I'm not entirely sure whose error the room description was), and so I asked to speak to the Manager of the customer complaints team.  I am still waiting to hear from them weeks later.  I think it is this that has irritated me the most about the whole experience, as the customer services team I spoke to were very pleasant and prompt, but their Manager is useless and refused to engage with a potentially difficult conversation - something you would have thought a customer services manager would be used to dealing with.  I have ended up paying the additional ¬£200 per night, as by the time I had waited for the Manager to come back to me, any equivalent accommodation locally was booked up.  My recommendation - find the hotels on the site and book direct, as Mr & Mrs Smith aren't adding any value.

Due to no fault of Mr and Mrs Smith booking at all, we had an issue with our room and I emailed them just to inform and they took it on with the hotel and agreed a refund for us based on the room we ended up in. I have been nothing but impressed and will now always look at the hotels on offer and book with them if I can. Really excellent customer service. Very impressed.

review_title: Good value stay at the Cow in Dalbury Lees near Derby
review_text: We booked the Cow in Dalbury Lees through Mr & Mrs Smith. The accommodation was very good as the rooms have been recently upgraded. We were in No 1 which is a good size with a lovely double bed (quality bedding) and a walk in shower (rain and separate standard fitting). Quality Towels and dressing robes provided. The bar area is part of the original building and has a nice atmosphere. Car parking available on site.Due to staff shortages (same as many in hospitality) the restaurant was not available for meals other than breakfast. We were informed prior to arrival and the staff booked us for dinner at 2 local restaurants. A free taxi service was provided by the staff to the restaurant.The staff were very friendly and welcomed us warmly. Our mobile service provider did not have a good signal in the area but we were able to check emails and receive calls.The free bottle of wine was in our room on arrival as promised by Mr and Mrs Smith on the booking confirmation.Overall good value.

I'm really unease about this. The staff is however polite and trying their best.
