review_title: The most painful holiday booking experience of my life!
review_text: This was honestly one of the most stressful experiences I've had in booking a holiday, let alone a holiday of a lifetime (our honeymoon). Where to start?! We usually book our own holidays directly with the hotel / airline, however on this occasion we were gifted quite a generous amount via Prezola and decided to use credit to purchase Mr & Mrs Smith vouchers. Luckily we knew exactly when and where we wanted to stay so it should have been straightforward. For a company that markets themselves as "luxury" I would have expected the highest of standards.I had already spoken to the hotel directly and forwarded the email to Mr & Mrs Smith to confirm how much a half board with transfers option would be. However, I was constantly told to wait until they had received an email back from the hotel. Why could they not simply put me on hold to clarify any small details? What should have taken minutes ended up taking almost 5 days to book because every individual I spoke to could not be bothered to pick up the phone to the hotel and insisted on emailing them for every detailStaff did not sound happy or say 'congratulations' when i mentioned it was our honeymoon and that we'd had to postpone our wedding 3-4 times and therefore the honeymoon too. They seemed robotic and incompetent with every small question I had for them.I had to explain how to convert USD to GBP to them (they wanted to email the hotel again to ask this!)Payment didn't go through because of their 'systems' so the booking was delayed yet again.At no point in my painful interaction with them was I offered any sort of apology or even acknowledgement in their handling of what is meant to be our once in a lifetime honeymoon to the Maldives. I find it shocking that people actually choose to use their services. If it wasn't for my persistence in getting the room booked i'd still be waiting for someone to email them back with a week left until our honeymoon! I'm also not quite sure what their 'value-add' is as I couldn't imagine they could have offered me any advice or benefits by using their terrible services!I've never been one to say this about a travel company before, but avoid at all costs and book your own holiday if you don't want to be stressed out beforehand!
Always easy to book; great range of choices!

Website miss represented the rooms, wrong pictures etc. Explained to the lady on the phone, it was resolved but was made to feel I was unreasonable especially after the lady bet me ¬£1000 I was wrong because she knew everything about the hotel in question. After an awkward conversation it was apparent I was right, no apology, but was resolved. Not a great experience on this occasion.

review_title: A really challenging experience with Mr‚Ä¶
review_text: A really challenging experience with Mr and Mrs Smith unfortunately. We were due to go on holiday in June 2020. They cancelled the holiday in May 2020 because of the pandemic which was expected, but would not refund. When rebooking a year later to use our credit with them, it was very difficult to get hold of them on the phone. Email responses were sporadic at best. We had no way of using our credit with them via their online booking system so had to persist with the telephones. The same holiday was going to cost us almost 50% more. When we eventually sorted out the rebooking (it took a month) we arrived at the hotel to find they had no details of our booking. They do no answer the phones during their advertised opening hours. They do not follow through with the the actions they promise in writing. I have so far submitted two complaints, neither of which have been responded to. My experience does seem contrary to the norm, and I‚Äôm sure COVID has put them under pressure, but their customer service has been appalling. Booking through Mr and Mrs Smith has brought with it a massive headache - what‚Äôs the point of going through an agent if they are not there to support when needed? In the future I will use their website for reference only and book directly with the hotel. I do not recommend.
Straightforward in all aspectsVery refreshing - it shouldn‚Äôt be but it is.David

review_title: We did not have an enjoyable stay but the hotel have put things right
review_text: UPDATED Please read to the end.*****************************We did not have an enjoyable stay. This was a rare outlay - an expensive and carefully considered hotel stay for me based on wanting somewhere relaxing for my wife and I stay. After checking out several high end boutique hotels in Cambridge, I made the decision to book a room at the University Arms based on how luxurious and decadent they claimed our stay would be and how pampered we would feel. When we first arrived we left our luggage with reception who said they would place it in our room and so we went off to explore Cambridge.When we returned and went up to the room, I was surprised to find that it was an accessible/disabled room. We went down to reception and asked if we could be moved because it didn‚Äôt feel like the bathroom would offer a particularly relaxing time for us given the low height (and small size) of the basin, the inconvenience of not having a vanity basin/unit and the fact that the removable shower head could only be set to a height of about 4 foot and therefore be used while sat down on the inbuilt disabled seat.However, we were told that the hotel was completely full and therefore we couldn‚Äôt be moved.Upon returning to the room, we discovered that our luggage hadn‚Äôt arrived so I called reception and they said they would bring it up immediately. After a short while, they called back and asked us to describe the luggage because they couldn‚Äôt identify it since it had not been labelled.After they found and brought up our luggage, we then discovered that our television didn‚Äôt work so we called down to reception again and they arranged for an engineer to visit the room who eventually worked out the issue so we could watch it. Then we started to get ready to go out for dinner and upon using the shower, discovered that there was only one bathrobe - we didn‚Äôt bother to report this since we d already contacted reception by this point on three occasions!When we went down for breakfast in the morning, we were told that breakfast wasn‚Äôt included. Despite the fact that I had specified early breakfast - 1x vegan and 1x vegetarian in the additional notes/requirements section when I first made the booking a couple of weeks prior to staying.Most of these things may be small issues and based on me being too sensitive or nit picking but it‚Äôs an expensive stay and I was hoping for better service.So, overall I felt like very little effort was made to make us welcome and relaxed and was left very disappointed in spending such a large amount on the room we were given. **********************Shortly after posting this same review to the hotel by email for their thoughts, I received an email advising me that somebody was looking into the issues for me and would come back to me.A few days after this, the same staff member contacted me with a very generous offer in the hope that it would restore faith in them to sometime stay again. The gesture and the effort that this stuff has gone to rectify my annoyance really impressed me and so I have added to the review and changed my star rating.

review_title: Very attentive a helpful in a difficult‚Ä¶
review_text: Very attentive a helpful in a difficult time.

I had some gift cards to use so booked a stay through Mr and Mrs Smith. I maxed out the gift cards so had to top up with credit card. Soon after making the booking I noticed they had taken the payment twice and had made 2 bookings. They were closed at the time so I left a message on their chat function which promised a response within 24hrs. By the time I remembered that it had been 24hrs, I realised they hadn‚Äôt contacted me and now had the hotel asking me if I had meant to book twice (at least someone had picked up the problem!) and could I ask mr and Mrs Smith to cancel one of the bookings. I tried to call and finally after being in the queue for ages someone answered and when I explained the problem I was either hung up on or the line cut out. I waited a few mins to see if they‚Äôd call back but still nothing and by this point I was wondering how much it was going to take to get my money back. I called again, waited in the queue again and when I got through I said I wasn‚Äôt happy so far with having my money taken twice (I explained it must have been a system error because I wouldn‚Äôt have been able to use the gift cards twice) and not being contacted when I had been told I would and instead of ‚Äúlet me look into this for you‚Äù I got ‚Äúwell you‚Äôre the one who booked it twice‚Äù!!! I explained AGAIN that it was impossible for me to have booked it twice because the gift cards would have been empty. She then went to look into it and discovered it was in fact a system error and there was no apology for blaming me or acknowledging that she was out of order for not believing me when I said it was a system error. She instead said ‚Äúshall we just move on‚Äù well no actually, I‚Äôve never been spoken to so rudely by a customer service representative so I wasn‚Äôt ready to ‚Äújust move on‚Äù, I asked to speak to her manager who rectified the issue and apologised for the staff member but it has left a very sour taste and not what I‚Äôd expect from a company who claim to be so ‚Äúupmarket‚Äù. I definitely won‚Äôt be using again and if you appreciate good customer service I‚Äôd advise you don‚Äôt as well. One positive is they are clearly very confident and happy with their computer system, so much so that they‚Äôll trust it over you, but I‚Äôd prefer to be given the benefit of the doubt over a computer programme first.

review_title: I would whole heartedly tell anyone‚Ä¶
review_text: I would whole heartedly tell anyone wanting to book a holiday with Mr & Mrs Smith to avoid them. The initial sales conversations were great but as soon as we had confirmed the booking we were totally disregarded. We were unlucky to have our honeymoon postponed due to Covid, but there was no correspondence from M&MS in relation to this. After much chasing I contacted the hotel directly and informed them we wouldn‚Äôt be staying that year. This was news to the hotel, but they were incredibly understanding and awaited our new dates. Eventually M&MS responded and confirmed our new dates. We asked what our options would be if we needed to cancel/postpone again, to which M&MS told us they were merely a booking agent and would not be issuing a refund under any circumstances. We crossed our fingers for travel this year (Sept 2021) and thankfully we did go. A week prior to travel we thought it best to contact M&MS to ensure all was fine with our booking (as we hadn‚Äôt heard from them in a year). After chasing I received confirmation 2 days prior to departure, what a relief! I was informed an email had been sent to an address that had been closed for 2 years and I had informed M&MS of this numerous times. We arrived at our hotel on the 6th Sept and on the 11th hotel I then received a booking confirmation from M&MS of our stay. All in all, a totally ineffective customer management and handling system. I realise the last 2 years in the travel industry have been awful but when you feel totally abandoned by a big brand such as this, it left us with a sour taste in our mouths over a holiday that is a once in a life time experience.Update: as of 27/09/21 - no contact from M&MS as per their comment below to ‚Äòreach out‚Äô.

review_title: A poor experience turned to an excellent one.
review_text: We had a hotel booked in Sicily, the Mandranova, for September 2020.  When Covid hit, we were given no option other than to move the booking to the following year (all other bookings we had via other companies were refunded in full).  Fast forward to September 2021 and we cannot visit without significant risk.  And yet, the hotel chose to keep the ¬£600 we paid for this hotel.  I had trouble getting hold of Mr and Mrs Smith... I submitted a form to ask to cancel or for options to move the booking forward again.  No response for over a week.  We have been given no options.  We felt ripped off and frankly would have done better to book via another agency.  However, Mr and Mrs Smith have now come back to me and have fully refunded our hotel, at their own cost.  The issue was caused by a training issue and they were very apologetic about the confusion and frustration I experienced.  My husband and I have used Mr and Mrs Smith before and been very happy with the hotels and service we have received from them.  Initially I was very unhappy but given the response from Mr and Mrs Smith to my complaint and am fully satisfied with their reponse and will definitely use them again.

Trying to get accommodation in the north of England  seems near impossible especially if you have a family  & when you finally come across a hotel after searching for hours or days it then tells you to call up to book so Your left sat on the phone for yet another hour ‚Ä¶.  Only to be told this hotel is no longer in the brochure !!!!I‚Äôm not sure why it‚Äôs advertised online then. i‚Äôm always incredibly greatfull for any gift but next time i‚Äôd rather a box of  roses this is

review_title: Aidan and the team were ridiculously‚Ä¶
review_text: Aidan and the team were ridiculously helpful ! so incredibly grateful for the help in organising our honeymoon! Will be back again soon

review_title: What is going on with Mr & Mrs Smith?
review_text: In the past I've generally preferred to book with Mr&Mrs S rather than going directly because of the great service. What has happened? I'm trying to make a new booking and can't get through by phone, no-one returns calls or emails. Absolutely shocking. How can you be a travel agency but fail to have any apparent appetite to take new work?! I'll be using the ¬£ held on my account ASAP as something is clearly wrong with this company
Absolutely terrible communicators Bad manneredPhone keeps ringing

Incredible service from start to finish. Mr and Mrs Smith really pulled out all the stops and we had THE MOST AMAZING and memorable time at The Datai. Even managed to get a cheeky upgrade!! Felt very spoilt and looked after. Thank you for everything you did for us.

The positive: The selection of hotels is good.The negative: They simply do not care about customers. No one ever answers the phone. Those dealing with e-mails take days to respond. The live chat takes hours and is unprofessional. I simply can't believe they have any repeat business. There is nothing luxury about this company.

review_title: Avoid them - something is clearly not right
review_text: I do wonder if they're seriously in trouble. I booked a hotel in Italy through Mr. & Mrs. Smith and when my plans changed, wanted to cancel the reservation. That was 18 days ago. 3 cancellation requests through Mr. & Mrs. website (the only possible way) and numerous phone calls later - no one there to answer - the hotel is telling me my reservation is still very much active and they cannot cancel it because it was booked through a third party. I now risk being penalised because Mr. and Mrs. Smith hasn't been able to cancel a booking in 3 weeks. Avoid this company like the plague...they're clearly going down.

review_title: Total lack of service and customer care.
review_text: Having had a very disappointing stay at a Mr & Mrs Smith recommended hotel in Norfolk, this was reviewed in response to Mr & Mrs Smith's review request.  No response was received, following this, so I tried to telephone their 24/7 Customer Service number, around 1630, today. There was no answer, only a repeated recording to say there was no-one to take my call. Having been less than impressed by the hotel this company recommended, I have an even lower opinion of Mr & Mrs Smith themselves. I would certainly avoid these amateurs in future.

review_title: Refused to honour their best price‚Ä¶
review_text: Refused to honour their best price guarantee for no good reason - and took days to reply to my original claim. Eventually only responded to refuse it 4 days after original claim because i chased via their live chat function several times

review_title: Not ATOL or ABTA protected, beware
review_text: Amazingly, Mr & Mrs Smith are not ATOL or ABTA regulated and so if they cancel your holiday you're completely unprotected!  For a company trading off its supposedly upmarket brand, it's mind boggling that their customers don't have this basic protection - you might as well book with a guy in the pub.

review_title: Do not buy their gift vouchers
review_text: We booked a hotel using gift vouchers online. No ability to change the dates online when it was clear the hotel would have to close. Tried to get dates amended via their website, no reply for a week. Finally managed to speak to a very uninterested person. The dates I wanted to change to had gone long ago. Poor, unresponsive service. She told me the hotel had zero rooms for my dates, but when I contacted the hotel directly I managed to get a twin room for the dates I wanted.Dates need to be amendable online or within hours these days otherwise service is not useful.

review_title: Terrible technology leads to terrible customer experience.
review_text: I've been a customer of Mr and Mrs Smith for many years, and have had many holidays with them. However, it's recently gone downhill. Mr and Mrs Smith have a partnership with Vitality that allows you money off a stay, but you have to book through a dedicated site. This site is buggy and often doesn't work. This has led to on more than one occasion in the past 8 months losing out on a room due to having to wait for their team to contact us. It's extremely disappointing and I expect more from a brand that represents boutique and luxury hotels. The customer service they offer really let's the hotel's they represent down. On this occasion I've been unable to book a hotel for my 30th birthday, which is a big disappointment. When talking to the booking team over the phone after waiting the day to be called back they were less than sympathetic and didn't want to lodge a complaint to get the faulty booking system removed. Becky in the booking team - do better!

review_title: Terrible customer service, holding money without fulfilling service
review_text: Booked a trip in August 2020 for November. Due to Covid we obviously had to reschedule, first for January, then March, now trying for June. I let them keep my money all this time. Now they come asking for more money as the ‚Äúdeal expired‚Äù. Absolutely horrible customer service, I‚Äôve been more than flexible to adjust to the situation, and now I am expecting them to do the same.
Love their selection in the Mediterranean!

Doesn't do customer service on Sundays and website often says places "unavailable" when they actually have rooms. Essentially means in many cases you can't book on Sundays or out of office hours as their Smith24 helpline is not 24 hours at all.

I got in contact with Mr&Mrs Smith regarding our honeymoon next year. I spoke to Grace, who was the most uninterested person. I was almost an inconvenience. Firstly we had a meeting booked for half 4 where she was to ring me, I waited till 4.45 and rang her number myself, her number was engaged.. she rings me around 4.50 and I mention our call was at half 4 (I have stuff to do), she doesn't even apologie, just says she was on another call... it is not decency to email to say you're running late? or at the very least apologies! That put my back up from the start - she then went on to mention she can't even provide flights, that is fine as I am sure it's a company thing, but we've been emailing, do you not think that would've been a good thing to mention that you can't actually provide what we want?She then goes on to recommend other places outside of Mr & Mrs Smith, so it's as if she didn't want the business -  but I have to say, one good thing is that it made our lives a lot easier by ruling them out for the future!

We booked to go away before Covid and unfortunately had our trip cancelled, we then re booked for a later date however we were then unable to go as the place we were flying too a country that was removed from the safe travel list a week before we departed. We made contact with Mr and Mrs Smith and they spoke to the hotel who refused to refund or offer a credit, at this point we thought all was lost however Mr and Mrs Smith went above and beyond our expectation and offered us a full credit even though the hotel wouldn‚Äôt. I can‚Äôt recommend a better travel agent for looking after their clients.

review_title: Good selection of hotels and Customer‚Ä¶
review_text: Good selection of hotels and Customer Service at a difficult time has been solid.

review_title: Mr and Mrs Smith do not answer the‚Ä¶
review_text: Mr and Mrs Smith do not answer the line! After many attempts. Impossible to contact Mr and Mrs Smith. We have a voucher (¬£600) which we used to book an hotel in Vienna. Because of quarantine we won‚Äôt go in October as planned. We tried to contact Mr and Mrs Smith to see if we could use this voucher somewhere in the UK. There is no help.It is a terrible service.

review_title: We have been trying to contact Mr & Mrs‚Ä¶
review_text: We have been trying to contact Mr & Mrs Smith for days, no one to take calls, no reply to e-mails. Just trying to rebook a hotel but we feel completely forgotten. Good at accepting payments, otherwise lousy customer service.

review_title: Best hotels at great price and fantastic service
review_text: Mr&MrsSmith made my booking experience just so easy, from choosing the hotel, to choosing my room and a package to suit my needs. Their hotel selection is impeccable, they make it so easy to choose a hotel that fits your requirements, and the extras you receive as a Smith guest are such a lovely touch when you are wanting to feel special on holidays. Their room selection was so much better than any other website and their pricing was also better and more transparent than anywhere else. I won't book anywhere else from now on. Their reward with money off on future bookings is also much more generous than Expedia.

review_title: Great service and curated list of hotels
review_text: I have always found Mr and Mrs Smith offer a great service. Their curated list of hotels is a real plus and any time I have had an issue or needed something they were responsive and helpful. Would definitely recommend.
The Mr & Mrs Smith team have the best customer service around. From knowledge on hotels and destinations to their outstanding support during the COVID pandemic.

Mr&MrsStitch Stitches not up to Scratch!Ordered a ¬£110 cotton dress.¬£120 with p&p Arrived crumpled up creased, appalling standard of sewing, bunched lumpy cotton, chipped button, button loose!Arrived in one piece of tissue!I've had ¬£9 leggings packed from Amazon in more care..Customer services poor!Despite I was told being the "Last one" (this turned out to be a lie) No reduction offered...Will not be shopping with This label again!#unprofessional

review_title: I wanted to write a review to say thank‚Ä¶
review_text: I wanted to write a review to say thank you to the amazing CS team at Smith for how everything‚Äôs been handled whilst the worlds been upside down! I‚Äôve been a member for years and during the lockdown I‚Äôve had 4 different bookings that had to be cancelled or re-arranged and the team have been incredibly helpful. I haven‚Äôt lost out in any way as a result ‚Äì which I know is extremely fortunate given the stance some other companies have taken and is very different to the service I‚Äôve received from airlines.I can‚Äôt imagine how hard it‚Äôs been for people in this industry during this time, so to still get that level of service whilst so many things are thrown at them sums up exactly why I‚Äôll always use Smith üòä.

review_title: No problems when we couldn't travel
review_text: After realising we would need to cancel a hotel in Mallorca because of the current travel problems, the response from the company was excellent - understandably a little slow initially but giving a full choice of postponement, credit (with an additional 10%) or a full refund. Much easier to deal with than other travel companies I've had to deal with recently.

Disgusting customer service during Coronavirus. Trying to cancel a prepaid hotel in Italy in May, with a no refund no cancellation policy, and all Mr&MrsSmith can say is ‚Äúwe are only an agent‚Äù in every email and phone call. Merely forward emails from the Hotel Manager/ Owner who still thinks he will be open again in May! No responsibility taken or assistance given. Amex have now taken over my case and issued an immediate refund citing that it is the responsibility of Mr&MrsSmith as that‚Äôs who I paid. I will never use them again, despite years of loyal custom

I‚Äôve had to change my booking due to my mother needing to self-isolate (not just because we changed our mind!) I‚Äôd booked with a ‚ÄòSmith‚Äô special offer which they are not prepared to honour so have charged me the full ‚Äònormal‚Äô price to move the booking. What annoys me is rather than admit this they are trying to blame the hotel saying their prices must have gone up, they haven‚Äôt they are the same year round, I‚Äôve contacted the hotel directly. I‚Äôm just not sure what the point of them is, the price without the offer is the same as if I‚Äôd booked direct with the hotel but with significantly worse customer service (and lying). Also given the circumstances I‚Äôd have thought maybe they would show a bit of flexibility as many other similar companies are doing. Totally pointless and unhelpful company.

Terrible service and are just a booking service who take no accountability to assist post service. Whilst trying to sort out payment with a hotel and alter the dates, I was threatened with Legal action. Do not use them!!!
I just don‚Äôt get what this company does apart from add extra faff. Pointless

Please, be very careful when dealing with the website and bookings. Their best-price match is not genuine. I have submitted a request based on booking.com (for non members and members alike). I received an email to tell me that it falls under their exclusion policy. Now that they are joining IHG it is even more disturbing. Again, just be careful!

Website is fine. Does the job. I don‚Äôt appreciate the marketing of the company however. My inbox is full of requests for reviews even though I hadn't stayed in the hotel and they came before I‚Äôd even finished registering. Really indicates they‚Äôre not interested in reviews honestly they‚Äôre interested in only positive feedback and for me to do their marketing for them. I replied to their request a review with a negative review saying the above, had an email from them saying they would not publish it. Seems there are only interested in positive reviews.
Excellent clothing and outstanding customer service! Would highly recommend

review_title: Refuses to publish my honest review‚Ä¶
review_text: Refuses to publish my honest review because it's unfavourable.

review_title: Looks lovely but it is a hoax.
review_text: Some good hotels but not really good value for money. As a blacksmith member you are trapped into a contract offering minor gifts that are not worth the money. We saved ove 550 dollars  to book with the hotel directly and they offered the same room with 2 glasses of champagne. $580 for 2 glasses of house champagne is not justified. You can book a lovely hotel with them as they have a lovely selection displayed. Just don't expect it to be good value for money. There is little to no concierge service as mentioned and at over $1000 dollars a year I would rather call a travel agent at Qantas than sign up for their special members discount.

What i‚Äôve Just been gifted my goodness This voucher is like a scam, you go on booking.com and the amount I should pay between my voucher amount and their publoshed fare is almost as much as what booking.com ask for the whole stay for better hotels.Nice book and presentation, but unless gifted I would absolutely never buy Garbage !

review_title: Having just booked with confidence that‚Ä¶
review_text: Having just booked with confidence that they would honour the clear price match ‚Äúguarantee‚Äù, and realising the exact same hotel room was on sale for exact same dates I checked T&Cs to ensure I qualified (which I did) Mr & Mrs Smith just slapped on a load of other things you need to fulfil once contacted on the phone - one of which saying they could be within a certain % more expensive and still not have to fulfil their price match. Essentially it‚Äôs just a con at point of sale to make you feel like you‚Äôre not getting ripped off when you are. Booking holidays and hotels can be a lot of money and it‚Äôs not worth dealing with scammers. Avoid this disingenuous and awful company and book with the others who are at least transparent.

Recently used Mr & Mrs Smith to book a family holiday to Tenerife and they were fantastic. Helped us book the hotel, arrange transfers and also arranged a free room upgrade - absolutely first class service!

review_title: I'm not one to leave reviews but just‚Ä¶
review_text: I'm not one to leave reviews but just had to leave one for a delivery company that was completely terrible as I noticed they would respond to complaints through here. I then came on the Mr.and Mrs. Smith page just out of curiosity and was completely shocked to find it has such a low score. I have been booking through them for about a year now and have had some of the best customer service I think I've ever received. I have booked 5/6 times with them, they've matched a price for a hotel I found for less elsewhere and gave me a voucher, they are responsive, call me back, have a generous cancellation policy, etc etc etc. Anyway just wanted to leave  a quick review as they honestly do deserve it :)

I booked to stay in Dormy House hotel in February 2019 via Mr and Mrs Smith. I contacted them in June 2018 to change the date of my booking as I knew then that I would no longer be able to go in February. I was told that my original booking would be cancelled and that to rebook I had to contact Mr and Mrs Smith to give them my credit card details. I decided not to go to Dormy House for various reasons. Imagine my shock to be contacted this week by Dormy House to be told that my original booking had not been cancelled by Mr and Mrs Smith and that my credit card would be debited for ¬£385 - the cost of a one night stay! I have spoken and emailed Mr and Mrs Smith a number of times who have been completely unhelpful and have taken no responsibility for the error or the miscommunication. Their only response was "We hold off on cancelling existing reservations in the case of amendments because we want to make sure that the guest has a room no matter what complications may arise" Considering that I clearly communicated that I could not make the original dates I don't think this is an acceptable response. Holding off cancelling a booking sounds to me as though they are making it more likely that customers will incur unnecessary cancellation charges.

I was shocked when upon checking into the Marktgasse Hotel in Zurich I was taken to a top floor room that appeared to be the refurbished attic.  Due to a conference I had reserved this hotel twice, with a break of 2 days in between reservations, for a total of 4 nights.  The room I reserved [as it appeared in the reservation confirmation] was not the room I received.When I reached out to the Mr. and Mrs. Smith customer service, I was told that it would be addressed.  It was not.  Rebecca Peters [a team leader non the less] wrote thanking me for the "feedback" that would be passed onto the IT team regarding the erroneous confirmation picture.  Further, she noted that the site correctly described the room before booking, therefore, the company was not responsible for my disappointing logging experience.

review_title: Fake prices-Terrible Customer service-do not use
review_text: I tried to book The Roget in New York, New York for May 9th through May 13th on Kayaks website. The price says $83 a night tthrough Mr and Mrs Smith. I clicked on the link and that priceis no where on the website. And the price is no where to be found. Its a website MrandMrsSmith.com where you can sign up for something. And it seems like the website is just tricking people to go to their website and sign up. It seems highly unfair. And I suspect no one has ever booked the hotel at that price. When I called to try to figure it out with Mr and Mrs Smith... they blamed Kayak. And Kayak blamed them because Mrs and Mrs Smith sends the prices to them. They contacted their tech support team and they have no idea how that prices ended up there. They provided terrible customer service. Said that hotel would never be at that price. Offered 15 % (which is available to any customer on the site) and $50 credit when the hotel was basically 3x as much. They said if they found proof it was their fault they would contact me but never did. Basically they made the mistake wouldn't own up for it. They said since the hotel wouldn't budge on price they wouldn't. Its all about money for them. Not customer service. Terrible experience. Do not use. And when you call everyone says something different. First a lady said they don't work with Kayak and then someone said she was wrong. I found on the website they offered the hotel for different day for $120/day but the man I spoke with said that hotel was never lower than $300 a night. More and more lies. I would not trust them with my travels.

review_title: poor service - use for research only
review_text: Bounced around between advisors on email.  Each lost the thread and became unresponsive, ultimately I had to book directly with hotel.

I was given a Mr&Mrs voucher as a gift. It was beautifully packaged and their site makes the places sound amazing. However, our room was nothing like the picture and in fact tiny and dirty. We gave detailed feedback when leaving the hotel but the receptionist just said 'I do hope that doesn't discourage from staying again'. Seriously. I gave Mr & Mrs feedback, in the hope that they would fix the situation; a partial refund, a voucher, something that would make us feel less cheated but they just regurgitated my comments and offered no solutions. My reply to that message received no response. Had we not had problems then the experience would have been good but don't expect them to help if things aren't all the perfectly clean Egyptian cotton sheets and waterfall showers they are made to sound.

I bought a Goldsmith membership in November 2014. However I never recieved any acknowledgement for this. Apparently I was meant to get access to a dedicated account manager and a special offers URL. Also I was meant to get room upgrades and a gift. None of this happened. It took 14, no less, emails to even get any attention from anyone. Then another 4 phone calls but even then they refused to backdate my membership. Also, do check their prices as I've often found cheaper rates elsewhere. If you have already booked on mrandmrssmith and prove its cheaper ekesewhere they will match the rate and give you ¬£25. You have to fight for this though!!

review_title: The finance department at this company‚Ä¶
review_text: The finance department at this company is so shady. I‚Äôm pretty disgusted with how they manipulate in order to charge late fees. Felt like I was talking to a a slimy used car salesperson. This is how the conversation went - ‚ÄúI have to ask my manager. The manager says no.‚Äù Asked if I could speak to the manager but the manager wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúavailable‚Äù to speak with me. They‚Äôll call you. Yeah. Still waiting. What a clown show.

review_title: This is a total rip off
review_text: This is a total rip off! My fianc√© paid $38,000+ for her shares. The maintenance fee is almost $2500 per year! I think she's used it for a total of 17 nights. By my math that's around $2700 per night and the shares are worth at best around $4000 to sell. Just rent a motel and save a huge amount of money to enjoy on the rest of your vacation expenses.

review_title: Grande villa resort and Cypress is a‚Ä¶
review_text: Grande villa resort and Cypress is amazing we have been coming here 2to3 times a year to this resorts for over 20 years..the staff /house keeping are wonderful the grounds and rooms are so clean..(except the windows outside do need cleaning üôÑ)  but they went beyond the call of duty for our 40th anniversary we were brought champagne and wished a many happy anniversary... That says so much for a resort I wanted to Thank them (Carla ,Anna and please forgive me I forgot the guy's name who made sure that we had the most wonderful time and the perfect room) they were absolutely wonderful we love it here and will be continuing on through the years Thank you Diamond Resort Lake Buena VistaüíïüíïDec 16....came back January 27 2023üíïü•∞ John and Rose Coleman ‚ù§Ô∏è

This was the BIGGEST SCAM! And once you‚Äôre in your stuck! Please do not buy a timeshare through them! They do nothing they promise and they points they give you per year are more costly than a vacation you can take their maintain e fees are outrageous and increase so much every year! We signed up in 2021 and weee not able to get out after a month, their grace period to get out of the contract is 3 DAYS!!!!

review_title: I feel like I was taken for a scam
review_text: I feel like I was taken for a scam.  This company can't be real.  I'm 8 months out trying to book a vacation and I cant.  Just Hawaii...  I am so disappointed.  There should be a way to Sue this company. I am out a few thousand dollars, like 6K.  we are 19 months out and I can't but can't book Virginia

review_title: Stay away from Diamond and Hilton‚Ä¶
review_text: Stay away from Diamond and Hilton Resorts which bought them. I just was referred to a number for help and was told to wait for 170 minutes. This is after a month of failure to contact them. I did actually try to make a reservation for March earlier in Sedonna, and was told they were all gone UNLESS I was willing to attend yet another timeshare presentation. You get the idea.

DO NOT BUY THIS ! I was told that they can make accommodations and what not. I gave birth to my third child a year after getting this crap and now they are telling me I have to get a separate hotel room because when I purchased the package it was a party of 4. I‚Äôm constantly getting transferred and put on hold. It‚Äôs the most frustrating thing

We are starting to think that no one works at this company at all. We are reaching out to them relentlessly, and getting no answer back. It is very unprofessional and a terrible look on them. Only solidifying for us why it is that we want out of this timeshare business in the first place

Stay away from this company if you can. Through their incompetent IT mapping,they managed to process a booking for 2 nights at a Tenerife hotel (which happened to be fully booked anyway) , and sent the booking to a resort in Santa Fe New Mexico. The payment was taken by the New M√©xico hotel, twice, and I'm now laying out ¬£600, through no fault of my own. They refuse to refund me. Oh, and for good measure, they didn't even send out booking confirmations or invoices. Basically give them bank details, and they'll take your money, regardless!

review_title: I purchased a promotional package for‚Ä¶
review_text: I purchased a promotional package for $350 3 years ago and was told I had 4 years to use it. I tried booking several times on their website and through their customer service phone number.  To this day,  I have not been able to book a vacation. I tried Hawaii and was told I could not use it there, I also tried several other destinations and was given an excuse why I'm not able to use it at that particular destination. I emailed them requesting a refund and never heard back. This is a total scam!!!

review_title: Diamond and Hilton are probably the‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond and Hilton are probably the worst organisation I‚Äôve ever had to deal with. I own many weeks at Sunset Harbour Club Tenerife and additional points. We have been going to Sunset Harbour for over 25 years and love it there but on a recent visit it was obvious that even the staff there regret any association with Diamond or Hilton. It‚Äôs basically impossible to get any help from them unless of course you want to give them money which they unexplainable manage to have available representatives all day long. I believe the organisation are bordering on dishonesty and I intend to pursue all avenues to finally achieve satisfaction.

BUYER BEWARE!  HORRIBLE! Got SCAMMED! They told us that if we bought a smaller package, we could use it for all of the locations and cruises etc. we went ahead so that we could use it for our 10th anniversary. NONE of what they said was true. The amount of pressure they put on us was INSAINE! They literally wouldn‚Äôt let us leave and kept sending more people in to turn on more pressure. It turns out we can‚Äôt use any points except to low huge facilities if they are even available and we have to go to another sales pitch for 90 minutes! Each time! Out of their 500 locations, we get the choice of 20 and none of what they promised us!

Diamond and its predecessor Embarc operate a bait and switch selling process.  During the sales pitch they show all the resorts that 'you can book'.  But after the sale is done if I try to book any of them they are not available.  Example... the website indicates they have 130 resorts in Italy.  Search May 2023, 1 resort available Jun 23, Jul 23, Aug 23, Sep 23 all the same and it's the same resort that is available do they don't have 130 properties, they have 1.

review_title: Diamond & Hilton Grand Vacation is a SCAM
review_text: I've been disappointed with Diamond Resorts since I purchased the timeshare but now it's worst than ever. Since Hilton Grand Vacations purchase Diamond since have gotten worse. Their service is awful. No one seems to give a dam about you...  And now it seems that we, the Diamond owners are treated like second class citizens, as compared to their HGV Members.  I am about to lose 6700+ points because they can't make an exception, although, within all the presentations they've had me in trying to sell me an upgrade, they've never fully explained the use of points nor exactly what I'm entitled to...  This whole company is a scam, and now I feel like a second class citizen, compared to the HGV members...

IT'S FRAUD The sales person waste 6 to 7 hours in Hawaii, forces us to buy $10K timeshare package by saying that this will change our vacation places. Told me i have to pay $900 annually as a maintenance. After 2 months got the first bill of over $2k. Try to call cancel my plan and make me refund. Called 5 different place and no straights answer. every time call you going to be on hold min 1 hr. After holding so many time talk to someone and the answer what i got was Ridiculous. As per contract if i want to cancel it then i have to pay $2k first and have to wait for 6 month. Also have to pay $2k as penalty and $1k as cancellation fee. And when i ask some legal question the person who was on other side hang up on me. Don't suggest to buy anyone. Please if someone come and tell you about timeshare concept. just run away.....

I've owned Diamond resorts for 20 years. Can't get rid of it. Spent $20k initially. Pay $1700 annually. 20 years of pain and torture trying to use points at 2 and 3 star places that are extremely limited.

review_title: This IS A TIMESHARE even though they tell you its not!
review_text: This company got us into one of their meetings where they laid on the pressure of trying to convinceus that this was going give us our dream vacation. They even told us that airfare was included, yet itwas not. We also have since found out that whatever the maintenance fees are, it is going toincrease every single year without fail. They tried to tell us that it was not a timeshare and we couldsell it, but now here we are trying to get out from under this and we are being told now that we can‚Äôt.Save yourself the time and money.

Falsely advertising clean and beautiful resorts, while checking an Owner into a filthy outdated resort. All they want is money and won't bother to address your concerns. Poorly managed resorts, Hilton!

This is the timeshare that everyone warns you about. Never once got a date or location they promised. I paid them in full to get them out of my life and they still haven't provided me with a paid in full letter or email. Everytime I call they say it's been sent and to request another letter that can take up to 72 hours. It's been more than a month for a paid in full email and I still don't have it. Garbage company do not trust them , they are liars and scam artists

review_title: This has been beyond the worst‚Ä¶
review_text: This has been beyond the worst experience. I was duped into the high pressure sale and have regretted it since. It's almost impossible to book when you need, I couldn't go just myself as my husband also signed the contract (the only way I could go alone is if he were dead or I showed divorce papers!! Yes, I was told that). You have to book a minimum of a half day whenever you do actually get to have a vacation so that they can try to upsell you into even more of their horrible experience. If you see them coming, take my advice and run away as fast as you can.

This was an awful experience at Thurnham Hall. The property is selling rooms that aren‚Äôt what is listed on the website. The propery has mice, mould, rooms aren‚Äôt cleaned with hair on bedding. The hotel is in beach of Health & Safety laws and is all being managed by a 2 week in role manager who never once acknowledged how bad an experience it continues to be. It is evident the property needs shut and investigated by the company, lancaster county council & the Health and Safety Executive. I have raised my complaint in full with Diamond Resorts Managemrnt team and the local manager.

review_title: Not value for money and just ripping people off
review_text: Have been with Diamond for many years but have never got our moneys worth from it as they don‚Äôt have any decent resorts available when we want to go on holiday. Also, we bought and continue to pay maintenance fees every year for what was sold to us as an exclusive club. How is it that they are now allowing anyone to book and pay to stay at their resorts but it is the members who are paying the maintenance fees and Diamond is earning the money. This is not what we were sold. I rang them recently and asked how I could get rid of the points and they said we could pay them 2 years maintenance fees and we would be free. Can you actually believe that we have to pay them. Unbelievable  and I will find another way to get rid of them. DO NOT BUY INTO THIS, IT IS A TOTAL RIP OFF

They called me to give some type of discount after staying with them. I said I wanted to talk to my boyfriend about it first. The guy then condescending asked if I was over 25, made over $65,000, and had a major credit card. I said yes to all 3. He said, well you sound kinda of young. I was like I'm almost 30, make over 100k a year, and you can kiss my platinum American express card goodbye.

review_title: Zero stars for ethical practices and‚Ä¶
review_text: Zero stars for ethical practices and customer support!!!! Do not sign with Diamond Resorts or Hilton Grand Rentals (things have not gotten better since the acquisition). We booked a trip to Hawaii for October ( Saturday - Saturday) and need to change it by a day as our flight got rescheduled (Sunday - Sunday), and they have not been helpful or communicative (we have been trying to work with them since June on another matter)

Scam scam scam ‚Ä¶.. do not buy the timeshare ‚Ä¶. The apartments are ok ‚Ä¶.BUT you buy and you buy for life ‚Ä¶. You will owe for the rest of your life ‚Ä¶ increase maintenance costs so you end up spending $2000 a year‚Ä¶ never believe anything they tell you ‚Ä¶ they lie ‚Ä¶and now they are trying to charge $15000 to give up the timeshare ‚Ä¶. What a scam

I had sent a letter to Diamond Resorts expressing my frustrations with the lies I was told when signing my contract. I had told them many things that I was told that were different from what is in the contract. When they responded, all the person said was ‚Äúyou signed up for this‚Äù. They completely ignored the fact that the company lied and manipulated us into signing. They do not care about a thing unless it is their fraudulent contract, they trick people into signing. It is absolutely ridiculous that they do not have any sympathy for the people they scammed. At the end of the day, the facts are that I have paid around $20,000 and have not been able to use it ONCE. The Attorney General should investigate them and if I don‚Äôt get any resolution, that‚Äôs exactly who I am going to tell my story to.

IT‚ÄôS A SCAM. The sleaziest rip off of a company. They tell you you‚Äôre in for an hour sales pitch and they hold you hostage for hours with the threat of charging you the ‚Äúreal‚Äù cost of the room you‚Äôre currently staying in for the weekend if you leave. If you keep saying no, they keep sending in a new person whose gonna ‚Äúget you guys outta here.‚Äù In our case, the guy who came to give us ‚Äúexit paperwork‚Äù told us we were signing something that gave us the ‚Äúoption‚Äù to try them out for $80/night for two years since we clearly weren‚Äôt sold on the product. Then the bills started arriving in the mail and it turns out our ‚Äúexit paperwork‚Äù was a contract to PAY over $2000 for those rooms up front. AND you can‚Äôt use any of those nights without sitting through the sales pitch AGAIN each time. Don‚Äôt even give them a chance. RUN AWAY.

review_title: Please I'm begging you run away from‚Ä¶
review_text: Please I'm begging you run away from these people.  They are liers! They are theifs... one will lie to get you in then more lies to have you in more debt. Shameless horrific business practices.  Wh as t happened to you is every review you have read. Please do not believe anything they say... if you dont want to go into debt FOR NOTHING.

review_title: I bought this MESS in Hawaii
review_text: I bought this MESS in Hawaii. All these people are LIARS. Please don't believe a word from them. Especially from Brandan Afungia (sales manager) and unexperienced Devin (sales agent). I can't believe they still in business and nobody take them to court for fraud and misleading advertising. Stay away PLEASE!!

review_title: Awful experience with Diamond Resort (Hilton Grand Vacations)‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond Resort (Hilton Grand Vacations) kept us trapped in their sales presentation and wouldn‚Äôt let us go until we purchased with them. On top of trapping us and not letting us go when we had told them we were not interested, they lied about the perks of timeshare. There were a few selling points that had piqued our interest, which turned out to be completely untrue:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØWe were told that we would be buying property‚Äîtimeshares are NOT the same as owning property.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ We were told that this property would allow us to earn a passive income. According to the salesman, renting out our timeshare would be simple, and we would be earning money in no time. We have discovered that it is nearly impossible to rent out the timeshare, and that it actually costs money to attempt to list it.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ We were told that the timeshare would increase in value, and we would be able to re-sell it later on. Again, this was a total lie.‚ÄØ Do yourself a favor and steer clear of Hilton, as they will dupe you into a contract as well.

review_title: SOS people be aware of Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: SOS people be aware of Diamond resort!!!! They are LIARS. The worst experience that we had in our life. The service is horrible, they lie about points, never available spotsCustomer service representatives yell on you, don't let you speak. Just awful Please don't let them to put you on hook! Be aware!!!

review_title: After six years as a Diamond member
review_text: After six years as a Diamond member, it pains me to say that my expectations have not been met. My wife and I are very patient people and have finally met our limit with the dishonesty and lack of service from Diamond. Our salesman, Adam, was the main perpetrator. He fed us a dream that his company could not deliver, and he knew it. We were offered the ‚Äúdeal of a lifetime‚Äù framed as a real estate investment. In our time as owners, the value has not risen, and we‚Äôve discovered there is no actual property that we own. Adam also stated there was a buyback program in case we changed our minds, but there is not and never was! We have tried to contact Diamond to have the cont

Terrible company. Booked a room, arrived and found out we had Covid. Left right away so we didn't infect staff. Polo towers was understanding however diamond resorts was not no refund because we "took the trip" even with the circumstances we had. Don't believe their lies.

Not worth the time.  Nice female with pleasant presentation.  Then high pressure sales by another man who was supposed to be giving us a ‚Äòsurvey‚Äô.We were offered a small discount for 2 hours gone from our vacation (that we waited 4 years for).   He wouldn‚Äôt sign us out after 2 hours.  I timed it!Then pretty sure we didn‚Äôt even get a discount.The facility was also rusty and molded.  Waste of time for losing time‚Ä¶.don‚Äôt waste your time!

review_title: Worst experience ever and ZERO value
review_text: Worst experience ever and ZERO value. Spent almost two years with barely any opportunity to use points. Points are expensive! It‚Äôs not worth the cost! The service is awful.!  I have gotten very little value but still have to pay around $1000 maintenance every year!  Diamond Resort is the worst Imvestment I‚Äôve ever made. It‚Äôs like a scam! Beware! And DON‚ÄôT buy this awful, useless and expensive Time Share!

review_title: Our accommodation was not available due‚Ä¶
review_text: Our accommodation was not available due to power cut following a storm. We paid for an airbnb under the pretense that we would be fully refunded and received this is writing, we are now 3 weeks on and feel like we are being fobed off and have yet to receive the refund. If anyone else has had this experience with Diamond resorts please let me know!

review_title: Outside it all looks very glamorous
review_text: Outside it all looks very glamorous. The resort is full of aggressive women who are very big in their mouths. My experience is based on receptionists that seem very friendly, but as soon as you ring the bell more than once you are threatened with being kicked out of your apartment. Crazy women run the resorts. Watch out for jumping in the pool after night hours, security guards are very serious people :D

Have been a "valued member" since 2005. Could not use our week last year due to covid. Said that we could bank the points, did NOT tell us that they were not applicable to the facility we own, and the ones that it is applicable to, are all sold out. Best part is my own facility HAS room, and they said no. This is not a business the values it's customers. Disappointing at best.

review_title: If I could do no stars
review_text: If I could do no stars, I'd do none. Such a scam!!!!! We've done so many of these timeshare things, and were able to say no, but this place got us. They got us in October 2019. The thing that got us was the "events of a lifetime" WHAT BULL CRAP!!! Covid happened, and they could care less. We couldn't go anywhere, but still had to pay, that is for sure.  We were hurting for money, but we still had to pay.  I could go on and on, but all you need to know is that they suckered us, and we've wasted thousands of dollars, and been on one vacation.  If I can give you any advice DO NOT GIVE IN, THE "DEALS" ARE NOT WORTH THE HEADACHE!!!!

review_title: Diamond Resorts is the worst timeshares-HORRIBLE
review_text: Diamond Resorts is one of the worst timeshares you can ever think of buying.  They just LIE to sell and when you actually want to book - it's never available or they take all your points with one booking.  Please do not fall for this TRAP.  IT is HORRIBLE - HORRIBLE - HORRIBLE

We checked in today. Countertops in kitchen were not wiped down. The complementary Wifi does not work. The toilet seats in both bathrooms slide and tip when you sit on them. (Could cause a fall for someone older with unstable balance). Lamps in main bedroom on each side do not match. The kitchen table does not have matching chairs And that is what we noticed the first night.

review_title: Scammed by Diamond and Hilton. Please beware.
review_text: Two years ago we brought a timeshare with Diamond Resorts. The same weekend Covid struck. We were told we needed to do a new member presentation. This would tell us how to work the program. Two years later after Covid we signed up for the presentation. We got there only to get a shake down from a Hilton representative telling us they brought Diamond. The deal was give them an additional 26K and we could get their upgraded timeshare. To date we have done ZERO travel with Diamond. We were also informed we lost our points. Where we scammed?

review_title: Diamond Resorts you have not been good to me
review_text: What makes me upset is when I bought my package before Diamond resorts took over; I was able to choose an available week for a low fee.  Now I am looking the Expedia prices are sometimes better than what shows on the resort?  So you guys want to continue with this business?  It makes no sense that I have this package and still have to go to Expedia or Groupon to get a better rate.  I‚Äôm really not happy about this.

review_title: Diamond Luxury Resorts are just like‚Ä¶
review_text: DO NOT BOOK...Diamond Luxury Resorts are just like every other 'vacation packages' out there.  They'll tell you you don't have to sit through a sales pitch, there will only be $25/night resort fees, everything is 4 star blah blah blah.  They suck.... horrendous customer service -i've not heard back in a week, the fees for the room are so much more than they lead on ($80/night is the cheapest i've seen so far) and their website is from the 90's... Please do yourself a favor and just say no... you will regret it if you don't.

review_title: We have been lied to every step of the‚Ä¶
review_text: We have been lied to every step of the way. Every single thing we have tried to line up they have changed our dates without telling us.  We have taken time off work to do the Daytona trip and all of a sudden the days have changed from a Fri Sat Sunday to a Sat Sun Mon. I have the documents to  prove otherwise but they will  no honor the original dates.... SCAM ARTISTS!!!! The tablet they gave us when we purchased the timeshare doesn't even work... stay away!!!

We stayed at the Polo Towers in Vegas. The presentation was on 09/25/21. There was one representative who treated us in a condescending and disrespectful manner. He basically told us that we should buy into the plan because we made time to come to Vegas. He didn‚Äôt know or want to listen to our situation back at home. The front desk and other staff members.

Please please do not book with Diamond Resort. They are a bunch of crooks and thief.  They tell you the package is refundable while you book and when you try to cancel they say is is non refundable. Please do not, I repeat do not do anything with these people.

review_title: I don't even have the energy to write a‚Ä¶
review_text: I don't even have the energy to write a lot about them. After just losing 30,000 points after months of trying to book, a pregnant wife, not being ale to travel because of everything being shut down I'm sick to my stomach with this company. Lies, disorganization, increasing bills with no organization in sight on getting anything worked out. The 131 hours on hold over the last two months. Stay away stay far away take your money and invest in mutual funds and use the interest to vacation instead of this.

review_title: It was a nightmare at Polo Towers Las‚Ä¶
review_text: It was a nightmare at Polo Towers Las Vegas! My wife‚Äôs luggage was lost for 4 days! Was told when it was delivered to hotel! But they said they didn‚Äôt have it! They kept telling us with security! We did every day! I asked the front desk lady (Anastasia) if they had cameras. She said yes! Told her I need to see the if my wife‚Äôs  luggage was delivered at 8:32pm. She said nobody has access to the cameras??? I could not believe it! The delivery company sent a picture of the delivery! She still wouldn‚Äôt help! Then I thought she was in on the theft of my wife‚Äôs luggage! Had to buy all new clothes for my wife! Finally got the clothes 5 days later! It was delivered across the street! Anastasia could‚Äôve made it so much easier! She actually said I need to apologize to her because I was upset! Unbelievable!!

I am a diamond member. My experience hasn‚Äôt been great. Resorts are hit or miss. Some great. Some not great. Biggest issue I have had - their customer service is terrible. I sat on a call where they said they have high hurtle on customer satisfaction. This has not been my experience. No creativity or willingness to help. Often rude. Experiences are just flat out frustrating.

We went to a timeshare presentation.  We were told in a private room with the salesperson we would get 75% off if we booked anywhere 30 days or less in advance.  Purchased the time share, got home, called the club to book trips and were told there's no such thing as 75% off. Now we're in a dispute and they won't let us exit the contract.  We were lied to but were told that it doesn't matter if it wasn‚Äôt in the contract  Shame on them.

Love my trips with Diamond! I read some of the other reviews and it seems like people are just complaining about the sales pitch but if you can get past that (my only reason for 4 stars not 5 IS the sales pitch that could be done differently) the membership and all the extras you get are truly awesome, I've been a member for 2 years now and been to Mexico, Key West, Disney and 2 cruises with my kids. NEver could've done all that without having these points. Give it a chance!

Was in Vegas. I was told I was touring Polo Towers. It was a lie. I was a timeshare presentation. When I explained I wasn't interested, the guy working for Polo Towers basically harassed me and tried to force me to buy a timeshare. I said no. I found out later this stuff goes on your credit report. It's all about sales. It's not worth the time or money.

review_title: Leave me alone ! Please stop calling
review_text: I signed up with diamond many years ago and cancelled the contract within 2 hours. Each week I get at least one phone call from them which is boarder-line harassment now! Every rep says they will remove me from their list but sure enough I still get calls! This is now a complaint so now I want this public so everyone knows how inefficient diamond are that they cannot even keep their records up to date!

review_title: If I could put zero stars I would!!!!
review_text: If I could put zero stars I would!!!!! They are very disappointing and don't actually care about your well being. This company will play on your emotions and sell you on lies! Beware of all those contracts you are signing. They can feed you straight lies and make you sign off on complete BS.Signed a super unsatisfied customer.

Purchased a package with the salesperson claiming to be part of the Hilton family. After receiving the confirmation email and terms and conditions I decided this wasn't right for me. Called to cancel and get a refund and was told I would hear from the finance dept in 72 hours for my refund. After 72 hours there was no response so I followed up. I was told that there was a "no-refund" policy and that this was disclosed in the T&C's of the offer...........I agree that it was however you don't see the T&C's until after providing your credit card info and being charged. Total scam, stay away from this company.

review_title: Please someone help me get out of this‚Ä¶
review_text: Please someone help me get out of this I can't afford them now my husband is very sick and can't work and I have two kids and they won't cancel it someone help me and gave me a answer I am only 26

‚ÄúFraudulent‚Äù is the first word that comes to mind when I think of Diamond Resorts. I‚Äôve had experience with them since 2014 and I still can‚Äôt say a single good thing over 8 years. Their employees are so unprofessional. When I signed my contract, their closer came in and swung his feet on to the desk, ate candy, and badmouthed other customers. Originally, I purchased 4,000 points but was told by a salesperson that I was ‚Äúfoolish‚Äù for buying them. That was supposedly the reason we were having trouble getting reservations. I have been absolutely disgusted with the behavior of their employees. I should have walked away as soon as the first person irked me.

review_title: If I could put zero stars I would!!!!
review_text: If I could put zero stars I would!!!!! They are very disappointing and don't actually care about your well being. This company will play on your emotions and sell you on lies! Beware of all those contracts you are signing. They can feed you straight lies and make you sign off on complete BS. Signed a super unsatisfied customer.

review_title: i have been a member since god knows‚Ä¶
review_text: i have been a member since god knows when - i refuse to pay anymore maintenance fees - this was supposed to be an exclusive members club - now any outsider can stay - these people, who i have spoken to, are paying a lot of money - to use the facilities that we pay for - not good enough - timeshare has finished -

review_title: We could not travel last year due to‚Ä¶
review_text: We could not travel last year due to Covid, when we got the points we were told we had till the end of 2021 to use them, now finding out that this was not true and we are losing about 3/5 of our points.  Today we were at a renew presentation and asked and was basically told, sorry you did not use them not our fault.  So we declined to renew or do anything and will never stay at another diamond resort.  You scammed me once, but not twice.  Thanks for taking 2400 dollars of my money so we could stay once at your resorts, what a scam!

Lies! Lies! Lies! We were told we could save money and travel to thousands of fancy resorts every year. In reality there are only a handful of places that ever have availability are run down dumps. I did some comparisons and I could book the same property through hotels.com for a lot less than what I pay in maintenance fees each year! All these places that don't have availability through Diamond can still have availability on hotels.com, Expedia and the direct site! My "dream" vacation was ruined by staff stealing my medication. We were then lied to again about being able to access Hilton properties! We have been paying extra since March so we can access HGV and still can't! It's a scam!

review_title: Diamond resorts is a complete rip off
review_text: Diamond resorts is a complete rip off. They give you so much information and make it sound like a dream. When in reality you‚Äôre spending at least triple what you would if you booked something on your own. Then when you have your points nothing is available to book. Worst mistake I have made!!!!

Went to Vegas for my birthday.  I was informed of a great opportunity... which I thought. A 4 days and 3 nights with only 199.00 deposit which includes 150.00 visa gift card, no restort fee, and the only black out day is New Years eve. I would have 2 years to use it. When I called the restort number, I was informed if its not use within a year you do not get your deposit back. I was informed that I could not  cancel, and I would have to pay a restort fee. Never again will Iwaste my time with timeshare sales associate.Beware of the sale associate Austin, he's the one that gave me false information.

review_title: I've been using this  for years‚Ä¶
review_text: I've been using this product for years and absolutely love it! I used to go with my friends' family as a kid and when I became a parent I wanted to vacation the way they had taken me (my family only camped) so they told me who to call and I bought a "silver" package and have been able to take my family on beach trips, cruises and I'm so thankful to have had this in my life. I've seen some of the other reviews and it seems like it's mainly about the sales process or maybe they don't know how to  take advantage of the system. It ROCKS!!!

review_title: Been a member of diamond now for 18 years
review_text: Been a member of diamond now for 18 years and have to admit the majority of that time has been excellent.On our last stay at Pine Lake Resort, in September was excellent.All covid precautions in place, both in the main building and around the resort itself.Lodges are excellent, clean and have everything you need for your stay.Yes, you are invited to attend a meeting with their reps, which we did take up this time but found it very interesting and informative, we learned some of the new advantages.Can't wait until our next visit in June üçªüçª

I bought 3 nights to hear about the timesharing. After an e-mail and several calls, they told me that all Diamond resort properties are booked and I can only stay in the best western cheaper than what I paid for.You can not cancel or refund.Doesn't matter the day you are resorts are always booked and just cheaper accommodations are available. On the same date, all properties are available to book online but they lie saying that they are all booked.Worst customer service ever.I lost my money because they don't want to cancel and reimburse me.

review_title: It was a great place to stay and will‚Ä¶
review_text: It was a great place to stay and will get there again.  The only downside is the high pressure sell of a time share but that is to be expected.  However, them being very angry after we declined was not.  Even with that said, the stay was very nice and the rest of the staff was great.
Charged me extra without agreement, for leaving late. Very rude lady on the reception who treated me like a little child who had misbehaved.

WAY too many negative experiences to write them all out, but here are the bullet points:1. Sales rep made promises the company won't live up to.2. Endless hold times on the phone just to find out I'm in the wrong place and need to be transferred again.3. Road block after road block in trying to get any issue resolved.4. A complete SHAM 'Consumer Advocacy' Group where you can send an e-mail with your issues - but the e-mails come back 'Undeliverable'.5. Zero follow up from the 'Customer Care' representatives that are supposed to be there to help.6. No way out.  Do yourself a favor and stay away from this company.  It will save you lots of time, money, and frustration.

review_title: I have loved Sapphire Valley for over‚Ä¶Mountain home getaway!
review_text: I have loved Sapphire Valley for over 30 years! I am thankful that Diamond has taken over at Fairway Forest! I was not able to enjoy last summer because of the global pandemic! I am looking forward to summer of 2021 to reconnect with my mountain home once again! Thanks Diamond!

review_title: Happy Silver member young family since 1999
review_text: We are Silver members and bought in 1999 when it was Sunterra.  Though the company could run better with communications and updates, we as a young couple with two young boys have had a great experience with Diamond Resorts.  We have had wonderful family gatherings in Sedona and Scottsdale, Arizona in particular.  We love the kitchenettes and ability for everyone to dine as they please.  The sales tactics are poor and they need to be more transparent.  But, I have good things to say about Diamond Resorts.  Maybe the Marriott buy out will make things even better.  :)

I use my points to have an apartment when I travel instead of just a room. I go to member updates when invited. I was promised 3,000 points as an incentive for attending one in May and only received 1,000. Phone calls. Emails and an in person visit to the resort have not resolved the issue. Attended another update last week. I was promised a 3 day 2 night stay and $100 gift card. I received the gift card but they took back the stay because my income dropped during Covid. Hot tip! Escape from the presentation by telling them you make less than 50k and don't have a credit card. Instant release.

review_title: Diamond/Hilton is the worst timeshare company
review_text: Diamond/Hilton just might be the worst company we have EVER dealt with. The presentations are designed to be a hostage situation where the sales staff tricks and traps you into buying something you never wanted. You are told what they think you want to hear, regardless of the truth to get you to commit. You are offered enticements which wind up being unattainable. We were offered a free week vacation at the destination of our choice, but after you chase that offer for countless number of attempts, you find that the benefits don‚Äôt exist. Long periods of time are spent accenting the benefits as they mask the real cost.  We end up paying about twice the price we expected by the time this nightmare is over. We wish we knew that at the time, we have never agreed to buy. The worst part is all this money is going to waste since we can never find reservations. We‚Äôre just throwing our hard-earned money down the drain.

review_title: In 2014 I purchased a timeshare of‚Ä¶
review_text: In 2014 I purchased a timeshare of course after they talked me into how great it is but they left out a few details. One I couldn't use it for a long time periodn can't remember exactly but it was like 6 months of payments. Two when that time period started the dates and areas  made it impossible for me to use. 1.  so I stopped making the payments. Now 7 years later it's still on my credit and I never used a dime, so I asked them  about it but of course they don't care . I was just told it was a loan.  I guess they're okay with just scamming people for no reason but I should have known better

review_title: Because of Covid I was left feeling unwanted.
review_text: Because of COVID-19 my doctor advised that I not travel neing I am 64. I said that I would stay quarantined in my timeshare unit and he said than whats the point.  I agreed and called your resort and was shocked to be told that there was nothing she could do. I knew the rules. I asked isn't there exceptions during this pandemic. I also told her that I have stayed at many Diamond Resorts and have always been treated like royalty. It made no difference. Left a horrible memory of your establishment especially in these times. We are suppose to support one another not turn people away.

review_title: All the bad reviews are true
review_text: All the bad reviews are true. Diamond is horrible and they will say whatever they can to lure you in and get your money. Hang up the phone if they call you and block their number. You do not want to deal with them!

We stay quite frequently at one of their resorts and LOVE it. After staying at the resort multiple times in 2021, we finally got pressured into attending the ‚Äúorientation‚Äù. That orientation was 3 hours and INTENSE. They sent in sales rep after sales rep‚Ä¶and the final sales rep (presumably the manager) ended the conversation with ‚Äúis this $140 (maintenance fee) going to prevent you from putting food on the table‚Äù? Extremely rude and unprofessional. I have never been more embarrassed and pressured in my life.  They would have gotten my business but not after these awful sales tactics. It was very disappointing. Very, very disappointing.

I want out! Back in 2018 my husband was diagnosed with life ending kidney failure. I paid my account current while my husband was in the hospital but with taking care of him I lost sight of making my monthly payment but than again I didn‚Äôt get my monthly statement after I called to explain the situation I was in and was told to send a hardship letter. Hard to do that when my main focus was my husband‚Äôs health. Now we are trying to remove the foreclosure on our account, made calls weeks ago with no response. I don‚Äôt understand when your trying to do the right thing why they can‚Äôt return that same respect and work with you.

They Wont Stop calling me, Every day from a different number, I block that number and  THESE PEOPLE call again from a different number, 2 weeks straight now, I ASK THEM PLEASE REMOVE MY NUMBER, THEY KEEP CALLING,  THIS IS HARRASSMENT !!!!!

We've been with DRI for over 20 years. The company started as Grand Vacations, then Sunterra, Diamond Resorts and now HGV. In the early years we enjoyed many vacations, although the 'hard sell' each time we went away became a nightmare!  We have noticed, however, that the standard of the accommodation has gone downhill, especially the cleanliness! Due to health reasons, we can only holiday in the UK, which limits availability, especially as some of the UK resorts have been sold off. What really finished it for us was during 2020 and 2021, travel restrictions were in place due to Covid, but we paid over ¬£4,000 in maintenance fees, but we're unable to use the resorts. Whilst this was not the fault of DRI, if we had booked a holiday wih a reputable travel agent, we would have received a refund, but nothing was offered by DRI. When the UK resorts reopened in 2021, we still couldn't make a reservation as there was nothing available!!We are pleased, at last, that one of us is 75, so we are now able to surrender our membership under their current rules!!Take our advice, don't sign up!!

My new husband and I were placed in a room with two other men who essentially bullied us into signing a contract. They told us that we weren't children anymore and even though my parents continued to warn us about signing up for timeshare that I needed to "break away" and do what was the "adult choice." We've never used the timeshare. Instead, we get phone calls telling us to pay for something that is not utilized in our world. We now have three girls - make decent money, but need to play our essentials before anything else. This company is a scam. They are taught to take your vulnerabilities and use them against you. They are absolutely disgusting.

Called the 928-282-1777 number on Los Abrigados website to inquire about a stay needing four units. This after talking with our timeshare reservations, serviced by Diamond Resorts. Telephone prompt said press 2 for Club Members. I did.  At the outset of this discussion, the agent was rude, then became surly, when our club membership was not Diamond/Hilton. He transferred me to the front desk at the resort. The desk agent was not as confrontational and transferred me again after hearing part of my first encounter. The transfer was back to the original line. Once again, I was told I was in the wrong department! At this point, I had been on the phone more than13 minutes. This man,DAN, did manage to get me to agent who was very helpful.
