At the end of that chat, I repeated the saga and suggested a modification to their phone routing instructions. total time 19 minutes plus. With the calamity that the hospitality industry is in, this kind of SERVICE will assist in completing the demise of some players. Good luck to Hilton in repairing the Diamond piece of their enterprise. Footnote:  due to how inept this experience was, we booked elsewhere.

review_title: I have one word for diamond resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: I have one word for diamond resorts ‚ÄúLiars‚Äù Yep that‚Äôs it. Right from the start I said no to buying. I really think it‚Äôs a game the sale people you say no and they hear. Here‚Äôs  a sucker I can get to them to spend money. My main complaint, I live right around the corner from one of their resorts I was told I could use the amenities anytime I wanted. When I went to sit near the pool I was told only guest not point owners can be on property. I called complained no one was willing to talk about it. Sales people come and go and your word against theirs. I own a time share and it‚Äôs great no problems with it. So I‚Äôm not saying don‚Äôt invest in time share just not diamond. I‚Äôm not paying them I will fight all the way. Do not trust this company.

review_title: DO NOT BUY INTO Diamond International‚Ä¶
review_text: DO NOT BUY INTO Diamond International Resorts.  On top of buying into a package, you get charged "YEARLY maintenance fees" that continually GO up every year.  I starting at 1100.00 a year, since 2017 and now I'm having to pay $2500.00.  Anytime you try to book a vacation no good destinations are available.  If your not Vaccinated then you can not travel out of the country.  It's a total waste of money.  If you don't pay your maintenance fees you don't get to use any of your points that you've already bought.  I've paid around 43k into this company and if i don't pay my $2500.00 a year maintenance fee, I can't even use what i've purchased.  Totally RIP OFF!  DO NOT DO IT.  This is your warning you will be sorry!

When Diamond Resorts took over Club Navigo, all my problems began. The amount they charged me was far more than if I had just paid for an entire vacation myself. When they contacted me and offered a 3-day/4-night vacation, I was put up in a run-of-the-mill MOTEL, not the fancy resorts that are advertised. The presentation I was required to attend was not ‚Äúquick‚Äù as described, as it lasted about 8 hours. Once I was coerced into a Diamond contract, I found that making reservations was an absolute nightmare. Only inconvenient times are available- if you can get a booking at all. Then finally when on vacation, I was harassed into more presentations with salespeople telling me that I need to upgrade. I feel like a fugitive trying to dodge salespeople on my VACATION that I am completely over paying for.

review_title: Maintence fees are high and now we‚Ä¶
review_text: Maintence fees are high and now we can't figure out how to get out even with transition@diamondresorts. The employees can't even tell you how to call.Sent a $1000.00 and still can't get out.

review_title: Diamond Resorts - The greedy scam artists
review_text: Greedy scam artists, liars, manipulators, these are just a few of the nicer terms that come to mind when I think about this company.When a Diamond rep approached me and offered a $50 gift card ‚Äúfor an hour of my time‚Äù, I should have walked away. It would have saved me a lot of frustration. Instead, I was tricked in to buying a timeshare. I was sold a small sample package, then was conned into a full ownership a couple years later. The promise of Disney vacations, no more maintenance fees, a guaranteed return on investment, and the ability to sell unused points sucked me in. Too bad NONE of it is true. Any time I try to speak to someone about ANY issues I‚Äôve experienced, the answer I get is ‚Äúyou must have misunderstood‚Äù or ‚Äúif you buy more, you‚Äôll get all those things‚Äù. Nothing but deception all throughout my ownership! I just want to be  done with them!!

review_title: I PAIR OVER $50000 AND ONLY GOT A 7 DAY‚Ä¶
review_text: I PAIR OVER $50000 AND ONLY GOT A 7 DAY VACATION AND A 10 DAY VACATION. ALL THE TIMES I CALLED TO SCHEDULE A VACATION THE PERSON THAT ANSWERED THE PHONE EITHER SAID THEY DID NOT KNOW WHAT TO DO OR LIED TO ME.

review_title: I read all the negative and disturbing‚Ä¶
review_text: I read all the negative and disturbing reviews.We did not sign on thank God! My question is did anyone use the gifts of: 2 airline tickets and a 1 week free stay?What was your experience?

review_title: I believe Diamond Resorts has unethical‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond Resorts has unethical practices.  I would not trust them to purchase a thing from them, because I worked for them and found them to be quite dishonest.

review_title: Worst first impression ever  from a platinum member
review_text: The modern Honolulu was our platinum stay reservation.  First we circled the block for almost 45 minutes as the hotel does not have its name on the outside. Really they can‚Äôt afford a sign? The only way that my husband knew that it was the modern Honolulu was when he saw the welcome mat. I guess this hotel can only afford a mat. When I complained about the poor signage to the diamond rep he said we do have a sign but it‚Äôs really small. Hmm. Then we tried to check in at 3:30 after a 5 hour first class flight, we were told our room was not ready. Is this really 5 star treatment of your platinum members? That would be a positively NO. I could stay at motel 6 and my room would be ready. Shameless treatment. Would never come back here ever again.

Crooks! I was told it was a two hour property tour. In small bold writing it said timeshare but I wasn‚Äôt wearing my glasses so I missed that. Once I knew I was doing the timeshare presentation, I complained during the tour about only getting one day when I was offered three days multiple times and was told marketing would take care of me after. When I went back down there, those people were rude and Austin (Manager) flat out called me a liar when I told him I couldn‚Äôt see what I signed because I wasn‚Äôt wearing my glasses. The lady explained everything to me as if it were no big deal. They‚Äôre good at their scams and I will continue to write reviews so everyone knows. They took advantage and I will NEVER stay with them again.

We were called to attend a presentation with Diamond as we had previously purchased a sampler package and had not used all of our points.  We were not interested in making a purchase but your salesperson convinced us that this was the only way that we could keep our unused sampler points.  It wasn‚Äôt until we returned home that we learned how much debt we had accrued as a result of this purchase.  They also never explained to us that we would be subject to maintenance fees every year, which has led to even more money lost!  We have tried to contact Diamond and resolve this, but all this has done is given their staff a reason to call and harass us about our request to cancel this membership.  Who treats people like this?

We were first given a room with bugs in it and a sharp edge on the tile in the bathroom that I got cut on. They upgraded us to a new room which was lovely. But as far as this company can you say harassment? I have stayed more than once but this year was in my name, I never consented to being called repeatedly when I booked the trip. They called me almost immediately after we returned from our trip trying to sell me a new one and I let them know due to medical reasons I can‚Äôt travel. They then called me again today and I told the guy I hadn‚Äôt given permission to call me and that I had already informed them I ca‚Äôt travel right now and to remove me from their list. He then argued with me and tried to cut me off telling me what a great deal he was offering. He argued with me twice trying to get me to listen to his sales pitch as I was asking to remove my number from their calling list.

Diamond and Hilton are both terrible companies! Diamond sold my wife and I a bogus timeshare and Hilton is upholding the contract. They roped us in with a ‚Äúfree‚Äù vacation- if we gave them an hour of our time. One hour turned in to SIX hours with salespeople wearing us down. They fed us lies the whole time about everything. The main things we were upset about are not being able to exchange points for airfare, not having access to Disney properties, and paying fees for a non-private resort‚Ä¶all of which were the primary reasons we bought! Every subsequent meeting was about the same. The hour we agreed to would turn in to more. We were lied to. They ALWAYS will try to convince you to upgrade. Every time we have expressed a concern, the answer is an upgrade, not that it ever actually helps. After $35k of debt, we have nothing to show for it.

Visited Liki Tiki Resort with my wife for honeymoon. Didn‚Äôt know what to expect, pictures online looked nice but the reviews were all over the place good and bad but I have to say it exceeded our expectations for sure. Service was good, rooms were great and clean (maybe a little dated but not enough to complain about), the amenities were outstanding: pools were great very clean, crowd was always a good level, peddle boats were a great bit of fun and basketball and mini golf was great for some pass time. Only thing I didn‚Äôt really like was the calls from time share people everyday but that was expected. Overall it was an amazing experience and if me and my wife go back to Florida by ourselves again I will definitely stay at the Liki Tiki Resort again for sure.
A very nice place but it‚Äôs in the middle of nowhere.  We got there at night and could not find our accommodation.  Our accommodation was fantastic and I would definitely stay here again.

Lies‚Ä¶Deception‚Ä¶Outright manipulation‚Ä¶this suits Diamond resorts perfectly, because Diamond resorts is a company filled with compulsive liars, with sales agents lying to pregnant women and hard-working families. My pregnant wife and I sat through a sales presentation and declined every single offer the salespeople presented to us. WE WERENT INTERESTED IN PURCHASING! I can‚Äôt be clearer than that, we declined offer after offer, but they wouldn‚Äôt take NO as an answer, they would offer more incentive and lower the price, what they trapped us with was DISNEYLAND! The salespeople sold us on saying we would have access to Disney Resorts, cruises, or theme parks so of course we were interested as that was the main reason we purchased this worthless timeshare, later we found out that was not true at all, being owners of the timeshare gives us no access to Disney, or even discounted tickets!

review_title: To whomever comes across this review
review_text: To whomever comes across this review, I want to warn everyone to please RUN and do not step foot inside a Diamond Resort property, now owned by Hilton Grand Vacations! I cannot stress it enough what a scam this place is! I purchased a timeshare with them a couple years ago, and it was all based on LIES and the sales reps just want to scam you and get money into their pockets. They start by being your ‚Äúfriend‚Äù, having breakfast with you trying to get in all buddies with you, but then BAM stab you in the back and take your money! Sales reps are extremely unprofessional, they make rude snarky comments, and they even disclosed information about their customers!!! I thought that was illegal.  They are just crooks and liars but also break the law! If that isn‚Äôt enough, they commit ELDER ABUSE without blinking an eye!  Don‚Äôt let this happen to you or your loved ones!

The staff at Diamond Resorts have the tendency to leave out crucial information that could allow you to make an informed decision. We signed up not being informed about the never-ending fees and how they will increase every year. They did a wonderful job at making it seem like this purchase would be the best decision of our life. Unfortunately, this was all a lie! All the meetings they trapped us in lasted way longer than they had originally said. During one of our meetings with Diamond, we were told that opening a credit card would decrease our monthly bills. I recently discovered that we had an additional timeshare put in our name because of that visit. This is not what I signed up for and this is another example of how the staff plays games with how things are communicated in the sales pitch. The Diamond sales staff are manipulative and well versed on how to twist words to make a sale.‚ÄØBe VERY careful when dealing with them!!

review_title: Oceanaire is one of my favorite places‚Ä¶
review_text: Oceanaire is one of my favorite places to stay on the Oceanfront.  The staff are always so friendly and everything is always so clean ans A++!!  I can‚Äôt wait until my next vaca!!!

We signed up on 5/17 in williamsburg. Since then  we have still not received our credit for the presentation after several promises from my sales rep that he would look into it. I have since then reached out to the Qa person via email and gotten no response. I then finally emailed the divisional VP since his lovely letter "comes with a promise of a response within in 24 hours", that was Friday and, of course, no response. There was another issue our sales rep was to help us with that "he will look into" and you guessed it, no follow or response. If I could give a zero rating on service and follow up I would. I am so sorry I fell for this. It is definitely not the relaxing vacation plan I was promised. I can tell that the communication training comes from above so I am guessing I will still get no response or resolution.

review_title: So far I am absolutely not impressed‚Ä¶
review_text: So far I am absolutely not impressed with Diamond resorts. I signed back in September 2021 and part of the reason was because I was offered a week 2 bedroom stay in Dubai through their Odenza week. I confirmed many times prior to signing if we were really able to use the certificate in Dubai and was informed multiple times yes. Well turns out we can't use it to go to Dubai. Also all of the additional items that they provide you, all have fees associated with them. Also as part of the presentation, they show you a book of many different hotels that you can use your vacation points on, that is all a lie. I tried so many dates and hotels through their website which they all mention not being able to be used. This all has been extremely disappointing and don't bother trying to call because you will sit on the phone for an hour just to be hung up on.

review_title: Be Aware of Purchasing a Timeshare
review_text: Our experience with Diamond has been terrible from the beginning!  We were in a room with multiple salespeople; all of which were consistently pressuring us to make a purchase.  Every time we declined, they told us that we would be disappointed if we didn‚Äôt buy and that this ‚Äúnew and better‚Äù deal was only good today.  When we finally gave in, there was an issue with the computer system, which made us the last people to leave.  Plus, once we were finally able to sign the paperwork, they rushed us through so quickly and never went over any of the information.   Once we tried to actually utilize the timeshare and the points, we were told that we could only book a studio AND that the places where we wanted to visit filled up more than a year in advance!   This is totally unusable and they never told us about the cancellation period!

Hilton Grand Vacations/ Diamond Resorts are untrustworthy and prey on ill-informed timeshare guests. My wife and I were approached by a sales agent offering all sorts of discounts in return if we were to listen to a 1-hour-presentation. It lasted way longer than they stated. They made us believe that with $1,000 deposit we would be owners of a timeshare, and this would be a great investment that would only increase in value. The lies continued saying that our kids would inherit this, yet they failed to mention that they would be responsible for all the fees attached to the time share. When we tried to use the time share there was never availability and when there was it was within time frames that you couldn‚Äôt use or wouldn‚Äôt want (think Scottsdale, AZ in July). They push and pressure you into even more sales pitches while making us feel ignorant and stupid if we didn‚Äôt purchase more. They are very demeaning and full of lies.

review_title: They pressured me to sign a contract‚Ä¶
review_text: They pressured me to sign a contract, promising a lot with their sales tactics‚Ä¶. One of their high-pressure salesman Jason at the Cabo Azul Resort asked me to not waste time & to just trust them & sign my contracts quick. Turns out much of what they were telling me actually was not true when I looked over the contract in further details. A lot of exaggeration about what I was purchasing compared to what is very limited in the contract and less than what they promised. Now I cannot get anyone on the phone to help answer my questions about the contract, the extension for the contract manager Fernando Quintana left me to reach him has wound up a dead end, each department I get on the phone with bounces me around and no one has taken accountability. Safe to say I‚Äôm concerned and feel a bit gullible for listening to anything those salesmen told me to do‚Ä¶.

review_title: Diamond Resorts is full of frauds
review_text: Diamond Resorts is full of frauds. BEWARE. My former husband and I ‚Äúwon‚Äù a free hotel stay IF we went to a presentation for an hour. Thinking it would be a power-point and/or a video, we agreed. Instead, we were immediately hounded by salespeople hurling information at us and saying the deals offered would expire as soon as we left. We eventually bought the timeshare and soon after, we started seeing the red flags.I am active-duty military, and my ex was a federal law enforcement officer. This means we were limited on our travel dates. After being told that the booking process was easy, we were irritated when we had constant trouble. When we finally could book a vacation, it would be spent being harassed by more salespeople during the ‚Äúrequired owner updates‚Äù- which are really more sales pitches. Between compromising on destinations, the harassment during vacations, and the hidden fees on top of already high payments, we are DONE. Don‚Äôt let the Diamond employees fool you too!

review_title: Run run run run fast as you can
review_text: Run run run run , out your hands over your ears and close your eyes and Run. They lie, they tell you everything is great and it's all a Scam. Anastasia at Mystic Dunes told us this huge lie, do not sit with her or talk to her,  if you do you will be in debt up to your ears, she lies with a straight face. Next is The Biggest Fraud of all, Brian Anderson from Cypress Point, he will tell you he is a Financial advisor and promise you he will refinance your loan and come to your house  for you to sign your refi papers. Then he  will tell you he will sell weeks for you for your profit. Run!! I ran to a lawyer and am in the process of a lawsuit against both of them and Diamond. There is a clause in the contract that literally says they can lie to you and they do. It's not worth your money or headache and everlasting mounting maintainence fees. Run run run!

review_title: Run don‚Äôt walk away from Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: Run don‚Äôt walk away from Diamond resorts!  After receiving yet another email inviting us to brunch and a presentation, ‚Äúto address questions as well as the new benefits of being a valuable member‚Äù we decided to attend to try one more time to find out how to use our low level points. We informed them immediately that we were not interested in upgrading just how to use the points that we have since every attempt to use them resulted in ‚Äòunavailable‚Äô.  We stood our ground during the high pressure sales pitch. Turns out that the points that we had bought years ago but never used were good for very little. Years of paying the maintenance fee was a waste of money and will continue to be. It bothers me greatly that they are preying on the elderly(as well as their heirs) and the unsophisticated consumer. They continued to shovel lies but we walked away.

review_title: Was in Vegas to get married and got‚Ä¶
review_text: Was in Vegas to get married and got offered a free 3 day/2 night trip and $150 visa giftcard to travel their time share property all it cost us was $40. Two and half hours later and multiple no we are not interested we finally got a ride back to the casino they picked us up from. Our $150 gift card worked so we got a free dinner and entry into the secret garden and dolphin show at the Mirage. However, we we got home and went to look into the free trip, the brochure said we had to go Mon-Fri only, would be in an economy rated hotel and had to pay a $78 deposit, all the taxes, and any additional resort/hotel fees. Not to mention the certificate number could not be found to even verify or book the trip on the website stated. At least we got a free meal and a show. If you don't mind losing 2 - 3 hours of your time a few benefits are nice. Smooth scam, and they are persistent at every casino entry door.

We have been "owners" with Diamond Resorts for 14 years now.  Most of the properties we've visited over the years are decent.  That isn't the problem.  The problem is that for the $3200 yearly dues we pay, ON TIME, we can NEVER book where we want to go.  It's beyond frustrating. In addition, when we have stayed at a property they try to lure us into a presentation by saying, "This is just an owners' update" but of course, they try to sell more points.  We have been treated very poorly when we refuse to buy.  We've had sales reps just get up and walk out and not acknowledge us again.  If I can't even use the points I currently have to go where I want, then why would I buy more?  Please do yourself a favor and do NOT purchase from them.  We end up booking on our own through other organizations most of the time anyway, and Diamond Resorts is definitely not a good value.  Far from it.

Our timeshare resort was purched by Diamond a few years ago. I have found the online system and reservation system so confusing that we have been unable to reserve on time, or deposit our timeshare ontime and so have lost our ability to make an exchange two years in a row. There are so few resorts available compared to our previous exchange company, and the service is terrible. I cannot get agents on the phone. I left a message after holding for 25 minutes and did not hear from anyone for 4 days. I called back and finally spoke with a service agent. I have to pay over $1000 to get out of my contract after the enormous amount of money we paid for it in VA Beach 13 years ago, and the over 950 dollars annually that we pay for maintenance fees. I'm sick of this system. From now on, I will book my own vacations. Forget Diamond resorts. DO NOT BUY A TIMESHARE!!!! YOU ARE WASTING YOUR MONEY!!! I wish someone had told me that 13 years ago.

review_title: We attended a sales presentation at‚Ä¶
review_text: We attended a sales presentation at Virginia Beach in September 2021 after being almost begged by a saleslady.  We bought 10,000 points for $37,000 and was told that we were a "VIP Silver member through this year with full VIP Silver Benefits."  In looking back, the real joke on us was that our points don't even start until 2023.  It gets worse.In January 2022, we attended our 'newcomers orientation' only to learn that we were standard members and we had to purchase a minimum of 4,000 more points just to receive the new Hilton benefits once they happen.  Under pressure and believing this lady, we upgraded to Silver for another $19,275.00 which I have since cancelled by reading my contract seeing that I had 10 days from our presentation date to our presentation.Knowing that 5,000 points cost approximately $20,000 and a one bedroom suite will cost you about 4,000 points, WHO in their right mind would pay $16,000 for one week???

review_title: This company is stealing from people‚Ä¶
review_text: This company is stealing from people and lying directly to them. Avoid them at all costs. I‚Äôve never seen a company that acts like they care about their members but really only wants their money as bad as Diamond Resorts. We could not travel for over a year because of a GLOBAL PANDEMIC. Not because of something we did but yet they are stealing $8000 from us and letting me book 2 trips if I want to right now still during a GLOBAL PANDEMIC and not letting you extend any of the point. They can‚Äôt even be gifted to friends. Just trashed. This company does not care at all about their clients/owner or whatever they want to call them.  Even their own booking agents will tell you this. But try and get a hold of management or anyone but a booking agent and you never will. It‚Äôs all lies. A waste of your money. Cheaper and  way better resorts if you just book an your own. My lawyer has been contacted about this

review_title: I have read through all the other‚Ä¶
review_text: I have read through all the other review on this page and am distressed to have to agree with those that indicate this is a SCAM of monumental proportion.  I should have known better.  Good luck finding anyone who is accountable for anything.  I have struggled for close to 20 hours to access the ‚ÄúClub Combinations‚Äù aspect of my membership so that I can make a reservation.  My account was on hold of an outstanding payment, when in fact, I have  a credit.  It took 3 weeks to resolve that issue.  After that, I attempted to transfer my week at another resort to Diamond and after having done that, I have been told that it takes 30-45 days to review my request.  Given my very limited window of opportunity, my options are likely to be limited.  At this point I have little faith that the points will even be issued to my account.  Customer service is virtually non-existent, and I believe this is deliberate so that the corporation does not have to be accountable for its promises.

I was visiting a resort in Utah when I was asked to attend a presentation with Diamond.  I had previously been an owner with Monarch Grand Vacations and was told that this meeting was needed to address changes due to COVID.  When I arrived at the presentation, I was told that since Monarch had gone bankrupt, I was being given the opportunity to upgrade into the Diamond system so that I did not lose my equity or see my maintenance fees increase to the point where they would be unaffordable.  I felt that I had absolutely no choice but to make this purchase!  I was told that I would be receiving bonus points, that my maintenance fees would be fixed, and that this would be a real estate purchase that I could refinance for a lower rate. Nothing that I was told that day is true!   What kind of company lies to consumers and records these conversations?  I am stuck in this contract and Diamond will do nothing to help me!

review_title: Diamond Resorts is a total fraud‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond Resorts is a total fraud company that should be taken down fast. Wrecking peoples lives and finances. We were bamboozled into a "small" point package which they promised over and over that we would be able to use the points for smaller weekend trips. Which at the time was perfect for us to stay in a nice resort for a weekend 2-3 times a year. They showed us a point break down and how we would be able to use the points for smaller resorts well when it came down to using the points guess what? we cant since all of the small weekend trips are double if not triple what we get. So we cant ever use these points unless we save them for 3-5 years and accumulate and move points over. We were young we were excited to spend the time at Walt Disney world. We were at the Mystic Dunes Resort in Florida they gave us discount tickets and they even gave us a tablet that does not work. We will never be able to use these points but were still paying dues and fees this is not right and should be looked into stay away from these types of practices because they are too good to be true.

Diamond resorts scammed us big time! When my daughter and I had agreed to purchase, after the ridiculous amount of pressure they were applying, they were going over what I needed to say to the person who was helping me sign. They told me to tell them I was single, which I am not. I felt that this was a fraud but our salesperson, Ms. Jones, claimed this was normal and this happens regularly. Later we discovered that our contract did not include a Truth in Lending Act page. We also learned that there was a perpetuity clause that was not disclosed to us during the presentation, along with many other lies. We trusted these "professionals" to tell us the truth, but we were wrong. We regret putting any trust into this company.   We wrote to Diamond Resorts regarding our timeshare and how we were fed false information by the salespeople so they could steal our money, but they still have not let us out of our contract. In fact, I just got a letter in the mail saying that they tried to debit money from my account, which they DO NOT have permission to do.

review_title: Diamond Resorts may be hiring if you‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond Resorts may be hiring if you are good at lying or good at ripping people off. We wanted to relax on our vacation to Las Vegas, but instead, we were constantly HARRASED about purchasing a timeshare. Our salesperson, Mr. Foley, claimed the offer included a variety of benefits/promises that were insincere. He promised we would receive big discounts on cruise tickets, hotel rooms, theme parks, restaurant vouchers, etc. When we tried to book a cruise, they told us they do not give discounts to Diamond Resort Members. All those ‚Äúbig discounts‚Äù, were fake. They did not explain anything from the contract clearly. They must have thought that just because we are Asian, they can get our signature and initials on a contract with false information and get away with it. We cannot believe this company goes to such lengths to sell people a worthless product.We had sent a letter to Diamond Resorts International regarding our frustrations with their company back in April and we have NOT HEARD BACK!!! They only thing they care about is money because if they cared about their customers, they would take the time to respond and resolve our issues and concerns.

Sunset bay diamond resorts tenerife DO NOT stay here its as noisy as a building site ...First day woken up with huge drills and bangingCalled reception who moved us next morning Underground car park start  drilling restaurant in the square drilling ...cant move us until friday ..these reviews staying relaxing break ARE YOU ACTUALLY JOKING it's day 3 and haven't been able to get a sunbed, lots of complaints and arguments and very unhappy people as just not enough beds available.....people in q at 8am....!!! This has got to be the worst Diamond resort we have ever stayed in. Management refusing any refund or compensation....they haven't even got a resort manager here....!!!! Worst thing I called and spoke to Rachel on  reception who assured me only minor painting works was going on as I had read a review that mentioned building noise....!@!!!Saying they will email Miguel the area manager but don't hold out much hope for him to do anything...?????? What....Do not waste you time and money coming  here wish we had read a honest review before we booked as having a truly horrible time......!!!!

We were vacationing in Las Vegas when we approached in the lobby of Circus Circus and offered a gift if we attended a sales presentation.  Since we were told this would take no longer than 90 minutes, we agreed.  When we arrived, we were paired with a member of the sales staff that pressured us into making a purchase for hours.  Every time that we said no, we were approached by more sales staff that continued to offer ‚Äúnew‚Äù and ‚Äúbetter‚Äù packages.  When we finally agreed, we learned that they had already run our credit, even though we had never consented.  We were so uncomfortable but felt like we had to make a purchase to leave!   Every time we have booked time with this membership, we have been forced to attend an owners meeting, which is just another sales presentation!  Why?? When we have tried to contact them to address our concerns, they have been no help at all.  All we receive are hollow apologies but no real action.  This is unbelievable!

I was visiting Polo Towers in Las Vegas when I was asked to attend a sales update presentation. I told the staff many times that I  was not  interested but they insisted that it was necessary for me to learn about new updates.  When I arrived, I was told that this meeting would take an hour of my time.  This could not have been further from the truth! I told the sales rep that I was not interested in making any changes to what I already owned and that I was on a fixed income and  could not afford anything more.  He told me that this loan would have an interest rate of 3.99% and  that the payments would only be $230 a month I was skeptical but trusted that the staff had my best interest at heart.  When I got back to my room, I call to cancel but was once again reassured that this was a benefit.  They misled me at every opportunity! Nothing they told me was truthful and I firmly believe that I  was a victim of  elder abuse at the hands of Diamond Resorts.

It has been our experience that Diamond takes zero responsibility for any issues/concerns. Our timeshare was illegally sold to us (we were underage and didn't make a high enough income). Diamond said it wasn't their problem because they took over the account afterwards. However, we weren't even notified that they were taking over the account (and definitely did not sign anything to be obligated to Diamond) Anytime I've asked a direct question, it gets ignored. This is proof they know that what they're doing is wrong, but do it anyway. I've now even been told that my account couldn't be located, but I'm still responsible for the timeshare?! I refuse to pay another penny to a company that can't answer a question, can't always find my account, and holds me illegally responsible for something I technically never signed. If you're considering vacationing with Diamond or signing up for a timeshare, I highly advise that you DON'T!! They are a company full of crooks.
Customer service is terrible. Dont try to book a reservation over phone unless you have hours free to listen to elevator music.

We bought a plan in October 2020 and were told we needed to attend a sixty minute "new owner orientation" in order to become more educated on how to use our points. So four months later, we attended the orientation only to find out that they weren't interested in educating us in using our points, they basically insulted the package that we had bought and tried to convince us that we should upgrade and buy more points so that we can get more of a benefit from it. I hit the ceiling when they insulted the package that we had previously bought, and instead of trying to talk me down from the ceiling, they continued to carry on with their sales pitch. I realize that getting owners to sales meetings time and time again is a tactic that all of the timeshare companies use; however, Diamond has hit a new low in my opinion by how they handled our "new owner orientation". I'm glad that Hilton has recently acquired them as I think that Hilton does a better job not infuriating their current owners.

review_title: Best service stayed at WBCC in Devon‚Ä¶
review_text: Best service stayed at WBCC in Devon England loved it staff super can‚Äôt wait to stay again when Hotels are allowed to do so .. Thank you
Great staff....much knowledge. Can used some more help with the availability.It‚Äôs time consuming going to each place and then nothing.

Beware of Diamond Resorts!!! Don‚Äôt get trapped into a timeshare with Diamond. They are crooks! Whenthey sell you a timeshare, they paint a beautiful picture of being an owner, but it‚Äôs all lies. Unless you‚Äôrelooking to be in financial ruin, DO NOT trust their sales agents. I was told I was buying an ‚Äúinvestment‚Äùbut that turned out to be an awful lie. I‚Äôm stuck with the burden of ever-increasing maintenance fees,special assessment fee and a huge financial liability on my family! No matter how many times youdecline to purchase a timeshare, they keep the pressure and lies on you until you cave in. What they aredoing is very evil and they are very good at disguising it as a one in a lifetime opportunity. Theyconstantly try and get me to upgrade! My wife and I were both over 75 years old when they sold us thisjunk and they took advantage of that. They are predatory and purposely don‚Äôt disclose truth in lendingand they never disclosed the rescission period. Don‚Äôt fall for the smooth talk and false promises.Diamond Resorts should be shut down for senior abuse!

review_title: Our first experience with Diamond was‚Ä¶
review_text: Our first experience with Diamond was when we received an invitation in the mail for a weekend getaway to Orlando.   When we arrived, we were asked to attend a sales meeting, where the staff told us about all of the benefits of being owners with Diamond.  We were told that this would be a great investment that would continue to appreciate and that we would be able to resell.  Not only has this been untrue, but EVERY SINGLE TIME we try to use our membership we are subjected to yet another sales presentation!   We have been in these meetings where the staff has been hostile towards us to the point where they refuse to give us back our personal property so that we can leave!  Why don‚Äôt they just allow their customers to enjoy their vacations?   This has become something that we can no longer afford, yet when we have tried to contact the company, they have not taken any responsibility for their wrongdoing and have told us that there is nothing that they can do to help us!  How is this possible?

review_title: Our one visit to Diamond Resorts
review_text: We visited Diamond Resorts when doing a camping trip down the coast of California. Diamond Resorts was where we parked our camper for a week at a storage facility and stayed on the beach.We enjoyed our stay very much. This was the first time we ventured down to southern California. The staff was friendly and very informative on what to do and how to get around. We enjoyed our walks on the beach and watching the sunset from our room. The resort was centrally located to the sights we visited.We were there just after Christmas to January 2nd.We looked at purchasing a membership but only if we could trade or sell our current membership with Resorts West. At the time Resorts West was in the process of being bought by Holiday Inn and they were not willing to talk to Diamond Resorts. Since that time we cancelled our membership with Resorts West and our membership was paid for by Holiday Inn.If we venture that far south again we may consider Diamond Resorts if we are not staying in the camper.

In 2019, we were visiting a Diamond Resorts location and were offered a discount 4-day trip to Palm Springs if we attended a timeshare presentation while there.  The staff pressured us relentlessly into making a purchase.  While at the presentation, we were told that these resorts were for the exclusive use of members, that this was a real estate investment, and that not traveling more with our family made us bad parents.   Finally, we felt that we needed to make a purchase, not only to leave, but so that our children could experience the lifestyle that the representative was promising.  After that day, we continued to get hounded with calls from Diamond employees asking us when we would be attending a welcome presentation. Every time we tried to book it; nothing was available!  Not only can we not book rooms that would accommodate our family, received bills for maintenance fees that continue to rise!   What are we continuing to pay for? This has become such a burden on us, and Diamond is unwilling to help us.

review_title: So I just got a call from these cons
review_text: So I just got a call from these cons. We stayed at one of there Diamond resorts in Ormond Beach using a friend of mines RCI points. The resort was ok, but nothing special. So I get this call on the phone....of course the call comes in using my area code (already a scam) They tell me how they have a great package offer for me. They tell me how much they enjoyed having me and my wife there. All I need to do is show up and get 4 days for...no not $149....throw that number away this clown tells me.....$49.....let's get going on that paperwork right now because this unheard of offer is only good today. So obviously I'm not an idiot and would sleep in the street covered up with newspaper before I would buy anything even remotely timeshare involved, so I told him no thank you, I'm not interested. So here's the really weird part....I thought we were really close and he truly cared about me and my wife, but when I nicely said no, he just hung up. Now my feelings are hurt. LOL.  Do people still actually fall for these timeshare scams. I would sure hope not

In 2013, we were visiting the Cancun Resort in Las Vegas when we were told that Diamond Resorts had taken over the membership that we had in two different timeshare companies.  We were asked to attend a meeting where the sales staff told us we needed to make a purchase so that we could continue to keep the ‚Äúequity‚Äù we had already built up over the past 10 years.  What ‚Äúequity?‚Äù  Timeshares are worthless, especially Diamond‚Äôs.  Since that meeting, we have been subjected to numerous ‚Äúupdate meetings‚Äù where we have been pressured to the point where we felt we needed to make a purchase to be able to leave the room.  Every time we told the staff we were already unhappy and that we could not afford to make another purchase, yet they have assured us that a new purchase would solve all our problems.  After this past September meeting, we have had enough.  We have tried to solve this with Diamond and their representatives to no avail.  Who treats clients in this manner?  We feel we have been continuously preyed on by Diamond Resorts.  Stay away!!!

review_title: Diamond/Hilton has been awful to us
review_text: Diamond/Hilton has been awful to us. My husband and I owned with Sunterra originally, until Diamond took over, then Hilton. In 2014, we went to a meeting specifically for previous Sunterra owners. We thought it was to update us on changes since Diamond took over, but it was a sales ploy to force us into an upgrade. They gave us a ‚Äúspecial rate‚Äù at $4 per point. The same thing happened in 2015. We went to another meeting and were shown amazing upgrades- but we have to buy more points to enjoy them. Oddly enough, we got the same one-time deal as 2014, $4 per point. In 2020, we got talked into another meeting where we said our fees were too high and we were concerned as we were about to retire. We got tricked in to yet another contract for, you guessed it, $4 per point. Except this time, it was supposed to lower our maintenance fee costs, but those fees went up by $400 per year. We also agreed because the salespeople said we could give it back to Diamond if we ended up not wanting it. Spoiler alert- that isn‚Äôt possible. Now we are stuck with a huge, financially draining, burden because Diamond representatives are snakes!

review_title: Polo Towers bait and switch scam
review_text: Stayed at the Polo Towers in Las Vegas (10/22-24/2021).  We are already Diamond Resort Members.  Upon the VIP checkin, we are told that as a result of COVID 19 that we overpaid on our maintenance fees and that we needed to go to the 19th floor for no longer than 1 hour to discuss this "issue".  After about 90 minutes of one representative drawing on a single piece of paper the exciting new changes with The Hilton buyout, we are provided an opportunity to switch to "trusted" ownership for 75K (over 10 years) - and this is how they say we will save on our maintenance fees - with a 75K Loan!  I thought we were there to discuss overpaying our maintenance fees from the previous year - not seeing a piece of paper with a new loan on it.  Nevertheless, we declined, and that's when number 2 person comes out and basically berates us for not buying in!  Way to go Diamond Resorts - we don't buy-in to your sales pitch (which downstairs promised wouldn't happen) - so you lied to us.  Kept us over the 1 hour and tried to get us to buy in on money you don't control!  Shame and you and your salespeople.

review_title: Me and my fiance stayed at Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: Me and my fiance stayed at Diamond Resorts for more than 3 weeks while our house was being renovated. While there, our car was broken into and everything inside stolen, including an invaluable laptop that had my son's baby pictures on it. Diamond Resorts then proceeded to put us through HELL. They made filing a police report difficult, management lied and told us they didn't have security cameras, but police pointed out that they DID. We talked with a very lazy adjuster named Deborah who took weeks to get back to us. She didn't care about our situation and told us we were denied because Diamond has a "sign out front." But we were robbed because Diamond's parking lot lights were broken. In addition, the door to my hotel room didn't work and Diamond didn't refund our stay. I will never stay with them again and I highly recommend you take your family and friends to a different resort because if you are hurt, or someone steals from you, or your room door doesn't operate, they will not make things right. They will put you through hell for months with their "adjuster" only to deny you in the end.

review_title: DO NOT BUY INTO DIAMOND RESORTS
review_text: DO NOT BUY INTO DIAMOND RESORTS.  DO NOT ATTEND ANY OWNER UPDATE MEETINGS.  They lie and tell you it will be an hour.  it will be 3.   Also, we have been members for 4 years now and are contacting an attorney to get our money back and cancel this crap.  I have not been able to access my benefits as a gold member for over 5 weeks now.  i have called and called, chatted and chatted, emailed and emailed.   The motto of this company seems to be"   ignore the customer until they stop contacting us".  We have been lied to face to face by a rep in the Las Vegas VIP check in.  Since her boss was not there, i complained to the resort asst manager who said she would relay our message to the check in reps boss.  I told the resort manager, I wanted a call from that woman's boss.  After not getting a call ( as usual with Diamond employees), I called the resort again and spoke with the same asst manager.  She let me know that the check in reps manager sent the resort manager an email saying that he had spoken with me and taken care of it. THIS IS A FLAT OUT LIE.  I NEVER SPOKE WITH HIM.

review_title: allow covid positive guests to travel and stay. Stay far away!
review_text: Their Orlando Florida location told my family to still come after we tested positive for covid. Disgusting place.

review_title: After booking a stay at one of the‚Ä¶
review_text: After booking a stay at one of the Diamond Resorts properties, we received a call to ‚Äúconfirm‚Äù our stay.  The rep offered us a discount on our stay if we were to attend one of their 90-minute presentations.  At the presentation, we met with a salesperson that was very rude and pushy from the beginning.  He told us that this was a real estate investment that would increase in value, that we could sell our unit at any time for a profit, there was no fees for utilizing other in-network resorts, and the maintenance fees would increase at a nominal rate.  The main reason we purchased was because they told us there is a robust rental market and we could make extra income by renting it out to pay down the mortgage debt.  It didn‚Äôt take long to figure out these were all LIES!  We have since done research on selling this and there is ZERO resale value!  The maintenance fees have tripled ‚Äì to the point where this is now an extreme financial burden on our family.  Plus, the availability is so terrible that we can‚Äôt even use it!!   Do not accept any discounts or free vacations from this company.

review_title: THANKS FOR MAKING MY VACATION A TRUE‚Ä¶
review_text: THANKS FOR MAKING MY VACATION A TRUE SUCCESS!! ALL MY REQUESTS WAS MADE AND I REALLY ENJOYED MY 7 DAYS. MUST RETURN-

Traded our Marriott thru Interval International for a 2 bedroom in Suites at Falls Creek, Branson, Mo.  So NOT up to the standards I am used to with Marriott and Wyndham.  Would NOT recommend this company to anyone.  The living room furniture is old uncomfortable and dirty.  There are loose floor tiles in one bathroom.  The mattresses are lumpy and uncomfortable.  The cabinetry needs refurbishing.  The counter tops need to be replaced preferably with granite.  The carpet is an ugly dark brown.  The appliances although clean need to be upgraded to stainless.  If Diamond Club wants to compete these changes NEED to be done.  I am sure the maintenance fees are high here.  Although I don't know what might be happening with the money it is certainly NOT going into upgrading the interior.I am EDITING THIS REVIEW TO ADD. When we checked out A DAY EARLY because we could no longer stand the horribly uncomfortable beds we learned that they ALREADY WERE AWARE of this HORRIBLE REVIEW but obviously made NO ATTEMPT to improve our experience in their resort.  Only goes to confirm they have no regards to costumer satisfaction.

review_title: Diamond Resorts is a horrible company
review_text: My wife and I were in Las Vegas when we were approached by Diamond Resorts representatives at Circus Circus.  They asked if we would be interested in receiving free tickets to dinner and a show as a gift for our attendance at a one-hour presentation.  When we signed up, our yearly income did not meet their minimum, but the rep said not to worry about it, which in hindsight, should have been a huge red flag!  At the presentation, when the first offer was presented, we told them that this was way more than we could afford.  After 4 hours of continuous better and ‚Äúone-day only offers‚Äù, we finally gave in. The employees led us to believe that this would be an investment for us and our family.   The one time we have used this membership, we could not make reservations in Hawaii like we desired so we had to settle for Las Vegas. They forced us into a mandatory member presentation, where we were talked into upgrading.  Since the representative told us that we could refinance with our bank for a lower rate, we relented.  This is not possible!  Now we are stuck with something we cannot afford and Diamond will not help us!
We had a great stay. Room was very clean, bed was very comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

We were visiting Disney World in 2017 when we first became aware of Diamond Resorts.  We were approached by their reps, and they asked us to attend a 60-90 minute travel investment seminar. This seminar was more than twice as long as we were originally told that it would be, which was pretty frustrating when you are trying to enjoy a vacation with your family.  Since we were told that this travel investment would allow us to take our family on vacations all over the world, we thought it would be a great investment for our future.  Since that purchase, we have been required to attend sales meetings every time we visited any Diamond property.  These are always fraught with complex sales tactics and extreme high pressure.  Every time we would mention the disappointments we had already experienced during our time as owners we were told that these upgrades would solve our problems.  The only thing that has changed are increasing assessment and maintenance fees with no end in sight.  Had we EVER been told that there was a cancellation period that we could have taken advantage of, we would have done so.  Now we are afraid that our children will be burdened with this ‚Äúinvestment‚Äù in the future.

review_title: Diamond Resorts A Lie And A Scam
review_text: Alfredo Abedrabbo | Marketing ManagerDRI Williamsburg Sales OfficeLied to me and my family as we were asked to change the date of our presentation fromJune 28 to June 29th 2021 and he told us we would get a ring doorbell and 800 minfree with ADT if we would change the date no mention of the terms or commitments. We changed our date. Then when we said no to the timeshare it turns out it is a doorbell from ADT it is not not a ring doorbell at all, you have to sign up for a year with ADT and if you cancel there is a termination fee. So we got nothing for our trouble. The place we stayed in was filthy and the ac leaked so we had to call maintenance to fix it before it ruined the floor. They would have blamed us and charged us to fix it. I do not think a company should be built on lies. The people at the presentation were rude and pompous we kept saying no and they would send someone else to sell to us what we had said no to earlier, we had to stay for 3 hours before we could leave. This company relies on lies and bullying to sell there product stay away from them dont fall for there free night stay and sit down with the presentation you will regret doing so.

review_title: Diamond resorts sampler package is a‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond resorts sampler package is a WASTE OF TIME, ENERGY AND MONEY. 20,000 points worth USD$4k was used to book 2 weeks in Hawaii - it came to crunch time with our package expiring. So, we made use out of what we could get otherwise we'd loose it all. Turns out we got a 'hotel room' for one week, which is aload of BS as we were given the impression of having an appartment type - there was a cockroach in our bath and hair in our towels..Also, and we were expecting a 2 dbl bed room + kitchen the other week - we got a studio (1 dbl bed, NO KITCHEN).. Now, being 25wks pregnant and with a 2 yr old son.. this was not ideal. Also, that same room had a dirty floor on arrival so we had to have the room vaccumed the following day - cleanliness is a MINIMUM requirement and we didn't even get that.Overall, our experience has been extremely disappointing for many reasons. Even the process leading up to our trip was poorly managed with no confirmation emails of our first week accomadation and attendance to the presentation. We've been circulated round to many people on the phone to try and find a solution during our holiday and no one has bothered to get back to us to fix false promises so we've lost all trust in Diamond resort and Hilton who have bought into Diamond resorts now. Don't buy into their BS - you will regret it. We certainly do.

review_title: It‚Äôs regrettable that I find myself‚Ä¶
review_text: It‚Äôs regrettable that I find myself writing this review of Diamond Resorts but what they have put my wife and I through has been dreadful. We were swindled on our Honeymoon in Las Vegas to attend a sales presentation after being offered a Helicopter ride. One of the Diamond sales reps Patrick Acton met with us and lied to us to influence to buy a Diamond Resort timeshare. They lied about all the different places that we would be able to vacation at around the country and even Mexico. We come to find out it‚Äôs all non-sense. They lied to us and told us that a benefit of owning a Diamond Resorts timeshare would be VIP status at Disney resorts and theme parks. Despite multiple attempts, we haven‚Äôt been able to book a single vacation through Diamond Resorts due to the lack of availability! Everything they presented to us was just to get us trapped to their timeshare contract. You won‚Äôt get anything in return for thousands of dollars that you pay them. When you sign up with them, they purposely skim over the terms, conditions, and financial information! It‚Äôs the biggest scam in Las Vegas. It‚Äôs false promises, high pressure, and unfair financing. Diamond Resorts is getting away with robbery! Do yourself a favor and don‚Äôt make the mistake of getting involved with Diamond Resorts timeshare, they‚Äôre a crooked company!!!

review_title: It‚Äôs regrettable that I find myself‚Ä¶
review_text: It‚Äôs regrettable that I find myself writing this review of Diamond Resorts but what they have put my wife and I through has been dreadful. We were swindled on our Honeymoon in Las Vegas to attend a sales presentation after being offered a Helicopter ride. One of the Diamond sales reps Patrick Acton met with us and lied to us to influence to buy a Diamond Resort timeshare. They lied about all the different places that we would be able to vacation at around the country and even Mexico. We come to find out it‚Äôs all non-sense. They lied to us and told us that a benefit of owning a Diamond Resorts timeshare would be VIP status at Disney resorts and theme parks. Despite multiple attempts, we haven‚Äôt been able to book a single vacation through Diamond Resorts due to the lack of availability! Everything they presented to us was just to get us trapped to their timeshare contract. You won‚Äôt get anything in return for thousands of dollars that you pay them. When you sign up with them, they purposely skim over the terms, conditions, and financial information! It‚Äôs the biggest scam in Las Vegas. It‚Äôs false promises, high pressure, and unfair financing. Diamond Resorts is getting away with robbery! Do yourself a favor and don‚Äôt make the mistake of getting involved with Diamond Resorts timeshare, they‚Äôre a crooked company!!!

review_title: The use of the Diamond membership
review_text: The use of the Diamond membership has left us very disappointed due to the lack of consistent and truthful information that Diamond Resort employee gives us. Each time we reserved a Diamond stay, it came with a required ‚Äú60-minute‚Äù presentation which ends up being a full day! This takes time away from our Vacation that we would very much enjoy instead of being faced with lies and inconsistent information that the MANY salespersons would give at these LONG presentations.  One of the lies was that we no longer needed interval International membership because Diamond would ‚Äúpay for it‚Äù. We were then notified that Diamond no longer covered that fee and we would have to pay it along with a myriad of other undisclosed fees. On our last stay, they told us that we are a gold member and that we had to attend ANOTHER required presentation. In this presentation, they informed us that we did not have that gold member status and that we would have to pay $12,000 if we wanted to be that status. We declined the offer and left as ‚Äúsilver‚Äù members. After all this misinformation, we then were told that we were indeed gold members. Diamond is a dishonest company and should be avoided at all cost.

Our entire experience with this company has been terrible! We recently wrote to Diamond Resorts trying to explain our frustration with them and to ask them to release us from our contract. They answered, declining to take responsibility for any of what I had told them I experienced. May I add, this seemed like a very canned response, almost as if they copied and pasted everything. They said they usually tell people to put aside a couple hours for the meeting. I had explained to them that they told us it will be an hour and it ended up lasting 8 hours. That is not a couple hours!! When we told them that the salespeople claimed it was an investment and we can make money off it in the long run, they claimed we misunderstood, and it would be an investment in the sense we would be able to travel more. Funny, as there is no availability so we cannot travel even with them at all. I had told them I am requesting that all communication be in writing only. However, they recommended we speak on the phone so they can have a full understanding and how I can assist them in working towards an appropriate solution. The ONLY appropriate solution I will accept is canceling my contract, which they had refused to do! Seeing some of these BBB reviews, I can unfortunately see that this is a common thing. They lie to everyone and are NEVER held responsible!

When we visited Las Vegas for our anniversary in 2016, we were asked to attend a sales presentation in exchange for a $200 dinner voucher.  We were told this would be an hour of our time but were in that meeting for OVER 6 HOURS!  We were subjected to no less than 5 different Diamond Resorts salespeople, including one that identified himself as an executive, into making this purchase!  No matter how many times we said no, they just kept asking what we could afford to pay per month.   They told us that we would be receiving free points, that the maintenance fees would be a set amount, and that we were making a real estate purchase that would continue to build equity.   None of this was true!  When we tried to use the ‚Äúfree points‚Äù we were told that there was an activation fee and that we had to pay taxes on the points and every year the maintenance fees increase exponentially.  The few times that we have visited their resorts, we have been forced to attend another presentation where we are pressured into upgrading our membership as that will solve the issues that we are having.  UNTRUE!   We have reached out to the company to try and resolve this, but they do not respond! What kind of company treats their OWNERS this way?

I had been a happy owner with Monarch for many years until they were purchased by Diamond Resorts. Diamond began calling me telling me about this amazing offer they had so I went to the meeting they had claimed was going to only take 2-3 hours. Instead, it was over 5 hours! This was not the worst part!! After the long hours of pressure to purchase, I finally agreed to sign, yet the sales staff made we wait for NEARLY TWO HOURS for the ‚Äúpaperwork to be ready‚Äù, so I eventually just walked out. Approximately 2 hours after, I received a call apologizing for the inconvenience and offering to come to my house to finish up the process. This is so UNPROFESSIONAL and INAPPROPRIATE!! The amount of pressure he applied over the phone was absurd. I never called him back after, but he has continued to call me multiple times!! In 2018, I was called and offered a 3 day/2 night stay in Las Vegas as long as I go to another meeting. At the meeting, the salesperson gave me the same pitch again! When I asked for time to think and consider, they only gave me 15 minutes! Not long enough!! I regrettably signed and realized EVERYTHING they told me was a complete lie. My fees went up, there is no availability, and my points are not worth anything leading me to pay out of pocket if I want to book a room. Diamond lied to me for their own benefit. They do not care about their customers and I encourage everyone to stay far away.
Amazing experience

My entire experience with Diamond Resorts formerly known as Intrawest has been a disaster. We attended a presentation of theirs in Whistler Canada back in 2015 and caved into the whole hard sell experience. At that time they were also offering Hilton Hotels as part of the deal. This was the only aspect that made sense to us as we live in the UK - which meant their North American resorts were not so accessible. This tie up with Hilton Hotels in 2015 was however subsequently ditched I think when they rebranded and became Embarc. Now in the latest manifestation as Diamond they are offering some sort of tie up with Hilton Hotels again. But we are yet to know the details. Forgive me for appearing cynical but given the way in which this company has behaved up to now and throughout Covid (no allowances have made for the fact that we have not been able to travel) I do not believe this is a customer orientated "Club" that you can trust to look after its members' interests. It is a hard sell commercial company out to maximise its own profit. Your shares are not easily saleable contrary to what we were led to believe back in Whistler and booking is not easy even if you are flexible on dates. If I could turn the clock back I would not have touched this company with a barge pole!

Things are definitely not improving with Hilton Grand Vacations either. I bought into Diamond resorts in 2012 with intention of buying a few more points each year so when we retired, I would be able to travel. I saw it as an investment at the time. I paid my maintenance fees every year and never used my points. But was still convinced it was a decent investment for future travel. Things started falling apart in 2018.  Very long story but trying to remove a name off the timeshare cost me approximately 3000 dollars. Then was given a ‚Äúfree week‚Äù IF I paid my fees for that year. I was not going to pay and just be free of them. But decided I would give one more try. Went on the ‚Äúfree week‚Äù only to spend an entire day in with sales. Was told they would ‚Äúcover maintenance fees‚Äù that year. Which they did not. We had to. Went just before pandemic to mystic dunes where we were told once again our maintenance fees would be paid if we attended ‚Äúan owners update‚Äù(which is a high pressure sales meeting). And again‚Ä¶they didn‚Äôt pay. We did. And now‚Ä¶living in Canada, we have not been able to travel at all since the beginning of Covid. Just started to look at places to go this fall in Orlando, and found out that Hilton has foreclosed my deeded property. Claiming we didn‚Äôt pay our fees. (We did even though we couldn‚Äôt travel). Have called for months with no answer. I was hopeful HGV was going to be an improvement. Sadly, it is not. Same old same old nonsense unfortunately. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
The agent was professional and courteous.She was polite and a efficient.  She was a listener.

review_title: As members we were asked to attend a‚Ä¶
review_text: As members we were asked to attend a sales presentation when checking in at the Diamond Grand Beach resort in Orlando. We declined the invitation from the desk rep in the lobby but were told if we did not attend, we would lose our Diamond points. We reluctantly agreed to attend the next morning. When we checked in the took our drivers licenses and did not give them back. More on that later. We were assigned a salesperson who started to tell us a series of lies. He said that if we did not upgrade out of our Diamond contract the annual fees would increase dramatically. He assured us he could convert us to Hilton Grand Vacations ‚Äúfree of charge‚Äù and in so doing, decrease our annual fees and increase our booking opportunities. We were also told that HGV had a buy back program and once our rolled over loan was paid, we could walk away without issue. He assured us that the HGV product was a ‚Äúreal estate asset with Hilton and that HGV had a 99% satisfaction score‚Äù. None of this was true! We did not roll anything over to HGV and now have a Diamond AND HGV membership with loans and fees due on both! At some point in time, a Hilton credit card account was opened without our permission (using the information on our confiscated drivers‚Äô licenses) and they charged a down payment to that card. How illegal is that? We later discovered that there was a 10-day cancellation window but did not discover this until well after the 10 days had passed. When we called HGV to get this fixed, the rep on the phone said they receive several calls DAILY from people telling them the same issues as we have. An obvious pattern of fraud! We have written a letter to HGV leadership about this situation, and they have ignored that communication to date. Protect yourselves and do not fall for this scam!

Diamonds Resorts is implementing ruthless, illegal, and fraudulent sales tactics to get timeshare owners to upgrade. Beware of what they say and do not sign a contract with them. We have been owners for over about a decade now and I can‚Äôt tell you enough how awful and rotten they have become as an organization. It seems like the older my wife and I get, the more appalling and predatory the treatment we get from Diamond Resorts. They constantly hound you to go to an owner‚Äôs presentation to get you to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù when really, they are just trying to squeeze every penny out of you. We were falsely led to believe that when upgrading from Silver to Gold level, that we would be able to monetize our points. They told us at least three times that we could monetize points with Diamond Resorts. That was all lies, we‚Äôre now left with an astronomical amount of debt.  All we want to do if enjoy our retirement without the threat of being unable to pay increasing costs of something we cannot use. We were lucky to have one of our contracts rescinded after we found multiple inaccuracies in the contract. We were fed a ton of lies from their sales folks and we went back the next day to have it nulled. From what we‚Äôve learned Diamond Resorts is just taking advantage of good innocent people. If you‚Äôre looking for honesty and a great timeshare it‚Äôs best to avoid Diamond Resorts.

While on a trip to Las Vegas, Nevada in 2019, I was lied to and deceived by the scam of employees at DIAMOND RESORTS. Once again, I repeat DIAMOND, stay as far away as possible! RUN! We were approached by a lady asking my friends and I if we‚Äôd like FREE DINNERS and FREE SHOW TICKETS, and of course hearing the word ‚ÄúFREE‚Äù instantly we responded to her ‚ÄúOF COURSE‚Äù!!  , She informed us that there was one thing we had to do to be able to get these free goodies, she told us that we had to attend a 2-hour presentation about vacation ownership, from there this nightmare started. I thought I would just attend the presentation and after that be able to get some free tickets and free dinners but that was not the case at all. During the presentation the employees claimed that there are thousands of resorts available for DIAMOND owners. I was given a ‚ÄúDREAM VACATAION PACKAGE‚Äù and a free cruise. Unfortunately, with the pandemic that never gave us a chance to claim these vacation packages. Any time I booked a vacation at any DIAMOND properties I always had to attend a presentation for owners, all they tried doing these presentations was SELL! DIAMOND RESORTS IS FULL OF LIES, the sales reps LIE to you, and they withhold information, all they want is money, they have no heart. I hope no one else goes through this nightmare IF I COULD GIVE THEM NEGATIVE 5 STARS I WOULD!
Really appreciate the outstanding customer service we received from our agent, Kassandra.

review_title: These companies liars don‚Äôt Listen them
review_text: These companies liars don‚Äôt even try to listen theme. They gonna lie you more and more.

review_title: Not happy with DRI and our presentation
review_text: We have been timeshare owners since 1990.  Our resort has had a number of management companies over the years but DRI is quite possibly the worse ever!  We attended a "seminar" yesterday here in FL so they could tell us all about new things happening which we were lead to believe was in regard to Hilton buying them out.  WRONG!  They have come up with a new way to try to sell you points called their "Redemption Program".  We are fixed weeks, always have been and always will be.  They told us our deed was considered a "bankrupt" deed.  We were also told that they have parted ways with I.I. and we would no longer be able to deposit our weeks there as they would not release them to I.I.  We were also told that because we are fixed weeks that Hilton taking over would give us no advantages, eluding to the fact that we needed to convert to points and pay them $30,000 at an interest rate of 16.99% over 10 years in order to be included in the Hilton benefits.The people we dealt with were not professional looking whatsoever.  The first gal had huge false eyelases, botox lips and long fake nails and sneakers.  Then a man walked in with a mint green suit.  We thought we were at clown school!  Hard to take people dressed like this serious.We left feeling like we had been totally scammed on what we thought we were attending for.  Not a good feeling at all!

review_title: Issues with Diamond Resorts Internantional, et al.
review_text: My husband and I have been members of DRI since the early 2000's.  We originally purchased a 1 week timeshare in Las Vegas, NV at Polo Towers (pre-construction).  We have made several purchases since then and eventually converted our weeks to points.  We now have 100,000 points per year.  We made an additional purchase in Oct, 2018 "to remain Platinum status" and were told we could "sell back the additional points for a profit" in 3 years.  We were also told we could use 50,000 points towards maintenance fees and still have 50,000 points to travel.  I have not found any of this to be true.  By the way, just prior to going in to contract signing the salesman advised us to keep all this to ourselves as he was sharing news with us that hasn't rolled out.  We should have known then to walk away and I wish we had.  Our maintenance fees have sky rocketed!  We were told we would receive paperwork within 30 days of the purchase.  There would be equity paperwork that would allow us to refinance our loan at any bank.  The loan papers never arrived and no salesman or DRI contact has been able or willing to help us.  Diamond Resorts is being acquired by Hilton very soon.  We worry about being told we will need to spend more money on Hilton points.  We are looking into getting out of our contract.  We hope this doesn't ruin our credit.  STAY AWAY FROM TIMESHARES!  Save your money!

review_title: They never tell the turth it's one lie‚Ä¶
review_text: They never tell the turth it's one lie after another lie
Everything  was great. The accommodations were clean and very nice. Staff friendly.

When we arrived in Branson, MO, at Diamond Resort‚Äôs Fall Creek, we had no idea that we would need to attend a sales presentation.  At this presentation, we spoke to countless members of their sales staff who continued to tell us all the ‚Äúamazing‚Äù benefits of ownership with Diamond.  In an effort to leave, we purchased a sampler package.  Once we returned home, we tried to use this to travel, yet every time we went on the website, nothing was available.  We met with the staff a second time to try and resolve this issue.  We were assured that if we purchased enough points to get to the next membership level, all our problems would be resolved.  THIS WAS NOT THE CASE.  Again, we went to meet with the staff to discuss.  At this meeting, which lasted over 7 hours, we were adamant that we needed to see how this worked.  Our biggest concern was that my disabled son would be left having to take ownership of this contract.   He was with us on this trip and could not be left alone for this length of time, yet the staff did not care!   They made rude comments about my health, to which I finally walked out.  My partner, however, stayed to try to get me removed from the contract.  He returned, hours later, believing that I had been removed from these contracts.  We found out later that was another lie.  We are both military veterans and cannot believe ANY reputable company would treat servicepeople in this manner!

review_title: Diamond Resorts - How Can They Still Be In Business?‚Ä¶
review_text: I am amazed that Diamond Resorts has an overall average review score of 3.3 given all of the negative reviews I read.I have owned timeshares since the early 90's and became a member of Diamond Resorts when they purchased Sunterra.Many of the negative reviews I have read talk about Diamond Resorts being "scam artists". In my opinion, that is a 100% accurate description for everyone in the Diamond Resorts' Sales Department. I have multiple experiences dealing with the DR Sales Department and all them clearly tell me that they are all scam artists.I recently spent the last two plus months making a dozen or more calls to Diamond Resorts attempting to get a $600 refund they owed me for deposits on Sampler Program vacation weeks I cancelled. I won't go into all the details. Diamond Resorts has the absolute worst customer service. They are totally disorganized and redirect calls willy nilly. Today, I finally (after two months) spoke to a woman who assured me she would work with me until I got my refund. I have my fingers crossed but her re-assurance makes feel positive that I will finally get my money back.A word of advice to anyone reading this review who is considering purchasing a timeshare  (or anything) from Diamond Resorts -- DO NOT DO IT. You would be better served to go to the bank, withdraw the amount of money you plan to spend on the purchase in paper money, pile the cash up in your backyard and burn it. Less aggravation...

Worst company ever! We have made countless complaints to Diamond Resorts on the sheer fact of how everything that our salesman Craig Miller promised was an absolute fabrication. Please do not fall for any of their lies! You can not book whenever, wherever you want. Your rates will continue to go up. The salespeople will do WHATEVER it takes to get your money. We feel like we have done nothing but set our money on fire! The company is unwilling to work with anyone who is in need of getting rid of their timeshare if they do not have everything paid off, so do not let anyone tell you otherwise. We have received a letter stating that they would be automatically terminating the account. Yet nothing has been done and they continue to hold us hostage. We have even made it clear to them that in some of our documents that the dates are wrong from the date that we actually signed, which would make it null and void, and they still refuse to do anything about it. They continue to tell us that they stand firm in their decision that they will not grant cancellation out of their rescission period even after receiving the letter that they are terminating the account. They have told us that they consider the matter resolved. THE MATTER IS NOT RESOLVED! This has in turn hurt our livelihood and our business. Whoever thinks that a timeshare will not impact your personal life and your job, think again. These people will scam you out of your money quickly to watch you struggle so that their greedy hands can profit.

One week in Scottsdale and one week in Sedona, attended one review for each week we stayed. Bought $4000 of promises.  Flight back home delayed to 1045 pm because of winter storm back home. Asked concierge at front desk in Sedona to see if late check out possible. Yes>> but 45$ dollars for every 20 minutes past 1030 am! ouch. ok what about a room? yes i can get you one but in Scottsdale at Mirage for $ 45 . Great please book this for me. Get a call from him saying that room ok but need to attend another update meeting. Told him already attended two in last two weeks.He said let me check.Get a call from customer service at Mirage in Scottsdale and tells me I can have a room but need to attend another review with intentions of buying points or no room ???  First of all, already gave you 4000$, just last week! Just need a room to freshen up before our flight! I will never buy another dime from this two-bit company!!! Anyone thinking of buying form Diamond or Hilton should reconsider because this is just one red flag out of many. Hilton should be ashamed buying a dishonest company like this.In two weeks, in just two meetings what we purchased was no longer the same from both sales reps. Read the reviews!!
