I am an honest intelligent person with 34 years of corporate experience. I would have been fired a long time ago if worked with these types of ethics. How are they still in business?? Ever see a company without a link to their reviews! Must be ashamed!  Paul Panneton

review_title: I booked Grand Pallidium resort in‚Ä¶
review_text: I booked Grand Pallidium resort in Puerto Vallarta using our diamond points 2 months ago (sept 2021). My diamond points were deducted from my account and I received an email from 7Across (my understanding is these guys have a tie up with Diamond resorts) stating my reservation with Grand Palladium is confirmed. Myself and my wife and our 2 children arrived at Grand Pallidium resort yesterday (N0v 19th 2021) from San Francisco approx at 3.30 PM and place looked good. we were greeted with a glass of juice and they were trying to check us in. Almost at the end of checking in process lady asks us to pay 5000 USD for 6 nights stay. We thought there must have been some misunderstanding and we explained how we booked the resort and Diamond resort should have paid them. After a long back and forth (we had a early morning flight at 8.45 AM and we were all extremely tired at this stage) Resort people told us we did not get paid so we cannot check you in. We were angry and extremely disappointed. we tried to get 7Across and Diamond guys on the phone with no result (as they were closed for the day). we had to leave the resort and find another place to live. I feel Diamond resorts is a scam. They lure people into buying these time shares and when it's their time to pay they exactly know how to avoid. Master Minds.  I hate them and I will tell everybody I know my experience with them. My next step is to figure our how to cancel the time share. I am sure this will be n up hill battle and I will not give up.
It had good service, place was very clean and neat, location was great

review_title: Would give a 0 if I could, Lured under False pretenses
review_text: Would give a 0 if I could, Under false pretenses An initial guy named Daniel baited us by telling us about the several free nights at the diamond resort. That very day we paid for a room to which we could not check into due to a busted pipeline at a ‚Äúsister resort‚Äù I was under the impression that I would get the free nights. Daniel eventually booked us BUT a only after Daniel FAIL to tell me that I‚Äôm supposed bring ‚Äúmy cohabiter‚Äù and initial and sign a invitation form. The day of the presentation, A gentleman in a grey suit and contoured eye brows proceeded to fast talk over me and was more interested and kept asking about my ‚Äúsignificant other‚Äù and passed me off to Nassim who was nice and Claudia her manager was pushy and trying to get in my personal business. Their boss (can‚Äôt remember his name) stated Claudia would get a talking to. I Did the presentation. After declining 7-9 times they handed me my walking papers so to speak. I was waiting in line at the Gifting booth when the contoured eye browed gentleman in the grey suit Accosted me by saying ‚ÄúI lied to him about making decisions without my significant other‚Äù I specified that I could initially but there were unforeseen factors in the ultimate decision making. He proceeded to talk Over me and I stated I was NOT DONE with my explanation. I asked why he was so defensive and curt‚Ä¶. He cut me off and after a dramatic exit, after his ‚Äúokay whatever‚Äù retort‚Ä¶I tried to explained that if the timing was better and I wasn‚Äôt lured under false pretenses, it would have ended differently. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

review_title: Looking forward on my trip to Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: Looking forward on my trip to Diamond Resorts. Thanks for the help !

We were asked to attend a meeting with Diamond Resorts in late August 2020.  As Monarch owners, we were told that we needed to upgrade into the Diamond system in order to keep the equity that we had with our prior purchase, that we would never pay maintenance fees and that we would never be called to attend another meeting.  There appeared to be no downside!  It was not until a month later that we started to see the lies that had been told to us.  We never received any paperwork or billing information and when we called no one knew anything about it.  In November, we drove to Las Vegas to try and figure out what was going on.  When we met with the finance department, they claimed they had no paperwork from August and had us sign new paperwork, again reiterating that there would be no maintenance fees.  When we got home we noticed they back dated the paperwork to August, which immediately eliminated the cancellation period which is 5 days according to Nevada law.  We feel this was intentional and that this alone is a violation of consumer protection law.  However, in January we started to get bills for THREE TIMES the amount we were told the mortgage payment would be PLUS a $5000 bill for maintenance fees!    When we called to complain, we were put in contact with someone who they claimed was a member of the executive board.   On this call, this executive told us that we were stupid people that should have been more careful.  How does an executive of ANY company speak to a customer in this manner?!!  Stay away from them!  They are all liars!
Rooms were nice. Parking was a little inconvenient for our stay.

review_title: The resort was ok, in a great location (Sedona)
review_text: The resort was ok. Nice service at front desk and the amenities were ok. Note: 2 of 3 hottubs were out of service. We had a studio that was clean but needed some upkeep (dings and dents). Our view was of the wall of the next unit (in Sedona). We were outside most of the time so it didn't really matter this stay. Concierge roped us into Diamond preview. We were offered a significant atv discount (which was a great experience!!!!). We were offered a couple other incentives, which were insignificant. Overall, the Week was great, the location (Sedona) was great. The Diamond presentation was HORRIBLE!!  I own a timeshare, and they ushered us into a room, only to tell us we do not understand how it works and that it's too expensive for us anyway. I just wanted it explained to me how 6500-10k points equates to 10weeks vacation a year.  How 48-65k mortgage and 2k-3k a year maintenance fees equates into the 60k savings over 20 years. The math doesn't add up. I asked legitimate questions so that I could understand the system and they in turn were irritated and insulting.They ushered us to another table where they try to sell you a sampler points package, and we were furious by then. I have sat through a number of these pitches in my lifetime and this was by far the most disappointing.  During the presentation they even spent time to show you the bad BBB reviews to explain away that it's only .0025% of their membership that are disappointed, but anyone with common sense knows that not everyone throws down disappointed ratings on BBB. JUST DO YOUR RESEARCH. I will be avoiding ANY Diamond resorts on my future travels because of that experience.

There are very few words to describe Diamond Resorts and the vile people they have working for them. If there was a way to give them less than 1 star I would gladly do so. These miserable thieves have abused me long enough. I made the HUGE mistake of buying into a timeshare with Diamond and the entire experience has been a nightmare. When they sold me the timeshare, they were very kind and professional, they found every way possible to kiss up to me and convince me to buy a timeshare. At first, they didn‚Äôt call it a timeshare, they said it was a ‚Äúmembership‚Äù. The tricks didn‚Äôt stop there, these bums falsely claimed that what I was buying would double in price. I kept refusing to buy anything and explained that multiple times, but they would not take no for an answer. They kept lowering the price, but the truth is they were just covering up the other fees and actual costs. They falsely claimed that maintenance fees would stay a set price. They play a game with their point system, so you never really know what you‚Äôre getting until it‚Äôs too late. Don‚Äôt trust anything they say, it‚Äôs all fake. They just get you locked into their cycle of false promises and debt. I reached out to the office of Mark Wang the CEO directly and explained my experience. I received a call from one of their goons who very rudely called me a liar and threatened me. I was shocked that anyone would talk to me like that, let alone an employee from a pitiful company like Diamond Resorts.  As a member of the armed forces, I‚Äôve served my country honorably and the last thing I expect is to be called a liar and harassed by Diamond. Shame on Diamond Resorts! I look forward to continuing to take action against them to disassociate myself from such a pathetic company.
Our accommodations were excellent and very active resort.
Our stay at Diamond Resort was nothing short of fabulous!

review_title: please stay away from these    they are‚Ä¶
review_text: please stay away from these    they are shocking

review_title: Diamond Resorts is the absolute worst
review_text: Diamond Resorts is the absolute worst! My experience with this company has been a never-ending headache from the start! It all began with their timeshare sales meeting, which is practically a hostage situation, where they told us a ton of lies and pressured us into getting sucked into their timeshare scheme. The staff was very aggressive, and they made their timeshares out to be ‚Äúinvestments‚Äù. They told us if we bought a timeshare, we‚Äôd make profit from renting it out. Despite all their promises this has yet to come to fruition. They told me I would have access to thousands of properties in their network but that too has proven to be a lie. I‚Äôve spent hours on the phone with them and NEVER have success in finding anything available. The timeshare is useless, you‚Äôre better off booking a hotel on a regular website instead of getting trapped into their timeshares. I should have known better when every time I refused an offer, they would drastically lower the price and sweeten the deal. It‚Äôs all a scam! The sales staff told me to lie about my income so that I would be approved for their loan and get a better interest rate!!! That goes to show what sort of company Diamond is‚Ä¶asking people to lie!!! There is absolutely no value in Diamond timeshares. I can‚Äôt believe they get away with what they are doing. Nothing about their timeshares makes sense, the fees increase, and you‚Äôre expected to pay them yet there is never any availability. The financial burden of their garbage timeshare has left me in a bad position both financially and mentally. I have asked them to void my timeshare and told them everything they‚Äôve done to me and all I got was a series of snarky emails and a letter giving me the run around and no solutions! I suspect that their Senior Resolutions Team is just a sham group of Diamond staff that are going to harass me to upgrade. Look at what others are saying. They are getting away with fraud!

review_title: Diamond Resorts - zero stars if possible
review_text: My husband and I attended a timeshare presentation which lasted more than four hours and ended with us signing a contract with Gold Key Resorts/Ocean Beach Club/Diamond Resorts. The presentation started with a young saleswoman who talked about the resort‚Äôs Ocean Beach Club. She then shared her life story: how she was jilted at the altar and how she was dealing with that by using her timeshare to vacation on some island. The second salesman joined in on the conversation. He talked about how the timeshare was a good real estate investment and how it would save us money on vacations because we'd only have to pay a $100 fee to book our week. He didn‚Äôt touch on the maintenance fees at all. I think the saleswoman‚Äôs sob story and the salesman‚Äôs divorce were tactics because their sad stories made us empathetic towards them, and they used that empathy to get us hook, line, and sinker!  I seriously think those stories were completely made up and are used on every person they sell to. We were never told our children would inherit the debt and be responsible for the mortgage and maintenance fees. They were not open and honest with all the facts. Since buying the timeshare in August 2014, we have only used it twice: once in January 2015 and again in January 2017. Both times were an exchange with one being the Ocean Beach Club but not the unit we had purchased. The other exchange was at the Ford‚Äôs Colony by Marriott in Williamsburg, VA. After those two bookings, we weren‚Äôt able to use it because there was never availability during the summer months to do an exchange. Also, every time we called to book a trip, we are told to use the website because whatever was on the website was the same availability in their system.  No one was remotely interested in helping owners book a vacation.

In 2010, we purchased a timeshare with a company called Island One while visiting one of their properties in Florida.  When they were purchased by Diamond Resorts, we were immediately hit with a 70% increase in maintenance fees!  ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS!!  For the next 8 years, we were continually asked to attend Diamond‚Äôs ‚Äúmember updates‚Äù.  It didn‚Äôt take long to realize that these were just additional sales presentations where we were continuously pressured to purchase more and more points.  Every time we declined and left these meetings, we were rudely dismissed.  On one particular occasion, we were FORCED TO WALK BACK to a totally different resort because they had sent a car to pick us up earlier in the day.  What kind of company treats people this way??? When we started to have problems booking in 2020, we again attended an update meeting to solve our issues.  We were told that this was due to us not having converted into their points system.  We were specifically told that we would be able to keep our banked weeks if we converted to their points system, and that we would receive a ‚Äúdream vacation‚Äù but we would have to act that day.  There was NO MENTION of the expiration date on the points or the additional fees. And we LOST the two banked weeks. We still have problems booking the weeks we requested as owners. But we can reserve those same weeks as a private customer.  We were told the resorts were for owners only. The booking problem was not solved.  Had we been told that there was a 10-day window to cancel this, we DEFINITELY would have taken advantage of that!  To make everything worse, they told us that this purchase would allow us to have the 0% interest on our credit card extended.  This was a total lie!!DIAMOND IS A TERRIBLE AND DECEITFUL COMPANY and now we are stuck with their timeshare with no end in sight!

review_title: The only comment is there was no‚Ä¶
review_text: The only comment is there was no restuarant onsite

review_title: I am a retired nurse with Multiple‚Ä¶
review_text: I am a retired nurse with Multiple Sclerosis and a disabled child. My husband and I bought a timeshare with Embassy Resorts in 2001 and we had some difficulties at first but for the most part it was OK. In 2004, Embassy was bought out by Diamond Resorts and that is when everything went from bad to worse as we could never book a vacation due to lack of availability.Over the next 15 years, they kept calling us for owner‚Äôs updates, which they proceeded to upgrade our contracts to fix our availability issues and give us higher status, so we had priority bookings. One time they took our drivers licenses and held us hostage until we upgraded again! Our last upgrade in 2016 was done so we could have an ‚Äúexit plan‚Äù so our disabled child wouldn‚Äôt inherit the financial burden. Our salesperson became our ‚Äúgo to guy‚Äù, but when we reached out, he disappeared. In 2021, Hilton bought Diamond. We thought, finally a reputable company that we can work with, boy were we wrong. A salesman named Todd from Diamond tried to get us to upgrade again, telling us for $10,000 they would turn our 15-year loan into a 10-year loan, and we could refinance with a bank. They offered to open a Diamond credit card for us to handle the deposit, but we were so fed up with all the lies over the last 2 decades we walked out. A few days later these Hilton characters had opened a credit card under our names without our knowledge, consent, or permission!We pay $14,500 a year towards the mortgage and $6,500 a year on the maintenance fees, which totals $21,000 a year for a timeshare we can‚Äôt use! The stress of this financial burden could cause me to relapse and I would have to go to the hospital frequently. After all the lies and manipulation and broken promises, we asked to be let out of our contract because of our financial hardship, Hilton had the nerve to tell us that our only options are to either keep paying or keep upgrading.

Hilton Grand Vacations purchased Diamond Resorts, but it is clear they are just as corrupt as Diamond was! I have been lied to by Diamond several times and made the mistake of buying into their program. When HGV bought them, I was told I would be dealing with Hilton from then on. Hilton, the company with a sterling reputation? Yes, thank you I thought‚Ä¶but since have learned Hilton Grand Vacations is nothing like Hilton the hotel company with the great reputation. My last misadventure with Diamond started with a salesperson who told me a series of egregious lies in order to coerce me into purchasing into the worthless Diamond timeshare system. She ran my credit without my permission, told me she would charge $2,000 to my credit card but charged $8,500 instead, that I would receive a free trip for 2 to Hawaii with accommodations and airfare, I would have access to a myriad of Disney Resort properties, and even held my ID and refused to give it back until I signed the contract. I signed the contracts but then cancelled a few days later. This is where the real harassment began. I started getting phone calls and texts from her and other staff regarding my decision to cancel. VERY unprofessional and scary. Some time after this experience I was called to schedule a meeting to hear about the Hilton takeover and my chance to get away from the Diamond scam. I got on a webinar with a salesperson who told me another series of lies to get me to buy into the HGV system. He told me that it was mandatory to buy into the HGV Max system, that if I did not I could not use my Diamond points, I would have access to HGV properties, that since it was a ‚Äúreal estate‚Äù purchase I could make money renting the points out, and I could only get the deal that day and I was not allowed to sleep on it. All of these were lies!! I asked why the contract still said Diamond and he said it was because they were still using the old Diamond contracts and assured me, I was buying out of Diamond and into HGV. I did not get a copy of this contract for almost 2 weeks which put me outside of my cancellation period for the purchase. Several weeks later, when I tried to book a stay at an HGV resort, the HGV rep told me I did not own with them at all and had been sold MORE Diamond points! I reached out to my sales rep, but he ignored me. I also reached out to another employee who had worked with me on the contract, and she said my access would be activated soon. It was not. I was duped and defrauded again! I reached out to HGV leadership, but they have ignored my attempts to rectify this situation.  Diamond was a terrible company, and it is clear Hilton Grand Vacations is no better. Take it from me, stay away and do not make the same mistakes I have.
Was there for business - it was fantastic!!
I will return! Amazing customer service!

I am writing this review because I feel that the truth needs to be known about owning a timeshare with Diamond. It is a battle in trying to get your membership canceled with them. They will use any type of tactic to get you to come listen to whatever ‚Äúnew updates‚Äù they have just to try to sell you on more. The fact that you have representatives feeding you this so called dream investment and writing everything down on a scrap piece of paper to show you how easy everything is going to work. They keep you hostage and pressure you for hours. They will ask you things like how you want to vacation or why you are wanting to vacation so that they will use it to their advantage. We thought it would be a good idea to have to come together as friends and vacation. They stated that they had many ways to take advantage of all of our points including a program Destination Exchange. It is extremely hard to use and it does not work with just points but you have to be in a certain tier as well. You will have to pay extra fees to even utilize it. That is absurd considering the amount of money that you pay for the timeshare to begin with.They will make it sound like such a wonderful investment and that you will be saving so much money by investing in them. Honestly all you are doing is throwing your money in the trash. We honestly have tried to understand and make of the best of this timeshare but the lies and distrust have grown to such an extent that we realize that is all there is. They continue to press on the matter that we were in the wrong and that there was no fault done during the sell of our timeshare. Yet they were not present for what was said to us before we signed our paperwork. They stand behind the liars that day in day out that steal peoples‚Äô money by selling the fake dream vacations. I would not want to wish this nightmare on our children, which is why we will continue to fight against all the dishonesty that Diamond allows its representatives to get away with. They cannot be trusted at all. If it sounds too good to be true, then its best just to walk away. I hope that in writing this I can help someone else from falling into the hands of these deceitful and crooked people.

review_title: Just spent a week in Virginia Beach at‚Ä¶
review_text: Just spent a week in Virginia Beach at your Beach Quarters Resort and I am sorry, I have to rate is as only average.  I was there on my relatives week and for a non member it would not be anything that would sell me on becoming a member for sure.  The parking garage is dangerous especially if you don't watch out in turning up or down to the next level, you might put a dent in your car turning. The room was average.  Our air conditioner did not work.  Called for service to fix and worked for one day only of the 5 days we stayed.  Left 2 days early, just could not take it anymore.  Had a sales person tell us when we went for our time share appointment that they would not stay there.  They would of stayed up the street at the other resort of Diamonds!!  Our grand daughter accidently forgot her necklace and left it in the bathroom on the vanity ledge and did not realize it until the next morning and we were in Maryland.  We called the front desk and did not receive a call back so my wife called later in the day only to find out they checked and could not find it.  Asked to check again, we knew it had been left and we knew the room had not been filled at that point since our week did not end until Friday and this was only Thursday.  Again, no response.  I cannot put blame, but someone cleaned that room and found it I am sure.  That necklace was given to my grand daughter with her mothers birthstone and it said MOM.  She lost her mom to cancer in December of 2018.  That necklace meant a lot to her.  Not what I would call any better than staying in a motel.  Very seldom did we find anyone at the desk where we could ask questions about places to eat, visit or even get discount prices.  Overall I can only give 2 stars and lucky I give you those 2 stars.  For the maintenance fees that my relatives pay they should be given at least part of their points back for the bad experience we had the week of 4/30/2021 through 5/5/2021.It is now Friday, May 28th and the only communication with Diamond is they need the reservation number which I gave that to them about 2 weeks ago and that is the last word I have had with them.  Not a very reliable company when they are wanting you to purchase a time share with them.

review_title: This was our second trip to preview‚Ä¶
review_text: This was our second trip to preview Diamond Resorts. Our first trip was less than impressed so we did not buy. We were contacted to preview again and we decided to look at another resort so we purchased and went. Was promised when we bought it we that would get a 4 night trip and after the presentation we would get a $100 prepaid Visa card, 1 week trip, and a cruise voucher.  When we actually booked we were treated like the dirt on the bottom of the reps shoes and only would give us 3 nights, first in a 2 star hotel as rated on Tripadvisor. Called back within 5 minutes to change locations and had to basically argue with the guy to change my location so I at least feel better about where I am laying my head... WTA you know what... be a better representation of the company. Then when he finally agreed to work with me he sent me my confirmation and only had me down for 3 nights. When I questioned that he said we didn't "book in time", which was NEVER part of the terms... they were not booking during during COVID mind you so I couldn't have "booked in time" and NO exceptions! Thanks jerk! Then when we got to the presentation and we brought up our customer service concerns, they first ignored, pawned us off, ignored again, then when we were pawned off again they told us, don't worry about that, give us money... of course I was paraphrasing the "give us money" part but the other part about ignoring the mean man on the phone, screw your feelings as a perspective client and it will be all better once you become a member! LOL WRONG! Make it right or you do NOT get my business... PERIOD! THEN to top it all off, we DID NOT get a $100 VISA card... we got a crappy $100 restaurant.com card that I cannot use within 20 miles of my house OR the resort I am staying at!!! USELESS!!! HORRIBLE! NEVER AGAIN! My suggestion, go check out some other company like Bluegreen! We are! Hey Diamond Resorts... you know the age old saying that a good experience gets you one referral and a bad one gets you 7 bad stories... the internet is now making that worse. Step up your customer service game or go under! I will give credit where credit is due... we were lucky enough to be booked at the Bent Creek Golf Village, a Diamond Resorts property and it is very nice. Wonderful rooms and the campus is very nice and pretty well maintained and ALL of the staff is wonderful! Be prepared to be treated as NOT a peer till you drop thousands with them.

Our health issues didn‚Äôt dissuade Diamond and Hilton to sell us multiple timeshares while we are in our 80‚Äôs.  My husband has bladder cancer, PAD, and heart problems.  We enjoyed Diamond Resorts with family and friends for 12 years before salespeople started to promise that we could redeem points to help pay for Diamond loans and maintenance fees. We were then pressured into buying more and more points telling us that we could redeem some of our points to pay maintenance fees as well as Diamond mortgage which is at a ridiculous rate (12% to 17%).  Diamond salespeople told us we would be able to refinance with a bank for a lower rate.  NOT TRUE! A year or so later, we were told that if we went to Platinum level, we could redeem up to half of our points to pay 30 cents per point for maintenance fee and Diamond mortgage.  This convinced us to become Platinum level.  Less than a year later we were convinced by salespeople at Branson that by becoming Centum level we could now redeem 40 cents per point to pay for fees and loans.  This meant we could redeem half our points which leaves half our points for reservations at 50% off as told to us by the salespeople.  The documentation was entered on the contract incorrectly by the Branson purchase by giving us credit for two Club Select units instead of one.  We have only one Club Select Unit.  We received a call from Diamond Corporate in Las Vegas telling us about the "mistake" made in Branson was incorrect and we were NOT Centum.  In order to become Centum with all the benefits, we needed to make another purchase.  It is obvious by now that we were being lied to many times by every salesperson we encountered.  To this date, the 30 cents or 40 cents per point redemption has never happened. In addition to the above lies, we were told that the price per point would increase substantially after Hilton purchased Diamond which influenced further purchases.  In order to be a part of Hilton we were told that we must make another purchase, which we did.  Later we were told that we still need another purchase to become Hilton.  They always found something wrong, and we needed another purchase. We must have been easy targets. The only reason we continued to purchase points was because Diamond promised redemption and Hilton membership.  The redemption as stated never happened.  We were perfectly happy with being Gold level, but the salespersons made us feel terrible if we "passed up this great deal". Our grown children looked into timeshare ownership and told us that they are not interested in inheriting Diamond or Hilton timeshare. The lies we were told at each presentation were not stated in the sales contract.  They always referred to a presentation as an owner update which in reality was a sales pitch to pressure us into purchasing more points.  We believed what the salespeople told us at each presentation only to find out that most of what they were telling us was NOT TRUE! For the amount of money we have spent over the years, we could have had great vacations for a lot less by other means. We feel that the level of elder abuse is more than reason enough for Diamond Resorts, now Hilton Grand Vacation club, to cancel this contract.George and Celia Laputka

review_title: We went to a presentation in Phoenix‚Ä¶
review_text: We went to a presentation in Phoenix when they told us that they had information they would present to us on the Hilton merger.  We went to the meeting and a sales spent about 10 minutes talking about the merger and then moved into selling us additional points.  We received the same discussion from last March 2021, that they had tried to contact us on Hilton Max Pre Inventory Option and that we were unresponsive but they could maybe go back and still make us the same deal on points. They said that they sent it to us by registered mail.  They then followed normal procedure that as soon as we finally got them to understand that we didn't need any additional points, he said thanks and that another salesman would come over to finish things up and release us.   When other salesman came in, he almost immediately started to selling us another deal for buying additional points.  After about an hour he wore us down and I said ok.  I thought that I would have the normal 10 days to cancel.  He went through the contact with a small I Pad and we were ask to just hit the spot on the screen to sign it.  He was very good about going through each of the items.  At that time, I thought that we would have a period of time to think about what we were purchasing and then turn it down if we were not happy.  When I go home, I went through the contract and just above the last signature line, there was a sentence that there was not right of recession, cancellation, or refund as this was not a timeshare purchase.  Never once did the salesperson go over that statement while reviewing the contract.   I call Diamond Resort as soon as I was at home.  I talk to a representative who after explaining everything to him, said that he would send my complaint to appropriate people and somebody would call me back in 3 to 4 days.  I asked to talk to somebody in the contract group and he said that there was nobody available.  I received a call 4 days after.  A lady said that they had receive my complaint but there was nothing that they could do because I had signed the contract and it was my responsibility to know what I signed.  I told the lady that everything that I had to look at was the I pad that the salesman held in his hand.  There was nothing that I said would change her mind and asked if there was something else I wanted.  I said that I wanted to discuss it some more.  She then said no and again asked me if there was something else that I wanted.  I said that I wanted somebody to look at their process for selling member additional points. She said that I was responsible for reading the contract and again asked me if there was anything else I needed.STAY AWAY FROM DIAMOND RESORTS.  THEY DO NOT HAVE ANY LOYALITY TO THEIR CURRENT MEMBER OR TO OTHERS WHO MIGHT BUY IN.  I am not through with my complaints and I am going to the Better Business  Bureau with a complaint.  One last time stay away from Diamond Resorts.
scam scam scam

review_title: Overview of our stay at the Flamingo‚Ä¶
review_text: Overview of our stay at the Flamingo Beach Resort, St Maarten.We checked into our rooms hoping to get an ocean front room.  Very view people get ocean front room apparently.  We were put in the worst room up in the hillside Bldg 3 room.  We were they for a ten day stay.  First morning we woke up to water pouring out of the ceiling in the bedroom on the lock off side.  We used all the towels in both rooms to soak up the water on the floor.  It had already soaked the bed, clothes in closet and bathroom floor.  Also water dripping from the main kitchen ceiling, but not as bad.  I found a mop and bucket outside of our room and start to use it.  Water was coming in faster that we could mop up.  Then a jack hammer started in the unit above us.  Obviously there was a problem with the pipes, but they still put us in the room below.  We immediately went down to the front desk to speak with a supervisor and get another room.  We supposedly were speaking with a supervisor who told us ‚Äúno problem‚Äù just go back and pack our bags and he will send a bellman to move us to the new rooms.  After waiting 45 minutes for the bellman, we hiked (yes it is a hike) to the front office.  The ‚Äúsupervisor‚Äù we spoke with was not in and NO ONE knew anything about moving us to a new room.  Every time we went to the front desk, NO ONE knew anything about us.  How frustrating?  We had to wait for the ‚Äúsupervisor‚Äù to come back.  We waited all morning, still no room.  About 1pm we said we were going to get lunch and he said he would have a new room for us (you think they would have at the very least comped our lunch, but no).  After lunch, he gave us the keys to two new rooms and the keys did not work.  One again we hiked down to the office and he gave us new keys.  Went back to the new room and second set of keys would not work.  Knocked on the door and someone answered.  They had given out these rooms the day before.  How do they not know this.. We went down to the office once again and they still did not have a room for us.  We spent the first entire day of our vacation waiting for a poorly run front desk to find us rooms. After we finally got into our new rooms we went down to the beach about 5:00.  We had several beach chairs set up on the beach.  We were in the water and I looked up on the beach towards our chairs and some employee was taking them to lock up stating the beach was closing.  What in the world, 5:30pm 95 degrees outside and the beach is closing.  Then on the third day, my son realized he had left his expensive razor and other items in the bathroom in the room we had moved from.  We went down to the front office and they said they would check into it.  After a day we checked back with the front office and they had no idea what we were talking about.  They referred us to housekeeping.  Housekeeping referred us to security.  Security referred us to housekeeping and so on.  We spend other day trying to track down these items.  We just wanted whoever took them, to turn them back in.  They were never found..Then on our 7th day of our stay, all of our keys stopped working.  Mind you every time they gave us new keys on the first day they kept messing up the length of our stay.  I went down to the front desk again and she said I had to have all of the old keys to give me new keys.  How impossible is that?  So I can not get into my room because the rest of my party is out and about.   This was one of the worst vacations we have had in a long time.  Very disappointed in Diamond Resorts.  This is not a 4-star resort.  Would not even rate it a 1-star.  Was very disappointed in the way we were treated by the staff all around.  Not that this will matter to anyone, and I usually never say anything, but I had too.  I was so angry and frustrated with the whole vacation.  I never had any resolution to this so I will keep posting.Kathi C

review_title: I took a tour of the diamond resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: I took a tour of the diamond resorts program in Virginia Beach.It started off okay, with a question lurking in the back of my mind whether or not I was believed by my host.  Right from the start, my host said multiple times that he wanted to be sure that there was no pressure, as the FTC or Federal trade commission wanted to assure diamond resorts did not pressure anyone. So I listen to the plan, and it left me with questions that I needed to have answered from outside sources before I signed a contract. The man walked me downstairs and asked me to sit at the table where another woman came out who is apparently supposed to close the deal which I had not agreed to. The woman came over and she was rude on multiple levels. I told her truthfully that I needed to do some research for a day or two before I decided on signing a contract and at one point, she so rudely just snaps at me and I do mean snaps at me, how do you make a decision in life how do you even buy a shirt? She also just blatantly says to me when she asked me a question that I answered truthfully about   about where I stayed if I went somewhere that I'm a liar and no I don't do it. d it was a condescending acting like she knew anything about my life when she didn't kind of a way. y. She had one of those kinds of tones on multiple occasions during the conversation where she was just mad that I said I had to think over something that was going to cost me any amount of money and lock me into any kind of a contract. So she then goes and gets another guy who sits down with me and he offers me this, which I'm sure you're going to understand why this left me with a very bad feeling about this . So he tells me that he will only charge me $118 a month for 2 years and I'm locked in at that price for the duration with the company, earlier, my first host said that I could do five times per year some sort of 60 minute presentation which would waive all the maintenance fees and also at the end they would give me a $300 gift card every single time so I would end up with $1,500 and no maintenance fees each year. I was also going to go in at the silver level which is higher than the standard level and I was going to get  15,000 points.. sounds too good to be true because I'm being paid to actually sign on to  their program, right? Well the thing that had gotten to me, is that I had honestly said I needed time to think about whether or not it would be a good plan for me, and both this man and the very rude woman before and even my first host but he just had a little bit more decorum than the woman, they had a problem with it that I actually wanted to talk to other people and then come back and make a decision then. Talk about pressure.. if your company has a good product, you're not going to force your customer to make a decision in a 2-hour presentation that they cannot get out of. It's just       b a d business. And in fact, just to get out of there sooner, I even told the very rude woman as politely as I could that I was fine with forfeiting the gifts that have been offered to me to come do the presentation if I could just leave. So that's when she got up and went to talk to the other guy, who I politely explained why it was that I needed time to       think things over and he irritatedly although it was more polite  than the first woman, escorted me to the front desk. I was given an envelope with a MasterCard gift card in it and I asked if it had my $40 deposit that was required that they said that they would refund. The woman said no, that it was $100 gift card and they return the money to my credit card. I thanked her and left, but then I went to the parking garage I was instructed To park in?And that man told me they had nothing to do with diamond resorts and I owe $20. Well I did get the same woman to validate my parking, which she should have done from the start. And I didn't particularly want to go back into that building. and what have I done with  the free oh wait no it wasn't free the $300 vacation that they offered - which was basically a week-long stay in a hotel for $300? Nothing I ripped it up. I also broke the credit card in half and would love to post a picture of it because I didn't spend ai dime off of it. I don't care what you're selling, but if you treat a potential customer badly, particularly the kind of customer I am? I don't care what you offer me in the future, you're not going to get my business.

We are owners. Each time we vacation they call us for a sales meeting, though they hide it under the guise of an owners' update. High pressure sales. We've signed up to upgrade 6 times, and each time they reneged on something they promised. We actually bought the 7th time, because they promised us an exit option from homeowner dues. Wouldn't you know it, they said we did not sign up for the exit option. Duped again.
She was great...  I was able to move trip to later in the year!

Diamond resorts are first class.  They treat you with great respect.  All service personal are wonderful.  I will stay there again!

I realize they were just doing their job but when we said no I hoped that woud be the end of it and it was not - we ended up just not answering the telephone.    Lovely unit, uncomforable couch (the cushions kept moving forward), clean, lovely grounds.   Just a few things that were not perfect.   Pleasant and accommodating staff.  Great location.

review_text: We have visited two Diamond resorts. One in Brian Head Utah and the other outside Orlando Florida.  Neither was new but each met our expectations.  Each was clean, comfortable and efficient.  We look forward to our next vacation.

review_title: Beautiful Grande Villas Resort in Orlando, Florida!
review_text: My family and I (3 adults and 5 children -  two  3rd graders, one 4th grader, and two 6th graders) stayed at the Grande Villas Resort in Orlando, Florida for 7 nights.  We visited Disney, Universal Studios, Kennedy Space Center, and Sea World during the day and came back and swam in the heated outdoor pool at night.  Since the neighboring resort was also a Diamond property, the children also used there pool for the slides.  Beautiful suites (which had everything needed),  friendly and helpful staff!  We also liked how the resort was so close to all the attractions!  We plan to  return in the future.
Excellent accommodations and friendly staff.

My wife and I isn‚Äôt it Cabo Azul on a couples vacation three years in a row, the rooms we‚Äôre beautiful, we stayed in the same area where we can walk out my bedroom or living room And be  6 feet away from the pool. Overall great experience. Resort was quiet and very clean. Social distancing and mask were required and all respected this. Rooms are spacious. The only thing to be aware of is staff is not friendly. We even had a staff member ask us to open the door for them.

We arrived earlier than expected. The staff was welcoming and offered us use of the pool area while we waited. Our room was perfect. We loved having the windows open to feel the breeze come through. Every encounter with the staff was great. Beautiful seating areas throughout and a wonderful short walk to the beach. Perfect spot to see amazing  sunrises and sunsets. We look forward to returning.

review_title: It has been over 18 months since I‚Ä¶
review_text: It has been over 18 months since I stayed at the Diamond resort in central Las Vegas so I'm not sure why I have been asked for a review now. The apartment was very pleasant, say just short of 4 stars, and the location good. The a/c broke down in 40C (104F) temperature but was fixed the same day, unfortunately it was then so noisy that I couldn't sleep in the master bedroom. Having signed up for their membership I decided to withdraw; clearly they were not happy but fulfilled their cancellation commitments completely without any problems.

Our experience at Diamond Resort, Hawaii was fantastic.  Our stay was 10 days.  The level of professionalism, cleanliness and location where significant for us to have an enjoyable vacation.  The only exception, although small, was the lack of toilettes offered, specifically shampoo and conditioner.  The amount provided in the room was to last all 10 days.  Hardly think so.  When we asked for additional supply, the resort wanted to charge our account.  Not a chance of that happening.  We certainly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return to a Dimond Resort in the future.

review_title: One of the best hotels I have ever‚Ä¶
review_text: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Just plain beautiful. The hospitality from the staff was first class for sure. Complimenting the resort to the fullest. I will not see other hotels or resorts the same way ever again.

review_title: Very pleasent place to stay with‚Ä¶Diamond Resort at Orlando
review_text: Very pleasant place to stay with family,all accomodations clean and up to date with all hardware materials for use and clean.Staffs very competent and all the time available for any question or requirement.A lot of fun and commercial/foods/restauarants near the hotel.
User Friendly and Timely information that fits my interests and needs

review_title: During our presentation we were made to‚Ä¶
review_text: During our presentation we were made to think that we were paying our maintenance fees in advance for 10 years when actually it turned out that they were selling us 8,500 additional points.  This was discovered during the closing process,  Needless to say we stopped the process and left.  This is the second time we were baited and switched at closing.  This time we did not fall for it and left upset with the representatives and the process.  We will be reluctant to participate in another "Training" session.  This is the second time we have attended one and were feed a line to get us to purchase something that we can not use.  We have attempted to use our points several times only to find out that we are considered members now not owners. We were never told this when we purchased our first 7500 points and still do not understand the difference,  We do own 7500 points why are we not owners and considered members?
Fantastic service, clean, great food, amazing staff, well equipped apartments, comfortable beds, can‚Äôt wait to come back!

review_title: Our stay in Virginia Beach Ocean Resort‚Ä¶
review_text: Our stay in Virginia Beach Ocean Resort was memorable. Even during the covid-19 our world is experiencing. The staff were fantastic and Sophia went above and beyond, so very nice to meet her. Thank you so much to our Resort. Our presentation on the other hand was less than desirable.

I live in the Phoenix area and frequent Sedona often. I stay at several of the Diamond properties. While the location is amazing, the properties are not quiet as nice. A BIG issue is lack of internet. This is 2021 and everyone now needs to be connected. NO internet is a NO go. Most of the properties in Sedona are average and could use a refresh. I am a solo traveler and always ask for a quiet area of property, rarely do I get this which can put a big damper on my holiday when all I hear are screaming children and parties. I appreciate the kitchen and homey feel, safety, and proximity to the best hiking in the country.

This is a review for the Polo Towers Suites in Las Vegas. I spent a week there. I was given a large suite with a fully stock kitchen. Great if you want to do some light cooking, which I did. The unit was clean, with a great view, and the location was very central with easy parking in the basement. Definitely recommended.

The place was beautiful. Very clean the people that work there are great. We loved the place. I work on the screen door. I fixed it. I also fixed the hose to the washer. Sorry that‚Äôs what I do. I work for college. I‚Äôm a maintenance guy. When we return. I‚Äôll stay with you and your resort. Thank you Tom.

This is the Fourth time staying at Greenspring Resort in Williamsburg Virginia. The first was through Travelocity  with the last three as exchanges. Units have always been clean and well maintained. We have not used many of the onsite amenities due to the outside attractions that we enjoy (i.e. history).The staff is friendly and not extremely pushy on wanting us to attend one of their sales pitches (or whatever they call it here).Would not hesitate to stay again.

review_title: This reservation I believe you are‚Ä¶
review_text: This reservation I believe you are talking about was not for Kendra.  It was for Wayne and Marci Misch at Mystic Dunes in Kissimmee, Florida.  They were there from Saturday, Dec.25,2020 until Friday, Jan. 1,2021.Their feedback was that the unit was small compared to what our family is use to at our home resort, Liki Tiki, in Winter Garden, Florida.They checked out a day early to come home.I am Carole Green, the Diamond Resort owner, who used some of my points to book their reservation.  I don't know why the survey was sent in the name of "Kendra", my other daughter.  She did not travel with them.

review_title: We enjoy when we can use our time‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoy when we can use our time share, but we were not able to use recently.

review_title: I signed up for a package with you for‚Ä¶
review_text: I signed up for a package with you for a cruise and Resort stay. Because of COVID, I could not go anywhere and lost both deals as they were not taken within the time allowed.  Now your sales reps keep calling me fto buy another deal. Why would I ?  Already lost all the money I spent the first time !!!
Mostly everything about the resort was good. Maybe the restaurant left something to be desired.
Representatives are dishonest and lie to you.

review_title: Even During the Covid Restrictions, 1st Class Service
review_text: Even during this time of restrictions the staff was always polite and helpful. Check in was  a breeze and a smile was alway seen
To many and expensive fees Unkown until day of check in, fooled me once hopefully never again.

review_title: The fall before the global pandemic
review_text: The fall before the global pandemic, I had the pleasure of enjoying the Brian's Head ski resort with lovely restaurants, eclectic shops, and beautiful scenery.

review_title: The resort is great but reservations service over phone bad
review_text: The resort is great, but when we call to reserve something I got terrible experience with guy who knows nothing about work with customers. Screaming over the phone, so that kills the reputation even if the resort is great and promotions are good.
Really a great place & service!

review_title: What a horrible place to stay
review_text: What a horrible place to stay. Where do I begin? To check in and unload, you have to sit in line in the parking lot and wait for each car one at a time to check in. I sat in my car for 35 minutes. First come first serve limited parking at the property then you have to park in the other property parking lot a 1/2 mile away. In the lobby where the valet should be, because there is no valet, are sharks who try to sell you time share properties. The lobby and hallways are filthy. The one bedroom condo was filthy. I will say the maids were very kind and helpful unlike the people at the front desk who were rude and condescending.

This place was awesome.  It was a very nice condo our family of 5 stayed comfortably in easily! Friday night movie in the pool was great for our 10 year old. They do try to get you in a time share meeting, and they don't want to take no for an answer,  otherwise it was fantastic!

The site, the staff, the unit, everything was fantastic.  My husband is handicapped, in a wheelchair and everyone was very helpful and accommodating and provided resources and information to make our staff pleasant and less stressful
IGNORE TEXT
Excellent amenities  Beautiful location

review_title: We haven't stayed in a Diamond property‚Ä¶
review_text: We haven't stayed in a Diamond property recently, so we don't know why we've been sent this survey.
Great stay.  Wasn't allowed to roll over one unit due to COVID travel concerns.
Carla is the consummate professional. And the entire staff is just great.

review_title: Terrible Experience at The Daytona Beach Regency
review_text: We stayed at The Daytona Beach Regency by Diamond Resort on December 18-21 2020.  We arrived late the first night, and upon arriving the room smelled like smoke terribly.  I have asthma and allergies, so it made breathing unbearable.  I phoned the front desk to let them know and they said all rooms were booked, and sent maintenance up.  They changed the air filter and sprayed some cheap fragrance all over the carpet in an attempt to cover the smell.  It just made matters worse.  I phoned the front desk first thing in the morning and demanded that we be moved.  We were moved to another room, but that room wasn't the best smelling either.  It was better than the last, so we stayed.  Even the hallways had a stinky. moldy smell, and you could smell the cheap fragrance throughout.  Instead of replacing the carpets which desperately needs to be done, they keep spraying them to try and cover the smell.  Our room's carpet was also stained pretty bad.  There were things missing from the kitchen that have always been in every room of a Diamond Resort, and just general maintenance was lacking.  Our shower door was broken off the hinge, and my husband just went ahead and fixed it instead of us calling the front desk. The shower door would of been obviously visible when they cleaned the bathroom. I have always had a great experience at The Cove at Ormond Beach, and since it is practically down the street, I will always stay there, and will not go back to the Daytona Beach location.  I honestly was surprised that this was a Diamond Resort as they don't meet the Diamond standards I am use to.
We were in room 203, which was a bigger one (handicapped accessible). It was great! Comfiest sofa bed I've ever slept on, and the view was amazing.

review_title: We have always had a wonderful place to‚Ä¶
review_text: We have always had a wonderful place to stay when with the Diamond resorts and everyone is so friendly. The location, atmosphere, and accommodations are always top notch!  Love it!

review_title: Our story is not very pleasant
review_text: Our story is not very pleasant. We bought a package for 4 days and 3 nights. We were told that we could (if we wanted) get a $100 visa returned if  we attended a presentation. We just got off the phone with them and we were told the presentation is a MUST and if we do not attend we will be charged extra for our stay at check out. Also, we were NEVER TOLD when we got the package that we needed to bring a major credit card (to the presentation).. which at this point it sounds very sneaky to me. I am just putting this out here because we have no time to be playing their games. Also, how can they not offer online presentations during this pandemic. Plus, we DO NOT want anybody else to also be fooled by them. PLEASE BEWARE and READ EVERYTHING before signing and paying. We hope you are not another family or person that has to lose their money like we are now.

review_title: Great place to stay  Lots to do  Our‚Ä¶
review_text: Great place to stay  Lots to do  Our whole family of 8 was happy. We had 2- 2 bedroom villas. Something for everyone From the pools & water slides. To the restaurants & store. We'll go back if in the Orlando area. This is why you buy a timeshare. To get all the amenities & big comfortable place to stay.
We had such an amazing experience with Diamond Resort.  They were fantastic.  I have nothing negative to say.
Amazing friendly staff. Rooms were nice and clean. The property itself was well kept. Will definitely return.
Disappointingly, customer service with Diamond Resorts is usually consistently bad. It is probably one of the worst services. Unfortunately, we are stuck with this regretful purchase.

review_title: The cleanest place we‚Äôve stayed in
review_text: The cleanest place we‚Äôve stayed in. Definitely would like to stay there again!  We were very pleased.
It was fine.  I mean fine.

review_title: Went to branson and had a great time.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Staff tries to help, but we were sold a package we did not understand.

We are at Summer Bay and after checking in and unpacking into our room I found out that we are next door to another guest family. I mean front doors three feet apart with a common entryway I did not expect this to happen during the Covid-19 distancing. The resort has hundreds of rooms and at only 38% full I never expected this to happen. We are here for two weeks and did speak to the manager and she said we could move with no guarantee that someone would move in next door again. She did call back and said that she would block out this unit after these guest left which was consoling to us.I don't underhand the logic of this with so little occupancy overall. Again this is a trying time with this virus stuff going around and to place people on top of each other confuses me. To the managers credit she did try and work something out for us.

review_title: Love to be at Diamond Resort ‚ô•Ô∏è

review_title: DIRTY ROOMS TERRIBLE SERVICE. Never going back
review_text: Our first visit to Palm Spring Diamond resort was really relaxing and the pool was wonderful, BUT the carpet was filthy and I found a dirty dried up wash cloth in between the shower curtains.Our second trip was lousy. The stick is ( me & my daughter) in a handicapped room (even though we aren‚Äôt handicapped) and it was awful. There was a light that flashed everytime the phone rang or the doorbell rang and there was a tweaked out weirdo in the apartments that faced us. The guy was walking around his apt in the dark ( with a light behind him so we could still see him) and he kept looking out the window at us and picking up a bat in a threatening way. I told them to move us and it took until 4pm the next day! We then had to move all of our stuff to a different room and it wasted our whole day ( and we were leaving the next day!) It literally wasted our whole trip. I asked for a refund and they refused repeatedly. I got so sick of trying to get my money back that I finally gave up. They also have those stupid sales things and once you attend and tell them you are NIOT interested in buying in they are very rude and try to force you into buying in!We are never going back there!!! I would much rather go to Marriott and get excellent service then be treated like crap and pay for it!!!

review_title: Misleading and limited explanations of‚Ä¶useless investment
review_text: Misleading and limited explanations of what purchasing a Sampler Package entails and the closure of the Canada/US border had made this a poor and unusable package

review_title: I feel like the Diamond program is a‚Ä¶con
review_text: I feel like the Diamond program is a money pit.  I don‚Äôt like having to do the hard sales pitches.  In Hawaii the reps made me feel like I was an idiot for purchasing the plan I did.  They also explained how my fees are going to continue to rise every year.  In time of COVID19, fees should be waived.  We are not really able to travel!I don‚Äôt think any one will actually reach out to me regarding my feedback but it would go along way to building trust.  At this point, I feel like I am a sucker for purchasing Diamond Resorts.Paulette

review_title: Visited grande villas lake Buena vista‚Ä¶
review_text: Visited grande villas lake Buena vista Orlando twice in 2019 fantastic place
Beautiful place, very well looked after, very helpful staff, close to parks, outlets and markets. I have already stayed twice and I recommend it to all friends.

review_title: Beautiful welcome on check in very‚Ä¶
review_text: Beautiful welcome on check in very helpful friendly and professional. Resort itself was small but great value and great location resort close to Celebration which was a beautiful community to enjoy morning walks and a choice of good restaurants if looking to eat out.
Beautiful and well mainrained resort. Units are very spacious with everything you need for a fun vacation. Great location for most everything in central Florida. Staff always friendly and helpful!

Diamond Resorts are a heartless company! We were lied to by a representative. We did not realize this until we returned home and tried to use our points as outlined. Found out it was bogus info. Wanted to get out of our upsell, even willing to forgo some of the many 1000s that we paid. Got a flat refusal!

We loved the resort!! We stayed at the Grande Villas in lake Buena Vista The only downside was parking (should be assigned) often we would have to park far from our room! If the parking was assigned and reserved to rooms this would have made this much easier. The drinks at the pool bar were amazing and most people were friendly. There were some guests that were rude to us while smoking in the designated areas (which were poorly placed at the bottom of stairs for a bunch of rooms) it would make more sense in the parking lots away from where people walk. Definitely will return... if we are ever able to travel again.

review_title: We enjoyed our stay and we were just‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoyed our stay and we were just enough out of town. Beautiful location. Would go back!

I enjoyed my stays with Diamond Resort but I am utterly disappointed with the customer service or lack of customer service. Not one time since COVID-19 have I received one call or letter to even see if I was displaced or needed assistance. Also, I deleted my bank information ten months ago and they NEVER ceased drafting monthly from my account. I was given a free cruise and due to the pandemic I could not go on the cruise and I was offered nothing in return. To rate Diamond Resorts with 3 stars is being overly generous.

review_title: I paid extra for the room that‚Ä¶
review_text: I paid extra for the room that overlooked the beach. I was on the third floor but at least 4 out of 6 nights, the bar below (on the beach) had loud noisy late parties.The room required some renovations and painting. The beach was nice and the restaurants fair. A busy hotel due to time sharing.

review_title: We had a wonderful time at Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: We had a wonderful time at Diamond Resorts! We have been very happy everytime we have gone! They have wonderful customer service and it is very clean and well kept! We will come back!
excellent attention, very cozy rooms and everything one needs has it. Excellent place to spend with the family

review_title: My mum and dad have been members for‚Ä¶
review_text: My mum and dad have been members for over 10 years however decided to come out of it this year due to my dad being diagnosed with alzheimer's. When I called to explain the situation and ask if they could get any compensation for paying their maintenance fee for the year 2020. They weren't able to travel due to covid and paid around ¬£2,000. One woman was extremely rude and said covid was not their fault, which we completely understand however it does not condone them doing nothing. Like I said my parents have been loyal members and the way they got treated at the end was digusting! I think some companies have shown their true colours during this pandemic, diamond being one of them. Dont join you will regard it. ¬£2,000 they paid diamond for the year 2020 for nothing!

review_text: Since joining we have paid exorbitant amounts of money for nothing. The dues and amounts have only gone up. I would not recommend this time share to anyone and wish there was a way that we could get out of it

review_title: Solo vacation The customer service was amazing and‚Ä¶s
review_text: The customer service was amazing and the staff are very friendly. Great solo vacation for New Years. The only issue was the couple across the hall were arguing constantly in the hallway around 2:00 am
Excellent resort. We had a great room, the staff were brilliant and our holiday here was perfect. Cant wait to go back
This is a nice place and very convenient.  They do need to update the rooms. There were several things in our room that were broken and reported to the staff. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Powhatan Plantation by Diamond resort. Beautiful resort and great area to travel.   We stay here twice a year and would not hesitate to recommend or go again.  My only complaint is the beds are very hard, not as comfortable as they could be.  Staff is amazing and very accommodating.  The condo is clean and well kept.  The property is appropriate to the surrounding historical area.

review_title: Never got to go.Diamond never upheld‚Ä¶
review_text: Never got to go.Diamond never upheld their promises.

review_title: Everything they tell the customer is a‚Ä¶
review_text: Everything they tell the customer is a stretch of the truth.You don't have to join Diamond to stay at any of there proprieties.

review_title: Good stay overall but there were problems.
review_text: Really enjoyed our week's stay at the Modern Honolulu but we had a mishap with our HVAC unit smoking during the night. We called the desk multiple times and could not get anyone to come until the early morning hours. We were thankfully able to turn of the unit and open the window to clear the smoke enough to get some sleep. Thankfully they were able to fix it while we were out for the day exploring the island. We were not offered anything in recompense, not even a free drink or appetizer for our troubles. I would return because it's a very nice property.  Also caught one of the salesperson in a lie. He told me my points were not good in anything but the US collection but I was told something different when I bought my points. when I pointed that out, he didn't have a explanation. He changed the subject. Admittedly I didn't expect much less but it really irked me especially given there were protestors around the property all weekend talking about how Diamond is known for this sort of bad behavior in the time share industry.

review_title: Daytona Beach Regency is nice, but stay away from the Timeshare Sales Presentation!
review_text: We visited the Daytona Beach Regency in July/August of 2019.   While the hotel was nice and staff was great, the Timeshare Sales presentation were exactly as they have always been rumored to be - full of high pressure sales tactics and even a request to lie about the size of an "exchange" unit, with promises of extra points based on the lie.The advertisement for the DBR, on the Diamond Resorts page, contains misleading pictures with angles making it appear to be large and new, but in actuality, the picture shows a slice of the DBR pool and the oceanfront of the neighboring property.If you want a nice stay in Daytona Beach, the DBR is a nice place, just stay away from the Timeshare Sells presentation - no matter what they promise you in return.

review_title: We loved staying at your resort on Maui‚Ä¶
review_text: We loved staying at your resort on Maui - we would travel ther 2-3 times a year and your resort treated very well.

review_title: This is an amazing place to stay
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Average resorts and I find it difficult to schedule time

My family stayed at the Diamond resort Mystic Dunes in Orlando Florida. From the moment you pull into the resort we were in awe! The rooms were spacious and clean and the pools were amazing. Staff was super helpful also with any questions.
Lovely room, very pleasant and helpful staff.Would definitely recommend this resort to others!!Enjoyed the location, layout and pricing!

We were at an event and saw a booth offering a free cruise and golf in exchange for attending a 90-minute presentation.  We felt like this was a fair trade, so we decided to attend.  This began our terrible experiences with Diamond.  We were in that presentation for over 6 hours!   We left cold, hungry, and believing that this was a real estate investment, and the rental income would more than cover our ownership costs.  A month later, we started getting calls asking us to attend a ‚Äúnew owner orientation‚Äù.   Since we could not figure out the reservation system, we felt that this was a great way the get our questions answered.   This was just another sales presentation!  We were told that an upgrade would allow us to write this off as a second home; what a great benefit!  We only agreed to the update because we were told that they would help us refinance the purchase; yet the employees never called us at the scheduled time or ever returned our calls since then.  Be very careful, they lie!  This has cost us thousands of dollars!

review_title: We loved Liki Tiki in Orlando. The room was really clean and there was so much to.do! We will stay here every time we visit  Orlando!!
review_text: We loved Liki Tiki in Orlando

When we purchased points in 2000 we were told we could sell them back if we decided to leave.....THIS IS NOT TRUE!!!! As we are now Pensioners and struggle to pay the ever spiralling maintenance fees we cannot afford it. We have been told that we have to pay this year's fees, then a further 2 years maintenance fees to get out.....What happened to us selling them back???? Please, please be careful. We have never been able to book what we wanted and always ended up with separate rooms for our family.....normally the opposite side of the resort. Please do not waste your money!!!
Very professional polite staff. Are really accommodating.

review_title: Their Lake Tahoe resort is nice enough
review_text: Their Lake Tahoe resort is nice enough, but they managed to get me to sign up for one of "those" packages, where I gave them money upfront in exchange for the promise of a return of that money when I returned, stayed a few days, and listened to a sales pitch.  But when it came time to return, they put such unreasonable conditions on how I was to attend that sales pitch that we just stayed somewhere else for that vacation, and forfeited the money I had paid for the package.

We visited the Diamond Cancun Resort in Las Vegas in June.  Upon check-in, we were offered a three-day stay in exchange for a one-hour tour.   We felt like this was a reasonable exchange and decided to accept.  When we arrived, we told the sales rep that we were vacationing with our children and that they were alone in the room waiting for us so we could only spend the allocated one hour.  We also told him that we were not interested in making a purchase, but he was quick to assure us that there were amazing deals in place due to the pandemic.  We told him that our income had been severely impacted by the pandemic, yet the continued to push forward.  It was like he couldn‚Äôt hear us.  After saying no for hours, we finally relented, especially since we were told that there would be NO ADDITIONAL FEES after the price we were given.   Our children had been alone for over four hours and we were anxious to get back to them as well.  When we visited the Palm Canyon resort in August to attend an owners update, we learned about maintenance fees.  Since we were told that there were no additional fees, we asked to cancel the contract.  The employees laughed at us and told us that there was no way out!  Stay Away!

In 2018, my family visited Liki Tiki Village in Orlando.  Upon check-in we were directed to Member Services and were asked to attend a 1-hour sales presentation in exchange for a gift card.  We were in the sales center for hours, being pressured by their employees to make a purchase.  This took far longer than the one hour advertised, which left our son on the play area for an extended time.   We left that presentation feeling like we had made an investment in the future for our family.  When we tried to use points for a trip, we were sent to a ‚Äúmember update‚Äù which was really just another sales presentation.  We were told that an upgrade of our status would allow us to sell this membership if we ever wanted to no longer be owners.  Since that day, we have learned that everything they told us was a lie, we cannot sell this or even give it back, we were misled about maintenance fees, and the true value of our purchase was not disclosed.  This is not the type of company that I can recommend and I would be very wary of even speaking to their employees.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I have no idea what is going on
review_text: I have no idea what is going on. Everyone tells me something different. I paid money for special trips this year that has not been refunded. I don't know what I can do!!

review_title: Be Careful, misinformed from day one..
review_text: We were visiting Universal Studios in Florida when we were approached by Diamond employees and offered show tickets in exchange for listening to a presentation.  The presentation was more than 30 minutes from the hotel where we were staying, and the presentation took FAR longer than the 45 minutes were originally told.  The four different employees that we met with led us to believe that this was a fantastic investment and money-making opportunity, so we decided to purchase.   However, we were not given the opportunity to view the documents that we were signing or read the fine print.  To make matters worse, we were not even given copies to take home and read!  We received our signed copies a month after this meeting ‚Äì far beyond the five-day cancellation period!  This, on top of the misinformation we were told makes us wary of ever recommending this company to anyone.  Please be careful if you meet with them, they are not an ethical organization!

Extra firm mattress are not for me.  They can be firm, but at least have a pillow top.We reported a problem with laundry room door on Wednesday and they said someone would be right up.  It was not fixed until we called again on Saturday, just before checkout.

review_title: Waste of money...we do not feel we are‚Ä¶

review_text: Your sales process is a scam. Awful people

review_text: I love to travel,  but since this covid 19,   we have not been able to travel and now have to pay the end of the year maintenance fee.  We was told that as long as we used our points,  we shouldn't have to pay it,  but since the pandemic killed all of our travel plans, now we have a $6000 bill, and we don't know how we are going to pay it.  So this really stinks.
Location was in process of converting to a timeshare from hotel while we were there. Protesters out front, poor resort amenities and lack of cleanliness were evident throughout the property.
We were received like royalties. We really like our stay in Virginia Beach. The personel was friendly and polite.  We recommend Diamond resort without hesitation.Thank you for a very good time.

review_text: Wonderful staff and a beautiful setting in Waikiki!  The sunscreen and ice water were a nice touch as well as the beautiful patio around the pool.  Would stay here again in a flash - ok, after Covid!

I have stayed at several Diamond Resorts. My favorite resort is Liki Tiki Village, Winter Garden, Florida. Whenever I‚Äôve had a problem at the resort, they were quick to resolve it. The staff is very friendly and professional. Upon arrival the security staff makes you feel at home.
Great location & super clean lobby & room. Would recommend to my friends to stay at Polo Towers.
I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Amazing facilities, super clean and amazing staff culture.Highly recommend Diamond Resorts

Great facilities, convenient location but the best thing about this location is the staff. They put on a fabulous party at Halloween and even helped arrange international shipping for an item we left behind - a pet toy llama. They were so helpful, they will be our first choice when we return to Florida.
As always, awesome place.

review_title: The 3-bedroom condo was quite nice and‚Ä¶
review_text: The 3-bedroom condo was quite nice and well-stocked overall. The only recommendation is to have more toilet paper readily available!!

Clean, comfortable spacious room, great services, friendly staff. Perfect location, walking distance to the entertainments and restaurants. Had a great stay. I wanted to extend my stay, but it was already booked. I will definitely come back.

review_text: I enjoyed with my family our holiday there, but we had little problems. For example, we had found hair on the bathroom,  the air conditioning didn't work very well and we had looked at a cockroach in the living room.

review_text: Had booked them through hotels.com and even though I canceled due to the pandemic would not refund my $700 stay!

My wife and I recently visited Scottsdale, Az for an "after Thanksgiving" break.  We stayed at the Scottsdale Links resort.  The resort was nice, and all of the accommodations were in working order.  We typically goto Arizona to do Christmas shopping, and were able to accomplish this, sort of?  The staff, that we had contact with, were helpful, and professional. The weather was really nice, and warm. The resort is located in a great part of Scottsdale, and easy to access the 101, so travel was easy.  Overall we had a really great time.  I recommend this resort, and also the other Diamond Resorts property "Villa Mirage", which is located about 2 miles from this property.

I was a member some time ago and paid fees to join and my monthly payment.  However, one month was not deducted and I was not contacted and therefore based on the one month not being paid my membership was cancelled.  I attempted to contact the relevant department but there was no negotiation and they were not willing to reinstate the membership.  The service I received was very unprofessional and unpleasant.  Your service personal was not willing to escalate the issue nor negotiate in anyway.  I was forced to stand to lose hundreds of dollars I had already paid your company.
