review_title: The hotel was very nice but the‚Ä¶
review_text: The hotel was very nice but the pressure for buying condos was horrific!!  Never again and the people were ruuuuuuude!!!

Used the Orbit one apartments and I honestly can not find fault at anything. Staff were exceptional, condo was exceptional and location couldn‚Äôt be better .Can‚Äôt wait to return once the pandemic settles down

review_title: The resort overall was very nice
review_text: The resort overall was very nice. The staff was very helpful and courteous. However the Preview experience was very very disappointing. We were very forthcoming with our future plans for travel and current ownership with another vacation resort company. The sales staff was nice but very high pressure. When we explaned a second time our plan and current ownership the demeanor changed dramatically. The young sales person collected her purse and jeys and said goodbye and left us sitting with the manager. It was very off putting. Left us with a very disappointing experience.

review_title: The Marquee palm springs resort boasts‚Ä¶
review_text: The Marquee palm springs resort boasts huge suites with fully fitted kitchen, living rooms and large bathrooms.The grounds have a beautiful pool and hot tub, tennis courts and gym.Great location within walking distance of the main Palm Springs drag, restaurants and shops.Even when things were not perfect with things like TV and internet not working,  they worked with me to compensate me for my inconvenience. I highly recommend this resort for your Palm Springs getaway.

review_title: We first learned of Diamond when we‚Ä¶
review_text: We first learned of Diamond when we were approached by one of their employees while walking in downtown Las Vegas.  They offered free gifts in exchange for attending a short sales presentation, which we accepted.  We were told of all of the lavish vacations that we could take and all of celebrities that we would be able to vacation with. This seemed too good to be true, but we decided to purchase a sampler package to try it out.  Since that day we have upgraded multiple times as we were told that this was the only way to keep the investment that we had already made.   We were told multiple times that we could use our points for things like airfare ‚Äì which we learned later was untrue.   We feel that we were told lies constantly to manipulate us into making these purchases.  We wish we would have just walked away that first day!
Unexpected daily resort fee very disappointing. I wanted to leave and return home. I will never return to any Diamond Resort

review_title: I visited Diamond Resorts in Orlando fl‚Ä¶
review_text: I visited Diamond Resorts in Orlando fl in feb 2019.  Our apartment was fantastic.  There were activities we could participate in, the pools were fantastic.  All of the employees were very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable

Stayed at Liki Tiki/Diamond Resort in February 2020 (pre-pandemic).  There were 7-10 of us and we had three units for 3 days then two units for a week.  The front desk staff worked hard to assure all units were on ground floor and near each other.  There was easy access to the pool and hot tub. Units had everything we needed and they even brought some extra items for us.  Gang loved the big pool area where we could also dine.  Having great weather sure helped.

I called concerning my points that were taken from my account (5000 points). I was informed by the account agent they created a member appreciation account to save those points. Since its my account,  I would appreciate being told ahead of making account changes, what changes will be made.

review_title: We have ejoyed our stays at Diamond's‚Ä¶
review_text: We have ejoyed our stays at Diamond's Resorts for manny years.  Happy Holidays to all.  Fran & Jim

review_title: Every place we went was lovely
review_text: Every place we went was lovely. Our disapointment was we had to cancel our last week plus our last 2 nights at the place we were in back in march because of covid. We were told we would be able to rebook the week that had to be cancelled as we were told we needed to bb back to Canada immediately.
Perfect two bedroom unit, very clean and spacious. Had everything we needed. Easy quick access to the strip. So love the location. Free shuttle service was so handy. Top floor pool was awesome.

review_title: I originally owned a timeshare with‚Ä¶
review_text: I originally owned a timeshare with another company that was purchased by Diamond.  I was told by their sales reps that I needed to upgrade my membership to remain in their system or that I would lose all of the equity that I had accumulated.  I felt that I had no choice but to make a purchase with them.  Since that day, all I have had are problems, headaches, and higher fees.  I do not understand how this change has benefited me at all!  Every time I have tried to reach out and ask about the problems I have with things such as booking, I am just told that I need to upgrade and spend more money to correct the problem.  I have reached out to Diamond several times to correct this but they never respond. Do not buy anything from this company!

review_title: As we live in Australia we fine it‚Ä¶
review_text: As we live in Australia we fine it difficult to reach out to my people but when we have reach out everybody is extremely helpful.  I would like to pay a huge compliment to Cathryn ONeal from diamond dream Holiday department she went out of her way to assist us with any query we had and assisted us with out point system and cancellations due to COVID.  Thank you Cathryn you help is greatly appreciated.  Look forward to be able to travel again soon.
IGNORE TEXT
Beautiful resort, great amenities for kids and safe. Highly recommend it.

review_title: We came for a quiet respite and were‚Ä¶
review_text: We came for a quiet respite and were surrounded by noisy neighbors. Screaming kids, loud fighting, etc. Our building was filled with a team of sports families who were obviously here for a competition. I would think that members would not be put in the same building with renters. It was very unpleasant.

review_title: We enjoyed our stay at the Round House‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoyed our stay at the Round House PVC because the cabin was spotless, roomy, well equipped and comfy.  The staff were responsive, friendly, helpful, and available.It was a fun break from the ciy!!
Had a wonderful time. Clean and aesthetically pleasing. Lovely staff.
We loved diamond resorts. With covid, we just can't go back at this time. Would love to though.
This is a great place to stay and kept up very well and super clean. Would stay here again in an instant. Really great place with a great and friendly staff

Unusual stay with his time: upon arrival my family with 2 kids observed the guy in the garage smashing with his hands and kicking a car ( not sure his or someone‚Äôs else) with his girlfriend trying to stop him. My Kids are not used to such views and youngest was very disturbed. After check in, as we were on our way to our very not cheap suit we could smell marijuana on stairs. Another residents were loud and all over the place with security guy hiding in the office. We even thought it would be our last stay and this nice place turned to garbage. We could not go back home right away as we were after 15 hrs drive. However, next morning - Sunday, new people checked in and things were more calm and nice like as we had them in previous years. We come to the place every year, btw. Pool was available and nice, but jacuzzi was closed due to Covid. Another unpleasant thing that happened during our stay was suddenly beeping fire alarm in the middle of the night- firefighters confirmed there are no fire- it was electrical issue, but they could not locate the source and fix it for hours, again in the middle of the night. Needless to say us as other residents with little kids had not so good night. I also never saw promised by manager of the hotel discount for inconvenience of that night returned. We stayed in August and now in December- still no discount. Thank you.
Always premium costumer care and facilities.

Diamond Resorts was a very, vary nice place to spend our 30th wedding anniversary the crew from Diamond Resorts give us a warm welcoming and a pleasant stay...to the point that give us a complimentary champagne bottle with a nice warming card.. I strongly give them a 110% satisfaction and a super 10‚òÜ for all they did...sincerely Thank you from my wife and I‚ô§

review_title: We have stayed at the resort in Santa‚Ä¶
review_text: We have stayed at the resort in Santa Fe numerous times and it is always a pleasant experience

review_title: Our visits to Diamond Resorts are very‚Ä¶
review_text: Our visits to Diamond Resorts are very nice.  The people and staff are exceptional.  BUT, I do have to be honest about a few things.  We feel the units need upgraded.  The ones we have stayed at have furniture that is dilapidated and uncomfortable to sit in.   The carpets are stained and ragged in places.  The beds have always been high standard, which we are thankful for.The biggest problem we have is the exorbitant maintenance fees.  They are ridiculous!!!!  We are Platinum members and have invested A LOT of our money into Diamond.  The least Diamond could do is lower the fees for those who have invested this much money into your company already.  To be honest, we wish we could dissolve our timeshare and break free of all ties with Diamond.  We don't have the funds to constantly pay the out-of-reach maintenance fee each year.I do hope this falls into the hands of those who care enough to do something for us.

review_title: We visited from the UK to attend a‚Ä¶
review_text: We visited from the UK to attend a wedding on Lake Tahoe.  The entire experience was very positive and enjoyable.  The accommodation was excellent and your staff were very helpful and highly experienced. We hope to return to the US when this dreadful Covid is over.
was a great location-was clean. Room and bathrooms large. Pool rea was beautiful and all the people employed there were very friendly and helpful.
IGNORE TEXT

Room had exposed wires, door did not have the safety bar to latch when inside, the light would not work properly, the outlet plug by the sink was pushing into the wall and not safe to use, the walls were dirty and looked like stuff was splashed on them. Very disappointed in the lack of care put into this clarion hotel, we have stayed in clarions up and down the east coast and have never seen one with such low standards.
The property was very well kept and the room we stayed in was very well appointed.  Check in was quick and we were able to unpack and relax in no time.  Would definitely return.
We have always had a great experience and a beautiful resort wherever we we have stayed. Always courteous and friendly!

review_title: Stayed many times in Grande Villas
review_text: Stayed many times in Grande Villas. It was just what we wanted. Great location. Spotlessly clean. Great pools. Great staff, who were pleasant, helpful and efficient. Looking forward to staying there again, when the virus passes.

review_title: I was not able to use my free week and‚Ä¶
review_text: I was not able to use my free week and it expired and no attempt from you to help me resolve this. I understand COVID played a part,but you should offer an extension during these such  times. Your representatives acted like they could care less. If this is how you treat a potential owner I can‚Äôt imagine how you are once I buy a timeshare.  No thank you.

review_title: It was excellent nothing bad to say‚Ä¶
review_text: It was excellent nothing bad to say about it . I would definitely consider going back

review_title: The people I spoke with were very‚Ä¶
review_text: The people I spoke with were very polite and helpful.

Diamond Resorts has many ways to upsell you. They got another $10,000 out of us for something we already owned by telling us things that were not true. The best day was when we transitioned out. It's a shame we had to pay to get rid of something that was worthless. I will never, ever buy a timeshare again & I will warn everyone I know about Diamond's tactics.
Not impressed. Horrible communication. Refusing offers already bought .

Resort is very clean and quiet.  Had an issue with the door to the small back porch.  I called front desk and within hours it was fixed.  Only problem I could c is cob webs in the cathedral ceiling.  Other than that was emaculate.
Sadona, Az. One of the most beautiful places we have seen. The condo was one of the nices we have stayed at. The view was breathtaking.
IGNORE TEXT
Great location, and clubhouse. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were average, kitchens need upgrades

review_title: I wish I could get my money back we‚Ä¶
review_text: I wish I could get my money back we have had severe issues. So many other things we could spend our money on.

We finally succumbed to the very high-pressure sales team and bought a 15000 sampler package. Booked a 1 week stay in Maui and were very upset to find out we had to pay $300 up front which they say is refundable on arrival but still highly unusual - we have a number of other timeshares and book them all the time and never have to pay anything upfront with the promise of a refund.  Anyhow, once we use up our points, we'll be done with Diamond forever.

review_title: Have not had any success in making a‚Ä¶
review_text: Have not had any success in making a reservation!

review_title: We have stayed at 2 Diamond Resorts
review_text: We have stayed at 2 Diamond Resorts, both were great. I would have given 5 stars if hold time on phone calls were shorter. Way too long.
IGNORE TEXT
Very bad communication. Will not return emails and you need to call several times to get an answer from someone to make a decision.

review_title: We enjoyed our times in Santa Fe at Diamond Resorts
review_text: We have stayed at the Santa Fe facility for three consecutive summers, 2017, 2018 and 2019.  The apartment was clean and spacious.  The facility is within walking distance to the Plaza, and it is an easy commute to the opera. Had there been opera in 2020, we would have stayed again.

review_title: The first resort we stayed at was great‚Ä¶
review_text: The first resort we stayed at was great with friendly staff. We purchased a package & stayed in Gatlinburg. We went to a presentation & then purchased a sampler package. However all information was not fully presented to us. We mentioned numerous times how I had way more vacation time than my husband & would be traveling with someone other than him. We were never advised that this was something we had to together, until after the fact & it was to late. That seems like shady business practice to me! Lesson learnt!!

review_title: We love staying in Diamond Resorts
review_text: We love staying in Diamond Resorts.  Very nice accommodations!

review_title: We had such an amazing time
review_text: We had such an amazing time. There was always something to do for both adults and children. We were never bored. The resort was clean, up to date, and the staff was an absolute pleasure. Will be booking again!

The check in was easy and relatively fast. At first, I was told my unit was not ready. But, a call came giving an update of clean units and mine was ready!  The unit was clean and the location was near the trolley depot and Dollywood. We didn't use any of the amenities, but we looked at the indoor pool.It was clean and inviting.The only complaint was the people above us had a young child that ran stomping across the floors whenever they were there. Luckily, the child went to sleep before we did.

review_title: I feel that DRI does not value it's‚Ä¶
review_text: I feel that DRI does not value it's members. You've changed so many policies and taken away so many benefits of membership. Each time feels like a slap in my face. The last straw for me was losing Club Select. When I lost that I quit even going on Diamond's website to look for vacations. I now only use my points to trade on Interval International. Your new DEX system looks like just another way for you to rip off your members. I gave 2 stars because your phone operators are always friendly and try hard to do what I need.
Don't know why I got this 'review'.
We absolutely loved staying here!!! Any time we come back to the area we will definitely stay at the same place!

review_title: Was unable to use the free stay (s) due‚Ä¶
review_text: Was unable to use the free stay (s) due to see rating from my spouse at the time (who was also there when we looked into the time share). I was going through an extremely difficult time with the kids and I moving out of our home. I reached out to a representative but was given little information and just gave up on the vacation all together.
Everything was great. Epic vacation, one we will never forget.

Excellent facilities on site. Resort was immaculately clean and well presented and the room was extremely spacious for a family of 5 complete with all the amenities we required. Would certainly return without question.

review_title: The agent that helped on this occasionn was Excellent, but...
review_text: The agent that helped on this occasion was Excellent and very knowledgeable!  I could not expect anyone to be more helpful and understanding than she was.  I would give her a 5-STAR recommendation.  However, the Diamond Resorts organization as a whole is the reason for the 3-star (mediocre) rating. Reaching an agent that knows anything about what you are talking about or how to accomplish reservations is very rare and has been normally a bad experience.  In addition, the Destination Exchange "capability" is essentially worthless and a horrible experience.  An Owner can not count on getting any tier level at his home resort anywhere close to what we put in to the Exchange!!  Even the DRI Agents are completely frustrated with how the Exchange website doesn't work and works inconsistently.  Also, we have NEVER been happy with the DRI management of our resort.  The local resort management team is excellent, but they appear to get little or no assistance from management at the DRI Corporate level.  In addition, the DRI Board members on our resort HOAs don't care about owners, their desires, and our vacation experiences at the resort.  They only appear to care about raising maintenance fees and selling DRI products and services.  DRI needs to give our Board back to the Owners!

review_title: Tried to find out why a small credit‚Ä¶
review_text: Tried to find out why a small credit was posted on my account, before paying the annual fee. Absolutely no one had a clue nor were any explanations given for it .... only told your fee is due .... pay it. That's it.

Accommodations were great. Setting was wooded and pretty. Nice walking trail through property. Minor problem with TV in living room but taken care of promptly. Main complaint concerned those in unit above us. Constantly sounded like someone was running and jumping and about to come through the ceiling until late in the night.

review_title: Do NOT buy timeshare from Diamond Resorts
review_text: I am a retired CEO of a multi-million dollar company and have never encountered such a dishonest and misleading company. We own five other timeshare investments and only regret buying this one. This company should be investigating for fraud and misrepresentation. Do NOT buy from Diamond Resorts. Do buy a timeshare if you are able to properly use it. üòâ
Everything was great
Diamond resorts we beautiful and wouldn‚Äôt stY any where else
Greqt place. Clean and always freindly
Point system doesn't make sense. Vacation days are never available. Customer service is horrible.

review_title: Made our Lake Tahoe experience one of a‚Ä¶
review_text: Made our Lake Tahoe experience one of a kind

review_title: What do you want me to review
review_text: What do you want me to review? What is a diamond resort? In case you morons haven't noticed there is a pandemic going on, travel is not recommended, borders are closed and so on. I have not gone anywhere for over a year.
Fantastic place to enjoy with the family

review_title: Two failed attempts at solving my issue(s)
review_text: I called twice and attempted to speak with someone in the financial department. Neither call was transferred to the requested department. I will attempt to speak with someone in the financial department next week.

I wanted to change a reservation from one location to another because I learned that the resort I had scheduled had closed its indoor pool because of the COVID-19 virus.  The staff person was exceptionally helpful.  I was able to find a new location that fit my dates and had a pool that was open.  Wonderful! Saved our vacation.

review_title: I am very disappointed with this‚Ä¶
review_text: I am very disappointed with this company..They have cheated me in all the process, first they laid about how many weeks you can use for the money. Second you can‚Äôt go anywhere because they do t have any showings. 3rd I have been inquiring about an extension on my time as of now no answer yet.. please don‚Äôt buy they rip you off..

review_title: Disaster from day one to day seven!
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Parkway international resort in Florida is a home from home for us   so many friends and friendly faces. always enjoy staying there

I was dooped.  I was told one thing when I signed up and then it was entirely different when I visited the resort.  In fact, in one presentation, the presenter wrote, "We lied" 3 times on a page of paper, and then wouldn't give me piece of paper.  I will never deal with Diamond Resorts again.

The stay at Greensprings Vacation Resort was great. Staff was wonderful. Sat through the sales pitch for the vacation package was great. Only problem i had was trying to book the free 5 or 7 day vacation. All dates were blocked and it expired before I could use it. Never got a return phone call to help alleviate the problem.

review_title: Diamond has been terrible to us
review_text: Diamond has been terrible to us.  We had been owners of a different timeshare that was acquired by them.   They started to call us and tell us that we needed to come in for a meeting to discuss the changes.  When we did so, they told us that we would lose the entire prior purchase if we did not purchase a Gold-level membership with their company, lies.  We felt that we had no choice but to do so.  When we asked about a cancellation period, we were told that if we tried to cancel within the legal period to do so, we would be charged a six-figure amount in return, lies and illegal.  We have tried contacting them many times to get out, but they are not helpful.  We believe that they intentionally preyed upon us due to our age and do not want other seniors to get themselves into the same situation.

review_title: Our experience has been extremely horrible!!!
review_text: Our experience has been extremely horrible and we will let everyone know that they should not invest in this company. Customer service is extremely poor! The customer service is disrespectful: we‚Äôve been hung-up on, told we were stupid to believe the sales people and purchase a membership and the list goes on. We are a family of six, with young children, there are no rooms to accommodate our large family. We were told that there would be and becoming a member with Diamond is a better way to travel. We were promised a cruise when we first signed up and have yet to receive our vouchers. We were promised so many things, but it has yet to come to fruition. We were told by Jimmy Martinez that our maintenance ‚Äúfee rarely increases, and if it does it‚Äôs minimal, like $5.‚Äù Our first year it increased by $100. We received our maintenance fee bill one month early this year. Covid-19 occurred! I am disgusted that Diamond would send a bill. No one is traveling. We are not traveling, people are u employed. This asinine! A customer service rep called me trying to sell services three days ago. He told me that COVID-19 is not what everyone is making it out to be and that he had it for 36hours and he is completely healthy. He went further to say that we need to get out and enjoy life and not spend the rest of our lives locked in the house. This company has now reached the lowest of low!

review_title: Beware of ANY encounters with Diamond
review_text: Beware of ANY encounters with Diamond.  We have been in countless meetings with them over the years where their employees have told us that we would earn millions of dollars in equity when they became a public company.  At one point we tried to cancel our contract within the legal cancellation period we were denied.  When we have tried to discuss our concerns with their legal department, they never return our calls.  We are extremely concerned that our children will become responsible for this nightmare. Do not do business with this company.
We had a great time! Very clean! Great staff! Affordable!

review_title: I stayed at resort in Maui
review_text: I stayed at resort in Maui. It was such a great place that we actually had a hard time getting away to sight see. Like family, great experience!

review_title: My kids said it was the best vacation‚Ä¶
review_text: My kids said it was the best vacation ever!

review_title: Every booking we tried to make was‚Ä¶
review_text: Every booking we tried to make was UNAVAILABLE. We were not able to utilize one single point. A total loss. We have been lied to and misled..
Excellent customer service at the resorts
Worse timeshare. Rooms are never available when and where I want to go. I wish I could get out of it. Such a scam.

Our stay was very enjoyable, 1 br condo was clean and well equipped, check-in was quick and painless.  My only complaint is the communication on when the spas were going to be worked on.  Front desk did not seem to know the schedule.  This did not inconvience me too much as I started to check to make sure the spa was open before committing, and a spa was always available, but not just a walk away.  Maybe some kind of schedule of maintenace times upon arrival would help.  But all in all, we had a wonderful time, very nice resort!
Not very impressed with Diamond Resorts.  Have been to two of their resorts in Williamsburg. They have a lot of room for improvement.
IGNORE TEXT
Loved the exchange. Would do again.

review_title: Christie resort, the Motel 6 of ski resorts
review_text: I would compare the Christie resort to the Motel 6 of ski resorts.  The bed was rock hard, I haven't slept that poorly since the first night of boot camp.  The lobby was noisy at night.  The 3 level atrium promoted noise as people walked and talked loudly.  It had a feeling of being outside so I think people talked as if they were walking outside.  Couldn't sleep.  On the third day I asked for a different bed, all they could do was offer me an egg create mattress cover.  That helped a little bit.

review_title: Resorts are fine, Time Share sales are crooks!
review_text: I have found the resorts to be well run and the staff performs well.  The time share sales people are a bunch of liars, thieves, crooks and deplorable asses.

Stayed at numerous hotels throughout Orlando. We visit 2-4 times a year and love everything about Diamond Resorts EXCEPT the fact that there‚Äôs NO CEILING FANS in the 2nd-3rd bedroom. It gets so hot in there especially during the summer months that we‚Äôve actually had to buy a fan than leave it there bc we fly home. I‚Äôve voiced this concern several times the past couple years and still no ceiling fans. I think my maintenance fees could buy a fan or two, just saying. Other than that, we love all the resorts.

From the time I checked in curbside until the time I checked out electronically, this stay was nothing but exceptional!  The shuttle service to Bally's was a perfect place to start and reasonably spaced out through the day.  Facilities were clean and I was happy to have a suite at the very end of the hallway.  There were only a few times I could hear a group of children with rooms closer to the elevators.All in all, this was one of the best resorts that I've exchanged into.  Keep up the great work.

review_title: Our stay in the Marquis Villas Resort‚Ä¶
review_text: Our stay in the Marquis Villas Resort in Palm Springs was fine.  The staff were very nice, and the unit was pretty good.  Just older, but comfortable.  Needed a chest of drawers so I could unpack suitcase, but that's no big deal.

We added the sampler to our silver membership this year. We used it once to travel. We went to use it again and were treated poorly. One month before our plans to travel with reservations already made, we were billed $1200 for our trip. We were told this is due to the fact that we have not had the sampler for 6 months yet. This was never discussed upon purchase. Now we are paying for the sampler every month and unable to use it until the Spring. Our trip was cancelled.  It is bad business. The customer service when dealing with our sampler package is also abrasive. We aren‚Äôt happy and won‚Äôt purchase the sampler again when our current one expires.

review_title: I called to make a reservation for the west coast of florida
review_text: I called to make a reservation for the west coast of Florida in late Jan. After waiting on the phone the usual 20 to 25 minutes. I got a lady who was clueless. I should have hung up, but I did not want to experience the wait again. First she had terrible english. Second she did not know the difference between the west and east coast of Florida much less anything about Florida. She finally admitted that to me after I kept turning down Miami,Fort Lauderdale and Cocoa beach. Then she kept trying to give me Orlando. This was a terrible experience and I now know to either hang up or ask to be transferred next time. I still have to call back for a reservation. This is from an upset platimun member
Extremely wonderful accommodation and services throughout our week's stay!
IGNORE TEXT
Very good place, apartments very clean and good spaces, access very easy. Recommend and will come back in the a next opportunity.

review_title: It seems like never anything ever works‚Ä¶
review_text: It seems like never anything ever works out the way it is presented in sales presentation. The fees are higher, no availability. We had more opportunities when we had just a week than now as a Gold Member.  We are never able to book where we want to go. The website is useless, Wyndham and RCI are much better. When searching, it doesn‚Äôt matter how many months you go out in your search, all you get is no availability. Only time there are availability is inside 3 months!  What kind of vacationing planning is that?  I have called many times to vacation reps and get the same results.

review_title: Don‚Äôt do a Diamond Resort Time share‚Ä¶
review_text: Don‚Äôt do a Diamond Resort Time share presentation.  You will regret it.  Don‚Äôt get me wrong vacationing is GREAT.  Don‚Äôt fall into the pay in advance scheme.  Because then you‚Äôll pay to get out.  Not worth it.  I checked into the a Diamond resort and  expressed that I was not interested in doing a presentation.  I was assured that Diamond was no longer doing presentations do to COVID-19.  (LIE #1) Later on the way to contract I saws more than a dozen couples at presentation tables  with sales associates.  (LIE #2) I was told that I could see someone to help me save the points I was not able to use this year due to COVID and that is all they wanted to help owners with right now. (LIE #3) I agreed because I was also told that I would not be kept more than 45 minutes because of a new State Governor mandate.  (LIE #4) Then she wrote no more than one hour on my slip.  (LIE #5) It was very clear that I was lied to when I arrived at the appointed time and sat down.  I was kept for 5 & ¬Ω hours and was played on to purchase additional points.  I was caught up in the fear they presented and did everything he said out of fear.  Let me explain a bit of the 5 & 1/2 hours.  After disappearing for 20 minutes, the salesman returned to tell me that my account had been flagged because I failed to respond to a letter that had been mailed to me at the beginning of the year.  (LIE #6) I asked why the account was flagged and he explained that it is not normal for someone to not accept the invitation to save money.  (LIE #7) I was curious but very suspicious.  I should have left.They explained that Apollo sent out a letter pre COVID (Lie #9) informing owners that their maintenance fees would be going up 12.5 percent every year.  (Lie #10) He wasn‚Äôt supposed to tell me that Apollo purchased Diamond.  (LIE #11) Would I not have known about the Apollo purchase when the letter came, if I had received it?  Anyway, he told me that my maintenance fees would end up being over 120,000.00 dollars over the next 10 years.  WHAT!?  (LIE #12)  I explained that that was insane and that it would price people out of ownerships including me. Then he proceeded to threaten me and tell me that I was locked into my agreements and that if I tried to back out that a lean would be placed on my house and my credit wrecked.  (Truth #1?) So we spent the next hour talking about how that the purchase of Platinum for 90,000.00 dollars would eliminate all future maintenance fees for life including (LIE #13)  through legacy (LIE #14) as long as I used 29,000 points every year (LIE #15) and that those points would be credited to my account as credit towards full maintenance. (Lie #16) Thus eliminating my yearly maintenance.  (Lie #17) How is that possible I asked over and over and he explained that all Diamond wanted owners to do was go on vacation because they would spend money.  (I can‚Äôt believe I fell for this)I couldn‚Äôt find any about this on the paperwork I received.  Because of this I returned the next morning.   I questioned him again about the maintenance fee credits for life as part of going platinum and he again assured me that It was in fact there in writing and a very real part of the program. (Lie #17)  Before I went to contract, I was prepped on what to say and what not to say.  I was told not to mention the credits towards maintenance or that would raise the price of the program.  I was told to only say that I wanted additional points for benefits, and to go platinum.  (Now they are asking me to lie #18)There‚Äôs a lot more detail that includes additional lies and sales tactics used to place pressure and fear that I will not go onto.  Don‚Äôt fall for this trap.  I‚Äôve been taken for more than 120,000.

Very expensive. Limited options if you live in New England. You basically always need to fly somewhere to stay at some place decent. I've found their sales groups deceiving. I was convinced into buying more points because I was told that I could use my points like currency to book flights, hotels, etc thus offsetting the cost of vacations. Proving not to be the case.
Old but cleanGood servicesNeed more kitchen equipment for those that stay longer

review_title: Nice and safe place at a great location

review_title: Beautiful resort that went above and‚Ä¶
review_text: Beautiful resort that went above and beyond in sanitizing and keeping guests safe, social distancing.

Hotel staff are great, very friendly and helpful!! The hotel itself is a little older. Not many rooms with a view and we could hear people above us quite often. The roof is currently under construction so nothing fun up there. The location is perfect. Within a very short walk to the beach. Located next to multiple restaurants with great food. At the beginning(or end?) of Ocean Drive so it's not extremely loud and within a short walk from more of the party.

review_title: Person in financial department was very‚Ä¶
review_text: Person in financial department was very helpful and did a great job.  My complaint continues to be long wait times when you call.  This issue continues to be unacceptable.

review_title: We are spending a long time at the‚Ä¶
review_text: We are spending a long time at the condo that‚Äôs why isn‚Äôt very confortable but we have a place where to recline our heads
Diamonds website and vacation booking is much more complicated than RCI. I never can find a trip to a popular place without planning a year in advance. I'm really sorry that I bought into Diamond.

review_title: With thanks to our Embarc Ambassadors‚Ä¶
review_text: With thanks to our Embarc Ambassadors whether staff, administration or sales ~ we were left a message by the Site Mgr ‚ÄúWelcome Home‚Äù  ~ we felt very welcome and right at home! Love love love Sales staff  Vince, Michael & Shelley! See you all in May 2021!

review_title: Cory in Customer Service managed many‚Ä¶
review_text: Cory in Customer Service managed many angles of my situation.He found solutions to cancellations due to Covid-19, rescheduled reservations with improved accommodations (saving points)He also explained how purchasing the cancellation protection was good for 12 months including making reservations for 2022 when I make them during the current 12 mos.    Cory was most reassuring.  It was a pleasure to have his assistance.

review_title: I was put in a situation
review_text: I was put in a situation because of the COVD-19 virus where I was unable to take my scheduled trip. I spoke with an agent who was very kind, understanding  and helpful. I really appreciated how she and I worked together to solve my  issue.

review_title: The resort I bought into over 25 years‚Ä¶
review_text: The resort I bought into over 25 years ago was purchased by Diamond a couple years ago. I don‚Äôt have a real complaint more just things I liked before when it was Amber.1. With Amber I could select my room at my resort which was great since if my visit I was bringing my elderly Dad along I looked for rooms with less steps to climb and ones closer to elevators, with Diamond I can only choose the floor.2. With Amber my yearly time automatically converted to points unless I notified them, with Diamond they schedule me for the deeded week, which after 25 years owning I have never went at that time, now I have to call each year to get that changed before I can book anything.3. I was not pleased with the condition both inside and outside of the resort, but the GM who has been there the whole time I have own has told me they are in a process of getting the resort over time updated.I do still enjoy the friendly front desk, but I hate every time I go someone trying to sell me something else. I am happy for now with what I have and don‚Äôt want to spend any more. I have retired and moved away now so at some point I would be interested in letting go of my timeshare, hoping that is something they will allow me to do.
IGNORE TEXT

We have stayed at only 3 Diamond properties so far. In each case, the rooms have been less than top quality. Maybe because we are at a lower tier of membership or maybe, as was stated, " we haven't renovated those rooms yet".The Maui property was by far the nicest - probably influenced by the location.Right now with the travel restrictions, we cannot make use of our Diamond membership at all. Disappointing, but we are all in the same situation.

review_title: We could not take our planned vacation‚Ä¶
review_text: We could not take our planned vacation because my surgery was scheduled for that week. We tried to get it changed to two weeks prior but were not allowed because we didn't have cancellation insurance so we lost the points. Don't feel it was fair with the covid going on and having to have surgery too.

review_title: When we brought the Sampler we were‚Ä¶
review_text: When we brought the Sampler we were told we could used them at any Diamond Resort and we had 24 months to do it in, not true. We were owners with Amber at Sunrise Ridge for 20 years and never had a problem. We loved Sunrise Ridge because it was near the Smoky Mountains where we want to vacation. After Diamond took over we were told we had to buy into Diamond or were would only have the week we own and because of our age and health problems we transition as of August 3, 2020.                                                            We have 6481 points left on the Sampler contact and have been trying to make a reservation with 4 different Sampler employees and they tell us that because we have transition they can't make the reservation.  We paid for these points and should be able to use them.  We have a contact with Diamond for these points and if Diamonds doesn't let us book a reservation you are breaking the contact. In the contact we can buy additional points at 31 cents, if these points are worth 31 cents each you can send us $2,009.11 or let us book.           Harold and Bettye Coggin  615-388-5678

review_title: The facility was clean and well kept
review_text: The facility was clean and well kept! The staff was courteous and helpful!The only thing that made me angry was the amenities charge which we had to pay when we arrived! Because ther were absolutely no, I repeat no amenities!The pools were All closed except the outside pool which was about 65 degrees. The store, exercise facility, and every thing was closed!What exactly did I pay for?  I can assure you that I have access to other vacation sitesMr. Richard J. Spor
It was real good and we enjoyed it

review_title: Great except for the attack to get us‚Ä¶
review_text: Great except for the attack to get us in a sales  meeting on each visit regardless of what its called, such as an update! Not the way to treat long time shareholders who no longer need or want any more than we have. You need to do a better screening job on who gets this attention, but just make it available if we choose, not harassment.
This inquiry has been sent to the wrong email address! I‚Äôm not William!
The individual was helpful and answered my questions.

review_title: I‚Äôve been trying to get ahold of the‚Ä¶
review_text: I‚Äôve been trying to get ahold of the Corporate Office for days now, seems no one likes to answer the phone. No wonder why you cheat you patrons.
Under the current situation, it is hard to rate this experience o previous ones.  It's like ghost town now.  Hope things get back to normal soon.

review_title: Nice Resorts, BUT High Pressure Sales Pitch
review_text: I really like some of your resorts that I've been to on "Timeshare Exchange", thru RCI or GPX. EX: Point at Poipu, Ridge at Sedona and Kaanapali Beach Club? I think all are Diamond properties.However, while in Sedona, I went to a presentation at AulaBerge at Tlacapachi and received a high pressure sales pitch. It felt abusive and overwhelming. It actually affected my heart condition.I've been a timeshare owner since 1989 and this was way over the top! Since then...I have been bombarded with sales calls to come back. Which I decline.

review_title: Booking on line is cumbersome unless‚Ä¶
review_text: Booking on line is cumbersome unless you have a specific resort and timeframe in mind.  If we could add a feature that let's a user compare 3-5 resorts it would be helpful.  When booking more than one room we need to call to get that done- add a feature to book more than one room.

I purchased a sampler after having travelled to a few of Diamonds destinations with my sister. I had the good fortune of visiting Maui, Kauai and Honolulu. Excellent venues. I decided to invest with my sister rather than on my own. We have many plans once the pandemic subsides.  With her, I have taken a Mediterranean cruise, gone to Palm Springs, cabo San Lucas, Zihuatanejo, Daytona, Orlando, and Hawaii. Diamond is really excellent!

Everything was pretty much good,, i had a 2 year sampler, which I try to use to the best of my ability, I lost out somewhat, that's because I do not travel as much as I use too, but when I did t was all great. The workers at The Regency resort, in Dayton Beach Florida, were very patience kind, courteous, and helpful, such as Ms.Georgia.
We had a great room that was very comfortable. Location of hotel is perfect to Robson Street. Staff was excellent...plan to go back again.

Due to the loss of income we were forced to request a loan modification. The team at Diamond did an outstanding job in restructuring our loan with terms that would fit our reduced budget. As a result, we get to stay Diamond members and Stay Vacationed! A special thank you to Sybil Carter in the Modifications Department who guided us through the process and was there to answer questions and provide updates.

review_title: Very enjoyable holiday at vilar do golf‚Ä¶vilar do golf
review_text: Very enjoyable holiday at vilar do golf portugal
Great place to vacation.

review_title: We traveled last May (2019) to Sedona
review_text: We traveled in May 2019 to Sedona. Overall the location was very clean, and modern room. But customer service was average, though friendly. What really bothered us was the sales presentation we agreed to attend in exchange for a Sunday brunch. The presentation was the next day and we had been told this would be about a 1 hour breakfast meeting. When got there, there was no food and endured a very long sales presentation. We were told we could could to exchange points from another timeshare to join Diamond. After telling them that was the only way we could consider buying. When we explored this further we realized this was not accurate. That took almost 3 hours to get through. We told them then we not interested, we were told that was fine, but they had to have a second person us close. That took about 30 more minutes before we met with him. Then we found out this was just round two of another sales pitch. After about 45 minutes, now we had spent over 4 hours. We finally had to just be rude and walked out. We lost the better part of the day and had not eaten. We had planned to do a full day hike, but had to change our plans to a half day hike. The brunch was an average brunch and certainly not worth the 4 hours of aggravation we endured.This experience tainted our opinion of the resort, and Diamond. We will never consider buying into a Diamond Resort.

review_title: no help at all- totally unsatisfactory
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Too many lies from salespeople.  Unethical practices.  Extraordinarily high maintenance fees.

My wife & I have been trying to return our timeshare for over 2 years now. The first year we were told not to use the timeshare if we wanted to return it and to fill out the forms and wait on a response, for which we could have the pleasure of paying $1,000. We did as instructed, never received a response, & when we re-contacted Diamond, were told our timeshare was not eligible for return. So we paid a year of fees for which we got absolutely nothing. When we were asked if that time or payment could be rolled over for the next year, we were denied. When Diamond took over our timeshare, they listed it as every other year ownership. It was an ordeal to prove we had yearly ownership. Nothing has been pleasant in dealing with Diamond. I am one of those people like you see on the TV commercials, trapped in an unwanted timeshare. As a senior adult, this is appalling. On a fixed income, this is brutal. Diamond is a heartless corporation with enough strings and stipulation to keep a person stuck in a timeshare forever.
We have not yet been able to avail ourselves of the offer. COVID prevented us from going.
No special considerations established for the Covid situation, no extensions for not being able to travel this year. Cancellation policy was adjusted somewhat. Very disappointed.

review_title: Before covid19 we had a trip to Cuba‚Ä¶
review_text: Before covid19 we had a trip to Cuba canceled and things have gone down hill since then.I don't have an agent to converse with and no one have contacted me in a while.

review_title: We would not renew due to a few‚Ä¶
review_text: We would not renew due to a few reasons. We were very disappointed that we couldn't choose our rooms. We never received a room with a view of anything other than parking lots and streets. We were told it was because we were part of a sampler plan, but when talking to others we met who were platinum members, they had the same complaint. Too much money to not be able to pick views. Staff was always pleasant, rooms were subpar, nothing special about them. The Palm Springs resort hallways smelled terrible.

review_title: I only go to the Ridge on Sedona golf‚Ä¶
review_text: I only go to the Ridge on Sedona golf course in Sedona and I like it very much.

review_title: Chat function is time-consuming and useless
review_text: I used the chat function to have points added to my account when we upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom. Basically, we were charged twice for the same trip, 4 nights for a studio and 3 nights for a one bedroom. I have called 3 times to have the 3 unused nights at the studio refunded back.  I decided to use chat feature. It took an hour for a supervisor to say he'd see that it was taken care of in 72 hours. Long lapses between comments from Diamond, girl took 15 minutes to tell me my point balance when I could see it on screen and not the question I typed in. Useless process, call instead

review_title: The lack of maintenance brings this resort down
review_text: I will have to say my rating is 3 stars and not 2 stars only because I know how well the resort we stayed at can be and was at one time, (Ocean Beach Club, Virginia Beach). The maintenance and up keep of this resort needs to become a higher priority before if becomes a run down hotel with the only plus being it's right on the beach.  I hope in the upcoming years the maintenance and repairs to the accommodations will be maintained at a better standard.
Our experience a Diamond Resorts have been positive. However, the Resort Fees create an additional expense we do not experience at most other resorts.

Do not buy in! Diamond does not care about its consumers what so ever and is only concerned that they get your money. They will have you sit down with them persuaded by free money or a cruise and then they will lie to your face over and over. You will say no we can't afford that and yet they will continue to pressure you and present you with offer after offer. Then they will send other people over to try and get you to buy in. While they dont hold you at gunpoint or tie you to a chair, you will most definitely feel as though you'd just been held hostage. After hours you will sign almost anything just to get on with your vacation. I imagine you can just get up and leave but for an honest and respectful individual you feel like it'd be rude to get up or maybe you've always wanted to go on a cruise and this is your one chance. Just dont do it. It is not worth anything they offer.For the last 2 years or so my husband and I have felt mistreated and misled by diamond over and over again. I find it almost comical at this point when I get e-mails from Diamond warning people not to go to third party timeshare cancellation companies when it feels as though we are getting pushed in that direction by Diamond. We have gone on one actual trip since becoming members/owners in Diamond. I have spent hours on the phone trying to get in contact with cancellations in the spring of 2019 just to finally talk to someone about having it cancelled and she told me we would either have to sell it or if we waited a year there was a program where essentially it could be cancelled and Diamond wouldn't owe us anything and we wouldn't owe them anything. I did this after having several complications with Diamond. After waiting about a year I called Diamond and asked about this program and was sent to the sunrise ridge resort to what we thought was going to be a meeting to discuss our issues and the potential to get out of Diamond, but instead they tried to get us to buy more points and were being very deceptive about the whole situation. We then were completely mislead into getting a sampler, which after several months of trying to get it resolved, has finally been resolved.It seems that no one there understands that at this time I don't think we can even afford to continue paying for diamond. It continues to affect our quality of life and cause us undue stress. A little over a week ago we had a phone meeting with a customer service vice president who really did not act like she wanted to hear me out or just blatantly did not care we've had issues from the get go. She said I'm not refunding something after 2 years while we've been attempting this for the last 2 years. She said let me help you find a resolution and asked me where we wanted to go on vacation like that solves our problems. She was either trying to blame us or make us feel dumb for going to the last meeting. We weren't even asking for a refund, they can keep the money we've spent to go nowhere and cancel our membership. That is what we want. It's not as if our points wont be sold to some other individual who has no idea what they are signing up for. We feel as though Dimond is selling the idea of a vacation or ownership and not anything truly tangible.

review_title: Expensive but great for travel lovers!
review_text: We have been Diamond owners for two years now. We have really enjoyed our stays at the resorts, especially Cabo Azul. The customer service is very good, and Diamond employees will reach out to share marketing specials (Free stays!) fairly often.However, the timeshare is very expensive, and the financing Diamond offers has high interest rates. I would like to see more resorts in the Midwest because we cannot always afford to travel that far. Diamond is making progress in that regard by expanding the amount of resorts, especially through the Destination Exchange. The timeshare has allowed us to travel more. I would recommend Diamond if you love to travel and can afford the timeshare.

I'm not sure if that was the case or if it was a ploy to get us to attend the presentation.  Either way, I would have to seriously think twice before going to your resort again.  I don't like these tricks.As far as the Diamond Resort company.  They use hard sell tactics to the point that the person we talked to was bordering rude and insulting.

review_text: Hard sell and deception at every corner. Beware. Check them out on better business bureau and google. Not reputable.

review_title: Loved all aspects of the experience
review_text: Loved all aspects of the experience. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

review_title: Tried to get in touch about‚Ä¶

Kohl‚Äôs Ranch is one of the most peaceful and beautiful Diamond Resort Property‚Äôs I‚Äôve visited. There‚Äôs great hiking, fishing, golfing and total relaxation. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. ‚ù§Ô∏è

review_title: They don‚Äôt honor their commitments and don‚Äôt provide full information
review_text: We had bought the a sampler vacation package and were not given any information on how to use it, except a mini computer (with out the password).  So it took us a long time to get a hold of someone and finally were able to use half the points, before we were told the sampler period expired.  This organization is not to be trusted.

review_title: Extremely difficult to access the area‚Ä¶
review_text: Extremely difficult to access the area that allows us to look at hotel deals and discounts. We like to take short/ weekend type trips to areas of our choosing. Have yet to find that area of the web interface.

We love using the resorts and have been to several in Hawaii on three islands and Branson, Mo. as well as both Las Vegas locations.  They are always clean and comfortable and staff is usually quite accommodating.  Our only complaint is the sales time that‚Äôs often taken out of our vacation.

review_title: The last 2 times I was at the‚Ä¶
review_text: The last 2 times I was at the Williamsburg resort, it was quite disgusting. The rooms were dirty, guests smoking marijuana and nothing done. The police were at the front entrance. Seems the locals are taking over. I spend too much money with Diamond to experience this!

I can't use the services of diamond during the time frames I choose to use it. I cannot go to the places I want to go in a timeframe that I choose to use it. So it's pretty useless to me when I have to make my schedule around when you allow me to use it.

review_title: Have had great experiences at most of‚Ä¶
review_text: Have had great experiences at most of the locations, have been to Virginia Beach 2 times and were treated badly by the update/presentation personnel that we dealt with. The resorts have all been very courteous and respectful in all ways. Thanks.
I like the hotel

We have been extremely disappointed between what we were told when purchasing our timeshare compared to things that have happened.  I have still not resolved an issue that we had over two years ago and now we have new issues.  I would love just to get out of the timeshare altogether because we have had such a bad experience.

The resorts are nice BUT it is a very poor use of your money! Outrageous yearly assessment fees plus you have permanently lost tens  of thousands of dollars when you join the CLUB.Much better to just book the resorts online as usual.All these outfits should be criminally charge under the RICO racketeering laws!The sales agents will lie and lie to suit their purposes!

We have called Diamond Resorts Customer Service on more than 1 occasion for help with a booking & they have been super accommodating & helpful. We have traveled to Sedona, Las Vegas & Cabo San Jose. The only down side to being a member is the persistent pitch to take another timeshare presentation every time you travel to a Diamond Resorts destination.
We have not had any major issues at the places we have stayed. Our experience has been good overall.

Resorts are nice, we stayed last at the resort in Scottsdale, AZ.  Room and grounds were nice.  Went to a presentations and have been to quite a few in other resorts.  The first gentleman we talked with was nice, the second one not so much, the third man was an ASS, told me I was stupid and didn't know anything.  Was all I could do to not knock him on his ass

review_title: Your STUPID company marked me late on‚Ä¶Terrible Experience
review_text: Your STUPID company marked me late on my final payment after 2 years marring my credit for a very long time. Absolutely NO follow up after ending with over 8000 points to use. I am so pissed about this experience i could SPIT!!!!!
Very congenial and professionally determined.

review_title: I travelled to zihuatenao in January‚Ä¶
review_text: I travelled to zihuatenao in January and what a wonderful experience it was. The resort was beautiful and the holiday wasso relaxing.It is a place I would gladly go back to.Thank you
OK, middle of the road.
Excellent locations, spacious and well appointed accommodations and friendly staff sum up Diamond Resorts. We have visited New Mexico, Sedona and Phoenix, Az and just love it!

review_title: Always wonderful and the staff is‚Ä¶
review_text: Always wonderful and the staff is great.  Too many people to mention.  Thanks Cabo Azul for keeping us safe while have a great time.

review_title: Nice Properties, very poor for owners with constant benefit reductions
review_text: Diamond has some very nice properties, and we have stayed at many of them.Their big problem is that for owners (even Platinum owners like myself), we keep seeing a reduction of our benefits; Diamond has reduced or eliminated several of the promised benefits since we invested.  I would not recommend buying points, but if you can stay at a property you will probably find it nice.  Try to avoid all the bribes they offer you to attend a "presentation" or "update," as whatever they tell you about it upfront, it will be nothing more than a high-pressure sales pitch.
My room was very nice, big and roomy. I like the workout area, and our excursion to the Symphony was amazing! I love visiting my Timeshare.

review_title: Trips are nice and resorts are good
review_text: Trips are nice and resorts are good, very hard to reach on the phone, told to call back mid October to book flights. After 1 hour on hold am told to call back mid January to book flights, very frustrating and only reason eating not higher

review_title: We loved our stay at Desert paradise
review_text: We loved our stay at Desert paradise. There is no other place we would rather stay and come back year after year! Thanks for another nice stay.

Our last trip was to Ormond Beach and had a ball.  I don't give out 5's so a 4 will have to suffice.  We were told that we would have a beach front room but had a room that faced a wall and if one would crane their necks around the corner you would see the beach.  Regardless, we really enjoyed our stay.

review_title: Overall we enjoyed our vacation but the‚Ä¶
review_text: Overall we enjoyed our vacation but the pitch we were told we did not have to sit through and did which last almost 3 hours was HORRIBLE.  Very pushy and visibly upset when we did not want to buy in, after sending over several agents and giving the same no. They were disgusted with us, it became  laughable at how bad we were treated when they realized there would be no sale. Don‚Äôt waste you time or your money with diamond resorts
We LOVE Ocean Beach Club. Luxury Resort and very clean. Front Desk, Maintenance, and Housekeeping all first rate.
Staff was wonderful.  Plenty of beautiful gardens and activities.    We loved having a sauna in our condo.

review_title: We want a winter retreat and we where‚Ä¶
review_text: We want a winter retreat and we where able to use our points rather then cash!

review_title: There is no other resort I would‚Ä¶
review_text: There is no other resort I would Vacation  at! This is perfection! Amazing grounds and accommodations. They go above and beyond to make each and every guest feel valued and cared for!

review_title: We love our travel to Diamond‚Äôs‚Ä¶

review_title: The employees were not very helpful or‚Ä¶
review_text: The employees were not very helpful or the most engaging people. The accommodations were average at best. The location was good. There was no dresser to put in  clothes in one of the rooms. The toilet did not flush and needed to be flushed by taking the tank cover off. The pool bar closed for good while we were there. There were very few lounge chairs at the pool.

review_title: We lost our points and trips canceled‚Ä¶
review_text: We lost our points and trips canceled due to Covid without the ability to reschedule as we were out of time to use our points. We are super disappointed and will letting all know to stay away from Diamond. Thanks for nothing!!

review_title: We have loved all of the resorts we‚Ä¶
review_text: We have loved all of the resorts we have been to, the only complaint we have is when we go to a presentation we are pressured to add to our current plan.We have repeatedly told them that we are not interested in more points or upgrading.The people have lied to us over time and there‚Äôs not a lot of trust there.
