review_text: Very happy with our membership and the accommodations. The service with Embarc and Diamond is excellent.
Binnie was excellant.  He listened to our concerns

review_title: I always loved staying at Embarc Palm‚Ä¶our stay at ‚Äú
review_text: I always loved staying at Embarc Palm Desert except for this time. There were large groups who had reserved several rooms and the pools were always packed with adults no children. No social distancing and didn‚Äôt see anyone cleaning after so much use. They had ice chests, leaving towels on pool chairs.  Didn‚Äôt feel safe at all! If you are going to allow big groups than you should have a system like the Marriott. Not fair specially on the members. It looked low class. So sad to see that!! Please do not allow that to happen. Place restrictions. Thks
The associates were excellent. The fact that I cannot Trace a payment clearly taken by Diamond from my account, is quite frustrating.

Wonderful sales team! We worked with Eric Wilson who is a great guy and very helpful. The Club Combination turns out is not as easy as it sounded when we purchased but we'll figure it out.Was overall a great experience thanks to Eric
For me, Polynesian Islands Resort is the place to stay when I'm in the Orlando area. Clean, comfortable, spacious apartments in a well kept resort with lovely staff. Will be back a.s.a. possible.
Not helpful. Change of benefit structure which wasn't easy to understand so guess what, the consumer loses! No flexibility due to new program or even a willingness to discuss. too bad, I lose.

My daughter stayed for 7 nights at Embarc Vancouver.  Beautifully appointed rooms, ideal location in downtown near everything, great view - way better than a hotel room or AirBNG.  Customer service was top notch as mid-vacation she was able to easily upgrade from a studio to a one bedroom.
Beautiful location and service oriented resort even through Covid.

review_title: i‚Äôve been going to zih mexico  for years and‚Ä¶
review_text: i‚Äôve been going to zih for years and the bar  staff  are the greatest people!  The location is great and the weather consistently perfect . üëçüòé

Properties are inconsistent in their upkeep. When staying at Marriott, Hyatt, etc. I know I will have a certain level of quality but with Diamond I can not count on the same level. In addition I have had several bad experiences with timeshare presentations that I do not experience at other resorts.

review_title: I spoke to a representative yesterday‚Ä¶
review_text: I spoke to a representative yesterday to ask some questions I got all my answers promptly and professionally

review_title: Lovely Small Resort on the edge of the 30A
review_text: My wife bought into this time share so she can go to Sandestin for her birthday in mid-April. Mid-April in Ottawa is ugly; rain, wind, cold, no snow for skiing, no leaves on the trees.Mid-April in the Panhandle is beautiful. Sunny, mid 70's, often warm enough for swimming but too early for the tourist hordes.Seafood in the area is great. There's a restaurant area within easy walking distance of the resort that usually has live music every night.We usually rent real road bikes at Big Daddy's in Blue Mountain Beach.Watch videos on Youtube that relate to highway 30A and you'll get a very clear vision of this lovely part of the world.The resort is very nice BTW
Great rooms, great people, and great service,  all this made for a great stay

review_title: Almost  perfect just no transport to‚Ä¶
review_text: Almost  perfect just no transport to Tremblant village as they use to

I‚Äôm very disappointed and frustrated that Diamond Resorts are allowing to bank points for an extra year.   In the year of Covid this is disgusting.   My husband is 74 and diabetic.  I had heart surgery May 1, 2020.  We cannot travel.    We will be losing 160 points.   In my experience you are the only company not extending privileges for at least an extra year.  We are not happy at all

Disappointed. I wanted to find a place where I could buy points to use to travel anywhere in the world. After I purchased mine I was told that the ownership had changed to diamond and my points were basically worthless unless I wanted to spend another $300,000 buying enough to allow me to use than the way I wanted to. Which left me with a $25,000 purchaseThat felt wasted. Several things occurred to me. One‚Ä¶ I have been missed lead. Two‚Ä¶ That I could continue With my ownership and only have one place that I‚Äôd be interested in staying and that would not be in Canada because I own a home in Canada and don‚Äôt need a timeshare there but that this was not what I wanted. And three‚Ä¶ That it was going to cost me a lot of money every year to maintain this position. So‚Ä¶ It felt like I had been duped. Which is not a good feeling. Then when I realized I might be able to buy more points by finding another person like myself who wanted to ‚Äúdump them‚Äú, diamond made it very difficult for me to buy them from a private party constantly making me feel like I was being a criminal

review_title: The people at the Front desk and‚Ä¶
review_text: The people at the Front desk and exterior of the resort were loveky, however the maintenance and state of the rooms are in need of improvement. Broken closet door, bathroom door knob, kitchen blind, and coffee table.
As always, the accommodations were top-notch, the staff warm and helpful, and the local area spectacular!

review_title: Easy to use website for Palm Desert!
review_text: Easy to use website for Palm Desert reservation.

We are owners at Cabo Azul Resort in San Jose Del Cabo Mexico. This is the best resort in Diamond‚Äôs inventory. I recommend visiting this amazing property and enjoying all the nearby amenities; Golf, snorkeling, diving, fishing and many more.

review_title: The shower drain was being worked on‚Ä¶
review_text: The shower drain was being worked on when we arrived.  Later in the evening it wouldn't drain.  Ken called down and said we needed it fixed the next day.  We were gone all day and they fixed it right the second time.  Drains should be checked routinely to make sure they drain.  Don't wait for a complaint.  House-keeping can check them once a week or so and let engineering know if they can't hear the water draining.  Everything else was good.
I had the worst experience purchasing your sample package. Definitely not being a permanent member.

The amount of time spent with aggressive salespeople is just too much.  Taking a day out of every vacation to spend with a salesperson was not explained clearly. I‚Äôve already paid for this product.  Then to be told every time that we were given a bad deal by the previous salesperson is just mind boggling.  Paying $900 a year in maintenance fees for basically 4 nights a year has proven to be a very bad idea.

review_title: I had a problem With my reservation
review_text: I had a problem With my reservation,  I talked to someone at customer service and my problem was solved way above my expectations!!!  Amazing service!
This particular salesperson was friendly and not pushy.  That technique would never work with me.  When she knew I had no need for anything at this time, that was it.

review_title: Always enjoy our stay in any Embarc‚Ä¶
review_text: Always enjoy our stay in any Embarc resorts.  Beautiful accomodations, friendly staff, in beautiful locations.

review_title: Great time and the kids enjoyed it.
review_text: Great time and the kids enjoyed the pool and the beach. Great golf time also. We come here every year for over six years.

Terri was very nice. He listened to us and seemed genuine. He was more attentive to our opinions and thoughts regarding our past experiences. It is encouraging that Diamond is acknowledging that not all owners children want to inherit timeshares and hopefully can give assistance if/when owners need to sell. Also, Terri stated that we now need to contact him regarding our account. He has been responsive to our emails so far and hopefully this continues. I believe all Diamond owners should have an account manager and if that person moves on another experienced person should be assigned.

review_title: I have always enjoyed the Ridge
review_text: I have always enjoyed the RidgeIt now belong to HolidayInn club.

I used the One Star, since there wasn't a choice that fit my response.  Our stay was canceled with you this past summer in July due to the COVID-19.So we did not stay there this year.I would suggest that if this is an automative survey, that you would have a response that says, "UNABLE TO STAY THIS TIME."Thanks,

review_title: Never give 5 stars but this is as close‚Ä¶
review_text: Never give 5 stars but this is as close as I would come. The staff were great and made sure not to put us in any danger of infection, we did the same. The unit was cleaned and precautions like single-serve salt and pepper dispensers showed that our health and safety were important. Recommend Tremblant at any time as the village and towns nearby are great to visit and have some good restaurants

review_title: I enjoyed my most recent stay at Orbit‚Ä¶
review_text: I enjoyed my most recent stay at Orbit One Villas.  I was able to check in early and get directly to my room.  This made me feel good because of the pandemic.  I was given a "care package" with such things as masks and hand sanitizers-very helpful.  Staff was friendly and helpful as needed.  Resort was very clean and safe.   It is very close to Disney as well as access to 192 which has about everything you could need available to you. I would definitely stay there again!!

review_title: Great place to get away from winter
review_text: Great place to get away from winter. The golf course was great again after the construction around it was finished, and the villa was very nice and comfortable and the grounds were very nice and very clean. Good times. The restaurant upped their game too, and was better than before.

review_title: If all the resorts had the same‚Ä¶
review_text: If all the resorts had the same standards I would rate it higher. If all the employees had your best interest in mind I would rate it higher. We have been told so many different stories from different people its hard to know who to trust. Get everything in writing, have all calls recorded and keep an eye in your points and fees.

review_title: Diamond Resorts' outstanding staff - they go the extra mile!
review_text: 2020 has been a challenging year, to say the least, and it is in the tough times that the true measure of individuals and organizations can be taken.  One is happy to share highest praise of the Diamond Resorts organization in the time of Covid, particularly the outstanding, caring and mission-focused staff of Alhambra at Poinciana in Osceola County, FL. As the entire nation, and indeed world, was upended by mid-March, under the leadership of A @P Manager Sarah W., supported by Meaghan her Asst. Manager, office staff Isa and Nicky, housemen/maintenance Christian and Julio, and security staff, all worked hard and with success to maintain their hospitality and safety mission with professionalism, caring and guest service until the last guest had departed safely. (Diamond Resorts also provided lodging for first line medical staff during that early, scary time, an act of corporate good citizenship of which many may not be aware.)  In a time when, generally, too many are quick to criticize and too slow to defend, thank and highlight preferred companies and their hardworking employees, I am happy to give deserved praise to Diamond Resorts and its Alhambra @ Poinciana outstanding staff who go the extra mile.  One was truly overwhelmed in March by the uncertainties created by the virus, and DR's staff went the extra mile to make it all work out for myself and all their other guests.  If Diamond Resorts performs so commendably in times of extreme stress, imagine how well they will continue to deliver when more normal times have returned!  Diamond Resorts provides well-stocked, well-maintained, very clean properties with great staffing, imho, and of the several choices in their hospitality category, in my experience they deserve your business and support.  Sincere thanks to all from "The Lady in the Hat, MR"

Left messages asking about when our week was. Never called back. Sent emails inquiry‚Äî no response. Now we missed our week and they don‚Äôt care. Awful. First timer we have been treated badly so not sure what‚Äôs changed. Cannot recommend Diamond Resorts with such poor customer service.
abcdefgh fffff
Great place to stay. Wonderful facilities. Staff treat you like family.

review_title: Just difficult sometimes to get the right location
review_text: Just difficult sometimes to get the locations I prefer.  Otherwise everything is great.

review_title: We stayed at Rangeley Lakes Resort‚Ä¶
review_text: We stayed at Rangeley Lakes Resort which was wonderful.  It is great that this is a pet friendly property.

review_title: We have had little to do with Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: We have had little to do with Diamond Resorts since it took over Embarc so Unable to comment

Horrible company and horrible people. They have repeatedly refused to refund the money we paid for a trip to their Palm Springs resort. The booking was initially a non-refundable booking. This is an annual trip we take with friends and our kids. However, a few weeks before the trip in early July the state of CA announced limitations to indoor dining/etc and the resort announced that their indoor restaurants and other activities would be closed. They also announced that their pool (the only real reason to visit this resort) would be limited to 60-90 mins per day per group. There is no reason to visit a resort in the desert in the summer if you can't be in the pool all day. So we asked to cancel due to Covid restrictions. We explained we all have young kids and couldn't subject them to being stuck in a hotel room for 22-23hrs per day. They have refused. We explained that our jobs and income were effected by Covid. They still refused a refund.Horrible company. Horrible people. I will make sure to review them on every site possible and I truly hope you and your party consider traveling anywhere else. Diamond Resorts does not deserve the business or anyone's money.They're crooks. In the middle of a pandemic. Shame on you!s

review_title: Great vacation flexibility, but a less-than-honest sales force
review_text: While Diamond Resorts provides very flexible point usage and vacation options, it has also been less than truthful from a sales perspective. Our initial "Sampler" purchase was a disaster because we were unable to use the points for the sole purpose that we purchased them (our daughter's honeymoon), even these plans were discussed with the sales rep (and she agreed would work fine). We then gave Diamond a 2nd chance and bought again.  We eventually upgraded again, purchasing the "Club Combinations" feature to merge our Hyatt Residence Club weeks into Diamond upon request.  However, we later found out that Hyatt does not honor Club Combo - something that we were never told before that purchase.  Diamond is in great need of an honest and ethical sales force.

review_title: We recently tried to book a vacation in‚Ä¶
review_text: We recently tried to book a vacation in Hawaii however we not able to book the dates we preferred. So the next available time available was July 14.  We like May. No avat until July 14. Called Costco travel was able to book a trip with Costco at a diamond resort in May with an ocean view. Called diamond back canceled our vacation with them went eith Costco travel.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Stop with the ‚Äúreviews‚Äù where you are‚Ä¶
review_text: Stop with the ‚Äúreviews‚Äù where you are pressured by multiple people to buy more points !   It is a sickening interaction and remains the most negative part of the vacation

review_title: Never was enrolled in Diamond Exchange‚Ä¶
review_text: Never was enrolled in Diamond Exchange per my request in April for my 2 weeks. Now they want me to give up my 2 bedrooms in Maui for a 1 bedroom and split it. I want the 2 bedroom Penthouse for 2 weeks starting on December 4th and waive any fees or 2 1 bedroom ocean view  My son  needs a full quern or King  bed due to his neuropathy not a sleeper or rollaway due to low vision at night.He needs his own bathroom with seperate walkin shower and deep tub. Please call us and have Mr.Fladkey follow yp. We need to book our airfare and hope Diamond can cover any extra incidentials for First Class if the fare goes up. You treat Plat members better and we feel left in the cold especially with COVID our MF would go down the drain as a 2 bedroom for a 1 s a doengrade and we want to stay in Kanapali. Unless you want to pay for a 2 bedoom Ritz Carlton in Kapalua . We do not want to stay in Kihei.

We stayed at Whistler Embarc and sincerely enjoyed our stay. Very impressed with the COVID protocols throughout the facility. Normally we would have avoided the pool but the quality standards in place to ensure sanitization, limited people and social distancing made us comfortable to lounge by the pool. The staff were helpful as usual to explain hiking trails and other activities. The room was clean and the kitchen was well stocked with cooking pans, plates and utensils. Only one issue was the air conditioner on the deck was quite noisy as it kicked in and out of service.

I bought one of your preview packages. You closed the office .I was unable to schedule a stay since NO ONE would answer the phone. I was put on hold a few times only to hung up one after 20 to 30 minutes. No one would respond to my emails.  If this is how you treat your customers  I could not recommend Diamond to anyone. I would like my money back $149 but am sure that is lost.

review_title: We placed 4 calls last 30 days for our‚Ä¶
review_text: We placed 4 calls last 30 days for our Dream vacation week and never receive N call back.

Resort was great. Dishwasher broken and could not b fixed till after we left. Shower in master small, Any other problems corrected. Location in downtown area very congested to get to resort area. Car show took place on arrival we were not familiar with caused major traffic jams. Took us 2 1/2 hours to go 12 miles. After weekend over it was okay to get around area except in Gatlinburg was terrible everyday. Resort close to many things.
Value for the $. Quality resorts.

review_title: Wish we had never gotten this
review_text: Wish we had never gotten this. Maintenance fees keep going up and we were lied to during presentations. You can never get a room when you want it. We were told you can transition this back if all is paid and maintenance fees paid but I‚Äôve read over and over that this doesn‚Äôt happen. If I could rate a zero I would.
Don't buy. All of their owner updates are hard sales presentations. Their best resorts are also available to the public at a cheaper rate.

review_title: Resort was nice except for most‚Ä¶
review_text: Resort was nice except for most amenities being closed due to Covid. I was told that the resort fees would be waved from the concierge desk but was not. When I called they said the $150 gift for attending 3 hour long presentation was for resort fees but my understanding is that would be separate gift and was not explained that way by Rebecca at concierge desk. Normally after going through gruelling presentation that is separate gift for listening to what is being sold.
Not getting my money‚Äôs worth. Told lies when I was sold. I was conned and cannot afford what I pay.     No concessions offered for Covid...
Small cramped rooms.  Average resort amenities. Good locations. Aggressive timeshare promoters.  Rooms clean.  Grounds OK.

We went to Panorama. It was beautiful but there was only one restaurant open, no stores, and everything was shut down for the season. Why would you even take bookings then?Also, there was no cleaning whatsoever while we were there, except for what we did ourselves. There was tons of dust everywhere, definitely not clean when we arrived. I don‚Äôt see why staff couldn‚Äôt have come in once a week while we were out.We had issues with the kitchen tap dripping incessantly, and called for it to be fixed twice.The movies in the Embarc Suite could be updated. Since nothing was open, and there was tons of smoke from the Oregon/Washington fires we stayed inside a LOT.This trip was quite disappointing and we ended up heading home several days early. The only great things that happened were the excellent paddle boarding at the Columbia River and Lillian Lake, as well as the Valley Trail. We brought our own gear along, thank goodness.I think to improve things, you need to be clear online that the season ends at the end of August. We wouldn‚Äôt have booked in September had we known.

Good reservation service but we didn't have the chance of using it due to the Corona virus, we had to return home early.Of course we got our reservation postpone till April 2021 but for moment only God knows when we will be able to use it because of Covid-19.We renew our membership in mai 2020 and we were suppose to receive a bonus week which we did not receive yet. So we gave only a 3 star because the reservation service is good but the compensation is poor. We feel that if we did not consume our reservation week we should be refunded our points and reservation fees. Thank you for your attention.

review_title: Staff was very helpful and attentive
review_text: Staff was very helpful and attentiveRoom was impeccable thoroughly enjoyed this experience

Our group of 6 cyclists and our supporters biked 160 kms to the resort at Blue Mountain.  We were warmly welcomed and relaxed in the hot tub and on the porches before walking into the Village for dinner.  The next morning we felt well rested for our ride back home.
Struggling use points in this new normal of restricted travel.  Very limited options when unable to fly internationally and limited response from the service centre.

review_title: Much has improved from prior visits as‚Ä¶
review_text: Much has improved from prior visits as I was a little concerned if my requests at time of booking would be met . . .   I got the room I requested :-)   I got the supplies I requested :-)   This time, ALL appliances were working :-)   Great covid-19 safety, sanitation supplies, saw janitors cleaning elevators :-)
We all had s great time. One issue I meant to voice  while I was there is the hot tubs. Drains were not being emptied and grime around the top of hot tub.
Excellent resort!!! Employees all very friendly... well maintained property!!üòÑüòÑüòÑ

review_title: My wife and I were reluctant to travel‚Ä¶
review_text: My wife and I were reluctant to travel to our time share in Virginia Beach. The same restrictions were there as well as our home state. Being under quarantine also did not suit or plans for a vacation.Reluctantly we decided to stay home this summer. We called Diamond Resorts for options. A friendly vacation counselor told us about the choices we were able to make. We decided to enter our week into the rental pool and hope that maybe locals who did not have to travel would occupy the facility and help offset the yearly maintenance fee.Well that happened to our satisfaction. We thank Diamond Resorts for helping us decide this outcome.

Absolutely disgusting customer service. I‚Äôve been waiting to hear back about my ‚Äúcovid delay‚Äù since the beginning of covid. All I get is the ‚Äúwe will get back to you in 48 hours message‚Äù. What a joke. Not one rep has contacted me at all. Bunch of thieves.

I‚Äôve attended several ‚Äúmember updates‚Äù where Diamond offers ‚Äúfree‚Äù night(s) vacations just for attending, when afterwards I find them not to be free  and not able to find any vacancy space to use the offer. It seems I have to talk to several different Diamond staff members to get answers to my questions.

Room was not cleaned well, presentation was somewhat helpful but failed to give us the package of benefits she promised.  Remodeling was ongoing and elevator was out for most of stay.  Reduction in housekeeping services was not helpful and charging for fresh towels was really not justified.  Also, getting room on first floor was less than desirable considering we have been owners for at least 15 years when I see Embarc all over the internet for non-members.  Paying extra points for Bayview room not justified for first floor room.  No view except for concrete wall with rust stains.  Really should get refund of some points for this room.

I booked a 4 day, 3 night stay with Diamond Resorts international one month ago against my better judgement. I told the salesman, ‚Äúit‚Äôs not worth buying a package because I‚Äôll never find good dates available at your resorts,‚Äù and he responded, (direct quote) ‚Äúas long as you don‚Äôt call our Las Vegas location on December 20th to book a trip for New Years, you will always get a spot even at our most popular destinations. As long as you book a month or so ahead of time, we always have availability - no black out dates.‚Äù After that my wife and I talked with a couple of friends and planned to book a trip less than one month after securing the vacation package. On September 27th, (more than 3 month of advanced timing) I reached out to our travel agent to book a trip to Las Vegas (where diamond resorts owns 3 resorts) for New Years And was told that they had no availability. Diamond Resorts owns resorts in Las Vegas, yet not one available unit with 3 months of advanced notice. When I complained at the agent because of their false promises, he didn‚Äôt seem to care - no options to get my money back or cancel this package based on false promises.Then when I asked if they could tell me which resorts were available on New Years so I could consult with my wife about other locations, he let me know that‚Äôs not how it works and that we have to pick the location and then he can check - seems to be a stupid process and it has left me looking foolish to my wife and our friends because I got all of our hopes up for a Vegas New Years trip.I won‚Äôt be using this service again. More than 3 months of advance notice in a location where they own 3 resorts and they couldn‚Äôt come through for me. I don‚Äôt think they will ever come through unless I book inconvenient dates at empty locations. Thanks for nothing Diamond Resorts International!

review_title: Love the club property at Whistler
review_text: Love the club property at Whistler! It's in a great location, clean, updated spacious accommodation and friendly, professional staff. We rested up really nice and look forward to our next visit.
We haven‚Äôt booked anything since COVID hit - tried Tremblant for September but it was fully booked

Well we have not used the facilities during covid but our previous stays over the 16 years have always been outstandingWe especially love zihuatanejo, the resort is spectacular and the staff go above and beyond, we truly love that resort!!Whistler is another fantastic facility that has been our mainstay over the years as it is so close and our kids love it!!!Then you have the hidden gem that is Ucluelet, what a fantastic spot to get away and relax, excellent resort and simple restful spot!!!Thank for all the great memories!!!

Our stay was wonderful, the apartment was very clean and all available ( unlike some hotels) we asked for extra items which were delivered to our apartment straight away.Was great to be able to use all, gym, pool area etc.Thank you Embarc..
Great properties, wonderful staff and service, excellent value for money. Whistler and Zihaut definitely our favourites.

review_title: Our stay at Palm Desert Embarc club was‚Ä¶
review_text: Our stay at Palm Desert Embarc club was very enjoyable and relaxing.The grounds, units, and facilities are in excellent condition.The big treat was staying for one night of the five nights in the 2-bedroom Casita unit. We love the way you adorned and planned those rooms.The trip would not have been anywhere as good if not for the kind and professional help of Yadira at the front desk. Whatever you're paying her is not enough. She tried her best to accommodate our every need with a smile and prompt action..

We recently traveled to Palm Desert and stayed at the Embarc Resort timeshare for one week.  Our unit was clean and well-equipped.  Although we did not have any cleaning service due to the pandemic restrictions, if we did need any supplies, we simply called the front desk and our requested items were delivered to our front door.  We felt the staff did an excellent job of making us welcome and keeping within COVID-19 restrictions.  We definitely will return to this site.  It's one of our favorite timeshare units to visit.

Zihuatenejo is my favourite Embarc home. The staff has been the same since the first time I went many years ago. Each and everyone is friendly and helpful. They responded to our concerns about construction noice during my granddaughter's nap time. They are always willing to assist when a cranky child needs a ride on the golf cart. They respond graciously to requests. I love the choice of an adult and child pool and the option to swim up to the bar. Room service is excellent and the food is exceptional (and I'm someone who loves to walk to the village for local cuisine). The tequila and mescal tastings are always a highlight.

review_title: The last Club Intrawest trip we made‚Ä¶
review_text: The last Club Intrawest trip we made was in Feb/Mar of this year. We went to the Whistler club for a week and had several nights at the Vancouver, BC venue before and after the Whistler trip. Earlier this year we spent a week+ in the club at Desert Hot Springs. These are three of our favorite Club Intrawest locations. All three are well run, well located and everyone is always helpful. We are tired of sales pushes scheduled under the guise of helping us. We are already Signature level members and we try to get that across but, so far, no one seems to pay attention. If someone would actually just answer our questions we would have given this review 5 stars!

review_title: The shape of our resort is shameful
review_text: The shape of our resort is shameful.  We are ORIGINAL owners of Turtle Cay Resort in Virginia Beach, VA.  We truly did not enjoy this vacation at all.  Balconies were being held up by jacks.  The clientele at the resort is no longer family based.  There were too many guests that have no ownership in Diamond Resorts.
We have been to Panorama a number of times in early Sept.  Always enjoy the quiet in the resort this time of year.  Our room, as always, was clean and comfy as always.  We‚Äôll be back.

review_title: We upgraded from Silver to Platinum and‚Ä¶
review_text: We upgraded from Silver to Platinum and always enjoy our Diamond Vacations!!

review_title: The units are spacious and well‚Ä¶
review_text: The units are spacious and well equipped and have a large screened-in porch to relax in. There are plenty of greenspaces and landscaped areas making the resort beautiful, and we even had an owl visit a tree right outside our condo a few times. There are activities every day to keep you entertained. The pools are clean and have ample seating with umbrellas and tasteful music plays just loud enough to enjoy without overwhelming conversations. There's a free shuttle that can be taken to the beach that runs throughout the day. We had a great stay at Island Links!!
The owners meeting is conducted by salespersons who can not answer direct questions about individual accounts. They have a set presentation and do not deviate from that script.

review_title: We paid our maintenance fee but forgot‚Ä¶
review_text: We paid our maintenance fee but forgot to choose what we wanted to do with our week so about 59/60 days before our rental week we called and was told that our unit was already rented out my the management. Now that in my mind is a rip off, we paid our maintenance fee and because we forgot since we are over 70 we lost our week. We have own this unit for probably over 40 years.

review_title: Diamond resorts tries to make former‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond resorts tries to make former Instrawest owners feel like they are getting a value for their investment but,it is hard to say during Covid.

We noticed a definite decline in the standard of the room to include comfort of living room furniture and bed linens. The kitchen was not very well equipped, the studio had no cups, the burners on the stove were not connected and the a/c units were extremely dusty. Just having stayed in a beautiful Marriott to come to this was a big disappointment
Fabulous customer service by your representative as we used the rental program this year and we love this option. Thank you!

After a nice 20 year relationship with Club Intrawest / Embarc we have upgraded three times in the past 5 years and have gotten used to using Interval International and love all the properties that are generally quite easy to book for few points and a small exchange fee. We have visited so many other properties - France, Scottsdale, Palm Desert, Neuvo Vallarta, Cabo San Lucas, San Jose Del Cabo, Maui and of course our home club at Whistler all in the past 4 years.  Now Diamond is severing that relationship and going to DEX for triple the points and so far nothing is working smoothly on the Internet, so we‚Äôll have to wait till next year to see how it works.  Disappointing for sure but we will all wait and see how it unravels.  Have only just started using the ‚Äòmembers‚Äô Facebook forum and find that very useful for tips and assistance from other member experiences.

review_title: An incredible first experience in Zihua
review_text: What to say and where to start. We are members since over 20 years and we always return home with memorable souvenirs and cannot wait for the upcoming stay in Intrawest or now Embark resorts. The ones we visited are Tremblant, Blue Mountain and Destin. Each one has a special place in our heart. Zihua was always in our plans but the problem was that we have to book 11 months in advance and since we were unable to plan that much in advance so finally last year we started our preretirement so we jumped on the occasion and bang we made our reservation for two weeks in Zihua for February 2020 just before the pandemic. What an amazing resort so much different from the others in many aspects. You feel at home from day one, very nice welcoming from the staff, quick service, a restaurant in the resort, a bar in the pool and the beach is just there. Many activities are offered on site like Loteria (Mexican Bingo), Mexican night dinner and show, painting on clay or wood‚Ä¶ and the reception can guide you for some discoveries around the resort plus some tours to Ixtapa, La Saladita, Archeological Site & Museum, Troncones. We have even spent one day in Acapulco (4 hours‚Äô drive). It‚Äôs so much fun to go make your own shopping of fresh food from the Mercada Municipal and meeting the local people there is priceless. Some restaurants in downtown are a must visit like Any Restaurant. You have also one major supermarket called the Mega Soriana. Beside the activities that take place almost every night in the down town specially in the weekend at the so called the Basketball court where you can walk along the seaside and take photos of the famous mermaid. Most of the members that we met there are frequent if not yearly returning members and this explains why at the reception when you make the check-out the staff asks you if you already reserved your room for the coming year, which I have never heard from any other resort reception staff. Of course we will never forget the exercise that we have to make 5-6 times per day between our room and pool or the beach or to go out of the resort, since we had to climb 122 steps each way but of course there is a Golf cart that can take you to your floor and back. We are looking forward to go back again.

review_title: Loved our stay at Zhuataneo last Dec!
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

Up until today with previous stays at Embarc, most of them at Palm Desert, we have had excellent service. However today was an exception when I went online to cancel our Jan 2019 reservation due to Covid. The customer service rep I chatted with wouldn't waive the $25 cancellation fee despite not being able to travel to the US. review_title: Poor customer service, even taking into consideration COVID!
review_text: Still waiting for opt out of Extraordinary Escapes paperwork, been told it was approved by VP.  Just a rip off!

review_title: To date our experience with Diamond has‚Ä¶
review_text: To date our experience with Diamond has been positive. No surprises and accommodations as anticipated. Staff have been courteous and helpful. Please continue this good work.

review_title: Our stay at The Cove on Ormond‚Ä¶
review_text: The check-in at The Cove on Ormond Beach was a quick, good experience.  It was pouring rain so I wonder why their is no canopy on the North Tower where you check-in...  Upon arrival I was surprised that there was no soap in the bathroom.  One flush and we found out that the toilet needs repair (had to open the lid to stop it from running on and on).  We bought some food on the way there. Opened the frig to put away the groceries and something gross was on the bottom and (unknown to me) it was raised to it's highest level.  My vegetables froze and I had to throw them away :(I don't want to say that it was all bad!  We realize that no stay anywhere is perfect.  We relaxed and enjoyed and would definitely use this facility again.

review_title: The apartment is great and comfortable
review_text: The apartment is great and comfortable. The surrounding is clean. There are other amenities provided but we did not use, so cannot comment.The only drawback is the business centre.The allocated time on the computer is quite little and timed out quite quickly.

review_title: Most of the vacation was decent
review_text: Most of the vacation was decent.  Considering what is going on nation wide, we were able t relax and enjoy our family time.   Outdoor pool was clean, but is too hot.  Year after year.  Grounds looked ok. Most amenities closed due to Covid

review_title: Disappointed to see the building and‚Ä¶
review_text: Disappointed to see the building and facility maintenance lacking with the maintenance fees going up . Amenities like pools falling apart , saunas / Jacuzzis are removed instead of being repaired is bait and switch to promise 4 star accommodations then to not follow through repairing anything drops it to lackluster 2 stars . The associates who worked there were very nice but our resort feels like a vampire is sucking the value out of it .

Diamond is the worst timeshare ownership.They lie during the sit downs, the sales Managers are like car sales people.During the coronavirus when we can not book resorts that are closed, they are threaten to take points on 12/31/20. what a joke. I had to pay for travel insurance to keep changing reservation's 3-4 times during last 6 Months, totally unacceptable. Out of our control, and most of resorts closed.Disney cruise -vacation club we own moved our points to same cruise to 2022without a problem'It's hard to stay at Diamond resorts, all they do is harass you to meet them to sell you more.Disney Vacation Club never does any high pressure during our visits.Apollo has made Diamond a worse company.I would never recommend Diamond Resorts to anyone.Money blood suckers, but had no problem taking loan payments and maintenance fees during all the resorts closed.Time to start a class action against Diamond and Apollo.

review_title: One star because zero isn't an option
review_text: I'm only giving one star because there's no option for zero.Every visit to a resort, high pressure at check in to schedule and attend an "owner update."  What is an owner update? A high pressure sales pitch that lasts "30 minutes" in quotes because it's always multiple hours of high pressure. They take your id when you first check in and then don't give it back so you can't leave.Even after you've spend 100k + on membership, you'll still be saddled with 6000 or more per year in "maintenance" fees.  I've never spent more than 3k on vacation and now it costs me 6k just in case I can get the time off and have the money for airfare and what have you?  Yeah, GREAT value proposition.Every single resort where I have stayed have extra firm mattresses that cause my hips, knees, ankles and back to hurt making the entire vacation worse by not being well rested.I've even had them try to charge me for an "extra cleaning" because we stopped the guy in the hall and asked him to take out the trash because the 10 gallon trash can in the kitchen really doesn't hold very much.Diamond Resorts is not an investment, it is a scam to lock you into a lifetime of fees for no value.  The sales tactics are strong armed and 90% lies about the benefits you're getting.  They just keep you there and wear you down until you'll buy anything just to get out there!

review_title: The hotel and staff were nice
review_text: The hotel and staff were nice. I wish the pool was cleaner.

The points we booked through Interval international were canceled and we were given a certificate to use in up to a year with no fees required. So our year was just lost to us

review_title: I love the staff at the Boardwalk‚Ä¶
review_text: I love the staff at the Boardwalk Resort. They were very pleasant and responsive even through the frustrations of being short staffed. The upgraded patio area that was being installed will be a nice addition. But, as an owner, I was very disappointed to see how poorly maintained the room was despite the excessive amount of fees that I pay annually. The beds are excellent,  however the drapes and carpet are weathered, the air conditioning unit had a dangerous metal base that extended beyond the unit, the pantry door was missing, things were just suffering from general neglect. I sincerely hope that, at a minimum, there are plans to upgrade those items.

review_title: We have not traveled this year due to‚Ä¶
review_text: We have not traveled this year due to the COVID-19.

Hello! I am an owner of over 12 years at Beach Quarters and my stay was good outside of a few issues. I requested a vacuum cleaner and a few supplies to clean my bathroom/kitchen and was hounded by the Janine, at the front desk, to return these items immediately. As an owner, I treat this unit like my home; therefore, I clean as I would my own home! I only had the cleaning kit for one hour and called to advise that I was resting from being at the beach and would return it once I got settled. Janine EMPHASIZED repeatedly that I needed to return the products immediately, especially the Clorox spray, so I rushed and cleaned the unit to return it to her promptly!  I set it outside of my unit and after one hour, I called her AGAIN to advise that it was waiting for a pick up!  She finally sent someone to retrieve it. I only had the vacuum cleaner and Clorox product for a total of two hours, yet was badgered by her to return it ASAP! I want someone to maintain the unit as I do on my yearly (week) vacation, which is why I treat this unit as such! Other than her rudeness and disrespect, all was well! The maintenance guys, Benjamin and Reggie, took care of the numerous small black ants and roaches that were in my unit! The tiny ants were a menace and I shook 20 of them out of my clothes while sitting on the couch one evening! This unit has been plagued with massive roaches in the past, so this year we fought off tiny black ANTS inside and large roaches on the balcony! Other than that, we managed, I kept the unit clean and presented it immaculate when I checked out! Again, last year it was roaches and this year it was tiny black ants, which grossed me out and kept us from sitting on the couch...ugghhh! I always love my visit yearly, but I am concerned as to why I have to battle these pest every year! Again, I literally shook out my hair and clothes over the small table to see what I discovered and I got 30 plus small black ants, along with many bites on my body...arrghh, ughhh!! Thanks! üêú üêú üêú

review_title: It it the worst thing my husband and I‚Ä¶
review_text: It it the worst thing my husband and I ever did.  I would give 0 stars of I could.

review_title: Ocean Beach Club is a very nice place‚Ä¶
review_text: Ocean Beach Club is a very nice place to stay. All the employees have always been really nice and happily helpful. I have only 2 things that bother me about going there. I have a timeshare in December, and in the winter they don't have their breakfast place open in the morning to eat. Sometimes, I don't want to leave the place to go elsewhere to eat breakfast. Secondly, as soon as you check in, they want you to sign up to listen to a timeshare speak. I dont want to spend my vacation for 3 hours, ( they say its 1 hour, but its not), listening to that. They start calling my home a month prior to my vacation trying to get me to listen to that. Then, if I dont agree to the first day I'm there, they keep trying each day for at least 3 days after that. I just want to enjoy my vacation there. Other than those 2 things, I really enjoy the place.

review_text: We often have problems getting through the phone system to actually be able to talk to someone. Have to leave messages but they don't call back. It is really hard to find accommodations at places you want to go at the time you want to go. Many of us don't always want to go to Las Vegas or Florida. Other options seem limited.

Diamond resort pricing average

review_title: We have owned in Virginia Beach for‚Ä¶
review_text: We have owned in Virginia Beach for over 15 years, beginning with Gold Key Resorts and now with Diamond Resorts.  When we go to the owner meetings we are treated like second class owners because we do not own points with Diamond Resorts, we have a deed at Oceanaire.  We love going to Virginia Beach, but not the owners meeting.  Wish Gold Key Resorts would come back.

review_title: Diamond does not live up to their motto ‚ÄúStay vacationed‚Äù!
review_text: Diamond seems to only be concerned about selling more points.  You cannot check into a resort without being pressured to attend an update presentation!  VIP check-in really stands for Very Intense Pressure to attend a meeting.  Points purchased have no value and for the price we pay for annual maintenance fees per point you could stay at a very nice resort without purchasing points. Diamond should stop paying celebrities to do virtual concerts etc. and work to lower maintenance fees and upgrade certain resorts.

While the rooms were clean, and the staff wonderfully friendly and helpful, the age of the resort was showing through in multiple places.  For example, the air conditioning units were very loud, and blew extremely cold for a few seconds, and then wound down.  Only to turn on again a minute later.  And there was rust around the bottom of the units.  And a supporting leg for a peninsula in the kitchen was also rusty around the base.  The resort next store that we stayed at last year was a four or five star by comparison, and it shares amenities with this one!

Absolutely tired of 'off the street' renters coming into properties we own or exchange into and destroying, trashing and disregarding rules.  Tired if the smokers, and now the pot smokers all over the properties.  Disappointed with Diamond allowing RIFFRAFF renters at my expense.

review_title: BETTER VILLA OPTIONS NEEDED FOR OWNERS WITH PETS
review_text: We were sold on Diamond based on its pet friendly resorts.  However, they failed to disclose that owners traveling with pets would receive far inferior accommodations than those without pets.  Our pet friendly villas have been a huge disappointment.  In Sedona we're assigned to dark, dreary ground floor units with views of buildings and/or parked cars rather than the beautiful red rock views a Platinum Member could enjoy.  We understand that folks traveling with Service dogs are not relegated to the worst units.  I think we're all in agreement that most of those small dogs wearing their "service" vests are simply pets or emotional support/therapy dogs.  Those vests are easily purchased online without restriction.  So far we've not joined the ranks of other owners (and employees) who cheat with their service animal vests to enjoy more favorable accommodations. We'd prefer instead that owners traveling with pets be accorded the same vacation experience as those who do not.
The stay was great. There was an incident involving kids sneaking into the jacuzzi that was closed. But it was a great visit.

review_title: Except for the high pressure from sales‚Ä¶
review_text: Except for the high pressure from sales people. Los Abrigados &Spa Resort in Sedona is exellent. Staff and rooms great. Cabo Azul Resort in Cabo is top notch. Were going back in Feb.  2021

review_title: Vacation at Ocean Beach Club was great‚Ä¶
review_text: Vacation at Ocean Beach Club was great despite COVID this summer. Only complaint was that the mask rule was not enforced indoors. Otherwise I thought the resort did a really nice job.

review_title: I have been trying to get my deposit‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been trying to get my deposit back and my points moved ahead to 2021 for my 20,000 sampler package . Pls I don‚Äôt want to lose my points .Unfortunately no one has gotten back to me , it‚Äôs very frustrating. Could someone pls reply to this email ?RegardsMargaret Pino
I found my timeshare clean, quiet and comfortable. If I needed anything, they were prompt and efficient to fulfill my request.

Booked 2-2 bedroom units for our family and couldn‚Äôt have been happier. To be honest, the units are a bit dated, however you‚Äôre not there to sit in the room and watch tv, right? The rooms were clean, bed was comfortable and we had what we needed to cook meals. Could have used BBQ tools, but we made what was there work. There‚Äôs so much to do in the Smoky Mountains that our family would definitely go back. Staff was attentive when we did call. We utilized the pool and fire pit area almost daily. It‚Äôs a great resort!
Dangerous diswasher, screws loose to hold the dishwasher
Sales people too pushy. Maintenance fee keeps increasing, but the resort is wearing badly. Check in and out always too congested.

review_title: as always good experience nice and‚Ä¶
review_text: as always good experience nice and spacious rooms very clean and convenient , I stay here for couple times when me and my family go to Disney I definitely recommend

Our most recent visit to Diamond Resorts, Scottsdale Links Resort,  was October 2019, and it was our vest stay yet!  Our need for a ground level unit was graciously provided for and the unit was well stocked with linens and kitchen items. Housekeeping was very responsive and did excellent freshening our unit twice weekly.  We felt welcomed and well cared for.  We're looking forward to our next visit.

The Scottsdale Links property was in good shape.  Some functions like the gym were closed due to COVID-19.  The 1 BR I had was in good condition with everything working as expected.  I was ok with being given the option for room cleaning service, which I did not use during my stay.  Between the Links and Vista locations, it's a toss up for a preference, but I preferred the Vista pool.

review_title: Oceanaire in VA Beach is our favorite
review_text: Oceanaire in VA Beach is our favorite. We enjoy the resort and surranding area.
Except for the high pressure, disceptive sales practices employed at the owners' updates, everything else about DRI is superb.  We usebour points everywhere we travel and enjoy the resorts.

We had problems with the neighbors upstairs, complained several times and nothing was done about it.  Like we didn't matter at all.  So very, very disappointed. Ruined 3/4 of our trip.  Couldn't get enough sleep.

review_title: We spend our family vacations at‚Ä¶
review_text: We spend our family vacations at Powhatan Resorts and always have a great time there.The Resort is beautiful and so are the people that work there...always friendly and helpful!

review_title: We enjoy our week at Oceanaire in Va
review_text: We enjoy our week at Oceanaire in Va. Beach, Va. each year.  It is located right on the beach with lots of amenities on the premises and close by. They have offered wonderful Events of a Lifetime to members in the past and trust they will continue. We hope they will replace furniture and bedding more often than they have in previous properties that Diamond Resorts owns in that area.

On the positive side, all the properties we have visited have been well maintained and have the essentials for a vacation.My two main issues are the following.Lack of inventory at Diamond properties. I just tried to book a vacation for next summer in the western US and there was nothing available. However, when I go to the property website, units are available at a daily rate. That tells me the general public is more important than the members.Cost of annual maintenance. The annual maintenance cost at the 15,000 point level, is about the same as booking the property at the rate offered to the general public. Makes you wonder why I purchased the points.
Resort availability should be "wider" for gold and platinum members. If you lose us you are done.

review_title: I find the web site difficult to find‚Ä¶
review_text: I find the web site difficult to find what I want. Covid has made it even more difficultto use. Diamond should give us a break on the maintenance fees and use of points. I have basically wasted my money.
Very nice and helpful, patient.
Housekeeping and grounds keeping could do a better job. Spiderwebs around, patio full of leaves, just general cleanliness should be addressed.
Always enjoy my stay here ,everyone that works there is so friendly and the units are beautifully maintained. I feel like I'm staying in an apartment.

Ocean Beach club in Virginia Beach is superb, first class, wonderful staff, great amenities. Any property that we exchanged also was first class, well appointed, managed well etc.  for the record. I applied to be a board member three times - we have no Canadian representation. Does anyone care we pay between .30 and .40 extra for $1.US   In Canada all service clubs (day care, health clubs etc.) provided refunds to customers because there was no service during Covid - what has Diamond done?  nothing!They should consider giving back the maintenance (overpriced) dues.

review_title: We recently traveled to Maui and Hawaii‚Ä¶
review_text: We recently traveled to Maui and Hawaii in March.  Our stay in Maui was not up to our expectations of Diamond Resorts.   It was on a sampler points package.  If I wasn't already an owner, I would never sign up with Diamond Resorts.   They did eventually move us to a villa that didn't have holes in the walls and mold in the bathroom.   Our accommodations were much better on the big island.  As of today, 9.2.20, I am still waiting for my $300 deposit from my week on big island of Hawaii. With our current situation with Covid and living in NY state, I dont know when we will be able to travel again.  I can not afford 2 weeks unpaid quarantine to travel for a 1 week vacation.   What options do you gave available to end our timeshare?

We stayed here for a week to visit Walt Disney World.  Our 3 bedroom unit was amazing.  Large rooms and 3 bathrooms.  The grounds were also amazing.  Beautifully landscaped, 2 pools, playground, putt-putt, beach area were all well maintained.  It was the perfect place to come back to to relax after being in the parks.
Excellent presentations. Our thanks to both presenters.
