review_text: Annual fees are way to high for the US club membership.  They don't need to be that expensive for owners dues  !

We've been owners for about 10 years and have had some amazing experiences and seen remarkable places.  Overall, it's been good but if we had it to do all over again, there's no way we'd do it.  With the annual maintenance fees and the decreasing value of points over the years, we're convinced we could have more effectively used the money we've spent with Diamond to travel and stay at world class resorts.  With the spotty customer service and less than luxurious conditions at many of the resorts, we most definitely believe we're not getting our money's worth.

review_title: Loved our visit to Lake Tahoe beach and‚Ä¶
review_text: Loved our visit to Lake Tahoe beach and ski resort this month. Weather was perfect and pool and beach open for use. We do wish the hot tub was open perhaps by reserving times through front desk.Friendly staff and we already booked for next August.
We booked a 3 week stay at two different resorts in Hawaii.  The process was simple and easy. We got the rooms we wanted at a discounted point value.

review_title: Our experience was very very good
review_text: Our experience was very very good.  Especially in these COVID-19 times our service was very good.  I will be back again to enjoy the clean and safe environment provided. Thank you.
Most Places have a staff that starts nice and becomes pushy
The Condo was very easy to view and book for future travel in 2021.  Thank you for the excellent method you have to view the rooms and to book the vacation.
The accommodations have been exceptional and accessible. Thanks.

Stay at The Cove on Ormond was fantastic. Staff friendly very helpful and professional.  Facilities clean and well maintained. Would definitely recommend and would definitely stay here again. Best thing you are steps away from one of the best beaches.

review_title: We have been going here for years
review_text: We have been going here for years. We had to change our dates due to COVID and was charged a fee. After several calls and being told different options, all different each time we called. Just sad a company this large can‚Äôt absorb the fees.

review_title: Company notable  to get us reservations
review_text: the company was not able to get us reservation when we wanted them even thought we were platinum members & cost for maintenance was so high we could not get enough vacations to warrant the expense

Very poor sales staff. Was lied to and made to feel if I didn't purchase additional points I would be sued for having incorrect information on my account. Thanks to their review people, it was a letter and no purchase necessary.

We are having financial hardship right now with the Covid 19 pandemic. The agent was courteous however, wasn't able to give us much help. She advised us that Diamond doesn't have a plan in place to assist members with financial hardships at this time. The only suggestion was to make payments on a as available basis (to show good faith). Or to divide the amount due in half and make 2 payments? How does that help when each month still adds on to the amount due. Not happy with this resolution.
We had a great time. We had asked for a larger pot for dinner cooking. It never came when we were told It would be a few moments. Other than that a great time!
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: THE ROOMS WASN'T AS CLEAN AS I THOUGHT‚Ä¶
review_text: THE ROOMS WASN'T AS CLEAN AS I THOUGHT IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN
Not too many resorts to choose from, and some resorts treat you like a number, polite but unaccommodating.

review_title: Our recent Diamond vacation to Vegas‚Ä¶
review_text: Our recent Diamond vacation to Vegas was great. Everything was well coordinated and we had no complaints at all. In order for us to give an 'excellent' rating, it would have been nice if our suite was facing the strip, and the tickets we received from Diamond for a local concert would have needed to be closer to the stage. But again, we were completely satisfied.

review_title: So BEWARE i booked a three night stay‚Ä¶
review_text: So BEWARE i booked a three night stay at Diamond resort Kenmore for three guest one who was disabled for a two bed roomed lodge , the booking was taken and confirmed , we then discovered with only 45 days to our  holiday there were no such units at Kenmore. Compliant submitted then worse than the holiday cancellation and having to try and find another suitable holiday at short notice was the Customer service experience, basically holiday until fully paid are only provisional yes we should not have taken your booking and you have provided a learning experience for our booking team , was it unreasonable to then ask and what about the inconvenience to me and my family , well i have apologised came the response , and I quote "what do you want me to do " really a company that doesn't even consider the impact for customer as a consequence of their incompetence doesn't deserve your custom . Rude unhelpful and uncaring

review_title: Unable to get through to anyone on the‚Ä¶
review_text: Unable to get through to anyone on the phone. Chat function hit or miss. Waiting for a reply to my question posted earlier today, please advise!

review_title: We have been with Diamond Resorts for 6‚Ä¶Not Classy
review_text: We have been with Diamond Resorts for 6 years.  It was not a classy and upgraded Resort that was advertised to us.  We have stayed at Marriot Resorts and other Resorts and they were more upgraded.  The places we have stayed have been below average or just highly used average.  At each resort there has been a detailed comments report that have been sent into Diamond Resorts and no follow up has ever been done.  One of the worst places we stayed at was in Australia and I had issues with that before we left because I researched where we were going to stay and made my concerns to Troy in the Administrative Offices, he told me that no problem BUT there were problems and when I complained he hung on me 3 times and I told him if he hung up again, I was calling the Director of Diamond Resorts.  Nobody called me again from Diamond Resorts.  Call me 571-228-4186,  Let's really talk.

review_title: The only criticism I have is on the‚Ä¶
review_text: The only criticism I have is on the sampler. I literally paid nearly $5000 for one week at Cabo Azul.  My husband was very ill and could not travel with me for over a year. I was told I could not use these 20,000 points without him.  Just a couple of months before the points were to expire it took me five days to get a pool view room in Cabo for one week. All 20,000 points when I could have used my Silver Points for 9,600. When we got there we were given a room with an obstructive view. I had to make a seen to get a better room with a pool view.  At that point we decided not to purchace any further points from Diamond. Sense then we have had several nice trips on our Silver Points. Regardless as a result of how we were treated while trying to use the points from the sampler.

review_title: They were able to resolve the issue‚Ä¶
review_text: They were able to resolve the issue that I had with the website
In the past, when we have traveled, we‚Äôve had good luck with bookings. Places have been clean and friendly staff.

review_title: Your staff are always very courteous‚Ä¶
review_text: Your staff are very courteous and helpful and have give us suggestions on what to do or how to change something. I have experienced times where your employees English is some what lacking and thus makes communication difficult. Recently though I have not experienced this. We are truly happy with our communication with your staff. It has become more difficult to book our time in Hawaii I have noticed. This last booking was especially frustrating but understandable that people were booking online and I still have not figured this out. I prefer talking to someone.
Everything went smoothly. We felt the room was clean and properly taken care of.
Found them unresponsive to questions, big promises poor results.
IGNORE TEXT

We were Told Many Lies from the sales staff, Lies they knew were Not the truth. Here are the Most egregious:1. We were told Diamond No longer sell Samplers. But when we got to the paperwork, it same Sampler All over it.2. We had used a previous sampler years ago to book 4 rooms on one weekend, for a family weekend in Branson. (1 room for each of our Kids and their children). The sales staff said we could do this again! But paperwork says Only We as Owners can use these points, and Only 1 Room at a time.3. We were told we would have a Representative assigned to us to learn to how to use the many Benefits available to owners.  Later we find Diamond Does NOT assign Reps to assist owners. We can call and ask about benefits, but we have to know What to ASK about, If you do not know what to ask, how can you ask?4. We talked about wanting to go to Hawaii, or to Costa Rica. The Sales rep bragged about including a certificate for Round trip Airfare we could use to fly to Hawaii, or Costa RIca, any where Southwest flies But  when we got the certificate from a third party travel agency, we see it is Continental US Flights ONLY.Once we got home and found all this out, i called the Sales area of Sedona Summit, and asked for Nathan Burns, who I was told was the Sales manager. He was Not available, but I was promised He would call me back. 4 months later, I assume he is not going to return my call, and never was gong to return it. I called the Sedona Summit and asked for Brandon Swank. Same response "Not availalbe, but will call you back". No Call.Welcome Home.

review_title: I have not performed any transactions‚Ä¶
review_text: I have not performed any transactions with Diamond Resorts lateky but generally, I am not satisfied with my ownership. Although they promise alot, I have not gotten what I really wanted and had to settle The maintenance fees keep going up and availability is not sufficient

I was promised certain things after buying regarding payments that would no longer need to be made. I was lied to and thus far 2 payments have been automatically taken from my checking account. I was promised on or about July 9th that I would be reimbursed for the first payment. Thus far it has not been done. On August 4th it happened again. I‚Äôve written to my customer service representative who tried to sell me more points again last week. This was done on Tuesday this week. I still have not received any response. I was also told by 2 representatives they could make a reservation for me during the sales call a week ago today.  As of this writing the reservation isn‚Äôt showing up on my Diamond Resorts page. Diamond Resorts is only interested in selling you more points and their representatives have lied to me and done nothing to correct their companies errors and mistakes. Right now I wouldn‚Äôt trust anyone who works for Diamond Resorts.

review_title: my resort was just ok I feel its not‚Ä¶
review_text: my resort was just ok I feel its not updated compaired to some other resorts that I own at or even  that I have traded this resort for (Parkway International)

review_title: I made an investment in a timeshare
review_text: I made an investment in a timeshare.  Why are you spending all this time and effort with these online media persons. That doesn't improve my customer experience..And Why did you cut our Interval connection and membership? That is going to cost me an additional $163 each year.  You did it without any apparent warning or explanation.  I'm also angry to see you selling nights at our high demand properties when members could be using them with our points.
In the current climate where travel arrangements can change at short notice, it was great to be able change an existing booking with no fuss and no penalties.

review_title: Currently not travelling, but hopefully soon.
review_text: Have only used Diamond resorts lately to deposit my points / weeks, with the travel bans on to most places. We‚Äôll see when I use them, how that goes.  When the border opens up again, we can hopefully plan some vacations.  so for now diamond resorts has been fine.

My trips in the past have always been wonderful and my last trip to Virginia Beach was the same.  I did an update and a refinance, which required buying more points.  I was told that I would get a phone call in a couple of weeks (it‚Äôs been well over a month) to help me move some (or at least the largest one) of my payments to next year to help me financially. I never received that call and have sent two texts asking about it.  I‚Äôm assuming the person who was ‚Äútrying to help me‚Äù was only after a sale and not really interested in assisting me.  I can assure you that I will NOT be purchasing any more points.

review_title: We would like to have more options!
review_text: We would like to have more options for travel at major tourist spots, San Francisco, San Deigo, Niagara Falls, etc.

Diamond Resorts is amazing. Great vacation opportunities and awesome staff to deal with in making those vacations a reality. Their website is friendly and it is always a gem, yes Diamond of an experience.

review_title: We love going to Ormond Beach
review_text: We love going to Ormond Beach. Clean nice rooms an the people that work there is great

review_title: Did not visit a resort yet this‚Ä¶lost timeshare points.
review_text: Did not visit a resort yet this year.did have plans at spring break for family to get together.but that fell through. Now I have points that I will lose buy years end.not really fair for the amount of money spent on fees.someone should be looking at what to do for shareholders.not feeling I got my money‚Äôs worth from timeshare ownership at all.thanks let us know what you think.

No action taken on Covid19 impact, all points should roll over indefinitely. Not one year but multiple. Significant cut in dues and fees are necessary to allow members to be able to rebound when the world gets better. Lost of money now but the increase in spending over the years will outweigh any lost. think long term...

WITHOUT PREJUDICEWe had two weeks at the Liki Tiki resort in Orlando.  Wonderful relationship with the previous owners.  Completely different experience with Diamond Resorts.  Ended up relinquishing one week for an extra $200.00 U$D.   Relinquished the second week last year.  Were fully paid up but were told that we owed for the COMING year and that nothing could be done until that was paid.  The amount was about $1200.00 U$D.  On top of that, the $200.00 that we paid to relinquish the first week was now $1000.00 U$D.  We feel robbed but are glad to be rid of them!  Don‚Äôt get involved with this company!
Great service. I‚Äôm pleased with the courtesy and professionalism during my stay.
the place was great. but i had three phone calls trying to get me to go to a owners update . think that is a bit over the top, once should be enough.

We enjoy using the Diamond timeshares and the booking of them has been easier once we figured out how to book.  However, the "owner updates" are the reason for the bad rating.  To entice you to go they give you Visa gift cards and/or free dinners but getting them requires patience and time.  We have attended very few over the years where we haven't come away feeling stupid and sorry for attending.  Worse, they have outright lied about what we own, the value of it or what they're trying to get you to buy.

review_title: I am not pleased with the fact that i‚Ä¶
review_text: I am not pleased with the fact that i was charged a Resort fee, of which i was told when i checked that i didn't have to pay this fee, during my 07/19/20 - 07/22/20.
The Resorts are always in perfect condition we are always treated with courtesy and respect.

review_title: We have 10,000 points banked and we‚Ä¶
review_text: We have 10,000 points banked and we tried to get a reservation for our daughter and son-in-law a couple of weeks ago at Lawrence Welk Resort. We were told you had zero rooms.  Well I daughter called the very same day and she made a reservation with that resort..  It cost her around $800.00.  We are so unhappy with this company.  This is the second time at the same resort this happened.  We really don't want our time share anymore.

review_title: Always a pleasure staying at Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: Always a pleasure staying at Diamond Resorts.  The rooms are always clean, the staff is fantastic and  ever so helpful.
Not the cleanest, just adverse, to many restrictions

We are Canadian, we upgraded our single resort ownership and purchased points in December 2019 and joined the Diamond family in January 2020. Then  the pandemic caused us to lose our bonus Cruise, cancel an exchange in April and possibly lose the bonus points we received at purchase! We now cannot travel to our holiday planned for Hawaii or any where else in the USA. It looks like our introduction into Diamond Resorts may have been an expensive mistake! We're hoping for better luck int 2021. James
Diamonds high annual maintenance costs for an owner are just as much as a non owner going on line or directly to the resort and booking a one week stay.

Our condo was spotless. The linens and towels were nice and soft. The kitchen was fully stocked, except for salt and pepper which we have had in the past. This was the longest stay we have had in Fairway Forest and one of the most enjoyable in the last 5 years.

review_title: Had a great vacation at Fairway‚Ä¶
review_text: Had a great vacation at Fairway Resorts, just outside Sapphire, N. Carolina..We walked many trails & took in breathtaking waterfalls. We visited the Lake & rented a canoe (16.00 per hour, very reasonable), and took a peaceful ride around the lake... The Golf Course is nice, and depending on your financial situation, 67.00 for 18 may or may not be a bad price... Recreational putt putt & swimming are free!!!! COVID made it where only 1 family was permitted on the entire putt putt course at a time... Rooms are nice...

review_title: The Agent very quickly understood my‚Ä¶
review_text: The Agent very quickly understood my situation and gave suggestions that would enhance my vacation experience.

review_title: We have found being a member of Diamond‚Ä¶is frustrating and not what we expected.
review_text: We have found being a member of Diamond Resorts good and bad and very frustrating. We had a call from a customer service representative who said she was calling to see how we were doing during the pandemic and to tell us more about the "new and exciting" things going on with Diamond.  She called when we were not home and sent and email.  I did have some questions and was interesting in hearing about why Diamond was not long associated with Interval International.  I called her back five days in a row and never heard anything back from her.  Keeping in mind she contacted us first and yet we never got a call back from her.  However, if they are trying to get us to attend an "Owner's Update" where they will try to sell more points, they not only call and email, they call several times a day.  If you happen to be out of town, they will call a family member whose phone number they have only in case of emergency.  We feel they are not interested in us as members of the Diamond Community, but only to keep selling points.  Then one of the ways to use points was for travel - 100% for airfare, cruises and some hotels.  That has been taken away from us.  We now only can use points for 30% of the purchase price.  This was one of the best options available to use points and now it is gone.  My advice is to stay away from Diamond Resorts!

review_title: The rooms were clean and beds were‚Ä¶
review_text: The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The swimming area was fantastic and wasn‚Äôt crowded. That staff was helpful, polite and ensure everyone had their mask on in area that you were required to wear one.

Diamond Resorts is a waste of money. After buying member points, I pay nearly the same in maintenance costs as someone who is not a member and stays at the same resort, often they pay much less.  Also Diamond blocks members to allow vacancies for non members.  Save your money!  You all have heard about time shares, believe it.

I‚Äôve been an owner of the cove at Ormond beach timeshare since 2001. The place is a great place to stay. Nice staff, everything you‚Äôd want in a vacation spot. HOWEVER...Being lied to, learning the scams to get you to buy something is the downfall.

review_title: Last time we were there it was great so‚Ä¶
review_text: Last time we were there it was great so we're doing it again this year that's all I got to say see you in October what
Getting expensive bod is useless  maintenance fees are high for only 44 units

It seems all they want to do is find ways to sell you more timeshare and tell you how you missed the last deal. The events are great and I would pay for those but not with a "free" breakfast and hard sales pitch.
We Love the quality and friendly staff of every Diamond Resort we have stayed. We love to travel and Diamond offers so many beautiful locations throughout the world.

review_title: I want out of this ridiculous waste of‚Ä¶
review_text: I want out of this ridiculous waste of money time share.
Last year I traveled to Ormond Beach, FL.  My entire family had a great time.
Owned for 25 yrs, but not going to Florida this year.Enjoy the quiet.  Love the pool and the access to Disney parksWonderful eating places everywhere!

As always, availability is an issue.  What good are points if you cannot go where you want to.  Diamond needs to increase their inventory at certain places.  And not the useless affiliated resorts.  Cant get in.  Need something on the Florida Gulf Coast.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I have been at The Cove at Ormond Beach‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been at The Cove at Ormond Beach twice in the last month.  Although the hot tub is closed due to Covid and the amenities in the owner's lounge are not available, the rest of the resort is open and operating nicely.  Employees are practicing safety measures, resort is clean (as always), and you can forget that there are "problems" for a while.  The staff at The Cove are ALWAYS considerate, responsive, respectful, and friendly.  I absolutely love this resort.
While maintenance fees keep rising, I do not see the value / dollar within my Diamond resorts.

I'm very disappointed in the available inventory in the resorts I like to frequent.  It's especially frustrating when I can book them online via Diamond Exchange using cash but unable to use my points.  It's been explained as something to do with Diamond owned inventory vs owner inventory.  Why isn't Diamond owned inventory available for Diamond owners to book?

Have been going to Sedona Summit for over 5 years. My recent visit was disappointing at best. The facility is demonstrating a total lack of upgrading and even normal maintenance. Looking for another place to visit.

Enjoyed our stay in July 2020. This was the 5th time we had stayed at Powhatan Resort in Williamsburg. A/C was cold in our unit. Resort was not crowded due to Covid-19. The resort fee of $20.95 plus tax per day is unreasonable especially with several amenities that were closed due to Covid-19. The other timeshare resorts in Williamsburg are free or $30 per week for the resort fee.

Claudio and Sergio took great care of us. The pool room view- all that‚Äôs it cracked up to be, beautiful but quaint. The ‚Äúteacher cafe‚Äú- we walked down to hole in the wall- and we had the best experience- my hotcakes were the biggest i have seen- I could not eat the whole things (2 hotcakes) smoothie to die for- i am partial to mango. We had to go three times. All and all, we had a great experience at Cabo Azul.
IGNORE TEXT
Everyone is so caring and understanding.  They answer my questions in a timely manner.
The representative's assistance throughout the process was professional and responsive.

review_title: I have been lied to numerous times by‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been lied to numerous times by the sales and hospitality teams.

Very disappointed with Diamond Resort‚Äôs response to our complaint back in February.  It has never been resolved. Also very disappointed that some compensation has not been offered to Canadian members as we are not able to travel during the Covid-19 restrictions.

review_title: Nice properties but constant reduction of benefits for owners
review_text: The Diamond Resorts properties I‚Äôve stay at are all very good to excellent.  However, as a timeshare company, I‚Äôve been greatly disappointed by the constant erosion  of benefits, which makes my ownership shares very much less valuable and useful. It‚Äôs almost like a bait-and-switch operation.

review_title: Tough times in the world today
review_text: In this unprecedented times that we are living in it is tough for everyone.  We as Canadians dont know when we can travel again as the border remains closed.  Unfortunately we still have to make our payments and that has been difficult for many in the past 4+ months when you lose your job and dont have income coming in.  We are managing and still are making our payments although sometimes they are a few days late.  We didnt get any extensions.  I realize things still have to have some normallcy in all of this.  Just my opinion.  We usually enjoy our stay when we use our timeshare just unsure when the next time will be.

My experience with DRI has always been a pleasant experience with the exception of my trip to Kona.  The Kona resort is a resort DRI guest can stay, that is NOT manage by DRI.At all DRI properties at which I've stayed, customer service and accommodations have always lived up to my expectations.I have recommended my friends to this join DRI as it operates like a vacation club. It is not a timeshare.  Your points you receive annually allow you to stay anywhere in the world you choose.

I savex all my points, then my wife and i thought we would use the tool looking for somewhere we hadn't been to Nd the damn system scheduthe trip without checking to see if I wanted the trip. The system pulled the points that I saved and after I canceled the trip, I can't save the points now. What a rip off...

review_title: I received an email in February of this‚Ä¶
review_text: I received an email in February of this year from Diamond offering me the ability to change my Sure Pay method of payment. I did so and was penalized 2 percentage points on my loan. I called to complain and changed back to ACH payments. I was told my original interest rate would be reinstated. So far it has not. I‚Äôm not happy.

review_title: I was tricked into purchasing a Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: I was tricked into purchasing a Diamond Resort ‚Äúsampler package‚Äù for $7,000 with the promise that I would be able to go on several vacations all across the United States.  At the time of this ‚Äúpressure‚Äù presentation I was in the middle of a chapter 13 bankruptcy and I told them I wasn‚Äôt supposed to go into debt beyond $7,000 without court approval.  They told me it would be okay.  After I signed up I received a call about 15 days later and was told I could only go (the first vacation) to one of three resorts and attend an ‚Äúupgrade presentation‚Äù.  At the upgrade presentation resort vacation we were told that because we were in bankruptcy we could not attend the presentation.  After paying monthly for a total of $6,000 they notified me that my sampler package would expire in June 2020.  At that time I stopped paying the monthly fee and now they are threatening to sue me.
Excellent location, enjoyable stay, and friendly staff
have had difficulty getting return calls.  i just keep leaving messages and hope i get a call back at some point???

review_title: I keep having sales pitches that tell‚Ä¶
review_text: I keep having sales pitches that tell me one thing and weeks later.  It‚Äôs no we don‚Äôt do that or cannot do that.  Tired of....

review_title: We booked through II was told we could‚Ä¶
review_text: We booked through II was told we could take our 13 lbs dog, but obviously they don‚Äôt allow pets,  there are signs on the property ‚Äúall pets must be on leashes‚Äù. So I‚Äôm confused, plus there were many dogs around us and big dogs.  Plus only one burner worked on our stove.  The TV went out they did replace it.  The buildings need maintenance for sure, the steps are all rusting out.  The back of the building are green.  The screen in porches are full of spider webs.  Trash laying around the grounds.  Very disappointed we own Marriott time shares, we may be spoiled a little maybe I don‚Äôt know.  And they left the previous people‚Äôs soap in the shower, which made me wonder if they cleaned it so I cleaned it.

review_title: Stay as far away as you can
review_text: Stood at their place in Orlando, which unfortunately was nice, but their time share people are so terrible. I own my own time share through RCI and they tried down talking them so much. Reluctantly I took a cruise voucher with them and booked a cruise, so far its been over 2 hours of waiting for nothing. No results, no refund, no updates and they still push for credits instead of refunds. I will never in my life stay at any associated diamond resorts nor will I ever use anything associated with these people. They are horrible. Stay away, keep your money and use your money with another company. I would recommend RCI, they have been great and would tell you this, you are better off with them than diamond resorts any day of the week.

This company‚Äôs Mexico Resort (Cabo Azul) tried to scam my wife and I with adding an additional timeshare to our account but represented it would be a replacement to our original ownership which is paid off.The Las Vegas Branch our home branch assisted us with eliminating the scam/fraud BUT they removed my wife from ownership. We have tried to explain the error but their staff keep sending up forms to pay $250 to add my wife back to ownership when it cost zero dollars for them to improperly remove her.It‚Äôs been hell under Diamond resort ... We are glad we are outright owners and only have to be maintenance fees.  We will NEVER upgrade with this company. We make sure to share the horrors to our friends and family every time ‚Äútimeshares‚Äù come up in conversations. The company‚Äôs slogan should be ‚ÄúSmoke and Mirrors‚Äù

review_title: Misleading information on why we needed‚Ä¶
review_text: Misleading information on why we needed to attend a meeting. Initially stated to review new website info and answer any questions,but was another sales pitch with the old "Well you maybe Platinum but you need this to be solid" routine.Note: Any future vacation stays at any Resort we will NOT attend any meetings! Very misleading from what were told prior.

I went To Cancun knowing the shorter pool hours so I can't say anything about that. But when I checked in and went to my room I noticed we did not have a sauce pan in the kitchen (wanted to heat up a jar of spaghetti sauce. I called down and requested one. They said they would bring it soon. The next morning I called again for that sauce pan. After a day doing this and that I returned to the room and still had no sauce pan. Went down to the front desk and informed them of my 2 phone calls and the need for a sauce pan. Sometime later I finally got one. Also had to report to maintenance the shower in the small bathroom was leaking behind the toilet. Really not a very good stay.

review_title: I have spoken to several agents in the‚Ä¶
review_text: I have spoken to several agents in the last couple of weeks regarding bookings to use my points. .... to no avail ! I was promised a call back on two occasions. Neither ever happened. I am discouraged at the lack of assistance available. It is a whole days task just to reach a person on the phone, so when nothing gets accomplished it becomes a big waste of time. I just need someone to help me make a booking so that my points don‚Äôt go to waste this year. Also a call back from an agent when it is promised would be appreciated.
Finally got right person after being transferred three times.  Jared finally was able to help.  He was able to cancel flight and assist me on other matters not in his department .

review_title: My last visit there was a very good‚Ä¶
review_text: My last visit there was a very good one, I got some much needed R&R The unit was nice and clean. The other guest coming and going were very pleasant in passing.

During April I left several messages to cancel my trip scheduled for June and no one called me back. I had to continue calling and did not get a response until May. It would have been nice to just get an email or something saying you got my message but can't handle my request. Or a message letting us know that due to COVID-19 no one was able to handle cancellation until ....

review_title: My first unit purchase was fine
review_text: My first unit purchase was fine, and I am glad I purchased it. however I feel as though the second unit was purchased as a result of false information.That is why I have rated Diamond two stars.Also, due to the covid19 pandemic I do not see myself utilizing both units in the future.
I was given incorrect info while buying...

review_text: IGNORE TEXT
excellent staff,  accomodations and location (kitty hawk-nc).  Super relaxing

review_title: I really didn‚Äôt like the attitude and‚Ä¶
review_text: I really didn‚Äôt like the attitude and the fact that they tried to deceive me with the cost of services. But the hotel room was very cozy, comfortable and clean
Hard to work with. I have tried to get out of my timeshare and they will not let me. Would no recommend ownership to anyone.

review_title: Difficult to schedule some of the more‚Ä¶
review_text: Difficult to schedule some of the more popular resorts. Some of the resorts definitely need an remodel. The Cabo Azul, Cancun Resort in Las Vegas, and the Rancho Manana resorts are definitely my favorite. Nice accommodations and great service.

review_title: Diamond Resort lied and duped us
review_text: Diamond Resort lied and duped us. I am now stuck with two maintenance fees, they told us by joining Diamond Resort it will remove Monarch Grand Vacation but it didnt.  I am now stuck paying for both.  If i only knew they lied I would have not joined Diamond Resort.  The room they gave us had dirty carpet and soft.  I am so disappointed.
Diamond Resorts is the worst company to deal with - all I have gotten is the run around, bullied, lied to - avoid this company.
Traveled to Sedona October 19. Very nice

review_title: After 7 years membership‚Ä¶now a disgruntled member
review_text: For the first 6 years (2013 - mid 2019) it was a worthwhile membership, with the most beneficial aspect being the attractive, inexpensive resort availability (cash option or points) offered to me under the Club Select program.  During this period, I rated my membership at 5 stars.However, changes implemented since late 2019 have now caused me to question the wisdom of my membership.  Unfavorable changes include discontinuance of former Club Select availability, and increases to most Diamond Loyalty Benefits fees, done surreptitiously without advance notification to membership.  The explanations offered after the fact were at best misleading, if not downright deceitful.  DR's explanation that discontinuance of the Club Select Program was to make searches simpler & easier for members, is at variance with my own personal experience.  The major difference that I can see is that resorts that were previously available to me for $400 - $ 500 were subsequently available to me through the simpler/easier search program for $2,000 - $4,000.  Aside from being much more costly, it was not even simpler or easier.  Simply put, it was a cash grab!!Resort availability now available to me through my DR points or cash options, are available to me through other agencies (RCI, II etc.) at much more affordable rates.I am now feeling more like a "cash cow" for DR, rather then as a valued member.It is still to be determined whether the new Destination Exchange Tier Program will be more of a benefit to me or to DR.  I recognize the obvious  benefit of deferring annual point usage into a 5 year time frame. However,  some of the limitations & restrictions in tier points leads me to believe that DR will ultimately prove to be the major benefactor through points still unused.Please feel free to share my review with all DR members.  I would welcome their comments, should they agree or disagree.

review_title: Cabo Azul resort in Baha Sur is‚Ä¶
review_text: Cabo Azul resort in Baha Sur is outstanding! The resort staff is above reproach. Ground are immaculately groomed and facilities are well maintained. Pool, food and beverages are all excellent! We. Return yearly because we enjoy it soooooo much.

review_title: While we enjoy Diamond Resorts and all‚Ä¶
review_text: While we enjoy Diamond Resorts and all the staff, from the top on down, are excellent, I do have to constructively criticize how they are dealing with ability to use points within assigned timelines during this period of the Covid-19 crisis.  More thought needed to go into how to allow for point carryover when they simply cannot be used and trips have been forced to be cancelled.  One specific example; we had booked Hawaii for a week in June.  During this period, Hawaii had a two week quarantine.  These points were impossible to use this year and have had to be sacrificed.

review_title: My stays at Grand Beach in Orlando
review_text: The employees are very friendly, helpful, professional and will do as much as they can to make your stay memorably. The rooms are very clean, neat and furnished to make your stay as comfortable as possible. You have on site parking, with swimming pools, hot tubs, tennis, basketball, fishing, grills for cooking along with more to do.

1)After signing up and taking money (as well as annual Maintenance Fees ) - Then continue to REDUCE or eliminate the benefits without any consideration for Owners2) Don‚Äôt tell me it is a ‚Äú Member Update‚Äù and ‚ÄúHow to best utilize point‚Äù..... Totally False.... 3) Owners are last in line!... Just ‚ÄúGive me your money!‚Äù4) Sales People are only about 5% truthful and no repercussions... Owners loose  5) Volunteered to be Beta Tester for Diamond System..... System needs to be more user friendly.   6) Reservation Protection‚Äî- Total BS! Used to be $75 a reservation and could change up to 24 hrs prior to arrival.... Now $120 per reservation or $499 for 1 year (FROM date of BOOKING... NOT arrival!) AND does NOT include any changes 30 days prior to arrival!    SO, how many people know if you will be sick, have a death in the family, or something else!   TOTALLY NOT what we purchased!!! Now, NOTHING we can do!!!  $$$$$$ 7) Oh... there‚Äôs more..... Frustrated and disappointed.
We love some resorts, others are in desperate need of updating. There is no consistency throughout the program. Availability is often a problem as well.

review_title: This is one of the few places that has‚Ä¶better than any
review_text: This is one of the few places that has gotten better and better over time. With the coronavirus being such a concern the resort here at Riviera Beach has shown all of the precautions necessary and then some.Management here really knows how to do it and it shows in the treatment that you receive as a guest.

review_text: The room was great and satisfied our request.  many of the non-pool areas were still shut down but we still had a relaxing time.  the beginning was a bit disappointing as the information I was given from the on-line gentleman who was helping me set up the reservation gave me information that was completely wrong about the status of the resort. review_title: Everything has been great so far
review_text: Everything has been great so far. The only thing that I have questions about is why can't our points be saved automatically. If it wasn't for the fact that I called to plan a vacation (a day before I would have lost my points) and the person that helped me happened to notice it I would have lost them.

review_text: I was very pleased that I was called back quickly and informed my request was satisfied and the new reservation was placed and the old one canceled. just as I had requested.

The customer service representative did an excellent job except she did not send the email confirmation that I requested nor did she send me the email follow up that she promised.  I had to go to the Diamond website and try to figure out if she accomplished what she said she would do.This seems to be an ongoing issue with a Diamond.  Only about 50% of the time can I get folks to send me email confirmations.  And often they do not even follow up with my requests.  The financial division also screws up my finances on a regular basis.Overall I give Diamond a two star rating and will never recommend purchasing to any of my friends...hum, maybe yes to my enemies!

We were promised by the person that sold us $63,000 worth of extra points that would bring us up to Diamond that he would be our "go to" person and be available if we emailed him.  He never responded for 2 months, after repeated emails and calls.In making future resort reservations (which he said he would assist with due to needing time for our points to be processed), it took me 4 calls with a wait time of about 20-40 minutes to finally get an answer to some questions.  I was transferred multiple times and 2 of the people had such heavy accents that I could barely understand (and I speak 5 languages).There is so much I could say about broken promises but I will end by saying that the ridiculous music/commentary that is used while people are put on hold (forever..) is condescending and boring and soooooooo repetitive.I was told by some of your staff that they too have to listen to it.I can't believe that you have to even use that time for a stupid sales pitch.

review_title: POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE , NOT THE HAPPIEST PLACE ON EARTH
review_text: Not happy , because of covic 19 this year , it isn't safe for my wife and I to travel. I called your corporates office customer service number , and waited on hold over thirty minutes . When your representative finally answered , she just made excuses and didn't take ownership of my situation . She advised me that if I didn't use my points I would lose them . I explained that being sixty-eight  years the Federal Government told me to stay at home . She could care less about my situation , so I asked for her supervisor , finally after much more discussion she transferred me . Your supervisor took ownership and transferred points to next year . BUT YOUR COMPANY WASTED ABOUT THREE HOURS OF MY TIME ! SHAME ON YOU !!!!

Every yr we would vacation at Cancun Resort in Nevada, this yr 2020 was the worst experience. June 18th, I made it in 2 hrs early before check in time so i went to do pre check-in. No room ready yet didn‚Äôt have what I requested for either (strip view) so I requested mountain view but she recommended pool view instead, I asked to be notify as soon as there‚Äôs a room available. Past 4 pm and no call, drove back to resort, finally got room key. Drove to garage to access elevator and there were puke by the door. Got to our floor, the hallway and room had bad odor thru out our entire stay. There were no sponge in the room, called customer service, they stated that they were out of stock which is not acceptable when inventories should be kept at par to maintain business. Saturday night june 20th, my daughter (5yrs old) came back to resort with her aunt and had to witness a drunk customer peeing by the garage elevator door. Unsanitary. Next morning, I was told of incident, i asked if it was reported, my sister said it must have cause another customer was there to point it out. I checked the area and didn‚Äôt look like it was clean or wash off.  Could had at least make it look deceit. Every time when i would call for supplies for room, there was alway something incorrect. Every night they‚Äôll be customers in parking lot drunk or walking around. Need better security system. We pay maintenance fee and for our timeshare every yr not to have a bad vacation experience. Please keep up to what is promise dream vacation when was first presented.
IGNORE TEXT

In August of 2018 my family vacationed in Florida, using my fatherinlaw‚Äôs Diamond resorts timeshare. We were required to attend a sales presentation. The agents gave us numbers that were way too high. We explained there was no way we could afford it, we were living paycheck to paycheck with 3 teenage daughters. The floor manager came back with something we thought we could afford and offered us a dream holiday for 2 people to go to Hawaii for free, including airfare. That was huge for us in making this decision. We said we would want to bring our kids too. They told us that we would just have to pay a few hundred dollars per kid. We were sold on the Dream vacation to Hawaii. We purchased 7500 points for a 10 year term product. They said it was a basic membership. Our monthly payment would be $207 a month and around $875 a year for maintenance fees. We didn‚Äôt have the money for the $3366 down payment, so they had us apply for a Barclaycard to charge $1959 down and finance the balance of the down payment at $214 a month for 6 months before starting loan payments. A few months later we called to book the trip to Hawaii. It was a nightmare. We could not have 5 people in the room for the ‚Äúfree‚Äù trip. We would have to get 2 rooms. It would cost anywhere from $4000 to $6000. I was more than irritated, let down mentally and felt taken advantage of. We were stuck, we signed on the dotted line. This trip was one of the main reasons we said yes to the timeshare. December of 2018 we accepted a free weekend getaway for the Red Lion in St. Louis supposedly to learn how to use our points. It was 4 months after we had purchased our timeshare. It ended up being a sales presentation. They are only interested in making more money not helping you to use the timeshare you own. In July of 1999 we booked a trip to Florida using my father in laws timeshare again.  We stayed at Mystic Dunes. One of the customer service girls said that if we met with the sales team we would get a free trip. I was angry. I wanted to cancel the membership. The Florida sales person informed us that we had purchased a starter plan that needed to be upgraded to full membership. He was confused because he couldn‚Äôt find us in the system. He said if we didn‚Äôt upgrade we would have wasted our money and wouldn‚Äôt be able to use our membership‚Äôs full potential. He said what we bought wasn‚Äôt even a real membership. Most things we wouldn‚Äôt be able to do. He said that if we upgraded, even if we didn‚Äôt go on trips every year, we could purchase airfare, gift cards, and get cash back. There were alot of options. We felt like we didn‚Äôt have much choice. We had paid so far about $6000 for what we were told was useless. We had to pay another $1200 for the down payment and other fees to upgrade. The program costs us double monthly than what we had been paying, and another large down payment was put on credit cards for basically the same amount of points. Our new payment is $408 a month and maintenance fees went up to $1856 a year. After upgrading the plan, we ended up with 22500 points. If we don‚Äôt use the points by the end of 2020 we will lose all but 7500 points. That is like losing 2 years of points. We have a wedding in Cancun scheduled for October of 2020. When I searched through diamond resorts there are no rooms available. When I searched online through Priceline, there were rooms available, when I worked through the resort they had rooms available. I am sick to my stomach. I can‚Äôt sleep and mentally struggle trying to figure out why we are going through this. We are honest, hard working people. We don‚Äôt deserve this. We have been scammed and lied to. What we had before was not worthless. We could have used that program. Instead we have an outstanding loan of $23516 as of May 2020.  We have paid in over $12000 past 2 years and have not been able to use our timeshare membership. All we have gotten from this membership is a huge headache and a lot of empty promises. I felt obligated because I signed on the dotted line but then realized these company ‚Äúconsultants‚Äù have been far from honest. I feel violated and honestly pretty angry. We have been lied to on so many different levelsIf you want to be lied to and cheated sign up for a timeshare with diamond resort. Worse decision of our lives..

Pool area was not washed down after the 2 hour change of people! Large groups still together and very few masks. Theres a large increase in Covid sadly!

All staff members wear masks and they enforce the maximum occupancy in the pool area. There is a pool attendant that wipes every seat and table down with cleaner once someone leaves. I can‚Äôt wait to come back!
