review_title: We love the resorts and customer service, BUT...
review_text: We love the resorts and customer service. We like the location of the resorts. We like the idea of a pre-paid vacation and forces you to vacation. We can never go back to a regular hotel room. Love the concept of a condo with cooking facilities and separate bedrooms. We do not like the high pressure sales and the nagging to attend an "update" which all know is a sales pitch. I hate coming to a resort to be hounded to do an update.I also don't like the high cost of the maintenance fees, when I can go on booking.com or timeshare rentals and get a unit for approximately the same cost as my timeshare ownership and not being connected with a timeshare and no way out.I don't like how the declining privileges of Platinum benefits.I don't like that when you turn a deeded unit into Club combinations and get a point value back, then DR turns around and rents it for double the amount of points.Is Diamond a good value for your money and an investment? Absolutely not.However it is an investment into vacations and the experience you get out of it which we enjoy our vacations. The other crap-not so much.

review_title: Nothing good to say about Diamond...
review_text: Owner updates are nothing more than a blatant upsell.  We have already used the Transitions program to divest ourselves of anything to do with Diamond.  Your sales practices are horrible an your sales people are shameless.

review_title: We always look forward to our stays at‚Ä¶
review_text: We always look forward to our stays at any of our locations.At check in We Do Not look forward to being  directed to the concierge. only to be tricked to try to sell us an upgrade. TOO much pressure, we have resorted not to answer calls where ever we stay.
Well kept and good customer service.

review_title: Diamond Resorts failed to record a Grant Deed
review_text: If i could assign negative stars i would. The problem is not resolved. The consequences of Diamond not recording the Grant Deed to a parcel we relinquished all interest in will affect our credit score among other things. As is typical when trying to resolve an issue with Diamond, the buck keeps passing from one person to another. Not recording a Grant Deed with the County is a huge mistake on their part.

You still owe me $178.  I have been calling and no one give me any answer.  Also Christina Herrera said I was suppose to get my 7 day vac for buying those stupied points and I still have not received the week that was promises.

review_title: If this is in response to my question‚Ä¶
review_text: If this is in response to my question regarding payment the answer is AWEFUL!  Didn‚Äôt even get response

Normally brilliant service , but I had an e-mail from a representative to get in touch with her about my reservation for my son , so I have rung her twice and also emailed her to her email address but have not had any reply .There is coved 19 that everyone is staying home to avoid but I still receive and answer my mails that I get from clients , so unless there is a reason she cannot answer I do not know what the problem is

review_title: Have left 3 messages with loyalty‚Ä¶no callback
review_text: Have left 3 messages with loyalty rewards dept, message says someone will call you back in 24 hours have received no phone call yet
Difficult to get time and venue I would likeI have difficulty understand some agents

review_title: I always love my stay at The Sedona‚Ä¶
review_text: I always love my stay at The Sedona Summit
Except for a few resorts, I feel like the resorts need big updates to them..  they don't seem to be in great shape.

Accomodations have always been outstanding- we have fewer points so we tend to use the program that provides Timeshare reductions in points if made within 60 days - we do not like the updates seminars during our stays and have stopped attending as the salesmen are pushy and want to keep u there - I do not need additional points as I also have RCI Timeshares

review_title: My home resort has gone down hill since‚Ä¶
review_text: My home resort has gone down hill since Diamond bought it.

We've stayed at Villa De Santa Fe, Santa Fe N.M. Not only is it walkable to the town square the Villa is beautiful and clean.  Santa Fe has free music in the Square & fantastic Festivals thru out the summer.  Also not to be missed are Canon Road Art Galleries and the near by Museums.  You must return to enjoy it all, we did !

Units are lovely, clean, and in nice areas. However Diamond needs to expand so that more resorts are available in different areas in the country especially near national parks. We have needed to rent VBRO‚Äôs many times due to this problem.

review_title: Year to year I find the rising costs of‚Ä¶
review_text: Year to year I find the rising costs of maintenance fees becoming prohibitive for us because we are on a fixed income. Each year it becomes more difficult and eventually not affordable. Not sure how to resolve this problem.

review_title: We had a great stay at Santa Fe
review_text: We had a great stay at Santa Fe. We would defiantly stay there again. Always clean well appointed condos with Diamond Resorts.

The resorts are great and located in some great vacation destinations. I have been from Orlando to Virginia to Vegas and Scottsdale. The selling and upgrading of ownership is tedious. I have been a member since 2012 and I love being an owner, but it seem like everytime I upgrade there's a promise or an incentive that is misexplain or left out when it's not necessary. Just tell me and be honest and I will be fine.

review_title: I was not able to get through for many‚Ä¶
review_text: I was not able to get through for many a day. After two hours I finally got through today. And they tell me they don‚Äôt have any space for me unless I want to go to a meeting. That‚Äôs not right.
We appreciate all you do during this Covid-19. Our safety and  you‚Äôre safety‚Äôs means the world to us.

review_title: I enjoy my time using my timeshare‚Ä¶
review_text: I enjoy my time using my timeshare membership. I do not enjoy the constant push to buy more points. Every time I book a stay, I am constantly called regarding an update. The incentives to attend are not worth the high pressure tactics and belittling when I say no.
Trusted vacation brand. Always a great experience.

We are snowbirds and like to spend the month of March at Grand Villa in Kissimmee,  Florida.   The resort is lovely and we really enjoy the location.  Resort is clean & well kept. Staff is friendly & helpful. The negative points are some people put towels on the lounge chairs & leave.  We can never find a seat!!!  Must be some way to correct this.  Wish the pool was a little warmer.  Livingroom furniture is very uncomfortable.  The gates at the pool clang very LOUDLY.  Very annoying while trying to relax at the pool & even worse for those staying in units near the pool.
Always helpful, friendly and quick to answer the phone.

review_title: Difficult to make reservations at Lake‚Ä¶
review_text: Difficult to make reservations at Lake Tahoe Vacation Club since this needs to be done via phone vs online.   Also, week requesting is never available

review_title: Glad you included Los Abrigados Resort‚Ä¶
review_text: Glad you included Los Abrigados Resort members in your membership group!
Anna was very patient, knowledgeable and answered all my questions. She gave excellent customer service!!!
The resorts are fine, but the way Diamond  treat the members is shocking!
Always clean and fresh.  Staff is always kind and willing to help. Our family loves it there

review_title: I love the resorts but several of the‚Ä¶
review_text: I love the resorts but several of the amenities and programs have been removed.    Seems more problems having been popping up. I absolutely hate having to deal with "an update" every time we go some where.

The members services keep being  reduced without clear communication or understanding why they are. I am paying for a service that is no longer available.   The travel service web page does not work.  Have tried numerous times. The site seems like it is working until the final submit button and the there is an error that the reservation did not process. This has been going on for years.The resorts are very nice and the people are also very accommodating
friendly, but availabity was very limited.

Diamond tries very, very hard to help. However, unless they are gaining money, they will do nothing.  When you do gain something, you lose 2 or 3 b other things but you don't know that until you try to go on vacation.

The properties are usually nice and as Platinum members we can usually get the units and properties of our choice.  However, our sales experience (owner updates) over the last 12 months have clearly soured our outlook on Diamond.  We unnecessarily purchased more points, exit and then have to re-enter our preferred collection ("ping pong") based on (to be charitable) false information. Additionally, we also purchased a sampler based on false information about DRI "buy back" policy that would be implemented.  These along with un-anounced  upgrade cost increases and undue pressure on my wife cause us to give this rating. If not for the actual sites and properties, the rating would be one star. Unfortunately the pledge for transparency etc. did not apply to our recent experiences.

We did not buy additional points based on the giant lies Given at the presentation.  Actually we were going to upgrade to gold based on our presentation.  The closers could not meet what was promised.  For your information....there is no buyout for seniors and you can‚Äôt pay for annual fees based on points.
I love Diamond Resorts. The staff is extremely professional and competent! Always satisfied with My experiences with them.

review_title: The interests of the members come second
review_text: The interests of the members come second to profit motives of the company. This is not a owner friendly company.

review_title: I have always been a supporter of the‚Ä¶
review_text: I have always been a supporter of the timeshare option due to the safety, quality of the properties and the consistency of what to expect.The Diamond Resorts point program offers me flexibility and I am impressed with the ongoing efforts to move with the changing times, the needs of both us the users and DRI.

review_title: I would describe my personal experience‚Ä¶
review_text: I would describe my personal experience with Diamond Resorts as the worst decision of my life. I purchased more points after struggling to find availability, just to find out my yearly maintenance fees would more than double. I see the resorts availability on websites like Expedia, Booking.com, etc. , when these travelers don‚Äôt have to pay for maintenance or resort fees. Extremely frustrating.  Talk about the rip off when it comes to your loan, regardless of credit score, the interest rates are just outrageous! I called the customer service and finance department just to be told I can apply for a home equity loan to pay them off. They want me to go into more debt just to pay them off. I applied for the transitions program after the loss of income and was told I could only return the membership that had already been paid off. How is having the payment of the outstanding loan and increasing maintenance fees help a customer who is struggling. Would I ever recommend Diamond Resorts, easy NO. Why would I feel comfortable telling someone I know to fall for an endless pit of fraud.

review_title: Ordered product after two months it has‚Ä¶
review_text: Ordered product after two months it has not arrived. Understand it is a difficult time. They have contacted us twice to change order and then canceled part of the order.  Would appreciate an offer to have money returned.  Not a positive experience.

I enjoy going to PVC Roundhouse for our local getaways and would give PVC 5 stars!However,  as a timeshare holder i would not recommend Diamond Resorts because you rent out for less money to the general public for a stay at PVC!  What is the benefit for us as owners then?

Covid 19 provides unusual circumstances so I appreciated no hassles, fees, etc. with cancelling reservations later than that original deadline. Let's see if the 5 star rating holds up when it comes time to rebook--I'm optimistic

I do not like the pressure to buy when attending Owner's Review. DR should be nicer to owner's,  so that owner's don't form doubts about their initial purchase.Unfortunately it is VERY DIFFICULT to sell, once you buy! I have had some very vice vacations through DR and Interval Intl and hope to continue to do so.

Front desk was very friendly. Responded promptly to our requests for info and more supplies. Cleaning staff friendly too but could spend more time with unit cleanup. Floors did not seem like they were vacuumed at all. Outside area clean and well maintained. Ample parking. Should have more 3 bedroom units. All in all great experience. Our guests were pleased. Will go back.
Lovely properties, great amenitites, wonderful staff!

review_title: New website was easier to use than‚Ä¶
review_text: New website was easier to use than previous version from a booking perspective.  Would like to have floor plans and more pictures of the units when I drill down into the property information.

My time share annual fees have more than doubled under Diamond management.  The last time I stayed in the Sedona area I was offered an app for discounts at restaurants through out the US.  I preferred the old paper discount coupons for the area restaurants.  It seems to be much harder to book a stay now compared to a couple years ago.  I used to be able to book a room when traveling the same day using so many points a night.  Now you need to book at least 48 hours out.  Truly shameful. If a room is available as I travel through an area for that night or a couple of nights I ought to be able to use my points the same day to book verses it going empty.  The old matrix for viewing availability worked well also.  I don't care to waste my time with Diamond representatives on up grading how to get the most out of my points because it ends up being pressured to expand points and spend more fees.
Just booked two resorts today. Ready to get  out of town and do something fun.

review_title: My biggest disappointment is to not‚Ä¶
review_text: My biggest disappointment is to not have the Bed linens changed midweek by housekeeping as a free Service. That is important as a service to guests.
Kohl's Ranch was beautiful! Everything was clean, well cared for and convenient. The staff was friendly and helpful.
Teressa was excellent. Helpful. Superior customer service.

We were Scammed  In the past year, we feel that we have been scammed into purchasing more points, with promises such as we will be paying too much maintenance if we don't upgrade to, unless we upgrade we won't be able to sell our timeshare.Now we have a huge payment due on the Barclay's cards we were talked into getting and we don't know where we will get the money to pay that bill. And "NO" we do not want a high interest mortgage from Diamond. In over 50 years of marriage we have never before felt that we were in a position not to be able to pay our bills.
Trying to talk to someone. Was told I would hear back in 72 hours and that was a week ago.

review_title: We have enjoyed traveling but are now‚Ä¶
review_text: We have enjoyed traveling but are now so that we have so much money in this endeavor.
We use our membership frequently. Biggest concern is the dishonest sales reps and there is always a new gimmick. The lying reps should be fired and you know who they are.
As always, Diamond goes above and beyond!

I spent 28 minutes on hold. The agent I first reached, said her system was very slow and she said she would transfer me to another agent. Before I could say anything, I was placed on hold for another 21 minutes. That was unacceptable!Louis Hahn
We love going there. Our favorite place. The only thing we wish was that the restaurant stayed open  longer. An some of the rooms need to be updated. The carpets are old an tiles are cracked.
The lady that helped me was very nice. Best service I have had with Diamond!

We booked to stay in the diamond resort in Costa Adeje in Tenerife. Due to COVID19 our flights were cancelled. I had read on the website that they waving cancellation policy as we had booked non refundable. I was concerned there would be an issue though. How wrong was I, I called customer services and got through within minutes, I spoke to a lovely lady who reassured me that we would get a refund (our contract for our booking didn‚Äôt say they had to). We received our refund within 10 days as promised, still haven‚Äôt had anything from Ryanair! Really impressed with how they dealt with this horrendous global crisis! Will definitely be rebooking once this is all over. Thank you Diamond Resorts :)
Response time was quick.  Available rooms were available.  Agent was very helpful and met all of my expectations. I was very pleased.
Good quality accommodation

review_title: Fairly easy instructions and glad to‚Ä¶
review_text: Fairly easy instructions and glad to save paper

review_title: Diamond Resorts team members are not‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond Resorts team members are not returning our phone calls!

Me wife and I bought into this for $10,000. We never used it, not once. Diamond Resorts for months wouldn‚Äôt do anything to allow us to leave the contract. We couldn‚Äôt sell the ‚Äúshares‚Äù, no one wanted to buy them. Finally, after writing to their ceo, they agreed to cancel our contract, charged us a fee for this and gave us zero back for our $10,000. They can put the yearly fees up as much as they want, regardless of whether you stay anywhere and they keep on accumulating..Stay clear of these conmen.

We've enjoyed our stays, but we are very disappointed in the devious ways that you attempt to get owners to buy more points.  You exert very high pressure and do not respect the wishes of owners to terminate the "update" sessions.  They are not "update" sessions...the are coercion to have you buy more points!!!  We will never go to another "update" session in the future.

review_title: No Customer Service from Diamond Resorts!
review_text: I have made two complaints about customer service to Diamond Resorts and they don't respond to emails after the initial contact. I made a complaint in December 2019, got an email and then spoke to another agent who said she would look into my complaint further and I have heard nothing. Previously in the summer of 2019 I sent four messages on the membership page under "Contact Us" and never received a response or acknowledgement. Customer Service is a disgrace and it is the lack of response that makes one think that all Diamond Resorts is interested in is getting you on the hook and then you can't get anyone to talk to you. The company should be ashamed of themselves.

review_title: I really  like Knorr Khar a lot
review_text: I really  like Knorr Khar a lot. Wonderful to work with and prompt with getting back. He is great

review_title: I have been trying to contact Diamond Resorts
review_text: I have been trying to contact Diamond Resorts Dept that gave us 4-Day/3-Night at GreenSprings for the past (3) weeks that due to the State of VA ‚ÄúMandatory Travel Restriction‚Äù we would not be able to attend our booked date 5/19-5/22 & need to either re-schedule or refund $100.To this date, I have not reached any live person or after leaving numerous messages on different phone lines, no person has replied to me. I did however get my ‚ÄúPoints‚Äù returned from our scheduled ‚ÄúMemorial Day Family Reunion‚Äù week from 5/22-5/29 to re-schedule. Your promotions department has done a horrible job of returning calls or contacting me via E-mail on my request. Yours Truly K.S.

review_title: My daughter and I have nothing but good‚Ä¶
review_text: My daughter and I have nothing but good things to say about our experience at the Grand Villas Resort in  Orlando. Everyone was courteous and friendly. Thank you

Scottsdale links, ArizonaRequested ground floor since no elevators. No problems. Pool for. My grandchildren was heated so pleasant in late January. Grounds per all Diamond resort properties was immaculate and pleasant. Close to amenities. Staff so very helpful. Very kind to my grandchildren. They have activities for all age groups. Planning return trip.

review_title: The Coronavirus has brought out the‚Ä¶
review_text: The Coronavirus has brought out the worst in Diamond. I tried numerous attempts to contact a real person and got no response. Phone calls, emails, nothing!I am a Gold member, but have remaining Sampler points that I need to use. No response, no contact!

review_title: Required to attend a sales presentation‚Ä¶
review_text: Required to attend a sales presentation and having to deal with pushy sales people while on vacation is not our idea of a vacation.

review_title: You've got good people working for‚Ä¶
review_text: You've got good people working for you,,,But I get it's just about the money for you upper crustsand that's disappointing because I have to now pay on top of my dues because they won't cover a studio weekPlus, I have not been able to get  a Los Abrigados studio (which I bought!!) for over ten years now, thanks for what !??Signed a disgruntled customer ready to sellGreg S

Extremely disappointed!!!! Have been waiting for a call back on a recent purchase inquiry in Feb 2020 at Polo Towers in Las Vegas for over 10 weeks now!!!! Have tried contacting you SEVERALl times, left messages, no return call!!!! Starting to feel you could care less about us and only care about your company!!! (I understand the whole travel world is turned upside down at the moment but feel as if you have kicked up to the curb. We have been faithful, reliable Diamond members for several years now and are extremely DISAPPOINTED!!!!!! Prior to this current ordeal we have always given you FIVE STARS!!!! This is truly heart breaking to us.
Always ask how you can get out this investment. No way out. Think about it.

review_title: When I went to Europe it was great
review_text: When I went to Europe it was great! Had really nice rooms! Cost was nice too!

Every time we have gone for an update we get pressured to purchase more points.  Everyone is real nice at first and if you say no to a purchase, everything changes. sales people become rude. With the pandemic we have not gotten to use our time share this year....so $4,000 dollars in maintenance fees that we can not afford now that we are not working.  I do not know when we will feel safe to use the points we have paid dearly for.  We are thinking we might have to give our timeshare up next year.
The Point at Poipu, in Kauai, Hawaii, is a very good place to stay!  The suites are spacious, comfortable, and well provisioned. The grounds are lovely and the views are magnificent!

review_title: Love My Points Which I Use in Sedona
review_text: I usually go to Los Abrigados in Sedona, Arizona.  Love it - wonderfully beautiful place, centrally located with great resort amenities and staff.  Marcos, the manager, goes out of his way.  As a Silver member, I have extra perks, such as the 14 nights of upgrades, and I often go during the week at a bargain.  It's great also to share my reservations with others.

review_title: The stay at a Diamond resort is‚Ä¶
review_text: The stay at a Diamond resort is typically enjoyable. The rooms and facilities are clean and well maintained. However, a member must be willing to tolerate the "sell" every time you decide to utilize a resort.Gets a little old and annoying.

review_title: Regretting our our purchase - not sure who or what to believe.
review_text: The website is terrible.  Resorts show availability and when we call back, they are full.  When we upgraded to Platinum, we were told we‚Äôd have one point of contact to work with.  No such person has been assigned. During our last our purchases, we were not given the option of selecting a collection.  We heard from other representatives that we should have chosen the Hawaii Collection in order to not be assessed for the hurricane damage at one resort.  We‚Äôve heard too many different stories or pitches from different sales personnel and don‚Äôt know who  or what to believe.We‚Äôre frustrated and regret our purchase.

I have enjoyed travelling to Arizona over the last 25 years and staying at my timeshare. I know timeshares get a black eye over maintenance fees, but if you choose to experience the different places to visit, they leave lasting memories. Covid has pushed our family vacation back a few months, but can't wait to experience Sedona and Scottsdale in August

review_title: We cancelled trip due to corona virus‚Äôs
review_text: We cancelled trip due to corona virus. Should add one more option  on the evaluation questionnaire .
Costs go up every year, number of available properties goes down. Way too many "use your points plus x amount of dollars for luxury items"  This is not what we want , or were promised

We visited Williamsburg, Va. and we had a wonderful experience. We were able to get accommodations on the first floor as climbing stairs was difficult for one of our family members. The staff was courteous and professional and very helpful. The resort was clean and inviting. There are lots of activities and restaurants close by. It is always a great experience.
IGNORE TEXT
Excellent facility conditions. WiFi is spotty on some properties. Tired of the BS ‚Äúupdate meting‚Äù hard sells.

review_title: I was at The Links for a week and then‚Ä¶
review_text: I was at The Links for a week and then over 5 weeks at Villa Mirage. I would suggest that you make every effort possible at the Links to put requests for 1st floor available to especially those over 70 years of age. When I arrived I requested 1st floor and had been put on 3rd. It was worked out to put me on 2nd floor. Otherwise, my stay was very good. The staff was helpful and friendly.While I was at Villa Mirage I enjoyed the guests and the staff. The front desk staff were always helpful and friendly. Bill, the front desk manager, is a gem. Make sure you do not loose him!

review_title: Diamond Resorts is wonderful for families
review_text: Diamond Resorts is a big corporation with a lot of divisions because they have a lot to offer. If you can be patient and get through the organizational part of it when you get to one of the resorts you will not be sorry. Our family loves diamond resort,  there‚Äôs tons to do for kids everything from tie-dye to horseshoes to minigolf to beautiful pools and spas lovely accommodations. Most rooms have some sort of eating facilities to make meal time a little easier on families that are traveling. Getting involved with Diamond Resort was one of the best decisions I have ever made. With their legacy program you you work hard for it but then you can pass it on like the rest of your estate to your children and grandchildren so it is a wonderful wonderful program. We love our Diamond Resort membership and we plan to stay vacation for life.
Simply awesome, everytime, everyplace!  The perfect rest get away.  Relaxing fun-filled break from the hectic world of today!!!  My go to spot.

review_title: honestly its streamly difficult to book‚Ä¶
review_text: honestly its streamly difficult to book anything. Doesnt matter how in advance I do it.

Although we enjoy many of the sites we visit, we discourage all of our friends, family and acquaintances from buying into Diamond.  The unethical behavior of the Marketing and Sales group is worse than anything we've experienced in our lives.

review_title: Going to Sedona in April/May or Oct/Nov‚Ä¶
review_text: Going to Sedona in April/May or Oct/Nov is fantastic.  The weather is perfect and the many hiking trails are even better than those in Moab, in my opinion.  Sometimes the road traffic and trails can get busy, but there are so many places to go that you can avoid the crowds, especially if you hike by 8am or so.  There is an assortment of great restaurants of all types.  Some are very expensive, but there are lots that I find very reasonable and serve really tasty meals.  There are many places to stay, but I enjoy staying at the Summit, on the West side of town.  In addition to Sedona, there are many great attractions to visit within an hours drive, especially going West and South.

review_title: Diamond resorts doesn't seem to care
review_text: I have tried contacting Diamond resorts in Sedona AZ about a reservation on May 30. I know the property is closed now and have been told by Interval International that it might open May 22. My frustration is that you have nobody assisting people in my situation... phone calls and messages are unanswered, chat lines provide no response, phone answering services at the facility are circular and hang up on you. I would expect better customer service from a company like yours. So many others have adapted by allowing employees to work from home to maintain a connection with their customers. It is like you just gave up!

review_title: We love the Los Abrigados Resort.
review_text: We love the Los Abrigados Resort and staff!HATE the pressure to attend the owners meetings. Have bad experiences with them. We‚Äôll refuse to attend another.

Excellent for our vacation. Central location for parks and town. Room & common areas all clean, pleasant. Large pool. Kitchenette included pans, dishes, tableware, icemaker in refrig, 2-burner stove top. Staff very pleasant & helpful.  Several local sites not yet open as Covid regs lifted just 2 days prior.

review_title: Once was a great company... not so much anymore...
review_text: "Sell, sell, sell" that is the motto at Diamond Resorts! Or maybe it is called Diamond Resorts because they want all the diamonds (money) that their owners have... and then they keep cutting the things that we actually like getting, such as the Interval International Membership included... also they actively reduce the usability of many of their properties kitchens and other areas. They take items we like and remove them, then replace them with crap. They provide WiFi {sort of} and not a wired connection like other hotels and resorts do, they have "smart" TV's that don't connect to the internet.The Company obviously cares more about their shareholders than their owners... which in my mind is backwards, in fact they should have made the "Points" equal to "Shares" in the company. If it were a true "ownership" that is how it would be.

I bought my membership at the Polo Towers, Las Vegas. I love Vegas and I really like the Polo Towers. BUT then I went to Orlando with three friends.  It could be a great resort but it is way too big (lots of 10+ stories buildings) where management believes elevator maintenance is not necessary.  My friends and I have mobility problems so I requested a first floor unit. Was placed on the third floor but were told it was a handicap unit by the elevator.  BUT the elevator nearest to our unit only worked the day we arrived!  Three flights of stairs was a killer for us! Management then told us to 'use the stairs or the elevator at the other end." For us it was a 10-15 minute walk and it worked only about half of the time!  AND WORST: they have a humongous staff in Sales (should move some to Maintenance!).  They held me there for several hours for the required presentation. The reps were rude, did not answer my questions and DID NOT GIVE ME THE PROMISED GIFT!  Gave me a $100 credit voucher to present during check-out but at check-out they would not accept it.  I called my contact at Polo Towers, left several messages but she never returned my call. During the Sales pitch when I bought, I was told they never say NO to a member. In Orlando we never heard a YES from Diamond staff.  I AM SO DISAPPOINTED; I WISH I HAD NOT BECOME A MEMBER.

review_title: Diamond Resorts Sampler does not respond to our call
review_text: We need to contact the Diamond Resorts Sampler department to adjust our travel plan due to COVID-19.  In the sampler program, you cannot cancel or book online by yourself; all needs to go through a representative by phone.  We have called them on daily basis for 3 weeks and left numerous voice messages, but no one calls us back yet.  Can someone advise how we can get help from the diamond sampler department to cancel and re-book our vacations?  Would really appreciate any help.

review_title: Trash company that doesn't care about‚Ä¶
review_text: Trash company that doesn't care about customers.  Do not recommend booking with them.  Changes due to Covid-19 and they will still take your money.

review_title: the presentations are what I hate ,they‚Ä¶
review_text: the presentations are what I hate ,they always try to upsell
Diamond is not customer friendly. I have had recent travel problems through no fault of my own and the Diamond reps would not helpful at all.
Class operation and locations/accommodations

review_title: Grande Villas in Orlando is our second‚Ä¶
review_text: Grande Villas in Orlando is our second home, we love it .

review_title: Diamond Resorts are beautiful and well kept
review_text: I enjoy our resorts very much. Everyone is exceptional except salespeople.

The accommodations are very nice.  The amenities are very good.  The only problem is with the sales force.  It is hard to get an answer from anyone if you have a problem.  If you call, they say you have to talk to your property sales force & at the property they don't have an answer.  The right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing.

review_title: Pressure salesmen continue try to get‚Ä¶
review_text: Pressure salesmen continue try to get you to upgrade. Too expensive.Better to NOT have a timeshare.

Rooms are good, clean and spacious. The pool areas are packed with people saving their chairs starting before 7 am and some not showing up until mid afternoon, against rules - but no one supervises this. The one pool has 3 private cabanas set up for rental - they are never used and take up valuable space where more lounge chairs could be used. The "owner's update" was misleading from the VIP Reception through to the update itself. We were very frustrated and are not willing to go to one again. The stay overall was OK, but improvements are required.

review_title: We have been very pleased with the‚Ä¶
review_text: We have been very pleased with the resorts but not the sales pitches pushed at each visit.
Less Bang for the Buck.  Maintenance fees are way too high

review_title: Cabo Azul is the most Spectacular‚Ä¶Spectacular resort I‚Äôve ever been to in the 35 years that I have owned timeshare.
review_text: Cabo Azul is the most Spectacular resort I‚Äôve ever been to in the 35 years that I have owned timeshare.

review_title: We have attended many update meetings‚Ä¶
review_text: We have attended many update meetings for Diamond Resort owners at various locations.  Many of them have been enjoyable, and at others we have been lied to.  While our accommodations have been nice for the most part, our accommodations associated with the sampler have been sub par.  In one case we were in a condo that had no windows in the living room or kitchen and our room overlooked the parking lot even though we were in the beautiful Smokey Mountains.  More recently we were in a condo in Lake Tahoe where the only access to the shower was through a deep jacuzzi tub.  No, we are not happy with Diamond Resorts.
Relatively nice facilities. Periodically hard to reserve.

review_title: the quality of resorts is very uneven‚Ä¶
review_text: the quality of resorts is very uneven and service is indifferent. What makes it worse is that Diamond Resorts keeps upping maintenance fees and trading points.
Diamond properties are lovely, however I have NEVER be able to 'stay vacationed'.  The tag line should be 'stay presented'.  Every stay except one has been linked to a sales presentation. I'm done.

review_title: Wish we never purchased Diamond Resorts Timeshare
review_text: We were led to believe our purchased Diamond points would secure much better locations than we are able to get for one year‚Äôs points. We can‚Äôt get rid of our ownership. Points per resort go up and up, taxes and dues go up and up, but our value drops to lesser and lesser quality. When we attend a seminar about our ownership, we are practically held hostage while they try to sell us more points to get places we were told our original purchase would be enough for. They are pushy, and misleading. Only by enormous effort are we able to use our annual point allotment without having to save two year‚Äôs points to get a half decent place to stay. This is our worst Timeshare ownership!

Sea of Cortez beach club is a small quaint resort! The staff at this resort are exceptional! We have stayed here months at a time and the staff treats us like family. We plan on going back this fall. It is just a great resort with great location and great staff!

review_title: We always have a great time at the KBC
review_text: We always have a great time at the KBC. As a platinum member I think it should be easier to get reservations. Of course now with COVID who knows what will be happening in the travel industry

review_title: Beauty & Comfort in Cave Creek, Arizona
review_text: First, the Coronavirus has had a big impact on our travel plans this year, pretty much knocking them out.  Our last trip to a Diamond Resort was in November of last year, when we spent five days at the lovely Rancho Manana Resort in Cave Creek.  The rooms were large, comfortable, well-appointed and with breath-taking views of the Arizona desert and the golf course.  Without question we'll return to Rancho Manana.

review_title: Always very nice places to stay.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Some resorts need a lot of work
review_text: I can't give any more than this amount of stars because some of the resorts are great but some are in need of a lot of work.  Also, I can't travel anymore due to health reasons but my membership is paid off.  Diamond still wants a large amount of money from me (which I don't have) in order to dissolve the membership so I wouldn't advise anyone to purchase from them.

Stuck forever! Great facilities/resorts, but NOT great representation. No matter the level you "own" you are always being pressured to attend more sales meetings. Maintenance fees go up and level of service goes down. ANYTHING told to you (be SURE it's in writing). Not in the contract: it doesn't exist! Already a member and don't want to attend another sales meeting ("owner update"); don't expect ANY service.

review_text: We appreciate adding the ability to "roll" points into the new program (not Interval International) but am a bit disappointed that it costs additional fees. We will be unable to use a large number of points this year - because of the COVID-19 crisis. We already paid fees for these points and now will have to pay more to use them.

review_title: I found this to be very confusing

review_title: I was able to reschedule my vacation‚Ä¶
review_text: I was able to reschedule my vacation easily and without charge in less than 5 minutes on the phone.

Too expensive, no way to get out, and short stays are hard to find.  Resorts are generally nice, but paid way too much.  Wanna get out by returning all points/obligation to Diamond, like other clubs allow.

review_title: Most Diamond Resort properties are OK‚Ä¶
review_text: Most Diamond Resort properties are OK but not as nice as some others I have visited (e.g., Marriott, Consolidated Resorts).  Like most timeshares, they are always trying to sell you more and have no problem using deceptive techniques to seal the deal.  It is difficult to reserve the property you want when you want it.  Diamond Luxury Homes used to have a lot of good properties available but booking was a chore. Now they don't have a good selection of properties, and I don't know whether booking has improved.

review_title: The overall experience has been very‚Ä¶
review_text: The overall experience has been very good however the choice of European and in particular UK resorts seems to be reducing.Could really do with more UK. France. Germany resortsIn general the resort accommodations are very good/excellent.All staff, including phone calls excellent.

review_title: The Club doesnt value its members
review_text: The Club doesnt value its members. It wants to grow the club , but then once you're a member, they dont offer consistent service. I never get the same answer twice to my question and am unable to go to Resorts because there's never availability. If the properties are awesome , but you cant get there, what's the point?!

Diamond Resorts properties are pretty nice but the constant sales pressure is irritating. We spend more on annual fees than the room stays are worth and there's no way out. Don't ever buy a time share.
Clean rooms, Easy and quick check-in and Check-out, Nice activity area,(and with free coffee too). We were in Las Vegas for 12 days but were homeward bound before COVID-19 became a problem.

review_text: I was Lied to Buy one of your salesman up at Lake Tahoe. I will never buy another point from you guys ever please don‚Äôt even ask me to the next time I go somewhere. I think it‚Äôs a crying shame when you can‚Äôt trust anybody in this whole world.

review_text: Oversold me pointsNo offer to defer points when Covid restrictions lifted.No offer to defer huge loan payments or part during pandemic when unemployed.Outrageous interest charges.No contact with my Gold concierge.I expected much better quality of service from Diamond!

You are over pricedPlaces are misrepresented-in a bad wayYour sales people are horrible and lieIf I could give you a minus 10 I would

review_title: The constant focus on selling us up via‚Ä¶
review_text: The constant focus on selling us up via VIP check in is a huge distraction. Leave your members alone. We joined to vacation, not listen to sales pitch.

review_title: Bought sampler package for $4,000 as we‚Ä¶
review_text: Bought sampler package for $4,000 as we travel 6 to 7 times per year.  Each resort picked was only suppose to have a 45 minute presentation.  You have to fight to get out after two hours.  The rooms you get are the least desirable in the resort and they go down in quality as you decline their offers.  They show you top quality resorts they claim you have access to, only if you pay top dollar and that is only on rare availability.  So to be nice I would have to say that my experience with diamond is mediocre at best.  If you want to get into the time share business go Hilton or Marriott, better quality but more expensive.  Better yet save your money and just pay as you go using Orbitz or Expedia.

review_title: We enjoy our membership and have been‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoy our membership and have been to many places that we might not otherwise have visited and enjoyed.  We just have to keep reminding ourselves how the annual dues and constant "presentations" and "updates" relate to what we might have been spending to have the same quality of accommodations.  DRI is working to change this-- not all the way there yet, but getting better.

review_title: We had good experiences in Sedona at‚Ä¶
review_text: We had good experiences in Sedona at the two resorts we stayed in, namely Los Abrigados and the Bell Rock Inn. We stayed strong during the checkin process and didn't go to the so called update without going to the proposed events. The hiking was awesome.

review_title: You are very pleasant and friendly and‚Ä¶
review_text: You are very pleasant and friendly and fast service and always clean and good services and need to lower maintenance fees.

One was my 93 yr. old Mother-in-Law and another was my disabled son. We called Diamond hoping they would let us rescind our purchase. We were I believe 2 to 3 days past our 14 days. Diamond refused to let us rescind. Being a Diamond member this to me said a lot about how they treat members after the fact!Michael A. Miller815-744-7093

But service seems to diminish once they have your money.  At least on the sales side.

review_text: My most significant issues with Diamond are:1) High pressure sales. Get so tired of going to a Diamond location and having to set through a high pressure sales meeting. I have a family budget and know what I can afford.2) After retirement I had plans to travel and saw Diamond as leverage to help me stay in places with top notch accommodations which is very important to me. However, my wife now has health issues and is unable to travel under normal conditions. So I now find my self just paying high maintenance fees and not being able to utilize my points. Looking for a way out of my contract. Diamond not a good fit for me at this time. 3) Inability to make reservations at Diamond sites that I would like to visit. There is always no availability. 4) I will have to admit that if a person has the finances with the ability and freedom to travel at will, Diamond is a great way to accomplish this.

review_title: Diamond Resorts Timeshares - A Rewarding Experience
review_text: I have been a member of DIamond Resorts for over 12 years and have traveled throughout the country quite a bit.  The quality of their resorts is exceptional and the staff is always very courteous.  I often take family members with me on our trips and they have loved it.  It has given me the opportunity to travel more than I would have expected and in a way it really enforces that you take vacations or you lose points - some - it motivates you.  I've traveled to Hawaii several times and quite a bit in the midwest and southeastern US and honestly, if I did not have this, I'm not sure I ever would have visited some of the places I've been or stayed in the quality resorts.  Yes, there are rules and you have to sometimes work a bit to book what you want and where you want it, but be flexible and you can create a memorable vacation.  Sometimes it takes a bit of work to get what you want, but in the end, I have always been satisfied.

review_title: The Diamond Resorts - the good and the bad
review_text: The Diamond Resorts Are top notch places but are extremely limited when it comes to locations in the Northwest US. We have always enjoyed our stays at the Diamond properties but have a more limited experience at affiliates. Maintenance is always going to be a big issue as the hounding of an owners update, refresh or what should really be termed as sales presentations.

Also, it is very irritating when I request a resort for a certain date there is not available, but I can book the same hotel/dates on Expedia or other booking sites for less than I have paid in fees to DR.  It takes two years or more to accumulate enough points for an exchange (most times).  Whenever I go to an owner update meeting (which is just a high pressured sales pitch), I'm told my "level" is old and I need to update by buying more points ($35,00 to $45,000) more.  Never again. No more exchanges, meetings nor am I going to pay any more maintenance fees.

Received a call April 22, 2020 where the caller left a message with my daughter to call back. OUR TIMESHARE WAS FOR MAY 8-15, 2020. Upon returning the call I was told our home resort was closed they put me on hold and said they would check into a sister resort. They came back on the line and said there was no sister resort. We would have to bank our week with DestinationXchange.com another racket. There are no government mandated  shelter in place orders or restrictions in the area of our home resort. My grandparents were initial owners and were consulted on design during construction @ 1979. They then said that the resort amenities were closed as well. When asked if they were to refund our maintenance, cleaning and lodging fees since they have closed with no governmental mandatory restrictions, they indicated the only way to save our week was to join, and at our expense the Destinationxchange.com of course owned by them and then pay an additional exchange fee to them for their ability to deny us access to our already paid for timeshare. There is no recourse. We are not members of any exchange... and from the looks of this site only invited, highly satisfied or compensated reviewers can place anything greater than two stars.  Our maintenance fees went up 53% when Diamond Resorts took over our resort in 2019. Sold out by the board of directors on that deal. Again likely  compensated under the table...Your 4 star reviews are those compensated individuals. DO NOT GET HOSED, STEER CLEAR...!

I‚Äôve stayed at the Ridge in Sedona on several occasions and have always felt it is the most enjoyable Diamond property in Sedona. This past March I was there for a week and felt something had changed. No mid-week housekeeping service. Bags of trash left outside my door sat there for several days until I finally flagged down someone from housekeeping and asked that the trash be picked up. The television in the living room of my unit only worked intermittently. I had the TV in the bedroom so didn‚Äôt bother to have the maintenance staff look at the TV. A minor issue, but the cooking utensils didn‚Äôt work well with the flat-top induction surface of the stove. Bottoms of pans were warped so cooking was tricky. I used the grill outdoors several times. At least one of the grills near my unit was operational. The other grill would not light resulting in a bit of competition for grill space. I was impressed that electric car charging is now available, but felt that having the heavy-duty charging cord draped across the walk way was a bit dangerous. There was  no lack of attention when I walked into the resort lobby with staff trying to convince me to attend an ‚Äúowner update‚Äù at every encounter, even though I repeatedly told them that I was not at the resort with the co-owner.  I‚Äôm probably just being picky, but it just seemed to me that attention to detail is not what it used to be at this Diamond property.

review_title: We have stayed at more than three‚Ä¶
review_text: We have stayed at more than three Diamond-run resorts in the past two years. Two of them were places where we had stayed before they were managed by Diamond. In both of those resorts we saw a marked improvement in the way the resort  looked and the enjoyment of our stay.There were more services offered, better accommodations, extra maid service, and attentive employees. We realize that these niceties come with a slightly higher maintenance cost, but after all, they are supposed to be ‚Äú resorts‚Äù not just a hotel room In a pinch. The improvements Diamond makes at the places we have stayed make it seem like a true luxury vacation, not just another do-it-yourself hotel vacation.

review_title: I don't like the way diamond resorts‚Ä¶

review_text: The resort in Scottsdale was fantastic. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They made sure that all the services were explained and available,they were very helpful in recommending places to go,eat and shop. I am definitely recommending Diamond Resorts to family and friends.

Very hard to book resorts on where we want to travel. And the maintenance fees are too high. Now with the "new exchange" plan, it's going to costs us MORE money. Also, when staying at a resort, the constant harassing to see the "owner updates".

Too expensive, too pushy, and the maintenance fees are waaaaay to high for what your getting! It would be much cheaper to rent...the places are nice if you can ever find availability! They tell you one thing when you meet, but once they got you...they got you and keep changing and charging more and more, but you get nothing more out of it, just less and less in your bank account! If I could go back in time, I would have NEVER COMMITTED to this crap! Hope that helps...

review_title: We love our Diamond Resort ownership
review_text: We love our Diamond Resort ownership.  Resorts are clean and well kept up.  Staff is friendly.  Our only complaint is that some resorts are hard to get reservations at.  Would also love to see them add resorts in some states like Texas, Ohio, Kentucky and a few more.

review_title: We are Platinum Member and this year is‚Ä¶
review_text: We are Platinum Member and this year is our fiftieth anniversary year. We planned to celebrate the entire year. We have been traveling to Hawaii for the last five years and had some special events planned. But in the season of Covid 19, plans changed substantially.  We were hunkered down at Kaanapali Beach Club Resort for most of our visit which is not a bad place if you must stay-in place.  The week of Mar 16 , we were told we could stay until our reservation day of April 4, 2020, but subsequently we were told we must leave by Mar 30, 2020 because the resort was closing and our reservations cancelled. Consequences, $200 of groceries lost. Points lost. However, the staff at Kaanapali Beach were very helpful and understanding but they were being whipsawed just like members. It would have been helpful if corporate were decisive with their directions.  It would be beneficial to members if we could save these points to next year considering reservations were cancelled and many resort locations will not be availbabe this year and maybe not 2021

review_title: I believe the website is difficult to‚Ä¶
review_text: I believe the website is difficult to use.

Excellent resorts and staff!  Can't say enough about them.  The sales dept, though, not so much.  Always pressuring you to buy more, and often misleading with their sales pitches.  We are members for the experiences, though, which we thoroughly enjoy!

review_title: Not a ejoyable trip - and a drawn out property move
review_text: We speant 3 weeks at the Ridge Point in State Line, NV - we have own proberty there for 15 years.. This year was not good year.  The building spa was rip out as well as several other spa's were shut down for upgrades. The new spa sitting on the patio was blocking the BBQ grills. The work out room was messed because of a water leak.  All the equipment was shove to the middle of the room. Then last Sept.4 at Dana Point we converted all our deeds to US collection, this included the Ridge Point property.  We were informed that we had not payed ourmaintenance bill for 2020. We  converted our property in Sept and  it was late Feb. They said we still owned the property and owed the 2020 bill - it had been 5 months - we came home tried to get this straightened out. Today April 30,they found our paper work and will fix the problem. (7 Months)  was not a great trip.
Kaanapali Beach Club is fantastic.  This year however we had to leave ahead of schedule due to the COVID-19.Disapointed that the resort closed for now was very sad.

review_title: Coming up with creative ideas for dealing with DRI realities.
review_text: I just spent an hour quickly perusing the reviews with special attention to the negative ones. There are common threads: bad customer service, rude and lying sales representatives, exceptionally maintenance fees, chronic difficulty in getting desired resorts, clear if caustic language by members who are frustrated with the whole experience, warnings about staying away from DRI, dirty rooms or whole resorts, worst investment ever made, impossibility of getting out of the Time Share, etc. DRI has issued warnings in various forms about ‚ÄúAvoiding getting out of time share scams.‚Äù  Yet DRI offers no reasonable alternatives for members who for whatever reason no longer need or want to continue the relationship.  I can think of several alternatives: 1) donate the DRI TS to a homeless shelter; 2) pool,our resources and pay for full page ads in major newspapers highlighting the problems,3) use social media creatively; contact your political officials and call for regulations to be enacted regarding time shares (TSS are not intelligently nor adequately regulated).  Even before the Covid-19 disaster, we would not be in a position to use points at all this year. We are in our mid-70s, have mobility limitations, and are just not in a position to travel thinkers and, quite possibly, into the years ahead. What to do?  Nothing is NOT an option. Let‚Äôs think creatively and seek to arrive at reasonable (or patently unreasonable) alternatives.
i have been coming to the resort for over 20 years just love the atmosphere

Only problem is we purchased a sampler last fall with the intention to book another trip to Hawaii however Hawaii is not listed as a choice so we are somewhat confused but hopefully will be able to clear that up.

review_title: Too many lies and too many bad changes.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

Every time we attend a meeting we have been honest about not buying more points.  We have been spoken to in the most rude manner.  The sales people have been downright nasty and, often, have no answers for our questions. We have been lied to and insulted.   Michael Flaskey and John Betros should be ashamed of themselves and their company. Lately, resorts have been dirty (oursourcing cleaning?)  Resort staff have been kind and helpful but it does little to make up for the rest of the horrid treatment.  I will never hear from anyone because you hide all the honest reviews.  Why learn the truth if you might have to look in the mirror.

Kaanapali Beach Club: We bought at this specific resort years ago even though the cost was higher than other properties, because this is where we wanted to vacation. Early on it was easy to schedule, get your dates, and a room in the general location of where you requested. Over the years changes have been made in the scheduling process, and it is not easy to get your time. We've had multiple occasions that despite being an owner we aren't able to get a room when we wanted and we are scheduling months in advance. But, non-owners who want to stay there can rent a room during the same time. That doesn't sit right with me as an owner at that property. We've reserved a "Deluxe Ocean View" room, and when we got there our room was located on the north side of the building 8 rooms back from the ocean corner of the building. Not what I would consider a "Deluxe Ocean View". Their answer has been that we need to purchase more time to get some additional lead time on scheduling. We still love the property, and our time there. But, we wish they would stop with the pressure to get new owners, or buy more time, and concentrate on taking care of the longtime owners at that property.
They seem to care more for customers who are visiting to possibly purchase or those who are just buying a room for the night than those who are actual owners.

Other presentations have lasted 3+ hours. Overall I've enjoyed some nice vacations but I think merely paying for a resort week is less expensive that ownership with DRI.

The Diamond resort in Maui is excellent. Also, the resort in Kauai is very good. However, we have stayed at 2 resorts in Florida that were pretty bad. Each had recently been acquired by Diamond. Before booking ensure when the resort was acquired and whether it has been updated.

review_title: Not valued as year round owners
review_text: We are owners who do not often use our week, we deposit and exchange it for a more convenient time at The Historic Powhatan resort. We have owned this week through several companies over the past 25 or so years. The resort itself is beautiful, the units have what is needed and look inviting. Diamond no longer treats owners as owners, they have imposed an amenities fee for all exchange guests through RCI. I explained I was an owner to the check in manager, who stated it was required I pay this fee (despite being current on my maintenance fees), and to call RCI as they put my reservation through incorrectly as it did not show ownership at a Diamond property let alone the one he is managing! I did so, even though it sounded absurd, and it wasn‚Äôt an incorrect reservation just an exchange of my week to another at the same property. As I do own five weeks, I prefer RCI to any one company who has an internal exchange as I would need to manage my time with all companies separately. What I am still most upset about is that Diamond is NOT treating their owners as owners year round! Upon purchase I was told I could use their amenities year round even if not staying on the property. Now I am staying there, being lied to by mgmt, and feel double billed. I was assured by paying this fee I had full use of all amenities including the racquetball court (We are both seniors, I‚Äôm disabled and at that moment it was 34 degrees fahrenheit outside!). We will never regain our crown with such awful policies in place... heck I am even thinking of selling but after I have time to look over my initial paperwork. Granted Diamond purchased it but no one amended my deed to state I will only be a valued member on the week stated on my deed! So much for our owners are valued members of our family! Still so angry...

Our stays at Diamond resorts have always been fine.  Nice units & great service.  Last few stays we got great units as staff tried to meet our requests.  Very pleased.. However the calls & pressure to book an owners "update" before we arrive is an unwelcome experience.  The line is always that it won't be a sales pitch but it is.  Sometimes we fall for it sometimes not. If you don't commit before you get pressured at check in. Then there's that "transparancy" statement that's read.  If you are in Hawaii you are told info that conflicts with what you heard from the mainland collection.  And vice versa My husband isn't as bothered by all this as I am.  That said I hope I can keep my resolve to NEVER go on a fake owner's update again. Staff on the phone provide any help I need.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: The thing about my timeshare is that I‚Ä¶
review_text: The thing about my timeshare is that I use it. Every year. I think the people who don't like their timeshare is because they don't use it. I own in the Hawaii package. I bought my timeshare in 1999. It was Embassy Suites back then. It was nice. Then Sunterra took over and things got difficult. The resort was still nice, the people at the counters were not very willing to help. The management was a challenge. Since Diamond took over things were made a lot easier. The management support staff has been great. From house keeping, to front desk, to people helping with my bookings, everyone has been great to work with. The last few years I have been booking my trips short notice and my points have gone a lot farther. Kauai has been half price. Southern states in the late spring are about a quarter of the amount of points. I have been booking golfing road trips during May using short notice (59 days or less). I have been going to Palm Springs, Scottsdale, Sedona, and Las Vegas all back to back. Checking out of one and back into the next one on the same day. It's been great. Back in 1999 it was a lot cheaper. If you are looking to buy a timeshare, I would say go with Diamond. If you are thinking about buying a timeshare, I would say don't do it. There are a lot better options out there using online bookings. Vacation rentals by owner,  Air BNB, and such. My biggest complaint is that once you buy you are stuck with it. You have to pay the high maintenance fee costs. (mine are over $3000 a year) I am going to retire soon and be living on a fixed income. One time I asked the sales person in Sedona during our owners update, how to get out of it and he said to commit suicide. In Palm Springs the sales lady said that even when I die it is automatically going to be passed on down to my kids and they will have to continue to pay the maintenance fees. So I usually don't care for the sales people. But the resort staff is great at every resort I've been to. Again. If you are thinking of purchasing a timeshare, don't do it. If you are going to buy, I like Diamond.
Courtesy and personal attention are second to none.

review_title: When asked about Diamond Resorts by‚Ä¶
review_text: When asked about Diamond Resorts by others, I need to point out that in my mind, I separate Diamond the management company from the Diamond sales dept. I would rate the management side a 4 with my biggest complaint being that Diamond never consults their owners and guests about improvements at the resorts. Who better to ask about potential improvements than those who spend their time and money at the resorts. If you ask me about the sales side of Diamond, I would rate it a 1. The deceptive and unethical practices that go on and the fact that once purchased, the points have zero resale value are the main reasons for that rating.

The letter - original in my file somewhere - also said I would have a 13 months priority reservation window going forward.In trying to make reservations since that time i CANNOT use the 13 month reservation window as it says I have to be Platinum.Well, I am Platinum.When I brought this up at my visit to Point at Poipu this February, they said because of the odd nature of my ownership that I really wasn't Platinum and so they tried to sell me additional points.
