They have always gone above and beyond to ensure that my stay was a pleasurable experience.  I have always been able to get into the resorts that I wanted, my accommodations have been good and very clean, and the diamond staff is exceptional wherever we go.
The resorts are nice, but the maintenance is high and availability is low.  The sales pitches are always demeaning and deceitful.

We have been owners, at Sedona Summit, for 15+ years. We greatly appreciate the resort and how well it is maintained. Other than a few experiences, caused by construction and maintenance issues, we have always received considerate and accommodating service.

review_title: Our family had a wonderful time!
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Converted weeks to points only to find‚Ä¶
review_text: Converted weeks to points only to find we had less value than after adding more money. Staff lied about benifits

review_title: It‚Äôs just another Timeshare your Investment Advisor warned you about!
review_text: The only good thing is that we go to Hawaii every year for two weeks. Our maintenance fees have increased consistently, access to even our home resorts has gotten more difficult. They are always adding more‚Äùbells and whistles‚Äù, when I wish they would just do the Timeshare thing well. I have never been able to have a sit down ‚ÄúReview‚Äù without being pressured to buy more. I‚Äôm a Platinum member and will likely try to get rid of this before it becomes a burden on my children!

review_title: Need more resorts in less popular area
review_text: Need more resorts in less popular area, ie not Florida, not VegasWith travel limited this year we should be able to save all points

review_title: My wife and I have yearly
review_text: My wife and I have yearly, with only a couple exceptions, traveled to our home resort on Kauai, since 2003.  The staff are courteous, the units comfortable and the grounds well maintained.  The Point at Poipu has been a great escape for us.  Additionally,  Although we have not taken advantage of other Diamond Resort offerings we are impressed with the world-wide selection.

review_title: Diamond makes promises it does not keep‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond makes promises it does not keep once they have your money.  We became Platinum members specifically because we were able to use the time shares ANS because we were able to use our points for hotels, airline travel and car rental, not 30% of the point value but 100%.  Now, we cannot!  They haven't even offered the courtesy of extending the deadline of 4/3o inn the midst of Covid-19!!! Their salespeople stop at nothing  to coerce sales, including outright lying about buy back programs. Etc.  The resorts are declining due to deferred maintenance, even theirs-callwd signature resorts.  Stairs pulling away from balconies, mold in bathrooms, shower doors that come off tracks when you touch them, to name a few.  Kitchen equipment has been reduced to the point that we have to bring our own bowls and left-over containers. I would NEVER recommend that anyone buy at Diamond Resorts.  Their snake oil sales force and customer service managers all try to manipulate members.  suites at Fall Creek, The Historic Piwfatan, Rancho Manana, Kohl's Ranch are all in various stages of disrepair,to name just a few.  We have enjoyed staying at timeshares in the past, but would never purchase again through this unethical company.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I like most of their accomodations
review_text: I like most of their accomodations.  I have trouble schedudling them online and frequently have to call by phone to get information onlocations that are supposed to be available.  I think their marketing strategy is offensive.  They frequently engage in "bait and switch".

Many of the destinations are old and need to be renovated (and barely meet "hotel room" expectations), there is very limited availability for the most popular locations (many of us are busy with other priorities and cannot plan a year in advance) and long-term owners have no way to sell back ownerships (and their heirs are forced to take over ownership).  So is there any question why I gave two stars?

review_title: Your fees are way too high
review_text: Your fees are way too high. I want out. I have been deceived over and over again. thew sole purpose of your company seems to be maximizing profit, not serving your customers. I have been a embarrassed  to admit I fell for the sales pitches of so many of your company's representatives. The latest being promised a $225 gift card that I still haven't received after over a month.

review_title: This Company is a truly SCAM.
review_text: This Company is a truly SCAM.If I could give the rating of this place zero stars, I most definitely would. I got looped into this membership 8 years ago and after a month I got the membership realized that it was a complete mistake. Then I called Diamond Resorts and they told me that I cannot back out of the contract because I already signed it.That is something they did not mention to me in the meeting before signing the contract, if that was something that would have been mentioned before I would have never signed into this.I am still paying them all this money for almost a decade now and I have never once used the Diamond Resorts Facilities. Every time that I call them there is never any help, I mean this is what's to be expected from a company like this, a company that runs scams and takes people's money. I think someone needs to do something about this, whether that's the government or people who specialize in dealing with companies like this, SCAM companies.More attention needs to be brought to disgusting companies like this. I am going to take further action and take this to the media, so that others can be made aware of this loathsome company that presents itself to be any more than that.
most times hard to get resort the week you want, but they are good

review_title: The major issues that Diamond continues‚Ä¶
review_text: The major issues that Diamond continues to irritate me is the so-called ‚Äú owners update‚Äù that they tell owners does nor involve a sale presentation or effort to sell more points. You end up in a hosts office and eventually end up hearing bwhy you need yo buy more points.Our last experience was in Kauai at the Point at Poipu. On owners update with lunch. Very nice and enjoyable until we ended up in the hosts office and we told her that we had told the person that set up the luncheon that we were absolutely not interested in buying more points. At this point our hostess became upset and seemed mad that we had wasted her time.She called in another person who continued the sales presentation and we had to tell that person we absolutely did not want to buy more points and in fact because of our age and health issues needed to divest ourselves of the points we have. 50k, Platinum level. A totally unacceptable was presented to buy our way out of the timeshare agreement.The total experience left a very bad tast in our mouth.It‚Äôs very difficult to recommend DRI because of these kinds of issues.

The Diamond resort in Mishawaka Ind. is giving free stay overs for all of the health workers in our hospitals during the c-19 challenge. Great job Diamond! That is wonderful and it makes me proud to be a part of Diamond!
Diamond has the most extensive international resort collection,  all of top quality.  In addition,  it has extensive travel staff to help get anywhere in the world.

A very relaxing and quiet vacation at a well maintained facility.The staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. It wouldhave been nicer if the weather had allowed us to enjoy the pooland outside activities but it was still a pleasant visit.

review_title: We do not like being hustled by the‚Ä¶
review_text: We do not like being hustled by the sales staff. We have all the points we need or can use.
As always , easy system to use and complete booking My only issue is , I booked 2 villas but can‚Äôt put both in my name which becomes an issue when u arrive at the resort but we can deal with it
Always lives up to expectations.member since 2001 never had a bad holiday. This company "certainly does what it says on the tin"

review_title: The Point is starting to age
review_text: The Point is starting to age.  I know remodeling is on the way.  Sales focus sucks the joy out of our experience however, Facility staff are awesome, very helpful and keep the facility spotless.

review_title: I have mostly enjoyed my experience‚Ä¶
review_text: I have mostly enjoyed my experience with Diamond Resorts. It is a class act.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Making reservations is next to impossible
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Stayed at Sedona Summits again i
review_text: Stayed at Sedona Summits again in March. As usual we had a great time and were treated super.  We get out here at least every other year and always stay at the Sumitt.

review_title: The associates of Diamond Resorts have‚Ä¶been great!!!
review_text: The associates of Diamond Resorts have always been very helpful. They have handled all of my questions and have solved any problems that I may have had. They have always ensured that my wife and I have had excellent vacation experiences.

review_title: Once a good company now a total rip off
review_text: Diamond use to be a great timeshare but now the points used for reservations has gone up substantially in some cases doubling but they do not give you any more points. They have also discontinued our coverage in Interval International and use there own plan which uses double the points to book. I booked a 2 bedroom Marriott for 6500 points and Diamond wanted 12,000 points for the same booking. I do not have anything good to say about the new owners or management of Diamond Resorts. They have also raised the points used to book cruises as well. So much so that your points are not worth anything anymore. It is a shame how they have made a once great timeshare in to a total rip off and money maker for themselves.
Love the Poipu property.  During the Covid 19 situation, I had no problem finding a solution to the reservation I had while we could not travel.  Diamond Resorts was very helpful.
Bad no availability. New Site awful.
Diamond properties are very nice.  I would like a guaranteed exit strategy that could return capital when needed.

Difficult to get accommodations where and when we'd like them although the same places can be found available through other means and often cost less to book. Many affiliated resorts tend to be in various states of disrepair, although staff members are typically quick to fix things, when possible, and pleasant to deal with. Wish I could say the same about most Diamond Resorts team members, particularly the sales staff.

review_title: Diamond to be a leader in its industry
review_text: Diamond resorts have had a lot of improvements. I hope it can be same or better in flexibility, availability of high quality  selection, and service than Marriott Vacation Club.

review_title: No good reason to buy a Diamond timeshare
review_text: Attended Sampler update but declined to increase my ownership.  Sales people friendly but could not demonstrate a reason for me to pay more money for any Diamond vacation.  Product is over-priced compared to travel you can secure over the Internet.   Terrible investment.

review_title: I really like a webinar experience to‚Ä¶
review_text: I really like a webinar experience to learn information about how to use my diamond resort points   Much better than the sales pitches.

review_title: I gave a four star rating for simple‚Ä¶
review_text: I gave a four star rating for simple reason: Owner Updates or whatever adjectives you want to use to name the sessions are NEVER, repeat NEVER what they are advertised to be.They never finish within the "allotted" time. There is no respect for MY time. There is ALWAYS a sales pitch.If I decline to attend an update when I'm checking in, I'm ALWAYS asked "Why". No thank you is never enough, someone always wants to know why.
Everything was good except we had an issue with a ceiling fan, the repair/replacement of which was not handled well and we were greatly inconvenienced by the continued visits of the service people.
Excellent service. Everything sorted quick and smooth.

We've visited Kaanapali Beach Club in Maui every year for over 10 years now.  Always a comfortable temp.  & new openings in this Lahaina, Kaanapali, and Kapalua area to explore.  Prime whale watching season even from shore anytime in Feb. or Mar.

review_title: Diamond has always sought to be clear
review_text: Diamond has always sought to be clear, direct, and value oriented. Our family has enjoyed many years of varied locations and activities through Diamond. We look forward to many more years of vacations of exploring, learning, and relaxing.

review_title: I have been trying to reach someone for‚Ä¶Disappointed!!
review_text: I have been trying to reach someone for over 2 weeks with no success. It is very disappointing. We need to speak with someone from the cruise department ASAP.

review_title: We have been going to Diamond resorts for a long time year after year.
review_text: We have been going to Diamond resorts for a long time. We love the resorts The staff are always helpful and friendly. The apartments are bright modern and clean. The bed linens are top quality and the beds are always very very comfy. We always look forward to arriving at the resorts. Meeting up with our holiday friends. It‚Äôs always home from home.

review_title: I HAVE CALLED THE DIAMOND SAMPLER‚Ä¶
review_text: I HAVE CALLED THE DIAMOND SAMPLER TELEPHONE NUMBER SEVERAL TIMES AND SENT EMAILS, NOBODY ANSWERS OR RESPONDS TO THE EMAIL.  MY RESERVATION WENT AWAY AND I AM TRYING TO FIND OUT WHY.
It is great. We like to travel Las Vegas and Panama City. We love beaches.

review_title: For the last 2 years we have been to‚Ä¶
review_text: For the last 2 years we have been to Cabo Azulejo Resort and found it to be to notch. Wonderful pools, swim up bar, eating facilities and great room accommodations.

review_title: Limited Resort Options and No Replies from Sales Team Rep or Manager
review_text: Very limited number of high end resorts, and limited availability at those resorts unless booked at the very earliest of the booking window.   Need more resorts in desirable areas, not just Florida and country music hot spots.  Keep taking away or reducing benefits for long-time owners and adding benefits for new owners or new purchases only (different from perks).  Promises not kept by sales team, including not following up on comments and questions during owner updates, is very frustrating and CONTINUALLY ONGOING.  NEVER changes.  Have been trying to contact platinum update rep from Maui resort for months by phone and email and no reply from him or his manager.  None.

Overall we like several of the resorts (Maui especially which is where we bought). But we‚Äôve been staying in some Marriott resorts over last few years (laguna and palm desert) and diamond resorts don‚Äôt come close to that level.
Loved the Greensprings Resort in Williamsburg, VA.

review_title: Very helpful with what we all are going‚Ä¶
review_text: Very helpful with what we all are going through.

We‚Äôve been Diamond members for around 16 years. Resorts are usually very nice. The one in Sedona was no exception. Golf course looked very inviting but due to virus we had to cut vacation short and drive back to Ohio. The grounds and rooms were excellent. Staff first rate. My number one complaint with Diamond is trying to get a particular location can sometimes be very difficult.
Poor maintenance bad management constantly increasing maintenance fees and lowering availability what‚Äôs not to like
Your representative answered all my questions and was very well informed.

review_title: Cannt travel at all at this point hope‚Ä¶
review_text: Cannt travel at all at this point hope they will let us roll over more points
Kaanapali Beach Club, Maui.  Beach is receding and that's very dissapointing.  Can't get any answers from Diamond or Owner Services.  Looks like will be no beach at all in 3-5 years.
Too busy trying to get owners to buy more points. Seems to be the only reason to meet with owners.
You‚Äôre financial department has had a fraudulent charge on my account since December. They‚Äôve admitted it‚Äôs their error but still have not removed it.

review_title: I am upset with Diamond Resort right‚Ä¶
review_text: I am upset with Diamond Resort right now with Promo offices. Twice now l have been led on a wild goose chase both from Costa mesa  and Las Vegas office. Names given and number and then no response. For almost 15yrs with this company l have never been treated this way. loMy stays are the best except for my last visit in January in Palm Springs.

I loved the accommodations.  I don't much like the hard sell when you consent to the presentation....they are soft about it but sooo persistent.  We stayed at the Point at Poipu.  Getting to our room was a long and circuitous walk.  There are elevators, but when you have to take 2 of them .....  Parking was a little difficult.  That said, the grounds are beautiful and include good family activities.  The rooms were well furnished, nicely arranged, modern and convenient.  We really enjoyed our stay.
the staff was excellent,  checked on me because I  was alone for a week and arrange to help me with ways to go on the strip for shows like michael jackson and motown revue .

review_title: Had a great time at the beach
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I come to KBC almost every year with‚Ä¶
review_text: I come to KBC almost every year with the whales. I completely enjoyed my ocean front room and will be returning.

We have not been to a Diamond resort for a while now. The last time we went was enjoyable and relaxing. The staff were helpful and courteous and we enjoyed interacting with them. Never had a problem and don't anticipate any in the future.

review_title: I had to cancel my stay for myself and‚Ä¶
review_text: I had to cancel my stay for myself and my daughter at Sedona Summit several weeks ago and did not notice that the points had been returned to my account.  I emailed Diamond with the question about my points being returned to my account and have been waiting for a response since that time.  The reason for the 3 stars is I realize with Covid-19 that response times will probably be delayed but it has been several weeks with no response.

Cons: Diamond Resorts fees and insurances have gone up significantly.  Their Tiers for levels of ownership are costly and dramitcally favor those who own a tremendous anoint of points.  It is difficult to actually speak with anyone in the office regarding concerns. Pros:  The time shares are nicely appointed as well as tier grounds.

review_title: All points should roll over to next‚Ä¶
review_text: All points should roll over to next year that we were notable to use this year because of covid-19. Also since wewill not be able to go to the resorts since many are closedand we cannot fly at this time dues should be returned or atleast discounted. Many insurance companies are giving clientsdiscounts of 30 to 50% off our rates since we are not driving !Do the right thing Diamond. Many people need that money to live right now because they are not working. If this is not done I am sure many will be forced to not pay their dues and maintenance fees.

review_title: The new owner web sight is very hard to‚Ä¶
review_text: The new owner web sight is very hard to use and navigate.RegardsBruce

review_title: I was not told the truth in this‚Ä¶
review_text: I was not told the truth in this presentationI sat in on one in 2017and was told it was a sampler . Was not what I was told it was and cancelled with within the grace period.The presentation in 2019, never mentioned the word sampler and because I trusted the person giving the presentation,  I got screwed again but unfortunately didn't catch it within the grace period.Therefore,  I will never but buy another product from diamond resorts again

Overall the resorts are nice, but very limited options if you want to stay on the beach.  Plus I wish the personal gym was a little bigger at most resorts with more than a total of 3 pieces of equipment.

review_title: Not Worth the Cost of Ownership
review_text: The resorts themselves are more like a 3, with most of them being a 4 or 5 star rating.  However the timeshare system that is prevalent in Diamond Resorts is failing.  I was promised that I would be silver once I purchased the final 1000 points that I did back in September, 2019.  However, the next time I was at a resort, Feb, 2020, I was told that was not true.  So that just added to the distrust I already had when listening to the person during any review when I was on vacation.  On top of that, the maintenance fees are so ridiculously high, that there is no real reason to be a member, as the cost os now more expensive, than if I just stayed at a regular hotel.  This cannot be disputed.
We have always found you to be very helpful and professional when booking a break with no problems to report over all the years we have been with you. A big THANK YOU.
Loosing money.

review_title: I appreciate many of the benefits of‚Ä¶
review_text: I appreciate many of the benefits of Diamond Resorts as well as their world wide reach.  Their sales personnel leave me cold.

review_title: The location was beautiful and staff‚Ä¶
review_text: The location was beautiful and staff was fabulous.   We were disappointed that you had to pay for umbrellas at the pool and pay for chairs if you wanted to sit at the beach.    We would rather pay higher points and have that as an inclusion.

Nice resorts, but the CEO dropped the ball in keeping members informed on how Diamond Resorts would handle reservations during the COVID-19 situation.  It was within a week of my reservation in late March and I still hadn't heard anything from Flaskey (nor the resort for that fact).  If he was waiting to see what the Trump response would be, then shame on him - he should know better than to rely on the POTUS for answers.  By early March, I had received e-mails from American Airlines, Hilton, Marriott, National Car Rental, and even Holiday Inn.  I did not hear or see jack from Flaskey.  Whatever lame excuse he has for not informing us sooner or being more proactive as the pandemic became a U.S. problem is exactly that - LAME.

review_title: Like Covid 19‚Äîno clear way to rid yourself of it
review_text: Initially seems good. Decent facilities, not great, but not bad. Once you have it (membership) it is virtually impossible to get rid of it.  Not really able to sell because there are so many restrictions on what the new owner would own, that If the buyer wanted most of the benefits he or she would essentially required to buy new and at a price that makes it not worthwhile.

What a scam. You buy in. The maintenance fees go up continually. They are constantly trying to sell you more points because what you have isn't good enough. They are bought out by a different company all the time. What a mistake.

review_title: Last year was Las Vegus and Lake Taheo
review_text: Last year was Las Vegus and Lake Taheo. Both places where very good and we enjoyed them veryMuch.

review_title: It is unfortunate that we have had so‚Ä¶
review_text: It is unfortunate that we have had so many challenges with Diamond.  Challenges from over pricing, sales promising benefits but not true.  The staff at the resorts are extremely nice but sales has a real big issue with inconsistency and not expressing all the truth.  I literately had a representative tell me to look at VRBO to find accommodations.  I have a laundry list of things that have occurred and it is completely sad.  I have request the recordings of when we signed but crickets because the issues I am having are the same ones I asked and the quality assurance rep and sales individual said oh yes but not true.

We have been Diamond Resort members since 2003 and over the years have enjoyed many holidays to many destinations including Florida, Italy, Spain, Canary Islands, Dominican Republic.  I have always felt that we receive excellent service and stay in beautiful accommodation.

review_title: Good And Bad About Diamond Resorts
review_text: We love Diamond Resorts especially their customer support and service. We appreciate Diamond allowing us to switch our dates during the Covid-19. We love the always friendly and accommodating staff. The resorts are immaculate.  If I could change anything I would change some (some not all) of the salespersons. Not all, but many of them will lie to get you to buy. They lie in a way that they cannot be detected in their sales pitches. No one is there to hear what they offer-illustration-we were told by the sales agent if we became Gold Members we could use points to pay maintenance fees. LIE-only Platinum Members. And in the quality control meetings when signing contracts they NEVER talk about it. You sign off on a plethora of items-Yes, I checked it off, not knowing, the one that said only Platinum Members can use points for maintenance fees, but you see the sales persons (not all) don't care about you-it's your money-not you. They tell you they are all about helping you, but they LIE-they only want to help themselves. If you could do away with some of the Sales people (not all) it would be a great company. AND, the folks in Las Vegas don't care about you either. They just brush you off and stand by the LIARS who do the selling. I am tired of typing! I could go on. I would get out today if I could-but you are legally stuck after you sign those contracts so read all the small print you need to read with a magnifying glass. My family loved Diamond before Apollo Global got their hands on it. Now I hear no more buying airfares using points is coming and that was one of the reasons we became Gold and also being able to use points for maintenance fees. Just another LIE. Sorry-I'm done. Ronnie Jones

review_title: I have been a Diamond member since 07.
review_text: I have been a Diamond member since 07.  I do not travel by air anymore so I stick to those areas that are no more than 24 hours of driving.  All of the resorts have been all I could ask for.  I also use points as gifts to my kids and grandkids so that they can have time off.  Every place we stay has been clean, well equipped and staffed with exceptional people.  Everyone from grounds keepers to front desk clerks are always willing to assist.

review_title: We came at the beginning of the ‚Ä¶
review_text: We came at the beginning of the  covad19 so our experience was not good. No tours  left a week  early
Great places  Great Holidays. Just wish there were more choice in the UK

I had booked my spring vacation back in early February,before the impacts of COVID 19 had started to manifest themselves.Then the closures started,first,we were told not to fly,then the borders were closed,then we were told to isolate ourselves.So,as the month of March progressed,more closures occurred,first restaurants,then the stores started closing,and the death toll was steadily increasing.I became sure that my vacation would not happen,as in my province,Ontario,it was reported that the US border would not open before the end of May.It was really great that Diamond allowed me to rescind my reservation,at no cost to me.

review_title: That's one of the best places that I've‚Ä¶
review_text: That's one of the best places that I've stayed in all of my times of travel everything was perfect there was anything wrong with anything my stay was absolutely wonderful

review_title: We bought a sampler package first week‚Ä¶
review_text: We bought a sampler package first week of December 2019. We did not receive information on our purchase for at least 10  weeks . Since day one I requested in writing that since we  were now in the trust that our deed would be void upon our death as promised in the buying experience. Since then I have made at least 20 phone calls to the resort and corporate offices trying to get this in writing. It had now been over 4 months and nothing yet. I am fet up with the lack of professionalism. It seems they just wanted my money and then be damned with you    Eric tipton.   413 885 7582
Excellent resort. Clean and well maintained. Landscaping is beautiful. Unit is fully stocked with everything you could possibly need. Staff are friendly and eager to satisfy.

Overall - in the many years of Diamond ownership...starting back when it was SunTerra, we have been mostly satisfied. The occasional bump in the road, has been met equally with above and beyond experiences. What keeps me from a 4 star rating is the rude and aggressive sales presentation, without an honest ‚Äúowners update‚Äù with the true purpose of education. Hopefully, that is something that might improve.

review_title: I have been cheated by them
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

My partner has points.. She sent email when flights were cancelled on 7th of April informing them to get in touch to sort out the cancellation of the holiday booking in June.. Rang up again today to find out why they hadn't been in touch and to cancel the holiday.. To be told she should have cancelled before the 12th of April and she will now lose half the points. Diamond Resorts had 4 days to reply to the email and tell her this.. Lack of communication on there part has cost her a lot of money.. Not happy is an understatement..

I understand that These are unprecedented times. However when we had to cancel our trip to Hawaii we lost multiple number of points due to the fact that we were canceling so close to the time of our vacation. Around a month later we received a general email from Diamond that said we wouldn‚Äôt lose points due to the Covid-19 situation. To date The points we lost have not been returned to our account.

review_title: some of the furniture is old and worn‚Ä¶
review_text: some of the furniture is old and worn out

Difficult to make reservations.  Popular locations, such as Hawaii are often booked far in advance, no openings.  Initial purchase of points, very bad investment.  Ebay has several Diamond Resort points for sale, minimal price.  Easier to rent online without joining Diamond resorts.  Several choices, even same resort.Point of Poiou, Kuai is very beautifull.  Also Cabo de Azule in Mexico.

review_title: I like going to the updates, but they keep trying to sell more points.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Maintenance fees are too high!  Limited availability of resorts.
It must be tough to keep mildew and bugs from invading rooms in a tropical climate. But I didn‚Äôt see that the resort even attempted to keep it at bay.

review_title: The resort's are generally well maintained.
review_text: The resort's are generally well maintained and have comfortable accommodations. The maintenance fees seem above average but if properties are continuing to be improved I can accept that.  The updates are a problem from the standpoint that the information provided is too often sales spin instead of facts.

Powhatton Resort in Williamsburg was the last resort that we visited that is owned by Diamond.  It is a very nice resort with many amenities.  The grounds are fairly well kept, although the holly bushes in the rear of the units need some severe trimming.  They are so large that the view of the pond is obstructed in certain units.We love the area that has many attractions.
slow and not very intuitive ... seemed to be geared to the public rather than owners ...
The Dimond properties are very well maintained, their location is great, and I love going to their resorts.

review_title: Good system but management fees are too‚Ä¶
review_text: Good system but management fees are too high.

review_title: Resorts we have stayed it are generally‚Ä¶
review_text: Resorts we have stayed it are generally wonderful.  But having to deal with the high pressure sales people every visit is EXTREMELY annoying so couldn't possibly give a 5 star rating.

review_title: If you're talking about the concert‚Ä¶
review_text: If you're talking about the concert last night, everyone doesn't have an instagram account and I can't see opening one for just your concert.  Use Facebook or the Meet app or Duo app.

review_title: The quantity and quality of United‚Ä¶
review_text: The quantity and quality of United States properties is extremely limited in quality and quantity.  We travel domestically often and if it weren't for exchange points, we would be "out of luck" in time shares.  Also, I did not buy our property/points knowing that I would have to pay for a trade to get domestic properties.Now with the drop of someone as major as Interval I am especially concerned.
The resorts are of a high standard, very comfortable and well equipped. However, the pressure sale and tactics used by sales personnel is abhorrent.

Mystic Dunes is in a beautiful location and has very good facilities. We had a thoroughly enjoyable time, enhanced by the courteous and welcoming staff. A very pleasant week away from the day to day activities, and completed just in time before the travel lock down.To all involved, and to all members, keep safe and well.
Availability is poor, particularly in UK. Standard of accommodation is good. Value is average. Customer service is average.

review_title: Not sure of the way they handled my‚Ä¶
review_text: Not sure of the way they handled my date change.Cost me lots of money.   Disappointed!!!!

review_title: I stayed at the Scottsdale Links last‚Ä¶
review_text: I stayed at the Scottsdale Links last July and really enjoyed my stay immensely despite the heat.  In fact, I got use to the heat.  I liked my stay so much that I bought and extended weekend in Branson, which I also enjoyed.  I told Scottsdale associates that I would return.
Bent Creek Golf Resort (Diamond) is our home-away-from-home AND we love the staff there.

review_title: We had to cancel our trip to Hawaii‚Ä¶
review_text: We had to cancel our trip to Hawaii because of travel restrictions.  Our points were not refunded related to Diamond Resorts policies.  Don‚Äôt waste your money on this timeshare.

review_title: Changing membership with interval to an‚Ä¶
review_text: Changing membership with interval to an internal exchange but they don‚Äôt tell you the available places that we will be able to use/exchange into.

review_title: Always love our trips to Maui staying‚Ä¶
review_text: Always love our trips to Maui staying at Kaanapali Beach Club. The resort has everything to offer; beach, pool, restaurant, luau etc. Would definitely recommend staying here and visiting the beautiful island of Maui.

review_title: One of Diamond‚Äôs great resorts, The Point at Poipu
review_text: We have been with Diamond Resorts since January 2009. We became involved with Diamond since they became owners of The Point at Poipu, Kauai which we first purchased in 1996. We have gone back to the Point at Poipu every year since 2020. We really enjoy the resort. It is one of the best managed resorts we have visited. Diamond Resorts and the Point at Poipu go out of their way to ensure your vacation experience is exceptional. Diamond Resorts is a great company.

Our Sedona trip was cut short related to the Covid 19 virus. I am nurse,and was called back to work.  The property was nice and we will definitely be back. I hope I will be getting my points reinstated for the days I did not stay. I spoke to customer service and they said it may take a few weeks but it has been a month no points reinstated.  I have been a member for 10 years and pay my membership on time. I hope to hear from someone soon. I checked in on a Monday and checked out on a Wednesday. My original stay was Monday-Saturday. I hope to hear from someone soon

review_title: Smoke and mirrors attempts to upsell
review_text: Diamond Resorts consistently ruins our various vacations with dishonest attempts to sell us more points resulting in wasted hours during our vacations.

review_title: I have enjoyed all the travel I have‚Ä¶
review_text: I have enjoyed all the travel I have done, although manyntrip were book through II due to a lack of resorts in the NE.  DO NOT LIKE THE Changes you are making.  It makes it much harder for senior (65+ years of age) to understand and book.  What are tiers etc.?

review_title: Worst Time share company in the world
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
The sales force is pushy.  We were told we were stupid to Nate take that deal he was offering us.   I would love to sell my time share and not get pushed against the wall.

Sedona, AZ,  Kauai, HiAlso the Mountain Retreat Timeshare in California which used to be a part of the Grand Pacific Timeshare group. Diamond Resorts stopped exchanging with them, so I don‚Äôt go there anymore.  I also heard that we are no longer going to be getting or Interval International membership, is that correct?

Too much money and I find it very hard to book a decent place to stay- we used to be able to trade in points for Marriott. Now you charge twice as much as anyone else in exchange. I would love to get rid of my Diamond resort obligation

review_title: The resort is fine (KBC)  The employees‚Ä¶
review_text: The resort is fine (KBC)  The employees are great except for those only interested in getting us to purchase more points.  The maintenance fees are way to expensive for what the property has to offer.  That being said, we have almost always had a great experience when visiting Hawaii (Maui) and look forward to a couple more trips before we sell or give away our time.  I do wish Diamond had a buy back policy so we wouldn't take a huge loss when we can no longer afford to travel due to finances or health.

review_title: Had a week booked in a resort
review_text: Had a week booked in a resort, unfortunately it was cancelled, but fortunately we got our points back. Thank you. Hope to see you again soon

review_title: Before the shut down for the corona‚Ä¶
review_text: Before the shut down for the corona virus we tried calling representatives to book a trip because the website would not allow us to have have more than one book trip through the sampler package. The trip was never booked because we have yet to hear back from a representative to solve our problem. We purchased the sampler package and have been paying on it.  Every time we try to use it there is an obstacle that wasn't mentioned in the sale presentation.  For example, we need to attend a sale presentation for every booked trip.  We are not allowed to have our adult daughters use it without us being there.  Not happy with the $5000 purchase of nothing.

I find the resorts in the USA collection are very good.  However, in the European collection, I find a lot of inconsistency and I am also beginning to be disturbed about the cleanliness at the UK resort we visit the most.
Always well looked after and excellent standard of accommodation
Limited availability of properties ,took away club select on line site .

review_title: I need to cancel a vacation courtesy of‚Ä¶
review_text: I need to cancel a vacation courtesy of COVID-19 - that vacation starts 2 days after Diamond Resort's date when they stop penalizing cancellations. Doesn't matter that the Governor says you can't leave the state and the medical center canceled all vacations. Anybody want to buy a timeshare?

Diamond resorts at Lake Tahoe, Cabo San Jose, Orlando are excellent. My only troubling issue with Diamond is the search and reservation system for owners. It is not possible to maintain a search until a room might become available.Currently is it necessary to everyday or every hour i.e. constantly to see if at that moment of the call the room might be available.  With RCI, a member can request a search for a particular location and room type and it is maintained until its found or the date expires. Diamond only needs to update its reservation software programs.

review_title: We have enjoyed our stays at Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: We have enjoyed our stays at Diamond Resorts and find them friendly and clean.We have stayed at many different locations.Last December we stayed at the REd Lion in St. Louis, MO and found it was not up to expectations.  Do not plan to go again.

review_title: Maria Kalber and Jazmonique Ellis were‚Ä¶
review_text: Maria Kalber and Jazmonique Ellis were extremely helpful with our Transitions.

review_title: Our recent travel experience was last‚Ä¶
review_text: Our recent travel experience was last fall. We stayed at a resort in Branson, Mo. for a week, but could only get a studio, which was much too small. There were no chairs available to even sit outside. Not happy with that one. Then we drove to Scottsdale, Az. and stayed for week. We could still only get a studio, but it was much larger, and a nicer resort.
Diamond Resorts is a wonderful way to take a vacation.
I was not able to renew my interval membership using the promo code because the promo code was not accepted by the system when I entered it.

review_title: Never have a place where or when we‚Ä¶you asked.
review_text: Never have a place where or when we want. Always Florida, Las Vegas or Lake Tahoe or Branson   Now no longer supports membership with II. They at least had places to go to. Buy me out.

review_title: This is the second time that a hotel‚Ä¶
review_text: This is the second time that a hotel reservation made through travel services using points did not actually exist, even though a confirmation was sent.  I would never have known except I had to call to talk to someone about another reservation.  I actually had to tell the rep that he needed to call the hotel and he kept saying but the reservation is here.  I had to say ‚Äúyes‚Äù but the HOTEL doesn‚Äôt have it!!! Very frustrating. At least unlike last summer I didn‚Äôt show up and find that I had no reservation.
Still one of my favorite places of PEACE

review_title: Scottsdale Villa Mirage.  Great location and amenties ‚Ä¶
review_text: Scottsdale Villa Mirage  is one of our favorite destinations.  We have family and friends in Phoenix and its suburbs and this location provides us a central point to stay and then travel in state to visit friends, family and former classmates.  Clean rooms, plenty of amenities and a great staff are all present at this Diamond location

The chat rep was fine.  However, some of Diamond's policies do not make me "feel vacationed".  I was calling to cancel two trips scheduled in July due to COVID.  I had received 50% off one of the bookings.  I had to get annoyed in order to get a note on our account so when (and if) we can book again, we can get that credit.  Additionally, I think Diamond should be lenient on the ability to roll over points due to COVID.  We are in unprecedented times and Diamond should help their customers instead of penalize them.

review_title: Diamond is entirely to expensive on the‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond is entirely to expensive on the maintiance  fees, Way over priced and have now added a fee, which i do Not like, when a guest uses timeshare.Often difficult to get reservations.

review_title: Being a 19 year owner of or timeshare‚Ä¶
review_text: Being a 19 year owner of or timeshare at Lake Tahoe Vacation Resort, we've been very pleased with the accommodations.   The rooms are well kept and designed well so that they can be either a 1 bedroom with a kitchen and living room,  a one room hotel like room,  or a combination of both when used as a 2 bedroom suite. We've had rooms with views from all sides of the resort and have been very pleased with all.  It's location at the end Ski Run Blvd is conveniently close to several restaurants and shops and is close to many attractions around the lake.
Our maintenance fees exceed $5,000 annually. We will not be able to maintain that once we retire.

review_title: During annual up dates we are usually‚Ä¶
review_text: During annual up dates we are usually given false information in order to sell more points. Diamond has to find a way to buy back points from owners that are too old to use all the points they have bought.

review_title: It had been great experience a t Lake‚Ä¶
review_text: It had been great experience a t Lake Tahoe Resort in the past. I hope our next visit there this year later will be the same.

We loved having our timeshare for many years,  Sharing vacations with friends and family.  But the last three years were hampered  by phantom shares that showed up whenever we went to an ‚Äúupdate‚Äù. We wanted to know about new benefits and new places to go so we went to these presentations.  Once there, we were under huge pressure and were led to believe there were errors on our ownership that could only be corrected by purchasing more shares.  We paid lots of money but were able to get out of our ownership.

review_title: I do not like your website
review_text: I do not like your website.  the old one was much easier to navigate

Our experience with Diamond Resorts have averaged above our expectations.  There have been a few resorts that have met our expectations but 90% have been above what we have expected and we are thankful to have been associated with Diamond Resorts over the years.

review_title: If there are more easy access for‚Ä¶
review_text: If there are more easy access for parking, I‚Äôll give it 5 Stars.

review_title: It is often difficult for me to get a‚Ä¶
review_text: It is often difficult for me to get a reservation to places I‚Äôd like to go to. However I‚Äôd like to express that the ones I‚Äôve ended up at I‚Äôve been OK. We were last at Cypress point and just didn‚Äôt have the best time and the activities were less than exciting.

review_title: Diamond Resorts - A Great Way to Travel
review_text: Diamond Resorts is a professional, first class company that has served us well for 20 years.  Every resort we have visited has been clean, spacious, well appointed, with nicely stocked kitchen cabinets and on attractive grounds.  We have never been disappointed!

review_title: The Cabo Azul in San Jose Del Cabo was‚Ä¶
review_text: The Cabo Azul in San Jose Del Cabo was a beautiful and very hospitable resort.The only bad part was the "update" we attended which was supposed to be no more than 60 min. and turned out to be a grueling 3 hrs. with the pushiest most irritating sales person we have ever encountered..which caused us much anguish as we barely got to our flight in time....Already talked to a Diamond person later when we got home about it...we haven't been compensated in any way besides a large apology...not enough.

review_title: What do you send me a survey without‚Ä¶
review_text: What do you send me a survey without telling what you are surveying?  How am I to know?  Do you really think I can read minds?  Nincompoops!

In the past we always had a4-star to 5 -star stay.  However, in January in Phoenix we were so disappointed with our unit we left after two weeks of a three week reservation.  It ruined our winter getaway, and, unfortunately probably our last.

I own timeshare property with Marriott.  Compared to Marriott, Diamond is more expensive and the properties are of lesser quality.  I also find the sales staff to be untrustworthy and misleading in their presentations.  They apply more pressure than I have experienced anywhere else and they never honor their time commitments.  I will NEVER attend another Diamond presentation no matter what I am offered to attend.

review_title: I was lied to during a sales‚Ä¶
review_text: I was lied to during a sales presentation.I fell on property due to low lighting but Diamond is fighting the claim.I love the properties.  Have owned for 20 years.

review_title: He knew what he was talking about‚Ä¶
review_text: He knew what he was talking about finally someone did not pressure you

review_text: When RCI wouldn‚Äôt or couldn‚Äôt get me a reservation at a resort in Scottsdale, Diamond got it for my family and I.

Never expected to pay almost $3000.00 in maintenance fees along with reducing benefits.  When will enough be enough??  I really loved my timeshare but with all other services out there maybe its time for a change.  Stop reducing our benefits and lower my maintenance fees, please.  I will not be able to pass this on to my children.
Loved Kaanapali Beach. Great resort and great room.

review_title: It's very said that Diamond does not‚Ä¶
review_text: It's very said that Diamond does not promote honesty with their salesmen.  We were lied to and now have very serious financial issues.  Diamond has a good product and should now allow them to lie to us.

Good quality resorts in Sedona. Fantastic location.We stayed at The Ridge, Kohl's Ranch, Los Abrigados, Bell Rock Inn and the Summit. All were very well appointed, except Los Abrigados had only a basic kitchen.

review_title: I continue to feel screwed by the‚Ä¶
review_text: I continue to feel screwed by the increasing number of internet "renters" I encounter at diamond properties. They are easy to recognize by their appearance, breaking of rules, noise, foul language, public drunkeness, smoking in public areas, etc etc etc. Not what I signed up for when I spent my teens of thousands of dollars buying points. Mr. Klubek would be ashamed. I expect this review will quickly disappear.

In the beginning, we were extremely happy with our deeded ownership. We thought the idea of and the ability to use points for bookings was an excellent idea as well as the benefits. However, maintenance fees began to rise at a higher than expected rate, benefits that were promised were eliminated or changed. Point values for stays in many places are increasing ( Cabo Azul, etc.) which makes our purchase less valuable while at the same time you increase the purchase price of points. Going public caused too much pressure on the sales force creating horrible experiences at owner updates. These are all complaints about corporate. As far as most resorts and staff, pretty much we have been extremely happy. Call centers, platinum line especially have been most satisfactory. Our suggestion would be to make our ownerships valuable again (resale value) for those of us that reach a point that we cannot travel anymore. Make transition less expensive. Garner goodwill with the owners / members and we will be your best sales agents! The first few years of our ownership, I could have sold it because of our satisfaction and belief that we were part of something special. There was a feeling of pride and ownership when visiting a resort to the point that we would pick up trash, straighten items, tighten loose fittings, or other minor maintenance items we came across. Now, we no longer have that feeling of exclusivity that we once had. We still enjoy our vacations and look forward to many more. We continue to learn how to get the most from our membership and appreciate some of the new programs we are seeing.
We own at Polynesian Resort, Kissimmee, FL and go there every March.  Diamond has been excellent in our preparation, reservations, and stay there.
Trip to Hawaii was wonderful,, we had super assistance booking numerous tours  working with our concierge.   Got to see and experience many beautiful sites.This was a trip of a lifetime!

review_title: Because we was at the resort at the‚Ä¶
review_text: Because we was at the resort at the beginning of covid-19 Diamond didn't handle the second week I canceled I was supposed to there making me join the exchange club...... I should have been able to use my second week at N extra charge,Rick and Trula Dettloff

review_title: Have always enjoyed going to diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: Have always enjoyed going to diamond resorts they are always clean the staff is excellent.

review_title: Very dissatisfied customer. Still waiting over a month for a cancellation and refund.
review_text: I have been trying for the past month to  cancel a reservation in Washington DC, for March 25 -28.. All I have gotten is the run around from the many representatives that I have spoken with. Many don't even know what they are doing or have answers for you.   I have been spoken to disrespectful and the last gentlemen refused to give me his name. To date I still am not sure that my reservation has been canceled and a refund has not been issued for the luxury hotel my son and family were meant to stay at and needed to cancel do to Covid 19. I feel that Diamond could care less if they have customers and being a twenty plus year member doesn't seem mean a thing.  Very dissatisfied customer.

review_title: I don‚Äôt like going to your update‚Ä¶
review_text: I don‚Äôt like going to your update meetings.  They are pressure filled and take a lot more time than you promise.
Constant pressure for purchase additional points. Lengthy so called update sessions. I'm gradually developing regret for owning points with costly annual assessment for maintenance fees.

review_title: Powhatan Plantation Resort is always a favorite!!
review_text: Powhatan Plantation Resort is always a favorite for us! We are always treated above and beyond and Elizabeth at the front desk has just been out of this world with her customer service for the past five years. It would have been nice to have more on site facilities open but we truly understand the precautions during this Covid-19 outbreak. Keep up the great job. The resort looks fantastic. Thank you!

review_title: I called  to cancel my vacation‚Ä¶
review_text: I called  to cancel my vacation reservation because of COVID - 19 and was taken care of promptly, with friendliness and I was given all of my points back.

review_title: Thanks for allowing me to cancel my‚Ä¶
review_text: Thanks for allowing me to cancel my trip due to the Corona virus.  Thanks for refunding my points.

review_text: You keep calling me regarding my timeshare.  I have more important things to be concerned about at this time.
Worthless. Points are wasting away. Yearly maintenance fees wasted. Can‚Äôt even forward to plan... flights... locations.  Nothing.

review_title: We stayed at Desert Paradise Resort
review_text: We stayed at Desert Paradise Resort. We attended an owner update. We were told it was imperative we purchase to get our points moved to a new "Trust". And if we purchased it would all be taken care of automatically.  So we purchased the sampler to satisfy the requirements only to find out it wasn't really true.So no, I will never recommend Diamond to my friends or family.

Diamond resorts have great facilities from rooms to grounds to locations.  My only concern has been availability of rooms to book when using our points.  We have seen adds or room rentals in Maui's Kaanapali Beach Club when we could not book with our points.  We have to book 13 months in advance or we can not get in.We have had assurances that double Gold status would help us but only works.The constant drive to sell more timeshares causes us to book hotels when our rooms are not available with points.

review_title: I did not stay at the resort
review_text: I did not stay at the resort. I sent my son and family up to celebrate a birthday. Thank you so much for honoring my request for a room with a patio facing the creek They really enjoyed their stay. Thank you!
Well run organization. D0 not appreciate calls offering 3 day weekends.

review_title: It is like going home on a holiday
review_text: It is like going home on a holiday. Super comfort. Great welcome. A bit posh but hey we all deserve some luxury sometime. Too bad activities are not so well attended we have the opportunity to explore in security.

My son was staying for 2 weeks and he received a call at 9.30am to say he had to leave the resort straight away as it was closing.   I appreciate this is difficult for everyone but surely a little bit of notice should have been given.  My son had to find an immediate flight back to the Netherlands.  Thank you Diamond Resorts !!!!!!

The concept is good. The facilities are good.BUT...The sales staff seem to have excellent training in truth stretching and sunny day predictions.The fees are becoming extremely high. Enough I have looked into dumping the weeks I own.The extras, like using your points to buy merchandise, would be good if the prices weren't jacked so high that I can find the same or similar items for sale at a lower price without using any points.

review_title: I dont know but I did cancel the‚Ä¶
review_text: I dont know but I did cancel the exchage program and never booket from such a page

We love this resort and have been here many times.  This was a very different experience because of the covid-19 pandemic.  We arrived just as the pandemic was beginning so our first few days were as wonderful as ever.  Even as restaurants started closing for dining, we still enjoyed being at the resort, going for walks and eating in our condo.  We were thankful that we had a full kitchen so we were not dependent on restaurants.  We did leave a day early because our flights were canceled and rebooked for a day later but the resort would not extend our reservation, so we got a flight out the day before our reservation ended.

The units are quite nice and there are often rides to places of interest. The staff is always very helpful. The grounds are always well kept and pretty.My last trip was not great because pools were not available and the unit was not quite as clean as it usually is. I am glad to hear that you have now designated some buildings as pet friendly.Your fees are way too high. They keep going up and there is no way to stop this or get release from the contract without paying even more money. I paid good money to own my timeshare, and I feel that I should be able to get some of my investment back.

review_title: the staff and entire experience was‚Ä¶
review_text: the staff and entire experience was very good. Evrything went as planned and rooms were above expectations for supplies and equipement

I love your timeshare facilities. Very nice, clean, and convenient.However, your website is no longer easy to use (your last major change made it harder to use). Takes much longer to do searches. Your rules on using hotels, cruises, etc  are very restrictive-must be used by a certain time of the year. Also, If I can save all my points on Jan 2, why do you penalize me if I forget to do it at various times of the year from June on. These are some of the items that does not it user friendly.Ken Fass

I tried to get an 87 year old owner some help.  He doesn't have internet and has lost his wife just recently. She was the one that loved to visit the resorts. He now  wants to get out of his ownership and he didn't know how to go about it. I had him to my house so we could call Diamond because he was unsure of what to say.. He was disappointed that we were told he would have to wait up to 4 weeks to get a form to relinquish his contract and it would cost him $1000 just to get out of it. He just thinks this red tape and the cost was just not acceptable.

review_title: Would never go with any other company.
review_text: Would never go with any other company.Awesome...

review_text: I would have rated them a 5 star if it wasn't for their high maintenance fees. Last year my fees for the Hawaii collection actually went down a small amount which was good. I am hoping since they are no longer paying the Interval International fees anymore, that they will be passing that savings along to us. If they do not pass along the savings to us that would not be so good.

review_title: I will have wait and see how the‚Ä¶
review_text: I will have wait and see how the in-house exchange works.

review_title: Every time my wife and I Stay at‚Ä¶
review_text: Every time my wife and I Stay at Cypress Point the staff can't do enough for us. we always enjoy our stay!

review_title: Had some very good friends interested‚Ä¶
review_text: Had some very good friends interested in buying a Diamond offering, but when the final papers were presented, the terms of agreement had changed from the brochure their sale representative pitched them. All were surprised when headquarters said the brochure was incorrect.  Needless to say, I was embarrassed and Diamond lost a $17,000 sale.  Hope this was an isolated case.

review_title: I seriously regret putting any more‚Ä¶
review_text: I seriously regret putting any more money into a timeshare. I felt pressured and was totally insulted through out the process. Recording the closing and then judging us whether we were serious or not was humiliating. I have never dealt with such an unscrupulous organization   I would have cancelled immediately but when I came home we were in the midst of this virus. I am stuck in a situation we I deeply regret every day   With everything going on in the world spending money on a timeshare will be my biggest regret

review_title: DO NOT BUY I have been an owner since 2006 so I do know
review_text: I have been a diamond owner since 2006. DO NOT BUY under any circumstances. You will pay an exorbitant amount to own and then you get to pay an exorbitant amount in fees each and every year that does nothing but go up and up and up.  Also, if you want to use your points for weekends FORGET it as you easily could use all of  points in just 2 weekends.  For example, I currently pay $1433 now just for ONE week and this after paying I will not share how much to be an owner as it it was stupid stupid.  We use to have access to other resorts and could buy a week for a low price which for many years off-set my agitation with the fees. Now they have taken that perk away.  I could buy a week vacation for less than $1433 in a huge cabin!  If I could get all of that money back I would in a heart beat!!!! DO NOT BUY!!!
I have surrendered my points with Diamond Resorts last year. It is cheaper to rent weeks online than it is to pay maintenance fees on time you bought.

The staff at Greensprings Plantation is excellent.  They always try to accommodate special requests for a specific type of unit.  The front desk, gate security and staff are friendly and make you feel welcomed.We‚Äôve been coming to Williamsburg for 30 years.  For us it is a reasonable 5.5 hour drive and there is so much to do in the Williamsburg area.  We can‚Äôt wait to get back there!

review_title: I enjoy the properties and the‚Ä¶
review_text: I enjoy the properties and the experiences at the various resorts and the memories that we make while travelling.  The constant negative changes to the program are very disappointing.

review_title: Have no idea what this email is all‚Ä¶
review_text: Have no idea what this email is all about!!!

Terrible customer service. It takes forever to get anyone on the phone when you call to book or ask questions. Everything they say to you at the sales presentation is pretty much a lie. They make you feel valued and as soon as they get your money, they all disappear. People I met in person in Vegas and Orlando are pretty much ghosts. Even one of the apparent higher ups who gave me his business card just listed the number of basically the front desk. Total croc. It‚Äôs time to get the word out so these crooks don‚Äôt make any more money off of good trusting people

I have enjoyed many of the Diamond Resort properties. We stayed at Oceanair in Virginia Beach - lovely resort.  I also stayed with a friend in Playa del Carmen (Mexico) and a great resort in Spain that offered tours (for a price) directly arranged by the resort.At times, it is hard to find locations in the areas that I wish to travel for the times that I want to go.The fees have gotten quite high and I often think I would like to get rid of my use of Diamond Resorts.  My children definitely do NOT want to take over payments!!!
Resorts are at great locations.Unfortunately, the sales department at the resorts often come across too eager to sell more points.

review_title: I just received mailing that you fees‚Ä¶

I happen to go on the Website to look at potential places and as a results was flooded with Marketing Calls.  We have purchased all we desired and we are not an open contract to more and more and more.  Sorry!

review_title: zoro star...Diamond Resorts is the only‚Ä¶
review_text: zoro star...Diamond Resorts is the only company in the world that doesn't care about its customers during COVID-19. Everyone else is offering customer support during COVID-19. Their first question is when you are going to make the payment, the only thing that matters to them is your money, not the well-being of your clients. Diamond Resort is one of the most difficult companies to do any business or ask for any type of help and understanding during hardship. Do not let them full you, they will offer you the world to become a member and after they have your membership they will leave you. If you or someone you know is experiencing the same situation,

review_title: Diamond is Unwilling to Step Up During Covid-19 Crisis!
review_text: We had booked a cruise on Norwegian (NCL) through Travel Services for May 1-21 using points for 30% and cash for 70%. NCL just notified us that our cruise has been cancelled due to the coronavirus. We are being offered 100% refund of the cash portion or 125% of this amount if we take a credit toward a future cruise. This is what most cruise companies are doing and it's very generous. What is not generous and outright unscrupulous is Diamond's position that the points used toward the 30% are just forfeited. In our case, that's 6,577 points, which gave us $1,973 toward the booking. The $0.30 per point was bad enough but we were looking for ways to use our points. Now, losing those points simply because Diamond is unwilling to step up during this crisis like any other reputable travel company is just pathetic and immoral.

review_title: We have enjoyed every stay at a Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: We have enjoyed every stay at a Diamond Resort.

We go to Powhatan in Williamsburg, Va. everyyear and every time we go, we are always greeted and treated graciously.In the past three years, we requested a certainUnit and the Manager of housekeeping wasoutstanding in accommodating us.  She cameto the unit to make sure we were pleased andif, anything was needed to call.  She gets a 10.Powahatan is absolutely a beautiful and well cared for resort. I always go to the pool andactivities for their fun bingo games & prizes.We go to other resorts in the Poconos, theycannot compete with the Diamond Powhatan Plantation Resorts.Looking forward to booking for our SeptemberGetaway at Diamond Powahatan!Robert and Mary Frances MillerOwners

review_title: Loved staying at cypress Pointe with‚Ä¶
review_text: Loved staying at cypress Pointe with our grandchildren,  so much for them to do
I do not like the fact that whenever I go to a resort, I am asked to attend a sales pitch meeting.

review_title: too expensive on the maintenance and‚Ä¶
review_text: too expensive on the maintenance and fee side     cannot get into places i want even though i am platinum     spent a lot of money over the years and do not see how i will recoup any of the expenses

review_title: I have had bad experiences that I‚Ä¶
review_text: I have had bad experiences that I reported, without a concern - other then attempts to sell me more - sell me more - how about listening?

I am sick and tired of being accosted by the Sales and Marketing people at check-in time!!  It feels like my parking pass or other necessary piece of information is being withheld until I begrudgingly consent to the "60 minute" sales presentation; which inevitably lasts 2.5 to 3 hours.  I have voiced this complaint more times than Carter has little liver pills.  Why bother telling it again?  Hell. Diamond probably rewards that kind of behavior.

We are platinum members and enjoy using our points for many of the options offered  from resort stays to cruises, car rentals, airfare, escorted travel etc. For the ability to be creative and use your points for more that resort stays is great and the options are 5 star However, in many cases the agents your have to work with in Travel Services OVC/ICE are not even worthy of 1 star -  In first quarter I reached out to Travel Services to do a number of All Points bookings for cruises,airfare and car rentals within the 01/01 to 04/30 window In calling I spoke to a couple of agents who I had difficulty understanding and several made wonder if they really knew how to book a cruise and one was very arrogant In late March I found I had to cancel a car rental due the the COVID-19 restrictions, and travel ban to the country we were going to I reaching out by email (5 times) & phone (2 times) to the booking agent in Scottsdale, this was truly frustrating Finally I get an email, this was some 5 days later when he responds to say I'll cancel the car  Here it is now 3 days before we were to pick up the car in St Maarten, and the car confirmation has not been canceled That agent in Scottsdale wasted 2 weeks and still didn't do what he said he would do The lack of response was epic and reaching out to Travel Services customer service was equally as impossible and annoying as I was being as por-active to cancel the car reservation as I could be One can completely understand that thousands of Diamond travelers were also contacting Travel Services to find answers and cancel travel in the wake of COVID-19 Our travel dates were nearly upon us and I called Platinum Services I spoke with a wonderful agent in Las Vegas who was willing to help She contacted another great agent in Mexico City who  was able to cancel the car and get my rental car cost refunded I had booked with 2 other agents in Mexico City, 2 All point cruises and they too were the best but sadly getting to a GOOD agent may take a number of calls and for that 1 Star is the rating So in Travel services you have many agents who don't deserve a 1 Star and other (I've found 3 in Mexico City) who deserve the 6 Star rating While speaking to the agent in Las Vegas I explained that we had to cancel due to family related matters 2 all point cruises and after 5 weeks we still had not been refunded the Taxes & Fees These 2 cruises I booked with an agent I've worked with now for several years in Orlando and she was able to charge the cost for the taxes & fees on both cruises She told me that the paperwork will be forth coming form again Travel Services it was several weeks before I saw anything from OVC/ICE Actually on one of the cruises OVC/ICE had given me the Celebrity booking number and Celebrity indicated that that booking number was for different people not us - TADA another mistake from Travel Service!!   Yes one might say these are little things and what's the big deal we are involved in a world wide pandemic Very True but being able to cancel travel related items and getting a refund in also important Would you want to be charged for something you could not use October 2019 confirmation for Dunes Village 2 Bedroom Angle Ocean Front Unit  Worst experiences Property and the unit were awful It was so bad that we didn't stay 24 hours Attitude @ DV was  Awful A DV front desk person told me HATE DIAMOND Contacted Platinum Services gave detailed information of horrible time Forwarded photos & information about the less than 24 hour stay & to Dunes Village, Meghen Morgan Front Office Manager with photos  Agent indicated that this would be forwarded to the proper department after speaking to her supervisor Over 5 months passed & no contact from DiamondCustomer Service could be better in all aspects of Diamond I've found only a few great ones Sad considering the Maintenance fees we pay good service should be your priority

review_title: They have been most helpful and‚Ä¶
review_text: They have been most helpful and understanding of the request that we had to make during the Corona virus situation causing us to cancel reservations for travel so they reinstated our points to be used for a future time.
It was a pain trying to Cancel my reservations due to Covid-19. I am still waiting on my points to be refunded for a Hotel Reservation and a Car rental.

review_title: One must understand how the points work‚Ä¶
review_text: One must understand how the points work and the other discounts are offered on timeshares and hotels, cruises and travel. It should be the salesperson main agenda for the sales pitch, Once a potential owner understand the concept the sale is almost guaranteed. I got to the plutonium level by knowing I would buy additional points before I even had the sales pitch. P.S. I started by owning a week at Powhattan many years ago.

review_title: My assigned unit was not available when‚Ä¶
review_text: My assigned unit was not available when I arrived at 4:30PM. I had to wait an additional 30 minutes to finally get my unit. What did not make sense that the resort was well under capacity. Other than that my. 2 week stay was fine

review_title: The resorts we have stayed at are fine
review_text: The resorts we have stayed at are fine, and we have liked them alot. But we have experienced difficulty when we accept the resort invite to take an update owner's brief.   Additionally we are becoming very concerned what happens to our membership when we will no longer be physically able to take a vacation.

review_title: Time Share units are very nice but‚Ä¶
review_text: Time Share units are very nice but owner revies/update or whatever you want to call it is a disaster - very high pressure
Needed to change date of reservation.
All was accomplished easily, without hassle.

review_title: A short visit and very poor wifi
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Non-responsive to inquiries. Reservations VERY difficult to get at Orlando location.
Stayed at cypress pointe.  We own at cypress pointe phase II.  We loved the changes that have been made since we were there last.  Look forward to our next visit

review_title: We love our vacations as the resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: We love our vacations as the resorts are beautiful and first class.  Looking forward to traveling again after all this Coronavirus....
Not perfect experiences but still very good overall
Excellent properties, well maintained

review_title: This review has to be split into‚Ä¶
review_text: This review has to be split into different parts. As far as the actual resorts, most are very good and very well kept. Interaction with employees has been good. As a long time owner, my main problem is with the so called owner updates. I have stopped going to them because the have become a very high pressure sales pitch. Most are very cordial in the beginning, but once you turn down the sales pitch you are hit with at least 2 other salesmen putting more pressure on you to buy. I have been insulted, talked down to and generally been treated very unprofessionally. I would never tell anyone to attend one. As long as you avoid these 60 minute updates, which have been known to last several hours you will be fine.
Far too expensive. Cheaper to find better and more economical on-line vacations. Particularly cruises and hotels.

Although this is an older property, it is extremely well maintained, and has an awesome caring staff. From the Front Desk to the groundskeepers, everyone is attuned to the needs of the guests. We had to depart prior to our planned departuand the Resort was very understanding.

review_title: Never purchase a time share from Diamond Resorts
review_text: Diamond Resorts has stretched the truth on a number of dealings I have had with them throughout the years.  This week, I was notified by Interval International (II) that Diamond Reports will no longer be paying the annual membership fee to use their services.  The flexibility that II offered  was one of the reasons I purchased additional points last year. With the exorbitant  maintenance fees owners pay to Diamond, it is s crime we now have to pay for this service.

review_title: Diamond Resorts is one of the best ways to enjoy travelling locally or globally.
review_text: Diamond Resorts are meant to be purchased by those intending on great traveling and using the points they own.  You can be reassured Diamond will provide the best services and facilities available.

Love the places we‚Äôve stayed!  Disappointed in our ‚Äúownership updates‚Äù ‚Äî especially in Williamsburg. This last fall the ‚ÄúHawaii expert‚Äù told us what a terrible mistake we made buying into the Hawaii collection. The main marketing person who was providing good information to us apologized at least 3 times and reassured us that we did what was good for us. She was very good but the damage was done.Had better experiences last year at other places.
We  enjoy the resorts. The company we do not like and feel that we have been lied to and swindled

For most part we are happy with DR. I'm tired of getting hounded about going to Owners Update which is basically a sales meeting. I'm disappointed that Diamond will no longer pay out Interval dues. Wondering what they are going to do to make up for it. I'm sure it will make our fees cheaperüòÅ

My last trip was to Branson, MO. at Plantation at Fall Creek. The resort was decorated for Christmas was in great condition. Silver Dollar City was a fantastic trip for the family and one I would recommend around the holidays!

review_title: Diamond Resorts Responsibility to It‚Äôs Owners
review_text: States that are provoking a stay at home order I hope that diamond resorts will be giving those points back to clients and giving them an additional year to utilize those points. VA,MD, and DC has just gave that order until June 10, 2020.

review_title: Great resorts. But way to expensive.
review_text: Most of the resorts are very nice. The maintenance fees are astronomically. The Events of Lifetime are amazing- until the mandatory bad breakfast fast sales meeting the next morning. For what it costs us we could do a lot more staying at other places since availability is getting hard to find rooms for dates we want.

review_title: Most of the Diamond Resorts are 3-4‚Ä¶
review_text: Most of the Diamond Resorts are 3-4 stars. Many are older properties & while renovations are done it can only help so much. Also the affiliated resorts are usually not as nice.

We have been members since 1998, and are now GOLD MEMBERS.We have stayed at all the European Resorts, and have been highly delighted at the service and accomodation at each one.Our children and grandchildren have also stayed at some of the resorts, and give them a 5 star rating.We will continue to enjoy staying at all the resorts, and highly recommend Diamond to anyone. Joining Diamond was the best thing we spent our money on. Here is to more happy holidays. Thank-you so much Diamond.

review_title: I'd give it zero  if I could
