review_title: For the most part I think Diamond is‚Ä¶great
review_text: For the most part I think Diamond is the best thing since sliced bread.  Last stay was at Cancun Resort in Las Vegas.  Had a bit of a prob with elevators but all good.  We've been members of the Club since 2007 and have really enjoyed our trips and stays,  Wonderful people working there now.

review_title: Still have not heard back from requests‚Ä¶
review_text: Still have not heard back from requests  sent in.

review_title: Far too late in providing information‚Ä¶
review_text: Far too late in providing information regarding existing reservations during this pandemic.  Chat conversation responses were glib, and contained very little useful information.  After many attempts by telephone, being placed in the the queue for over an hour, I emailed my queries and finally received a response which allowed me to cancel our reservation without penalty, with a restriction on when my points needed to be used by.  I doubt very much that we will be able to use all of these points by your imposed deadline of October 31, 2020.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Big Thank You to Diamond Resorts.
review_text: Many thanks Diamond for you responses to the Covid-19 pandemic. We were recently on lock down at Jardines del Sol in Lanzarote unable to get a flight back to UK. As the Spanish Government had told resorts to close Reception team members went above and beyond duty requirements assisting with trying to find flights and making sure everyone was all right, whilst putting cleaning and safe distancing in place. All the staff were brilliant. I have also read this scenario from several other resorts and destinations.We appreciate that you are allowing members to cancel holidays and returning their points at this stressful time and that you are being flexible with other issues some members have.The fact that you are temporarily allowing some resorts to be used for frontline medical staff who are having to be away from home whilst they are working to care for sick people or unable to return home due to having vulnerable people there is admirable.  Thank you to all Diamond workers for your dedication.

review_title: Beware! These are skillful, deceptive, manipulative, thieves and liars!
review_text: Let me begin by saying I‚Äôm a reasonably smart guy. I thought i could match wits with a sales agent. Nope! I‚Äôm handicapped by trust and being honest. These sales people are ‚Äôprofessionals‚Äô. They are devious, highly trained, deceptive, manipulative liars and thieves. They are very creative. No matter what they tell you, only what is written on the hundreds of pages of the contract maters in the end. There is NO recourse after signing! Their escalation‚Äô appeals process is a joke. All they did was recite the contract back to me and tell me i signed the forms. The sales agent‚Äôs boss (VP of sales) just supported his salesman and essentially told me he had trained his agents in the very lies i had been told. Im just SOL. My recommendation:1. Don‚Äôt buy Diamond Points!2. Don‚Äôt accept a gift for a presentation!3. Don‚Äôt attend a presentation for ANY REASON!Consider;1. There is a huge secondary market for timeshares. (Hmmm.... i wonder why?) Look there. Massively discounted! DRI points for as little as $.75/pt. (They tell you the price per point is $11.00 and ‚Äòabout to go up - again!‚Äô but you somehow can buy today at $4.25/pt! IF you buy now! HIGH PRESSURE. 2. I don‚Äôt recommend Diamond Points even at $.75/pt!3. Maybe some other company is better. (I really don‚Äôt know about the others. )Good luck!

Horror in Hawaii. Attended a two hour seminar at Diamond resort. It ended up three hours long of abuse . You say no, then another sales person comes in with new numbers, then another, then another!I wanted to take an written offer home to review, but they said "no way can a written offer leave here". They were a bunch of thugs trying to intimidate us. They insulted my wife to a point of her crying.

review_title: This is a follow up to a previous‚Ä¶
review_text: This is a follow up to a previous review of Diamond resorts. I contacted their customer service regarding an ongoing issue and was told there is nothing that could be done. I followed up with e-mails to corporate and its been over 2 weeks and I have not received a response They actually asked for my contact info from my first review and there has been no contact. This company needs to be called out for what it really is, a DISGRACE, Lies, Deceit and NO customer service.Don't stop running from this organization

review_title: I loved Diamond Resorts until I had an‚Ä¶
review_text: I loved Diamond Resorts until I had an issue and got very bad guidance and direction.  I have asked numerous times for the email address for the head of customer service and the office of the president of Diamond in both email and the many many recorded phone conversations with Diamond.  My next step if I cannot speak to someone is to reach out to a consumer advocate group and go public with my experience.  You have so much documentation from me that was ignored and has ruined me because of your lack of communication and followup.  So much time was lost which resulted in monetary loss to me at your delays and bad information.

Total waste.  Annoy you with constantly trying to upgrade you to the package that solves for everything the last package was suppose to do but doesn‚Äôt because they flat out lie, mislead, or just don‚Äôt know themselves and do why they are taught.  But if you purchase you will quickly learn more than the salesperson that owns 4 Timeshare‚Äôs and this is the best for all these great reasons.  They always log into a platinum account to show you what your account can do (if it was platinum).  ‚ÄúStay vacationed‚Äù is their motto. It should be stay sitting at a sales desk.  You can never use your points without being begged and lied to in order to get you to a ‚Äúpromised‚Äù ‚Äúin writing‚Äù ‚Äúyou can just stand up at 60 minutes‚Äù.  One girl couldn‚Äôt believe I was turning down $200,m and a cruise.  She started saying her job was on the line. I was the only person to turn this down.  This is the way they are at every location ‚Äúcorporate‚Äù or otherwise. They have all said the same stuff.  I even had a guy thinking he would use leverage on me because I reason for not upgrading was because I came through on my end and they still couldn‚Äôt get my account to work.  Him and his manger tried to so me my account was negative and that might be why.  My dude are setup monthly to pay in advance and each month the amount goes bigger with ( ) around the number, as in I‚Äôm positive not negative. He even had him manager come say the same thing. So I paid the amount on the spot and it made my account go ‚Äúdouble negative‚Äù.  I have heard it all from these people.

review_title: Overall great customer skills and great‚Ä¶
review_text: Overall great customer skills and great accommodations
Always enjoy the time we spend at Kolh's Ranch, it's our favorite staycation place.

Diamond Resort is a SCAM; my husband and I went to their presentation while vacationing in Los Cabos, Mexico, and we were fooled into buying with Richard (Rick); Aside from the fact that we are paying a lot of money for not enough points to do anything with or go anywhere, our financial situation changed due to medical  issues, and even though we sent letters from my Doctor and my employer, its been imposible to cancel the membership and the payments;STAY AWAY; WORST COMPANY EVER

review_title: We complained about place we stayed so‚Ä¶
review_text: We complained about the place we stayed in so many time during the time we staying we was told nothing went to the time share thing I was told they do not allow what happened to us was going to fix it and for us go back to the place we stayed for to be fix so we did they told us they have no clue what we are talking about laugh it off so we left on our way back home this was the worst honey moon ever and feel very hurt and upset they didn't fix it we took there word that this would be handled and it was not first we where told we had to do all the laundry to the room since they do not do that then there was no heat in hallway's of the hotel then I was rudely told to remove myself from the pool where I payed to be in no sorry or my fault the guy that talk to me was so unprofessional I said this was the hotel from hell but I felt better when I was told that they where going to handle it this not how they treat people that stay with them to only find out that was a sale pitch and they lied to me I am so disappointed I bought a timeshare from them thinking that really put there customers first now I don't even want to use it I feel so played but won't be last of hearing from me very upset customer

review_title: The staff at Cabo Azul Resort & Spa‚Ä¶
review_text: The staff at Cabo Azul Resort & Spa were always professional, helpful and extremely courteous. A true five star experience.
great company

As  an elderly resident, we are always very careful of our surroundings. At Diamond Resort the 24 hour awareness of their residents is present and most evident, alleviating us of any possible negative encounters, DR takes care of their own very very well, Thank you.

review_title: For those of us who have trouble with‚Ä¶
review_text: For those of us who have trouble with steps it would be nice to be assured of a first floor when booking a resort with no elevator.Cathy McKinney Bitler

Suffered a major accident on the last day of our stay.Staff at the resort responded quickly and sorted out the Emergency Services then got the remainder of our party to the airport. We were relocated with no fuss, staff and management were superb, helping with transport, interpreting and generally being supportive and helpful - way above the call of duty!!It also helped that the two resorts we were accommodated in were well maintained and the apartments themselves were both lovely and well kept.

review_title: After over 15 years I found that our experience was extremely BAD
review_text: After over 15 years I found that the system does not meet our needs since we were not Abel to make any booking in good resort although our weeks are red weeks in Isle of Bali (Liki Tiki) which is about six miles to Disney. We tried to book as early as one year earlier which ended with loosing many weeks in addition to the high cost of maintenance, Tax, and exchange. It ended that we sold our weeks back to Liki Tiki for FREE and we paid for them the registration fees. Extremely Bad Experience. We advise every body to avoid buying time share weeks even for free.

We truly enjoyed our stay.  The Kitty Hawk site was a nice, quiet and pleasant location.  The amenities were family friendly and convenient although we did not use them during this visit.  We found the staff to be very cordial and helpful. We have no reservations of returning in the future.  We found the community and local attractions very accommodating.

review_title: Diamond resort takes very good care of‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond resort takes very good care of their members.  Royalty treatment. I have requested additional services, and the staff is very fast and to my satisfaction.  Excellent customer service. They have delivered on every promise they make. Everyone is super nice and have yet to meet an angry representative. I'm a satisfied member.

review_text: We were lied to at our membership update.need not say more. Money was taken out of our account when it should not have causing overdrafts.need not say more

review_title: A great place for a family reunion

review_text: Your 800 number answering service has a problem.  I called twice to talk to a representative pressed 4 then 3 and was placed on hold for over 10 minutes each time. I had to terminate each call. I change my approach to finally reach a representative.  I spent more 30 minutes in  solving my loan question. The delay by Diamond Resorts in acknowledging payments for loans results in owner frustrations..
Customer service is extremely good and the facilities are top notch and very clean.

Maintenance fees are too high.  Also getting more difficult to book a reservation at Desert Paradise Resort in Las Vegas & Marquis Villas and/or Palm Canyon Resort in Oalm Springs.  I have to believe the reason is because people are able to book these hotels they online bookings & I just saw Desert Paradise Resort listed on Southwest Air Lines. review_title: I wish I could give this company 0‚Ä¶
review_text: I wish I could give this company 0 stars. We signed up for a 3 night stay at one of their resorts and we were promised a $150 Visa gift card and a 5 night cruise for 2. We booked and as the time came closer we called to confirm. We were told they removed their sales force from Miami and that since we already had our flights booked we could still go and not do the presentation but would receive everything we were promised. A couple weeks after we returned we called and were told we would receive our packet with our gifts in 2 weeks. Weeks passed and we called again and a very rude woman told us we were getting nothing. They are completely unprofessional and we will do everything we can to share our experience with everyone possible so other people don't get scammed.

review_title: Every thing was and is terrific
review_text: Every thing was and is terrific . I‚Äôd like to see more policing of all the ‚Äúsaved‚Äù lounges during the morning time. I know you try. Also, it‚Äôs ‚Äútacky‚Äù to see towels and wet clothes draped on railings when we have racks in the units. Your employees are great!

review_text: It was a nice place and we would stop in again,

review_title: Evaluation of our recent Diamond Resort experience
review_text: Our experience was delightful. the apartment was clean and well stocked providing us the comforts of home. The staff were all polite and helpful.The only issue was parking our vehicle. Our unit parking place was always occupied by another vehicle.
Always have wonderful holidays staff very helpful and friendly.

review_title: Diamond Resorts Customer Service Is No Service
review_text: The Diamond Resorts customer service team was unwilling to help me with an issue with my deposit but thankfully my exchange company valued me as a customer and solved my problem. In addition, the Diamond Resorts maintenance fees are outrageous and continue to increase due to greed. Vacation ownership should be a positive experience...not one that creates stress.

review_title: I really enjoyed stay in Va Beach at‚Ä¶nice resort
review_text: I really enjoyed stay in Va Beach at one of the diamond resorts only place stay when I visit

review_text: Every damn time I check into a Diamond Resort I get this OWNER UPDATE bull-S! Yes I said BULL - S! I can why? BECAUSE I'M AN OWNER & I PAY MAINTENANCE FEES TOO! So just STOP YOUR OWNER UPDATE - Which is nothing but trying to get you to BUY MORE TIME! Just do yourself a favor - Don't F with your owners! Leave us alone! Go after NEW people...... NOT US!

review_text: Always a great stay at diamond resort sunset bay , friendly staff , great size apartments, can‚Äôt wait will be back in 5 days !!

review_title: 20 years of great holidays at various‚Ä¶
review_text: 20 years of great holidays at various resorts. Had to give up membership due to I'll health and problem obtaining travel insurance.I miss my breaks so much.
Staff was kind, courteous, and efficient.Condo was excellent, clean, warm. I have stayed at the Powhatan resort 3 times and always had a Fantastic time.

review_title: Personnel were wonderful and eager to‚Ä¶
review_text: Personnel were wonderful and eager to please. Great place to stay.

review_title: Do Not Purchase Diamond Resort Memberships
review_text: We would not buy a Diamond Resort membership again under any circumstances, and we are platinum members.  We recently stayed at a Diamond property.  When we checked in they wanted us to attend a "membership update".  We told them no.  They then called us for 3 consecutive nights asking us repeatedly to attend & each time offering more incentives to attend.  Almost all of the members we meet at their properties tell us they would never had joined if they knew how they would be treated at the "member updates".  We recently attended one in December & were promised 2 airline tickets to attend.  We did.  Upon getting home & calling we were told you had to fly out one day & then return the next day!!  What type of vacation would that be?  We have been threatened on multiple occasions at "member updates" that if we did not make additional purchases of points that Diamond would take away our membership!!

review_title: No matter what Diamond Resort we visit
review_text: No matter which Diamond Resort we visit we always get treated with utmost respect. Staff makes sure everything is to our satisfaction and quite friendly and courteous. No matter what kind of day they're having they always have smiles on their face.

review_title: We really enjoyed Diamond resorts in‚Ä¶
review_text: We really enjoyed Diamond resorts in Sedona, AZ.The staff are friendly and very helpful.Love the bookings for touring at the counter.
Diamond is the best.
DIAMOND RESORTS ARE BLEADING THEIR OWNERS DRY WITH THEIE MAINTENANCE FEES PLUS ALL THE ADDED CHARGES BEING INCLUDED.  PLUS THEY DO NOT ALLOW THE OWNERS ANY WAY TO BACK OUT FROM THEIR OWNERSHIP!

review_title: I've been to multiple Diamond resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: I've been to multiple Diamond resorts and have never been disappointed with the staff, the room accommodations or the activities. We have been to about eleven locations from Virginia Beach, VA to Sedona, AZ. Awesome experiences every time!

review_title: The Diamond Resorts that I have visited.....
review_text: Most of the Diamond Resorts that I have visited are okay.  They are not bad and they are not great.  They are fine for having a place to stay while visiting the destination but not necessary a place to stay and enjoy the resort.

review_title: Diamond may control our resorts but‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond may control our resorts but they really don't have a clue what Embarc is about. So many mistakes.
The Polo Towers - Vegas, is a great place to stay.  Central location - quick access to the strip - my first choice of accommodation when visiting Vegas :)

review_title: Expensive, Complicated, Diamond Resorts is only in it for the money ... they really don't care for you to STay-Vacationed!!!!
review_text: Expensive annual fees.  Little flexibility with trades and options for using points.  Always trying to sell more points ... they don't just let us enjoy a nice vacation.  Advise to anyone who has NOT purchased a time share or vacation points ... DON'T DO IT.  It's expensive and hard to manage.  Many rules where you think you have some opportunity only to find out that you had to respond before a particular month or within a certain time period ... stuff they don't really explain in detail when they sell try to sell you on buying in.  Additionally, we own a timeshare property that was not owned by Diamond Resorts when we purchased it .... now Diamond Resorts is trying to force us out of owning our week at our property of choice and to get out of that, they want us to buy more points!!!!  If they wanted the unit so desperately, they should be offering us more points in exchange for the week ... it should cost us nothing ... we have already paid for the unit!

We like the resorts, but using getting a room is ridiculously hard.  I can rent them through Diamond's Cash Rental desk.  But because of "inventory management" they don't have rooms available for points and vouchers.  To me this makes them total scammers.  Selling people points that you can't use because they don't have enough rooms in the "points inventory"  even though they have plenty of rooms available for "Cash Rental" should be illegal.

To Whom This May Concern,     First off i hope this doesn't fall on deaf ears but i would like to tell you about a very uneventful experirnce my wife and i had at one of your hotels that we stayed at for our visit to Las Vegas. We visited Las Vegas for our 10th Wedding Anniversary January 23 - 27 and stayed at Polo Towers on the Las Vegas Strip.We were there to celebrate our anniversary and to re-new our wedding vows and to have a great vacation. We were expecting everything to go great and were looking forward to a amazing experience. Well things started off well when we were able to check in early since the room was available. The check in agent was very pleasant and made check in easy. Then we were directed to the concirege, Cory, and he started to tell us about places to see, places to visit and places to eat. Then he suggested we partake in a presentation for a Timeshare if you will, and we would be rewarded some free gifts and after all who doesn't like free things. He told us that there were no obligations on our part to particapate in this presentation so we said we would check it out. We were told all we needed to do is listen for 2 hours and then we would be on our way. The presentation started off well with a breakfast and our salesman Jesse was very nice and polite. When we informed him from the begining that we would not be purchasing anything today he then turned pushy and slightly irritated. After telling him a few times we were not interested, after the 2 hours was up, he then pushed another salesman on us who was just as pushy and rude. He kept asking us over and over again "Why do you come to these if you are not going to purchase?" getting right in my face and being very aggressive. Now when he didn't succeed in selling us a timeshare he got another saleman who was the worst of them all. While trying to leave the presentation the saleman told me i was being very disrespectful to him but he was the one being disrespectful to my wife and I as he brushed up against me as he walked by me while i was talking to him. A few words were exchanged and then he hands my wife the paperwork for the free gifts and says in a degrading tone "Here, go get your hundred dollars" like we really needed it. When we left we tried to confide in the concirege who set us up on this presentation and when I started to talk he cut me off and handed me a form and said to fill it out and send it to Corporate office. So now feeling rejected by the hotel we were guests at we left, picked up our free gifts  and tried to enjoy the day we had planned. Later that evening we met up with the presentation Leader Tammy and she tried to do right by us and offered us $50.00 more in restaurant vouchers which was nice but still didn't make everything ok. I am letting you know all this to make you aware that i was not the only couple in this group that felt disrespected and degraded because we didn't purchase a timeshare. Now if they are trying to make sales they are going about it all wrong and really need to have some more training on respect, personality and generally being nice to the guests.

review_title: We enjoyed our week at Grand Beach in‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoyed our week at Grand Beach in Orlando. Nice units, well equipped and spacious. The suggestions I have are meant to be helpful and constructive. Some are maintenance issues. Unit 433* All knives including steak knives are terrible. A dull knife is more dangerous than a sharp knife. They‚Äôre junk. The steak knives were like saws.* There should be lights under the cabinets especially under the sink.* Dresser drawers do not work. Cheap furniture* Cheesy prizes for the games. Bingo numbers were read too quickly.  *Announce activities when ready to start - don‚Äôt just stand there!* Grills are not appropriately lit. Lights are behind the grill and when you grill the lid is up thus the grill is dark* You need another garbage and recycling container by the door to the lobby coming from the pool* No tongs in with kitchen utensils* Someone cleaned the cooktop with the wrong product. It‚Äôs not shiny it‚Äôs finish is dull and ruined* When doing a mid week clean garbage was taken out and fresh towels were put in place but the kitchen towels which are used more than bath towel were not replaced* The lamp next to the bed on left side is broken. The harp is bent and the shade on top is very wobbly and can not be straighten  * The TV‚Äôs in the bedrooms are Samsung but the one in the living room is a Sharp and it is JUNK!

This Unit B had interior lightbulb blown out and the lightbulb was blown out over the mini dining table. This Unit B was missing bathroom floor towel and again, partial balcony sheers were missing. In the Unit A, the kitchen sink sprayer loose from sink, and microwave turntable missing interior gadget which prevents microwave turntable fromrotating (did not report these two issues). All of the other maintenance and engineering issues were addressed and remedied. Being a Diamond Resort, I was saddened that the front desk supervisor/manager did not return my call (left message more than 4 days ago). I was also saddened and disappointed that Ocean Beach Club Diamond Resorts managerial staff did not address nor offer our family an iota of compensation for all our inconveniences sustained during our vacation week.  üòüUpon check out today, I requested parking fee compensation for the unit issues. review_title: Since this is addressed to Gail (who by‚Ä¶
review_text: Since this is addressed to Gail (who by the way is not a member, she was our guest over a year ago), I am writing with regard to her experience.  We had saved points to book rooms at the Scottsdale Villa Mirage for our son's wedding so that many family members (9 suites) could stay together at the same location.  We visited the facility about 6 months in advance and were told that it would be no problem to accomodate special requests, we just needed to work with the facility. We made the bookings with the request that the rooms be grouped together, and that two of the rooms be on the bottom floor due to mobility problems, and followed up to confirm about a month in advance.  As it turned out, the rooms couldn't have been farther apart, and only one of the rooms was on the ground floor, which caused mobility challenges for the groom's grandparents.  We have been Diamond Platinum members for years, and I was mortified and extremely disappointed at how our requests were dishonored and how our guests were treated. We also attended a misrepresented update at the Villa Mirage, and I am inclined to never again accept another invitation to such an event.  In our opinion, the management and service at Diamond Resorts has declined dramatically since the last ownership change.  I am not one to typically write such a review, however, in our "update", the feedback that we offered was not taken seriously as they were trying to sell us more points in a system that has declined in value for us.

A work out room would be nice for hot or rainy days, but we got our share of exercise on a few of the many different hikes in very close vicinity with the perfect low 70s temperatures.The wifi speed is significantly lacking for those of us who need to work during a vacation.All in all we thoroughly enjoy Rancho Manana and Cave Creek. We only bought what we did to have access to Sedona. In retrospect, I would not do it again. Some of their Sedona resorts are among the best of their resorts. It would cost us less to rent units etc. outright. They do not hold to the standards we have with our Marriott and Westin resorts.
Room was BAD and old
The check in staff was wonderful alert and attentive. Big smiles from everyone I encountered

review_title: Not a five for too much sales pressure.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I‚Äôd get out if I could!
review_text: Not a good value for price of ownership.  Club Intrawest was much better before Diamond Resorts got involved.
Their sales people lie constantly to get you to buy additional points. Their resorts for the most part are nice, but the annual maintenance fees are absurdly high and constantly grow.

review_title: They need improvements in all areas
review_text: They need improvements in all areas.  From their front desk staff to their sales personnel to the condition of their accommodations.

review_title: Property sold from DRI to Holiday Inn; Now What?
review_text: My property has been sold by DRI to Holiday Inn but I am seeing annual dues on my DRI dashboard. I have no idea how this is working or if I even need to be a member with DRI anymore if you no longer own my property (Ridge Tahoe). The representative had no info on the matter and I hung up more frustrated and confused than ever. They said yes I owe the dues and I will just get my 'points' with DRI now (which is what I have always received, even when DRI owned the Ridge Tahoe). I always paid the maint dues directly to the on-site prop mgmt "Ridge Resorts" even though it was owned by DRI. NOW WHAT and why is the communication so bad? Shouldn't owners be much more informed of this big of a transaction?

review_title: I enjoyed by stay at Beach Quarters
review_text: I enjoyed by stay at Beach Quarters; the room was extremely clean and everyone was so friendly.  It was nice to wake up in the morning and see all the friendly faces.  I am looking forward to my next stay.
Everything was just perfect. Loved our room. Great service. Didn‚Äôt even want to leave the resort. Thank you

Your telephone service is awful ... you assume all people do everything on the computer that is not so .... or have an iphone... waited 45 mins on hold 4 times never got through ... this is the normwith Diamond Resorts...

review_title: Stayed at Mystic Dunes and the elevator‚Ä¶
review_text: Stayed at Mystic Dunes and the elevator was out 90% of the time. So we stayed in a lot because we were on the top floor and when we called to report it was just told it should be up by 5pm and went back down before we returned from dinner.
Hard to find resorts that have availability, not enough available for members. The resorts are nice. We have had many memorable trips. Resorts tend to be very homey.

review_title: Villas de Santa Fe :  Wonderful Value Off Season
review_text: I've stayed at Santa Fe, NM  Villas de Santa Fe Resort and really enjoy the condo rooms (I stay in one with a King bed) - very clean, two TVs and DVD player, stovetop, microwave, and large refrigerator freezer in unit...excellent value "off season" for my budget....Safe area, park and can walk 5 blocks to the Plaza and Museums, shops,etc.  Nice outdoor pool (heated) and indoor exercise room; laundry machines available as courtesy to wash/dry clothing.  Pleasant staff and even  (advance notice) local Shuttle service available.

review_title: We have very little interactions with‚Ä¶
review_text: We have very little interactions with diamond resorts, other than we do pay our ‚Äòmanagement charges‚Äô to them for our apartment at Sunset Bay. We do get an occasional message but up to now it has been of little or no consequence to us personally.Cannot really give an accurate rating for diamond resorts, for the purpose of this survey.

The Resort is as beautiful as ever. I do not think that Javier's Restaurant food is as good as it used to be. While dining, a Mexican musical group played and I couldn't hear my companion's conversation as the music overwhelmed the entire place. It did not make for a pleasant dining experience. Overall, I will certainly return. I am at Cabo Azul about 3 times per year.
Great place. Kid friendly

I invested 4000 dollars in a promotional point event last year while in Florida.  I was promised I could use the 20  000 points I bought to use at any of the vacation spots I had identified with the sales person.  Also, he guaranteed I would have access to his cell phone where he would personally assist me with getting the places I spoke of with him.  None of this happened, and although I encountered some helpful good people in Diamond employees along my way this year I have ended up with a disappointing exchange at Palm Canyon for my 12 days@ 350.00 plus perday .  I have not had such a bad experience with Diamond before and would recommend to others to be very wary of point deals that are offered during the sales meetings.
Great staff, great location off the strip, wonderful facility!

review_title: A lovely weekend spent at Wychnor
review_text: Stayed at Wychnor country park for the weekend in a 3 bed house , it was very spacious andnicely decorated .We used the leisure facilities which were very good the member of staff made sure the pool was never overcrowded. Food in the bar was very good and there was entertainment later in the evening , we enjoyed the quiz very much .My little grandson loved the mud kitchen set in the wooded area .all members of staff were always helpful.

review_title: I had complained about a program being‚Ä¶
review_text: I had complained about a program being taken away, the club select program and website and was promised help and phone calls.I have received two calls with assistance to "show" me where the same features are, but both ladies could not guide me to it since it is not there anymore and the comment "we have made it easier for you to find it" is a lie since it is not there anymore and I hate that they take away bit by bit and you are stuck with only paying the bills!I would not buy into Diamond at all anymore and will get rid of my timeshare as quickly as I can!

If this is referring to the time when I was trying to pay a bill for an event, I must admit that it wasn't a stellar experience because the person with whom I was speaking wasn't clear on how to process the payment.  It took longer than it should have.

review_title: We had a rough year and missed out on‚Ä¶
review_text: We had a rough year and missed out on being able to make reservations when we could go.  This is a major downside to time share ownership - there should be some way to make considerations for this.  We are 25 year owners and really resent spending so much money on annual fees and getting nothing in return.
IGNORE TEXT
I don't like Diamond Resorts.  I think they are a horrible company.  If I wasn't married I would have gotten rid of this timeshare years ago.

About a month before my stay at a Diamond Resort, I started receiving phone calls and emails from Diamond Resorts staff in the Orlando area.  My stay was at a resort in Tennessee.  I was asked to contact them to "verify" the dates of my reservation and to see if I needed any information about the resort.  It all sounds harmless, right?However, when you call the number, what they really want is for you to agree to sit for a sales pitch for Diamond Resorts while you visit their resort.  It is an underhanded way to make contact with you.  In addition, when you finally check in at the resort, you will be asked you for your cell phone number.  Then, while you are staying at their property, you will be called by their on-site sales staff asking that you listen to their sales pitch. My review only covers contact with Diamond Resort sales personnel.  My stay at the resort is usually very pleasant.

Very disappointed I ended up paying double what I would have because my husband had to cancel I was told I could do the presentation at another date I was billed 600 dollars for a 3 night stay in a less than 100 dollar a night condo
I have stayed at two different diamond resorts in Orlando. Love them both. Found the staff at both resorts warm, friendly and helpful. Will definitely use diamond resorts again
High standard for apart hotel. Always clean ans nice. Friendly and attentive service in the reception

review_title: We enjoy staying at the Scottsdale‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoy staying at the Scottsdale Links Resort.  It's so close to where our family is out there and helps us stay close so we can visit with them. The units are spacious and have been recently updated. They are comfortable, too.  The 2 pools are very nice.  The office staff are pretty knowledgeable about places in the area and keeping you up on what's going on at the resort. They have nice accomodations for familys as well.
The representative assigned kept having to reschedule and since October I haven‚Äôt heard from him. I don‚Äôt even know how to use my points and I wish I could get rid of it.

Took a tour of the Lake District in England.  Stayed in a cozy cabin by a lake.  Tour bus left daily for historic and scenic sights in the district.  Friendly informative tour guides.  Cabins conveniently located within walking distance of the town and 2 grocery stores.

review_title: A Marriott guys point of view.
review_text: For the most part, the people have been very nice, helpful, and aimed to please‚Äîthe sales people need to improve in people skills, integrity, ethics.  The couple of location I have visited were very nice.
Terrible time getting through to Financial Services

review_title: They was not honest with Me at all...
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Nice place (Sahara Sunset), but The lokal super market was closed due to refurbishment. The resort should have offered to bring grosaries from a neighbouring super market.
Beautiful resort! Great food and other amenities.

DO NOT TRUST THESE people!!  My wife and I have been going to timeshare presentations for years.  Everytime we go we see how the systems have evolved and improved.  The providers usually give great gifts and they are fair.  They encourage you to stay at a NICE resort for free and offer cruises in exchange for your valuable time.  Diamond Resorts has a different mentality.  In their mind, you need to pay them to give a sales presentation.  They offer you "gifts".  Let me tell you about these "gifts".  They are completely saturated in fees.  You have to pay 300 dollars to get started. Their reaorts are old, dated, horrible decor with stains on furniture and holes in curtains.  We had a 3 night stay at a location that was worth 40 dollars a night on expedia.  So, that's 120 dollars.  We still paid 180 out of pocket.  The cruise voucher was supposed to be worth 650 dollars a couple.  As we booked our cruise, the price came to 1024 dollars (Not Free) like they promised.  We went on Carnivals Website (cheapest cruise line) and without a certificate it was 1300.  Now...where was the 650 dollar discount.  The travel agent advised us to call diamond back and get a new voucher.  Basically, diamond told us to "F" off.  We Also got a Dex Cert.  Tried to use it and NOTHING was available for like the next 12 months, the time we have to use the cert.  Told Diamond and again wasntoldnto "F"off.  Do NOT Trust Diamond and do NOT purchase with them.  Their resorts are terrible.  There are MUCH better ones out there.
Very friendly staff

The condo was exactly as promised. The grounds and the interior were immaculate. The pool area was relaxing and enjoyable. The staff was very willing to offer information about the Naples area. We would definitely recommend the Charter Bay of Naples to our friends and relatives!!

IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Brilliant New Years event and vacation
review_text: Great accommodation, clean, comfortable, well designed, great location and a fantastic New Years Gala with excellent food, entertainment and service.The staff were brilliant and the other guests made for a fantastic night, all compared by an excellent DJ
Way too expensive, very difficult to exit, including very expensive.  Limited availability.

review_title: Read before you sign. Bunch of liars.
review_text: These people lie in order to get you to buy their product. Do not trust them. I was so pleased to get my money back for one of the packages I purchased. Read everything before you sign. I'll never stay at their resorts nor do business with this company again.

review_title: Overcharged for a broken corkscrew in‚Ä¶
review_text: Overcharged for a broken corkscrew in France which snapped in my hand first use, not replaced despite my complaint.  No help from Diamond Resorts either.  The location was good but the resort nothing special.  Not up to usual standards.
Maintenance fees are too high. Especially considering, no matter what resort I visit, there is always something broken.
Very nice clean apartment. Will return xx

Bought a hotel stay package in order to try out Diamond Resort services before becoming a member.  We were misled on the list of possible destinations we could book with the package.  One destination, Charleston caught our eye and convinced us to buy the package.  The sales person confused Diamond Resort Properties with Diamond Resort package destinations. We were disappointed and hesitant now to become a member as the "fine print" can be confusing and difficult to get straight. our hope is to find a vacation company that can make this process easy to understand.

Service and employees were great. My poor experience is with financial services. My experience as a whole has been poor from day one. With being lied to and  having to call multiple times with no resolution. I will be filing a report with BBB.

review_title: Worked with Diamond Resorts for many‚Ä¶
review_text: Worked with Diamond Resorts for many years and I would recommend any young person with Zest , passion and dedication to help families to achieve family bonding to make Diamond Resorts a career place for them . Blessings to all .
Excellent accommodation and lots of places in the world to visit

review_title: I have had a trusting attitude until I‚Ä¶
review_text: I have had a trusting attitude until I was misinformed and have paid an outrageous amount to try to amend their error not mine.

Every year when I return from my vacation, with some complaints about the resort ( sometimes even safety issues) no one responds my email.Points ALWAYS goes up for the same location. Forcing me to purchase more.Complete disregard with customer.

review_title: I went in Nov of 2018 and I had a‚Ä¶
review_text: I went in Nov of 2018 and I had a Blast, the staff was excellent I felt like I was in another world. I LOVE THIS PLACE it was called Caribbean Resorts when I was staying Now I'm part owner of a Timeshare! #Blessed

review_title: Have talked to someone last Monday and‚Ä¶
review_text: Have talked to someone last Monday and again Wednesday regarding making our monthly maintenance dues and using our points. Both promised they would get back to me by the end of the day, they verified our email and phone number. We‚Äôve not heard a word. The second person Wednesday was a supervisor, Colleen? And promised she would contact us. Over the past year starting with the lying scam that was pulled on us when we stayed at a resort in Hawaii last January we have lost all faith in Diamond resorts and their staff. I feel social media needs to know what kind of people run Diamond and how they lie to their owners, even when they are on vacation with the rest of their family!! How upsetting is this!!Chuck and Sue ButtOwners and Members

review_title: Plan ahead and reserve your vacation as‚Ä¶
review_text: Plan ahead and reserve your vacation as soon as possible. Diamond Resorts is very helpful and accommodating.
Very nice property.

I think the sales representatives are very aggressive, I already have a vacation plan that I use. I repeatedly told them no but they kept going to get someone else, that really turned me off. I think the overnight plans should be introduced first. Maybe break down the group by who would want a overnight stay to longer vacations.

review_title: Los abrigados is our favorite place in‚Ä¶
review_text: Los abrigados is our favorite place in USA... can't wait to go back .... the spa is great ... ms. Morris runs a good facility  ... hope to see you soon
Very outdated TVs, housekeeping didn‚Äôt leave soap, poor selection of dishes and glasses.  Quite disappointing.  Furniture could also use updating.
Have always been treated very well by Diamond Resorts employees. I like their attitude of looking for a way to say yes to our requests.

review_title: The resorts are beautiful and the‚Ä¶
review_text: The resorts are beautiful and the employees are amazing.  As a single owner however, your marketing department seems to have a desire to not want to include me because I don‚Äôt have a significant other.  And anytime I‚Äôve traveled with a female, your marketing department makes every attempt to have them attached to my account.  This part is very frustrating.  The point is, I am an owner.  I should be offered the dinners and special events that married or attached owners are offered.  And if I choose to bring a companion with me or friend, I should be allowed.

Being charged a fee per person when paying to exchange to the resort is ridiculous. I can understand amenity fees but not when the guests are not even using them. I used to love Powhatan before Diamond took over. I will never exchange to there again which is sad because my parents had owned at Powhatan for 25 years.
Great room. All the team is so friendly. Wonderful service

review_title: Sixteen years of enjoyment at the Powhatan!
review_text: We have been coming to the Historic Powhatan Resort now for sixteen years. If I had one suggestion, it would be, please, replace the sofa and chairs in the living room area! They are miserable to sit upon! The Staff is stellar, the grounds are immaculately groomed, the condo is always clean with supplies in place. While it may not be important to others, this aspect is important to me...I always feel safe on the resort. It is so nice, to drive in, and, have the Security Team greet you, they are often forgotten when doling out appreciation. We look forward, to returning.
Accommodation is usually first class.  Housekeeping services are slightly less frequent than in earlier years, but nevertheless still sufficient.

review_title: Diamond is 1st class but very expensive
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

Very upset with Diamond Resorts.  We have been trying to go to Cabo every December for years and can never get in no matter if we try to book 6 months out!!  I thought Diamond Resorts put a stop to people being able to book more than 3 months in advance!  Yes, we have thousands of places to go but if people are allowed to book a year in advance, where does that leave the rest of us?

review_title: was promised an ocean view and 1 dollar‚Ä¶
review_text: was promised an ocean view and 1 dollar deposit charged 100 dollars and given a side view next to a construction zone would never had booked at all if i knew that prior something that was forgot to be told but the young lady at front desk was awesome very nice and helpful apologetic for my circumstances sent us a gift bag to the room very generous of her even offed me her parking spot if i couldn't find one. she deserves a raise
Too many issues getting payments correct

review_title: Extremely poor follow up from a recent‚Ä¶
review_text: Extremely poor follow up from a recent purchase of points.... not our first purchase.This last purchase was supposed to enroll us in a program called Stair Step, where points could be used (2 for 1) at $0.30 per point - between November 1 and December 31 of each year to offset cost of maintenance fees.The balance has been paid in full for several months but (Other than the Paid-in-Full document) we have not received any other documentation supporting the program as explained to us during the sales presentation.

review_title: I had a problem with the lock on the‚Ä¶
review_text: I had a problem with the lock on the door on the first day being locked out. However, the cleaner quickly got a handyman, although he couldn't get me in he arranged for me to wait at reception with a cup of tea whilst he sought help. A short time later he collected me and got me back in the room temporarily.  I went out a short time later and on my return collected new keys for a new door lock. All the staff were extremely supportive and professional. Not the best start but their help avoided any unpleasant memories, they even asked how I was the following day.

review_title: Love just about everything.  But the knives.....not good.
review_text: I love staying at Riviera Oaks with my family.  Always pleasant, always relaxing.  The condo is very clean and the staff is excellent.  I am rating a 4 though.  One of the reasons I continue to come back is the kitchen the condo provides as we cook many meals while there.  The knives provided are very limited and dangerously dull.  I was frustrated by the this while prepping meals.  Please take steps if possible to improve the cutlery.   (The Fitness Room is first rate and I would bump it up a half point if the option was there.)Thank you.
A fantastic holiday again. Welcome home is exactly what it is. Friendly staff and excellent service from reception to housekeeping. Bailey Bar and staff are both friendly and attentive. See you soon.

review_title: Didn't seem as pressured or lied to.
review_text: Didn't seem as pressured or lied to.Wished you had more activities at a do anytime method. I really wanted to do the tie-dye shirt as I have at most others but it was 1 day and at wrong time of day for our plans. Bummer. Also love bingo at multiple times maybe? I missed those too.
Very nice place to stay. Will definitely return
Stayed at the resort  with my family and had an excellent time. great service and price was good.

Received a call from Diamond Resorts for an upcoming stay. She would not upgrade my room as I asked and she raised her voice when we talked about events of a lifetime. (because I said no and she wanted me to pay to attend update}  POOR COMMUNICATION. Great start for my Florida vacation. I am thinking I should sell my timeshare.
Resort was very nice but some of the rooms needed to be updated.  Would definitely stay here again.

Diamond Resorts International allowed us to stay two weeks in our unit and brought over a big pot so we could make one our favorite recipes. They also brought over a few extra coffee-juice-wine and tall glasses for us when we asked. Thanks Diamond Resorts for a great stay as always.

The Diamond Resort professional who assisted me with my question on my maintenance fees was knowledgeable and resolved the immediate question.  I still need the documents to ensure the SurePay is set-up appropriately.

It's been a very pleasant stay at diamond resort in Las Vegas. Location was great, price was right. There was not a single thing in the suit that we were missing.I recomend this place and will visit again.

review_title: My wife and I celebrated our 12 year‚Ä¶
review_text: My wife and I celebrated our 12 year anniversary with a week stay at Diamond Resorts' Modern Honolulu in Honolulu, HI. The resort was beautiful with a view of the harbor and a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. The staff were courteous, friendly, and very professional at all times. While there, we upgraded to full owners in the Hawaii collection. Our stay was relaxing and full of fun times and great memories!

review_title: We Stayed at the Ridge on Sedona Golf‚Ä¶
review_text: We Stayed at the Ridge on Sedona Golf for a week. When we arrived, the toilet was plugged and the couch was torn. Maintenance told us that sometimes housekeeping flushes bars of soap .There was a rainstorm before we left and at 3am the ceiling began to collapse. This created a large mess and an unusable kitchen! We obviously had to move to another unit. No one asked if they could help us move in the RAIN. More surprisingly, we as Diamond Gold Members were NEVER contacted by the Resort Management to apologize or offer compensation. We are very disappointed in the Lack of Hospitality at the Ridge on Sedona Golf!
Great vacation. Staff excellent.
Kind and courteous staff. Attended to our needs in a timely fashion

So they think I am rude when I don't want  to listen to their lecture. But it is very annoying

review_title: Not an update just high pressure sales
review_text: We‚Äôre staying at the Cancun resort in Las Vegas and when we checked in they signed us up for the owners update. They said that the presentation would last an hour and the Apollo changed their practices of trying to sell you more points at the update, so we agreed to go to it. We went to the presentation and all the guy talked about was we need more points. So I told him what was told to me when I checked in and asked if you could stop talking about points cause I really was interested in hearing about the update but he said and I quote ‚Äúno‚Äù. So I got up and left and yelled at him. I would appreciate it if people just told me the truth so I don‚Äôt go wasting my time. Please put me on a ‚Äúdo not ask if I want to go to an update‚Äú list. Thanks.As an update Diamond Resorts wanted my owner information to verify my experience but at the same time, I got an email to review my presentation directly from Diamond Resorts so I figured that they already researched the information. Now they want to claim that this post is not legitimate because I didn't submit that information. They need to communicate better in the corporate office instead of wasting my time. Next will be a complaint to the BBB. Thanks.

review_text: Kaanapalli Beach Club is a comfortable Maui destination. The physical plant is old but it is being upgraded frequently. We enjoy the use of outdoor grills often during our annual visits. The bad and cafe serving has been there a long time and are pleasant and efficient.

review_title: What a disappointing experience we are‚Ä¶
review_text: What a disappointing experience we are having. We travel a lot and consequently never received our invoice for maintenance fees for 2019, despite having mail forwarding. We did not even realize this until early October when we were locked out of our online account.  We have made eight phone calls to a number we were told was our only option for reinstatement but they insist they pass the information along to Accounts Receivable and get no reply. Really poor customer service. Not to mention our points are lost for this year and next year's maintenance fees are now due.

review_title: Each time I‚Äôve called to make a‚Ä¶
review_text: Each time I‚Äôve called to make a reservation, there are barriers to booking the dates that I want.  Instead, I am subjected to offers of different dates and different locations as the ones I want are ‚Äúunavailable‚Äù!  Also have to wait long periods of time to see if the dates I want will be approved, and end up with denial and other dates.  It matters not how far in advance I try to book.  Last month ended up booking rooms outside of Diamond, as I was not willing to wait until March when dates were convenient for Diamond.

review_title: I booked a 3 bedroom Diamond Luxury‚Ä¶
review_text: I booked a 3 bedroom Diamond Luxury Home located in Bend, OR in June, 2019 to use the week of Thanksgiving with my nephew and his family.  The Monday before my arrival on Saturday, I called to confirm that the home was fully equipped for accessibility due to my husband‚Äôs disability.  I had been assured at the time of the reservation in June that it definitely was.  I learned just days before my intended arrival that the home indeed was NOT accessible, nor could it be converted for our needs.  As a Platinum member, I am very disappointed in Diamond Resort‚Äôs lack of sensitivity regarding special accommodations, especially since we have been members for 30 years.

This timeshare is just not worth the cost of the maintenance fees. The last resort I booked with them had black mold all over shower (since Diamond will make me prove that I'm an owner, they should know that I took photos as proof). Doesn't feel like much of a vacation when the first thing you have to do is buy bleach and a scrub brush to make sure your shower is clean. Some of the resorts require an outrageous number of points to book: for example, their NYC hotels cost about 4 times more in points than what it costs to book directly with the hotel (I have screenshots to prove it). Why, when I've already paid the money to buy the points, should it cost me more (in maintenance fees) to use my timeshare points than if I just book it directly with the hotel? If you're thinking of buying points with this company, do yourself a favor and read the negative reviews for some eye-opening discussion of their sales tactics, etc.

Diamond ResortsI and Bob Greeson have been Diamond owners for some time.  Ms Shore dates back to Sunterra ownership.Our experiences at Diamond-owned and affiliated resorts has been excellent. review_title: The Diamond properties are nice but the‚Ä¶
review_text: The Diamond properties are nice but the dues are expensive. For the price I paid for my points PLUS the yearly maintenance dues I have not been happy with 1) how hard it is to book a reservation (very limited availability even 6 months out) and 2) when I am told at booking that I will get a specific room type I expect promises to be followed through. Instead I arrive at the resort to have them tell me agents are not allowed to promise specific room types/locations. Very disappointing. 3) to sit in on a timeshare "update" only to be a sales meeting. 4) to go online and find the same exact room listed at the same resort through other travel websites CHEAP AND AVAILABLE when Diamond is telling me those dates have no availability. If there are paying members who wants those dates then give it to them. When I see that it makes me regret my membership and what I paid for this whole thing.

review_text: The unit we stayed in was very spacious but a little dated. The bathroom and closet area was enormous. We were in the unit right off the elevators do it was a little noisy. The resort was working on some renovations but the outdoor pool area definitely needed some immediate attention. The surface area around the pool was all cracked and crumbling. When you walked across it was all over your feet. Therefore ended up all over your poolside longe chair. Other than updating and renovations, the stay itsel was nice.

review_title: Was my favorite place but customer service was awful
review_text: We were in-town for football torment I had such a wonderful experience during a previous stay I returned and urged three others to book rooms at this location as well. I was scheduled to stay from sat 7-Friday 13th. We had a game that morning so I arranged for 12pm check out. On our way back from the field we ran into traffic from an accident at 1207pm I call front desk to let them know my my 23 year old daughter and 7 month old were still there with our luggage and I was getting off highway exit. I also informed them (a man stating he was manager) I wanted to see if I could stay another night even if we needed to change rooms. I pulled up to see 3 people caring my luggage down the stairs placing them down in the RAIN as well my daughter and my month old  son forced outside(of course he was screaming )The time was them 1215pm , I asked why they could have given me 5 minutes , the security approached causing a bigger scene stating we were needed to exit the  property immediately. I attempted to explain his must have been a misunderstanding he threatening to call POLICE. I have never been so humiliated in my life! My sons teammates and other patrons watched us be kicked off property like some kind of criminals. I dont understand why anyone would ever treat a customer like this for being 15mins late to check out especially considering we were trying to stay another night, inexcusable behavior by those staff members.

review_title: Next best thing to a Ponzi scheme
review_text: The initial investment in DRI (Silver member) seemed like a wonderful opportunity to enhance our travel experiences, and a number of them have been outstanding.  As a result, we ultimately increased our investment to the Platinum level.  However, we now see that we made a mistake in increasing our investment beyond Gold, and even that would have become onerous.  Every time we visit a Diamond owned property, we are inundated with sales pitches (often advertised as "owner updates") encouraging/hounding us to purchase even more points.  That coupled with the ever increasing, high cost annual maintenance fees (we pay over $11,000 annually for the privilege of being owners) has convinced me that DRI is running something like a Ponzi scheme, where each new investor/investment is used to sustain the lavish financial and other benefits afforded to its sales personnel (there sure are a lot of them) and its management.  We now realize that we could have afforded as many wonderful travel experiences paying out of pocket versus dumping our money into the DRI rabbit hole.  They say hindsight is 20/20, and we wish we had been more "eyes open" as we were led down the rosy path to continued investments in DRI.  And, our children will never see the benefit as none of them can afford to pay the annual maintenance fee to maintain ownership.  My personal calculation is that we have spent over $250,000 for something that we could have done for half the cost, and that cost continues to increase each year we stay with DRI.

The grounds are immaculate and beautiful.  The only complaint that I have is that the tv's (all flat panel) each the living room and each bedroom all have a different number assigned to the channels and it's not correctly listed on their info sheets.  In addition, it's 2019, only a handful are in high definition.  The staff have always been very nice and I will mention that we do not attend their "update" meetings.  We went one time and we're weeks owners and they want us to purchase our two units again to convert to points.

I have visited other high class all inclusive resorts, and that has now made my experience with Diamond in perspective even worse. I no longer complain. They did their best but the prioritization of their staff did not put their members or in my case potential member first.

I am a disgruntled owner. We spent a small fortune to accumulate 50,000 points per year several years ago, after going to a presentation that explained the travel benefits ‚Äî specifically being able to use points for airfare and hotels at 100% if booked by the deadline each year. A couple of years ago, we received notice that this was going to be phased out and the points could only be exchanged for 30% of the cost. Considering the need to book through Diamond travel and the plethora of red-eye and extremely early morning flights, we already were hard-pressed to find travel times that would work with family schedules two and three time zones away. There was no explanation for decreasing this benefit. I‚Äôd like to know why it was taken away.  We have fees that increase every year despite how well Diamond is doing, yet we are losing benefits. I also wish you would contract with Southwest for flights.  AND it would be nice if the special trips allowed us to use points without limiting the exchange to 30%.

review_title: Kid's waterpark meant nearly private adult pools!
review_text: In January I did a timeshare trade and visited Liki Tiki Village in the Orlando area.  The site boasted having an on-site waterpark, which was really more for the kids than adults, but that did mean the regular pools & hot-tubs were less crowded to almost deserted.  I was supposed to be trading into a cabin but was assigned to one of the suites in a building not too close to the pools, but with the warm weather, the walk was not too bad. I was alone, there to relax and I did lots of that.  Was advised by the resort of lots of non-typical Orlando things to do, including a visit to not-too-nearby Mount Dora, an adorable artsy downtown area.  Lovely trip, would visit again.

review_title: Stayed at the Alohilani Resort Waikiki‚Ä¶
review_text: Stayed at the Alohilani Resort Waikiki Beach in Honolulu in November 2019.  It was a great location overlooking the beach with wonderful sunsets.  The room was nice with a balcony.  The room was clean but could use new carpeting.  The bathroom was very small, about the size of the balcony that was adequate for a balcony but you could barely close he bathroom door while standing in front of the double sink.  Beds were comfortable.  Area was very convenient for restaurants and walking about. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful but the Diamond Concierge was not that helpful although very friendly.   Enjoyed the stay but did not like the members update meeting....too high pressured and too long.  Wasted half of my last day there.

review_title: Diamond Resorts the place to be in Vegas.
review_text: Diamond Resorts in Las Vegas is a fabulous destination.  Terrific amenities such as the roof top pool and the exercise room with a great selection of exercise equipment.  There is a spa for spa treatments.  Location of the resort is on Las Vegas Blvd. across the street from City Center. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the facility is very clean and beautiful.  Highly recommend this resort for your Las Vegas destination.

We have been members since 2/2011. The resorts themselves are good. Some of the sales staff in the last few years have been awful. Approximately 1 year ago our son went to Tahoe on his Sampler package and before he left someone in their office had merged his account with ours (he is also Richard, but not same middle name) without our permission or his, and we could not access our account. To this date our account number has not been changed back to the original, but we at least can now access the account. It took almost 2 months to get this straightened out because no one would talk to us. We were no longer listed as owners (we were Gold members) at the time. Last spring we went to Tahoe to a presentation and told the salesman we were not buying. He asked "don't you want to lower your maintenance fees'?. Well, of course if there's a way. He said you need to buy more points, then you can convert points for part of your annual fees. After spending an additional $18,000, we find out that benefit is only for Platinum members. So now we are out another $18,000 (we are seniors on a budget!) It seems the most honest sales staff per our experience were in Sedona & Scottsdale.  I was ready to get out of the entire program after this!!!

review_title: Your personal talk me in to sell my‚Ä¶

review_title: The service and resort availability has‚Ä¶unreasonable change
review_text: The service and resort availability has got poorer since opening up booking availability to booking.com and others while members are still paying colossal fees for management and maintenance of Diamond premises and can‚Äôt get access to book for holidays, even at long notice 14 month window for platinum members or even short /medium notice periods, availability is not there, making Diamond expensive holidaying..

review_title: I agreed to purchase a $2,500 sampler‚Ä¶
review_text: I agreed to purchase a $2,500 sampler package at a DRI (Diamond Resorts International) temporary location on November 5, 2019 but then sent DRI a certified cancellation letter three days later (in compliance with FTC's Cooling Off Rule). Two weeks ago, I received a reply from DRI that they denied my cancellation directive. They are claiming that the FTC law doesn't apply since I signed a no-cancel clause (although my lawyer tells me that federal laws CAN'T be put aside by the actions either the buying or selling party). FYI, I signed the "agreement" electronically and never had a chance to read it by myself before my credit card was finished processing and I was being pushed out the door. It was only after I got back to my hotel that I had time to read my printed copy realized how many of the verbal clarifications and summaries I had been given were simply not true.
If you haven‚Äôt signed a contract yet, you need to RUN. Even their Sampler package is a BAD. RUN from Diamond Resorts!!
Poor run no one cares after buying 70000 into diamond

review_title: We stayed at the Modern Hotel in‚Ä¶
review_text: We stayed at the Modern Hotel in Waikiki only to be met with a demand to attend a presentation which went for hours, was supposed to be 30 minutes, even though we kept saying we did not want to purchase as we have enough Timeshare with a much more reputable company RCI, who have never treated us like Diamond have. We got passed on to another presenter when we thought we had escaped only to be begged to purchase a sampler which we were told we could use all over the world, for flights and for cruises.  On arriving home (after an accident on the way) we discovered when we read the fine print that we had to return to America to attend another presentation before we could use it.  We live in Australia and my husband is not now able to make the long flight again and is awaiting surgery.  We made phone calls and wrote letters explaining this and because we were outside the cooling off period they kept refusing to listen to our problems, because we wanted to cancel this, it is no use to us.  First approach was okay, but since it has become very demanding and rude and they don't talk to each others departments, just keep pushing the problem on to another representative.  I am so tired of explaining the situation over and over and over - they are so rude.

review_title: Why DRII faces ongoing distain from long term, high value owners.
review_text: Sadly, the changes that are made to points usage, the availability of units at prime locations, the demands to attend sales meetings and the misinformation provided at those meetings is both offensive and inaccurate. We have watched the deterioration of DRII over the years, the ever increasing assessments and legal attempts to limit options to reduce points owned to protect the cash flow that funds the administration costs. We, like so many other Platinum owners, are searching for anyone at DRII that just might care about us. In our case, we are in our mid seventies, poor health, and there are no options for us to easily reduce our points/costs without sever penalties and the requirement to navigate an arduous/ costly process.

Where is the "ZERO" star? We drove 8 hours to Sedona only to get a crappy little studio looking up at the bottom of car and no view at all, and it is actually 20 minutes from Sedona. Diamond Resorts promised us a "Free Caribbean Cruise" as part of their "gift" for attending a timeshare pitch but after we got home we had to go to a different comapny's website to book our cruise and could not do it online. It also only gave us the option of one port of call without an upgrade for more days. We decided to take the cheaper cruise from Long beach to save travel time and costs. THEN we called to book it and were informed of a "$99 Redemption Fee" and "$24.99 Processing Fee" per person bringing a $234 cruise down to $110 + taxes + port fees equaling $215.50 We could not even upgrade to a balcony room even if we wanted to pay more.  They wanted $474 for the "Free Cruise" that would only cost us $679 to book it ourselves. Why couldn't they have just said 30% off?

review_text: The changes to the number of Resorts and their relationships to each other have not been helpful to the average user.  The support on a level of 'one stop shop' are poor to very poor.  The individual resort do vary in quality but by and large are good with some being excellent.  The sales staff have soured many owners.

review_title: A representative was supposed to call‚Ä¶
review_text: A representative was supposed to call me over 2 weeks ago and I still haven't heard from them

review_title: This is the worst travel company I have‚Ä¶
review_text: This is the worst travel company I have ever experienced.  We have had time share since 1996 and we have NEVER been treated like this or sold a bill of goods like this.  I was sold a package to stay in a condo.  I have a witness as to what was said. Expecting a condo we found we were placed in a very stinky very dirty hotel in Sedona.  We moved rooms but it wasn't any better.  We spent the night.  We were supposed to spend four.  When we went to the presentation we were told after we complained that they would see if there was space at the condo. Never heard another thing about that until we were told we could stay there if we purchased.  What a crock of bullwe were fed. I am making a complaint to the BBB and the state attorney general.  Your bit and switch con game has to be stopped.  Please don't ever call us again.  You won't like the response.

review_title: I checked out of Cabo Azul on November‚Ä¶
review_text: I checked out of Cabo Azul on November 17th, in which the front desk failed to return my credit credit card after payment was made. Once I reached the airport, I realized that the card was not in my possession and called the front desk immediately. The woman who had handled my transaction apologized and promised that she would return my card to our friends who were checking out at a later time. About a 1/2 hour prior to my friends receiving the card, I received an unauthorized charge for $1,070.00 from MyTheresa.com. The ONLY time I used this credit card was at check-in at Cabo Azul. All resort expenses were charged to our room. All expenses outside of this were charged to a friend's credit card. Therefore, my card was not used at any other location in Mexico! Despite how cleanly the resort was or how great the service was up to this point, this is unforgiving. The only positive that came from this was my relief that I had not signed up for a timeshare with Diamond Resorts (which is what intrigued us to vacation to Cabo Azul in the first place). I would never want to be locked into an agreement with a company whose integrity I do not trust.

Tricky - speak out of both sides of their mouths. I have nothing but bad experiences with their sales people.Tell you how wonderful everything about diamond is and then when you attend a "so-called update the good comes with all kinds of commitments, always involving buying more points.Their sales tactics are questionable at best.
Diamond Resorts is a progressive timeshare company.  We are always interested and impressed with their updates of their program and acquiring new resorts.

review_title: Limited locations in the Mid-West and Northern States
review_text: Limited locations in the USA for travel. Very few locations in the Northern States and Mid-West.  The condos' are very nice, but summer vacationing is difficult with their selections

review_title: Constant lies overshadow what could be decent vacations
review_text: While the resorts I've visited have been nice, not as amazing as they're made out to be, my vacations have been sourly overshadowed by the constant lies from Diamond Resorts about the "benefits" of my membership and stress caused by booking issues and arranging meetings with Diamond personnel during the trip.  Each trip I've been invited to a presentation/membership update and each time I've been told about features/benefits that conflict with the last meeting I had and they tell me the last person must have been "mistaken."  Once I was even told about features that the next rep advised me hadn't existed for over 6 months!  In addition to being constantly lied to, they also lie about the time commitment for these presentations/updates, eating into my valuable and limited vacation time.  Also, the "benefit" of being able to book hotels, airfare, and cars with points is a scam-- for example, I would have had to spend a couple hundred points plus $900 to book a flight through Diamond that I could book anywhere else online for just $600.  The hotels and car rentals are similarly overpriced.  Finally, I was told I couldn't book these resorts without being a member or there on a presentation- lies, not only can I book them, the cost to book them is less than I pay for my points.  AND they don't have properties most places I want to go, yet another lie.

I have tried to settle an issue with your resort for more than three months. I have made more than 10 phonecalls and it still has not been resolved. I am scheduled I have a four day resort stay scheduled in June or 2020 and I'm sure somebody will try to sell me a timeshare which I could never consider taking the fact that I can't get a simple issue resolved.

review_title: So many lies, so many misrepresentations, so many refusals to reply
review_text: This has been the most frustrating experience of my life.  We owned time shares from Hilton (with whom we have never had a problem) and from Goldkey Resorts (with whom we were happy until it was purchased by Diamond Resorts).  Since then we have been consistently told things that turned out not to be true in order, either to sell us more points under false pretense, or to get us to go away with a false promise that they would get back to us within days to resolve our issues.  We are left with no satisfaction, no resolution, no promise of any way to get resolution and no feeling that anyone cares or can be trusted to actually do what they promise.  Stay away from these people.  There is apparently a culture of doing anything to make the sale and saying anything to get the customer to go away (stalling) and finally doing nothing to ever help resolve any issues for supposedly valuable (Platinum Level) customers.

As an Embarc member I have felt the amalgamation has gone fairly smoothly. I still prefer phone calls to online registration and am glad that is still an option. I do believe more Whistler spaces should be reserved for members and not released to the public (even if legally done via weighted point owners).

review_text: We are members at Embarc Blue Mountain for about 10 years.  We love it, our kids - now teenagers, still love it and we try to get the most use out of it, even if it's just for a day trip.
