While the hotels were ok, they were not the resort vacation we expected. The amount of money spent trying to make the experience closer to expectations was far more than we were prepared for. Further, the full amount of money we paid up front to insure we would not skip the presentations, was not fully refunded. I‚Äôve been waiting over 40 years for this trip, and while Hawaii was beautiful, the trip was less than anticipated.
As a new owner, I was able to get answers to questions that I had. They were vey helpful with everything I needed.
Great service. Spacious suite and very convenient location.

Overall we enjoy Diamond Resorts membership.  Having a very large selection of places to stay without having to do an "exchange" is particularly beneficial to us, and was a key reason for acquiring more points.  Most of the places are quite wonderful and staff excellent t.  A few, mostly "partners" don't really provide much of a special experience typical for Diamond Resorts, but still are nice places to stay.  The single most unsatisfactory aspect, however, is the pressure sales to buy more points.  So often we have been asked to attend an "owner update" with promises there will be no sales pitch, only to end up in a very high pressure sales meeting.  We have had sales staff actually get mad at us for wasting their time, when we were clear from the beginning we did not want a sales presentation and would not buy more points.  Anymore we simply turn down all "update" offers, which is unfortunate as we would like to be able to simply get updates about new resorts, how best to use points, special offers etc.  It has also caused us to be cautious when referring people to time share ownership.  Other than that aspect, we enjoy being owners and it does cause us to get out and "vacation" more often.

review_title: Although the original sales pitch was‚Ä¶
review_text: Although the original sales pitch was fairly clear and we have felt we made a good decision to purchase the sampler package, since then we have been very frustrated with the pressure we have experienced at each meeting when we use the points. We understand that it is their job to try to sell us more vacation packages. We believe it is our right to say no and when they do not take that for our answer, our respect for Diamond Resorts drops. It has happened twice. Although we have a lot of points left, we are dreading the next meeting.

review_title: Our buying experience has been greatly‚Ä¶
review_text: Our buying experience has been greatly affected by the way a recent purchase was handled in Las Vegas. AlthoughI have promised Diamond in their agreement to refund my purchase, not to discuss the matter openly with others, I am very wary now of future sales tactics. In my most recent review in Williamsburg I was offered a means of selling my points to other owners through the new Hilton/ Diamond agreement. I declined the offer simply because it would have meant buying more points to get into the "program". Based on my long history with Diamond, I have come to understand they really are not customer oriented, but sales driven.

Since Diamond purchased our timeshare company, things have been going downhill.   We used to be a boutique timeshare with great resorts but Diamond is now treating our resorts just like all of their resorts.   Ours used to be exclusive to members only but Diamond now offers stays at our resorts through Expedia and other web sites.

review_title: I love the area in the room that we‚Ä¶

review_title: Need a lawyer to get out!
review_text: At first I absolutely loved Diamond Resorts. I thought it was the perfect fit for me. Now, I‚Äôve hired a lawyer to get me OUT!!  Things kept changing without any notification. The perfect example is using points for airfare. I was able to use my points during the year to purchase a flight. Before finally deciding to leave Diamond, it had changed.  The deadline was now APRIL!!!  I was lied to so many times, the last two times by someone I had come to trust over the last 3 - 4 years. A lie costing me over $100,000. It came down to my house or Diamond. I choose my House!!!
these resorts have never disapointed us, the clean units, the friendleness of all the staff, always helpful. nice kept up grounds and pools.  perfect for us.... the freemans  arkansas

As always, the grounds were beautiful (it still takes my breath away on the drive in to see the Manor House at the end).  I was SO happy to see that our units had been completely refurbished!!  We have owned our week at Powhatan for 35 years.  And I love the new furnishings.  The best part was that you put shower/tubs in the "master" bedrooms (I have commented about that on almost every survey).  Thank you for making things (finally) updated.  I LOVE it at Powhatan!!  And the people who work there are very personable and friendly.  Sadly, I missed the Ghost Tour (I usually go every year) with David Flowers this year because I fell (I hurt too much) and couldn't make it.  I will be sure to go next year!!

review_title: I stayed at Virginia Beach diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: I stayed at Virginia Beach diamond resort on my last vacation it was the night before thanksgiving when I checked in to my 12 floor ocean front room - room was beautiful and clean and I couldn‚Äôt believe I had a private balcony and hot tub UNDER $100 ?? What? Crazy but true! Also staff at check in was great lines and wait were extremely long but I do remember that it was holiday there also was a bleeding from nose kid of a guest one staff member was attending which left one person at desk but it was great all around and things happen so gotta be patient - all in all 5 stars

Diamond Resorts has a tendency to over sell and over promise when trying to sell timeshares. Just like other frustrated time share owners, the preferred destinations seem not to be available unless you are willing to shell out about $1K for an exchange, etc., from what I was quoted. Then the dates, suites magically are available even though in some instances this is your annual week that you regularly own and claim. There is  a lot of begging involve just to claim this week! The properties are nice and convenient, but it is the business practice that is unfortunate and unethical, defeating the idea what a timeshare is suppose to be. Totally turned off with timeshare and there is no pleasant way of getting rid of it.

review_title: Diamond is Tops in Our Book! Go Diamond
review_text: There is a distinct difference between Diamond properties and others. We have been properly pampered and spoiled and only wish there were more to choose from!

Just average, sometimes you feel you get value for your money.  More often than not you don't get that feeling of a deal for your money.  There is also a scarcity of availability, even 11 months out all the good resorts are booked.

in Maui: Our check in at the VIP desk was less than desirable.  Two people there one was talking to two people and the other was on the computer.  After 4-5 minutes the male looked  up and said rather coldly, Are you here to check-in? The female quickly left her computer and assisted us.At Point at Poipu:  We were informed at the checkin that the building we were assigned to had an inoperative elevator.  Our reservations were made in Feb for an Oct 3 day stay.  I was traveling with my 84 year old mother and explained that she could not climb to the fourth floor.  No apology just a statement that we could stay in another building one nite and then move out by 10:00 and await the 3:00 checkin for our second and third nite.  Finally got the manager who arranged that they would move us so that we could enjoy the island.  The elevator was out of commission for an entire month.  Poor way to run a resort.....

review_title: We would give it a 3 1/2 stars
review_text: We would give it a 3 1/2 stars.  All of the accommodations are excellent and that would be 5 stars, and the locations that we have been are top notch, but there are other issues that  affect our rating.  There is so very much to know about successfully making reservations, and often we are not able to get what we want when we want it. Making phone calls leads too much frustration as we don't always know which department to contact and we are transferred from one place to another.  The issue that has been the most frustrating is the constant sales presentations. There has only been one stay, when we have not had to go to an "update/sales presentation".  We have decided for various reasons that we do not want any more points.  What we have works for us, however we continue to get the sales talk.  What is very helpful (if we could just get it) would be the updates and instructions on how to effectively use the points we have.

review_title: We've been going to Diamond Resorts for‚Ä¶
review_text: We've been going to Diamond Resorts for years and keep going back because of the locations, the service, the quality and the fun. Thanks :)

review_text: Long intro where they promise all these awesome things but really they just want more $ with little effort.

We enjoyed our stay in Vancouver. However we had to attend a sales seminar which often are very pushy and filled with questionable information. I appreciate that the salespeople are paid to sell but I don‚Äôt think they need to supply incorrect information to achieve their goal.
Nice experience with friendly and helpful staff.  Nice renovations to Polo, and the place was very clean.

review_title: I believe most of the presentation‚Ä¶
review_text: I believe most of the presentation answered our inquisitive minds. I believe many questions were skirted and not answered. Financials: average. Board Meetings: never answered. Sales Presentations: addressed but not really answered.

review_text: I much preferred the old Intrawest days when  I could call Vancouver and people knew where Mont Tremblant was and where Ottawa was .Now I have to spell out these destinations like I was travelling to Abu Dhabi . review_title: Diamond Resorts is like going to a car dealoship
review_text: Diamond Resorts is like going on a vacation with a used cars salesman.  Every time we visit a Diamond Resort they bring on these sales people that often are not truthful and refuse to put things in writing.  The resorts themselves are okay but not up to our expected standards

I am extremely Happy, over joyed that we did not buy points from Diamond Resort. A year ago we purchased a Sampler from Diamond Resort Hawaii at the Point at Poipu in Kauai. It cost us over $4000. The sales person told us that we could use almost two weeks at the Point at Poipu. When we called the Las Vegas Sampler person they said that we could not use the sampler at the point of Poipu. That sales person lied to us! We did use the points. We used them to go to the Kauai Shores Hotel on Kauai from Oct 13th 2019 through October 18th and the Royal Lahaina Resort on Maui from October 18th 2019 through the 24th. At each stay we were required to attend an Presentation. Our first presentation was at the Point of Poipu at October 15th 8:30 am. We told the sales person that we were not interested in buying points and that we have had many other presentations. This sales person was very  pleasant and taked to us about 45 minutes and let us go. Our second presentation was at the Kaanapali Beach Club in Maui. Our presentation was scheduled for October 20th at 8:00am. When we arrived we were told that the presentation would not start until 8:30am. We waited around and then a sales person came by and started with the sales talk. We had to watch a movie about Hawaii Diamond Resorts which lasted over ¬Ω hour and also a sales person talked to a group of us in the theater room. Then the sales person took us around the resort and showed us a room. We were not impressed at all. The room had soiled carpet and was not appealing at all.  Then the sales talk continued . When we declined the purchase of points the big guns came out. Two or three managers began pushing the points The problem is that it would not only cost us $5000 but it would be $800+ more maintenance fees for life; and the maintenance fees would go up every year. The whole presentation lasted over 3 hours with a lot of lying high pressure sales!When we left the presentation we have decided that it would be the last Diamond Resort Time Share Presentation we would attend. We already own at Polo Towers and that costs us a yearly maintenance fee of $1,200. and continues to go up. I would never have purchased Polo Towers if I had known that we would have a life time of Maintenance Fees that went from$700. To $1,287.14.Thank You Diamond Resorts we will never buy into your point system.

review_title: Diamond Resorts is all about extortion‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond Resorts is all about extortion and deception.  I don't care for verbal assurances that are unclear or unfounded.  (Example: When we were roped into purchasing additional points in June, the sales and closing individuals promised our new points would be transferred to year 2020.  That did not happen!)  I believe that requiring a 15-year owner to purchase more points in order to update his contract is greedy.  Increasing maintenance fees is robbery:  We've already purchased timeshare at big bucks, and now we have to pay exorbitant prices annually to utilize our ownership.  It's more appealing to vacation elsewhere with fewer restrictions than to use Diamond Resorts.  I have no reason to recommend Diamond Resorts to anyone.
Too high HOA fees. Resorts are not always secure or clean.

Your organization is terrible. I HATE the day we every converted from a traditional plan to points with your organization. You sold us a program that offered no extended benefits to what we had. When we met with your organization at a later date you agreed and only attempted to up-sale us instead of resolving the problem. We are seeking legal help at this time. Your actions are criminal.

What do you suggest??

review_title: My recent stay at the Hotel Blue at‚Ä¶
review_text: My recent stay at the Hotel Blue at Myrtle Beach was very disappointing. First impression of the resort began with the check-in. The staff was friendly but the physical lobby and front desk area was very unkept and cluttered. I thought I was in the wrong place at first. My first impression unfortunately held true throughout my entire stay.  The kitchen was extremely small, the balcony area was very dirty. One of my request was for a roll of paper towels. I was told that they have none.  One morning after 8 am I called the desk for a couple of bath towels since the housekeeping staff didn't leave enough the day before. I was told that HK staff didn't arrive until 9am so I would have to go down and pick up my own towels.  The pool and hot tub area was not very well cleaned and maintained. The hot tub was very worn out and looked dirty.  Very uninviting!!! I was there with 2 good friends for a much needed girls trip and have never been more embarrassed with this resort. I will NEVER travel to this resort again. I am very surprised that Diamond has any affiliation with this place.

Disappointed. We tried to book a cruise using embark through Diamond as our agent.  The process was extremely tedious and totally unsuccessful. There was absolutely no advantage as the cost of the cruise including being able to use our points was calculated as  more expensive than the advertised price of the cruise. It took two days to get their answer. I would not recommend this process to anyone. While the personnel were pleasant enough the original agent had little knowledge of the process at Diamond for luxury cruises. He simply fumbled along before we finally got to a more senior agent who at least understood more of what we were asking. He did not know the whole process either and had to wait to determine any benefit for us using Diamond. Overall an extremely frustrating experience. We have invested a great deal of money to purchase points and subsequently pay a lot of money annually to maintain these points. At this juncture I doubt we will ever get close to redoing the ‚Äúalleged‚Äù benefits of membership. There is often something that interferes with getting a booking when and where we want especially in Europe. We have spent many hours in review sessions and have been excited about the development of program options only to find out it never works this way. Perhaps it‚Äôs time for another review? Perhaps another opportunity to be set up for more disappointment!

We‚Äôve been members for 20 years and for us it‚Äôs timeshare that has worked. We have had so many great holidays over the years and hopefully more to come. The standard of the apartments are greatly improved from our early experiences and the staff Are fantastic. We liked this points based timeshare system because it gave us so much choice and flexibility and it meant we could book last minute holidays which worked well with our work schedule. Having said this I wouldn‚Äôt recommend anybody joining now, I don‚Äôt see the point of spending thousands of pounds buying points plus maintenance charges every year when the general public have just as much access if not more to Diamond resorts availability. It‚Äôs very sad that members have become second choice to the hard cash of the general public, a sign of the times I suppose and inevitably if the company is to survive. I still pay the maintenance fees and I still hope for better times but one thing is for sure the holidays are always good.

review_title: Our opinion doesn't matter as evidenced‚Ä¶
review_text: Our opinion doesn't matter as evidenced by the number of complaints and problems that are described throughout social media of people who are literally trying to kill themselves due to the draconian stranglehold of DRI's perpetuity clause. Our family is caught in the tangled and blatant web of greed which forms the underpinning of DRI's raison √™tre. We have listed our "points" for sale and have over 1,500 people ahead of us who are wanting to sell their points back to DRI. Diamond Resorts aren't available to us during the times we would like to vacation and only one location is within driving distance of our residence - and it is an 8 hour drive from our home. We cannot afford to fly to any of the far-flung destinations, nor do we have any desire to do so.  The maintenance fee is putting an awful financial burden on us. We are senior citizens and the only source of income we have is our dwindling pensions, which are eroded by inflation. But as mentioned at the outset of this response, our opinion really doesn't matter to the people who manage DRI. They just want the money IN PERPETUITY and don't care about their clientele at all.

review_title: It's not an update, it's a sales pitch

There was 20 minutes of small talk which is about 5-10 too many.There was a lengthy update on purchasing additional points which was informative until she got to the part where we learn the cost.  Delay due to need to talk to manager.At this point, I declared that we had a dinner reservation and we would need wrap it up within 15 minutes. review_title: Good properties, terrible corporate business practices
review_text: We are timeshare owners and use our DRI weeks/points for one or two stays per year.  We have been happy with the properties.  However, DRI is incredibly slow in dealing with owner accounts and concerns.  If you need to call them with some timeshare business, you will get bumped around to various departments, each claiming its not their job to help you.  When you have paperwork that needs to be signed, know that it will take weeks, if not months, and that you'll receive an unsigned form letter, or, in one case for us, no letter at all unless you call and request it.  This (no signatures, form letters, months to process, call to get a receipt) does not seem like a well-run, efficient business to us.  We have returned one of our weeks (at a cost of $250 to us) and won't be buying any more DRI timeshares.

Resorts are good. It's the sales person you have to worry about.  They are not honest. ESPECIALLY AT MYSTIC DUNES. BEWARE!!!!!

When I booked a two-week stay at Santa Barbara resort Tenerife for the second of September 2019 in a two-bedroom elite apartment. Two weeks prior to arrival date I was informed after the fourth night they would be moving me to the adjacent apartment. All this after booking twelve months in advance. The moral of this, as a gold member.you can be bumped off should a higher-grade member make a request for your already allocated apartment.
Great location, not luxury, but clean room and great service.  Staff very friendly.

review_title: Avoid The Suites at Fall Creek in Branson
review_text: Stayed at The Suites at Fall Creek in Branson. I would equate the room quality to a super 8. Small, dingy, some things broken, and overall terrible. I‚Äôm sure they have nicer rooms, but the one we had was terrible. The grounds were fairly rundown. They had a sign up that they are replacing their mini golf course next year, so totally get that, but there was bird poop everywhere- and for days at least. I get that they may need to make repairs, but seems like they also gave up on basic ‚Äúcare and feeding‚Äù too. Staff was nice, but that is about the only positive thing I can come up with.

Good experience once arrive at the resorts.  However, booking timeshare is very stressful experience and not easy to plan.  For example, my upcoming fight to ZIH changed twice, and I have to adjust my room booking accordingly. With timeshare, I have book way ahead, otherwise rooms are filled up as soon as the booking is open. It is much easier to book packaged tour, or just go to room booking site, like Hotels.com.
Staff very friendly and usually willing to help assist guests
Please don't waste your money. Any resort that is actually available (the good ones never are) can be rented as cheap with out the long term commitment. The whole point saver thing is a joke.

review_title: Diamond resorts is a 2 sided coin
review_text: Diamond resorts is a 2 sided coin, their resorts for the most part are very nice and always "Diamond" clean. The desk, concierge and cleaning people are always friendly and helpful. We plan fairly far in advance and usually can get into where we want to go. I feel that we have received what we payed for and may someday buy further into Diamond. The other side is the sales portion of Diamond. Lets just say it is high pressure and not an enjoyable experience. Take your time when considering any offers presented.

review_title: Ongoing experience of being given false‚Ä¶
review_text: Ongoing experience of being given false information.  Like the resorts overall.  Just the information has been very different from application of use of points. Between using points for airline tickets ($3200 for ticket to Hawaii from Washington D.C.) to being able to use points for other hotels such as Hyatt and Marriott with Sampler points- never was allowed, it has been quite surprising.  Have learned to get what they say in writing before leaving sales presentation.

review_title: Pool was closed for the three weeks we‚Ä¶
review_text: Pool was closed for the three weeks we were there.   Construction was going on in the room above all the time sometimes as early as 7:30 am.   Wi-Fi was down more than up.

review_title: We enjoyed every minute of our stay in Diamond Resorts
review_text: Great service, beautiful place, nice apartements and the beach very near.

review_title: I don‚Äôt received the TEKit No.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Why are there so few places available‚Ä¶needs to try harder
review_text: Why are there so few places available for members, but loads of places available for Joe Public who pay?

I. Love suites at fall creek in Branson   But Bent in Gatlinburg is my second choice. Branson offers more things to do and close to restaurants and shows.  Bent has beautiful suites with fireplaces screened in porches overlooking a golf course.

I wish I could give no stars but I guess one star will do. This review is not for the actual resorts but for the process for the timeshares for this company. So my friend and I were staying at a different location and we were offered two food vouchers and a gift card if we went on a tour of a resort. Ok we thought, that's doable. So we planned the next day with getting up early, taking the shuttle, we agreed to 2 hours at this presentation then after we were going to Magic Kingdom. Mind you, this was my first time in Florida and my mind set was spending time in Disney.The next day, we get up, take the shuttle and get to this resort. We waited 15 minutes for a representative. I will not mention any names of people or resorts. So we all started talking and all that, then we took a tour, ok yeah great. It was a nice resort, the person we dealt with was really nice, but...everyone was a little pushy. I hate to say it but life isn't about taking vacations every weekend. I only vacation once in a while because I don't need to vacation all the time. People have responsibilities and bills. I like to vacation to but does that mean I want a timeshare? No. So we kept getting passed around to other people. Mind you, my friend got really uncomfortable over some of the things the representative had said to us. Not cool. We don't need to be talking about sex on a tour. Thanks, but no thanks. Not professional by any means. This tour was said to be two hours max,  we got there at 8am, we left at 12. We lost out on 2 hours at Magic Kingdom.  Then when we were all said and done, after declining all these offers, that were never ending, we were told the shuttles were done for the day. A father with his family made the desk call for a shuttle. I was not paying for an Uber and they made it clear they weren't paying either. So we got our gift card and waited 20 minutes for a shuttle. We could not wait to get the hell off of that property. That whole experience made us feel like crap..yes crap! Never again will we do that.  Not worth the free gifts at all! We made sure to get rid of the free gifts as quickly as possible. I do not recommend these presentations. Yeah it started out ok..but then it turned bad quickly. If someone turns down an offer and they keep telling you no, then the answer will always be no. Good thing Disney is the happiest place on earth, as soon as I left that diamond resort..I felt so much better.

Forever DRI only wanted to sell, sell and sell the owners more product.  The sales department makes Fairfield look like girl scouts. They are ignorant, condescending, lying, abusive, and childish.  Now with the latest changes in company ownership they have blocked reservation opportunity, restricted resorts availability, and increased point requirements.  DRI is no longer a reputable product.  We love timeshares, but DRI and the conglomerate owner family has taken advantage of the good will of the timeshare owners.  I was afraid something like this would happen when the original builder of the company eventually left.  And it has.

review_title: We had a wonderful in Orlando.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

We are disappointed with the Embarc at Palm Desert.  We have stayed at the Club MARRIOTTs‚Äô here in Palm Desert, the Westin and many Hilton Resorts, and this one was lacking many of the amenities of the others.  The units did not have makeup mirrors in the bathrooms or coffee facilities and fridge in the lock-off apts.  There are no washer-dryers and the kitchen had no cabinets so all food had to be stored out in the open.  There were no tables to eat or play cards.  This will be our first and last visit to Embarc.  Further, you couldn‚Äôt open any windows and the units were dark.  The one redeeming feature were the employees, who were extremely helpful and friendly.

review_title: Love the resorts; 3 things I don't like though.
review_text: We love Diamond Resorts.  Every location we've been at has been great.  The resorts are great.  The first thing that I don't like is that the annual fees have gone up and up.  Secondly, there are many many all inclusive resorts and the amount continues to increase.  I bought Diamond Resorts and timeshare in general so we could have a kitchen and cook for ourselves, just 'live' somewhere while we vacation.  That makes taking trips more economical.  All-Inclusive resorts are very expensive; honestly who can eat and drink $100 of  stuff on a daily basis for a week.  For a couple that is $1400 of expense.  Third issue is that sometimes it is really hard to get into a resort.  If you can't get your destination then it makes it difficult to use our time.

review_title: I have been visiting Royal Sunset Beach‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been visiting Royal Sunset Beach for many years and have enjoyed my stays there, however the decision to pass the running of the  resturant  and entertainment to an outside contractor has undermined the family atmosphere that was always there,
Great resorts, yet MFs can be pricey.

review_title: Having second thoughts about our upgrade to Diamond
review_text: After spending a considerable amount of money to upgrade from our prior association, as we're retired, the first time I try to use Diamond Resorts, I am disappointed.  The friends we were visiting in Tuscon said the area where the resort is, is very questionable.  Instead we will be staying with them.  I think we have made a mistake in upgrading.
I love the resorts. But I hate the over the top hard sell Tactics, and the Gimmicks. That apply when I try to use my points at other Facilities in your system.

Each of the recent vacations we have taken through Diamond has been a complicated affair with below-standard accommodations.  We are very displeased with our ownership and are actively looking to sell it.

We are currently staying in a Diamond Resort in Fairway Forest Resort. The kitchen isupplies are not up to our standards by any means. The pots supplied are a 6 quart and 4 quart pot.  No serving spoons, serving platter, serving bowls or any storage bowls. When I requested these items I was told 2 pots were standard. As far as the serving platter and bowls the young lady relayed that it was possible I would not get anything except maybe a smaller pot if housekeeping could locate one.This unit is so disappointing I guess supplying your owners or renters with even basic amenities is not important.  We are Wyndham owners and they really outshine your units by far. We have never requested anything that wasn't delivered to us  right away. I requested the above items around 1:30pm and it is now 5:30 pm and no response from housekeeping.Oh as a second note when we arrived on Friday we had to move the dirty laundry bags from the walkway so we could enter our unit.Very professional staff you have working here a Fairway.

review_title: i use to love you  but I have been‚Ä¶with out being able to get to my account for a week     still waiting for supervisor
review_text: i use to love you  but I have been without my account for a week  I can not get  in   iam still waiting for a supervisor
Simply fabulous! The resort is beautiful but the staff is fabulous. From the moment we stepped into the resort we felt welcomed and treated like VIPs.

We have been members for 21 years, we love it, the accommodations are all very spacious and high quality.  We have been to over 20 places in the USA and another 15 in Europe along with 9 in the UK including a narrow boat in Shropshire.  The verity and locations make it a very useful vacation system. It is not timeshare, but time points so you are not tied to any location or specific weeks,  It works well for us.  In the UK we can find a place say for next weekend, or can book up to a year in advance.

Worst experience ever! After this we will be selling our timeshares and finding a company that cares about their guest safety and well being.Tonight my wife is alone there with our 2 children (5, and 3). My wife and I both have high anxiety and ptsd from multiple deployments in red areas. While she was sleeping she heard the door making noise. She thinks oh someone‚Äôs kids probably just messing around, but then she hears the door open. Mind you my children are sleeping right there. Luckily my wife quickly rushed to the door (and luckily for them she decided not to be armed while on vacation). A family comes walking right in. She immediately confronts them and stops them there to ensure our children's safety. Called down to the front, the lady at the front counter said ‚Äúno need to worry it‚Äôs just a mild inconvenience‚Äù. Is she serious? So if I were to walk into her house in the middle of the night she‚Äôd fell that as a mild inconvenience? My wife requested new card keys. She tried staying optimistic as the front counter lady tried reassuring her it would never occur again and that they are extremely sorry. Ok so now my wife is on end and can‚Äôt even sit down trying to stay on the phone with me in shock of what just happened. Debating on saying screw this whole vacation as she now feels as we are in an unsafe location and fear for our children. I was able to calm her down and try and get through the night until I arrive tomorrow and we will decide what we want to do.30 minutes go by and noise at the door again. Another family walks in! This time my wife spoke to a manager Shawn. Same bs, he said it wont happen again, yet hmm history seems to repeat itself here. He offered a 4 night stay but we will not be accepting at all for we are selling this timeshare and informing every media outlet, and review page. He then said since we wont stay he can offer a $50 credit to shipwreck sally. My wife said whatever to get off the phone before she flipped out on him. We will not be accepting a bs $50 credit. He had the audacity to price the safety of my wife and children with a $50 bs credit? Is he serious? A 4 night stay then a $50 credit, that‚Äôs all my family is worth to this POS? What if it were his family? My wife asked for an internal lock however he said we couldn‚Äôt have one. She doesn‚Äôt feel safe and will now be staying up the entire night setting guard at the door. Our vacation is now doomed in fear of individuals in our timeshare. What if we went to the pool and had our valuables there? What if my wife was in the nude? What if she was sleeping with her meds, and someone hurt or took our children? What if someone hurt my wife? No one seems to care because it didn‚Äôt happen to them. What if I broke into Shawns house twice tonight? Would $50 suffice? His family (which I doubt he has since he could care less about family) would be traumatized. So we finally get a vacation and we have to have one of us on guard setting watch 24 hours. Great vacation? Promising it wont happen again, laughable since hey we were already told that and 20 mins later there it is. This is in regards to Liki tiki village Phase II.

Our experience was wonderful. My family enjoyed our week and the setting was relaxing.  My son-in-law found another guest who played tennis and they enjoyed the courts.  My daughter and I walked every morning and sat by the pool in the afternoon.  There was something for everyone.

review_title: Marquis Villas is dilapidated but well‚Ä¶
review_text: Marquis Villas is dilapidated but well located which is the only reason we stay there annually.

review_title: I would never intentionally do business with Diamond Resorts
review_text: Tried to steal my timeshare through bogus foreclosure attempt. Took me many hours to thwart WhT, in my opinion, was their unethical behavior. Was it intentional or or simply an administrative mistake? I don‚Äôt know. What I do know is that, based solely on my experience, their administrative response appears to me to be set up to assume their customers are liars and cheats.  They failed to return my calls and emails for months as I attempted to get them to consider their error. They just ignored me.  Finally, I got one person at the local property to listen and get it resolved. If I wasn‚Äôt stuck in this relationship (they acquired Mgmt of my timeshare), I would not do business with Diamond Resorts.

review_title: We have had lots of really brilliant‚Ä¶
review_text: We have had lots of really brilliant holidays in verious resorts in Spain and  other places but we are getting older  and a Lot off the friends that we have met are not going because of the cost and diamond are running the resorts more as holes and not for the members  and you cannot get the dates that you would like.                                               Arthur M.

I have 2 reviews.  One was an A-/B+ At the Kaanapali Beach Club in Maui and the other was in Palm Springs and I would rate a C-.  I can‚Äôt recall the name of the hotel but it was not a great hotel.  My traveling partner was so dissatisfied that we left a day early.

review_title: I have never been impressed by Diamond
review_text: I have never been impressed by Diamond. However my trust level is improving. A year ago I would have given a zero if that was an option.

Very disappointed.Not as advertised!

Good morning;Last year I didn't receive my annual fee invoice in the mail. However I did receive a reminder, in December, that my payment was past due by mail. I called customer service to make payment and to request that the interest charge be waived as I hadn't received the invoice prior to the due date for payment. Customer service determined that a letter was not sent but that an e-mailed invoice was sent. I checked my e-mail but could not locate an invoice from Diamond Resorts. My request was flat out denied in both tone and wording that made it clear a refund of interest was not going to be considered.
Clean, friendly, classic styles suited to the region.

The resorts we've stayed in has been beautiful and generally well kept.  There are some places we prefer to stay than other location because it's not as busy or crowded.  The downside happens every time we check in at VIP we are hassled into having an owner meeting sometime during our stay.  We are on vacation or we already have a specific agenda planned and having a meeting is not one of them.  If we have a question then we will schedule a meeting or call.

review_title: stay was great / shares sales director poor
review_text: stay was great. your shares sales director was terrible. made us feel so uncomfortable
The condos are usually nice from what I have experienced. They are difficult to work with and it‚Äôs usually make it confusing.  I also do not like them calling me.

1. We stayed in virgina beach.2. We was there 5 days not 1 time was our room cleaned or dirty towel picked up neather was our trash I was told there is a  shoot in the hall you need to take your own trash to. They do not provide Maid service unless you are there for more then 7 days, if you want to before then you have to pay for it.3. They promised a free gift. There free gift was a packet of coupons that you can obtain on every corner of the beach. 4. They call you over to this concierge desk directly after checking in. They tell you they are having a open house , and just for going and viewing the property you will get a cruise. We was also told to bring a ID and a Major credit card. We decided not to go, that morning I got a phone call to a very nasty guy who said " you missed you appointment you will need to pay now because I set this up on  good faith  that you would show up".5. We paid 15$ a day to park every time we went to get out of their parking lot key Cards didnt work and we had to pay. 10$ to get out.We bring this to the front desk attention where we are told they dont own the parking lot it is a 3rd party.6. They charge daily resort fees of 27$ which they charges 2 separate cards 5x each so that is 10x on a 4 day stay. Some of the cheaper non resort fee hotels had better patio furniture just as beautiful view with out all the mark up fee.After ne writing this review I got back home only to have my credit card charge $689.00 from Turtle cay resorts for a hotel night I didn't stay there on getting your money back in not happening never even got a I'm sorry.Virginia beach  is beautiful we will be back we just WILL NOT  BE STAYING AT THE DIAMOND RESORTS IN THIS AREA.

Once a person says no, that should be good enough. Don't keep pushing the issue, because now your just irritating the person.
Great holidays in quality accommodation, with staff who have passion for their work.  Just wish they could fix availability, within DRI for the European resorts!!

Since Diamond took over Club Intrawest and renamed it Embarc, it has not been good AT ALL.  Many people have left and they have ruined Extraordinary Escapes by hacking up the prices.  I would not recommend them.

review_title: We have had some really great vacations‚Ä¶
review_text: We have had some really great vacations at our Diamond timeshare resorts.  So glad to be able to take advantage of the program.

Stayed at Grande Villas by DR for 10 nights. Beautiful apartment, the heated pool and jacuzzi were top notch after walking all day at the orlando outlets and theme parks. The room is good for 2 adults. Kitchen fully equipped, we made breakfast every morning. No noise at night. The pool view is amazing. Rented a car, which made it easier to transport ourselves around, always found a parking spot right in front of the apartment. The mini market on site is really convenient and the food is good. Pretty close to everything, restaurants, pharmacy, bars, gas station. The people are im charge are really nice! They were not pushy at all with the time share that everyone talks about in other reviews. If I go back to Orlando, I will definitely stay at Grande Villas again.

review_title: The location and the accommodations was‚Ä¶
review_text: The location and the accommodations was phenomenal.

review_title: I hate the scam sales tactics everytime‚Ä¶
review_text: I hate the scam sales tactics everytime we visit a property.

review_title: We have stayed at mystic dunes 5 times‚Ä¶
review_text: We have stayed at mystic dunes 5 times and never had any issues. This past visit was horrible. Drug use in parking lot, broken AC, human feces tracked all over the pool area just to name a few. Not sure we will ever be back.
Need more places in western fl. la.

Diamond would have received 5 stars if my timeshare had remained "Exclusive" as it was when I first joined.   Now we have hotel guests who are paying less than our fees and getting to use our resorts.  My favourite resort in Europe is Sunset View in Tenerife and in UK it is Kenmore in Scotland.  It is time that Diamond tried to encourage new members and stop asking current members to buy more points at excessive prices.
Good facility but little bit insufficient care... if there was faster response to request for light in the night spa..Overroll good resort.
money grubbing, liars
Very nice! And helpful! Will recommend to others!

review_title: It's very hard for me to get a‚Ä¶
review_text: It's very hard for me to get a reservation when I need it, I tried 3 months in advance and no available time,  tried 4 month's no go, tried 6 months and gave up , my guess is that maybe it's only for those that work for Dimond resort and their family but I could be wrong.

review_title: Do not trust any of their reps
review_text: Do not trust any of their reps.  They sign you up for items you didn‚Äôt ask for (current owners).  Especially in Vegas, they have some of the worst reps.  Not to mention rude!! Prospective owners, don‚Äôt do it.  Not worth it.  What they don‚Äôt tell you is about all the maintenance fees you will pay each year, in addition to your mortgage.

review_title: The 3 star rating was not because of‚Ä¶
review_text: The 3 star rating was not because of accommodations or staffing at my home resort which is Cypress Pointe and adjacent Grande Villas.  They would get a definite 5!!!  My 3 star rating was for the customer service from the timeshare ownership aspect, the update scheme.  I know I created an issue with purchasing private points.  I purchased for the amount of points and the additional points I needed to enjoy extended stays after retirement. I believe I have owned my initial timeshare since 1991.  When trying to combine the two ownerships for simplicity and value an additional $18,000 was requested.  That amount was excessive in my world because of being on a fixed income and because of aging.  I will continue to do the best I can with my ownerships and try to pleasantly sit through another yearly update.

review_title: stayed at Virginia Beach in December‚Ä¶
review_text: stayed at Virginia Beach in December last year. beautiful place with ocean front and boardwalk. will go back someday...

review_title: Amazing product but Financial service dept need help
review_text: Amazing product and sales staff sell the product well.  The financial service departments are difficult to reach and work with.  I have experienced the lack of continuity of information dissemination when contacting the financial service department.

review_title: We went to Cabo and the amenities were‚Ä¶
review_text: We went to Cabo and the amenities were wonderful. The entire experience was great.

review_title: Annual fees are too high and present a‚Ä¶
review_text: Annual fees are too high and present a financial hardship.

review_title: We stayed at CanCun Resort in LV
review_text: We stayed at CanCun Resort in LV.  It was great for the most part.  The only things I would improve are: later pool hours, later hot tub hours on the balcony's and in the penthouse suites.  It's Las Vegas and guests stay up later than 9 pm.  We requested 2 fans to be in our room upon checking in but then were not.  No biggie, we just requested them again and they arrived within 10 minutes.  The concierge was amazing!  Definitely get a massage and facial while you visit the resort! It was well worth the money!! The beds were comfy and the rooms were clean.  We will definitely be coming back!

review_title: The resorts we have stayed in with‚Ä¶Diamond
review_text: The resorts we have stayed in with Diamond Resorts have all been wonderful. Some of them because of location and some of them just beautiful resorts. The personnel at the resorts have all been most helpful. The one drawback from joining Diamond, probably most time-shares, is trying to cancel the membership. My husband and I are getting older and travel is harder for us. We did talk to a Diamond rep. in Calif about getting out of our membership and we were not pleased with what they offered us. We will probably contact Diamond directly to try again and hope for more comfortable results.

review_title: Room was very good and spacious,the‚Ä¶
review_text: Room was very good and spacious,the lobby was clean,need new carpet. We loved the pool area. I would stay there again in the future

We love going on vacation...and now we do more than ever, however, maintenance fee is expensive and a debt! We usually have to charge the some $8000 plus a year for Platinum membership.   The locations are primo, we can use the points towards cruises, hotels, airfare.  But it isn‚Äôt easy.  Know the rules and the rules for exchange keep changing... am I happy with the product, I would say yes...but you have to be proactive and sometimes fight! For what you want...when I get older I may give up!  It is work.
Maintenance fees keep rising and benefits keep disappearing

review_title: Always a good place to stay
review_text: Always a good place to stay. Tried to get out of contacts was a nightmare! I got cancer & couldn‚Äôt use.. Ended up paying taxes on it in the end!!!

Love the vacation ownership and the variety of locations in network we can travel to. The main drawback is the affordability related to maintenance fees. For the cost of the fees I can usually find comparable places to stay for the same money. If the fees continue to go up this will begin to be a bad investment. I really like Diamond as a whole and would consider adding points but doing so does not make sense when I can book vacations destinations for less money.
4stars  somes  them up, not quite worth 5 stars.

review_title: It‚Äôs always an enjoyable stay at The‚Ä¶
review_text: It‚Äôs always an enjoyable stay at The Varsity Club in Mishawaka, IN. Everyone on staff is extremely helpful and friendly and always willing to help.

review_title: We love to visit Williamsburg VA as‚Ä¶
review_text: We love to visit Williamsburg VA as often as we can get away. Diamond has a great resort, the Historic Powhatan, that is clean, friendly with things to do. The coffee shop makes a great cup to sit and sip and enjoy the four tain. Can't wait to get back in the cooler weather with changing leaves and again during the Christmas season.

review_title: DRI - An expensive way to holiday - if you're lucky!
review_text: Diamond Resorts (DRI) no longer delivers it's original promises to European members. It is difficult to get any accommodation without pre-booking up to a year ahead. The chances of getting any short notice (59 day) bookings is virtually non existent. This was how, we were originally told, our membership points would reap great benefits once we retired and could take holidays at short notice. This has transpired to be a load of rubbish.Santa Barbara in Tenerife is one of our favourite destinations and we go there almost every year, often with friends and family. There used to be loads of availability there and even a good opportunity to get short notice bookings. This is now almost impossible and yet there is an ever increasing amount of accommodation taken up by non-members via holiday companies. My recommendation on DRI is don't waste your money!

review_title: found out later i could have book my‚Ä¶
review_text: found out later i could have book my hotel stay for half the price that Diamond Resort charged me.
Always friendly staff and fantastic properties.We never fail to enjoy ourselves
very good resort. thank you
IGNORE TEXT
Room furnishings especially tv need updated
Frustrated things we wish to use are never available.

We are here on our 10th visit which says a lot in itself. Would love to see some of the adult oriented activities come back and be fee based so those who are interested subsidize the event. Wine tasting, cooking in the kitchen with chef and bringing in local merchants on Monday morning for talks like you used to do with Pete, Ted, hiking guides, Clara Bo, star gazing guide, and Talaquepaque representatives. Serve a decent breakfast versus doughnuts. Sit in the living room chairs for an hour so you can see which ones need replacing. Put a comfy chair in the bedroom and a reading lamp. Turn mattresses frequently. Bring back all of the rose bushes, they were wonderful. The bathroom outside of Timos needs a complete overhaul. Timo's is a good setting with a lot of potential however quality of prepared food was disappointing the last two visits so we don't go any more. Our last visit to Timos service was rushed. Bring back the curio and spa shop, could be a money maker for you. Great move making the laundry free and offering soap. Very nice and allows us to reduce the volume of clothing we bring. Also great move making the golf free along with the hammocks, tennis, chess etc. The modifications from the creek area are all super and are really incredible versus 20 years ago!! Suggest next bathroom overhaul bring counter tops up to standard height. Seat cushions for patio furniture. Service staff and front desk staff really responsive! We will be back next year (2020) and will retire in 2021 when our travel options are wide open.

review_title: We have never had any problems
review_text: We have never had any problems, booking, arriving and staying at Diamond Resorts. Employees are friendly and willing to assist us in any way, without question. Look forward to our next trip.
I love the properties, sometimes the process can be a little confusing.  Wish there were a little more communication with the owners.

review_title: We felt that it was first class all the‚Ä¶
review_text: We felt that it was first class all the way - a true resort experience.  It was well located for our excursions and very comfortable when we returned exhausted.  The hot tubs were plentiful and extremely relaxing.

Update:The management team at the resort, after finding out how loud the construction was, actually upgraded us to a better room for the last three nights of our stay. Christina was fabulous and apologetic. There is still the sound of drilling and construction in the new room, but at least it is less and the view is better. Original post:Even though the Diamond Resort Kaanapali Beach Club site stated that there would be some construction - the assumption being some dust and inconvenience- never, ever did we expect that rooms directly adjacent to the active construction would be rented out to us! This is disruptive and unimaginable! The noise was so loud on Tuesday that we left the room in the morning. We came back at lunchtime and the noise of drilling was so constant and loud we could not have a conversation. The operator and front desk heard it when I called - I could hardly hear them - and I left a message for the front desk manager. This room should never have been allowed to be occupied this week! We have videos that we will gladly share from our room showing how loud and disruptive the noise has been. The front desk manager was polite and apologetic. Offered us a different room on a lower floor in the other tower, but moving halfway through are stay across the property was not great! We went on an excursion Monday and today, so we will see if we have to move since tomorrow calls for rain and we may have to be in the room!
Great place to stay, Diamond Resorts is luxury.  We will definitely stay there when in Whistler next.  Wonderful for families.

review_title: Very hard to get a room at most of the‚Ä¶
review_text: Very hard to get a room at most of the resorts.  Much cheaper to get the facility from one of the booking sites,  They do not do a very good job in keeping the maintenance fees down.
It was good, only complaint was that they spent too much of our precious vacation time, trying to get us to buy timeshare. We would go back but not ever be talked into attending time share meetings!
IGNORE TEXT
IGNORE TEXT
Our daughter and her family used our timeshare and they felt very welcomed and Diamond treated them very well. They unit was perfect!

review_title: The sales pitch (s) at the end of our‚Ä¶
review_text: The sales pitch (s) at the end of our Las Vegas trip made me/us not want to do another trip ever again - the stay was great our host  was perfect  - the sales marketing team horrible.

review_title: As a member who has to pay increasing‚Ä¶
review_text: As a member who has to pay increasing maintenance/membership fees each year, the amount of accommodation availability is getting less and less for us while none members who have not bought in to Diamond  Resorts nor have paid the vast annual maintenance/membership fees can simply use booking.com or Diamond Resorts & Hotels to book (none of which were advised when joining the "exclusive" club)

review_title: Still very hard sell everytime we go on‚Ä¶
review_text: Still very hard sell everytime we go on vacation we are sick and tired of it!! Sales rep used docusign to tap our initials and signature on every page we never slouched the tablet. When we got a hard copy and read it she left out key information or failed to correctly summarize the agreement so we sent a letter and rescinded the agreement

review_title: I had stayed at The Modern before‚Ä¶
review_text: I had stayed at The Modern before Diamond Resorts took it over and it was amazing and became my hotel of choice when travelling to waikiki.  My stay after Diamond Resorts took over was incredibly disappointing.  I had warned them before my arrival that I had discovered they had become a timeshare, and they were not to try and talk me in to a presentation or buying in as it would not happen.  The staff weren't particularly helpful and the food I purchased at the hotel was awful!  On previous stays the food had been great.  From what the hotel had been to what it had become, I will never stay there again.
Not the best experience wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to friends or family.
Great experience, very knowledgeable rep worth great insight and endless desire to satisfy.

Units are old in great need of renovation!Diamond resorts policy to assign ‚Äúold‚Äù units to Non Owners is a deterrent and turn away customers who may be interested in acquiring a Diamond resort property.

We have experienced good customer service when residing at the diamond resort locations (Las Vegas, Lake Tahoe). Our experiences with having the timeshare discussions are sometimes challenging. But overall, the experience has been good.

review_title: We have all the points that we‚Ä¶
review_text: We have all the points that we need,there is no more time in our schedules to go any place else. Thank You
Excellent quality of accommodation, but annual fees are high.
Hotel was ok.  I do not get the resort fee!!  I have stayed in much nicer place with a lot more amenities and they do not charge resort fees.

review_title: All the rooms are very clean and feel‚Ä¶
review_text: All the rooms are very clean and feel like home. The fees and point system could use a re-evaluation.

review_title: It's named Diamond for a reason.
review_text: Have been trading with Diamond for years, through Interval. We've been lucky enough to stay at some great properties. Can't wait till our next vacation.

review_title: We loved this in the woods quiet‚Ä¶
review_text: We loved this in the woods quiet retreat in N.C. Easy check in even though it is off site. Loved the floor plan with Madter BR and bath downstairs and kitchen, living, dining and extra bedroom and bath ipstairs.Lots of closet/cabinet space and good cooking and eating utensils. Clean clean clean. We will go again

review_title: Diamond is not a good investment
review_text: Dishonest sales people.  Difficult to get reservations places you want to go. They keep taking benefits away.  Transitions price keep going up which is absurd. And the list goes on.
Over the years, they have made it more and more difficult to use your points for what you would like by letting only those that buy more get in so you can't.

review_title: The BEST VACATION - according to our teenage sons
review_text: We had an incredible stay at the Diamond Resort - The Royal Regency In 2018 - in Vincennes France! We arrived the day after Christmas to a lovely apartment with 2 bedrooms.  The apartment was perfect as we need lots of room when traveling with our 2 teenage sons. The front desk staff is super helpful- but we knew this because this was our second stay at this property. The location is perfect. We were close to bakeries - restaurants and stores. 3 times a week was the huge street market where we bought all kinds of foods and treasures ! You will not be disappointed - book your stay and get a full apartment so you can embrace French food and be comfortable.

review_title: if you are going to vacation and want‚Ä¶
review_text: if you are going to vacation and want quality accommodations and fewer surprises this works. We have been very happy with the resorts. the sales team is less than honest at most places...especially Las Vegas. However, we have been a part of this since early 2000's and find it works for us.

review_title: This is our favorite property here in‚Ä¶
review_text: This is our favorite property here in Florida.   The staff here is like family.They actually remember you from years to years.I am alittle disappointed about being on the second level when I requested the first level to three different people.  I spoke to the manager today and unfortunately no first floor until tomorrow afternoon.  But after being here 2 days already we don't want to pack up and move again.  My decision, on that   but we love everything else...
Excellent place to stop and good food in restaurant

Our original time share, Intrawest, was purchased by Diamond a few years ago. We purchased Intrawest due to its exception product, customer service and exchange value. The value of Diamond in these areas is so very much below what we originally purchased, we would never have considered the purchase. Now we are stuck with sub-standard options. Extremely disappointed.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Dunes Village is right on the beach &‚Ä¶
review_text: Dunes Village is right on the beach & has excellent activities. Our vacation was cut short because of Dorian & had to evacuate so we did not get a chance to experience all of them.

The facility was nice. I few issues though. The fire place and sound system didn't work and there were fruit flies in the kitchen and bathrooms. We called maintenance. They came and addressed the fruit flies but said that they need to call a repair person for the fireplace and sound system.

review_title: Lies, Lies, Lies, Pressure, Pressure, Pressure!!!!!!!!!!!
review_text: We did the owners update and we were very sorry we did it.  High pressure sales and they go on on and on until we cry uncle.  They told us if we bought a sampler we would only have to pay maintenance fees in mexico at 2000 plus a year for the rest of our life.we relented and bought a sampler for 20000 points. Mike said it would up our temporary platinum status for another two years,  they also said we would be to be elite members of interval international. When we asked to have this in writing they said oh its in the computer.  We went back after reading everything and they said if they put it in writing they will be fired. We couldnt cancle anything because it said no cancellations.  Now we have to go through another time share review.We shouldn't do it but they talk us into it by lying and saying it is just an update,   Then the sharks attack us.Very unpleasant experience.
Love my home resort.

review_title: Not sure how it‚Äôs different than Wyndham
review_text: When I learned about Diamond, I thought it might be a good option for me.   The presentation really did not make it clear how it was any different than Wyndham.   Sadly, I heard the same ‚Äúlines‚Äù as I did with them.  And after I saw the resorts that were available, I do not believe I would have more options than I currently have.   The presentation itself was a no pressure sales pitch, which I appreciated.  However, the second guy who came up (and made sure I did not feel pressured) and tried to sell me AGAIN kind of annoyed me and made it seem more like they weren‚Äôt going to let me leave without buying.  You really should have stopped with the initial attempt.
Facilities are nice. Have update experiences multiple times a year destroys the whole thing.

review_title: Enjoyed our time with my family
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I have been waiting for my timeshare to‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been waiting for my timeshare to be tpaired in st marten.  Diamond‚Äôs solution is to have owners ‚Äúbuy‚Äù pay more money to join their share program while still paying a maintenance fee For weeks owned at a resort That is not available.  Then when you ‚Äútrade‚Äù your week, a 2-bedroom ocean front is valued as nothing because it is ‚Äúclosed‚Äù. DO NOT JOIN.

review_title: I'm very disappointed that you have‚Ä¶
review_text: I'm very disappointed that you have increased your charges for modifying a reservation.  Only last year did I discover, with the help of a very "withit" and helpful representative that the $25 charge would be applied to the call, and I could modify 3 reservations for that charge.  The only way I can get mid-week reservations at the Whistler resort now is to book a full week 11 months in advance and then later drop off the pricey weekend portion.  This is an obvious benefit for some poor working stiff to grab a weekend.  So in all fairness one would expect them to have to pay to extra fee, not the member who made this  possible.  But this is too much to ask for, I suppose.   I think one might at least expect to be able to do this for one charge instead of 3, as we were previously able to do.  Today, when I called to make these changes for my reservations in next January and February, I was charged $75 USD instead of $25!  This is a very large increase for the same amount of service, and obviously not justifiable.
IGNORE TEXT
Great service, nice space , most of all you have no excuses not to take vacations, which is very good for your overall health.

review_title: We enjoy visiting the resorts in sunny‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoy visiting the resorts in sunny and warm states. We have had a few issues with noise, unclean units, ripped furniture, and appliances not working correctly.  The housekeeping staff, maintenance staff, grounds staff, and concierge staff have all been polite and friendly.  Our real problem is with the sales teams. They promise but they don't deliver. I could go on but I won't.

We have never been disappointed at any of the Diamond resorts we have used.We have found all the staff to be courteous and helpful.Resorts are well maintained inside apartments and outside in the grounds.

review_title: Too hard to get reservations at the‚Ä¶
review_text: Too hard to get reservations at the resorts we want to go to.

review_title: I have been going to Sunset Bay Club‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been going to Sunset Bay Club for most of the winter for  over  20  years even though I am a platinum member and use the 14 month advance booking system l find it increasingly difficult to get bookings for me and my family.Yet when I look at various booking sites I see plenty availability at extortionate prices! What's going on? I have my suspicions!
Fabulous resorts. Staff are amazing. Everyone from the reception team to the entertainers to the housekeepers are polite, friendly and will do everything to make your stay great

review_title: Lack of choice of places to stay and‚Ä¶
review_text: Lack of choice of places to stay and lack of places available.  You have not expanded at all.

review_title: Kaanapali Beach Club is a beautiful‚Ä¶
review_text: Kaanapali Beach Club is a beautiful resort and the staff are always so pleasant and helpful with anything you made need. I look forward to going back.
Very clean, well maintained, love the coffee machine in the lobby. Front desk are very pleasant and helpful. Can‚Äôt wait to explore the area today.

review_title: back to normal after a poor start
review_text: back to normal after a poor start, inappropriate room allocation.
I felt your company representative who contacted me to arrange for the tour was deceitful in his offerings as rewards for taking the tour of your Las Vegas resort.
Wonderful vacation.  Quite,  serine,  but hot tub where we stayed was down.

We are extremely disappointed in the Diamond Resorts company.  Since it took over Intrawest we have had a total ‚Äúrunaround‚Äù with management concerning the discontinuation of our Extraordinary Escapes.  We have approached every manager available to us and everyone just comes up with excuse after excuse.  Our latest complaint is we were awarded a $150.00 gift card when after going through a presentation.  We used it for the first $75.00 and then it stopped working.  I tried to connect with a manager about it but had no idea who to turn to.  Frankly I didn‚Äôt even bother in the end as I knew I would only face aggravation and who would believe me.
Had a great time, the scenery was great and plenty of things to do. Luv'd it!!!!!
Easy to book, nice resort, great location. Only downside of our visit was the hot tub near our condo wasn't working.

review_title: Diamond resorts is part of a group of‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond resorts is part of a group of companies in search of people looking for vacations. After ten years of relationship we caution anyone to expect high pressure efforts to get prospects involved before vacation even starts. We are relatively high level aging owners but are continually pursued relentlessly. We like most resorts but struggle with the maintenance fees that can match or exceed typical resalable property.  The ever changing hospitality industry can lure an unsuspecting prospect into a situation they cannot afford or escape. Diamond is one of the most aggressive in that respect
nice accommodations, excellent service,

review_text: Excellent knowledge and service by the staff.
Great experiences in diamonds Europe , not so good USA as in my experience only have quick food , no entertainment .

review_title: I miss the Club Intrawest days when‚Ä¶
review_text: I miss the Club Intrawest days when member's were put first. Now that it's Embrac, it's all about business and all the extras and the perks of being a member are gone. Now it's simply another 'time share.' Definitely doesn't feel like home.
Accommodations were very clean, staff went out of their way to help and location is perfect for proximity to many attractions.

review_title: Trying to pay fees on fixed income is‚Ä¶

Beautiful property. Great staff! Would definitely recommend.
Chat experience was even lower so this is an average.Chat representative was rude, gave incorrect information, and disconnected chat in the middle of a conversation.
I love Diamond Resorts International. 5 star service. I‚Äôve never been to a location that didn‚Äôt treat me like the King I am and the Queen my wife is.

review_title: I appreciated an early check in and our‚Ä¶
review_text: I appreciated an early check in and our family accommodations were Across from each other. Housekeeping were very accommodating . Resort  staff were high class and the resort was spotless.
