review_title: I love staying at Diamond Resorts
review_text: I love staying at Diamond Resorts. The units are always clean and the beds are very comfy. The grounds and pools are clean and well maintained. Some resorts are newer than others. The older ones could use some updates.

review_title: Terrible timeshare offer!  Say no, and the perks may be worth it.
review_text: The timeshare offer from Diamond Resorts is a terrible investment.  It will sound great, but there is a reason they don't give a price for the package till the very end.  Do not let them hard sell you into something you don't really want.  Do the math and have the guts to say no.  And when you say no and they come back with a better price, ask yourself why they didn't start with the better price.  Answer, because they are not looking out for your interests at all!  They play "good cop, bad cop", and by the end it feels very much like a high pressure car dealership.  If you are able to say no, then the vacation packages they offer are worth the 2 hour investment.  We have done them twice, but each time they pushed me to be a jerk in order to get out the door.  Last guy, Sean Taylor from Orlando, was a real gem.  A professional you know what.  But seriously, those are the kind of people they bring in at the end for the pressure.  Say no, and leave with a smile as you enjoy your vacation package...

review_title: We have not been happy since they‚Ä¶
review_text: We have not been happy since they purchased Intrawest and changed it to Embarc.
Kids had a great time.

We have stayed at the Liki Tiki before and loved it, however the room we stayed in this time was a disappointment. The pull out couch was old and uncomfortable and the main bed wasn‚Äôt much better. We enjoyed the water park but left early because no one could sleep comfortably.

review_title: We enjoy The Kanapali Beach Club
review_text: We enjoy The Kanapali Beach Club, Maui.  This is our happy place. The bar staff, front desk and hospitality are tops.  Love it !!!!
When I've needed help since the purchase I can't get the help or a straight answer.

review_title: Diamond Resorts is a great timeshare‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond Resorts is a great timeshare program. It offers many many great resorts and great areas All Quality resorts we have been owners since 2002 and a very happy
3 months, problem not solve
A great place to stay, very nice people and service, also the localisation is very near of everything

We booked and paid for our stay prior to arriving. We booked a king size bed and when we arrived were told they didn‚Äôt have a king available. Instead we were put in a room with two double beds. As we had already paid we had no choice but to stay at this hotel. Further, the hot tub for persons under 18 was too small. We were able to go in the adult hot tub but our 11 year old daughter had to wait next to the hot tub. Even more infuriating was other people were allowing their children into the adult hot tub. So much for doing the right thing. Needless to say we had an uncomfortable 5 night stay and will not be staying with diamond resorts in the future. I feel as if I have already left a review for this resort upon our return home last year.

review_title: Diamond is unresponsive and I have‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond is unresponsive and I have tried numerous times to get them to correct my account. I am still missing a week that was never credited to me.

review_title: Some of the resort are old and needs to‚Ä¶
review_text: Some of the resort are old and needs to be updated.The money we pay for maintenance is very high and if we got reservation of those resort through another website would be cost us less even.Not to mentioned we paid a lot of money for our points originally too.I wish the diamond resort would buy the points back.We are tired off going to same place plus my kids are growing up and not traveling as much as before.

Great experience at Powhatan in Williamsburg, VA. Unit was clean and very comfortable. Loved spending time at the resorts pool, miniature golf and doing crafts with grandchildren. We had visited Williamsburg Historic area and parks in the past. So this time we wanted to just layback and enjoy some time with our grandchildren. We certainly picked the best place for that.
Diamond Resorts always delivers the best in amenities, service and quality.  A+!!!

review_title: Am not at all happy with your daily‚Ä¶
review_text: Am not at all happy with your daily resort fees.  Will be looking for other resorts rather than Diamond.

We booked through Expedia. Was treated very smugly at check in and told we "might have our room at 4pm". I called the General Manager and I was able to speak with him over the phone explaining our situation. He informed me that if we could find another hotel close by, he would refund us the money. So we did. We found another hotel .3 miles away, checked in and got into our room right away. I then called The GM to inform him that we found another hotel to accommodate us, and that I would now like my refund as promised. He then informed me that because it was through Expedia he will see what he can do. I have worked in Hospitality for over 20yrs, and did not appreciate the run around. I also know that a simple phone call from the hotel to Expedia can get you a refund. As I explained that situation to him he hung up on me mid sentence. I then called corporate after being on the phone with Expedia for 20 minutes, but who was very nice and gave me the refund right away.  When speaking with the corporate employee she put words in my mouth and was very condescending. She eventually informed me she called The GM and he had a different story so all she could do was email his area manger. Here's the bottom line. They need to learn empathy, and most importantly HOSPITALITY!  You do not talk down to people, hang up on people and just think that's okay. I would NEVER stay at a Diamond Resort. There are some many others that truly embrace the value of genuine hospitality

review_title: Staff is always accommodating  and we‚Ä¶
review_text: Staff is always accommodating  and we just like to relax and enjoy our away time in the well equipped unit or enjoy the spa, etc.

Great location for long walks along the rugged B.C. pacific coast or along Long Beach, a sandy mystical 4K walk. The accommodation was outstanding except for the noise from owners on the floor above, but that was minor.

review_title: Am NOT switching from ownership to points.
review_text: Still cautious about at-Poipu pressure to switch from ownership to point system.  We wish we had a little more say in which units we inhabit when we reserve. Also worried that the recently-sold property between buildings 3 & 4 and the coastline will downgrade a lot of "ocean front" units.  We always enjoy being there every other year, and we try to come at different seasons each time.  Some of the hot tub floors seem to be deteriorating. We appreciate the annal billing for maintenance as opposed to the former pay-when reserving system.

review_title: I used to think more of Diamond Resorts, then I stayed at Polo Towers.
review_text: After my last stay at Polo Towers I view Diamond resorts in a new light. I have been spoiled with the properties in Florida and Virginia. Polo Towers is not up to par with the other diamond resorts I have stayed at in the past. Poor service and poor facilities at Polo Towers resulted in my decision to never stay there again.

review_title: Diamond Resorts was a great place for us to stay
review_text: Diamond Resorts was a great place for both of us to stay.  The location was close to the Botanical Gardens and close to friends and family.  The restaurants were close to our hotel also.  Thanks for your hospitality!

review_title: Have not been away to Diamond Resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: Have not been away to Diamond Resorts since Feb 19. As normal I stayed at Lake Tahoe Vacation Resort. Never have any problems and have been going every year since I joined Embassy or Sunterra.
we've been there three times before and love the location!
Not the exclusive Timeshare company we bought into 20+ years ago
The resort was beautiful, and the staff was incredibly kind.

review_title: Can‚Äôt ever find openings when I need‚Ä¶
review_text: Can‚Äôt ever find openings when I need them and then get repeated emails and phone calls about me not using my points

review_title: My wife and I enjoy Diamond resorts
review_text: My wife and I enjoy Diamond resorts, we always use resorts from October to May when schools are working, so we enjoy a quiet relaxing holiday, Our favourite resorts are the Canaria islands and Costa Del Sol

review_title: I would have loved to take a trip over‚Ä¶
review_text: I would have loved to take a trip over Xmass time for 2019 but the minute I went to book all rooms were alreadt taken. I am not talking a Random try I waited till the supposed minute that you were allowed to make a reservation and it was amazing that all was taken. Then I checked on Expedia and the same room I wanted was available for cash. I called member services and they would not give up the room as it was owned by Diamond. IN the past Intrawest wouyld always turn over a room to members. Diamond sucks! Hard to rate a vacation when you cant go where you want.
Royal Sunset Beach Club, Tenerife is really good place to stay!
Terrible customer service and horrible value.
Not worth it. I want out

review_title: We have a LOT of mistrust with a LOT of‚Ä¶
review_text: Mistrust with a LOT of Diamond EmployeesWe have a LOT of mistrust with a LOT of Diamond Employees!  Although most resorts are first class and the "blue collar" staff are mostly friendly and helpful, but ALL of our recent encounters with the "white collar" staff have been undesirable and deceitful.
We had an awesome time!

It was great! We stayed for a week in Liky Tiky Village and everything was clean and in good conditions. The bathrooms are big and the kitchen is with full apliances. The Pool and other complexes of the village are really fun and good. Great experience!

review_title: what does diamond resorts have to offer
review_text: you give your members the impression that all you want is their fees and the hell with them. trying to book something on line is a nightmare. most times I give up in frustration. there is seldom availability yet if you want to pay and go through expedia you can get reservations for any time, even the same day. you dont have a great reputation on the embarc owners group site. I would never recommend anyone join diamond resorts

This was our second visit to Diamond Resort's Modern Honolulu. For the most part we enjoyed our stay, however we were disappointed with the lack of upgrades the resort was supposed to under go. We were here in January and were alerted the resort was under going renovations, and on this trip it appeared nothing was renovated. Additionally, we were promised an early check in, and were told nothing was available yet. We arrived at 1230 hours and left to eat and returned at 2:30 and nothing was still available.  We waited until 3:00 pm and were finally told we could check in. We initially had room on the 17th floor and it was changed to the 10th floor. A female clerk initially checked us in and quickly took our resort fees, but told us to wait. Upon returning at 230 pm, I spoke to the same female clerk and after telling her I've never had to wait this long for a check in as a Diamond member, she proceeded to sarcastically explain the cleaning crew was hurrying as fast as they could because of all the late check outs. She then asked if I wanted to change rooms, but she recommended we wait because the room on the 17th floor was worth waiting for. When I received the call at 3 pm, a male attendant gave us our room keys, but this was a different room. This resort needs to take lessons from the Cancun Resort in Las Vegas. The Modern should also limit late checkouts to Silver and above members only. After these encumbrances, the remainder of stay was fine. Hopefully our third visit will be like the first one.

review_text: Diamond Resorts is our go to spot for all our Florida vacations. We have even changed the date of travel if they were booked. The staff, the rooms, the grounds and the activities keep our family happy and having fun. It‚Äôs home away from home.

I can‚Äôt give 5 stars. One of the main reasons for purchasing a timeshare was to be able to bring our family to Disney World and not have to worry about where we are staying. In 2020 we are bringing our family of 10 and we don‚Äôt have enough points to stay anywhere for a week. review_title: We have been members of diamond since‚Ä¶Diamond Satisfaction
review_text: We have been members of diamond since 2003 from the days of GVC. It is something that has given us many wonderful holidays and experiences.Yes it's not an inexpensive way to holiday but it's certainly value for money. The standard of accommodation and the location of the resorts are really excellent We go away knowing that wherever we go we don't have to worry what we will find on opening the door to our accommodation. Diamond trains all its personnel to the highest level of proffesionalism everyone wants to make your holiday the best possible. May we continue to enjoy this for many years to come

If you don't mind a high pressured sales pitch to buy into a Timeshare with at least $800 a year maintenance fee- this is for you......If you don't mind your sales presenter trying to make you feel stupid for not buying- This is for you.My wife absolutely "Hates" these "60 minute Presentations" -but we bought a Sampler package, which means we have to attend a presentation everytime we use our points.......I almost bought a package for every other year-But didn't like it due to a maintenance fee even for the year I don't use it........

review_title: Do not go to the sales meeting! Longer than promised!
review_text: The resort was clean, updated and close but not on Virginia Beach. The pool are was well maintained. The registration staff were good at suggesting restaurants.BUT DO NOT SIT THROUGH THE SALES PRESENTATION unless you‚Äôre willing to be lied to about the length of time it takes (2 1/2 hours rather than the 90 minutes we were promised.)Upon complaining about the time spent, we were told that by not buying we cost the company money!
Diamond Resorts manage and maintain the resorts in the portfolio to a high standard whilst trying to control excessive spending.

review_title: Do not reserve with Diamond Resorts
review_text: Do not reserve with Diamond Resorts!  Worst experience EVER!!!!!
Expensive; limited; complicated, high pressure time shares plans with few or no choices for "outs" as life changes.  Don't Buy!

The location was excellent! And the screened private porch was wonderful. However, the units furniture, bathrooms, window fixtures, and appliances was very outdated and worn. Cleanliness was so-so. Most staff were very accommodating and pleasant. Had to request maintenance to close a stuck window in the bedroom.  First person came while we were out, closing a bathroom window instead, then used the bathroom. How do we know?  They left he toilet seat up; we were two sisters! It left us a little grossed out.  The second was there right away and took care of our issue.

Reservations are almost impossible to book where we want and when we want.  The extra costs involved and strings attached are ridiculous. Have received so many phone calls from Diamond Resorts we have started hanging up.  This company is nothing but a ploy to get unsuspecting people to spend money and not give them something in return that is actually easy and economical to use.
Excellent, relaxing place to stay.

review_title: This is about Caribe in Orange Beach
review_text: This is about Caribe in Orange Beach, Fl.  The condo has the most beautiful view, just great.  It also has so much to do.  It has many pools, the beach, mini golf, tennis, etc.  It is a fun place of the family.  However, I wish someone had a little warning that it was not set up like the Embarc Resorts.  That is there were no extra toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags, no beach towels, minimal shampoo, no hair dryer, and salt and pepper.  Of course, there was no mid-week clean.  Also, because these condos and personally owned, they were clean, yes, but really the couches and extra pillows were very dusty to the point of allergy problems.  I don't think their cleaning staff vacuums the couches and cleans the pillows.  Maybe I'm fussy.  But I have never had to run out to get toilet paper and trash bags before.  And don't even try to ask the front desk for them!

review_title: We are very happy members of Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: We are very happy members of Diamond Resorts. We travelled this year to Palazzo Catalani in Italy and had a wonderful time.
always is clean excellent service.i recommend Diamond Resortto all my friend.

review_title: This is by far the best resort we have‚Ä¶
review_text: This is by far the best resort we have stayed at it was very nice and clean friendly staff we will most definitely be staying here again I would recommend this resort to everyone

My rating is only a 3 because of the horrendous sales pressures.  I feel disrespected and pressured to spend, spend, spend, despite my always clear declaration that I am emphatically NOT buying any more points.   Furthermore, each sales presentation is a device to get my written acknowledgement that my future points will cost me more if I don't buy then and there.  The sales people DON'T LISTEN!  The properties are, by and large, nice but remote from any cities, so a car is a necessity.  Not all properties offer mid stay light housekeeping, or even linens exchange.  I like Greenspring (VA), Dunes (Orlando), Scottsdale Links (AZ), Sedona Summit (AZ), Los Abrigatos (AZ), but have been assigned horrible old units at Powatan(VA).

Its honestly not the same place it use to be. The resort fees are extremely high. There is not much cell service and the wifi is not the best. I do like the amenities and it's great to have a kitchen. It use to be my most favorite place to stay and lately I have been going to other places. I wish it wasn't so.

review_title: We enjoyed the visit to the new resort‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoyed the visit to the new resort in Palm Springs that we attended a presentation at, but we always stay at the Villa Marquis and have alwys loved it and thought of it as our second home in Calibut had a bad experience this last visit.Never had a problem until the second to the last night we were there, I found little bugs crawling on my bedside lamp and headboard and freaked out.I have never seen one EVER before when we have stayed there and its always been fantastic, so I was surprised. They moved us to a new room for our last night which I appreciated, but it was their attitude that bothered me.The housekeeping manager just smiled and said "  Its only little bugs " and I thought that was innapropiate.We have always loved the V. Marquis and referred it to everyone so I was hurt by their lack of caring.We  were there 4 days and taking off even just one night from the bill would have shown me there were sorry for the innconvinence, but they just seemed like I overreacted. I hope to go back , but not sure.  Martha  Hykel
Living space too small. Oversized bathroom waste of space. Too much chlorine in pool and hot tub. Ruined our bathing suits. Now you didn‚Äôt indicate which resort.

There are many plus points in Diamond Resorts favour but also some negative aspects. Having stayed at  many resorts over the last 25 years ( and at non Diamond properties) I have seen a decline in standards. This is unfortunate but demonstrates how they are focused more on money than their members.The properties are generally of good quality and refurbishments do take place which is a positive for the future. One big drawback is there continual "update " presentations which are really sales pitches. To do this constantly to members is disappointing and they should be better than this.The continual changes ---- now more  of a holiday club than a resort provider do nothing for me.

review_title: Very disappointed in how the plan was‚Ä¶
review_text: Very disappointed in how the plan was presented to us. We were actually very misled...out right lied too.
It's very resort dependent.  Some resorts are 5 star (e.g. Cabo Azul), some 4 star (e.g. Sedona Summit), others are less desirable.

This is the first time in my many, many trips to Whistler that both staff and facilities had flaws. I experienced sub standard interaction at the front desk and the facility had a lot of broken or tired games in their game room. It was very sad to see. Hopefully Embarc will correct these concerns for our next visit.

review_title: Just plain bad business practices for a timeshare
review_text: We decided to try a "passport membership" before actually going forward with a full membership.  I'm so happy we did because the booking system is SO poorly setup that you need a vacation by the time you've made a reservation. How are you going to recruit new members when the process is so painful that prospective clients no longer want to have anything to do with you?Really, i could write a short story on all the issues we experienced.It's such a shame as the resorts we visited were all very good. Just not worth the aggravation.

We were lies to by your sales team. Totally disappointed about how we were treated by your sales staff after bring to the attention of the supervisor who took no real steps to correct  or hold the salesperson accountable for lieibg to us.

review_title: I recently bought into diamond had‚Ä¶
review_text: I recently bought into diamond had previously stayed at almost all resorts in Orlando florida we choose to stay at liki tiki resort 1 month after we bought in it was horrible our unit was discusting doors broken floors gross tables scratched up bug in couch bed moved us to another unit just a little better not much no refund on my cost at all no compensation for our issues nobody in office had k owledge on how to fix issues if i had stayed there prior i would never had bought in

review_title: I have been very disappointed in the‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been very disappointed in the maintenance of my apartment over the last few years.  My apartment has been very poorly maintained, ie bathroom, kitchen, they are so out of date and falling apart.  I have put three Stars because of the wonderful staff there at the resort, but the apartment is like a 2 star.   Hopefully things have improved this year and standers are a whole lots better. .

Honestly, I‚Äôm very dissatisfied with non members being able to use facilities and paying a small monthly fee???? I pay almost 1000.00$ for maintenance yearly and have been for 30 years! Now you‚Äôre allowing outsiders to use the facilities I pay for? Please respond M
We have been regularly going to Woodford Bridge and now to Lanzarote for the last few years and have found nothing to find fault with at either resort.
Well, I have always had a good experience with your organization, have had a couple of problems with reservations and the rooms but we love going to Kohl's Ranch.

review_text: Bought the sampler package and did not read it carefully--my bad.Limited availabilities and every time you use it must sit through horrid presentation.  Walked out after the required 60 minutes and was berated, called a thief, a liar, and told the reps 7 year old son was smarter because we did see the value in upgrading   Tempted to let the $2,000 worth of points lapse just not to have to sit in their presentations.  Left waiting for 30 minutes while they schemed to offer upgrades.  Imagine the worst car sales person on steroids and you have it
Stayed at Grand Hotel Trafalgar Square in London. Staff very professional and friendly. The suite was perfect

review_text: Don't ever buy into a timeshare vacation of any kind! It's a rip off and keeps draining your pocketbook. High pressure tactics and lies. What you think you are getting is hard to attain and of course, the maintenance fees just keep going up. Biggest mistake we ever made! We could have purchase a vacation home and had something worth selling! Don't buy into this!!
Your customer service representative are good.  I can't say much for your sales people.  I don't have much trust or faith in them.

review_title: Sold me a sampler package and when I‚Ä¶
review_text: Sold me a sampler package and when I try booking it says I must go to a presentation and listen to them trying to sell me more stuff. I‚Äôm happy with what I have and don‚Äôt like being pressured to buy more. It upsets my wife and ruins our vacation. Also I have to pay resort fees with any stay which as a Diamond member I should not have to pay. Very miss leading

review_text: My family and I satisfied every time with the club.

review_title: You are just an income stream.
review_text: As long as they see you as a source of more profit, they will treat you like gold.  As soon as they have your money, you are ignored.

We enjoy the resorts. They are generally 3 star...but the sales folk tend to use mixed truths and confusing language to make a sale...We have been called stupid by a salesperson. .They push false truths to make a sale and then you don't necessarily get what you thought you were getting..very pushy and arrogant...but the resorts and their resort staff has always been good to us...I would say, Stay away from updates and sales unless you really want to buy more points.

review_title: We were at Parksville last summer
review_text: We were at Parksville last summer. Screen door on the balcony was broken. Promised a room over the beach which we did not get

review_title: We stayed at Royal Lahaina through‚Ä¶
review_text: We stayed at Royal Lahaina through Diamond. The Hawaiian setting, restaurant, front beach view with pool and water sports rentals, all right there. The Luau was extra nice, on the grounds.  We visited nearby Diamond Kaanapali location and were amazed by the size, open floral lobby, gorgeous pool, and cleanliness. Beauty
all resorts are clean, friendly and we've been a DRI member for 12 years.

review_title: We stayed at Sedona Summit this summer‚Ä¶
review_text: We stayed at Sedona Summit this summer for a pink jeep tour to the Grand Canyon. We loved the resort, the grounds are beautiful and plenty of pools to choose from. We will be staying there again. The staff was very friendly and helpful with our son and his service dog.

review_title: Don't deal with Diamond Resorts under any circumstance
review_text: We were hoodwinked into buying the Sampler package with a bunch of lies a year ago and have yet used anything. Wasted $4000.  The places we want to go are not available and the ones that are available are not worth what we would spend.  We could rent the places with no restrictions for less money.Tried to get out of the package but once they have your money, who cares.
Love. The look. Would prefer a cleaning at least once during an 8 day stay. Friendly staff. Maintenance fees very high.

Customer service is good, however,  high pressure sales and misrepresentation by these sales people is out of this world.  We have been taken advantage of several time but never again after being told out and out lies to get us to purchase or buy just to get out from the 5 hours they have been hammering at you.  Florida personnel  is the worst.Also I think you should be able to use more points and less cash.  Parent company of Diamond is the one make all the money and not sharing with point holders.  I have several other timeshares that seem to work out better and do not oversell themselves if we go to an update.I think Diamond could do much better.  Maintenance fees are out of line.  As they say, the rich get richer and us point holders get poorer!

Honestly, a few of the resorts are really great... the others are not great. But beyond that, what really makes this a TERRIBLE experience is the Sales Staff and support. My wife and I foolishly trusted TWO of their salesmen (shame on us) in previous sales for time share points, only to have to spend days, weeks, MONTHS tracking down how to even TRY to do what they SAID we could do with our points. We've even contemplated legal action. They need to get rid of their PUSHY commission sales and get everyone waged and on the same page - online, over-the-phone, and in-person. Bottome line - because of this - I REALLY want out... which also seems nearly impossible, unless as they tell me "Well, you can also give your points back to Diamond".... WHAT!??! That's like telling someone who doesn't want their house anymore to just give it to the local government... ARE YOU KIDDING ME? Argh. Yeah - I'm really not a fan. Hope this helps someone, and that I'm not the only one who feels this way.

review_title: Difficult to get available booking in‚Ä¶
review_text: Difficult to get available booking in European Resorts. Very limited availability in Spain and Portugal. Seem there is a saturation point being reached and need more resorts for members.

We have many great choices to stay with Diamond and they are comfortable places to make you feel more at home. We love the options  but  It is pricey to upgrade though and the constant promises that they are not trying to sell you when they actually are is frustrating.  Other than that it is great.

review_title: I have owned timeshare for years and‚Ä¶
review_text: I have owned timeshare for years and traveled extensively.  I have made fantastic memories that I wouldn't have if I wasn't forced to go on vacation because I had already paid for it!  Diamond has many properties that are easy to exchange in to.  When I bought with Diamond, they took my week from a different company and exchanged it for Diamond points.  They took that option away after three years- which neither the sales or contracting personnel were aware that they would do.  I feel cheated and lied to by the company for that- otherwise I have enjoyed the facilities.

review_title: The Orbit One resort was nice but it‚Ä¶

review_title: Stayed at Polo Towers in Las Vegas last‚Ä¶
review_text: Stayed at Polo Towers in Las Vegas last fall experienced an excellent time. The staff and room we used were wonderful. Would quickly recommend staying at this location to anyone who asks.

review_title: I was pressured to buy the sampler‚Ä¶
review_text: I was pressured to buy the sampler package after 4 hours of pushing me to buy a timeshare with two sales associates and a manager going back and fourth grinding my head with bogus deals, and to get them off my back, i found my self falling into another trap which is buying the sampler package, which is worth nothing simply because the inventory of rooms goes first to the timeshare holders then to customers who book on line through a third party (hotel.com, etc who surprisingly offer the same room for less), and whatever is left is offered to the sampler package owners, which made me waste my points on destinations and dates that were inconvenient for me. I am discussing a class action lawsuit with other victims of this establishment.
Really clean, well managed place to stay. Great organization!

review_title: Cancun Las Vegas is a beautiful resort
review_text: Cancun Las Vegas is a beautiful resort! The people are all very friendly and helpful.  The pool is AMAZING!  The activities center is great!   Since we cook in our room a lot, it would be nice to have some more space in the kitchen, rather than feeling like you are in a closet.

review_title: Really enjoyed the time we stayed‚Ä¶
review_text: Really enjoyed the time we stayed there!Thank You

review_title: Great locations but difficult to deal with
review_text: Whilst we have had good experiences with our holidays our dealings with sales staff have always been stressful Having decided we want to sell our points we are finding Diamond unhelpful and indeed possibly obstructiveUse of high powered selling techniques which mars the timeshare experience

review_title: As a Diamond owner don't trust them.
review_text: As a Diamond owner don't trust anything the people at this resort tell you.  They will lie to your face, get everything in writing, and be suspicious of everything they say.  There is one Diamond representative at the Kaanapali Beach Club VIP check in to be careful around, on our check in she gave me one story when I discovered  the story has changed I spoke with her again and she lied right to my face, telling a different story.  At the end she just said "have a nice flight home", which tells me this is their standard operating procedure, tell one story that they know is not true and then lie when confronted.  AmEx denied their illegal charge so at least that helps.  Best to record any conversation with them.
Great at options and flexibility; but not so much in savings per investment. Many logging options are old/rusty and not updated.

review_title: I wish there was a negative star‚Ä¶
review_text: I wish there was a negative star review. I have been a member since they first started and I am trying to get rid of it. Their fees keep going up and on the last trip that I told them was for my 40th birthday, they ruined the trip. What was supposed to be a short presentation for current owners turned into 5 hours that day followed by another 2 long days of having to escalate to management. I was there for 5 days and 3 were spent dealing with them bullying me and eventually treating that I was putting my child at risk for being sued if I didn't spend over $20,000 to buy more points. I want nothing to ever do with the company ever again when they went so far as to say my child could be financially ruined if I didn't upgrade my points to their new minimum. Eventually, the manager apologized and said the salesperson just had a baby and was really tired. I don't think that is an excuse to make threats like that to make a commission. They went back after I did an exclusion trip and increase my cost and put through on my credit card on file. I had to fight with them to get them to refund the money and make it match the signed authorized amount. My timeshare is worth $35,000USD and the only way I can get out of it is to "surrender" it to them and pay $750 for the legal fees. Then they will resell the points to someone else and they keep the money. I was also told if I tried to use a timeshare resale company that they can sue me. Nice company!DO NOT BUY, YOU WILL REGRET IT!

review_title: Its a great program when the can get‚Ä¶
review_text: Its a great program when the can get someone on the phone who knows what they are talking about- instead of " sorry, we have no availability" ok, so you don't - why not offer another location- or give ideas and suggestions- you have me on the line- work it! Also, if we are owners, make us feel important from beginning to end, not just at check in. Why not offer us travel bags so that we can use when we do travel and go other places, word of mouth and FREE advertising, it could spark up a conversation about your resort. Early check in and late check in, Period!

review_title: Impossible to book anything I wish to book
review_text: my resort sold out to Diamond Resorts a couple of years ago, and since then it has been almost impossible to book anything I would like.  It has been a very disappointing change.

review_title: Love my timeshare but hate the‚Ä¶
review_text: Love my timeshare but hate the maintenance fees and how they keep rising!

review_title: Diamond Resort Gone Bad and Greedy
review_text: Monarch Grand Vacation allows day use without reservation.Diamond Resorts DOES NOT allow day use and even if you are an OWNER you have block out days.  What is that? MGVOA is better than Diamond Resorts.Diamond Resorts became very greedy and selfish to MGVOA owners.

review_title: Diamond resorts needs to wake up and‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond resorts needs to wake up and realize that long standing members are the backbone of their existence and that having a two tier system for status recognition that treats long standing members with less respect and recognition than equal portfolio incoming members is unconscionable and completely disrespectful.

review_title: I love my resort but hate Diamond
review_text: I love my resort, Los Abigados.  The people AT the resort are always great.  Dealing with Diamond, however, has been painful at best.  People on the phone are always arrogant, nasty, unpleasant, and less than helpful.  I have made complaints and written letters to management since Diamond took over this property with no response and no change in the poor manners displayed by their employees.

The resort is nice with 2 large pools, water slides and many spa tubs.  There is an indoor/outdoor restaurant onsite and lots of activities for children and adults.  The rooms are smaller than I am used to but adequate.  The only draw back is the kitchen.  There is little storage and it is very small.    The staff are very friendly and helpful.

I know mistakes happen but I wanted this straightened out before I left Honolulu and had to insist that they do so. It was resolved in the end.

I'm disappointed with availability lately.  We couldn't find an opening for our kids and granddaughter for Maui between Jan and June.  Then we couldn't get a place at Lake Tahoe for a family gathering at Thanksgiving.  We are going to a wedding in Texas in Nov. and had to pay extra for interval to get a place.  After all the money I paid, this year has left something to be desired.  Roger Lorion

review_title: Diamond Resorts is a terrible ‚Äúmanagement company‚Äù with our 14 years of ownership with Club Intrawest.
review_text: We have been a member of Club Intrawest, then Embarc, then unfortunately Diamond Resorts.  The entire experience with CI and Embarc was awesome.  Ever since Diamond Resorts took over the management of ‚Äúour ownership‚Äù, we have watched the clientele change and our favorite resort unavailable due to the ‚ÄúExpedia Crowd‚Äù.  We have over $70,000USD ‚Äúinvested‚Äù in our ownership and we want out, quickly.  If Diamond Resorts wants to satisfy us, buy us out quickly.

review_title: I love some of their properties so give‚Ä¶
review_text: I love some of their properties so give them a four for properties but as far as management and sales people 1.  That averages to 2.5.  I will go up to 3.As far as their selling techniques they are awful and have become worse. We fill out surveys and expected someone to call and follow up with us and say they were sorry about our experience.  We are almost triple platinum so have spent a lot of money with diamond. This last year in 2019 we have had two bad meetings. One in Poipu and one in Bellevue Washington.  I always fill out surveys.  At least follow up on them.  The people in Bellevue and poipu were pushy and dishonest.  I scheduled the appointment in Bellevue because I was contacted and told they had never seen someone with so many points and so many points expiring this year. They said the Bellevue meeting would have tips on how to use them. Went to Bellevue and they only spent 30 minutes on that and we were assigned a sales person who tried to sell us something we had never heard of. He was surprised we didn‚Äôt know it was a sales meeting.  Also, I signed up for a Friday and called and asked if we could come on another night and they would give us fifty dollars more to do that.  When I told the people in Bellevue they said we don‚Äôt have cards to do that. Call the person who told you that.  I did and they never sent me the card. I think the management and sales department are terrible.  I would also like to use all of annual points on a trip like to the Galapogos. I had that option two years ago but not now.  When you have 138000 points and are never thanked for having that many points just pushes to buy more like in Hawaii they said we have to make money.  We also own shell.  They are so much better than diamond. We have never been treated poorly in an update.  Also, so many properties are never available.   Or if they are, it‚Äôs not advantageous time of year.  Adjust property availability during the year. Take some inventory back for platinum members from the outside groups

review_title: Loved our stay at Diamonds Resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: Loved our stay at Diamonds Resorts Sedona Summit resort - beautiful views, clean and spacious suite - just a lovely time.

review_title: We were talked into a sampler package‚Ä¶
review_text: We were talked into a sampler package that gave all these "benefits" for two year. We literally got to use our sampler ONCE to go to the nastiest hotel in St. Louis. The salespeople don't actually tell you what's included or not included. We were promised 20,000 free points and all these extras that did not happen. I'm so thankful we only signed in for two years because this was a waste of $5,000 dollars as I have paid out of pocket for every trip since signing on with them. If I could give a zero I would since the St. Louis property looked like a motel 6. If you don't believe me, look up the old Red Lions Hotel downtown. I have better luck just using bookdirect.com. At least there, I get what I actually pay for.

review_text: Last trip was to Cabo Azul.  One of my favorite places.

review_title: We always enjoy our time there as I‚Ä¶
review_text: We always enjoy our time there as I always stay with my Mom. The last time I stayed I made it a point to ask for a remodeled room. Our stay before that had a shower with mold and mildew and our comforter was dirty. They representative I spoke with made it a point to make sure we had a great room and contact info if we had any issues
Very good spot..didn‚Äôt want to participate in any time share chat, and we were left alone, so all good!  Suite and pool were excellent!
Room was great. Parking was horrific.

review_title: Cabo Azul is our favorite resort
review_text: Cabo Azul is our favorite resort.  We have gone every January since it's opening.  Over the years we have learned how to navigate the local buses and several markets that have fresh caught seafood.  We do not eat every meal out.  The kitchens are furnished with almost every convenience for experienced cooks.  The staff at Cabo Azul are the most helpful and friendly folks we have ever experienced.  The pool service is awesome.  The restaurant under the palapa on site is our favorite dinner and lunch spot.  My only complaint is that the staff does not share the favorite eateries and markets that the locals love.  We were lucky to get the inside scoop on the open air markets and seafood markets.  This resort location is so safe.  We are never afraid to venture off the property to shop, dine or bus with the locals.
Sampler package is not what was explained at the beginning. Not easy to use and limited on where you can go. The resorts have been good, loved the one in Tahoe.
Love the Diamond Resorts. Well priced and always beautiful locations and properties.

review_title: Way too expensive and no way to get out‚Ä¶
review_text: Way too expensive and no way to get out easily. We have had many reasons to lessen the financial burdens mostly medical bills, to be able to enjoy our Diamond membership. Where is the "heart" in Diamond, or is it the "almighty dollar" that rules Diamond?

review_title: Too many levels and rules of membership
review_text: When I joined DRI it was mainly a time share organization. Since then they have developed into more vacation options and different levels of membership which is good for their business development but leaves me back at square one in terms of options available with my points. I don't need more points but it's my understanding that when I view the website for available resorts, I can only "see" a limited number of resorts because of my basic level status.

review_title: Bad agent was why didn't buy in
review_text: The agent we had to meet with in Palm Springs was beyond rude and condescending. Unfortunately, this immediately turned my husband away from us doing any type of commitment with Diamond Resorts.Most of our getaways were great and the accomodations were ideal for families however, we didn't get what we expected with our downtown Vancouver stay (perhaps a lack of communication was the issue there).
Great staff, clean excellent accommodations. Wish there was an attached restaurant even though there were restaurants within close walking distance.
Higher Maintenance fees, elevators out of service, and continual noise interference from construction seem to be guaranteed every trip to Maui.

We brought $4000 sample points, the presentation were wonderful. But by the time we need book our weeks,  so many restrictions. We ended up spending more money than we stay in hotels.  What are scams.

The units are very nice...nothing exceptional but very nice, comfortable.  The people who help you on the phone in customer service do their best to accommodate you and are very pleasant. The sales people for the most part are pleasant but not exactly truthful.  Before Diamond bought Sun Terra, we had a great time share.  We lost many benefits over the years as our fees went higher and higher.  So many things we dislike and no way to get rid of it.  We would never recommend Diamond Resorts to anyone.

review_title: This is always a winter vacation that's‚Ä¶
review_text: This is always a winter vacation that's well needed...and very relaxing from arrival to housekeeping to exiting... always looking  forward to my week
Great places to stay. Employees are great!

review_title: All of the owner ‚Äúupdates‚Äù which are‚Ä¶
review_text: All of the owner ‚Äúupdates‚Äù which are either required or you spend 20 minutes for the receptionist to try to talk you into it - dangling carrots before you. Once there, it turns into a fast paced and highly pressurized sales push. We have been to about 7 of them and will never go to another.
It was our Honeymoon, the resort was really nice. We were happily surprised to get a King size bed (I am 6‚Äô7‚Äù) I think maybe it was new because it felt a little too firm.
Have returned to Sahara  sunset club  For the past 7 years. I just live it. Clean. Large  balconies and great mattresses. Just divine.

review_title: Excellent facility in a fun town!!
review_text: The resort itself was a good time.  It was very nice and yes we will use it again.  Rooms & equipment were great.  However, if you get ‚Äúhooked‚Äù into the time-share presentations, that is a different story.  We found the the various ‚Äúline‚Äù of salesmen to be very offensive.  The high-pressure tactics made our time there a bit unpleasant!  If you can avoid it.....do!!  Luckily, it was early in our stay and were able to get over the the 2.5 hour ‚Äúgrilling‚Äù (1 hour obligation) to have a fun time.
Swindled into getting this Timeshare, that I wish to God I had NEVER bought into this nightmare !!!

review_title: The Dunes is in need of major‚Ä¶
review_text: The Dunes is in need of major renovations; the decor and furniture was totally dated.  Given the high price that goes with ownership of a timeshare, I'm curious how they accomplish sales of any vacation ownership..

review_title: Had to get a supervisor to get a better‚Ä¶
review_text: Had to get a supervisor to get a better response & action during the hurricane crisis in Florida
Youre the BEST.  I'm proud to be an owner!
Polo towers and diamond resort in Las Vegas is a very great place to stay. Convenient location, Rooftop pool access, a great place for anyone to stay

review_title: can't always stay where we would like
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Been a member for over 20 years but money needs spending on resorts to give the luxury we signed up for !
review_text: Been a member for over 20 years but the luxury is sadly fading and each time I visit pine lake resort I have to call maintenance to come and fix a problem. This time the bathroom sink was leaking and had obviously been leaking for some time. When going to the bathroom in the night we were lucky no one slipped and fell on the wet floor. Unfortunately we had maintenance for two days but they couldn't fix the problem so we were one sink down for our stay. The bathroom wasn't as clean as it could have been and we encountered small wormlike creatures which we disposed of several times. Last time they had to replace the sofa bed and you don't find out that's broken till you go to bed at midnight so not a good nights sleep. The aluminium pan had a split in it so I couldn't understand where the water was coming from all over the hob. I've had new ovens and fridges over the years. I think it's time diamond concentrated on the UK instead of USA cos not every member has the desire to go to USA on holiday and many of us like to enjoy Europe. Maintenance fees keep rising but the standards don't!

review_title: Our  room was above and beyond our‚Ä¶
review_text: Our  room was above and beyond our expectations.  The grounds were beautiful.  Absolutely loved it.

review_title: Customer service departments should all mirror the activities of these company representatives.
review_text: The two representatives that my wife and I spoke with were helpful and professional. The first one fixed one issue we had but she was in a different section of the company so she transferred us to the correct person. She didn't just hit the transfer button and hang up, she stayed online until she could confirm that we were connected to the correct person. This next person was just as personable and helpful as the first lady we talked to about our issues. She followed in the same helpful and professional manner as the first representative.I have found this to be typical of Diamond Resorts representatives with the one notable exception being the sales people for the timeshares. They are worse than the old time stereotypical used car salesmen.

review_title: Not enough staff checking people in..
review_text: Not enough staff checking people in, as usual. Always an issue! Room was nice. Outside door was rotted and patched back together. 47-B. The on site restaurant was okay this time. Usually, it‚Äôs great. Not so much this go around. Cold fries served with hot meal. Corned beef was as tough as beef Jerky. 20 minutes later, when I was full, they brought me hot fries. The breakfast was a hot mess! The poor waitress has 10 tables to wait on, and it was a mad house. It took 35 minutes just to get my check. It was bad. On the bright side. The food was hot and tasted good! Overall, this is truly a nice resort for the price you pay. I would never pay over $85 a night for it, as there are nicer, less remote, places to stay. It‚Äôs decent though.

review_title: It‚Äôs the most relaxing and enjoyable‚Ä¶
review_text: It‚Äôs the most relaxing and enjoyable experience me and my children had.

review_title: I would not recommend Diamond resorts
review_text: I would not recommend Diamond resorts. From my experience, the sales personnel are very disingenuous (which is infuriating when you are spending this much money). My wife and I purchased a vacation package based on a presentation from Waverly Palmer (who is no longer with the company). His presentation was a complete misrepresentation of what we were buying, and we found that out on our first vacation with Diamond Resorts. A very long story short, we were informed that we did not have what we believed we had purchased initially. So we spent more money, believing that we finally purchased everything that we wanted. Then, on our second vacation with Diamond Resorts, we were again informed that we still did not have what we believed we had because we did not purchase the geographical collection we were led to believe we had purchased. So again, we had to spend more money. Lastly, on our third vacation, sales personnel again attempted to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù my wife and I by lowering an interest rate on a loan we have with Diamond Resorts. In order to do that thought, I would have to spend even more money, pay double the amount that I was paying monthly for six months, then after six months the payment would be four dollars less than the initial payment. My wife and I don‚Äôt need Diamond‚Äôs ‚Äúhelp‚Äù. Our last vacation was by far the best because we ignored all of the ‚Äúfree gifts‚Äù from the sales personnel that comes with a lengthy sales presentation that ruins the vacation experience. If you want to purchase through Diamond Resorts, read the details of what you are buying for yourself and ask the representative to answer your questions. Do not allow them to tell you what you are buying. The point system is a good product, but be very clear on how much you plan to vacation through Diamond, and only buy the necessary amount of points for that goal. And remember, do not accept any free gifts from any sales person. Only increase your points or membership level when YOU NEED TO.

review_title: We can never get booked where we want‚Ä¶
review_text: We can never get booked where we want to go!!

review_title: Resorts we go to are wonderful but are‚Ä¶clumsy administrators!
review_text: Resorts we go to are wonderful but are often difficult to get a reservation when we want it. Most of my frustrations are with the administration. Went through a period of time earlier this year every time I phoned in we were flagged as owing money. A half hour of our time and financials was waisted while they verified that this was an error. I was very angry by the third time when I tried to book a cruise. After all the back and forth, we ended up booked on the wrong ship! The British accent made it difficult to distinguish Niue Stanserdam  from Niue Amsterdam. No problem to fix but the one we wanted was incorrectly advertised, sailed on a different date and was full! Decided to stay with one booked but final confirmation gave a different itinerary than advertised and not at all to our liking! This was not the only ‚Äúfumble‚Äù more to come. Seems we could not get a correct booking, or mess ups with financial dept continue.

review_title: Not trusted They fooled me and deceived‚Ä¶
review_text: Not trusted They fooled me and deceived me.

review_title: We enjoy our time at Diamond Resorts
review_text: We enjoy our time at Diamond Resorts.  The rooms are spacious and clean and we love the amenities each property offers.
We had a great time, as always.  Lake Tahoe Vacation Resort is our favorite. No complaints.

review_title: Cannot find rooms where we want them‚Ä¶
review_text: Cannot find rooms where we want them even while searching 13 months out.

review_title: My representative helped maximize my points
review_text: My representative helped me book my vacation by using as few points as possible by helping me use benefits I wasn‚Äôt aware of. Thank you!
Our unit needs paint, there are scratches on the wall. The front curtains won‚Äôt close and open smoothly. However the front desk staff are Excellent!
The room was large as was the pool area.  The room was nice.   This resort is nice but medium quality as compared to others.  No beach.  Constant time share sales tactics.

review_title: We have stayed at Diamond Resorts a‚Ä¶
review_text: We have stayed at Diamond Resorts a couple of times. In both cases, the resorts were in a great location (close to many activities). First vacation was at Hilton Head. We were there in November, and the weather was fabulous. Second vacation was in Old Town Kissimmee at Halloween. We went to Universal Studios for 2 days, and spent the rest of the week enjoying the beautiful weather and trying some of the areas dining choices. In both cases, the condos were provided amply with dishes and silverware. The furniture was a bit dated and not very comfortable.

review_title: Very hard to get a helpful person to‚Ä¶
review_text: Very hard to get a helpful person to talk to.

We bought into Diamond Resorts several years ago.  We have a 1 br.  We were told the unit were being upgraded many times.  Nothing has changed since we bought into the resort.  The units need serious  attention and upgrading to be brought up to the standards of other resorts in the area.  The Lobby also need some serious attention.  As I said earlier, nothing has changed since we have owned our unit. Also, the dining areas need some serious attention.  You have to leave the resort in order to have a decent meal.
IGNORE TEXT

Just saying. Many of the Diamond properties are wonderful to vacation at. Diamond pressure to buy timeshare has been greatly  reduced compared to what it was which is greatly appreciated.   The negative with Diamond is that maitenence fees. They are very high making properties expensive to stay at and often there is no availablity using my points. Yet I can find availability with Diamond resorts and hotels.  There cancelation policy needs to be changed.  Why not return ALL points if you cancel 15 - 30 days before travel.  The graduated point cancellation policy is a loose loose proposition.

review_title: Good resorts but changes are needed
review_text: The resorts are well maintained and in good locations. The maintenance fees have gotten too high. The sales people at the presentations have lied to us multiple times, so I cannot recommend Diamond
It was very good to stay.

The property was beautiful & clean.  However, my granddaughter left a new Mickey Mouse hoodie in the room.  I called the day we arrived home, Nov. 11, 2018 to inquire.  Was told it hadn't been turned in - the employee was to check w/the maids & call back.  She did not.  I was also told I had to go online to file a report.  I did.  No response.  Nothing.  My granddaughter was heartbroken, & her mom was out over $50 for the hoodie.  Your resort needs followup, & the website does as well.  Very disappointing in lack of follow up customer service. This is the only communication I've received from Diamond since last Nov.

review_title: I love this place very clean
review_text: I love this place very clean. You feel like home. Employees very professionals.
Great location on Vegas Blvd. we love the rooms and how they feel like a comfortable apt away from home.
Great show, great food.
Desert Paradise Resort was great, staff was helpful too. Location was not too far from strip.

review_title: We have stayed at The Rivera Resort at‚Ä¶
review_text: We have stayed at The Rivera Resort at San Diego Estates in Ramona CA. Very nice place and the staff has always been helpful.

review_title: Whistler is a 3 star property but‚Ä¶
review_text: Whistler is a 3 star property but location and facilities make it 4 stars. It is a good resort at reasonable price. Excellent that families have their own pool so adults only can relax.

review_title: Our family has had many good times.
review_text: Our family has had many Vacation with Diamonds Property‚Äôs. Our recent stay at The Modern hotel in Hawaii Was outstanding.

review_title: Amazing properties with lots to do for‚Ä¶
review_text: Amazing properties with lots to do for the family.  We have never been disappointed at all!
The resorts are very nice, but customer service has been less than stellar.

The outside of the hotel was beautiful. The inside was very dated. After about 20 minutes of arriving in the room we were greeted by two roaches. A few days later while walking past another room, I saw two men who had these large containers that looked like the containers an exterminator would use, talking about bed bugs. We had to attend a meeting to discuss our time share. I felt like I had to contend with the sales team. They were too much and wouldn‚Äôt except the word ‚ÄúNO‚Äù. I spent almost 4 hours listening to why,  the time share we had, wasn‚Äôt the right one for us. This was my 25th wedding anniversary and I can honestly say, I didn‚Äôt enjoy my stay at the Royal Kona Resort. The staff were friendly but the over all decor was horrible. I would never come back or recommend this place to anyone.

review_title: We would not buy the full time share‚Ä¶
review_text: We would not buy the full time share points package, based on our sampler experience.  Much too costly and not full of value considering booking places and packages from various carriers can be less expensive, and more accommodating to your time frames.  The accommodations were good, but booking flights alone added much more expense, whereas booking accommodations and fights together in some cases would have actually been equal to flights alone.  Sales pitch wasnt quite honest as club connect options were more expensive than we were told, and availability had to be booked far in advance.

review_title: My wife and I and sometimes one of our‚Ä¶
review_text: My wife and I and sometimes one of our daughters as well have visited Grande Villas approx 6 times over the years.We have nothing but praise for the establishment and staff and hope to visit again in November.Lind and Graham LinforthYorkshireEngland
Love this place.. both staff and accommodation are brilliant.
Excellent service and accommodations, overall a most rewarding fun and relaxing vacation with the whole family!

review_title: If I could give a zero
review_text: If I could give a zero, I would have. ALL timeshares are not worth the money and monthly fees. They just don't add up, yet some how they make you believe it.

Review of Diamonds Villas de Santa Fe. Excellent location with easy on and off of most freeways in and out of Santa Fe and walking distance to Plaza and other attractions. Free shuttle to for guests with pickup services around Santa Fe. Well maintained with pool, library, pool table room, free washer/dryers and relaxing library.  Being older building there is some noise from halls and rooms above you (we were on first floor) but generally quiet at night. Definitely will return.
I absolutely hate Diamond, I wish we had never purchased points in this POS company.

review_title: I have enjoyed my membership with Diamond
review_text: I have enjoyed my membership with Diamond.  The resorts are always high quality and guarantee a level of comfort knowing the quality will be superb.  I think every effort continues to be made to keep maintenance fees reasonable and as little increase as necessary to continue to uphold the standards.  Every effort needs to be made to ensure owners stay up to date but without additional points pressure.  No means no!

review_title: Still cannot sign in ontine or figure‚Ä¶
review_text: Still cannot sign in ontine or figure out how to use our points.  Everytime I talk to someone it costs me more money!

Our recent purchase, and subsequent cancellation, was due to inaccurate information by the sales person. We had already purchased recently to get to platinum level and still have an outstanding loan. We were told our current finance rate was 19.9% and because we have excellent credit was told we could save over 6% if we refinanced. However we had to make a minimum purchase to do so. Some how 4000 points was the number shown us and we were told we‚Äôd save over $18000 on interest and our payment wouldn‚Äôt go up much. We asked a couple of questions and a manager was brought in, which seems to be the tactic of confusion to get your attention on something else. Long story short? We were there as the first leg of a Diamond Dream Holiday and leaving on the cruise 2 days later. But I had a bad feeling that the info given us wasn‚Äôt correct. I found a computer and logged into our account and found that our current interest rate was 12.9 not 19.9 that the salesman told us. So we were actually increasing our new rate to 13.9. Also the payment wasn‚Äôt close it actually was going up nearly $200 month. Also the only reason we went to the update was because it was presented to us as a meet & greet with other Diamond Dream Holiday travelers that would be on the same cruise with us. The Luau was fun but we met only one couple going on the cruise. Most weren‚Äôt on the Dream Holiday at all, and the sales presentation was exactly that and not a lunch meet & greet like we were told. Basically we‚Äôre so frustrated of promises that are actually untruths and will not be attending any updates in the future.
Hotel entrance had some oily residue on the floor that's one of my guests slipped and fell on so we ended up spending the better part of a vacation in and out of the hospital

review_title: Nice But It Does Have Issues
review_text: We put out a trash bag in the morning and when we got back it was not picked up and the win had blown hard enough to scatter the trash.This was not good.  Plus our bathroom always smelled as  if it was being used. And the waste of water waiting for the hot to get hot.  Terrible.  I live in Cali where water is precious.

review_title: We purchased a sampler package to try‚Ä¶
review_text: We purchased a sampler package to try the product out, we were never told that there were so many loop holes before you can use your points. On our first trip to Orlando we were told we had to attend a 60-90 minute meeting or we would be responsible for paying full price for our stay ( what happened to our points?). We were keptnin that meeting all morning and past lunch, when I told them I was diabetic, they bought me lunch and continue the pressure sale tactics. I was tired and overwhelmed, I ended giving in and bought yet another package. I was told that the 18,000 Sampler points would still be available to use however, the loop holes were still there and we had not been able to use them. Getting someone on the phone that can actually help you is a real joke. We bought a ‚Äú New Member Orientation‚Äù and we we‚Äôre told we could not book it for 8 months ( we made that extra purchase so that we could learn how to use this product); after ‚Äú8 months‚Äù we have now been allowed to access our new member orientation which we paid for in January.In conclusion, our experience has been frustrating and unpleasant to say the least, the worst part about this is that we are locked in for ten years!!

review_title: The Waters Edge in the Ucluelet.
review_text: We stayed 7 nights the last week in August. Loved the accommodation, the view over the bay, location in the Ucluelet, the restaurants were all very good, we had amazing 20+ weather in the day and would come again.

The property is beautiful but it's not worth being roped into a high-pressure sales presentation. We spent the first half of our day there dealing with it, way longer than what we were told to expect.

review_title: This company takes advantage of seniors.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

This experience started out being a nightmare. We were told we‚Äôd receive an email the week before our rental date with instructions concerning the house rental. After receiving no such email, I started calling Diamond Resorts. Every time I reached someone they‚Äôd tell me a message had been sent to the Department that handled the rentals and I‚Äôd receive a call within the hour. After 3 days of calling and no communication we were now down to the day of the rental with no info. I called again in desperation and got hold of an agent who took her job seriously. She assured me she would call the department and would keep me on the phone while she made sure this was handled, and that she did.  I was sent an email almost immediately after she took care of business. It‚Äôs a shame that it took 3-4 days and talking to endless agents to finally get one that did her job. We had friends meeting us there and this situation had me so stressed out it just ruined our trip. I received instructions 3 hours before we were to pick up keys to the property. The property met our needs with four bedrooms and 3 bathrooms but was not the quality I expected from Diamond Resorts and definitely not worth the points we had to use. The master bedroom had metal blinds that were bent and broken. While using the washer/dryer, I leaned over the railing to yell downstairs and it was full of dust. The cleaning crew did bathrooms and changed beds but that was all. There were several things in the house that needed attention. All in all it looked like a rental that had been neglected. Not the caliber I expected from Diamond Resorts. It was very embarrassing to have our friends comment on the state of the house and Diamond Resorts. Very disappointing outcome all the way around

Facilities and resort workers are great. Not so much some of the sales staff
Excellent hotel. Very friendly helpful staff.We had the best time

review_title: The room was extra large and‚Ä¶
review_text: The room was extra large and comfortable. All furnishings were on the new side except the couch which has seen it's day.  Kitchen well supplied.  We were on the non-pool side and was very quite.
Lots of amenities, and great for families, very clean and staff are accommodating.the only reason I'm not giving it a 5 star is the rooms are slightly dated

review_text: Customer service rep seemed annoyed by our questions and call.

review_title: Put the money in the property
review_text: Diamond is probably one of the worst in maintenance fees, gauging their owners and always wanting the owners to buy more points so they can get more fees.  They really don‚Äôt appreciate their owner even when they can get them to purchase sampler points.  You‚Äôre not treated as an owner when you use the sampler points as you don‚Äôt get the owner perks.  I keep hearing that they‚Äôre going to quit offering sampler points to owners every since I became an owner, but the last thing before you get out the door is would you be interested in purchasing a sampler.  All places want you to buy, but others put pressure on you to buy and when you don‚Äôt they either get rude or leave rudely.  Most places are getting where they don‚Äôt provide enough toiletries (soap) for your stay,  Furnishing and carpet are becoming worn or stained, couches are not comfortable where the cushions slide outward.  I own another resort and it‚Äôs maintenance fees are only 2/3s of Diamond and their facilities are better maintained and furnished, maintaining a 4 or 5 star rating.  They don‚Äôt pressure their owners to do updates and buy, buy, buy.

review_title: Had no success with pending requests‚Ä¶
review_text: Had no success with pending requests and no feedback from customer services. Can't book into prime USA resorts e.g Key West. Cruises becoming less available with full points. What happened to Norwegian cruises line who are owned by the same parent company? Staff on sites are doing a very good job and are always helpful. The problem is senior management who promise and do not deliver. I would not recommend becoming a platinum member as no significant benefits.Leonard and Katherine Jamieson

These are our preferred apartments when we stay In Benalmadena. They are clean, full equipped, serviced and very central for everything we like to do. We stayed here when we got married and quite a few anniversaries since. We are going back in November and possibly in January as well. They are slightly more expensive than others but offer so much more in facilities and comfort

review_title: I made a reservation for 2020 with 2020‚Ä¶
review_text: I made a reservation for 2020 with 2020 points. Then wanted to make a second reservation using 2019 and 2020 points. Called customer service for second reservation and was told that I had to have my 2020 dues fully paid before I could make the second reservation. I told them that I had reserved in 2020 with my first reservation. Explanation was, It must have been a glitch.The thing is, I'm enrolled in SurePay where I automatically pay my dues for 2020 on a monthly basis.What's up with that?

Customer service is the problem.  Need to get people that know what they are talking about and show they really care.  I had to fight to get reservations done as the individuals I talked to on the phone had no idea what they were talking about.

Reserved a year ago an 3 bedrooms condo for golfing while grand-kids were at Disney. 2 weeks prior arrival found out that access to the golf was refused because owner was not a membre. Even if we were on the golf and with more and less 10 to 20 golfers a day, we were unable to buy green fees. On top if that, condo is very dirty, carpets have stains, sofa are dirty and finish. Dishes with cracks and no services even if we stayed 3 weeks. If you want to have access to golf, tennis, water park you better rent it directly with Reunion Resort and it will be cheaper too then Luxury Home Exchange. This was not a luxury but lower standard condo. Try to received help from Diamonds and they refused to give any refound, change for another condo with access to golf, terrible service for members.

Stayed at Embarc Vancouver.  Fantastic spot, view.  Could see that there is a transition to Diamond Resorts.  We were given keys and walked into a room that was not cleaned yet.  Had to come back an hour later.  New person at desk for Diamond and did not know the property well.  Gave us inaccurate information about the property.  Once room was made, no disappointment.

review_title: Staff are 5 Star+ but standards have dropped.
review_text: Many years ago, when we bought into the ‚Äòtimeshare dream‚Äô, we were sold the concept on (a) quality (b) value for money (c) exclusivity...  in other words, the only way that you could stay at a Dimond Resorts ‚Äòresort‚Äô, was by being a member or guest of the system. Fast forward to the present day, and whilst we still pay our annual fees to be members, the ‚Äòexclusivity‚Äô element has been removed, as Diamond Resorts, now operate as a ‚Äòhotelier‚Äô, and allow the general public to book into the accommodation. Now I know that this is already sounding a bit ‚Äòelitist‚Äô or a touch of ‚Äòsnobbery‚Äô creeping in, I get that, but we paid a lot of money, so that two weeks a year, we could be a bit ‚Äòelitist‚Äô, we could break away from our normal lifestyle, and enjoy a family holiday, knowing that the location, and accommodation, were extra special.. I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs snobbery, we all like to stay at a ‚Äònice hotel‚Äô.So as a ‚Äòtimeshare owner‚Äô, you get sold into the whole ‚Äòyou own part of this‚Äô mindset, and with ‚Äòownership‚Äô, I believe comes ‚Äòcare‚Äô, you care for the property and the accommodation, as if its your own, you treat it with respect, and you keep it clean and tidy.. trust me on this, you do not get housekeeping everyday, like you would in a hotel, in fact you have your own ‚Äòvacuum cleaner‚Äô in a lot of locations, so that you can do your own housework.Now it seem that ‚Äòdrunken karaoke‚Äô and even, I‚Äôm not going to use the word pervert here as that would be unjustified, but in 2017, we did find that a single man in a connecting unit, was using his mobile phone, to peer into out accommodation, using the gap beneath the connecting door, a situation that was resolved using a bath towel, and I‚Äôm happy to say, that on our return in 2018, we noticed that the issue had been addressed.This review was asked of ‚ÄòDiamond Resorts‚Äô, not a ‚Äòspecific location‚Äô, which makes it slightly harder and I guess, that makes me slightly more biased in my ‚Äòopinion‚Äô,as I‚Äôm sure, you are reading this, as someone looking to book into a ‚Äòhotel‚Äô as opposed to a ‚Äòtimeshare owner‚Äô... on that front, the staff at all the locations we have used, are beyond 5 stars, quite simply, the best of the best and then some, but the standard of the Resorts has dropped, noticeably over the years, that‚Äôs not to say that you will be staying in squalor, far from it, but ripped fabric, broken fridges, electrical sockets not secured to walls, these all seem like issues you would have at a 2 star motel, not an ‚Äòindustry leading organisation‚Äô who‚Äôs goal it is to ensure your complete relaxation whilst on vacation.So I guess what I‚Äôm trying to say here is this, you wont be disappointed staying at one of the resorts, but if you do find issues, report them, ultimately, the resorts have to answer to us, the members when things go wrong, and we have in the past, taken action to ensure things were put right. On the other hand, staying at ‚Äòour‚Äô resorts aren‚Äôt cheap, and we have found ourselves looking at other ‚Äòhotels‚Äô and thinking, for the same money we spend on annual fees, we could be staying somewhere much better.The bottom line here is quite simple (a) are you happy to spend time in a little hotel room, with basic amenities or (b) do you want lots of space, and all the comforts of home.. if (a) then any hotel room in the world, otherwise a ‚ÄòDiamond Resorts‚Äô resort, wont disappoint you.Hope this helps.

Location was great, accommodation was perfect, well kept grounds, nice and peaceful.  Only let down was the scabby bar in the middle of the pool.  Rude, unhelpful staff - no idea why they have the contract at all!
Our stay was absolutely perfect.  Staff very attentive to guest needs.  Loved all the activities and that there was a variety for adults, teens and younger kids.

review_title: High pressure sales just like the other‚Ä¶
review_text: High pressure sales just like the other time share companies even though they say they are different.

review_title: The treatment received by staff on the‚Ä¶
review_text: The treatment received by staff on the days after check-in was not adequate.

I signed up for this, as I walked away my salesman had my fiance sign the contract as well. My fiance and I broke up. Months after when I went to go use the service for the first time, they told me that I can't use this unless she's present. I asked to have her removed as I'm the one paying and my credit was the one associated with the account. They told me I have to pay the entire loan amount first if I want to remove her. They lost my business. I was looking at purchasing the full program if all went well after this sampler.

review_title: Life is unpredictable. Eat dessert first.
review_text: The resorts are wonderful. The access to luxury hotels and houses ads a destination flexibility that is incredible. Luxury cruises make anywhere in the world reachable. Using points for rental cars and flights is very convenient.The only improvement I can imagine is to allow a way to recover equity once we are no longer able to use the wonderful product.

review_title: I would not recommend buying into this‚Ä¶
review_text: I would not recommend buying into this pyramid scam!  We purchased a sampler first, and thank God we did!  First of all the sampler is also a sales scam, but when we stayed at one of the 20 hotels you may stay at, the other people there were less than desirable.  Then you have to go to another hard sell to get you to convert, and its like a pump and dump boiler room on Wall Street.  Nope....I wouldn't recommend it, and I'll  bite my lip and stay at their resorts long enough to get my 4K back.

review_title: I've been in hotels that were just as‚Ä¶
review_text: I've been in hotels that were just as nice and just as clean, not having to pay high annual fees.
Diamond resorts has given us so many great times to remember.

review_text: We had so much fun! Loved the condo. The only thing we didn't like was the water at the indoor pool was FREEZING cold. Way too cold to enjoy
