The place was perfect, the were 20 of us traveling.  The accommodations worked out perfectly and wer had a fantastic trip.  We love the lock off rooms,  offers privacy, yet you can still be part of the group.
You ripped us off for 4600.00 . 20,000 points and 2 nights stay you charged us 641.00 . Enjoy my money cause karma is a -----. Have a great day!!!

Great place to relax, rejuvenate, and spend time with the family. The Cove is quiet, clean, and safe, and the staff couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful and welcoming. I spent a month there in 2019, and have already booked for summer 2020!

Most housekeepers don't speak English and they never have both hand towels and wash clothes. The self parking is terrible and not very lit up at night. we don't feel safe walking from parking lot to Polo

review_title: A great place to stay with wonderful‚Ä¶
review_text: A great place to stay with wonderful facilities.

I first gave Virginia Beach Club one star which designates BAD, which it was.  Poor describes the overall management which is not in keeping with most Diamond Resorts.  Despite it being the height of tourist season, there is no excuse for filthy rooms.  The entrance  of the facility needs to be redone for better flow of traffic, monitored better, or verbally explained at check in if one parks in the adjacent garage.  It would have been easier, quicker, and less stressful to walk our luggage in two trips rather than get caught up in a 30 minute traffic jam 100 feet from the exit!!

review_title: Excellent Customer Service and Excellent Resort Stays
review_text: Our latest experience with Diamond reservations agent Yadira T. was been wonderful. She is very polite, professional and answered all of our questions. Followed through on our reservation when we had to make a change and was always pleasant, making our experience stress free. Thank you.Our last resort visit was at Cabo Azul and it is a very beautiful resort, very clean and comfortable. The suite we had was beautiful, with an ocean view, clean and quiet. Exceptional service from the staff, excellent food and drinks. Great service at the front desk with help from getting a taxi or dinner reservations. We would highly recommend this resort!
great accommodations. we felt confused after every sales meeting. each one seem to have different amount and packages.

review_title: I cannot find any reasonable 1 or 2‚Ä¶
review_text: I cannot find any reasonable 1 or 2 bedroom units to rent very often.

Never know who to believe......Marketing has an agenda to scare you into buying & not being truthful about holding our price per point when we attended.  Again.....never know who to believe.  It is frustrating.

Unless you like being mistreated by tenured staff, including male front desk staff and the maintenance staff......I would never recommend the Marquis Villas. Think of your worst nightmares...and a bad horror movie....oh and look for the stained carpets in the hallways....as a bonus.  Diamond Resorts has great properties...upper management should investigate starting with my experience.  Not fair to Diamond!

Diamond Resorts have been improving over the years as far as accommodation keep in mind some of the resorts need a lot more attention than others. I am hoping that the bathrooms get a update most of the resorts have only 1 sink & the counters are to low.

Booking is so easy and if you have any special requirements as I do they have always been accommodating. The telephone customer services and resort staff are so friendly and seem to make the extra effort that makes a break so relaxing. The varying accommodation that we have stayed in are clean, well maintained and well fitted out and ideal for a family and/or friends breakWe hope to go back again soon.

We stayed at Palm Canyon in Palm Springs and The Summit in Sedona. Both properties were beautiful. It would be wonderful to have adult only pools at each resort for guests who want a relaxing rather than noisy pool experience. There was no escaping noisy, loud children at the pools at all hours. Or maybe consider having specific family or adult (over 21) hours posted in order to share pool time throughout the day.Thank you.

Diamond Resorts can be a very good investment but there are too many restrictions such as purchasing airline tickets with 100% points only prior to March if gold member. Many resorts are booked with no availability. You have to roll over your extra points by certain months or you lose them.  My experience has been good but could be better with less restrictions as mentioned above.
Great time in Washington DC.  Will definitely come back.

review_title: We  To mystic  Dunes this summer and‚Ä¶
review_text: We  To mystic  Dunes this summer and had a very nice diamond dream holiday. While we were there we spoke to Farah Ace. She was great and showed us some ways we can get some more vacations under  The belt. If you can afford it I highly recommend  It offers you a lot of different things that you just don't get at the basic levels. You gotta have money though otherwise this stuff is pricey. I was reading some people who were griping about the expense. Saver so broken made so many badd decisions why were they on vacation in the 1st . Anyway I really like that property. Now I'm platinum and I'm super happy.

review_title: They repeatedly tell us our account is‚Ä¶
review_text: They repeatedly tell us our account is ‚Äúmessed up‚Äù, but if you just spend 10s if thousands of dollars we will fix it. Making reservations is difficult. Anytime you have to call plan on being on the phone for several hours.I feel like a fool for ever spending any money with these people

We are always told something different no matter who is trying to sell us points. We are at the point of selling it all. Different story different vacay. When trying to resolve issues no one is able to help us out. Again, different story every. Single. Time. I do not recommend getting involved. Their vacations are nice, but not worth the trouble before you you leave.

Embarc Whistler is a beautiful property located in the Upper Village in Whistler.  Just steps from your door you are at the walking/biking/skiing trails to Lost Lake and beyond. The studio unit is comfortable and has a large sliding door to let in the fresh air. The adult pool area is equipped with a gym and steam room. The large trees around the property provide an excellent backdrop for Embarc.
Working hard to upgrade each facility.

review_title: Resort has taken a turn for the worse
review_text: Housekeeping was horrible. WiFi was seriously a download speed of .6mb. We called the first night because we had no soap, shampoo or anything. They were incredibly rude and basically said fine we will bring you some but it will be 20 min. I called after 30 and they finally showed up. The room was horribly maintained. Broken tiles in the bathroom, stains in the toilet, hair on the walls of the shower, overall just disgusting. We spoke to the front desk who apologized and explained that they would let the maintenance and housekeeping companies know as they are outsourced. When we came home on the second day one of the housekeepers we outside the building screaming at someone on the phone. This used to be a nice resort.
VERY hospitalble at this resort. One thing Is missing is a continental breakfast. They cleaned the room VERY well also

review_title: We stay at the polo towers in Las‚Ä¶
review_text: We stay at the polo towers in Las Vegas.   Best place.  From the rooftop pool area, you can see the bellagio fountains, and cook a great dinner on the grills.  We took our employee last year.  She had the time of her life.  We created another Vegas junkie.  Haha
Love the resort. Very kid friendly.

review_title: Be very wary of Diamond sales tactics
review_text: Diamond sales staff have been trained to tell half truths, make false statements and promises just to sell points. I spoke about this to a customer service representative and was told that my experience is not company policy. I have no real evidence other than my own notes and what my wife and I were told--sales staff make sure we do not walk away with anything in writing that they promised. I have even been told to not share some of what they told me to QA. This happened 2 times--once in Virginia City and another time in Las Vegas--so, you cannot tell me this was an unfortunate fluke.

review_title: We have been lied to and pressured at‚Ä¶
review_text: We have been lied to and pressured at every meeting we attended.  They force you to attend and then you can't leave for the pressure.  I would never recommend Diamond Resorts to anyone.  I wish we had never been suckered in by them.

review_title: I DONT FEEL LIKE YOU CARE ABOUT OWNERS‚Ä¶
review_text: I DONT FEEL LIKE YOU CARE ABOUT OWNERS AFTER THEY HAVE PURCHASED TIME.  EVERYTIME I GO TO AN OWNERS UPDATE THE ONLY WAY TO GET ANY NEW PERKS IS TO BUY MORE TIME. I FEEL I SHOULD GET THAT FOR BEING AN OWNER ALREADY.  THE TIMES I HAVE ASKED ABOUT SELLING MY TIME BACK IF I GET IN FINANCIAL TROUBLE THEY BASICLY TELL ME I AM SCREWED AND I DONT CARE FOR THAT.
Nice company to deal with - no hassle booking.  Friendly employees.
Great facilities in a wonderful town.

Ms.  McCoy was very helpful in setting up our stay at Branson for Sept.19-23.  She explained what we would have to stay in and gave us some other suggestions as to where we could use the remainder of our points we had to use before the end of the year.
Had a great time. Place was wonderful. Staff was very nice and very helpful. We stayed in Oak Creek near Sedona, the scenery was breathtaking. We would love to return someday.

The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the living room furniture is rather uncomfortable.  Bed is great, units are always clean and inviting.  We stay here every time we visit Branson, MO, 2-3 times per year.

review_title: RUN, don‚Äôt walk, AWAY from Diamond Resorts
review_text: They bought out our old timeshare company. Annual dues have more than tripled. Ability to book anything has dropped to near zero. I hate Diamond Resorts.

review_title: The facilities we stayed at are‚Ä¶
review_text: The facilities we stayed at are generally top notch, however, most of them are clustered in the southern third of the US.  We would like to do some Summer/Fall vacations in other places but the selections are few.  We have been owners for over 5 years but they also like to spoil your mood on vacation by their unrelenting sales pitch (don't ever believe 1 hour) to buy more and more points with an ever-changing price, like a used car salesman. They bombard you with all kinds of figures to show how much money you will save buying more points.  But it is all bogus for the way we like to vacation.  We don't care about their 5 pools and rec rooms and such because usually it is just a place to sleep.  We have places to go and things to do during the day.

We are Diamond owners and have stayed at Mystic Dunes in the past. The resort is very convenient to Disney and Orlando‚Äôs other attractions. Everything was pleasant, the grounds, pools, rooms and the bed was comfortable. Three things that made the short stay not perfect could be easily remedied. The WiFi signal was basically nonexistent, the safe wouldn‚Äôt function and though the kitchen was well equipped, there were no paper towels. (just an empty paper towel rack)

We have enjoyed many Diamond and Diamond affiliate resorts over the past 8 years of membership. We love to travel to different places throughout the US  and Hawaiian collections. We have had mostly positive experiences with the amenities and the Diamond personnel and staff. Timeshares aren't for everyone but we are enjoying our membership and the other members we meet on our various trips. Haven't had the best experiences with the Diamond sales staff and have felt deceived on many occasions when we were promised an update only to help us maximize our ownership and promised it would not be a sales pitch but of course it always is. Some frustration with the website as well.The best Diamond resort by far is Cabo Azul. Excellent facilities and excellent staff!

Not happy with Diamond!!! I enjoyed my trip BUT had to go to a sales meeting. Was totally lied to and tricked into buying more points. Went back next morning to cancel and was now told it was taken care of but now I‚Äôm getting bills for $4000. And a credit card was opened and 2 charges were put on it!!!! Totally SCREWED by Diamonds sales rip off people and NO one will help us get out of it! We don‚Äôt even use all the points we have now we NEVER would have bought more!!!!Anyone want to buy my timeshare?????Don‚Äôt go to any of their updates or sales meetings they‚Äôll screw you!!!!!!

The Powhatan resort is wonderful. The staff is helpful and caring. They seem to be constantly working to keep the grounds beautiful.

review_title: my experience at the golf resort in‚Ä¶
review_text: my experience at the golf resort in Sedona, AZ was pleasant.  I didn't give 5 stars as there are too many solicitations upon my arrival to buy time share.

Enjoy my stay every time. They try their best to accommodate room requests. Every once in awhile I will get a moldy shower curtain or dirty bed sheet or forgot condiment in the fridge from the previous guest. Some rooms are missing decorations and never get replaced. The pool is amazing and the remodel looks great!

review_title: We had a lot of fun
review_text: We had a lot of fun!  The place we stayed in was clean and perfect for the relaxing night we spent.

review_title: Liki Tiki is the best resort in Orlando‚Ä¶
review_text: Liki Tiki is the best resort in Orlando Florida

Sofa bed was out and cushions were laying on the floor upon arrival. Had to put it back together myself. Was told it was in need of repair but no one ever came. Toilet paper holder fell apart during the stay.

review_title: The Hotel in Saint Louis was not really‚Ä¶
review_text: The Hotel in Saint Louis was not really up to standards. The room was very nice, but there was no coffee maker or microwave.  I feel for the price there should of been more amenities. The staff was very friendly. We had to go out for every meal.

Having visited ten of their European resorts including the UK in the last two years  I can honestly say that my experience has been fantastic on every occasion. From the ease of their friendly check in's, the cleanliness of all the accommodations to the whole experience of staying in a luxury resort it just gets better and better on every visit which is why we keep going back time and time again.

review_title: I cannot recommend Diamond to anybody I‚Ä¶my huge mistake
review_text: I cannot recommend Diamond to anybody I know, and that is so bad after being a owner for 12 or more years.  Run and don‚Äôt look back

review_title: Very nice resorts and super friendly‚Ä¶
review_text: Very nice resorts and super friendly staff !Always feel at home.Always have activitiesThe grandchildren love Liki Tili!

I am increasingly getting disappointed with Diamond Resorts. First and foremost, 100% of our experiences start with Extremely Friendly staff, but in the end if we dont want to succumb to the pressure of spending more money, they turn RUDE, and then purposely extend the time it takes to exit. Secondly, and probably most important, is the availability of resorts to visit. We live in Washington State and there is absolutely nothing here, Oregon,, Idaho, Utah, - yes, there are affiliates, but never any availability. We have extended family and it costs quite abit to haul everyone on a plane to Hawaii or the East Coast.And seriously, how many times can a family  go to Arizona?

We were told upon. Arrival that we could not use amenities sent in writing. Difficult to contact. Staff for Assistance. None on site. We did like location and relax settings.  We were however mislead by offer sent in writing.  WE HAVE NOT HAD ANY RESPONSE TO OUR CONCERNS FROM PINEHURST  GOLF RESORT.

review_title: Not as good as it used to be
review_text: I've been a Diamond member (Platinum) for 10 years now.  While Diamond continues to add new benefits, few of them are of interest to me.  I find it increasingly difficult to book weeks in Hawaii during the periods I've always vacationed there, with only a typical hotel on Oahu or the Big Island, and limited choices on Maui and Kauai.  I really wish new behind Diamond would focus their efforts on the great timeshare accommodations for which I joined, rather than the peripheral "deals" they seem to be pushing now.

review_title: Santa Barbara Golf and Ocean Club
review_text: Santa Barbara Golf and Ocean Club, Tenerife - fantastic place to stay
Great experience, comfort and service!  Thank you!

review_title: I would give  Diamond resorts 0 stars‚Ä¶
review_text: I would give  Diamond resorts 0 stars but my only option is 1 through 50 do not attempt to deal with diamond resorts they are crooks liars and try to get you any way they can  They bamboozled me Into signing a contract and never told me about the rescission.  When I tried to contact the CEO or anybody above the sales rep I was rerouted until I could not resend the contract and was tricked into getting a credit card in my name which I told the sales rep no repeatedly several times
I changed from Interval International to Diamond Exchange.  What a mistake!  The selections of timeshares were very limited.  I went back to Interval.
Very nice resort with all the amenities.  Would be nice to have one cleaning for a short stay but other than that was great.  Nice family place.

review_title: Over 12 plus years I have had very good‚Ä¶John Vocker
review_text: Over 12 plus years I have had very good experiences with Diamond.  Very courteous staff when making reservations.

review_title: For what I have its perfect
review_text: For what I have its perfect. Just avoid the pesky owner update sale BS.  The resorts and staff are fantastic

Towels are inadequate, 1 * in reality, but resort is nice and if I compare an Embarc Resort of which am a member, and this one, it is definitely a Star below.It is however a nice resort with helpfull staff and I think is more a matter of positioning themselves as a higher end 3 star.

review_title: I have been a Diamond member since they‚Ä¶took over from Sunterra.
review_text: I have been a Diamond member since they took over Sunterra,  I have found vacationing with them sometimes very trying.  Everytime, they,  approach us for an "update" which we have been told countless times that it is only an hour presentation.  We find that there in lies the frustration.  When we have agreed, we don't get out of their sales department for at least two hours.  After their presentation, they make us sit and wait for the promised gift sometimes for almost an hour.  Also, we have had situations were the sales person gets angry because he (in this case was a male) we refused to upgrade and walk off.  The last mini vacation we took at Virginia Beach, we told them that we were meeting friends and the time we were given was wrong (had the time on our paper).  They still wanted us to wait.  Also, we have found that some of the resorts we stay in are "substandard" with unit issues.  We won't even stay at Powhattan because we have had more bad experiences from dishwashers flooding to broken appliances.  Please consider all that I have typed because these comments are coming from folks that have been members almost 20 years!!
Fantastic location! Nice heated pool and services!

review_title: Nice places to visit but the points‚Ä¶
review_text: Nice places to visit but the points structure is horrible for the owners of these worthless points.. would have too give them away!

review_title: I stayed at the Liki Tiki about an year‚Ä¶
review_text: I stayed at the Liki Tiki about an year ago, i really enjoyed my stay at the resort;. Nice view and also nice amenities. But the One thing that made never go back (and i was going to make that my permanent place to stay when going to Orlando every month) I receive several calls from them a week and they are sooooooo rude. and every time i try to tell them to call me back or im not interested right now they just hang up on me. Im to the point where Im about to take it to legal actions because im being constantly hung up on when i asked to just put me on the do not call list because i will never stay at the resort again. and every number i block they call from a different number. I will post this on every site and social media page until i am removed from your list.
Clean, comfortable, great customer service!!

review_text: Our 2 bedroom unit had a nice spacious layout, beds were comfortable, small kitchen The walls were thin you could here others in the next condo! The negative was having the master bedroom bath across the hall and the shower was in the bedroom and not in the bathroom! But since we‚Äôre not buying this condo it‚Äôs ok for a few days!
We‚Äôve stayed at two diamond resorts and have enjoyed both experiences. We hope to enjoy more resorts in the near future.

Fantastic staff on all levels.  Cleanest place I‚Äôve ever visited.  Plants everywhere.  Beautiful.  I would recommend to couples and families with young children. We have stayed in 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom apartments and they are spacious, well furnished and very clean.We stayed at Royal Tenerife Country Club.
Excellent accommodation. Staff always really shameful.

review_title: Really did a terrible disservice to the‚Ä¶
review_text: Really did a terrible disservice to the original Intrawest Owners.  Reduced some of our benefits, wanted to charge us a lot of money to get them back among other things

review_title: Some resorts are great some now so‚Ä¶
review_text: Some resorts are great some now so much. Maintenance fees are high. Sales people will tell you anything to get you to buy.  So hard to go back and get what they promise, get everything in writing.  Some resorts harder to get into than others. Their tier system leaves the low owner on the lowest end of the totem pole, with their platinum having first choice of all inventory.

review_title: have so little choices of resorts as we‚Ä¶
review_text: have so little choices of resorts as we were grandfathered in from a previous timeshare co.

review_title: I really enjoyed my visit to your‚Ä¶
review_text: I really enjoyed my visit to your property!!

review_title: My husband and I did a "trip of a‚Ä¶
review_text: My husband and I did a "trip of a lifetime" this year.  We knew we were Silver members, but were told repeatedly by one of your "salespeople" that we weren't.  We were basically lied to and coerced, kept in the "meeting room" for hours even with my husband having a migraine, until we agreed to buy more points.  We should have just walked out, but didn't - instead we bought more points based on the information given regarding the benefits we were about to lose.  Imagine our surprise when we got home and found our Lifetime Silver Member cards.  So we spent thousands of dollars to buy points that we didn't really need or want.  We set up auto-payments to pay off the loan.  I paid the balance that showed due on your website in June.  Here we are in August, and Diamond has taken another payment!  There are no records available online anymore for me to see, so now I have to wait for everything to be mailed to me.  The representative is claiming that we owed one more payment, but I don't see how that is possible.I will do everything in my power to get out of this.  Something that we were excited about for our future travel plans is now something that causes extreme frustration and anger every time I see the company name
Need to have a buy back program and additional dog friendly locations.

review_title: We've had several really bad experiences with Diamond Resorts
review_text: We've had several really bad experiences with Diamond Resort from the initial meeting with the sales representative promising things that did not exist.  We informed management and they wouldn't do anything about it.  We've stayed at Mystic Dunes and the unit was infested with cock roaches.  We advised the staff and they didn't seem to be concerned.We've tried to sell our Timeshare but can't get out of it.  They just continue to increase our annual fees.

review_title: the room was amazing and very clean
review_text: the room was amazing and very clean. however the cutlery was very worn out and needed to be replaced. the chef's knife was so dull i almost chopped my fingers off trying to slice an onion.

review_title: Beach Club at Virginia Beach was awesome
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

My wife and I purchased a 3-night vacation package in September 2018. We were told repeatedly by both the sales person and the supervisor that we would stay at a resort property, unless there were no rooms available for our preferred dates/locations. We were also told explicitly that there would be no additional fees besides the $199 purchase price. As an attorney, I actually read the fine print before I signed the contract. I asked about the language stating that we would not stay at a Diamond Resorts owned or affiliated property. The sales person and supervisor both said that language was only included as a disclaimer in case there was no availability at the resorts but that we "should have no problem" booking a room at either Powhatan or Greensprings for the dates that we wanted to travel. When I attempted to book our vacation, I was told that our package entitled us to stay at a hotel, not a resort property. We were offered a room in a Best Western. So, instead of allowing us to stay at a resort property (as we were promised), the booking department tried giving us a room at a cheap, crappy hotel. I was then told that we could pay $50 per night to "upgrade" to the resort property. At that point, I asked for a refund. However, I was told about about 10 different customer "service" representatives that Diamond has a "no refund" policy but they would be happy to cancel our package without issuing a refund. That was obviously not a viable solution. After speaking with countless people, someone from the escalation team finally helped us book a room at the resort - which is what we were promised when we purchased the package.We attended the sales presentation in April and described our experience to multiple sales people, managers, and even someone who claimed to be a director of something (although he did not have a business card and would not give us his contact information). All of the Diamond staff members told us that the booking department had made a mistake because the package that we purchased absolutely entitled us to stay at a resort property - not a second/third-rate hotel. One of the managers said that he "wanted to make it right" and asked if we would be willing to give Diamond Resorts a second chance. We were obviously skeptical, but he seemed sincere, so we agreed. That night, we purchased another 3-night vacation package from a sales person at the resort (Mona).We asked the sales person at least 10 times if the package entitled us to stay at a resort property, and if we would be charged any additional fees to do so. She told us repeatedly that the purpose of the offer is to solicit our business, so of course we would stay at the resort. She also said that we would not be charged any additional fees to stay at the resort (which is exactly what the first sales person told us).Well, that was obviously not true. When we called Diamond Resorts and attempted to book our trip, we were told by multiple customer "service" representatives that our package entitles us to only stay at a hotel, and there would be a $50 or $100 fee per night to stay at a resort instead. Even worse, the representative offered us a room at La Quinta or or another, similar hotel.  Before we purchased the second package, the sales person said that, if there were no rooms available at any of the resorts, we would stay in a hotel of comparable quality to the resorts (she even showed us pictures of some of the hotels, which appeared to be very expensive/luxurious). La Quinta and Best Western are in NO WAY comparable to a Diamond resort or any of the hotel options that the sales person showed us. The sales person also promised to cancel our package and refund the entire purchase price if any problems arose while attempting to book our vacation. She showed us a button on her computer screen that would allow her to cancel and refund our purchase. So, it appears that despite what the customer "service" people have repeatedly told us, there is in fact a way for them to cancel and refund our purchase.  When I asked to cancel the package, I received the exact same response as last time: "We have a no-refund policy; we would be happy to cancel your package but we will not give you a refund."We were also told that we would have to pay a $200 fee to go to Virginia Beach in August because that is considered "high season." Again, the sales person told us that we would be charged NO ADDITIONAL FEES. We told the sales person exactly where (Virginia Beach) and when (August 2019) we want to go on vacation, and she made no mention of the fact that we would have to pay an extra $200 for some ridiculous "high season" fee.When we purchased the package, we were also given a "Getaway Certificate" as a gift. The sales person said that after finishing the sales presentation during our next stay at a Diamond resort, the gift office would give us an activation code that would allow us to book our next vacation (either five nights for $49 or seven nights for $99). However, according to Wendy Hernandez, Diamond has NO RECORD of this gift and, as a result, the company is not required to honor it. Apparently our file does not say anything about us receiving the "Getaway Certificate." We have tried to contact the sales person from whom we purchased the package but, to this point, we have had no success. STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!!!

The maintenance fees at DRI are very high and it is frustrating that some of the benefits are only available for a portion of the year. For example: we pay a lot for our points and every year I experience a substantial raise in fees. As I pay for the points I need to reflect on this and whether or not it is worth being a member.I feel we should be able to use the points at full value for hotel rooms, etc. for the entire year.

I‚Äôm done using time shares and find that the salesman lied and there is no market for time share resales and Diamond has no program to buy back contracts. So under threat of law suit I continue to pay annual maintenance fees. That‚Äôs my experience.

review_text: A well-maintained resort with a great location.  Friendly staff and amenities to match.  Recommended.

review_title: Sunrise Ridge Resort in Pigeon Forge
review_text: Sunrise Ridge Resort in Pigeon Forge, TN, was great, and we had a wonderful time.  Our only real complaint about Diamond Resorts are the CONSTANT attempts to get us to go to a "Member Update", which translates into "put extreme pressure on us to spend more money than we already have by buying more points".  Last year (2018) we had several vacations at various Diamond Resorts.  At each one, we were offered incentives to attend Member Updates, where we were made to feel that we were somehow taking advantage of Diamond by attending the updates without purchasing anything.  NEVER AGAIN WILL WE ATTEND AN UPDATE.  Thankfully, at Pigeon Forge, after we said no to an update several times, we were not bothered by any other requests.
their sale people will  not be honest with youDo not buy from them.Do not go to a sale meeting

review_text: We have found Diamond resorts to be excellent quality. We appreciate the ways Diamond has developed to make full use of our points.

So far, I have been pleased with the properties I have stayed at but there are some drawbacks. Because I am not a Diamond Resort member, I always stay as a guest but don‚Äôt get all of the perks. It would be nice to have more perks as a guest which would make me consider becoming a member in the future.

I don't like it when you go listen to an update what you have is never enough. When you say you are no interested in changing anything the attitude changes among your people. That is horrible as far as I am concerned. I would never refer anyone to Diamond.

I was contacted on numerous occasions from Diamond Resorts for offers to stay at different locations. As a customer who wanted to be informed before making decisions, I did ask questions about payments, time frame, blackout dates, and anything you would want to know when making a decision of this matter.In a nutshell, this company did lose my business because I was hung up on the first time and told by the representative that I was wasting their time. I even tried to call back in the hopes to talk to another representative to get more info.  I called back and quickly explained what happened and was hung up on again. I let the company know about the issue and never heard a response back with any resolution. I did, however, receive numerous phone calls asking me to join after I specifically said I would not do that after how I was treated. I asked them to take my name and number off the list and that never happened. If the customer service representatives were patient, they would have a repeat customer. I would recommend working with another company that can meet your needs and have customer service that will gladly answer your questions.
It was a great experience!!

review_title: I can no longer afford the yearly fees‚Ä¶
review_text: I can no longer afford the yearly fees and also have enough money to  travel. This means I now loose a large number of my points every year. I had 5 contracts and used the Transitions program to attempt to drop two of my contracts. The very small one was accepted the largest one was turned down. So I expect my yearly fees to be about the same amount for next year. I currently do not have the funds for the non refundable document recording to attempt to have the remaining 3 contracts taken back by Diamond. There is no grantee the contracts would be closed, and if not I would still have the yearly fees due. I loved Diamond years ago, but things have changed, and I do not recommend it to anyone.

We spent most of our time outside of the room and came back only to rest and clean up. Our room had to switched because of the state it was in,the second room was not any better but better. I am highly disappointed with The Red Lion and Diamond and their regards for their guest.I will be contacting customer service about my stay Monday morning.

review_title: I wrote about my concerns after our‚Ä¶
review_text: I wrote about my concerns after our visit last December. There was no mirror in the room, nor trash can, nor closet. The bathroom was one floor down as well as the closet.Most disturbing, there was no handrail on the steps. My sister actually fell going down.On the lawn was a discarded shower curtain which stayed there all day and overnight.

review_text: This was a family vacation with married children.  our units were very clean with ample furniture, utensils and dishes.  The staff was always very helpful and friendly. review_title: The facilities at all locations are‚Ä¶
review_text: The facilities at all locations are exceptional (we are Embarc members) and staff is 5 star at all the locations we have tried. Some locations do not manage operations  properly. Example: We have been going to Zihuatanejo for over 10 years and have stopped doing so since a high percentage of chairs by the pool and on the beach were left unused (except for a towel) all day long while the was a shortage of chairs. That is not 5 stars!. The reservation system has improved significantly over the past few years thank you.It would be nice to have an information line with staff that actually knew the locations and could provide valuable insights when considering the usage of the membership. This existed under the precious owners. The updates during club visits are only for sales promotion with staff who cannot provide location specific information. Embarc has a few glitches to fix but it could easily be a 5 Star plus organization.
Great Resort and staff. Induction cook top and pans would be a bonus and add to the long term stay experience. I would consider them on a user fee basis.

review_title: I am a owner at diamond resorts
review_text: I am a owner at diamond resorts. I received a certificate voucher for 5-7 nights stay for "FREE" ( I was told) when I referred friends to attend a Presentation. When I activate the certificate I paid $29.00 non refundable activation fee. Per Terms and conditions you have to book 60 days In advance in order to get a reservation. After a month of activation I called every week for reservation and was told no availability on days I requested. after 6 months I called again to attempt to get a reservation and now I  was told that I have to pay $70 NON REFUNDABLE reservation fee, $100 refundable security deposit, and $30.95 PER DAY FOR RESORT FEE. Now my question is, where does the FREE 5-7 nights vacation stay comes in this picture when in fact with all the fees presented I'm basically paying for my stay. This is ridiculous! I will NEVER, EVER refer any of my friends to this resort again. I regret signing up to this timeshare and will consider a way out of this. This is all misrepresentation from the beginning. Don't be fooled or you'll regret you did.

review_title: Their sales presentation is very high‚Ä¶
review_text: Their sales presentation is very high pressure and when you actually purchase you find out later that what they tell you and promise you is not true. Example is that you can always save unused points and that points can be used to purchase merchandise 100%. Both not true.

We bought a "sampler package" in 2017 in an attempt for Diamond Resort to prove that they could accommodate our family of 7 as they swore that they could in the lengthy sales presentation. This "Sampler Package" still cost almost $4000 and we have not yet been able to book anything, anywhere or at anytime. Be aware that customer service to resolve these issues is non existent or hostile as I experienced today from a "supervisor" in the sampler department. We could however book at many of the resorts directly, paying out of pocket, but when asked if we could use our points, there was no availability. Expensive lesson learned.

Need more resorts at places for seniors in towns with Uber or Lift transportation.

review_title: The stay at the hotel was ok.
review_text: The stay at the hotel was ok. I give it three stars because we had to pay 15.00 daily for parking and when looking for parking there was nothing available immediately, every single time we had to search for 10-15 minutes and it was always far from the main entrance. We also had issues with elevator wait time, one elevator was down and they only had one for the entire section. Breakfast was very good and the room was enough for three adults and two children. Honestly will never stay there again.

Our last experience was not a great one.  We did not even want to attend an update, but as we checked in we were told we had an appointment the next morning at 8am and would receive $150 gift card.  Well we didn't feel we had a choice or that's the way it seemed.  We showed up, was there for almost 3 hrs and was presented updates and then pressured to purchase (which we could not purchase at the time).  Granted it was a great opportunity, but not financially able to purchase at that time.  We were told we could think about it & call them back during our stay.  We called back & felt so much pressure we decided to try it, but when we back the next morning, my wife was so upset that we decided not to purchase for the same reason as above.  Then we went to get our gift card and was pressured again while waiting for them to get it ready.  Not the greatest of experiences to say the least.  We love our Timeshare and enjoy staying in different Resorts and will continue to do so.  However, when we are ready to purchase more points, we will let them know.  Upgrades are great, but just can't take pressure in purchasing.  Seems like to us they don't know how to accept No when we tell them we can't afford it right now.

review_title: I purchased a timeshare at kaanapali‚Ä¶
review_text: I purchased a timeshare at kaanapali beach club in maui in 2006. I've vacationed for one week every other year since then at that location.  I enjoy all the amenities and the staff always makes me feel welcome and helps with any issues that I might have during my stay.  The last time I stayed the room that I had smelled like mildew and the bathroom drains didn't seem to work properly.  It's the first time that I've ever had this issue and i was told that the rooms were being remodeled.  As an owner at that establishment I would have thought that I  would have been given a room that had already been updated.  This is the only issue that I've had in the years that I've stayed there and look forward fo many more visits to this timeshare.
Great location. Unit was large and spacious and most importantly quite. Unit did however seem dated and would require to be refreshed.

The staff and management gave me a first class service.  Really good food and wine !I will certainly go back there and recommend my family and friends to go there.Excellent

It hadn't been loud but the sound insulation lacks.

review_title: The lack of European accommodation is a‚Ä¶
review_text: The lack of European accommodation is a constant nightmare when I try to make a reservation at a resort of my own choosing rather than having to settle for what I can get. Booking a year in advance is hazardous and buying suitable/available flights can make holidays very expensive. This is my experience this year having booked early to ensure availability. The resorts themselves are well maintained and very enjoyable to stay in when I get a chance to do so but when I look at the money I have given to this timeshare thing I concede I was crazy to buy into it.

review_title: We have been to Diamond resort in‚Ä¶
review_text: We have been to Diamond resort in Sedona, AZ, many times, the units are comfortable and well equipped for a family.  The area is great for beautiful views, great trails for hikers.  Overall, we would recommend the diamond resort in Sedona.

review_text: I am not sure what Diamond experience I am to evaluate
Embarc Blue Mountain needs updating. The unit we were in needed fresh paint, a new roof, much better pillows and dishes. The grounds could also use better maintenance.
Stayed at Cabo Azul, Cabo Mexico top notch resort. Definitely will go again.

We traveled to Amsterdam, to board a RC ship traveling to the British Isles.British Airways, pushed back from the gate on time, then we sat on the ground for 30 minutes. when we arrived at London (Heathrow) we missed our connection and upon our arrival in Amsterdam we found that our fairly new roller bags were missing wheels.  It took several hours walking and to find our hotel.Once we got on the ship, everything was excellent!  We visited Scotland, N. Ireland, Ireland, Wales, and England

We spend upwards of twelve weeks per year utilizing our thee time share ownerships. Diamond Resorts has the highest maintenance fees of the three. Diamond Resorts also has the most flexible ways to use your timeshare ownership. I don‚Äôt like the high pressure sales tactics every time we attend an ‚Äúowner update‚Äù! The sales staff is trained to sell ownership points to people who can‚Äôt afford them. The sales staff besieges the current owners to creatively confuse and bewilder them into purchasing additional ownership points when clearly they have been told that additional point purchases are not wanted or needed.
We stayed at Rancho Manana in Cave Creek, AZAll our expectations were met exceeded.  We cannot wait to return.

There are not enough options of resorts to visit within driving distance of Atlanta other than Florida.
everything was great.The only issue was the tv sound going in and out .Luckily we were out and about most of the time.

We had a great time with all the amenities, entertainment and upscale accommodations in both the comfortable and well decorated units but also the well landscaped grounds. Maintence fees are too high and can't be paid with points or Diamond credit card points.Diamond needs to work a a fair buy back program.Renters are getring better deals than members.Just visit Diamond Advocacy Group on facebook. See whar members are saying.So true!

The staff are excellent and they make the holiday or break the reason to return.Not sure that some of the mid to top managers understand what the staff on the ground understand.It‚Äôs not what you claim to give, it‚Äôs what you do give!A bar person that remembers your order from the last time you came or the maid that leaves you extra dishwasher tablets when she understands that your eating in!!!Little things go a long long way!Always nice to be greeted with a genuinely nice person and not one that has just learnt  the company twang!!!!!Have a nice day!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Really winds me up when someone is told to say it but doesn‚Äôt mean it, so well done The your front of house staff.Not to leave out you unseen staff who provide a great array of food at excellent quality and good prices. review_text: We get different information every time we call.  We were given what we now know to be incorrect information when we signed up.  We would not recommend Diamond to anyone.

review_text: Everything was clean- even the grounds!I appreciate order and that‚Äôs what I found.Pool areas-walkway etc.Definitely stay again!

review_title: If you cannot handle one flight of‚Ä¶
review_text: If you cannot handle one flight of stairs well then this resort is not for you. Happy hour is special, most people are there to socialize and enjoy low priced drinks. It is best ever.Embarc is different as most guests are unpretentious, no snobs allowed. Pooheads should not come. Just for nice people. Alot of Canadians.The resort welcomes you home and they treat you like it.This is a special place.You will feel like you have been on a holiday.

We do enjoy our Diamond Resorts vacations.  We choose to go to Kauai, Hawaii each year and thoroughly enjoy our time there.  The facilities are in great shape and in a beautiful location.  We go back to the same resort year after year.  The only negative on Diamond Resorts is the continuous contacts by phone (we ask to do by emails since we travel a lot, but still receive 'anonymous' calls from unknown numbers.)
so much potential,  but so many pool closures

review_title: Just returned from a vacation at‚Ä¶
review_text: Just returned from a vacation at Diamond suite Intercontinental hotel Malta, must say location was not what we were expecting. Very busy and noisy area, accommodation was very nice but in bad area.

review_title: Although Time Share gets a pretty bad press
review_text: Although Time Share gets a pretty bad press generally. If used properly and the benefits are used to best advantage it represents good value for money. We have been owners for 35 years, through the  Week/colour season system to the points and fractional ownership and have been very happy overall, even through the different ownerships of the company. It's not perfect, but hey! What is?Keep up the good work Diamond.

The check in went ok, I had to get a special note from my husband before we could pickup our keys, even though both of our names are on our RCI membership, I wasn‚Äôt allowed to check in with out him contact he resort, unreal. I took this trip with my girl friends, and our husbands would meet up with us later in the week.  Anyway we arrived early and was told our unit was no ready and that I couldn‚Äôt check in until after 4 pm. That was fine, we decided to pick up Groceries while we waited for our room.  The fridge wasn‚Äôt working, I called and someone came shortly to attemp to fix it, he couldn‚Äôt, it took 3 trips and 3 different repair mento finally got it working, they left the kitchen in a complete mess now it was dirtier then before. I was embarrassed to have brought them there. The place was filthy. When I called the front to have the room cleaned, floors and garbage papers from the last guests everywhere as well as to have the furniture wiped down. I was told someone would be there to clean to room the next morning and if we would be out of the room. We left the next morning and came back for lunch, room not cleaned, I ended up calling 4 days in a row but to no avail and finally had to go to VIP services to finally have something done the day before we checkout.

review_title: In 2001 we bought into the timeshare‚Ä¶
review_text: In 2001 we bought into the timeshare market through Club Interwest.  We saw this as an opportunity for our family to vacation over the coming years. In Dec 2017 we went to Embarc Palm Desert for the first time.  A few years before that we were at Blue Mtn and heard about the sale of Club Interwest to Diamond, we were concerned. We felt in Dec 2017, that we were STRONGLY PRESSURED into a sale for further points; one of the selling points was that we could use our points to purchase air miles and thereby help reduce our costs of airfare, which would reduce our 'overall' cost of time-sharing (airfare, yearly resort fees etc).  We have found this option to be very difficult and frustrating to sort out AND just recently bought United Air Miles, inquired about buying through this plan and was told I needed 85,000 points for return airfare for myself and husband.  This runs into all sorts of issues, which cost additional funds so much that we can find better fares through Expedia! Initially when Diamond took over the service when we called the service was terrible; the people who answered the phones gave different answers, it was difficult to find someone who could give answers.  This has improved..our biggest concern remains how can we sell our points as none of our children are interested in our points, which was another selling point that we were told, how can we sell these points! Yes we know about the Diamond Resort opportunity to sell, but it has a 20 year waiting list! We did enjoy our timeshare points before now it is costly, we see no 'out' from the financial burden and we feel very pressured to use up our yearly points even though it is a challenge to do just that!!

review_title: It was decent for the cost
review_text: We enjoyed the location of the hotel as it was close to everything. However, the pool was poorly maintained and there was no room service the entire week we stayed there. The parking was also bad in that it was always packed and if you left after 8pm, you wouldn‚Äôt find a spot when you came back to the hotel.

We find it not very fliexible or easy to use our timeshare.  There are only a couple of the really nice accommodations such as Cabo Azul so you are limited as to where you can go.  Reservations need to be made way in advance.  They do the hard sell and keep trying to get you to buy more points making you feel like it will make it easier to use but it isn't.

review_title: On June 15, not happy at all with all the wrong information!
review_text: On June 15, me and family went to polo towers, due to we had a purchased a $149 weekend in the past. (Me and my wife dont remember buying it, but ok, we will take it), at the presentation they tryied to sell us a life ownership, we decided to no to buy it, since we already have a 10 year, long story short on saleswomen very rude, raising their voice, making it sound like we are giving away money to them, for 10 years, not good for us, accorsing to them. Well, we decided not to get it. After that another sales woman   came and offered us a sampler, which included.. a full benefits like if we were life time owners, since there has been a lot of complaints for the samplers, they offer now full benefits, but... according to her they dont want the actual life customers to know, because is not fear for them, they only do it becuase of the complaints of the samplers. Then she said that we have to go to one more presentation to "unlock" full benefits, and start traveling all over the world, that if we purchase it for $4000 we have full benefits for our 10 year ownership. Well we beleived her, and we went to our presentation in scottsdale and our surprise was, that "its just a sampler", no benefits, no traveling around the world, only restricted places here in the US. And also she said that we will have more availability, which also at the presentation they told us that, nope, that was not true!!!.  They also said that they were going to find out who was the sale person who told us this and that someone was going to get fired!!. Which i dont beleive. Well there is more to that and before that, only good thing is that we had a chance to travel here in the US.
We have had good experience with Diamond Resorts.  The agent I spoke to recently was courteous and helpful.

review_title: Cabo Azul stay was fabulous & spectacular!
review_text: Stay was great, sad it‚Äôs over. Best vacation ever since diamond owner & visiting other resorts!  Was concerned in 5303 - the front door security bolt wouldn‚Äôt function.  Other than that, everything was heavenly!

Great place!! Close to CW and other attractions.  The only draw back is the ‚Äúupdates‚Äù ‚Äúworkshops‚Äù ‚Äúmore‚Äù !  They just won‚Äôt take NO for an answer. This year they did not have enough employees to open the Cabana at the pool.  They will try to accommodate things that we have requested.
Friendly staff at the lobby. Clean room with thoughtful touches. Great boardwalk view. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel and ate tacos. Very nice.
You need more  Carribbean experiences and availability   And safety for your members

review_title: If you own like Hawaii points than you‚Ä¶
review_text: If you own like Hawaii points than you buy some more points in vegas why dont they combine all the points and only have one maintenance fee.  now I have to separate maintenance fees which is a rep off.

review_title: Had a situation with the valet
review_text: Had a situation with the valet. Scratched my rims on my new car.  Made a report and they declined. It wasn‚Äôt handled well by management

We purchased one of your ‚ÄúDiscover Packages‚Äù. We have used it in North Scottsdale. One bedroom was ok but very dated compared to what we get at other resorts. The pool was also very small and crowded every day. We were told by a sales person at the resort on our required presentation that the best rooms were reserved for owners! Wow was I shocked.

The sales representatives (VA Beach and Williamsburg) were using heavy handed tactics during owners updates trying to frighten us into giving into them.  It upset my wife, and I had trouble sleeping for several days afterwards.The staff, on "this side of the door" are generally nice though.

review_title: Timeshare purchases way to high for‚Ä¶
review_text: Timeshare purchases way to high for point exchange received. Maintenance fees crazy high. No value for money spent.

review_title: We loved the Embarc in Zihautanejo!
review_text: We loved the Embarc in Zihautanejo on this 2nd visit this Spring. Beautiful decor and the very best location!

This company is nothing more than a high pressure sales organization for vacation resorts.  We have regretted purchasing our $2500+ Sampler Package that has never been used. At the time of our purchase we needed to make an immediate decision.  We didn't have time to fully research the locations that were included.  After purchasing, we visited one location in Rancho Mirage, CA.  It was not the quality of resort we typically vacation in. We later researched the other locations available to us and found that we could buy our own arrangements at far nicer places for less money.  We tried to switch our package locations several times to Embarq locations - in particular in Palm Springs where we stayed with family.  We were denied many times.  We continue to get calls from their Call Center to use our points. I've repeatedly asked to change our offerings to other locations.  The answer always is upgrade to other plans or a full membership for thousands of dollars more.  Why throw away more money when you've never been happy with what you already had.  Also at the time of purchase, we were told we would get two bonus "dream vacations" that could be used worldwide. We only received one and again nowhere we wanted to travel. We were totally misled by the sales rep and what we got does not match our expectations.  We do NOT recommend this company.

review_title: A 3 rating due to the numerous times‚Ä¶
review_text: A 3 rating due to the numerous times sales representatives were outright rude and condescending if we were not in the market,at the time, to purchase additional shares.One, at the Village Mirage in Scottsdale followed us out in the parking lot hollering at us after his and her rude pitch inside the center.We are already Platinum members. Never again!!Other than sales reps, everything and everyone else has been fine.

review_title: I had to cancel my contract with‚Ä¶
review_text: I had to cancel my contract with Diamond Resorts due to being in a high risk pregnancy that does not allow me to travel. I have told them this many many times and I still get at least 5 calls a day from their team. It‚Äôs annoying and disrespectful.

review_title: No longer the 5* accommodation we have‚Ä¶
review_text: No longer the 5* accommodation we have come to expect as a member. Disappointed on the last couple of occasions as to how things have deteriorated over the past few years üò©

review_title: As in many of the Diamond resorts they‚Ä¶
review_text: As in many of the Diamond resorts they all look a little tired...In Scottsdale Golf Resort they were in the process of updating the suites but the designer board in the lobby outlining the materials to be used  basically showed the same materials already in he tired outdated rooms...my wife being a designer thought it a little tacky....Kitchens at all properties insure that you will eat out. Really need to update appliances and get ones that fit. Some of the shimming and getting by is old. Most all units have a faulty dishwasher from 2005.At the Cave creek Rancho Manana the resort lacks more grilling space and  the Tonto restraunt will not charge items to the diamond rooms...that simply has to change as it is a major inconvenience when using the pool and really takes the fun out of what is a very nice resort...same with the attached spa Typical Diamond resorts property 4 stars never 5
Enjoyably stay, all the amenities, price is right

review_title: I'd been trying to get a place it Italy‚Ä¶
review_text: I'd been trying to get a place it Italy or England for 5 years (sad/frustrating) but finally I got Villa Glustinian which was wonderful. The staff was great and even helped us find restaurants/places to go in Venice. The breakfast was wonderful and all the servers were great.
The service and accommodations are always 1st class.  I have been a member since 1999 and look forward to many more years.

review_title: We love that place is great pool is‚Ä¶
review_text: We love that place is great pool is excellent fun fun fun place.

I am an ex-Car Salesman & I was never so hard-sold in my life ... while at my weakest because I was on vacation in Maui & my guard was down &, after 5 hours of barrage, by your Staff at the Kaanapali Beach Club Resort, I felt like a hostage that would never be released to enjoy the day unless I "caved".  Then it took me weeks & weeks to get you folks to allow me to pay-off the $15,000 of High Interest Loans.  You stonewalled my preferred banks as long as you could until I got a consumer watchdog TV News show staff on the case.

review_text: We always feel refreshed when we stay at Diamond Resorts. Beautiful location!

Wonderful experience for family of 6.  Our 2 room condo had enough space for our 4 teenagers to have their own space, while the parents could hide in the spacious master bedroom.  Highly recommend!
As always the family experiences good stays and expected personnel interactions.
Accomodation always top notch, welcome also. We have been members for over 18 years and not had a bad experience.

We‚Äôve been Diamond members for 23 years, started with points for 1 week as GVC. Had holidays all over the world including swaps with Interval International. Hardest issue is getting the desired booking. Most times it is a compromise, one has to be persistent to get the week and place you want, and Interval is another tier, hurdle to surmount.Having said that, we bought more points and are silver members. Family, friends and work have benefited with an impressive list of countries and places we have visited. We would not have done so much had we not been members.

We LOVE Cabo Azul Resort!  It is absolutley beautiful, peaceful and relaxing.  The service in the restaurants is excellent,  friendly, and professional.  The menu items are delicious.  Can't wait to go back again!  One more thing-there is a stunning ocean view and the grounds are kept spotless.  Your visit will be memorable!
Cool spot. Great amenities!

I have been going to Sunset Bay in Tenerife twice a year for the past 25 years and I am very happy to keep doing so. I have had a few queries with Diamond but they are usually sorted to my satisfaction. I have also been to Portugal, Spain, Florida, Las Vegas and Palm Spring staying in Diamond resorts. I have been extremely well looked after in all these resorts and would quite happily recommend them to other holidaymakers. Timeshare works for me and I am happy to be a Diamond owner.

Love the Whistler and Zihuatanejo Embarc properties. Don't like having Interval International in the extraordinary escapes.  They are useless and impossible to find properties that are available.

Lovely destination and friendly staff. Rooms are clean and updated.  Don‚Äôt bring your Thule or Truck as they won‚Äôt fit in their parking garage and no alternate above ground parking available.  The kids pool is fantastic, but if you don‚Äôt care for all the noise that many splashing children make all day, then best to request a room in a different wing.

Excellent and beautiful room. I was supposed to only have a regular room and never got to see it because somehow they were all booked up, so the staff in charge accommodated us with 2 bedroom which felt like a condo! And to top it off it was a comfortable stay. I will never forget this and have only looked for diamond resorts since! You guys rock!

review_title: We have a good weekend at the cancun‚Ä¶
review_text: We have a good weekend at the cancun resorts.Thank you

review_title: Not what we bought into in 1998
review_text: Not what we bought into in 1998. Less and less availability despite a decline in European membership.

review_title: Please consider some sort of fair relief for long-time owners
review_text: We have enjoyed traveling as an owner with Diamond (and the different companies before them) for about 25 years.The constant pressure to buy more points, update, etc. and no, even minimal, buy-back program is very frustrating.  Something like maybe a 5% of original purchase price starting on the 10th year with a max of 50% after 20 years would seem like something VERY REASONABLE and satisfying to us long-time owners whose children may not be interested in continuing ownership in the company.  Being "saddled" with something one is not desiring is not a fun thing.Selling a product that costs tens of thousands one day and worth $0 the next day without some recuperation seems almost criminal or maybe illegal and certainly ought to be a conscious/integrity issue for marketing agents and corporate officers as well.The seemingly "rigged" corporate structure of them choosing their own trustee(s) based of them being able to cast the votes for those not sending in a ballot, is VERY concerning.

review_title: I wish they would just do what say they‚Ä¶
review_text: I wish they would just do what say they say they would do.  I talked friends into buying in we got nothing as promised.  Friends were able to buy in at a much lower rate than we got.  Also was promised a 4 day cruise when I was in Vegas never received.
Kenmore Scotland , lovely setting, great apartments , well serviced and equipped.....would definitely recommend!
You can't find a resort to book - you can't get out of your membership - it has become a burden and Diamond Resorts don't seem to care!!!

review_title: Had to request move to alternate Lodge
review_text: Had to request move to alternate Lodge, as the one allocated had no shower. Moved immediately.

We booked our stay thru Groupon. While Groupon charged us twice for the same room..Diamond Resort was fantastic and we don‚Äôt regret anything! The staff is all top notch, friendly & go the extra mile. When we booked with Groupon we received a excellent bargain & a free $20. meal voucher for the poolside restaurant. We ordered nachos, cheese fries & jalape√±o poppers. The rooms were gorgeous! We had a one bedroom suite for multiple nights. The free laundry üß∫ rooms made life feel normal and easy. The 24 hour room service brought us linens & extra shampoo when needed. The wake up service was prompt & accurate. The kitchen was fully stocked so I could whip up ANYTHING my Kids craved or wanted. With a dishwasher! So I didn‚Äôt need to ever wash a dish. My Daughter left her favorite blanket and they had it cleaned & ready for pick up when I came back for it. It was so easy we felt like we were at home the whole time. We will stay again and we HIGHLY recommend it!

review_text: I am not happy with the sampler package I was not given the correct info when I purchased it. $3370.00 for what?

review_text: Some of the sale tactics the sale department uses is not necessary. Making promises that is knowingly untrue gives diamonds a face that I never seen or wish to see again. Diamond is better than that.

review_title: We really enjoy our Diamond membership
review_text: We really enjoy our Diamond membership. We are Platinum members, which simply means our yearly point distribution is in the highest bracket with the most value. Staying at really nice places makes you appreciate what our timeshare is worth when compared to hotels. I would never push timeshare on anyone, because it is not for everyone. However,  if you enjoy traveling and staying at high quality places that are much more comfortable and cleaner than hotels,  plus other amenities,  Diamond is the best!!
Diamond has some good resorts.  Cost 'way too much to buy.  Maintenance fees are exorbitant.  Cheaper to rent somewhere else than to pay maintenance fees.

review_text: They exist to take our money. There is little focus on customer service except ...... to take your money.

Dream Holiday?  Not; Royal Lahina on Maui not bad, but not up to the standards I expect of Diamond (like Kanapalli Beach Club).  I'll give 4 stars though to this part of our vacation.However the Royal Kona was another story.  We were first given an old musty room that even a 63 air-conditioning setting couldn't solve (and which wasn't working well anyway, so turning down the thermostat would not have helped).  I complained, and desk clerk was helpful and allowed an upgraded corner room (WHICH IS NOT OFFERED TO DIAMOND MEMBERS BECAUSE THIS IS AN AFFILIATE HOTEL).  I thanked him profusely and this "saved" our special anniversary vacation.We did upgrade our membership (hope that wasn't a mistake) and I hope our next 15,000 point "Dream Holiday", which we hope will be an Alaskan cruise next year, will be better.  Can we get an outside stateroom or will Diamond force us inside?  More to follow; look forward to reading more reviews on Trustpilot now that we're members.

review_title: People lie at the corporate office and‚Ä¶
review_text: People lie at the corporate office and every three months you will be raising theMaintenance fee, this is corrupt business and dishonest. I would not recommend the program to anyone.

Diamond we have sent a complaint to the BBB which it seems you failed to respond back since we haven't had any emails from the BBB about you responding or receiving the complaint. We are making complaints about how we were misled into the timeshare purchase and how the process really works. We have received multiple daily calls about payments but nothing about the complaint. Why would we pay Diamond when no one can email us about our concerns? This company pays people to lie and harass you. If they don't then they lose their jobs or don't get paid and that's horrible for Diamond to pressure employees to do this to innocent people. We have spent too much money to be treated like guests and not owners and someone needs to do something about it.

review_title: The Grand at Trafagar, was just that!
review_text: On our trip to the UK we stayed at The Grand @ Trafalgar twice while in London. The staff was great, Katy and Louiza were especially helpful. The rooms we had were large, king size, with full size shower. The location was perfect as a hub to see the city sights. Many sites close enough to walk to from the hotel. The Embankment Tube station is less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Try the Caffe Concerto 2 doors down from the hotel. Great pastries, expresso drinks, & meals. We‚Äôd definitely stay at The Grand on our next visit to London.

Despite proclamations that the "new" ownership of Diamond Resorts has moved away from the old "high pressure" sales tactics, we were exposed to a "one hour" "information" session at Lake Tahoe that took close to 3 hours until we succumbed to the salesperson and purchased $23,000 worth of points.  We were given "free" bonus of 5,000 points to be used for a trip of our choice (from 6 locations).  One week later, we called to make reservations for San Diego and were told that that property is not available.  The lies from Diamond Resorts just keep coming.

Stays at Diamond ResortsWe have stayed in Condos managed or owned by DRI since January of 2015.  Most of our stays have been very pleasant and we have been treated well by friendly staff.  Just be very aware of what the Sales Staff are telling you when investing in a membership. We enjoy the resorts very much and have stayed in Arizona multiple times, Virginia, Colorado, California, and Idaho.

review_title: We have had good experiences and‚Ä¶
review_text: We have had good experiences and horrible experiences with Diamond Resorts. When we go on vacation with Diamond we hate the fact that we always anticipate a sales pitch. The required 2 hours turns into 3, 4 or even 5 hours of pressure to purchase more points. They rarely take no for an answer. The rare times where we don't have to go to presentations is when we enjoy our stay without the sales pressure. Some of the places we stay are simply beautiful and the facilities are wonderful. A few of the properties are in desperate need of upgrading. Maintenance costs are a problem since they continue to go up. On a personal note, I have had health issues which meant that I had to cancel several trips. You can move only a certain number of your points to the next year, but we wind up getting stuck with a lot of points that go to waste. Be careful what you purchase and make sure you leave after the required time at presentations otherwise you lose a whole day of your vacation besides the headache you will have.

review_title: We were very impressed with the condo
review_text: We were very impressed with the condo, the service and the value.

review_title: Diamond has some excellent resorts, but....
review_text: Diamond has some excellent resorts that have provided us with some wonderful memories.  However some of their services and rules can be less than member friendly.  Their sales force has a well-earned reputation for deception and deceit.

review_title: Trying to find something where we want‚Ä¶
review_text: Trying to find something where we want to go is next to impossible as there are no Diamond resorts in the states we want to visit.  Most of the others you have to book a year or more ahead of time. We can usually always find something in Branson, but we would like to see some other states.  Was promised a list of other properties twice. We have still never seen them.  Would never encourage anyone to buy Diamond.  If anyone that already owns at Diamond would like to have some extra points at a good price, we have some for sale.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Failure to complete transfer as promised
review_text: In December 2018 we agreed to permanently transfer our property at Sedona Springs to Diamond Resorts in exchanger for 10,500 points. Prior to this we had to pay SS fees with VRI, book a week and then notify Diamond and have the week transferred to Diamond. We signed documents transferring the title and Diamond was to take care of all the rest. As of today, July 16, 2019 this transfer has not been completed. VRI still shows us as owners of the property. VRI needs a registered title transfer in order to make the switch.Also, a tablet computer given to us at the time froze up and became useless in one month.

review_title: The resorts are great  -- 5 stars but updates 1 star
review_text: The resorts are great  -- 5 stars, but the updates leave much to be desired- perhaps as low as1 star --- WHY???  Here is why!!We have attended three updates from November 2018 through April 2019. At the first u[date we were told if we purchased so many points we would move to the next level -- we purchased the stated number of points.  At the March 2019 we were told that the amount that we were told in November was not correct and we needed to purchase more points.   At the April 2019 update, we were told that neither of the two previous number of points needed to achieve the level we were wanting was correct and we needed to purchase more points.  We became very skeptical and did not purchase more points. At the end of this  last, lengthy update we were introduced to a person from 'hospitality'.   That person said that if we only would give him $4,000 we would be upgraded to the desired level --- BUT he said he would not put that in writing,  That was certainly a RED FLAG as we had to sign many papers during each and every update, but this man would not put this offer in writing.   We Wonder why?????????????

Every Embarc resort (8) we have stayed at has been great and enjoyable. The Embarc staff are very welcoming and enjoyable and the facilities are kept up to date.The one distasteful experience occurred at Palm Desert. We were offered a membership update and it turned out to be a high pressure sales promotion by Diamond personnel. The worst part was when they lied to us about Extraordinary Escapes. We caught them at the lie and the manager tried to soft pedal it.

review_title: I do like staying at Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: I do like staying at Diamond properties. They are always neat & clean. The only complaint is the requesting us to sit through a timeshare presentation. We have done that several years back & it was not a pleasant experience.

At the end of March we went to Sandestin.  We enjoy going to Sandestin as it is warmer than Ontario. Everything was fine but we noticed a difference in the employees, though pleasant and helpful not cheerful as usual - things felt different.  Also noticed that the rooms though top service clean are not getting properly cleaned anymore.  Under the dishwasher there we crumbs which I cleaned out.  The tiles in the shower had a bit of calcium deposits on them and the toilet roll holder needed tightening.  I would think if I was responsible for cleaning that room I would have told the service team to tighten that toilet roll holder immediately before the next check-ins.  However, I look at things very differently than the average person.  I am paying a high premium for this timeshare and I expect everything to be in tip top shape other than those items that are being worked on with the staff.  But I find that Diamond Resorts is not managing the repairs and cleaning as well as Club Intrawest did.

review_title: The Royal Lahaina resort and staff was‚Ä¶the best.
review_text: The Royal Lahaina resort and staff was exceptional.  I do not have any issues with them.  The issue that I have with Diamond Resorts is that I felt my wife and I were tricked into purchasing a 10 year program.  We were told that we could use the points for airline travel, but they did not reveal to us that our program only allows us to use 20% of our points.  They lead us to believe we could use our entire points for airline fees.  I can get it cheaper without the 20% that they allow us to use.  What a rip off.  If I could get out of this program I would not even hesitate.  They would not even return my calls after repeatedly trying.  Do not get involve with Diamond Resorts.  A year after we purchased the property, they then told us that the maintenance will go up every year.  I probably will pay almost twice as much as when I started with. Save your money and do it the old way of making your own hotel and airline reservations.  You will come out thousands of dollars cheaper over the long run.
The room was nice and clean.  The bed was comfortable.  Had a great view of the pool!  We did not get to use pool because we stayed in November.  Will return to use the pool while it's hot.
Clean quite and friendly staffClose to strip Nice roof top pool

review_title: Stayed at sunset harbour in Tenerife
review_text: Stayed at sunset harbour in Tenerife. The apartment was sad to say the least. A much needed up date was needed. Firstly in the bathroom the underside of the shower mat had a lot of black mould spots on it and some black mould around the bottom of the shower between the base and the screen. There was a bathroom cabinet that had been fixed together with a plank of wood. The patio door wouldn‚Äôt open properly and the furniture especially the dining chairs were dirty and stained. Not what you want when you are eating. I‚Äôm sure there are better rooms than this but we didn‚Äôt get one. The view from the balcony was good
Lovely quality, comfort and friendly staff. Always clean including the grounds.

Our last trip to Tenn. was what the experience is suppose to be, RELAXING.We were asked to attend an owners update, we did learn some things about how to use the point system more effectively. Wasn't a high pressure sales tactic, which is what a vacation getaway is suppose to be.

review_title: Diamond resorts is s bad investment
review_text: Diamond resorts is s bad investment. Unable to find resort with accommodation in my area. Every time is visit resort the demanded ‚Äú update meeting‚Äù takes 5-8 hours of my time trying to escape. To get out of rooms I stupidly sign papers that cost me $3-8,000. Would not advise anyone to get involved with this company. Lots of high pressure sales force.

review_title: I've only stayed once at Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: I've only stayed once at Diamond Resorts (the Orlando area) but the service was helpful and friendly. The suite was exceptional. Very comfortable for the 4 of us.
