Every time we go to our timeshare we are pressured into going to an "owner update" which is just a pressurized sales pitch to buy more points and has nothing to do with an update. They hold us hostage trying to bully us into buying more points for a couple hours and then when we say no their attitude turns and they aren't so nice. Would be nice to have a TRUE UPDATE so we know what's going on and what's new in DR. And would be nice to be offered to buy more points without all the BS and games.
Ready to satisfy your needs! Great management and efficiency.

review_title: If it was not for your so called‚Ä¶
review_text: If it was not for your so called updates I would give you 5 stars. But they turn into the sales person pressuring you to buy more points, which is really a turn off. They don‚Äôt give you honest answers and tell you only half truths and sometimes right out lies instead of finding out answers to your questions. Otherwise I love our vacations with Diamond, especially the great friendships we have made. Majority of the time you get great accommodations and great service.
Very kind and polite staff. Diamond has the best customer service in the industry.

review_title: Wish more info was in writing
review_text: Wish more info was in writing. Not just told to us.

The sales meeting you have to go to is HIGH PRESSURE and our experience each time we have gone is such that we are NEVER going to continue doing business with Diamond Resorts once our sampler is used up this fall.You would think a sample would be a company's best foot forward.  Not the case.  We were limited to where and when we could go plus you could not use the online system to book because it did not allow you to do everything you could do if you called in.... and the long sales meeting was a room full of people all talking, you couldn't hear, way too long , didn't take no for an answer. review_title: I liked the resort,the staff were‚Ä¶
review_text: I liked the resort,the staff were friendly. But it was difficult to get there, and the restaurant had burnt down. Gail Kenney

It's all just too expensive, and too difficult to go where you want when you want. When we look at our initial downpayment, our second purchase of additional points, and how many times we have to go out and try to find what we want, coupled with putting a couple hundred aside every month to meet our annual maintenance fees, it's all too much. Also, you purchase distressed properties and refurbish them.  They are definitely getting better. About ¬Ω are top notch and the others are working to get there. BUT I would just rather book them when I am on my way there as an outsider, instead of having to go through all of this.

Even made suggestions for me to use some of my points.  Went the extra mile to even ask if she could make reservations for me.  Excellent Service!!

I told her is wasn't necessary, and she simply smiled and said, it's a little confusing to find so she'd like to show me.   I had several experiences like that as I was learning to navigate my way around the resort.
Rooms nice and clean. Service great,.enjoy staying there.
Love the resorts.  Just some places have aggressive sales people and gimmicks - don't enjoy that.

review_title: We were a little disappointed with the‚Ä¶
review_text: We were a little disappointed with the hotel and the room we stayed in.  All of the pictures, videos and advertisements look very luxurious and posh but the hotel was definitely a disappointment.  Not unclean, or "bad service" but less than what we expected.

The resort was beautiful but our accommodations were not good. The sofa had springs broken and it was very uncomfortable to sit or sleep on it. We asked several times to have replaced or repaired. It was not good having back problems. Other than that inconvenience it was really a great place.

review_text: The resorts are clean and well kept.  The maintenance fees are too expensive.

Diamond's membership access is typically geared to favor members with higher points ownership.  If you are owner to 20k points or less, your access to properties and services are almost non-existent.  I've spent over $25,000 and I've only been able to take advantage of just about 4 weeks of vacation since 2016.  Very sad for me and very fortunate for Diamond.  They get my annual dues regardless!

review_title: We did an owner update in St Louis with‚Ä¶
review_text: We did an owner update in St Louis with a Diamond sales rep. We were presented with info regarding an equity account with Diamond...$68,201. HOWEVER, in order to access this equity we MUST make a minimum purchase of 6,000 points, $22,400. We had questions. Our sales rep WILL NOT return phone calls, WILL NOT even answer his phone. Our 5-day right to rescind now expired. We were told by our sales rep NOT TO MENTION this equity info from our sales meeting...he would take care of everything such as having our contract cancelled and having the equity released. LIES, LIES, AND MORE LIES. The money DOES NOT exist, the contract cannot be cancelled. We got ABSOLUTELY NO SUPPORT from QA, Corporate Las Vegas and ABSOLUTELY NO SUPPORT from Barclay when we reported the charges were made under fraudulent circumstances. This isn't over!!! I'm going to become their worst nitemare!!!
It is very simple to explain the rating.You had gained so much membership that is almost impossible to find the vacation (especially gateway), which was not the case just two years ago...

review_title: We travel to Florida and we're‚Ä¶Get Away!
review_text: We travel to Florida and we're satisfied. They are upgrading the resorts and we find them enjoyable. I just hope maintenance fees stay stable.

First time shares are horrible investment.  This was the only asset my ex husband and I argued over, You take it, NO!, You take it.  I lost and got stuck with it. Impossible to sell. Second when did try to use it they use the trip to try to get me to by more. I have never had a good experience EVER with anyone on the phone from Diamond. Rude, condescending and overall very disrespectful to deal with.  I vote NO on Diamond Resorts.

Most resorts are average to slightly above. There are some beautiful ‚ÄúDiamonds‚Äù in the mix though. For the most part, service from the hotel department has been very good. That said, there is a deplorable timeshare sales component that some of the hotel staff get a bonus for referring you to sales department. That bonus component can sometimes turn what should be a simple resort visit check in process into a very uncomfortable and intimidating process. The sales process is absolutely despicable. Our experience through many presentations led us to insist that every assertion the sales person made be put into writing. They of course will not do this. The misleading and outright deceitful statements made by many of the sales representatives appear to be supported by Diamond, as they do not appear to act to correct this.We would advise any and all who may be interested in purchase to do their due diligence and take a day to carefully consider their pending purchase. If it then feels like it‚Äôs for you, make the deal.

You offer fantastic offers and this one that I bought I will not be able to use because buying it not only put me financially strapped, even though it was very reasonable. But, the offers will have us traveling to and fro plus gas to get to and fro. That is not cheap right now and we have also had to take care of other financial matters which prevents us from taking on this offer. So from what I was told too late too bad ‚Äúno refunds‚Äù

I recently attended a Diamond Resorts‚Äô presentation in Las Vegas at the Cancun Resorts. I was there for over two hours for what was advertised as a 90 minute presentation and did not appreciate the high-pressured sales tactics.  The sale rep did not accept my response of no to purchase. I was asked to wait while he was going to check on my free gift.  Fifteen minutes later he returned with his sales manager. I felt like this was a tag team presentation. The manager was asking what reasons I was declining the offer. Why is it that DRI‚Äôs sales reps need to use high pressure tactics at the presentations?  Why does Diamond allow their sales reps to offer non-existent programs to potential buyers? I have learned from owners that there are many examples of this. Why do Diamond resorts allow their sales reps to be deceptive?  I feel if DRI has a good product, then why is it necessary to use deceptive practices at these presentations. Diamond Resorts does not have clarity as per their company statement. I do not recommend this company since they do not have clarity and honesty.

review_title: The rep was very helpful and went‚Ä¶

review_title: We have not been able to use it as much‚Ä¶
review_text: We have not been able to use it as much as we would like.  WE camp a lot.
Everything is wonderful!! The rooms is big and clean! The employees are very attention and perfect! So, I love this hotel!‚ù§Ô∏è

Lesson learned, don't do this again.  DR promises the world, tells you that the value of your ownership will go up, points can be traded and if you ever need to sell, it's easy.  What they don't tell you is the high-pressure sales, constant barrage of phone calls giving away free weekends for a simple meeting with their team, annual fees (watch the fine print on this one) and "ownership" doesn't mean you can sell it easily.  I'd like to say that it's great if only to sell what I have, but I'd be putting someone else into the hot seat.  Older folks like to get these, then leave them to their kids (who never asked for it and are now paying an annual homeowners' fee and can't sell because the market doesn't want it) and it causes more problems down the road.I was dumb and got into this not understanding the finer details of time-share ownership (the word ownership is an outright lie - you don't own anything, but rather owe everything).  I hate the monthly calls, the annual notices that I'm still required to pay an annual fee on something I "own" and if I don't pay, I'm sent to collections.Just stay away.  It's not worth it.  Stick with Universal or Disney, or Holiday Inn.  Anything is better than the lies these people feed you.

Mixed care from diamond representatives, Had a rep in Honolulu (Feb-2019) who said he has taken over managing our account with Diamond but cannot reach him by phone or email at all for follow up with our travel needs...

review_title: Negative changes and trends with ownership
review_text: I have owned since the mid 1990‚Äôs and have paid the expensive price of constant ownership, leadership and operational changes. There are many things I like about timeshare ownership however my comments are focused on what I am dissatisfied with. The change from 1 day to  31 days cancellation notice  requirements for the reservation protection plan is absolutely ridiculous, 7 days would be a good compromise. Resorts that allow Primary Owner Reservation only is a trend I do not like. Ownership into Diamond was sold and purchased based on my adult family being able to enjoy vacations on their own. Reservations for only the Primary Owner which does not include associates is a reason Not to buy more timeshare points with Diamond. Disappointed with the limited amount and locations of cruises you could book with all points this year.  Cruise voucher restrictions and limited use are not worth a referral for me going forward I would rather see a credit toward my annual fees and dues. Travel with Points is not a savings with such low Point redemption value. It would be nice to see larger percentage offerings  of 30% or 10% when using Diamond Loyalty- perhaps a sliding scale of Point values that could cover up to 75% of cost (cruise, hotels, etc).

we always holiday in Tenerif (adeje) for the last 5years would not go anywhere else brilliant staff and animation team last year my wife cooked fo the holidaymakers in the top pool and everyone enjoyed her dishes looking forward to seeing everyone again in november

review_title: The properties we stayed at were very‚Ä¶

The representative told us that we could stay at various locations for as long as we liked only to find out that we had to use the awards within a 2 year time frame. It was called the Sampler Program.

I am giving a 3+  I have noticed improvements.  I still have a problem with the hard sell given by your employees.  They do not accept a no I am not interested without adding significant additional pressure.  However the improvements made at many of your resorts along with friendly helpful staff I have encountered, have impressed me and made my vacations wonderful,

review_title: nice places but would never sign up with them ,forget that

review_title: Diamond has been a good and fair‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond has been a good and fair partner in vacation travel in past 6 years.Downside is can't get into popular areas. We had made 3rd and 4th choices each year.

review_title: They will seize all they can from your pocketbook!
review_text: Diamond Resorts International was poised to remove $14,000 from us and much more in their additional fees. Fortunately, my husband did a check regarding where we had stayed in Kauai, Hawaii, and investigated how many points it would take to stay a week as we had done in the past. This unit in Kauai was one of our two weeks of exchange with Interval International. He noticed it would take all the points offered; plus, charging us $14,000 atop this, and our already owned units and more. Which means they would have also derived some interest in our lock-off unit of two residences, and $14,000, plus all their annual fees, etc. And we read in the contract, they can increase owner fees up to 25 percent whenever they desire.The salespeople had assured us if we turned our lock-off units over to them for 50,000 points, and paid $14,000 atop this, we would gain a great deal. No, we were losing a significant amount of investment. It is unbelievable that people can take such advantage of others with no legal repercussions.Our one unit of two, is worth far more than 50,000 points; more accurately‚Äî140,000 points. And with the smaller lock-off unit, we always secure a five-star room as well. And to get what we already had, we were giving them our units plus $14,000 and we would end up with far far less than our current ownership. Plus, a a huge increase in charges for ownership fees.When you agree to a presentation, salespeople will set all these freebies before your eyes and soon, they have you dreaming of free flights and resort vacations to keep you from asking the right questions. They own your imagination as they present offers, appearing too good to pass by. They also state you must sign the papers now, which provides you no time to investigate.  When an offer is only for the moment and you are sitting with them, you are unable to get on your computer to spend the necessary time to check their legitimacy before they apprehend everything they can from your bank account. A couple salesmen presented themselves as religious and church-attending, Christian people to sound on the up and up which they are not!Please be warned you are dealing with reprehensible people you should never come in contact with! If anyone is short of wisdom, it is good to read a Proverb a day from the Bible from the Book of Proverbs and you can read it online. And we all need daily wisdom to see beyond smoking mirrors of illusion.

review_title: We went to the presentation and‚Ä¶

review_title: The timeshare I wish I never got involved with

Ending up going to NV.  Also offered FL  Where the markets with timeshares.  NOT happy we are Gold members and always have problems getting to where we want to go.

Loan statements are very incomplete and are almost useless, just showing your next payment value and due date, which most likely you have set up for automatic payments.Every good loan statement shows how previous payment was applied (principal, interest, and fees if any), along with starting and ending loan balance.You have to go to their Dashboard and select Make a Payment then selecting Payment History to get this information.Luxury Buying-You can only apply up to 30% of the cost via points depending on your level, gold or platinum, and almost all identical items can be found on the internet at 40% to 50% less than their price.

Resorts are generally very nice. The hounding you get to attend an "update" which is just a sales pitch is very upsetting. When I say no don't keep asking me to attend.

It is true that the accommodations are always very nice but you hardly get reset during holidays. However, you book that same reservation through a third party. The Maintenance fees are also very high

Terrible company.  Put a $3400 unauthorized charge on our credit card for a week at a resort in Sedona AZ.  During our stay their I fell on loose gravel on walkway on property incurring close to $10,000 in medical expenses.  Our unit had a filthy stove in it that oven caught fire and my husband nearly escaped being burned by. We have never been so totally outraged by any company.  Thankfully after hiring an attorney we were able to recoup our money.  I now make it a point to warn everyone I come in contact with to run when they have someone approach them from this company.
Representative was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable.

review_title: If I could I‚Äôd give ZERO stars
review_text: We were told we would get four nights and five days at a hotel that was comprable to their properties. Marriott or Omni. When we called to book, not only were the available dates limited and terrible, we were going to be put up at a Clarion!!! A Clarion! That is NOT the same caliber and if it is, I wouldn‚Äôt buy their timeshare. Of course, no refunds offered on our package. We were stuck with the meager offering of a low end motel chain. Watch out who you get on that customer service line too. They can be rude and unprofessional! This is a good ol‚Äô bait and switch tactic. Don‚Äôt do it! No matter what they offer you!

review_title: Fees are getting too high.  Salespeople lie

most resorts are affites and many times rooms are just "worn".  Also very difficult to get rooms unless you book a year out which is not reasonable way.  Will say the tours are getting to be good and we are trying a 1st lux. home in July.

I pay maintenance fees every year and I paid quite a bit for the points I own, so why is the general public able to get the exact same suite I am being denied availability at the EXACT SAME resort with the EXACT same dates???

review_title: My last trip was to Palm Springs and we‚Ä¶
review_text: My last trip was to Palm Springs and we had a wonderful time like always. Yes I would go back.

IT'S ALL ABOUT THE PEOPLE, AND EVERY ONE OF THEM CARES ABOUT WHAT THEY DO AND HOW WELL THEY DO IT. THAT'S FOR ALL THE EMPLOYEES - NO MATTER WHAT THEIR JOB RESPONSIBILITY IS. WE'VE BEEN TO A LOT OF 5 STAR RESORTS THAT MOST PEOPLE WOULD CONSIDER "SUPER UPSCALE" - BUT THE STAFF AT ZIHUATANEJO JUST NEVER DISAPPOINTS (AND THAT'S AFTER 14 YEARS AT ZIHUA!  NOT ONE SINGLE COMPLAINT - AND IF THERE WAS ONE MINOR COMPLAINT - IT WOULD BE DEALT WITH IN SECONDS.

Rooms are clean, the pool is nice, people are friendly.

review_title: Their is a consistent quality about the‚Ä¶
review_text: There is a consistent quality about the amenities at all Diamond Resorts I have experienced, as well as very courteous and helpful concierge/reception staff. The only complaint I have is the continued use of flat sheets for the bottom sheet. At many locations, this results in a sheet that either goes over the top of the mattress or the bottom of the mattress, but not both. It makes for uncomfortable bedding, at least in my opinion. I now travel with my own fitted sheet, so that I don‚Äôt have to remake the bed every morning.

Very friendly and competent staffI've stayed at the same vacation site six years in a row and all six years have been wonderful. Family atmosphere.This makes me take time for myself and my family which I know I just wouldn't do if I didn't have a preset commitment.

review_text: Flamingo resort is closed in st.maarten so bad to go to Las Vegas to use the weeks I had..Hotel was fair.Flamingo has been closed too long..What do I get this year for my two weeks lost in st.maarten?

review_title: Do your research and shop for deals.
review_text: Unfortunately, we're caught in the timeshare nightmare. Maintenance fees continue to rise and true availability for where we'd like to go eludes us. It wouldn't be quite as bad if we hadn't spent so much money to "buy" the vacation time, but even the maintenance fees annually can readily exceed the cost of a comparable rental. No value here! Weighing any feasible options to just cut our losses and walk away from "investment".

I recently stayed on two occasions at the Sedona Summit. In both cases the accommodations were excellent. My first stay was in a two bedroom suite and my second stay was in a one bedroom. The rooms were tastefully decorated, spacious and had very functional floorplans. Onsite amenities included several pools and hot tubes spaced throughout the complex. One waterfall hot tube in particular had spectacular views of Sedona's red rocks. My friends and I enjoyed the West Sedona location and we will choose this resort again for a future stay.
It has been our experience that your sales and marketing practices are deceptive.  We were misled when we purchased.  Knowing what we know now we would never have joined Diamond.
Wonderful apartment room. beautifully decorated.  Nice staff.Spotlessly clean.  highly recommended.We stayed 1 night as was so near airport but will definitely return for a longer stay

The beds and chairs were extremely low, which is uncomfortable for persons with limited mobility.  I hope they will add more outlets and USB ports in easily accessible place as they remodel.
We always enjoy our January-February trip to Palm Desert. Reception always greets us with a welcome home smile. The resort is full but never seems crowded.

My partner and I spent a weekend at Diamond Resort in Kenmore in February . The cottage was above expectation, clean and cosy and had everything we needed. We didn't really use any other facilities on the resort. Reception were extremely friendly and helpful and we definitely plan to return in the future.

Went to Sedona Summit again. The biggest complaint, again, is the poor internet service. Very slow, kept dropping the connection. My other big complaint is every time I go to a resort I get harassed about attending a meeting. Please, ask once, if the person says no respect that answer.

review_text: The staff at Santa Fe resort were super helpful, very interested in our well being and satisfactory stay.  We would not hesitate to return or recommend this property to our friends and family.

review_title: I have two memberships with my home‚Ä¶
review_text: I have two memberships with my home resort.  I feel that my wife and I have a product that has been tremendously oversold.  Unhappy with all the necessary processes to reserve and use the units.  Why would it be necessary to phone a special line to have any hope of using what we have paid for.

review_title: We really enjoyed our Trip of a‚Ä¶
review_text: We really enjoyed our Trip of a Lifetime to Hawaii. We haven't had a chance to use any of our points otherwise so perhaps I'd give a higher rating once we have.

The resort is clean, parking is a rat race, cars to close together, can't get in or out.  Don't ever sit for a sales presentation, high pressure, rude, can spoil your vacation.  For the price, better places to stay.

review_title: Point at Poipu is Very Nice, Timeshare sells are not
review_text: As a timeshare, I cannot recommend Diamond Resorts since they always hard sell, lie, and cheat. I have only been to one of their resorts since I own there and have no desire to travel anywhere else. The specific resort, The Point at Poipu, in Kauai is very nice. There are things they could do better but overall I really enjoy going here year after year.
These people are VERY misleading and false promises! And will do anything to take your money! We I wish these people never bought out the interval company!

Every January we return to Sunset Harbour, Torviscas, Tenerife. Every year we enjoy a relaxing week or two looked after by the staff who from resort manager to gardener and especially reception, go out of their way to ensure we have another 'time to remember'.  Good food, good weather, clean and modern apartments - lovely pool and two bars / restaurants on site - what more could you wish for.

Last month we had the experience of a lifetime! We went on a "Diamond Dream Holiday" 3 week trip around the world. It was better than expected. All the flights and resorts were arranged for us and it worked out very well. We stayed in spacious luxury accommodations at each destination and felt spoiled at each one. The trip took us to: Maui (Hawaii), Bali (Indonesia), Dubai (UAE), and Lisbon (Portugal). Wow, it was the probably the most interesting  and best vacation we have ever had. We kept saying to ourselves along the way, "Can you believe we're here?" We picked up so many fascinating things, mementos, and souvenirs that we had to buy an extra suitcase to bring them all home! We are still talking about this trip and looking again at all the pictures we took. Thank you Diamond Resorts!

review_title: If you have an issue they can find a‚Ä¶
review_text: If you have an issue they can find a solution.  I am very pleased with responsiveness.

review_title: We stayed at the Grand Kona Lodge
review_text: We stayed at the Grand Kona Lodge.  Staff at front desk not helpful or friendly.   Rooms sparsely furnished with old mattress and not in good condition.  The location is beautiful.  Just needs some updates and training on customer service.

review_title: I am not a diamond resorts owner but‚Ä¶
review_text: I am not a diamond resorts owner but got a week stay in Aruba in what I am guessing was a Diamond property.  For being in the low rise section, it was actually nicer than I had expected. Staff was great and friendly/helpful. But honestly you are in Aruba so how can you not love it there?  The only thing I can do without is being approached constantly by people offering me a free dinner to listen to their timeshare pitch.

we have stayed in 2 different beautiful resorts. Both times we invited family members. We selected 2 bedrooms. The rooms were beautiful, more like apartments, each had fully equipped kitchens. Living room, dining room, washer and dryer.  It was truly home away from home.  Planning our next trip soon, can‚Äôt wait to see the next resort!

Living room furniture very uncomfortable.  Would like to see recliners in the units. That's what people have in their homes. Slow check in process. Would like housekeeping at least once during a week stay without having to pay for it.

review_title: I have been on hold waiting to talk to‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been on hold waiting to talk to someone so far now 20 minutes! I was suppose to receive info on my trip, but never was told I had to fill out  medical , personal info and other items, that If I had not called earlier and talked to Leslie And asked why I had not received my Itinerary .she informed me of the lack of info that was needed and after she gets it would send me the info!  I was calling her back to see if she had gotten my Email and after 20 minutes another computer message said to leave name and phone and we would be in touch but give you 72 hours!

review_title: Lake Tahoe Vacation Resort, Will Come Again
review_text: Lake Tahoe Vacation Resort is a very nice facility with great staff.  6 floors with two elevators.  We like to cook in and the kitchen is well equipped, although a little smaller than other DRI resorts.  We had a one bedroom suite and it was very comfortable, with excellent climate control, a gas burning fireplace, small balcony, very comfortable king bed.  One bedrooms are paired up so they can be opened to each other.  However, unlike other lockoffs, there is a common keycard door off the hallway, into a "mantrap" entryway, with another keycard door for each A and B suite.  Kind of a nuisance to get into your room each time.  Not a show stopper, but awkward trying to open the inner key card door as the outer door springs closed behind you.  Unique indoor/outdoor connected pool with curtain in between.  Restaurant, bar on site.  Small weight room with several machines.  Self parking on site fills up, so free valet parking is provided.  This parking lot is off site.  We generally don't like valet parking, but response time to get our car was usually within 4 or 5 minutes of calling the valet from our room, which worked out well.  All staff were professional and courteous.  Overall, a very nice experience.  We will come again.
Very basic hotel-like accommodations for a luxury price.

overall great experiences.  The two negatives: web site very difficult to navigate.  Also when you are on hold via phone, The delayed announcement getting through to a representative very frustrating, constant conversation how great Diamond Resorts is, rather than music.  We would not be a member if we did not think they were great!
Great staff! Great time! Great vacation and can‚Äôt wait to return!

review_title: We love being with Diamond Resorts
review_text: We love being with Diamond Resorts! The benefits of being at the Platinum Level are amazing. No other timeshare company will treat you like family like Diamond Resorts. The locations that you can travel to, the people you meet, and the family-friendly atmosphere is bar none.

My family uses our points by Cruising around the World ( amazing ) - we able to visits different countries on an 8 days cruise , able to visits 4 Islands of Hawaii on a 2 weeks cruising as well , we love ‚ù§Ô∏èüõ≥it , looking forward on next year 2020 Carnival Panorama Cruise for Mexico ( 7 days)& not to mention we enjoy staying in different places / countries in using our points # Diamond Resort International üëçüôèüòç
family friendly, comfortable and secure!
Beautiful Resort with excellent customer service oriented staff and services!
Fantastic stay!!!!!!! Nice and clean! We had a wonderful time.
Very good! I and my family had great times there. Unfortunately we had a little problem with bugs in the room, but nothing big.

Clean 2 Bdrm Condo. Bathroom fan did not work, very steamy after a shower. Internet did not work. Spent over 2 hours throughout the vacation with front desk and Spectrum, trying to get internet working. Finally fixed the day before we left. Stayed 7 days. Just an average resort. 15-20 minute drive to parks or 35-40 to Universal. Long drive when traffic is bad on 192.

Perhaps things will improve but since our vacation club, Embarc, joined in with the Diamond Resorts company, there have been some growing pains.  Recently when trying to book a cruise, we were shuffled around to various locations in N. America and some had no idea what Embarc was or how the point structure worked.  We were able to book a Holland-America cruise to the Baltic countries next fall but it took some difficulty to find a customer service rep who understood our request.

review_title: hate going on vacation to get away from‚Ä¶
review_text: hate going on vacation to get away from the pressures of life only to be pressured in high tactic sales.  NO is NO!

Diamond Resorts are all beautiful. I would rate them 5 stars except for their insistence that you go to their ‚Äúupdate meetings‚Äùthat are only sales pitches. If you say ‚ÄòNO‚Äù they keep calling you. In Daytona I was called the next day that would be at a certain time after I said I wasn‚Äôt interested.
IGNORE TEXT

I annually return to the resort at which I am an owner.  The staff are excellent (front desk, Maintenance, Housekeeping).  Love my home resort.  Any other Diamond resorts that I have had the pleasure to stay at have been great too. I own at Parkway International but have stayed at Liki Tiki and Grand Vacation and always had pleasant experiences.
maint. fees are high and some what limited in available resorts.

review_title: Embarc in Blue Mountain is a preferred destination!
review_text: Embarc in Blue Mountain is a Diamond resort and it deserves that name. From the moment you register, till the moment you leave, there is a real attempt to make you feel at home. If you call the front desk, there is an immediate pleasant response. If you need anything, they are right there with it. The kitchen is well-equipped and the whole unit is comfortable and inviting. The gas fireplace is a nice touch, and the King-sized bed in our suite was extremely comfortable. Blue Mountain Village is a very short distance away with wonderful shops and restaurants. Georgian Bay is also close by, as is the town of Collingwood. I will definitely return to Embarc in this location.

review_title: I have been to Polo Towers in Vegas Turtle Cay in Virginia Beach
review_text: I have been to Polo Towers in Vegas twice in the last year.  I would love a small bar and snack bar at the pool.  Other than that, fabulous location, and nice suites.  Also went to Turtle Cay in Virginia Beach.  Lots of maintenance issues here, slow to fix some of our issues, good with other fixes.  If we had had no issues, the resort was small, great pool area, and the suites were nice.No matter what location owners go to: prior to check in, at check in and at your stay you are constantly HOUNDED to go to a meeting which is not called a sales meeting, but basically that is all this meeting is - but dubbed as a meeting to give you the newest and greatest information about Diamond.  I was hounded even though I had been to several meetings in the last 18 months.  It used to be that you were not bothered if you had been to a meeting in the last year.  I find this very disappointing.  Low rating is due to this

Beachwood / Kitty Hawk NCThe property had good location, tucked in wooed area near the beach (5 min slow drive) with private parking area at beach. The accommodations and facilities were nice enough with quiet spacious units. It has a beautiful large outdoor pool area. It has a nice big indoor water park setup which is great for kids.My MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT was when we checked in for our Memorial Day vacation week stay we discovered the outdoor pool was only going to be open for the checkin day, then CLOSED for the remainder of our stay. This was a MAJOR BUMMER since I checked the web site before booking which stated the pool would open for the season on Memorial Day. The front desk was taking all the complaints for this (which they had nothing to do with) in a very polite manner. The site management had months of time to prepare and be ready to have the pool open but failed to accomplish that.Other than that, just a few small issues. - Some roaches in the bedrooms, which I am sure are due to being in a heavily wooded environment. - The tennis court fences had years of poison Ivey vines covering them (a gallon or roundup would solve). -The electronic drive through entry gate was a nuisance since you had to have your card key within an inch of the reader to stand a chance of it working.   - The front desk checkin took 20 mins since they only had one young lady who was working hard to move folks through, even though there were other employees in offices hidden from view.

We were "ripped off" by Diamond.  I tried unsuccessfully to cancel our membership after many, many phone calls and a lack of getting answers in a timely manner.  Any "newbies" considering Diamond Resorts should think TWICE!!!!! before purchasing a membership.  WE made use of the points "given us" and a salesman at the place where we took our vacation was VERY unfriendly.  The "new member orientation" that we were required to attend was nothing but yet another attempt so sell even more to us.  NO INFORMATION was imparted to us.
Small quiet resort ideal for relaxing with a lovely on site restaurant.

review_title: It is simply too expensive in‚Ä¶
review_text: We are 18 year members from Sunterra (bought out by Diamond).VERY Experienced. The people at the resorts are generally wonderful, and most properties are very nice. But that would be true no matter how we booked it. You can almost always find rooms available on HOTELS.COM. It just makes NO FINACIAL SENSE. It is the WORST financial choice you can make.It is simply too expensive in maintenance fees considering we already spent over $35,000 originally (2001-much more expensive now). We have calculated that just the Maint fees average out to $152/night each year. We can get close to those prices by simply booking directly with the properties or similar properties as a hotel. And, the only way to reduce our fees with the new plan being offered is to BUY MORE points at exorbitant rates. As a direct example, Kaanapali Beach Club Maui costs us $1207/week with points, and $1503 booking directly on HOTELS.COM.  Invest $35,000 over 18 years to save $900/year. How is that smart? Plus, it is often impossible to get the resorts you want without booking 10 months ahead.AS a seasoned Diamond veteran,  I advise:- Do not EVER believe what the salesman says. They blatantly lie to get you to sign. Every time. - Do not EVER attend a "membership update". They are simply high pressure sales presentations that eat up precious vacation time.- If you do a presentation, tell them you will stand up and leave at 90 minutes and will want your "gift" then. AND THEN DO IT!- When booking a resort add in the comments "NO SALES PRESENTATIONS!" And then repeat that at the front desk and again at the Diamond Welcome desk (they will always refer you to). A true story:At one resort (Cypress Pointe Resort Orlando Florida Feb 19 2017) the front desk gave our keys to the "Diamond Guy" who REFUSED to give us our keys until we talked to him. Then when we told him our British friends were waiting outside, he left us and pressured our friends to come in to the office with us. My wife stomped back to the front desk and (in front of dozens checking in) started screaming that we were being detained against our will and demanded to talk to the manager about pressing charges. That got their attention and we finally got our keys and went to our room.DO NOT BUY!

review_title: We have had nothing but trouble with‚Ä¶
review_text: We have had nothing but trouble with Diamond Resort since we decided to try it last fall. We haven‚Äôt even gone on a vacation yet . We went to Branson, Mo for a short weekend January 2019 to learn how to use the app. And how Diamond works. It was supposed to be a 1hr or 2 and it turned into a sales pitch that lasted all day! We didn‚Äôt even get to go site seeing or to dinner. Then we called Diamond up and complained, they had us come back in and talk to them and this time we were talked into being owners but they made it sound like it would be much more then we were paying now and that we should of been offered this at the beginning but weren‚Äôt. They didn‚Äôt say anything about the maintenance fee going up and that we would be expected to come up with that money in just two short months! We have shelled out so much money to them and we keep getting the run around. We have left countless voicemails for people that we have talked and nobody gets back to us. Well a couple of weeks ago we talked to a lady Shelbey Knapp and she explained what we weren‚Äôt told and tired to get the maintenance fee into payment options instead of a lump sum of more then $2800 . Turns out this is still not fixed and we called yesterday and she is on vacation and the person covering was supposed to fix it. As of today it still isn‚Äôt fixed and we can‚Äôt even take our 1st vacation this June until it‚Äôs cleared up!!! Diamond Resorts need to do better training there employees to be on the same page across the board!!!! Nobody knows what‚Äôs going on.

review_title: The great majority of the resorts are‚Ä¶
review_text: The great majority of the resorts are great, but some could use normal wear and tear repairs.

review_title: Service is wonderful and very helpful
review_text: Service is wonderful and very helpful! Condo was very nice and clean - I would love to stay again, but would like to try to stay close to the beach. Our Unit was far enough back we really could only see the building next to us on our balcony. Otherwise everything was great!

review_title: Was much better before it was bought‚Ä¶
review_text: Was much better before it was bought out. Now they have high pressure sales and charge owners more at some resorts that you can rent it for

review_title: Have stayed at several Diamond resorts
review_text: Have stayed at several Diamond resorts.   Have always loved their location, services  and staff.
The resorts have always been outstanding, comfortable and welcoming.  They are a great home away from home.

I was told when I first bought into Diamond "we're different not like all the others"..  I'm here to tell you they are!!!!  Everytime I stay at Diamond their high pressure sales agents attack as soon as you check in.  I've have asked several times not to be approached and that I wasn't interested in buying more points and they still hit me when I check in and call several times during our stay  I understand they are trying to get you to buy more points, but when a customer continues to say no over and over again it's just plain annoying
IGNORE TEXT

We always enjoy our time at Mont Tremblant.The staff is very friendly and efficient. We have a favourite room and they do their best to help us.We always get help with our luggage, etc. as we are usually staying anywhere from 5 days to almost two weeks.My friend and I are both members and this enables us to travel several times a year.Tremblant is our favourite because it is in driving distance from Kingston, Ontario.We have been to Whistler, Panorama, Ucluelet, Blue Mountain and have been very satisfied with all the resorts.Donna North

review_title: We were in Cabo the end of March‚Ä¶
review_text: We were in Cabo the end of March beginning of April and as yearly visits there had a wonderful time.  Staff amazing and accommodations excellent as always. Heading back next March.
I love Diamond Resorts. I visit Kohls Ranch 3 or 4 times a year always an Excellant experience

Hello, I am a new owner under  Monarch. I was paid up for the year. Now I‚Äôm in the negative and rising. Why? Because I didn‚Äôt receive any statement or email regarding the quarterly fees. Till last week by certified mail. Saying I owed $200 +  as of 5/16/19. I get the letter on 6/1/19. I call on 6/3/19 YOU SAY I OWE over $350. And can‚Äôt usr my points that have been paid for. WHAT KIND OF. BS IS THIS?
Staff friendly & professional. Had a great time.

review_title: I had  Excellent time   My fiance and I
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Wonderful place, great location, staff was excellent!!

review_title: I have stayed at Sunrise Ridge twice‚Ä¶
review_text: I have stayed at Sunrise Ridge twice this year the room are extremely nice and well kept. Amenities & grounds are always in great shape, and the stall is friendly and helpful>
Very nice place. Had all the amenities I was looking for at a very reasonable price.Would definitely visit again.

review_title: Diamond has been an absolute nightmare‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond has been an absolute nightmare of a company to be associated with. Our experienced with Diamond has been filled with "updates" that was one minute told we had to attend to the next minute not mandatory. We have barely used the timeshare and some of that time included our guests not being able to use it.  We have spoken to a representative and asked her for guidance on getting out of the timeshare and instead of her sharing some insight she insisted that we were to blame and that we should have read the contract better. I'm not saying we aren't to blame we should have read the contract better but Diamond needs to take some type of responsibility here and train their sales members to not be so pushy and dishonest when it comes to making a sale. We would like to reach out to Diamond one more time and try to resolve the solution and situation before reaching other sources outside of Diamond for help. Can someone email us and get us some help, can the people at Diamond finally have compassion? We will find out.

review_title: Our unit was sorely in need of‚Ä¶
review_text: Our unit was sorely in need of maintenance updates - frayed couch, cabinets needing painting, shower and bath grout in poor shape.  Diamond is also cutting costs by only supplying one dishwasher soap packet and no hair conditioner.  Definitely going downhill from our previous stays.  Queen bed in one bedroom instead of a king.  They needed to check the internet and gave us a 3 day window of time, so we all had to wake up and be dressed before 9am while I am on vacation and want to sleep in.
Very aggressive, dishonest

review_title: 3 weeks in Maui and the entire vacation‚Ä¶
review_text: 3 weeks in Maui and the entire vacation was outstanding. Thank you Diamond for the beautiful stay and experience

review_title: We are holidaying in Vilar do golf
review_text: We are holidaying in Vilar do golf, Quinta do lago, Almancil , Portugal. We have been here two days, excellent accommodation, service first class.We attended a meeting with a Diamond resort employee for an update, we are here on the last holiday on a Silver Sampler deal. We have been disappointed on previous holidays within this deal, the accommodation was poor quality, not consistent to what Diamond resorts claim to be the norm. I would not buy any more products on this basis,the sampler surely would give you a true insight of what to expect. At the meeting today we were under the assumption that it was an update for 2019, not so. The diamond resort employee went through the whole sales pitch, and at the end when we said we would not be buying anymore points told us to ‚Äúenjoy our package holidays‚Äù Poor behaviour, very disappointed with this person
Web site is difficult to use.
Great service
Resort in Tennessee was great....sunrise ridge.

One of the most exasperating experiences I have experienced at two Diamond resorts in the past few months is that of waiting to check in after arriving an hour or so earlier than the official check in time. Some staff seem to enjoy making members wait, without any reason, to actually get in to their room. In Florida, we not only waited, we waited until 8:30 pm to get in to our suite.

review_title: Open, Trustworthy, I don't think so
review_text: With such a great number of constantly growing complaints, why is it that it seems that Diamond Resorts seems to refuse to resolve them? Many of which are from Platinum complaints, there cr√®me de la cr√®me or at least that‚Äôs the way they are spoken about during a sales presentation. Many of these Platinum members have submitted complaints filing with numerous States Attorney and Federal agencies such as Attorney Generals, the Better Business Bureau, and Real Estate Boards. Why does Diamond allow their front line sales representatives to use bait and switch sales tactics, pencil pitches, and promoting non-existing programs during the sales presentations? These sales representatives are paid commissions by Diamond and therefore shouldn‚Äôt Diamond be held responsible for their actions and promises? Diamond fails to care about their loyal members for reasons to what appear to be growing the bottom line. If Diamond cared about the people as they claim and respond with nothing, shouldn‚Äôt they be investigated for their growing number of complaints?  If they have nothing to hide, them they should open the doors to address these complaints filed with regulators and consumer agencies. Consumers please do your own research before agreeing to attend any Diamond presentations. The Buyer Beware flag has been raised by many others and should be on high alert before ever considering buying any Diamond Timeshare. Diamond although clearly published in many documents does NOT offer Clarity, Transparency, and concise programs as they have stated. This input provided from a consumer who has recently attended a Diamond Sales Update.

OLD & dirty. The bathrooms were old and a lot of rusty hinges. Doors were either paint chipped or warped. The patio was dirty and had to use towels on the chairs. I can't remember what the light situation was in the master toilet room, but you had to turn the main light on which was in the combo bedroom/bath.

High powered lying sales associates. Never buy a Sampler as you have to go to a very pressured promising all things that are mostly not true just to suck you in yo buy. Maintenance fees are over $3,000 per year. Just saying.

review_title: Haven‚Äôt used them / should never have‚Ä¶
review_text: Haven‚Äôt used them / should never have joined- we want OUT!
No qualms. They are legit.

Facility was great!  Clean and relaxing.  Personnel were helpful, friendly, and courteous!! Very pleasant experience except for the thinly veiled "Update"  which as always was just a long drawn out sales pitch in which they ignored their own promise of "No More Than One Hour!  We Promise" and pretty much ignored our need to leave after one hour because we had grandchildren waiting to participate in their activities for the day.  Only after several 'reminders' that we needed to leave and standing up for a full 10 minutes or more did the sales person figure out that I was not interested in buying more points as I had told him at the very beginning.  I did have questions but even though the receptionist had me write them down before hand and gave them to the salesman they were never addressed.  Pretty much spoiled the day of a long awaited vacation for us and the grandchildren!

review_title: Too many meetings taking too much time‚Ä¶
review_text: Too many meetings taking too much time out of enjoyable experience. Hopefully the next meeting we will be going to will be the last. Going to same resort we went to earlier this year. Otherwise rooms are nice.

review_title: Rooms are small as they would be in a‚Ä¶
review_text: Rooms are small as they would be in a historic inn and the Internet access was intermittent. But they are working on an upgrade to get that corrected. That you Gilmore group for the great deal you gave me. Next time I come back I promise to spend more money there.

review_title: Good access to lots of destinations
review_text: Good access to lots of destinations, but need to stop trying to force me to attend "owner update" sales meetings every time I check in.  If I don't stop at concierge desk when I check in I get multiple calls.

Very good cruise.  Went to the Caribbean.  Very hot there this time of year.  Shows had good talented performers but we didn't enjoy the musical shows because we could not identify with the songs that were sung.  Onboard food was very good and waiting staff were great.  Carnival Breeze stateroom was large and comfortable with two large windows which allowed us to observe the ocean.  Nice large bathroom.  Plenty of storage room.  Debarking the ship was a nightmare however and needs to be improved.

review_title: Deceived by the oral presentation of‚Ä¶
review_text: Deceived by the oral presentation of salesman.  All resorts have been very nice, but I will never give Diamond more than a 1 star rating after my experience with our last salesman.  We are top tier owners and have had good experiences over a couple of decades.  But they have lost all my trust.

Santa Fe, New Mexico is a great city to visit.  We went in the off -season so it was not too crowded but there was still a lot of art to see and fun/good places to eat.  The unit was nice and we appreciated the elevator service which many time shares do not have.  We could cook and do our laundry in our unit and the furniture was comfortable.  There were 2 things that we did not like - the parking was limited but manageable and, like all time shares, there is no desk or nice place to set up a computer which everyone travels with these days.  So a portion of the dining table became a desk and that created some clutter.  Also would prefer two sinks in the bathroom but that too can be managed.
Excellent option for travel. Like a home away from home.

review_title: I will not recommend DRI to anyone‚Ä¶
review_text: I will not recommend DRI to anyone until they come up with a fair end game strategy for those whose situation has changed ( eg age) and it is necessary to terminate their contract.  When will you have such a program?Title:  Need end game program.

review_title: I love going to Scottsdale Villa‚Ä¶
review_text: I love going to Scottsdale Villa Mirage.  It seems like it is taking an unusual long time to bring the resort up to date.  This past winter they were working on all the ADA requirements. That is a good thing. The units NEED to be updated.  I know that at the end of the winter season In 2020 they are going to start redoing them, but it will be years before they are complete.  My background is hotel business so I know all about budgets etc, but we always had plans ahead of time meeting the needs of the Franchises.  This is just a comment because I LOVE going there.  All departments are always very friendly.  Front desk employees make you feel like you are part of a family.  The manager is a great asset to the resort. Looking forward to seeing the resort completely renovated.

Horrible vacation and product. The sales people are pushy as hell, and other members in the company acknowledge and speak poorly of the sales people, but don't care and let you know it's your fault. You are trapped in owning the vacation and can't get out of it. You get no equity. All fees constantly go up each year. Your best bet is to be an old person and just die before you pay it off (except whoever inherits your debt). Properties are garbage, overly priced, and located outside major vacation cities (minus a very selective few). They constantly make you think its mandatory to go to "membership reviews" when really they are selling you more points. No one will help teach you how to use the platform. Extremely unprofessional. No physical locations to confront - your best bet would be to go to a location and MAYBE, just maybe you'll find a helpful person, but everyone is non-knowledgeable. I would love to see this company get fined and shutdown
I enjoyed it with much pleasure. I hope I can have more chances to enjoy and relax at Diamond Resorts chains. Thanks a lot!

review_title: My last trip was to Branson
review_text: My last trip was to Branson.  The resort was well maintained and the staff was great.  The room was excellent.  I would go back again.  I am very happy with Diamond and have a lot of great vacations at Diamond properties.
Not enough information to rate.  My experience has been with Intrawest and I would rate that experience much higher.

Great place to stay. Close to all I was looking for in a resort. All the staff was first class. I have been in the hospitality industry for years, and I was impressed. The only reason for the 4 stars? It‚Äôs an older property and could use a new set of earrings. I have stayed here for years and will continue in future visits.
I am selling my timeshare. I have not heard from Diamond Resorts in a month. Plus you keep sending information to my dead sister,Johnnie. My name is still on the paperwork as Diane Alvarado.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: The st Louis group is awesome‚Ä¶
review_text: The st Louis group is awesome people.but I wouldn't say that about Branson or Florida people. St Louis treated us with respect and honesty.

review_title: Great resorts and flexibility with the‚Ä¶
review_text: Great resorts and flexibility with the different vacation options. Maintenance fees are to high so you can not afford to buy more points. Misleading sales presentations leave you frustrated and wanting to unload your time share. In the sales presentations they tell you one thing only to find out that it is a half true. I don‚Äôt mind spending money for a quality product, but don‚Äôt misrepresent the facts in order to close the deal. I can say that I have had some great vacations and opportunities with Diamond. Just wish that that they would be more transparent

review_title: Nice convenient resort to Sedona area
review_text: Nice convenient resort to Sedona area. Great location and amenities.
Working with Fawn Rangel was easy and convenient.

review_title: My boyfriend and I have visited three‚Ä¶
review_text: My boyfriend and I have visited three different locations and have enjoyed them all. We can't wait until the next adventure.

I have been on many vacations with my Diamond Points and I have never had a bad experience with any of the resorts.  Having said that, the resort in Lake Tahoe more than met our expectations.  The customer service of the entire staff from top to bottom was exceptional.  I am one that notices when customer service is lacking, and this staff enhanced our stay so much that we look forward to going back.  Kudos to the management staff for a job well done.

review_title: I am very pleased with Diamond everyone‚Ä¶
review_text: I am very pleased with Diamond everyone was helpful and nice

Every time we go to a presentation they screw it up. when we try to use the complimentary stays you give us there is always a catch. While I like the properties we stay at there is always a hassle involved in either making the reservation or the location of our room or the presentation.
resort was good.  don't appreciate Diamond update meetings every time we vacation.
Good location. Nice facilities.  Concierge was very helpful All staff was very friendly  and courteous.
NEVER EVER buy a timeshare!!!They will never have the availability you wantWHEN you want it.

review_title: I feel like I've been had
review_text: I feel like I've been had. I paid a huge amount of money to become a member with large yearly maintenance fees yet the general public can get the same condos often at the same price or less than the maintenance fees that I pay without having had to invest a penny to become a member. And the public can cancel up to 24 hours in advance and get a full reimbursement whereas I have to do it 30 days in advance. And often I cannot get a condo even 11 months in advance in high season yet I can get the same condo at the same resort on Expedia just a fews weeks ahead of time!

The Suites of Falls Creek, Branson, Missouri.  Building placement varies your enjoyment greatly, and staff acts like their hands are tied and they can't help you, but the map is available online to help with building selection.The Cove on Ormond Beach, Florida.  ADA room for handicap and great accessibility to pool & beach.Desert Paradise Resort, Las Vegas.  Quiet, great pool & happy staff.Beachwoods Resort, Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.  Building placement will vary your enjoyment, but terrific for large group & family.  Super cool bouncy playground outdoors for small children, and nature trail for adults.Powhattan, Williamsburg, Virginia.  Great for families, fun activities, and easy to satellite around to historic locations.
Total misrepresentation and disrespect for our time and sincerity
Terrible experience with the high pressure time share sales.
Most facilitate equivalent to a 3 star hotel or condo.The personnel are typically friendly and helpful but the intrusive, regular presence of sales people detracts from the vacation experience.
Beautiful Venues and wonderful activities!  Professional staff and personnel!  Hospitality, second to none!  Memories are awaiting!Good Luck!

Availability is often poor so booking places is a lottery. Often better to get the same accommodation through third parties like Booking.com. Don‚Äôt like the tier scheme nor deviating away from accommodation to offer flights etc which are cheaper elsewhere. Used to be good value but becoming less so.

review_title: Polynesian Isles Resorts is the best‚Ä¶
review_text: Polynesian Isles Resorts is the best and Diamond Resorts and their employees are so excellent!! Nothing but GOOD!! Dean McAllister

After joining in 2018, we still can not book or research  anything on line. The system shows us not members until 2020. Pretty MESSED Up That NO One Can Fix It AFTER Paying Almost $100, 000. I would never join again that's for sure.
Beautiful resorts and excellent locations.

review_title: It is always a pleasure to visit Mystic‚Ä¶
review_text: It is always a pleasure to visit Mystic Dunes.

As a platinum member I would like to receive an update on the company, programs and new properties With Out any sales activity at all.  I don't need $100 for coming or anything, so just tell me what is happening.  We will not buy anymore points since we have 100000.  More cruises with longer lead time would be nice to have.

Confusing ... LOTS of details to remember, without any single document summarizing them concisely.  Plus different business agreement types, with multiple agreements for a single client sometimes.  Also it is confusing as to who to contact, since there are several different organizational units, with each handling different type services.  Once on vacation, everything has been well done, though.
Whenever I had the pleasure of staying at a Diamond Resort, I have been pleased. Thank you so much!

review_title: We have found the resorts themselves‚Ä¶
review_text: We have found the resorts themselves are very nice and staff is friendly.  The sales team or sometimes called owner's agents are pushy, demeaning, and often gruff.  If you decide not to purchase more points or upgrade, they become rude and make you talk to three more people after you have said the words NO THANK  YOU.!We will never sit in on an owner update again. 4 starts were for the resorts themselves - not a five as you get too many sales phone calls.

I have been a Diamond member (or their predecessors) for many years and have never had a bad holiday with them. In particular the points based system is far more flexible and easier to use than having fixed weeks.
The resort was fine.  Our disappointment with Diamond Resorts is poor communication and the complicated rules for using points.

review_title: Very helpful in all ways except the‚Ä¶
review_text: Very helpful in all ways except the transfer week from another timeshare

review_title: We have stayed at 3 diamond resorts and‚Ä¶
review_text: We have stayed at 3 diamond resorts and have found then all to be excellent. We stayed on the sampler program which no longer exists. The units were all clean and well appointed. While we were required to attend presentations, they were reasonable and professional. Best of all, we were otherwise not bothered. There were no calls during our stays and the info tendered upon check in was useful. We stayed at the Greensprings Resort near Williamsburg, The Cove at Ormond Beach, and Sedona Summit.

review_title: My family and I have enjoyed many‚Ä¶
review_text: My family and I have enjoyed many vacations through our ownership of Diamond Resorts .

review_title: Some resorts are 5 stars but all‚Ä¶
review_text: Some resorts are 5 stars but all resorts are at least 4.

review_title: Cabot azula  is very expensive and you‚Ä¶
review_text: Cabot azula  is very expensive and you can only pay thru your room .you can book a stay from a travel  agent  and it would cost less that been a member  of the time share

review_title: The 2 bedroom suite is the best
review_text: The 2 bedroom suite is the best. The 1 bedroom suite is not. The push for timeshare ownership is annoying. You don't have to hard sell something people want.

review_title: We enjoyed our stay very much
review_text: We enjoyed our stay very much.  We will do it again.

review_title: Overall the experience was great but‚Ä¶
review_text: Overall the experience was great but timeshare hustle was too pushy for my liking

review_title: Enjoyed the resort and all the people‚Ä¶
review_text: Enjoyed the resort and all the people there, but at the sales presentation, the salesman lied to us.

review_title: We often have a difficult time finding‚Ä¶
review_text: We often have a difficult time finding a vacation spot to use our points on, and are not interested in buying more points either. Discouraging. We use our points locally because we live in a resort area, but it isn‚Äôt what how we thought we could use them, and that is what is disappointing.

Quality and standard of accommodation is very good. However, the company focus always appears to be to get more money out of existing members! Very few membership enhancements come without the need to buy more points.

review_title: Resorts very good; Sales staff not
review_text: I would have scored 5 based on the value and experience of the actual resorts but, sadly, the attitude of the Sales staff is the reason for the lower rating.  We had been members for a number of years but were told in October 2017 that we either had to increase our points portfolio - or leave.  We could not justify increasing the number of points, therefore, had to leave in 2018.  I feel, also, that having been given this ultimatum it was completely unreasonable and unfair to then have to pay and additional 2 years' management fees for the 'privilege' of leaving - a step we had not wished to take but were given no option.

review_title: The stay was amazing and beautiful.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I enjoyed my stay at Fairway Forest‚Ä¶
review_text: I enjoyed my stay at Fairway Forest (Diamond). The unit was spacious and well kept, and the reception and sales people were warm and welcoming.A friend who is not very mobile joined me for several days, and she had a bit of trouble with the steps down to our unit. This was no major problem and I simply helped her navigate the steps. The upper level deck was especially pleasant for idly sipping coffee and relaxing with the surrounding forest.I do have a considerable complaint with the excessive "Amenities Fee" of $14.00 per day. We are 88 years old, and had no interest in the various resort amenities, plus my opinion that the mandatory  fee should be an option for guests who USE the amenities. It is just a money grab. I knew from the RCI web site that the fee is charged, but I did find my time at Sapphire Valley was quite pleasant.

review_title: Very nice resort to stay at and will‚Ä¶
review_text: Very nice resort to stay at and will stay again. Seem to have some new staff that are not so knowledgeable. Furniture in rooms is showing wear but still great to be there.

review_title: Its was a very pleasant time there
review_text: Its was a very pleasant time there. The employes are very accessibles , the apartment is large, well furnished and comfortable. In general it corresponded to my, and my family expectatives.
accommodations are very nice.  getting the time you want can be a challenge

review_title: We had a wonderful experience with‚Ä¶
review_text: We had a wonderful experience with Julio Aca of OVC when he booked us 6 cabins on Princess Cruises. He was courteous, knowledgeable, and patient with us. We would like to see Diamond Resorts email the owners once in a while to remind us about where points can be used. Thanks.
Good resorts.  Don‚Äôt like ongoing sales pressure to buy more.

review_title: Two thumbs down for Diamond Resorts
review_text: I owned a time share in Orlando FL for 19 years (2000-2019). I was lucky enough to be one of the few allowed to rescind a DR time share. As a result, I lost every penny invested in my Orlando timeshare. I could no longer take the constant sales pressure, lies, and increased maintenance fees from Diamond Resorts. Also, I did not want my three kids to inherit a HUGE PROBLEM! I rather book my own Hotel or Airbnb and enjoy a vacation without a time consuming conference, sales pressure and disrespect. Two thumbs down for Diamond Resorts. üëéüèºüëéüèº What a waste of money this was. The worst investment I ever made. üò°

Unfortunately although we have stayed on numerous  occasions  we were looking forward to bringing my granddaughter. However, this time is a Let down we asked for a room near the pool ground floor by a room up two flight of stairs then. When we got in the apartment another flight of stairs. Very dangerous for children. Also we could hear the music  which was very loud. They did offer to move us but wanted to charge us 30 Euro cleaning fee.  The young man who spoke to me was extremely rude and abrupt whereas the young lady  was more accommodating. This is such a shame as my granddaughter loves it here. We were thinking of coming later in the year - but we are having second thoughts.

review_title: I love our timeshare but it certainly‚Ä¶
review_text: I love our timeshare but it certainly not for everyone.
Much better than previous presentations, however there was still a strong push and not entirely accurate information.
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Our stay at Diamond Resort in Orlando‚Ä¶
review_text: Our stay at Diamond Resort in Orlando was outstanding! Our condo was cleaned and stocked efficiently with everything we needed,I recommend this resort to my family and friends when I know the are planning a trip to Disney World.

review_title: We have been members for 20 years and‚Ä¶
review_text: We have been members for 20 years and have been very happy with all the many places we have traveled and used our points.
Pay A LOT of money to be Platinum owners......Loyalty service is mediocre at best.  Fully expecting an Apollo dump soon.

review_title: My stay was good but the rewards given‚Ä¶
review_text: My stay was good but the rewards given for attending a sales pitch were not.  That 7 day stay that only gives a 60 day window for booking is basically useless.

Diamond has beautiful properties.  We use our membership regularly.  The check in/out process is always good. It's the sales process that is very challenging.  My wife and I will never attend an owner's update or sales presentation again.  No matter the nice deals or gifts or a "VIP" check in, It was 3 hours out of our Hawaii vacation, and we were already owners who have bought!  When I have escalated these experiences, no one responds or cares.  I would have to go all the way to the top president, and even then I may not get results.

review_title: I am not a member of Diamond Resorts
review_text: I am not a member of Diamond Resorts, but of Embarc.So far their handling of Embarc members is less than stellar
Spotlessly clean .well equipped, tranquil area .peace and quiet

review_title: The resorts are terrific and the‚Ä¶
review_text: The resorts are terrific and the associates and we have stayed in over 10 different resorts.But every time you check in, you are harassed to attend a update meeting (We all know it is a sales presentation). My wife an I have been humiliated in the past by  the sales people, and this is not just one occasion. Will never, ever attend another sales presentation.....

It is not easy to request dates normally reserved but I can find on line on websites such as Travelocity, hotels.com and etc. Very frustrating! Ask in advance to reserve certain cabin come to check in it is not available! Since we are members we should have an earlier window to check in and not have to wait until "check in time". Cleaniness in in rooms cabins are not what they used to be I have submitted concerns with an edited feedback.
Beautiful facility in Maui, right on the beach.  Food and drink was excellent and with a lengthy Happy Hour, priced reasonably! Lots of activities. The room was superb as well.
Stayed at Pawhutan Resort.  Check-in was efficient, but units need some tender loving care.  Need some renovations and upgrading.

review_title: We were sold timeshare points on the‚Ä¶
review_text: We were sold timeshare points on the basis of shared ownership, and with the guarantee that the company would buy them back if we ever wanted to sell them.   The implication was also that they were a solid investment.  Since Diamond has taken over, these points have become virtually worthless - in fact we can often find places to rent in the same resorts for less than the maintenance fees we pay on our points.
Facilities great and unique. Staff were wonderful day and night.

Awful company. The sales reps lie about everything. Really hard to use your points because they want you to keep buying more. We have regretted buying and tried to sell our points back to the company. We were told that in order to sell we would have to get under a new contract which had that provision. And of course a new contract would require we purchase more points. All of this was a bunch of lies. When we contacted them to sell we were told they didn‚Äôt buy points back.

ONE WEEK IN ORLANDOSUPER PLACE NEAR ALL SERVICES
