Horrible experience with the sales.  Was literally lied to at one property, and conned into paying to ‚Äúfix it‚Äù.  Reality it was not ‚Äúbroken‚Äù, but their people got a commission and we paid too much money. Next property we visit, they find the problem, but won‚Äôt fix it, without us paying more.  Next meeting, they start using the same con words as the first group about fixing it, so we walk out.  Now we pay more for less service.

review_title: Enjoy the time away....not the sales pressure
review_text: We enjoy the resorts we use.  Cabo Azul is great.  We spend most of our time in Hawaii. Kaanapali Beach Club needs some attention.  The recent update and sale presentation was more than a bit disappointing, particularly for someone with a good amount of ownership. All that said, we look forward to our vacations every year.

Overall, the hotel/resort is pretty decent for the price and experience. The unpleasant part of the ordeal was the staff who are instructed to constantly try selling you on coming back for timeshares.When checking in, 3 staff members tried selling me on the timeshare, withholding information until I explicitly ask for it. When checking out they kept trying to sell it, and then they continued calling and e-mailing me once my stay was over. The calls were borderline harassment and I would think twice before staying with diamond resorts exclusively because of that experience.To those considering the timeshare, realize that the fine print mentions when you can use it, possible additional expenses, fees, etc. In the end its not worth it compared to a hotel..
Terrible time share experience!!! Will never stay with them again.  High pressure sales very disappointed!

review_title: My husband and I went to the sales‚Ä¶
review_text: My husband and I went to the sales presentation and almost bought the time share but so glad we didn't. We were at the presentation for 4 hours!!!! I got the free 5 or 7 nights at one of their three resorts in Lake Tahoe and the free cruise. OMG, tried to book and there are NO availability. If you go to their website to book as a regular guest, you can book any time.  Called the number on the Diamond resort website and was on hold for like 45 minutes. Finally got a hold of a rude person who then just transferred me back to be on hold again. This is just a scheme to get you into you into their sales presentation. For the cruise, I've sent in my $50 deposit and then have to pay for the port fees. I don't know if I could get a reservation for the cruise either. Already read reviews on how difficult it is to book. STAY AWAY FROM THEIR SALES PRESENTATION!!!!UPDATE!!!!- After posting my reviews everywhere, someone finally tried to get it resolved but not without numerous and numerous frustrating attempts. I wasn't going to give up and let this go and have Diamond resort get away with this. I finally got them to honor their certificate and was able to book 7 nights.

Royal Caribbean lost my luggage,  it took almost two days to find two bags. The eggs were yucky and the bacon was over done and almost burned. Not appealing. And I love bacon. I forced myself to eat it. VERY CRUNCHY !  Two many fancy foods that I didn't even like and not enough down home cooking.

Over the years Diamond Resorts has changed for the worst. At one time you could use points for car rentals, not anymore. You could use points up to 100% for Hotel reservations and airfare, not anymore. Being able to make reservations was not to bad, but now anyone can stay at the Resorts using Groupon, Hotels.com, etc. So it is very hard to get in some of the Resorts. At one time we liked  Diamond, not anymore.
High pressure sales,told different stories in regards how we can our points...Bait and switch...waste of time and moneyI'll go to other time share company before I think about Diamond.
Great service, and most of all the accommodations were amazing

review_title: Very clean and tidy and a reasonable‚Ä¶
review_text: Very clean and tidy and a reasonable price

review_title: I have always had a wonderful‚Ä¶
review_text: I have always had a wonderful experience with Diamond Resorts Int.  They have made vacationing very easy and a lot of fun.  Resort availability is great.  The quality of the resorts we use is wonderful as well.  Staff a very professional and accommodating.

review_title: Bullying is the name of their game...
review_text: My husband and I visit a sales presentation at the Polo Towers in Las Vegas on May 19, 2019.  It was part of a bounce back for staying at the Golden Nugget for $199 for three nights.  The presentation started on such a positive note.  Breakfast, friendly greetings and a very upbeat presentation.  That all changed once we sat down after the presentation and simply asked "What is the cost?" We were given a constant run around by our representative. We were asked to fill out a form giving all of our personal information and we refused because there was no cost given.  We were then pushed and bullied into going on a tour even though we insisted on knowing the cost of what was presented.  We finally were told that it would be $35,000 for the vacation plan of 7,500 points to be paid over ten years.  My husband and I were asked what do we think about the value.  I said I see no value and then the intense bullying increased.  The manager or director came over and he said what about giving you an every other year in points program for $16,000.  We said it still equates to no value in our opinion.  We declined and he said we could just leave and pay full price for the hotel at the Golden Nugget.  This request was done in an elevate voice in front of others.  We were appalled beyond at this point.  Then Marissa, the sales director, came over and began to speak with us on other offerings.  She was very pleasant and offered a very affordable package.  My husband and I declined due to the manner in which we were treated by the first two representatives.  If bullying and embarrassing your potential owners is the way of doing business then shame on you.  I was also upset at the gifts offered as it was not what was said over the phone.  The cruise is a bunch of bull.  It was said that I would be able to cruise from any port in the US when I can only choose from three ports on off season dates.  The gift card was for restaurant.com which is a joke all in itself.   I would not recommend Diamond resorts to my worst enemy.  Their tactics are more than less desirable and totally uncalled for.Just a note:  We attended another presentation and we bought from them.  The pricing was upfront, there was no pressure and we look forward to the many vacations to come.
Freat friendly staff. Owner updates not so much!
IGNORE TEXT

On 29 May 2019, I tried to make a simple reservation online, but the system would not accept it.  I wanted to add-on three additional days to an existing reservation. The days were available on Diamond's website, but it couldn't approve it.  I called and talked to several representatives at Diamond (Tina (9:10 am), Christina (11:55 am), Leah (12:20) and Justice (30 May 19, 4:20 pm) with no success.  I called John Betros, GM at Daytona Beach Regency and he was very helpful.  He made calls on my behalf, which later proved to be successful.  Justice transferred me to his supervisor, LaJohn Mumford (4:25 pm), who was very rude and condescending.  If he is a true representative (supervisor) of Diamond, more training in areas concerning customer relations, telephone etiquette, and temperament are needed.  Marilyn, Operations Manager, Las Vegas, called (5:10 pm) to state that the additional dates were confirmed and apologized for the ineptness of the representative I encountered.  Kudos to John and Marilyn!!!

review_title: I've been a member for 20 years and in‚Ä¶
review_text: I've been a member for 20 years and in the last 5-10 years its almost impossible to book an apartment in the three resort's in adeje tenerife this is partly due to diamond who own units and rent them out for a ridiculous amount of money which I am not prepared to pay.I am now seriously considering selling my points as I can holiday anywhere for less than I pay in management fees.

"Update presentation" at Sandestin ( a former Club Intrawest location) was actually a sales pitch to buy more points. Traded an hour of our lives for the gift card. Don't promote the event as an update when you are actually doing a sell of more points - which I did not buy.
Very dated resort. I booked with Diamond as a Platinum member for a ocean view room. It was far from it ! Not happy !!However the Bar and restaurant was excellent,  with the breakfast buffet, $22.50.

review_title: Hard to have a vacation when we are‚Ä¶
review_text: Hard to have a vacation when we are spending half of it in sales situations.Inconsistent at resorts with robes etcMexico resort many issues giving us wrong key, not consistent housekeeping, much sales.

review_title: I have been a Diamond member for over‚Ä¶
review_text: I have been a Diamond member for over 10 years. Generally, I am quite satisfied with the variety of resorts found through Diamond. In addition, Diamond is constantly upgrading its properties. However, my favorite thing is the availability of so many foreign resorts found in Diamond‚Äôs portfolio.Dave

My honest experience: Every time I meet with a representative of Diamond for an update or questions, I have gotten different and conflicting answers and information.   I think you are in need of hiring honest people, who give truthful infirmation...not lies to sell more points.  The resorts are beautiful and not always available, and telling the truth about costs and availability would enhance the company's presentations.  I believe un honest and the company should employ people who also believe that way.

review_title: I have been a member for a long time. about 15 years
review_text: I have been a member for a long time.  All I have gotten was lies or put in the back  Of our hotel   Being a Silver member is no differant than a first time buyer.  All they want is money they could care less about the people.

review_text: The resort at Las Vegas was excellent the pushy dishonest sale presentation made sure we will never stay with Diamond again.

review_text: It was wonderful to get matched up with Binni Thomas.  We were mired in frustration not knowing what we were doing.  Binni explained everything and we love being platinum members.  Vacation time here we come.  Really excited to be going on the Alaska cruise!!  Alaska has been on our bucket list for a long time. Now if Diamond Resorts would implement Docu sign in all their offices  to make it easier signingfor those lenghty legal papers, that would be great.

The staff was absolutely wonderful, every last one!  We were not prepared for the amount of stairs, up and down that we needed to navigate with suitcases.  The desk clerk at check in did help us.  Also the loss of one elevator was not helpful.  I would like to draw your attention to the extremely high cost of using washer and dryer.  5 and 4 euros is pretty high.  Location is good, view amazing and again very good staff!
Good amenities, well equipped kitchen, comfortable suite for the family. Feel like home away from home!

super pushy. They keep calling me to take another "vacation" with them with a sales pitch. I keep asking to be put on the do not call list. One time I was transferred to a supervisor who was unbelievably rude and yelled at me, telling me I was stupid for not taking advantage of the offer. I told the next three reps when they called that there's no way I would do business with them, esp because of that supervisor. But still, I get emails and phone calls. Big mistake to ever stay with them.

review_title: We find the Diamond staff regarding‚Ä¶
review_text: We find the Diamond staff regarding payments not knowledgeable and when I called they stated they would get back to me via email and 3 months later I still haven‚Äôt heard why my loan payment did not come out! It is now but they said they would follow up ...

review_title: So far I have never been disappointed‚Ä¶
review_text: So far I have never been disappointed in a Diamond Resort.  They are nice, not deluxe, but then my taste does not run to deluxe.  I appreciate the space and convenience of a condo rather than a hotel.  I especially enjoy the ability to invite friends to join me in a 2 bedroom.  There is a lot of flexibility in their resorts, luxury points, II exchanges, and other options.Since I am retired and have flexibility, I like their "find a vacation" which shows all the availability for the next year.The Diamond staff are always enjoyable and accommodating.

When I started sending Emails they were not answered and I had commitments from people on when they would get back to me which none of them were kept. Honestly, one of the best resorts we've ever stayed in. Absolutely loved the rooms!

review_title: Never had a problem with booking or‚Ä¶
review_text: Never had a problem with booking or exchanging reservations. The last timeshare week was in Ormandy beach and it was lovely.
Excellent accommodations! Stayed over the holidays and had a great experience! We will be back!
No issues.  The hotel was quiet.  The room was clean and comfortable.  All of the linens and towels were top notch quality.  The staff was very friendly and welcoming.

3 trips so far, 1 to Maui, Hawaii and 2 to Orlando, FlMaui trip we stayed in the Ka‚Äôanapali Beach Club and in Orlando we stayed at the Grand Beach Resort.Ka‚Äôanapali is a beautiful area of the island and the Beach Resort is the jewel.  The view is excellent to awesomely outstanding. The staff are wonderful people who are dedicated to assisting guests to have the best time possible. The concierge was extremely helpful in arranging car rental and booking excursions. The Grand Beach Resort is located off of Highway 535 on beautiful Lake Bryan. You are near everything but away from the crowds. Close to shopping, dining, Disney Springs, and the Parks. The rooms overlook the lake, the fountain pond, the outdoor recreation activity areas or woods. When a problem occurs in the room an appropriate staff member takes care of or arrives to fix it very quickly.

review_title: So we were staying at a Hilton property‚Ä¶
review_text: So we were staying at a Hilton property at Virginia beach on our way to the beach we picked up some towels from the activity desk, the lady that was working there was very nice and was telling us about how we can get free tickets to the aquarium and $100 gift card, she said we just need to attend to a presentation and a tour at a new hotel and it would only last 90 minutes which they got converted into 3 hours, the first thing is we sat there the entire time no tour to the hotel. When she started talking and we asked her if this was a timeshare presentation she said she "Timeshare is the old way" we were like okay so started listing to her and let me tell you it is a F&%*@ Timeshare, we kept asking her what would be the monthly fees and maintenance because we already knew it was Timeshare and she kept saying we would get to that, let me tell you it is very expensive number and not worth it for us we just wanted to leave, she was very nice but once rejected her offer she brought a guy name (Aaron) this guys is very rude very unprofessional and doesn't have respect for you if you don't buy the Timeshare, people like him shouldn't be selling Timeshare if he gets that frustrated if a person say NO
Just not good.
Been to resort approximately 12 times and never had a complaint About anything staff very helpful resortVery clean really we would have no negative Comments about the resort  Christina Ireland

review_title: Excellent resorts all over the world
review_text: Excellent resorts all over the world.  Book on line or over the phone the staff cannot do enough for you.  Resort staff very friendly.

review_title: People don't know what they are talking‚Ä¶
review_text: People don't know what they are talking about . I have been lied to.

Terrible experience at new member orientation. Actually never even received the orientation while we were at mystic dunes. Appreciated the outreach from Diamond to apologize, however, still never offered to have an actual orientation.
Don't waste your time. Your never able to book vacation you want.

review_title: Sorry I ever got involved with Diamond Resorts
review_text: We attended a Diamond Event in January in Orlando. We stayed at the Mystic Dunes Resort.  The events were lacking.  The Dinner was supposed to be an awards ceremony for the amateurs.  We were led to believe that some of the celebrities in the tournament would be at this event...None that I saw.  Then we attended the tournament.  Everything there was nicely done except no one told us the 18th green were the lunch and seating were located was a good 500 yards from the club house.  My wife has trouble walking long distances without assistance.  If we had known we would have brought her walker.  We asked if there was a cart to get her back to the clubhouse and were told they were for the players.  The evening event was nice but not what was on the original documentation.  The accommodations were nothing special.  Room was not upgraded.  Looked like something out of the 70s.  And then we went to the sales presentation.  We said not now and they sold us a sampler membership agreement.  The "hospitality Representative, Randy Siedel, told us if we charge it on our Diamond Credit cards it would be interest free for six months.  Well, this month after the first month we were charged interest.  The Barclay Bank Representative said there is no notation on our account.  Still waiting to here why I am being charged interest since I was told it is interest free for six months.  I have yet to stay in any accommodations that I would recommend to friends.  I booked a vacation in Williamsburg VA this fall.  I requested a first floor when I made the reservation because my wife cannot climb stairs and I know this place has no elevators.  I get the reservation confirmation and it says second floor.  I had to call and redo the reservation.  They could not just change the floor, they had to cancel the first reservation and start new. As the title says, I am very sorry I ever got involved with these people.  I will not be buying anything else. From what I have seen so far this company is very poorly managed.  They have zero sense of customer service and it appears they lie to customers.

review_title: Truly a place we didn't want to leave!
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
IGNORE TEXT

review_title: I was never contacted back by them‚Ä¶
review_text: I was never contacted back by them about my complaint.I therefor will continue to speak my mind to all potential new clients to Diamond and let them know the total underhanded actions I experienced. Because I have far too much money invested now to just let it go I will use my points that I know must pay additionally for as best I can. I plan to go to every possible sight to lodge my anger at the actions done to myself and several other couples who were there in Las Vegas that day. Ripping off seniors is WRONG! Too bad Diamond cant offer the product they wish to promote honestly but the proof is in the pudding as they say. Ask yourself before even thinking of walking into a Diamond sales room "If I saved a few hundred a month for a year could I enjoy a great vacation in a year? You sure could and would be thousand ahead to boot. Diamond has my e-mail if they wish to try to resolve this but thus far they are not interested. Again please if you go into a "owner update" room bring a recorder and tell them up front "I will be recording this entire meeting, is this ok?" Before they start speaking. My guess is they will say no.

very helpful over phone. however when it comes to making certain request, not available.  also we would like to sell our time share back to Diamond and you told us to sell back to you first.  now you say.no thanks.

We bought our timeshare with another company that was eventually bought by Diamond. We upgraded several times during the 20 years we owned and were at Silver level. The annual maintenance fees got to be $2500 a year and it was almost impossible to book where we wanted to go. All the less desirable locations were always available, not what we wanted. Seems that Diamond has oversold it's inventory and unless you want to stalk the website or make vacation plans 1 year in advance you are not going to get booked where you want. Many of the resorts that Diamond has in their inventory also make rooms available on the booking sites so why bother with the ownership? Many of the complainers here either have failed to do some investigation or they are trolls, not sure. We took advantage of the Diamond Transitions program and were able to get out of our timeshare late last year. I cost us another $1000 but it was well worth it. Now we can use that annual maintenance fee to book nice vacations wherever we want, even some of the Diamond locations!

This investment is good holidays but you are trapped in it ! bought it 14000$, market value now less than 3000$and you have to pay ~900$ fees yearly.So better pay wherever you wanna go, don't enter the system !

review_title: We had to make a last-minute ‚Ä¶The rooms and service respect I can learn I couldn‚Äôt of asked for better. I would recommend diamond resort to everyone!
review_text: I had to make a last-minute  reservation on my way to Tampa Florida because  my friends and I  decided to leave a day earlier than our original schedule. We stayed at a diamond resort hotel and wish we could‚Äôve stayed much longer because we had a fantastic experience. Everyone there was extremely helpful, courteous and friendly. The rooms and service were excellent and I couldn‚Äôt of asked for better.  I look forward to visiting next year again and would recommend diamond resort to everyone!

review_title: The search for reservations online is not often successful.
review_text: The search for reservations online usually shows no availability, therefore, it requires calling at business hour time.

review_title: Not the value I had hoped
review_text: With the use of internet services to book vacations online, I don't believe a Diamond Resorts timeshare is a great value.  After you buy the deeded timeshare, you still have to make payments for maintenance funds that are diluted across all of the properties.  The bureaucracy of this system of vacation timeshares eats up money and becomes very inefficient.  You'd be better off utilizing online vacation services to book vacations, one-at-a-time.
Very good facilities, staff friendly, went out of ways to please.

review_title: Just love staying in Thurnham Hall‚Ä¶
review_text: Just love staying in Thurnham Hall staff all lovely and helpful

Property is declining. Fire alarm hanging off wall. Exposed wires in laundry area. Party central of Friday and Saturday nights. Cars parked up on the grass. Security just let's anyone thru the gate. Management staff has no concern.

I have always found Diamond very easy to deal with, and very helpful, the staff at sunset harbour are wonderful and will always go the extra mile to ensure customer satisfaction.Very happy with the Diamond experience.

review_title: Don't waste your money or time!
review_text: We were suckered into the sampler package, and was even told we could get the monthly fee reduced by calling customer support. We told them that we have a special needs daughter so we couldn't afford that payment BEFORE we were given the contract. When we called customer service we found out that was a lie and you can't reduce the payment. Also we weren't  informed that before you can use your points (that we are paying for) you have to attend ANOTHER presentation in the states during our vacation. The first one lasted WAY longer than a hour. More like 4 hours. Why would I attend another one? Can't book a cruise for your vacation time right away you have to first be harassed in the states. I would not recommend them for anything. I will utilize my points and tell everyone to beware. Very restrictive, immoral, and time consuming.
Quality Quality Quality

Absolutely the worst experience working with these people. The time share set up is a huge scam and all of the resorts are just filled with trashy guests who get cheap/free stays in order for diamond to try and sell them something. We got robbed while staying there once because they let criminals stay on site. Were told we could get a discounted vacation if we went to a 30 minute  seminar, ended up taking 7 hours!!
Owner updates and/or meetings with sales people are confrontational and hostile. Only bad thing with Diamond

review_title: Our room was a bit dated
review_text: Our room was a bit dated. one of two burners on stove wasn't working but I was able to fix it (the electric plug-in connection for it was broke). no oven. a burned out light in the single light on the BR night stand, only 1 bedroom night stand, microwave had rust holes in the rear, not sure if RF was escaping? table in dining area needed leveling (we used a paper towel), One GFI outlet by cooktop not working. Toilet paper holder was broke but we fixed (temp). Rooms had no salt/pepper, minor but saves one from purchasing a set. The office offers no DVD movies. We had to request a TV guide. Heater and fire place worked very well, bed was OK but just a queen. Nice location and area.

review_title: Having just returned from a diamond‚Ä¶sunset bay club Tenerife
review_text: Having just returned from a diamond resorts stay at sunset bay club Tenerife, it was the most horrendous holiday I have ever had. In the first instance, whilst  the booking was done through RCI, as an exchange,the appt allocated by DR was central to a building site Appt E304. After lodging a complaint to the fact I was a prisoner in this appt as the doorway entrance was blocked with power tools, refurbished furniture, bags of cement, boxes of tiles and the list goes on. Also the shear danger of live wires and extension cables, this appt should never have been allocated. Also when it became for the fresh laundry,  to be replaced mid week , to which was placed at the front of the door, it would hardly be cleaned as the sheer amount of dust was flying everywhere. This noise of workmen went from 8am in the morning till 7pm in the evening. Ensuring my complaint was lodged, I was totally shocked Diamond resorts would not accept any responsibility or move me to an appt that was suitable for my needs to which they knew of my  mobility problems , and the resort knew of this prior to checking in, as an email was sent by me  to them weeks in advanced of check in. In the end DR,  response was because I made the booking through RCI and because RCI had failed to notify their customer on their website that Sunset bay Club Tenerife was undergoing refurbished, then this resort did NOT have an obligation to move me and make my stay ...comfortable,  and it was the fault of my booking., and how it was processed... as far,  I am concerned Diamong Resorts should never ever get to put any of their guests whether owners or not treat such guests with humiliation. Whatever  the booking was made, and when  these resorts should treat guests  with the utter respect and be responsible for their actions.

review_title: As a Platinum member I have enjoyed the‚Ä¶
review_text: As a Platinum member I have enjoyed the majority of resorts I have stayed at and have experienced some excellent customer support.My issue is with the Owner Updates and the Sales Team.  I have been repeatedly lied to in sales presentations.  At one I was led to believe that in order to have certain perks I needed to upgrade, however it turns out I already had those perks.  Another where I did upgrade and I uncoupled my other timeshare, they only ended up uncoupling 1 of the 2 and now refuse to honor the request.  These are just a few of the many false truths that I have encountered. My last 3 upgrades were based on false information.  I know buyer beware and I own my mistakes, however I would never recommend anyone to buy into this company.  I have heavily invested now so I am making the best of it.

I didn't buy into Diamond. They bought out the previous company with which we had an every other year usage and paid half the fees each year, about  $350. Now it's a point system and we pay almost $900 each year. And we can't get out of it. That being said most of the resorts have been quite nice.

Diamond Resorts motto is ‚ÄúStay Vacationed,‚Äù but they go out of their way to make sure they harass you about attending ‚Äúan owner update‚Äù (not an update at all, but, merely a chance to hard pressure sell you more points) weeks before you even leave your home to start your vacation. Again, more pressure when you check in. And yet, more pressure calls to your room, later, if you decline at check in. Vacations are to escape the harassments of life, aren‚Äôt they? You would think they would appreciate & honor their members in good standing, and just let them be, sadly, they do not, they harass you just like they would any other non-DRI member, they hope to snag into purchasing more points. Many of their accommodations show lots of wear & furniture is stained & old. This is not to say that we haven‚Äôt had some great vacation spots with Diamond Resorts, we certainly have. However, the most stress-free, relaxed vacations are those where you decline an ‚Äúupdate,‚Äù and ask to be left alone and/or not answer your room phone, or cell phone. We‚Äôve been members since 2007, so we‚Äôve had lots of experience with them being, well, let‚Äôs just say, ‚Äúless than truthful,‚Äù in all ‚Äúupdates‚Äù we have done. If you are able to go into those updates, stay focused, keep saying no to the purchase of any more points, remain calm, and make them honor the stated & promised minimum meeting/update time, the ‚Äúfreebies,‚Äù they ‚Äúgive‚Äù you, really can be worth that small amount of pain & suffering. If we had to do this all over again, we would take a hard pass & vacation much cheaper using Airbnb, Evolve & other like vacation rental sites, without having to be tied to the expensive & ever increasing DRI maintenance fees, and continued high-pressure sales, for the rest of our lives.
Love the accommodations however the high pressure to upgrade is really annoying.

review_title: We are happy with Diamond Resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: We are happy with Diamond Resorts except for always insisting that we do "updates".  And updates always end up as a pressure tactic for us to buy more points.

I have loved my ownership for 11 years. I recently upgraded to platinum and cannot wait to enjoy my retirement traveling the world. Not every resort is 5 stars, but all I have been to have been at least decent to very good and the staff have been wonderful. I LOVE Cabo Azul (I own there specifically) and Los Abrigados. The sales presentations can have some pressure; However, the vast majority of my updates have been educational and informative. The updates are OPTIONAL, too! I have taken dream vacations with my diamond points and look forward to more in my future. I would recommend Diamond to all of my friends and family and have 3 close friends who I have referred that have become owners.

review_title: I am tired of the sales people lying to‚Ä¶
review_text: I am tired of the sales people lying to get me to buy more points, and not getting what we paid for,

My wife and I just came back from Honolulu, Hawaii. We used our diamond points to stay at the Imperial Hawaii Resort in the heart of Waikiki. We had a wonderful time together and were able to visit with my daughter who is currently working in Waikiki. This resort is close to everything and so we were able to walk or take the trolley or the bus to do all the things that we were able to enjoy in the area. This is an associate resort that is very clean with friendly staff. They were nice enough to upgrade us to 2 bathrooms and we certainly did not expect that. We have been owners with Diamond Resorts and the previous owners for about 20 years now and have taken many family trips over the years and have very much enjoyed our ownership with Diamond Resorts International.

We enjoyed all of the Diamond resorts. But as a sampler owner we had to attend presentations at all 8 resorts we stayed at. All of which were scheduled for an hour and last from 2.5 to 5.5 hours. Each presentation resulted in offers to join which were good only at that time, however each proceeding presentation a better deal was offered.  We don‚Äôt intend to become owners. When we stayed atOrmond Beach and Daytona there were picketers outside the resorts every day

review_title: The sales person explained the program‚Ä¶
review_text: The sales person explained the program to us. When we declined the offer to purchase more points, we were treated with respect and no pressure.

review_title: Resorts need to be improved faster
review_text: Resorts need to be improved faster.  Palm Springs resorts have belonged to Diamond for a long time.  Still not completely dated.  About a 1/2 star rating.
great vacation, comfortable accommodations

This is a very expensive timeshare with regards to the maintenance fees. Worst part you can book a lot less than than annual fees on travel sites such as expedia, orbitz or even direct with the resorts. We got "suckered" into buying more points with them telling us we would have more access to the resorts, and while we may the amount of points required it usually two to three years worth -- with maintenance fees that's over $4,200 for one week -- definitely cheaper to stay in a hotel and not have the recurring yearly cost. Very disappointed in this timeshare. We did not originally buy a Diamond property but it bought our timeshare company and now we're stuck.
Timeshare is not resellable. No resorts where we wanna go. And the upkeep isn‚Äôt very good.

review_title: A very goog place to stay
review_text: A very goog place to stay, nice People and nice property.

review_title: Some of your properties need some‚Ä¶
review_text: Some of your properties need some renovations and upgrade.  Other than that, most of them are in great locations.

We will never go through another presentation again. We were lied to about what we were signing and it cost us $22,000 plus 5 months of hell trying without success to negate the transaction. Went all the  way up the chain of command to the CEO and still no relief. I think the guilty parties of the sales team are still employed there.  Has left a very bitter taste with us with Diamond.

review_title: I have stayed at 4 different Dianond‚Ä¶
review_text: I have stayed at 4 different Dianond Resorts 9 or 10 times in the past 3  years. i have also sent my mom to 2 Diamonds resorts. After you stay at 1 you will never want to stay anywhere else.  Diamond Resorts are the BEST!! First of all they are affordable. I can stay in a 2 bedroom condo for the price of a hotel room most places. They are clean & immaculate inside and out. The condos have everything you need. The kitchens are fully equipped with plates cups glasses flatware and every single pot and pan and utensil you can ever need. They have top-of-the-line toasters coffee makers blenders Etc. Each condo I've stayed in ihad ts own washer and dryer. They give you dish soap laundry soap paper towels Etc. Their beds and linens are top-of-the-line and like sleeping in heaven. Three of the four places I've stayed had huge bathtubs in the master bathroom. Plenty of bath towels pool towels blankets pillows and extra linens are always provided. I've never had a problem with parking. There are always activities planned around the clock for kids and family members. If you forgot something from home more than likely they have it. If you need anything you just call the front desk and someone will be at your door right away. Now when I plan little mini vacations I always make sure I visit locations where there is a Diamond Resort. I usually booked through Groupon or Expedia for the best prices. The places I have stayed are Cypress Pointe, Liki Tiki, Mystic Dunes(all 3 in Orlando) and The Cove on Ormond Beach. I love all of them. This weekend I'm taking my daughter for a 3-day stay at  Mystic Dunes. We wanted to go back to the Cove on Ormond Beach but they are booked up. My daughter agrees with me that Diamond Resorts are the best places we've ever stayed.

We were in Unit 37, with friends, our holiday was spoiled every day  and mainly nights by excessively creaking floors, it is so bad that if someone goes up-stairs you can plot their movements and what they are doing.I am so surprised that Diamond, would allow a unit to be let out like this, I also understand that other units are suffering from the same problem.Colin Milton

review_title: Nothing has been the same since the‚Ä¶
review_text: Nothing has been the same since the take over. We no longer have a private members club and we wish we could sell our points.

in Las Vegas, Tahitti Village is our favorite timeshare to stay at.  Located on South end of Las Vegas Blvd, has shuttle, restaurants near by, across the street from outlet mall, has huge grill area, and lazy river along with the pools & hot tubs.

review_title: Great location just a half block to the ocean
review_text: Great location just a half block to the ocean... but ensure you get an upper floor (4 through 6) have balconies that overlook the ocean (the first floor does not have balconies and the second and third are blocked by other buildings.  This location has a pool, miniature golf, and other amenities.

review_title: We had 3 wonderful weeks at Sunset Bay‚Ä¶
review_text: We had 3 wonderful weeks at Sunset Bay resort in Tenerife. The accommodation was great and the staff at the resort are so friendly and helpful. We love it there and go back every year. Twice this year.

review_title: Diamond = extremely high pressure sale tactics
review_text: Chaos! Diamond uses high pressure sales, scare tactics and empty promises to coerce and/or contract a purchase. We have visited the same TN resort every May of our anniversary, for 26 years. This particular resort is our absolute favorite. We got married in Pigeon Forge and will continue to stay there. However, our opinion on Diamond as a company, is less than favorable. The new rules or policy with Diamond is requiring us to attend a "sales" presentation, regardless of our ownership status each time we book a reservation there. We have owned since 1997. So, last May after sitting for 5 hours and stating continuously, "we're not purchasing that" they tag teamed several sales associates in an attempt to twist our arms to purchase. After we declined the high priced sale offered, they offered (and we decided to try) a "sampler" package that came with several promises to provide a cruise and an opportunity to get out of this timeshare after the sampler ends in 2020. The sampler package allows us a "try me" points to use where and whenever, but as we were unaware and was not explained, we would have to attend presentations among other restrictions. Well, we weren't handed that cruise that was promised, but we weren't giving up that easy. We had asked for it during the numerous times when checking in during our many stays there throughout the year. Each time we were only to be promised they would provide it at the end of each stay. No cruise certificate ever surfaced, until this past week. May 2019, we had booked our annual anniversary trip using that purchased "sampler" package acquired only 1 year ago. When the Diamond representative from Las Vegas had to get approval and call us back for us to be placed in a hotel and not the resort, I canceled the reservation. When she did not return my call and confirm my cancellation, I called them again. I spoke with another Diamond representative and he assured me that it would be canceled and that he could get the dates that we asked for. I asked him to check on it. But, he took that as a booking request. After numerous emails to my husband and me, we thought they canceled the reservations and then I took it upon myself to book it directly through the resort. Apparently, you have to cancel the reservation(s) with the exact representative who scheduled it since they are commission based. After we arrived at our resort, it was discovered that there were TWO reservations for the same weekend at various hotels, not including our resort that I booked directly. I was then able to cancel all of them except the resort I booked, with the help of the Diamond concierge. At that time, we complained that we weren't able to get the Saturday stay we asked for to end our trip and we still didn't get our promised cruise. She assured us that we would this time and then proceeded to offer us a gifted Saturday's night's stay. We graciously accepted after she told us that we wouldn't even need to change rooms. Unfortunately, we were unable to use the free night's stay due to the time spent at the sales center explaining that we STILL do not want to buy. I asked if in the last year that they had renovated any other rooms than the one they continuously show to unsuspecting newcomers (we could see it from our balcony). He then stated that this resort would NOT be upgraded or improved for a very long time. Which tells us that the resort will continue to deteriorate until then. So, after another high pressured, scare tactic, 1.5 hours of wasted time, we finally received our cruise certificate and headed to our room where we planned to relax and watch it rain from our balcony for the rest of the day. However, when my husband and I returned to the room, we received a knock on the door by the cleaning personnel. We told her that we were staying another night and she appeared to be confused. Next we received a text message from a sales associate at the sales center who introduced himself and asked if there's anything he can do to make us feel better and that he saw us leave and we appeared to be very upset (which we weren't). I told him that we hadn't met and he confirmed but wanted to speak with us. I graciously declined after another knock on the door. This time it was a man and he told us that we have to move rooms since that room was already taken. My husband said he would call the front desk to verify that. Sure enough, they said they had been trying to reach us to get checked into another room but was unable to locate us (we were scheduled in the sales center for 8:30AM!). After I pulled my wet clothes from the washer and we had already loaded the car, we decided that enough was enough and we proceeded to just check out and go home.

review_title: In general my experieces have been bad
review_text: In general my experieces have been bad.  Low quality resorts, over priced.
Nice three bedroom lock-off for a Girlfriend Weekend.

review_title: We stayed in a Diamond Resort in‚Ä¶
review_text: We stayed in a Diamond Resort in Sedona. The accommodation was very comfortable; reasonable for that time of year (November) and the area itself was beautiful.I would be encouraged to try other Diamond resorts as a result of my stay.

All the staff we met were super awesome especially Luis Montero although they were unaware that we were already owners with Diamond. This apparently caught the staff off guard which turned our 2hr presentation into a 6hr ordeal as we upgraded into a new package.

To begin with, I'd like to say that Diamond properties are very nice and well cared for.  We have enjoyed every stay.  However, we recently were talked into buying a sampler pack when we had said no numerous times to buying more points.  It is our fault that we didn't do due diligence on our part and did not read the fine print.  Some of their sales pitch however, was an outright lie.  Our 21 year old daughter was with us and they said she could use the points from our sampler; well she can't.  We as owners, need to be there because with each trip we have to attend the dreaded one hour sales pitch.  Long story short, we have resolved ourselves to follow their contract and will use the points if we can.  We have reserved a week in Scottsdale and have reserved our one hour presentation per the contract.  Well a good friend has passed away and I must attend the funeral which conflicts with the presentation time.  I called in to change the date and time of our presentation and they said they were completely booked for the time we were there.  And if we didn't show up for our time slot, we could be charged for the retail cost of the week, up to $400 a night.  Even though they couldn't get us in at a different time!  Needless to say I was truly disappointed in their rigidity.

review_title: While we have enjoyed various resorts
review_text: While we have enjoyed various resorts, we can no longer afford the maintenance fees.  In April 2018, we were tricked into buying more points with the promise that we would pay no more per month than we were already paying. When we discovered in August 2018 that the salesman had misrepresented the the facts about owning more points, we tried to withdraw from the deal.  Diamond has not cooperated and we are left owing about $80,000 dollars; our credit rating has dropped from "excellent" to "poor" and we see no way out.

review_title: Mostly good but some rough edges.
review_text: Diamond Resorts membership is generally good but has few annoying niggles. The accommodation is usually of a high standard.Customer service from the American office is not up to the European Office standard. Sales staff are not always consistent or honest in their dealings. The Website and Diamond App can be difficult to navigate and lack a good subject search facility.That said, I have enjoyed my visits to the European Diamond Resorts.

review_title: My wife and I had a good time in the‚Ä¶
review_text: My wife and I had a good time in the Coasta Del Sol, Spain.  The suite was nice and had everything we needed and everything worked.  The restaurant was good and the staff very professional.  They helped us with all the tours we wanted to go on and making sure we had a ride back to the airport.  The only thing we were not happy about was that they were doing some renovation on the suite next to us a couple of the days we were their and it got kind of noisy.

review_title: Even though we had some issues with our‚Ä¶
review_text: Even though we had some issues with our room, they got right on it fixed everything.  Everyone is very professional and friendly making us feel right at home.  Thank you to all of the Grand Beach Resort for making out stay a great one.

review_title: We stayed at Liki Tiki over Christmas‚Ä¶
review_text: We stayed at Liki Tiki over Christmas break. Rooms need to be updated. Fire pit did not work most of the week. The children who are 12 and 11 liked the bikes and paddle boats.
