review_text: Finding resort prices are going lower for outside renters while I pay the maintenance fees....and more points....

review_title: My last experience with a Diamond‚Ä¶
review_text: My last experience with a Diamond representative was great.  No pressure just information and facts for my consideration.  This was in Virginia Beach and I was pleasantly surprised as I had been accustomed to high pressure and insults.  Definitely NOT APPRECIATED by an owner of many years.  Check the records.Your image is improving!!!

review_title: The resort was excellent the people‚Ä¶
review_text: The resort was excellent the people were very helpful

review_title: I stay here all the time.
review_text: IGNORE TEXT

review_title: Our last trip through Diamond Resorts‚Ä¶
review_text: Our last trip through Diamond Resorts was great! The rooms were nice and the family enjoyed the resort.

We loved this resort with a backdrop of the beatiful mountians of Sedona. The room was perfect with a kitchenette complete with appliances and utensils. Spacious room with a balcony. Absolutely lovely.

review_title: DO NOT BECOME A CUSTOMER OF DIAMOND‚Ä¶
review_text: DO NOT BECOME A CUSTOMER OF DIAMOND RESORTS.  Their business tactics are deplorable. They are dispicable just like a previous reviewer said, "high pressure sales and lie to get sales".   Not a good business practice especially to do this to someone who is already a customer of yours with no real resolution.  You don't want to loose customers.  If I could give no stars I would.  We were lied to and tricked in order to get additional money.  At the mandatory sales meeting they tried to sell us more points as usual.  We said that we could not afford any additional monies to be paid out to them at this time.  one salesman left and another person came in with a paper.  He came in and lied about the program that he was selling, to get us to sign and bind us to something that is not what was promised.  Then when we ask questions and find out we have been lied to, they prolong it out, promising a resolution.  Later in the end, after pushing you through the departments and the wait tactics, you talk with your assigned person to tell you nothing and to do nothing for you.  What is the resolution..."you can buy more points and combine your contract".  REALLY?!!  I have told you, I cannot afford anymore and I was tricked into paying more and your solution is to buy more!  That is not smart to do this kind of thing to current customers.  You want lifelong customers that spread positive word of mouth reviews, not angry customers that have been taken advantage of, out in the world spreading negative first hand knowledge of your dubious business tactics.
Great properties. Cost efficient. Great benefits.
Zihuatanejo is the best club of Embark after Tremblant GB

review_title: Great hotel and great for families with‚Ä¶
review_text: Great hotel and great for families with toddlers

Sad but true, I've attempted to make reservations 8 to 10 months out and there is never any availability. I regret giving up deed for points. With my designated deed week I pretty much could exchange and go anywhere  I chose.  VA BEACH is my family's favorite vacation spot. Now I can't seem to get it anymore. The vacation locations on the Diamond website always have availability at places where we don't have desire to go or the point cost are higher than the number of points we have available.

review_title: Diamond uses high pressure sales and‚Ä¶
review_text: Diamond uses high pressure sales and lying to make a sale . They will sale there souls if it means a sale. They make you want to run and all over the  endless sales presure and the fact they will say anything.  I don't trust anything diamond says. Do your homework .

review_title: Love the Lodging Options - Hate the "Updates"
review_text: First, I have not stayed at a "bad" Diamond Resort property.  I do not regret the number of points we have or the maintenance fees for using them for lodging.  We do not use the points for anything else but lodging.  I have no intention of purchasing more points.  Done.  Kids don't want to deal with them; therefore, when we are gone they will be turned back to the resort.  Until then, I will enjoy them and got to places I would not have done without them.  The extreme negative resulting in two stars is their idea of an "Owner's Update".  I have stopped going to them no matter what funny money options they throw at me and I have told any guests not to go through the events.  If they need the money that bad to do something (dinner, train ride, tour, etc.) let me know and I will get them a gift card.  The friendship is worth more than listening to the horror stories of their experience.  I know more about the properties and options than the person doing the update because their sole purpose is not to provide an update but to sell more points.    Our key is that we do not use the points for anything but lodging and no plans to.  Therefore telling me all the things I can do with more points falls on deaf ears.  I cannot fault Diamond on their points approach because every vacation club out there does the same thing.  Just wish I could sit down with someone for an owner's update, actually get an update on the properties and company, and then walk out.  Of course, if they did a group thing on a Saturday or Sunday as an update, who would site through their sales presentations?  I have been offered as high as $300 in resort funny money to sit through an update at their sales building/room.  That tells me there is no "update".

We find that Diamond Resorts for the most part are professional, friendly, customer centered, clean and service oriented. Some properties needed further growth in these areas were a bit old and not up to date, smaller than expected and overrated but this was rare -  continued quality control measures are important. Usually, we are quite pleased. Thanks.

Although we have had some nice trips, the overall cost with purchase and maintenance fees, has been more than what we would have spent traveling without Diamond. We were misled numerous times, just to get us to buy more points. Availability has been challenging at times on locations that we want at the time we want.

review_title: All I can say after all the years that‚Ä¶
review_text: All I can say after all the years that I have been going to The Cove this was the last year .MANAGER does not do anything to ensure that there guests are enjoying there stay and if there is a problem nothing is done about it !

review_title: Was mislead by two sales persons
review_text: Was mislead by two sales persons.  Thank god I canceled within the five day time frame.   Tried calling back to number was given when signed contract no answer I called ever 15 mins for one day and left messages for a return call.  To this day have not gotten a call back and it‚Äôs been 9 months.  The shame of it I wanted to keep it but will never do it again because of lies and deception.  Before you sign with them read everything even the booklets they just show you  but want let you read don‚Äôt take their word trust me.

We bought entry level points in Maui in 2012. They gave us the grand tour of the best accommodations Kaanapali and were very fast to take our money. The sales guy even went as far as suggesting that we should use Interval trade off to get better and cheaper vacation options. In 2015 we made the mistake of going for an event update in Maui. We were sucked into buying more points. Again Diamond were very fast to take our money. December 2017 we got sucked into another lifetime event in St Maarten and yes we bought more were convinced to transfer of Hawaiian point to the US collection we were granted temporary Gold status for 12 months (expiring December 2018). September 2018 we got sucked into another life time event in Kauai and we were convinced that we needed to transfer our points back into the Hawaiian collection. December 2018 in Orlando, we expressed our outrage during a life time event to no avail. But in good faith we entered into an arrangement that would help get us to Gold status (3500 points) by way of a sampler package. Come December 2018 our temporary Gold status (granted in December 2017) expired. To my surprise in February 2019 I received a letter DATED NOVEMBER 2018 congratulating me on my Gold Status. I have made many calls to many people and sent many emails to many people trying to validate the temporary Gold status. All I get is we are going to look into it and get back to you. In April 2019 while in Maui I requested a face to face meeting with the highest ranking Diamond official to see if I could resolve the temporary gold status issue. They referred me back to the people in Kauai suggesting that they would be best suited to resolve the issue. As of today May 10, 2019 over 3 months later I still have no answers and my portfolio still shows me as Silver. Here is what upsets me. Diamond are very fast to take your money and to charge you fees and late penalties and interest  but as an owner I have NO LEVERAGE to get results. So here are the mixed feelings. We like the vacation part, we like Maui and will enjoy traveling more in the future BUT we feel like once Diamond have your money they forget who you are and really don't care. Its a one way street with Diamond.

review_title: I have stayed at the Grand Villa‚Ä¶
review_text: I have stayed at the Grand Villa Resorts in Orlando, FL the past four years and only have positive things to say.  It is one of the cleanest places I have ever stayed.  The kitchen efficiency has everything you need and the store in the middle of the resort is nice, as you can pick up some necessities from there.

review_title: Resort great, if only you can get more info on your unit.
review_text: Overall we enjoy our Embarc vacation homes but I am frustrated with the information offered on the website. We have gone to Zihuatanejo 3 times and have been disappointed the last 2 times with our accommodations because there is no clear description of what I am booking. When I booked a studio, it was really just a hotel room and in a very high traffic area, no privacy. So I asked to see a one-bedroom and the next year I booked a one-bedroom. It was dark and very little natural light, again very disappointed. Our first accommodation was fabulous and I have seen many of the other suites, but I can never seem to get a nice room. So the resort is great, but the website for booking is so clunky and with no way of choosing a unit you want.

We really trusted Diamond Resorts when we traded our membership in another timeshare and bought here. We have been members since 2010 and have utilized it twice. If you want to stay in Daytona, or Orlando, or Las Vegas, you may find accommodations. Major metropolitan areas, exotic places, Europe, forget about it.We are not usually that naive but this has been not only a disappointment but a financial bust!

We were clear that we were not interested in purchasing more points. We were also clear that we had agreed only to a 75 minute update. 2 1/2 hours later, we finally walked out after being harassed and lied to multiple times.

We bought the minimum points. However, we have gotten a very good use of them. We are happy with it.Not happy with the Sales presentation that are a constant requirement. It becomes annoying.Not happy with the real possibilities of getting to go where you want to go.Not happy for having to pay a high assessment fee, you use it or not.Otherwise, for people that are flexible with their travel plans, it works great.Cecilia Ward
IGNORE TEXT

The room was what we were looking for. We did not want to pay the big Hotel prices. The room was very clean and the bed was great to sleep on. If your looking for a lot of perks this is not the room for you. Again perfect for what we were looking for!!

review_title: The check-in and out procedure was very‚Ä¶
review_text: The check-in and out procedure was very easy. The room was very clean & comfortable.

review_title: Cozy rooms and easy check in
review_text: Cozy rooms and easy check in. Cute building and the location was walkable to the cruise terminal.
I felt at home. Everything clean and  confortable. Great Location.

review_title: Advice you do not stay. I think we would‚Äôve gotten more sleep‚Ä¶
review_text: I think we would‚Äôve gotten more sleep in a hostile. Very old house with paper thin walls and all dilapidated wood floors. The upstairs (owner?) was loudly clunking around until 12, room 5 (do not accept) has bed headboard by front door. 3 individual parties came in between 2-3 am sounding an alarm each time. Very cold with old windows. No walkway or ramp for suitcases. Will never stay there again.

review_title: This is a great little place to stay
review_text: This is a great little place to stay - close to the Strand, the cruise ships and the medical district.  Quiet, clean and great communication with the staff.
Great room, but the code entry did not work the best. Toilet was a little difficult to figure out. Overall loved the look and feel of the building and room.

review_title: This quaint house is in a perfect‚Ä¶
review_text: This quaint house is in a perfect location for us for the Lone Star Rally by the Strand and everything we needed for our arrival was communicated perfectly a day or 2 before, and we had no problems when we arrived and had an awesome 3 night stay. We will definitely stay here again when on the island!

Very small but comfy room.I found multiple hairs on the bedding though‚Ä¶ no shower door in the bathroom so water gets everywhere.. No human to talk too. This place is more like a Arbnb house with rooms to reserve‚Ä¶not my preference so i will not be staying there again ..
Cute, quaint appointments in a central location. Very responsive. I had a minor issue that was easily fixed. Beekman boys toiletries in room on arrival. Safe and sound. Just what I needed.

A great price, we would defiantly stay here again. Cozy little room,very clean,comfortable bed.It was a great place to stay the night before our cruise. Has a great coffee bar. Great instructions sent in a email. Only one small detail it was a little hard to find the address because the cars that were parked out front other than that everything was great.

review_title: Was perfect for what I needed bed‚Ä¶
review_text: Was perfect for what I needed bed comfortable!! Would be nice to have courtesy water in room ! Coffee selection is limited!!

ReReally cool place to stay, especially if you don't like stairs or hotel staff. Very private. The room was cozy, bed was comfortable and the bed sheets were clean. About 3 blocks from the strand and right in the middle of some extravagant historic homes. Also, me and my wife did it that night and that was pretty cool too. Can't wait to stay again on our next trip!

The rooms were comfortable, well equipped, quiet and well priced. I had one of my best night's sleep as the bed was so incredibly comfortable. Mattresses and the pillows were top notch the sheets were amazing and even the towels in the bathroom were very high quality! I've often traveled to Europe with nothing more than a backpack and many of the hotels were very similar to this one so I felt very comfortable with the configuration and the amenities. Kudos!

Stayed two nights, the house was very nice and on a quiet corner. Rooms were as described... small and European. When I say small, it's literally enough room for the queen bed, a small corner table and space on the floor for luggage. The bathroom has no counter space or tub. The bed was too soft for our liking, and we left a little sore but nothing is ever as comfortable as your bed at home. We did our research, expected these amenities and enjoyed our stay overall!

Great stay, a little underwhelming. Yard needed to be manicured, there were no paths, or signs telling us where to go. The room was easy to access and was clean. We enjoyed our stay. Only complaint about our room was the a.c was stuck on a low setting and it was kind warm during the day.

review_title: You HAVE to try this place at least‚Ä¶
review_text: You HAVE to try this place at least once!!!! It is now our cruise hotel and we love it so much. As long as there are rooms available we will stay here. VERY clean, quaint and so lovely. Right down the street from cruise terminal. Away from hustle and bustle

review_title: The house is very nice and in a great‚Ä¶
review_text: The house is very nice and in a great location. Very quiet and close to gulf and port. Room is small but expected. Nicely decorated. Coffee good. Depending where your room is located, neighbors can be noisy because your right next to them.

Beautiful property with a wonderful fresh smell as we entered!Our queen room was cozy, fresh, and sparkling clean!TV was great and we enjoyed Netflix after a day at the beach. The only thing that would have been nice that we didn‚Äôt have available was an ice machine.  I highly recommend this beautiful property!

This was a nice place to sleep for one night. A/C worked great. The room is very small. There is no bottled water available to drink. The towels have to sit on the floor in the bathroom because there is nothing to sit them on. There is no coffee cups by the coffee maker. you have to fish the pocket door to the bathroom out because it sits back in too far. I emailed a question and by the time they got back with me it was too late and they said I should have called instead but the choice was there either or.

review_title: The room did not have a view like it‚Ä¶
review_text: The room did not have a view like it said it did. The room was super tiny. The shower did not have a full door. The sink was extra small. There was worms in the morning after we had showered. The next door was coughing all night. We could hear all them all night when we got there. I wish money could be refunded. It was the worse experience of my life. I do not recommend this place.

review_title: Our room was exceptionally clean and‚Ä¶
review_text: Our room was exceptionally clean and Jade helped us tremendously with the issue we had with the smoke alarm. The negative is that the air conditioning doesn‚Äôt work. It was hot and stuffy in our room even at night.  The heat and humidity was extreme in the area when we went but it literally felt like the mini split in our room didn‚Äôt work at all.

It‚Äôs a nice place if you‚Äôre a lone traveler or low maintenance. The only issues I had were a clomplete lack of trash cans on the entire premises, they only give a small bathroom trash. There is also no real place to set stuff in the bathroom. It‚Äôs a good clean place with no staff to disturb your stay! Highly recommend if you‚Äôre low maintenance. Not ideal for me though
Great room for the price! Needed a place to stay for the night before our cruise and this place is as perfect for us. All the necessities were furnished. Would recommend and stay again.

review_title: The staff girl we met was wonderful
review_text: The staff girl we met was wonderful!   Even though our room was not ready for check in, they locked up our luggage in a closet for us, and moved it to our room, so when we did get to our room, alll our luggage was waiting for us!   This place is quiet, quaint and cute!   Perfect for a little place to crash for a night!  Will definitely stay there again if I ever do another cruise from Galveston!   Thank you so much for the wonderful stay!  Started our vacation perfectly!

review_title: The rooms were very nice and clean .
review_text: The rooms were very nice and clean .. everything you would need for an overnight stay .  We were able to check in a little early which was very nice. The curb appeal was a little to be desired but I believe they are working on that .  The interior was beautifully done ... We enjoyed our stay.  Thank You .

Hidden gem in Galveston. Exterior doesn‚Äôt do it justice but the interior is beautifully updated. Stumbled upon a bargain on Expedia. I‚Äôll definitely stay here again. Some helpful tips for future guests might be to add a sign with the property name outside & provide ice or a vending machine. It was great place to stay the night before our cruise!

I‚Äôm not super impressed. The pictures are not even close to what you get. Check in is way late. The bathroom is so small you and even do your make up or use the bathroom in privacy. Over all the bed was ok but please explain the room and what you get clearly to your guest.
The room was very nice and easy to access. It was in a great part of town too definitely work taking a walk around.

The room is clean but too small, much smaller than a regular hotel room. The AC unit wasn't cooling the small room enough so it was uncomfortable and we didn't have a good sleep at all. The bed size is full, not a queen size as it was advertised on booking.com. That isn't enough for two adults to sleep. The sink is located close to the bed, and it is too small that when you wash your face the water drops on the floor. Overall,  our experience wasn't good, and I'm afraid I wouldn't recommend this facility for couples to stay.

review_title: This facility is clean and conveniently‚Ä¶
review_text: This facility is clean and conveniently located to cruise port in Galveston. The rooms are small/compact and no frills offered. Works great for sleeping quarters only. Showers are a bit of a challenge ‚Ä¶ no lip on floor to guard against wet floor and drainage somewhat slow. Facility served it‚Äôs purpose and was priced reasonably in doing so!  Thank you!
I stayed in room 1, the room was so cozy, very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable!

review_title: Nice clean room for a good price
review_text: Nice clean room for a good price.  Great place to say if needing a quick overnight before or after cruise.

review_title: We enjoyed the atmosphere of the house‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoyed the atmosphere of the house and our room.  The bed was comfy with beautiful linens. Loved the decor.  The ac unit did not cool that well. I should have contacted the owners about it, but did not. Felt secure.   We will be back.

review_title: Nice out of the way place
review_text: Nice out of the way place and close to the Harborside Drive and Starbucks. Room Very nice. To enter, they have digital locks, and so to get it to light up so you can punch in your entry code, you have to press the lock logo at the top. Took me a few minutes to figure this out.

Air conditioning unit was not functioning properly during my one day stay. Support staff were unable to assist with repairing it, and or offering any other viable solutions such as offering a fan. Communication with staff took hours for responses and I finally got a message at three in the morning from the manager that there was nothing that they could do.Edit: I was told they could not do anything because of the ‚Äúheat waves‚Äù in Texas. I also rented two other rooms in this hotel that night that had no issues with air conditioning or keeping the rooms cool. I was simply requesting a courtesy fan, but could not be assisted.

review_title: I loved the room and location
review_text: I loved the room and location.  The room is very small but cozy.  I do have some suggestions.  Shelves in the bathroom close or above the sink.  There is no place to put your toiletries. There is very little room on the sink.  Also, a shelf or two on the wall in the bedroom would be helpful.  There is no place to enjoy a cup of coffee while in bed.  Maybe a small shelf close to the bed to put your cell phone, a cup, the remote or an alarm clock.

The rooms are very small but clean and comfortable. It was a perfect place to stay the night before our cruise. It was close to the pier so we could easily walk there (including pulling our luggage). The check in and check out process was very simple and worked well considering we came in on a late flight. I would definitely stay here again!

review_title: I had a very difficult time getting‚Ä¶
review_text: I had a very difficult time getting into your facility.  Yes you sent me an e-mail with the access code but you didn't give any hints on how your cipher locks work so I almost couldn't get in the building.  Thank goodness when I banged on the door someone came to see what the matter was and explained the lock system to me.There was NO hot water in my lavatory so I didn't even attempt to take a shower.  I would not recommend Domum de Vence to my family or friends.

review_title: We were under the impression it was a‚Ä¶
review_text: We were under the impression it was a bed and breakfast. Our mistake. The rooms were tiny, busy most of all cold!   Although it was a freak cold weather, the rooms could have been warmed prior to our arrival.  Small units were inadequate for heating. The staff was excellent for trying to help. Maybe three star instead of two.

This is an excellent place to spend the night. We stayed before our cruise and it‚Äôs about an 11 minute walk to the cruise dock. The room was cleaner than any of the high-end hotels I stay in for work! The temperature was adjustable, the bed was comfortable, free coffee/tea available at all times and the owners were prompt to answer questions and correspondence was professional and friendly. The d√©cor was awesome - restored from original. I would stay there again!

review_title: Small but clean and great location‚Ä¶
review_text: The room was a bit smaller than expected but very clean and exactly what we needed for one night. Walls are thin though. I could hear my the neighboring room coughing. Only 15 min walking/4 min driving from cruise terminal. 5 min walking distance to several restaurants. I wouldn't stay with a family but it was fine for my husband and I for a night's stay before our cruise.

My stay at Domum de Venc√© was very comfortable and convenient.  I really liked the digital access.  I travel a lot and It's super nice to be able to go straight to my room after a long flight.  The bed is very comfortable and everything is beautifully done.  The coffee bar was definitely a bonus.  Also great that we were so close to down town.

review_title: Location worked out great for us
review_text: Location worked out great for us - within walking distance of great eating and live entertainment. Room was fine for a quick one-night stay, but super small - bed took up most of room. Very clean and European feel to the room. Recommend if you don‚Äôt plan to spend much time in the room.

review_title: I thought this was a good value.
review_text: I thought this was a good value.. and so quaint.Only a few things missing.. another mirror.. so someone could get ready to go out, while the other one showered.  We experienced waves of hot and cold.. I am sure that is because it's an old building.. you just do not find charm like that.We will definitely stay there again.. very convenient to everything. We loved it.

review_title: Our stay at Domum de Venc√© was‚Ä¶
review_text: Our stay at Domum de Venc√© was convenient to our Galveston cruise.  Although the room was small, it met our needs.  We enjoyed the Keurig coffee in the commons area before we left.  (I only gave 4 stars because it was very difficult to locate after dark, and the path to the front door had no sidewalk and was a little hazardous due to unevenness of the ground due to roots.)  ...We would consider this location again!

review_title: So much character here and in the‚Ä¶
review_text: So much character here and in the surrounding neighborhood. Great communication and check-in was easy. Small room/rooms so know that going in but ours was really nice and a good use of space. Good coffee available was a nice bonus. Lots of places to eat nearby and easy walk to the strand and trolley.

Excellent stay. Great on site managers. We had  the large room and it was perfect for 2 people. We did have trouble getting the front door code to work but a quick text to the place took care of the problem.This is like an European hotel. Netflix was a nice touch.I highly recommend this BnB for your stay in Galveston.

review_title: The fan on the heater/ aircondtioner‚Ä¶
review_text: The fan on the heater/ aircondtioner barely blew air out. All the housekeeping staff did was take the dirty towels and replaced them.with ne ones. They did not make the beds or clean the bathroom. There was a good stock and variety of coffee and  teas but when one particular brand was used it was not replaced. The location and prize was  great

Amazing house to stay in. The room was clean. It was a very easy check in and out. The host was very nice. I had accidentally left the parking permit in my car when I left for a cruise. The host was understanding and let me return it a week later when I got back. Will definitely recommend this place to others and will stay here again!

I have stayed at the Domum de Vence 3 times and my nights rest are never the same. I love everything about the ambiance they've created. Close to many different attractions for me. Domum de Vence is definitely my escape place for when I need my quiet time. It is always clean, I'm a bit of a neat freak and this place is definitely it. Communication is excellent from the I make reserving for my stay till my last day. I however, need to know where they got their mattresses from, since my best restful days are have been there.

review_title: We had a short vacation for the‚Ä¶
review_text: We had a short vacation for the Houston/Galveston area. Our stay at Domum de Vence was only 1 night but we enjoyed every minute. The communication was perfect, and our room was adorable and impeccable.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  It would be an easy walk to the Strand/Harbor area. We would stay here again, and would easily recommend to others.

There is only street parking, the curb was horrible, hard getting our suitcases up. Code was easy to use to get in front door and room. The room we were assigned #2 was tiny! I think our RV is bigger, too small for 2 grown adults with luggage, the pillows were old and flat there is no night stand to put my hubby CPAP machine on we did not see the iron? we checked out 4 hours after we checked in and went to a hotel as we were disappointed as pictures made it look lovely

Excellent value - perfect for anyone visiting the historic part of Galveston or UTMB, and the seawall. It is close to it all. We booked 2 rooms and both were comfortable, clean, and well furnished.Suggested add on for Domum de Vence to consider - outdoor furniture for the porch or other covered area. Since our rooms did not have a large sitting area having a spot outdoors would have been very useful. Even in the August Texas humidity. :)

My stay was only for 3 nights and the only thing I missed was having a closet or a dresser to accommodate your clothes.  The room was clean and the bed is very comfortable.  I found it to be very quiet, but then I left early in the morning and did not return until sleeping time.  The coffee machine is also a plus and very much appreciated by me.

review_title: This was very clean and nice
review_text: This was very clean and nice. The only complaint I have is that the foot of the bedframe sticks out and it's easy to run into it if you don't notice it (drew blood). Within walking distance of food. Less than a mile from cruise terminal.

We stayed just one night before our cruise bit we enjoyed our time Domum de Venice.  They let us drop off our luggage in the morning and we explored Galveston while we waited for our room to be ready.  Everything was clean and in working order.  It was a really cute room, comfortable and just perfect for what we were needing.

I loved the safety and cleanliness.  The interior was very pleasant. Check in was extremely easy and the location is perfect for me. Also, the number and location of electrical plugs was so good, I actually noticed! There was no hot water at the sink.  I tried the "hot" tap under the sink, but the water remained cold.  Not a deal breaker for me, but in the winter I would have contacted the host. I love the clean, minimal look, yet something small next to the bed for phone and glasses would be appreciated.

review_title: No frills B&B without the second B
review_text: We misunderstood that this was a house with very small rooms and not a proper hotel. For clarity, it‚Äôs a corner lot with street parking. They provide a temporary parking pass, which was a nice perk. The access is completely electronic and worked as expected. The room is tiny. Barely enough room for our stuff (we needed a room as our cruise was departing the following morning).10 minute walk to downtown. Beautiful neighborhood.No frills, but comfortable. Quiet and safe. Clean and tidy. If you‚Äôre looking for something quaint but utilitarian, this is probably a good fit.

review_title: Nice clean room with all the‚Ä¶
review_text: Nice clean room with all the necessities for a nights stay. The bed was comfortable and the location was perfect. We stayed the night before our cruise. We walked to dinner at Willie G‚Äôs and bar hopped on the strand then breakfast at The Sunflower Bakery and then to our cruise terminal. Everything was perfect.

Located within walking distance of a lot of food and shops. Room was compact but nice and loved the wood flooring! The only things that were kind of a con was I don‚Äôt think our floor was swept at all for the whole stay, the shower doesn‚Äôt have a door so shower kept soaking the towel and floor when stepping out. Also we had to daily for extra towels because they initially would just give two sets for the day. Other than that I did enjoy the stay and how quickly someone responds to any issue.

Small room but well arranged. Very clean and much more economical than others. Best for singles but adequate for couples short stay due to size. No contact with manager during stay but no problem. Safe neighborhood, in walking distance of restaurants on Strand. 1 mile from cruise terminals.

Nice experience for a couple. It is a small and quaint place close to the Strand. It is good for a one or two night trip or even if you will be out on the town. The bed is a little too soft but overall the experience was really good. I will be coming back if I visit Galveston soon.

Room temperature control is controlled centrally and was unable to regulate my own temperature to cool the room during a warmer part of the day. Regardless the room fan worked well and the heater worked at night to keep the room warm as temps dropped

review_title: The house is in a great‚Ä¶
review_text: The house is in a great location‚Ä¶walking distance to all the great restaurants etc‚Ä¶.very clean, comfy and we felt very safe!  Only thing I wish was in the room was a full length mirror‚Ä¶.

review_title: The house was very fancy and the room‚Ä¶
review_text: The house was very fancy and the room was cute and perfect my me and my daughters one night stay. The linens were comfy and the room temp was just right. I liked how it was close to everything. I would stay again.

review_title: We had a bit of a difficult time‚Ä¶
review_text: We had a bit of a difficult time getting our room door to unlock and were getting eaten alive by mosquitoes. Our room was clean and cool. Bed was super comfy.

review_title: Great if you won't be in the room much
review_text: I wish there was a 3.5 stars. The room was good for our purpose, as we didn't plan to be in it much. But it is SMALL! Nowhere to hang up clothes. Really, no room to put the suitcase. I would personally take out the corner desk and put some sort of narrow armoire there. If someone wants a workspace, get an armoire with a slide out tray and tuck a folding chair behind. Honestly, my only real complaint (like I said we really just needed somewhere to shower and sleep) was that the bed was REALLY uncomfortable. It was WAY too soft, and it didn't stay against the wall.

The room was very clean and updated.  The house was old and historic which I love but the room was not small it was tiny.  The queen size bed was surrounded by three walls so I had to crawl over my husband to get out of bed.  There was no closet just a coat rack.  The bathroom sink was one foot by one foot and the room was so small the bathroom door was a barn door that the tracks went over the bed so if the door was open you had to watch out getting out of bed.We got there at nine at night and left around eight in the morning we preferred to lug our luggage and stuff around Galveston than to stay longer.

Good, nice place,  coffee is a bonus. Bed was somewhat comfortable, but edges seemed to sink down and pillows way too soft. Maybe a head board would help.. Not much counter space in bathroom to hold your stuff. Good value for the price, and no contact is a bonus

We never could get the AC unit to come on. Luckily the ceiling fan had a handy remote that allowed us to crank up the airflow and stay cool through the night. Its possible we just didnt know how to work the device or remote control to the unit.

review_title: I had no idea that I was booking a‚Ä¶
review_text: I had no idea that I was booking a guest house when I reserved the room.  Upon arriving, I was hesitant about staying the night based upon the outside.  Once inside, however, I relaxed a bit.  The room was clean and provided what was needed, but it had a strange smell. I did not like that I could hear others moving about the house and talking loudly while doing so.  If the policy doesn't require guests to consider others who are staying there, it should. I must say, however, the bed and linen were great! I slept so very well!The stay wasn't as bad as I thought it would be upon arriving, but I will not return. For what I paid, an actual hotel would be my first choice.
The place was decent on the inside. Small rooms and the A/C did not work well. It was difficult to sleep in the warm room. Also, the outside was unkempt - tall grass and not much landscaping.

Several things. When I went to read the directions to get codes for entry they had the check in for 3:30. I tried to call, no answer. I wrote them immediately in their messaging, they never responded. Pictures are deceiving. Thought we had a little coffee bar, it‚Äôs out in the hall for everyone.  Which I think if it‚Äôs for all to share, why not add a little ice maker and maybe a microwave? Issues getting in the first time, apparently due to not allowing you in till 3:30. Another couple staying there helped me with that. I was there for a wedding.  Hair dryer didn‚Äôt work, plug prongs just fell into the hair dryer. I actually helped the couple next door to us when they were trying to get in their room.  They didn‚Äôt send them their code for both door entries. They were so grateful I was able to tell them mine was the same for both door entries and that worked. Two windows in the room, but 3 are shown on their site. No shower pan, so it was hard to keep your things dry. More hooks would be helpful. No directions for the tv, I‚Äôm not that good with smart tv‚Äôs, but no information on what channels we could get. Decor was cool, unique hardware etc. for the price of just under $128.00 total, expected a little bit more. A partial credit would be very fair.

review_title: The low rating is because of the size
review_text: The low rating is because of the size. The pictures of the room are very deceptive. We did enjoy the location and the room was very clean. The size of the shower was a joke and no closets space. Not a lot of room for luggage or your belongings.

review_title: 5 stars because the room is very clean‚Ä¶
review_text: 5 stars because the room is very clean and bed is comfortable.  Location is great for near the downtown area.  The sink is smallest I've ever seen, a better shelf in that area would be only complaint.

review_title: The picture on the Airbnb website are‚Ä¶
review_text: The picture on the Airbnb website are not even close to the room. The room we got was very small. The bed was old and the view we had was an air conditioning unit. There was free wifi and free Netflix but no cable. Would not recommend
Very cute and quaint bed and breakfast type. It is pretty close to the seawall, and the Strand. It's very easy to get from point A to point B. Will definitely stay again when visiting Galveston!

It was very cozy, bed was super comfortable! The only thing that I could say negative would be that there wasn‚Äôt anywhere to put bathroom items.. it needs a shelf or shelves to be able to place items. I would stay there again for sure!

review_title: Very convenient nice and clean I have‚Ä¶
review_text: Very convenient nice and clean I have requested  room also next year its close to the ship

review_title: Very clean rooms and comfortable bed
review_text: Very clean rooms and comfortable bed. Very quiet and cozy room.. I wish there was a fridge in the room, but other than that it was amazing. I will come here again.

I liked the hotel. I was alone. The room is great. It is not small and well sized for one. I liked the view from the window and the very cozy atmosphere of the hotel. The staff is at the level. I advise you to visit.

review_title: Enjoyed the stay with super comfortable‚Ä¶
review_text: Enjoyed the stay with super comfortable beds.  Small, but very clean and convenient location. Hair dryer did not work and I would suggest putting a mirror on the wall outside of the bathroom.  Will be back!
We loved the quaint room. It was very tiny so a luggage rack and something to set towels/clothes on in bathroom would help.It was a great price for a bed to sleep in!

review_title: This was a great place to stay
review_text: This was a great place to stay. It was very, very clean and close to everywhere we wanted to go. They came in and changed out towels and cleaned while we were shopping.  We will definitely stay here again when we come back.
What a charming place. Loved my room. Was nice and cool. Super clean. Dining options in walking distance and just a few blocks from the port. Loved it and will definitely stay again
Excellent location and beautiful home and room! We had some trouble getting into the home but called and had immediate help. All in all, a great stay for a weekend trip - no complaints!
Very easy to check in. Only issue is we got locked out of the back door and our code didn‚Äôt work back there to get back in after being in the designated smoking area. Not too big a deal though.

After eventually getting in the front door everything was clean and for the most part updated.  The outside was dated and needs attention.  Grounds were uneven, I can see someone injuring themselves.  We stayed in room #3 and it was an extremely small room, should be just for one person if that.  There were no pictures of this room on their Booking.com site and I can see why.  It was humid and warm (not hot) in our room.   After attempting, unsuccessfully, to turn on the air conditioner I text the number they provided and received an immediate response.  Unfortunately they said they had turned off the air conditioning and we needed to utilize the ceiling fan, sleeping was uncomfortable and taking showers made it worse.  Bed were comfortable.

review_title: A great experience at a great price
review_text: Although the room was small, it was very quaint and accommodating. Domum de Vence was a wonderful find at a great price. Well done.
Very cute and clean spot. Loved the location and the convenience of using a code to get in and out instead of key cards. Netflix was a big plus. A little smaller than expected but still a good time.
The accommodations were perfect and location was superb. We especially appreciate the clean the room. Quiet! Checkin was easy, check out was easy, awesome experience thank you.
The place was nice, clean and close to everything we needed. The neighborhood was friendly and we enjoyed our stay. I loved the ease of checking in and out. It was wonderful.
It has nice quiet and spacious rooms. We felt like at home. Our holiday was very nice and unforgettable. The hotel was at a level that can be said to be perfect. Thank you for your services.
We appreciated the coffee availability in the hallway. Room was just fine for the price. Loved high ceilings gs, hardwoods, and big shower. Bed comfy!

review_title: The only thing I would change is‚Ä¶
review_text: The only thing I would change is putting a sign out front either on the lawn or on the property itself so people realize they've reached the proper destination. Everything else was great
Nice older house. Room and bath were on the small side, but functional.  Easy check in and was very clean inside. Nice having a coffee bar. If there would have been an ice machine, even better.

review_title: Really nice little place to stay
review_text: Really nice little place to stay. Only thing I would change is having more counter space, otherwise everything was very clean and nice.
We enjoyed our short stay. Very close to cruise terminal. Room was clean and comfortable bed. Priced just right! We will return next time we‚Äôre in Galveston. Thank you.
Very nice, clean, and accommodating boutique hotel. This was our 2nd stay, and would definitely stay again.
Very clean, meet our need for an overnight stay but didn‚Äôt stay cool enough for our taste but we like it cold when de sleep
Very clean, but very small.  Bed was uncomfortable.  No sidewalks to enter, very uneven stones.  No handrail.  Door locks are not easy to navigate.  We had to park a v block away.
We enjoyed our visit very much - it's a perfect, quick get-a-way for a short trip or stay. Everything was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the location was perfect.We will be back!

review_title: It was very nice and quiet
review_text: It was very nice and quiet. Room was clean. We had an easy time getting in and out. Parking can be tight at times, but not a bad enough issue to not stay here again.

review_title: The room was quite clean and neat
review_text: The room was quite clean and neat. Room was small but was ok for the two of us . Bed was comfortable clean sheets and towels. But all in was a wonderful stay. Loved it.
Our stay went fine. The accommodations are basic and very clean. Would appreciate simple, strong black coffee in the morning. Otherwise, price and location were very good!  Thank you!
Great quick stay , nice and clean , very quiet . Met a family staying there also who were really nice . Nice location super close to the beach
Bathroom immaculate. Sink was slow draining.  Bed ok and coffee was good.

review_title: Hotel and Rooms were very cute
review_text: Hotel and Rooms were very cute. Great location and staff. Little issues: Fan stopped working in Room 5. TV remote stopped working in Room 1.

As this room is on Booking.com, I am comparing it to other rooms I've stayed in. The positives are: great wifi and TV Netflix provided. Close to the historical area & cruise ship departure area. Nice hot water & communal coffee machine.However, if you don't have a car, the fact that you can't enter before 3.30pm and can't store luggage before check in or after check out is disappointing and very inconvenient, especially if it's raining.The pillows were terrible- thin polyester filling which didn't support head. There were no cushions to support back while watching TV. The pillows were supposed to do that, yet because there was a gap between the wall, used as a bed head and the mattress, the thin pillows could slip through the gap and they didn't support the back.Also, the hairdryer plug was broken, so it was unuseable. There is no refrigerator or microwave either and while the room states it is sound proofed, it is not. Aircon motors cutting in and out, a cat fight & other noises, meant little sleep.

review_title: We always stay at Domun de Vence
review_text: We always stay at Domun de Vence.  It is a clean and well maintained facility.

review_title: Great place to spend a night in‚Ä¶
review_text: Great place to spend a night in Galveston. Super affordable. No frills, but clean, quiet, and perfect for a comfortable place to stay.

review_title: This place was perfect for a place to‚Ä¶
review_text: This place was perfect for a place to stay on island before sailing out on a cruise. Thank you guys so much!
We enjoyed our stay. The bed was comfortable for us It was an interesting house that has been fully modernized. Plus it was close to the Strand.
Quaint little room. Only issue was that the floors were cold but what do you expect when Galveston gets down into the 20's. Would stay again!!
I absolutely loved it our room, it was perfect for a day after the beach. We were comfortable and will be staying here the next time we‚Äôre in Galveston.
We loved this place.   Perfect for the 1 night stays before cruise!    Only thing I wish is it had a common area to sit and talk with your group

review_title: This older house does not keep up with‚Ä¶
review_text: This older house does not keep up with Texas Heat!!! Way too hot in these rooms. They said the AC units were new but our room never got below 80 degrees even in the middle of the night. Plugs in the bathroom area are close to the shower with no door so if anything is plugged in, if you try to take it out, you might get electrocuted.  I text the hotel around 10pm and got a response, but then again at 230 am they messaged me again, different information. We were asleep!!!! Will NEVER use this place again.** response to below "explanation" ** After just now reading reviews we are NOT the only ones who had AC problems. May be time to upgrade the system again!! May cost more on the electric bill but having happy customers would mean more to me than that!Also!! Handicap access would be great too!! This was a pleasant place to stay and we would not hesitate to stay here again. It is a modest house with small comfortable rooms, which seemed to be recently renovated. There is no signage anywhere, nor is there a front desk with anyone to talk to. You get an email the day before with the digital code to unlock the front and room doors and you just let yourself in. If you have any issues, you have to text message them - which we had to do a few times. Jade (not sure if she was an owner, a manager, or service staff) was very friendly and responsive. The bed was very comfortable. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. The air conditioner and ceiling fan kept the room temperature comfortable.  The location of Domum was perfect -  a few blocks walk to the Strand and a 3 min Uber ride to the cruise port. The only reason it has 4 stars and not 5 is because of it‚Äôs minimalistic character. All in all we had a very positive experience with our 2 night stay.

review_title: If you value comfort or having any‚Ä¶
review_text: If you value comfort or having any space at all, stay somewhere else. The room was tiny which was made worse by the way they had it laid out. There‚Äôs no mini fridge and only one tiny trash can. In the bathroom there is no counter so if you have hair utensils or anything else you have to set them in the sink while you use them. The water takes forever to get warm. The bed is hard and uncomfortable, the pillows are lumpy and have no substance so you‚Äôre constantly trying to refluff it. There‚Äôs only one mirror and it‚Äôs above the sink in the bathroom, so no way to see below your neck. Housekeeping turns your air up when they clean. We had it set to 61 because we need it cold to sleep. Came in to nap after having been gone a few hours and they had cranked it up to 68 and turned the fans off. This happened twice. The door to the bathroom is glass, so if you need to use it in the middle of the night, it will light up the entire room. There‚Äôs no ledge in the shower so if you‚Äôre trying to shave good luck. The doors are extremely heavy and don‚Äôt stay open, so coming in or out with luggage is a hassle. The sheets are scratchy and made of a super loud material, every time one of us turned it sounded like someone was crinkling a newspaper. If you‚Äôre a single person just looking for a shower and a clean bed it‚Äôs perfect. If you‚Äôre not traveling alone and have so much as one bag, you‚Äôll likely feel cramped and irritated at the lack of storage or any other space.UPDATE: Below is owners response Reply from Domum de Venc√©Greetings, as advertised: ‚ÄúDomum is a minimum space/lightly furnished boutique‚Äù. The rooms are modeled after European dimensions; recently rebuilt and regularly updated, everything is bespoke, from Phylrich bathroom fixtures to Ann Sacks floor tiles. For larger accommodation we recommend our Deluxe options.I tried to copy and paste the text on the website I used to book but it won‚Äôt allow me to and this site won‚Äôt let me attach. So to the owner of the hotel: go check your business description on Booking.com. No where on there does it say anything you just described. If you‚Äôre going to use different sites to book, you should make sure they all say what you think they say.UPDATE:I appreciate you changing your reply after realizing that your description was not as you thought, however, there was only one picture of our room which showed the bed and a hallway and one picture of the bathroom. The description of the hotel said every room had a seating area so I assumed that somewhere off the hallway pictured was the seating area. But the hall just went back to the door and bathroom. So you can say now that the room is as ‚Äúpictorially described‚Äù but when I booked, your description said seating area, so despite your pictures, there should have been a seating area. Most hotels don‚Äôt shoot every angle of every room so I wasn‚Äôt concerned not actually seeing the seating area. I‚Äôll know better next time I book a hotel somewhere.
IGNORE TEXT

On their website they say"A Beautiful Space To DreamHistorically Modern | Minimal SpaceAn intelligent rendition of 19th century elegance infused with modern comfort.  Domum offers thoughtful beauty in minimum / lightly furnished space for guests seeking a spot of luxury with their morning coffee.  Guest rooms are complemented with ten-foot ceilings that accent this home's historic origin.  Original wood floors that, although revived, reflect a charm earned through decades of experience. En suite personal bathing rooms are reminiscent of the Mediterranean, both fresh and tranquil.  Your room is coated with juxtaposed color that's both subtle and bold; a rich expression that is sure to delight."The key phrase is "minimum/lightly furnished space"This is an historic property turned hotel, but really more like a B&B but there is no breakfast. I really liked the 19th century feel of the property. The location is quiet and perfect for the strand area of Galveston.Inside the property it is quite modern. Before I give you the negative side of things, I would stay here again. My intention is not for you to not consider the property, but to better understand what you are getting. I stayed in a single room with a queen bed. I knew the space would be small but didn't really care at the time because I was just planning to sleep. There was a bed, desk, chair, and a coat rack (plus the bathroom of course). There was no closet, no shelf, no place to put you suitcase, no mini-fridge, no ice on the property, and no vending machine. So if you wanted a cold drink, you would have to head out to a store. I didn't realize how important it was for me to have ice or access to a cool drink if for no other reason than to take my medicine. It was very inconvenient to have to place the suitcase on the floor. The description they provide is very accurate. The pictures of the rooms are accurate.There is no front desk. You are emailed a code that gives you access to the front door and your room door. If you are technology impaired you might find this difficult. I personally had some difficlty because it is not very clear that you have entered the code correctly. The place is not ADA compliant and probably is exempted due to it's historic nature. I only say that because if you use a wheel chair or walker I would not recommend this property as there in no sidewalk, an uneven cobblestone walkway from the fence to the house, and steps to the front porch. And more stairs if you are on the second floor. In my single room I don't think you would be able to turn a wheelchair around in the room and a walker would take up sprecious space. There is no onsite parking. It is street parking and there is a sign on the street that says 2hr parking 8:00am-5:00pm with exemption for resident pass. Fortunately when I entered the room there was a parking plackard for the car. If you have children the small room is not for you. If you are a couple, the small room will be a bit cramped. I don't know about the other rooms. Even with that, overall it was a pleasant stay

This is very nice room, building, location is outstanding within local communityYou need to address and take action to resolve important issues if expect us to ever stay or recommend others:--major issue is invest and install premium quality a/c units that function above and beyond minimum expectations = comfort;--parking is controlled by city so need to provide AT LEAST 2 passes per room;--Door lock systems require serious attention  ABSOLUTELY SHOULD WORK WITH ONLY 1 TRYTook at least 4-6 try before door code accepted and openedUNTIL YOU INVEST TO RESOLVE THE ISSUES, I'LL NOT RETURN OR RECOMMENDRalph Gandara

review_text: Perfect for one person or a couple trying to save money but still feel comfortable and classy

This small property was very well kept and updated especially for its age. Keeping to a European type hotel was good advise since I was not expecting lots of "frills", in which there were none. 1. The sheets/blankets seemed very nice and clean until I found numerous pubic hairs. I am sure (and hoped) they were from the washer or dryer during cleaning, since everything looked and smelled clean, but still disturbing.2. The air conditioner above the bathroom was leaking water excessively. The floor outside of the bathroom and inside was especially pooling water. Housekeeping should have noticed this previously and advised management. It was there when I checked in so not a "new" problem but I had to step over, or in, water consistently.3. Nice to have Netflix and other stations like that but I get those on my cable at home. Would have liked some local channels for news/weather etc.also.4. I am a career property management professional, not a "picky" consumer. If this was one of my properties that I inspected, the manager would have to do some "splainin" to do (to quote Ricky Ricardo).Have stayed in many hotels in Galveston over the years and this was not the worse. Fixing the above issues would have earned 1 or 2 more stars.

review_title: Cheaper than some but we definitely found out why.
review_text: The pictures made it seem like a much larger room but it was basically a closet with a bathroom in it. We did not get housekeeping, we tried to ask about it and they just said they would get it the next day. When we arrived there were spiders crawling on the ceiling. There was mold on the shower curtain. When we finally did get housekeeping, 2 days into our stay, they didn‚Äôt sweep the sand off of the, maybe, 3 square foot area where we could walk so it was impossible to not track it into the bed. They talk about the complementary  WiFi but it hardly worked either, not that we needed it a lot but trying to wind down with a show after being in the sun all day was what we were trying to do. The ac did not work well either so the room stayed muggy and somewhat warm. There was no signage when you pull up so we had to approach the house to be sure the number was correct according to the address. Seemed odd for a place that calls itself a hotel. The entire description is extremely generous considering what you actually end up getting when you walk in. Though I guess ‚Äútechnically‚Äù they do not lie.  It was cheaper than some but we definitely found out why.

Beautiful home! Upon pulling up, I was a ‚Äúbit‚Äù skeptical but after going inside and seeing how beautiful and clean it was all skepticism left and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and it was a great location as well !!

Beautiful house. Gorgeous details and so modern with key pads for the front door and room. I didn't meet the host, but they were responsive in emails and gave me all my room info the day of booking and a parking permit for street parking in my room to put on my car dashboard. The room is large walk in closet size which was great for me and my 10 year old for one day. She loved it and wanted to stay there instead of the beach. I only saw a guest or two for a second, otherwise it was so quiet that Iwouldn't have thought anyone was there.

There were a couple of things we noticed during our stay. The location was great and the parking permit was very handy. However, we had two minor inconveniences and one suggestion we‚Äôd like to offer. One being the bathroom door. It was hard to turn and had a moment where I was concerned we would have to damage the door to get out. The other is the shower drain. I‚Äôm not sure if it was clogged or always drains so slowly but the water was all over the bathroom floor in a matter of minutes. One suggestion we would offer is another trash can. The small on was just not enough after we got take out. Otherwise the room was nice for the price and fit what we were looking for on our weekend getaway.

review_title: Unique experience in a cute, quaint neighborhood
review_text: The rooms are surprisingly small, but perfect for a couple. There was no signage on the building to let us know we were in the right place other than the house number, and it was a bit odd to check ourselves into and out of our room, as there was no front desk. In our room we were provided with towels, a couple of makeup wipes, and shampoo/conditioner in the shower. Had we needed anything more we would have had no way to get it. There was a TV with Netflix already loaded on it. I will say, it could have been very difficult to find a specific room as there were no signs leading to certain rooms, just numbers on the doors. Definitely a unique experience in a cute, quaint neighborhood that was perfect for what we needed but could be frustrating in other situations.

Absolutely wonderful accommodations! Cute, clean, and bed was very comfortable! Parking pass also included in the package for parking on the streets. Fabulous location! Short walking distance to downtown market square of Galveston where shops and many many bars are plentiful. Was very impressed and pleased with this stay!

Parking, like all of Galveston, was terrible and to have only 1 cup for coffee (and not any other cup to be found) when we booked for 2 people was really annoying. Did not like the fact that we had no control over the temperature in the room. It was stuffy and humid and for a couple hoping for a lovely romantic stay, it was very uncomfortable. Now, had I been alone, this place would have been perfect. We actually booked the second night at a hotel just to get some sleep.

review_title: The room was really lovely and in a‚Ä¶
review_text: The room was really lovely and in a great location. I loved the digital locks, the room was very clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the bed and pillows were way too soft and uncomfortable. Also the bed had a big gap between the wall, which made it feel like you were falling in. Other than that everything was absolutely awesome.

review_title: Quick to respond when had to call
review_text: IGNORE TEXT
Beautiful room! Very clean and comfortable--cant wait for my next stay!
Excellent setup,  very chic, clean and very COVID 19 FRIENDLY since there is no human direct interaction due to keyless full system and electronic instructions.
Was very pleased with the accommodation. Will probably visit again

Enjoyed the atmosphere,  very nice up to date furnishing. Room was nice, bathroom needed a longer glass on the shower water drenched the floor was disappointed cause breakfast wasnt served. So it didn't give me the true bed and breakfast experience. Will come back if breakfast is added to the amenities.
Room was clean. We got to check in early. Bathroom was clean. Thomas was very helpful and friendly.

review_title: The place was very clean and cute
review_text: The place was very clean and cute, our room was perfect for our visit, had everything we needed. Loved the style and touches throughout the property. This was a great value for the price and location. The staff was friendly and helpful! Would recommend, my husband and I enjoyed our stay here
Great stayt. Very quiet, easy to access. Room size was good for us. Only wish there was a fridge of some sort to keep something cold. No way to control A/C. But would stay here again.
Great space. Super soft sheets.  Overall pleased!
We absolutely loved the place. It had such a modern look and was a nice, quiet place to stay on our trip to Galveston. We'd love to come stay again!

Real hassle just getting in the place, especially if one does not have a smart phone.  How is a guest supposed to guess how to use the outside keypad?  No kleenex, no closet, no counter space in bathroom, no place to hang wet towels, tiny bathroom sink, no clock, no way to get ice, tv did not function properly.  No way we would stay more than 2 nights,  Charming looks were deceiving.
Nice place to stay. Will definitely stay here again back to Galveston!

review_title: Very clean but much smaller than‚Ä¶
review_text: Very clean but much smaller than expected.. Shower water soaks bathroom floor. Codes are confusing to get in at first.

review_title: I would highly recommend this place
review_text: I would highly recommend this place. It was a great location and super clean!

This hotel/room was on a website where‚Äî I thought that only promoted hotel stays. This room is like an AirBnB stay. You defiantly have to have an open mind to vintage stay. Likes:1)Staff super nice very responsive. 2) upgrades to the bathroom. Dislikes:1) tiny sink in the room ( outside of bathroom) 2) cracked  floors3) I was In room 5 your can hear the front door open and shut. Again, if it was just me it would be fine. I had a guest with me and he was not happy.

Lovely space! I stayed in Room 3, which was small but suited me just fine. Everything was VERY clean. Loved the no-contact check in and mobile app to unlock and lock doors. I would have liked to see some disinfecting wipes at the coffee bar, but otherwise, I felt completely comfortable. Wifi gave me some trouble while trying to meet with coworkers over Zoom...I didn't mind (gave me an excuse to say "I'll catch up via email!" Hah), but might be useful for others to plan ahead. Great location...short walk to the Strand and short drive to the beach. Easy parking. Overall, I had a fantastic stay, and will definitely stay again the next time I'm in Galveston!

review_title: Hip Charm in Galveston‚Äôs East End
review_text: Loved the place! And a preserved 1886 home with wonderfully hip public areas and rooms!  I stayed Domum for a single night and was in town for business.  My only reason for not granting five stars was a lack of hot water on the morning of my check out (Had a wonderful hot shower at night but a lack of hot water the next morning, although I was in the shower before 7 AM) and for spotty WiFi TV connection. (TV worked once in the early evening on then day I checked in but would not work for me on thereafter. But then, WHO goes to beautiful Galveston to stay in the room to watch TV anyway?!) Other than that, the room was all that I had hoped, Beautifully appointed with the latest beds, linens, toiletries, black out curtains, with absolutely exceptional bathroom facilities! Beautifully functioning air-conditioning.  The bed was pure bliss and absolute heaven, with fluffy pillows and wonderful linens.  Extremely accommodating staff, made allowances for my inability to download the app that would allow me to bypass the magnetic locks on the exterior doors and my room door: Provided me with a physical key to allow me to enter my room! (Thank you!) And provided a free parking pass for me to park my vehicle in the permit-only residential neighborhood.  The price is incredibly reasonable and the location, for me, gets me closer to everything that I want to see in Galveston ‚Äì ‚Äì which most often does not include anything near the seawall or the beach.  I hope to return to Domum de Vence‚Äô As soon as Darci and her friendly, professional, and efficient staff will have me again!
Great stay - awesome communication ... room as described/parking was easy and close to many local spots!

review_title: We had a great stay at Domum de Vence
review_text: We had a great stay at Domum de Vence.  It was very secure with easy instructions on how to access our room.  The room and bathroom were adorable and just perfect for a couple.  Centrally located, near some great restaurants and the beach is a few minutes drive.

review_title: Such a cute place and accommodation for‚Ä¶
review_text: Such a cute place and accommodation for my little weekend getaway! The room was very clean, the bed was extremely comfy and the staff is so pleasant & professional. Would definitely book with them again.  5 ‚≠êÔ∏è

review_title: I think they are new and need some to time to get the place to be more comfortable and attractive.
review_text: We found the bed uncomfortable and could not sleep.I think it was too soft for us as were the pillows.There was no place to set our luggage.The sink was way too small.We couldn't get regular broadcast live tv.The outside of the house needs some work.I think they are relatively new and need some time to get the place looking better.
Clean quiet and so cute! My 2 day stay was so great the bed is comfortable and the room it‚Äôs super cozy it‚Äôs not far from the seawall or port so you want tons of options for activities.

The accommodations were quite charming. Our room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. We could not have asked for a more perfect experience!

review_title: We loved our stay here and it was‚Ä¶
review_text: We loved our stay here and it was perfect! Very nice and clean!!

We loved our stay! Our room was so clean, fresh and peaceful. The bed was blissfully comfortable! My husband is very picky about pillows but even he was pleased. The decor is chic and our stay was super quiet. It's in a neat neighborhood close to the beach and within walking distance of good food and shopping. The roomy shower is perfect for cleaning up after a day in the sand. Best of all it was affordable. This is going to be where we stay every time we visit Galveston!

The place was nice.  I did not, however, like the bed at all.  The room was definitely big enough for a king bed, and we got a full.  Not enough room and way too soft. That would be the only reason not to come back.
Nice place to stay. I would highly recommend
Amazing and beautiful stay! The room was beautiful and it's very close to the beach and shopping areas. Highly recommend!

review_title: We really enjoyed our time we spent‚Ä¶
review_text: We really enjoyed our time we spent there. We will definitely return.

Loved the room and the use of technology to check in and access the accommodation. Lights are very bright and would suggest dimmer switches. I had room #1 which is at the entrance to the property. I did not hear anyone entering or leaving which was a plus, though with being able to use technology it would have been nice if the lights in the hallway dimmed ore there wasn't much light coming through the door.
Really enjoyed my stay! It was safe, quiet, comfortable and clean. Thomas was great to meet and I would definitely stay again!

Neat old house with a good location and easy parking with the permit provided. Quick walk to downtown, or short drive to the beach. The room I stayed in was very small (#2) but decent for a weekend stay.
excellent service,  very flexible,  and wonderful people. I would give 6 stars if I can.

review_title: Hi very stylish place the owner has‚Ä¶

Good place and really quiet, we had a very good expience there!!

review_title: Ik chose the B&B because it was not‚Ä¶
review_text: Ik chose the B&B because it was not expensive. The downside is that there was nobody present. Doors open on electronics which is a bit difficult for older people like me. Good coffee available no breakfast. Nice room good bed clean. Quet area.

review_title: Property/ room was very clean and‚Ä¶
review_text: Property/ room was very clean and within walking distance of great restaurants, trolley, and museums. Good to have Netflix but would prefer live tv. There was some music noise from another room during night. Would definitely stay again.

review_text: Lovely room and very convenient to Historical areas.... enjoyed walking the neighborhood and seeing the Victorian homes.  Very nice coffee bar in the hall.  Will definitely book again.
The staff was fantastic.  Super convenient to everything near the strand and pier 21.  We will definitely stay here again.

Thank you so much for such a wonderful place. I just loved all the detail of the room. It was so clean, the bed was comfortable, the house was quiet, and we were able to walk downtown to get where we needed to go.

review_title: Couldn‚Äôt figure out how to turn the‚Ä¶
review_text: Couldn‚Äôt figure out how to turn the ceiling fan on. Sink is way too small and water gets on the floor every time you use it. Otherwise, wonderful place!!!
Small but very clean, easy access, the attendant was very nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
Staff most accommodating and helpful. Only reason I did not give 5 stars is that for cost value, I felt some basic upgrades would be nice, I.e., floors and grounds. Again, wonderful host and staff.

Perfect clean room, comfortable bed, nice shower, great toiletries. Exactly what I was looking for for a one-night stay - perfect location and perfect price as well. My only suggestion would be to add a nightstand and to eventually have a sidewalk and maybe switch out the chain link fence for something a bit nicer - the inside was so nice, it just didn't fit.

Pleasant clean nicely refurbished modern small room inside an unmarked blue house. Find it by going in the back porch door with a key code and then using your phone to unlock and always relock the room door.  Modern lights, bedding, bathroom; original oak floors. Simple and clean. Very reasonable price and good location between medical school and downtown, in historic district.  Coffee maker in the hallway shared by all guests. It's a small room and bathroom, perfect for a budget minded single, maybe too small for many couples except for budget advantage.

review_title: I enjoyed my stay here everything was clean and relaxing
review_text: I enjoyed my stay here everything was close the strand is walking distance and beach a quick bike ride. I loved the look it was extremely clean and the management was excellent. Will be staying here again.

review_title: I loved the experience at Domum de‚Ä¶
review_text: I loved the experience at Domum de Venc√© during my stay. I liked how easy and convenient it was to check-in with the August lock connected to my phone. The room was very spacious with a modern look and beautiful decor. The Tv with complementary Netflix was a nice touch. The place was conveniently located as well! Just 7 minutes walk to the historical strand district. I met Thomas, he manages the place. He was very attentive. He offered us coffee and gave us permits to park close to the residency. I would definitely stay there again on my next visit. You‚Äôll love the attention and convenience. ~Christian Franco

review_title: Everything is clean and perfect here
review_text: Everything is clean and perfect here! I have loved this hotel.

A modern technology enabled guesthouse within a easy walk of the center and the cruise line terminal. With more places opting for no onsite staff it is guesthouses like this where that works best. The app for accessing the room works well and the property manger responded quickly to emails. The room was cosy and clean with a streaming TV subscription. Coffee was provided in the public area. I highly recommend visiting Star Drug Store on 23rd St for breakfast. Watch out for the parking rules on the adjacent streets, particularly if you are staying during the week.

This was a delightful stay. The furnishings and decor are refreshing and relaxing. It was like staying in a luxury spa...stepping out of the busy world to a quiet escape!Thought was given to each detail from the plush towels, super soft bedding, and the luxurious personal care products. The location allowed for our morning coffee to conveniently be delivered right to the door!Every detail of this beautifully restored home will leave you feeling like you've had a grand vacation getaway!

Great ExperiencedOur trip to Peru organized by Miluka was very memorable. she helped make the daily plan, making things easier for us, and the tour was executed as it was and on time! Everything was well organised!She understands the customer's need and want. I made a few changes to the plan she made and she was fine with it. She recommended a chocolate-making class for us, since we travelled with kids, and glad that we took it. It was fun and interesting. It was the highlight for our children. Communication with her is easy, always replied to tons of my questions.

I had a limited window of time while in Peru for a tournament,  and very much wanted to see Machu Picchu and as much of that area as I could with my time.  They did an amazing job of creating a perfect itinerary for me.  Their guides were knowledgeable and very accommodating to my extremely limited Spanish.  I recommend them highly.

review_title: Our experience with Explore Inca was‚Ä¶AMAZING
review_text: Our experience with Explore Inca was fantastic. Miluska is amazing and she made our dream become true. Our guide Saul on the Salkantay trail was very very good too. We are planning our second trip to Peru since we absolutely love the first one. Thank You guys you are amazing We definitely recommend your service to everyone that wants to go to Peru.

Outstanding from beginning to end. Very knowledgeable guides, timely transportation and Miluska was easily accessible for any question we had. All of our accommodations were carefully selected and made us feel right at home.  I would recommend this company to all who travel to Peru.

review_title: Satisfied for all your arrangements and‚Ä¶
review_text: Satisfied for all your arrangements and attention from arrival to departure and in between which include transfers, vehicles, transfer staff and guides, Hotels and meals.Thank you, we will come back for a second trip and definitely recommend you to our friends.

review_title: We really enjoyed our time in Peru
review_text: We really enjoyed our time in Peru, finally getting there after multiple rebookings due to COVID. Would highly recommend Explore Inca to anyone looking to tour Peru.

My wife and I were very happy with our round trip in Peru organised by Explore Inca. From the very beginning we got good advice and the tour exceeded our expectations. I can really recommend Explore Inca.
