review_title: Explore Inca was my perfect travel‚Ä¶
review_text: Explore Inca was my perfect travel planning partner! They were with me every step of the way, even arranging for COVID testing for my husband and myself in our hotel before our departure to the US. The guides furnished by Explore Inca were excellent, and the drivers always on-time and trust-worthy. Every hotel, museum, and restaurant were perfect. Explore Inca listened to my input on goals, places, preferences, and priorities, and laid out the perfect agenda. They also responded quickly and well to a couple of in-route change requests. I recommend this group to plan your perfect trip to Peru.

review_title: Best trip to Peru with children
review_text: We traveled to Peru last Easter with our 2 boys and Explore Inca organized  a tailor-made trip for us. The organization was perfect, all transfers were on time, the hotels were superb, the guides super-knowledgeable and kind and the choice of activities was perfect for the whole family. The schedule was filled with different activities to learn about the Sacred Valley, Machu Pichu and the inca culture, to keep the kids engaged and the adults interested. Explore Inca understood perfectly our needs and organized the trip accordingly. I recommend Explore Inca 100%!!

Patricia, thank you so much for organizing a wonderful trip to Peru. We enjoyed it thoroughly. The pace was perfect, the places we covered beautiful and your support was exceptional. Guides were very knowledgeable and prompt.  Transportation was very comfortable. All eight of us have returned home with wonderful memories.  You stopping by to say hello was a nice touch! We would certainly recommend you to friends and family who are planning trips to Peru!

review_title: Great experience with Exploreinca and perfect organisation!
review_text: The organisation from the beginning till the end was absolutely fantastic. We didn't have to worry about anything. The guides, the drivers, the agents - all were extremely punctual, helpful and friendly.I would really recommend Exploreinca without any hesitation.

review_title: I am very pleased with services I got
review_text: I am very pleased with services I got. Can‚Äôt ask anything better. Sure will recommend to our friend. Everything was well taken care about our tripüëçüëå

This review is posted by Reena Shah on behalf of Mr. Bharat Mehta. We were 8 friends visiting Peru from July 7, 2022 to July 21, 2022. Thanks to Miluska and her team at travel agency, this was one of the best vacations. Everything went like a cloak work except two minor issues. For our trip to Cusco, bus was small and uncomeatable, Reena called and new larger bus arrived within 40 minutes during this time guide gave us nice sightseeing. There was two days of transport strike in Cusco, travel agency rearranged our plans in advance and this was not an issue.Pre planning, prompt response to any request, reliable bus driver, good English speaking guides, all hotels per agreed plan and excellent sightseeing. I also want to thank Reena for working with travel agency to plan every little details. Guides went beyond their duty to support some of us for difficult hiking.Transfer agent bought boarding passes for all of us for flight from Cusco to Lima.I highly recommend this travel agency and team.  Well done.

review_title: Great tour to Chiclayo, Lambayeque, Trujillo and the amazing archaeological sites of the Lord of Sipan, Lady of Cao, Huaca de la Luna, and Chan Chan
review_text: Exploreinca put together an excellent four-day tour of historical and archaeological sites of northern Peru for me.  My guide, Ana, was very accommodating and extremely knowledgeable of the archaeology and ancient cultures;  our driver, Paulo, was very safe and careful.  Both were good humored and much fun to be with.  They also suggested excellent, reasonably priced restaurants serving traditional Peruvian cuisine.  The entire tour was a delightful experience.For anyone interested in exploring the truly astounding archaeological sites and museums of the Chiclayo and Trujillo region (some quite remote) and learning about the amazing cultures that existed there prior to colonialism, I can highly recommend the services of Exploreinca.

review_title: Thank you Patricia for organizing all‚Ä¶
review_text: Thank you Patricia for organizing all the details and arrangements for our vacation trip to Peru(Lima, Machu Picchu, North Peru) flights, tours , transportation, restaurants, Hotels were outstanding! Our guides were so helpfully, friendly and people with knowledge and care making sure people like us traveling fir first time to Cuzco and Machu Picchu we‚Äôre happy and ok‚Ä¶Every aspect  with our trip to Machu Picchu, train ride with such impressive views, tickets , everything was great! We just enjoyed and had fun ‚Ä¶ Cuzco is impressive, their people, markets, Ollantaytambo, the Incan ruins around then town the different activities‚Ä¶Ziplining was so entertaining for my family with those beautiful green mountains‚Ä¶Exploreinca I highly recommend you..thank you for our beautiful time in Peru‚Ä¶

review_title: A fabulous trip with exceptional guides‚Ä¶
review_text: A fabulous trip with exceptional guides everyday.  The itinerary was fantastic.  We got to see everything we asked to be included and more! I would definitely recommend taking a tour with Exploreinca.
Trained professionals; follow-up and permanent support; services received above expectation

review_title: Great experience planning for our Peru trip
review_text: Great experience planning our trip to Peru. Good, timely communication. Easy to work with. Great support on the ground between ExploreInca and Lima Tours. Would highly recommend!

A trip to Machu Picchu was a longtime dream but we had no idea how to plan it, where to go, and where to even begin. Explore Inca made this trip so easy and stress free. With the hectic schedule of everyday life, planning was the last thing I wanted to do. Explore Inca made this one less thing for me to worry about. They did everything from arranging the hotels, transport, excursions, meals and guides. We did not have to worry about a thing, we just needed to show up. This trip was truly an experience. The guides were great and showed us all the local shopping areas as well as the historical sites we never thought of visiting. One even took us to an overlook in the Andes Mountain where some of us ended up zip lining. I truly appreciate Explore Inca for helping me have the trip of the summer despite COVID and they are truly a business I would go back to for another trip.

review_title: One of the best experiences we've ever had!
review_text: Our experience in Peru (organized by Explore Inca) at the end of last year was simply amazing. It will remain an unforgettable memory that we will keep in our hearts for the rest of our lives.We spent almost a month in Peru (Lima, Cusco, Arequipa, Puno and Iquitos / Amazon) and all our trips, transfers, flights and accommodation were perfectly organized. All our requests along the way were met on spot and we felt truly taken care of every day of our journey.We are a family of four - two teenagers included :) - and from the very beginning we realized it is not an easy thing to arrange such a long trip so far away from home (especially considering the LARGE amount of luggage that we had with us). However, Explore Inca and their partners made our experience flawless.Thank you so much for your professionalism, for your dedication and for your support in discovering the wonders of Peru - a country where magic surrounds you every step of the way.Marinica Fam.Romania

Thank you, thank you, Explore Inca!!  You have made a dream come true!! From landing in Lima, staying in  Sacred Valley, Cusco and then on to Machu Picchu and back!  I was so impressed with our guide Manny.  His knowledge and wonderful personality made our trip amazing.  I have a slight issue with asthma and during our climb in Machu Picchu he was so attentive.  I really enjoyed all of our day trips and his commitment to  make sure we were exposed to the wonderful Peruvian culture.  What an educational and joyful experience.  After returning from the Amazon we met our guide Ruthie at the airport.  She made the transition back to Lima and all the covid protocols much easier.  Our last day was so much FUN!!  Ruthie was so energetic and amazing.  We enjoyed a wonderful tour, her recommendation for dinner (best PISCO SOUR during the trip!!), and a fabulous experience in the town square. I just can't say enough about Explore Inca!  Their attention to detail, listening to what you would like to explore and their insightfulness is incredible. I would highly recommend their services.

Kudos to both, our team leader for pre planning and making itinerary and Miluska for implementing our request so well. Perfect team.I enjoyed long private bus rides with timely short stops, long boat rides, Gandola ride, Aroplane ride and train rides and all - It was a treat to do all these without headaches for buying tickets and inquiring details as everything was included and all tickets were just ready. Optional Gandola ride was also easy to purchase and was very enjoyable.All included luncheons and few dinners were excellent in good restaurants with nice hospitality and wonderful, eye pleasing local foods. No one got sick either !!!Planning was perfect for toilet stops.The best part was expert drivers and very pleasant, friendly young English speaking guides. They were able, willing and ready to help any time. We could not have done so well without them especially me!!!! I could have been miserable without their strong helping hands extended willingly. I certainly thank Miluska from bottom of my heart to have put together team of such wonderful young people and I send my heartfelt blessings to all.Last but not the least, I cannot thank enough to Miluska's timely response and ability to find solution for unexpected issue. Replacing 8 sitter bus to 15 sitter bus in about an hour was exemplary. It certainly made journey more comfortable for all of us.I do not have words to thank Miluska for her efforts to collect my watch from restaurant and deliver it to me at Lima airport. She certainly walked an extra mile !!!Watch itself was not expensive but it has great sentimental value! Miluska added in to it's value.

review_title: Excellent customer service , good transportation and hotels !!! Great guides definitely a plus as they all spoke English ! All the excursions were well organized hassle free!!
review_text: Excellent service ! Thanks to Maluska , her team !!!!

review_title: The Difference is in the Details
review_text: It‚Äôs been a long and difficult 18 months dealing with Covid. From being quarantined to missing family and friends, I was exhausted from the whole routine of living like a hermit. So when the opportunity arose to visit Peru and Machu Picchu I jumped at the opportunity. Of course because of the continuing health crisis I knew the only way I could have the experience I needed and deserved was to use a top notch travel agency group. So when I found ExploreInca it was like winning the lottery!  They handled everything, from the day to day schedule, hotels (which were 1st class), meals, etc. But one of the biggest üëçüèª I can give is the safety measures for Covid 19. They followed all the protocols but did it in a way that it was never a hassle. They made sure we had any and all documentation we needed and if anything did come up we made one quick phone call to Patricia (The one you should talk to!) and BOOM! Problem solved. I loved the way the itinerary was set up with a healthy mix of scheduled events and free time. I have to give a shout out to Manuel, our day to day tour leader,  he is a 3rd generation tour leader and you can feel his passion for the craft as he explained different things. His culture and its history are important to him which just gives the whole experience more juice!  To sum it all up please see my title as Patrica, Manuel, and everyone at ExploreInca left nothing to chance thus ensuring the amazing experience my family and I had!You can‚Äôt go wrong with ExploreInca!

I cannot speak highly enough of Miluska and Explore Inca.  We just didn't have an excellent experience, we had an exceptional experience.  The excursions, the properties and guides exceeded our expectations. I would like to make a special mention of two guides in particular;  Juan "Manny" Manuel Yanez was one of the best guides I have ever experienced as well as Ruth Silvera Raymondi Khadidja.  (For those reading this review I'm a seasoned traveler - 25 countries, 4 million miles) Visiting the village at Huilloc watching how the local villagers made beautiful textiles and their weaving methods was a highlight of the trip. This fun adventure was followed by a horse ride at Wayra Ranch through the back streets of Sacred Valley.  I love that property!! (Sol y Luna)  The next day we thoroughly enjoyed Manny guiding us through Ollantaytamia and the ancestral grounds of the Inca's.  His extensive knowledge made this site incredibly educational.  Our guide at Machu Picchu was also so knowledgeable he kept us very engaged the entire time.  The next day we enjoyed a 1/2 day Cusco tour going through the markets and streets of Cusco. The JW Marriott was a perfect location and a beautiful property.   Finally ending our vacation back in Lima where Ruth held our hand through COVID testing at the airport and then a fantastic excursion through Lima. The highlight was watching Ruth and my nephew Salsa Dancing with the crowd on a Saturday night!!! A perfect ending to a fantastic vacation thanks to Exploreinca!  P.S. Thank you Miluska for the pdf file on Lima and Cusco restaurants - UNREAL!!! I didn't realize Peru had become the gastro capital of the world.  Central was an excellent recommendation.  We decided we're going to have to come back to Lima just to eat our way through the city with so many Top 50 restaurants!!!!

review_title: The agent was SO personally invested in‚Ä¶
review_text: The agent was SO personally invested in helping me find the "right" reservations.  That meant determining the rooms, room sizes, factoring in many elements to get the best rates, such as "Would I add breakfast or not?" to the booking.  He answered every question and helped me  analyze many factors.  Finally, I was 100% satisfied with every aspect of the reservations I eventually made.
The clarity, practicality, elegance, organization and straight-forwardness presented by the FiveStar Alliance Group are an indulgence to any traveler.
Very easy to communicate and easy to understand

review_title: Glad I called for customer support
review_text: After difficulty completing the online reservation process I was delightfully surprised by five star alliance‚Äôs customer care support. My call was answered promptly by a cheerful and knowledgeable representative who completely shifted my experience to a 5 star rating.
honest offers which are always respected.

a restaurant that's open 6:30am to 11pm, it has a Starbucks INSIDE! Everything! Our Room was okay, a couple of things I'd change but nothing big enough to complain about. Staff was friendly, location was perfect! I would absolutely recommend this hotel and we'll be back again!

This is the 2nd time we have used the Five Star Alliance.  Our first trip was a great success.  We enjoyed all the perks afforded to us as members of Leading Hotels.   Very easy reservation process and all the information I needed to choose the right room is easily accessible.

He then helped with new bookings and was so helpful. Overall a great experince!

review_title: Amazing luxurious vacation packages booked by agents who listen, respond incredibly fast and defy expectations.
review_text: It is always a pleasure working with Five Star Alliance.  There are so many reasons why I continue to use their services.  For one, the recommendations for hotels always exceed my expectations.  Their response time is incredibly fast. The packages that one can only "score"  elevate a standard experience to a luxurious one.

review_title: I was looking for luxury hotel in‚Ä¶
review_text: I was looking for luxury hotel in Charlotte, North Carolina. I chose the Omni as it was listed as excellent. The location is great. The hotel is old and in need of clean up. Doors with gaps 1‚Äù from bottom of door to floor. The housekeeping knocked on our door 7 times between 8 and 10 am. So I would not have rated the hotel as excellent.
My representative offered great options and suggestions for our stay in Las Vegas!!

I was billed by M&C Hotels and Millenium Durham for the same hotel stay. M&C Hotels tells me to email Millenium Durham, which I have done 4 times without a response. I've tried calling the hotel, which is not returning voicemails. If they pick up -- and it's rare -- I am told that the billing person is off duty or transferred to reservations. You all charged me $298.28 and $298.27 for the same two days in the same hotel. I want my money back!!!

review_text: FIVE STAR ALLIANCE is AGODA HOTELS PTE LTDHeadquarters are available in Singapore and Miami FLSKYTEAM CARGO service is currently available on STAR ALLIANCE. AIRPORT RETAIL MANAGEMENT and AIRPORT RESTAURANT MANAGEMENT services are available at all SKYTEAM CARGO airports.

It was not Five Star Alliance's fault, and they were still able to help me out.  I appreciate the customer service I received from a gentleman named John.  My problem occurred on Christmas Eve Day.  John's quick response and help saved my vacation.

My hotel stay was amazing and I plan to use Five Star Alliance for all my luxury bookings in the future. Thanks

review_text: Great travel website that gives us tons of perks. Thank you! Our vacation turned out really reasonable with all the food credits plus some resort credit. review_title: I wanted to edit my reservation and‚Ä¶
review_text: This is the first time I have used Five Star Alliance for a hotel booking, but it won't be the last.  I inadvertently booked a hotel room in Amsterdam that did not have a cancellation guarantee.   Given the times we are living in, I wanted to change that and didn't know how via the computer.   I called Five Star Alliance and to my surprise, a REAL person (John) answered the phone, listened to my situation and completely fixed the situation to my liking.   That is what I call customer service and I am now a loyal Five Star Alliance customer.   Thank you.   John

The two-night package I purchased, two months prior to travel, indicated a cancellation policy requiring 3 days‚Äô notice, and indicated ‚Äòfree to reserve‚Äô.Upon reserving my stay, I received a confirmation notice that indicated, several times throughout the page, that:1) cancellations received within three days prior to travel would not be refunded ( as previously indicated), and that2) cancellations received at any point outside the three days‚Äô window would receive only a 50% refund. This was nowhere stated, and I don‚Äôt see this being a good business practice.

review_title: Always a good experience with Five Star‚Ä¶
review_text: Always a good experience with Five Star Alliance. Seamless integration between self-service and live service. Professional and helpful with finding the best price and hotel. Proactive with offering recommendations and information with regards to hotel locations and attractions.

I wanted to synchronize the two destinations for a 2 week vacation.  I received an acknowledgment email on 1/11/2022 from Emily S. saying she worked for Home & Villa Network a partner of Five Star Alliance, and that she would look into my request and get back to me.  It is 1/29 and I‚Äôve heard nothing more.  I had even replied to Emily‚Äôs email on 1/17 checking on status.  And yes, I check my spam folder. This lack of responsiveness is totally unacceptable.

review_title: I have loved this website for a few‚Ä¶
review_text: I have loved this website for a few years now, however I never booked directly through the site (sorry!).  During my last search I found a hotel and, after checking the cancellation policy, to book the Five Star Alliance Signature Perk Package.  I called Five Star to verify the reservation, but hung up after a couple of rings.  Courtney called me back, and I hesitantly asked about the rom upgrade at booking.  She was soo incredibly professional, kind and helpful.  She contacted the hotel, followed up with an email, and the next day called to say she had the room upgrade confirmed and sent a confirmation email.  Very unexpected, but soo very nice!  I will always begin my hotel search with Five Star Alliance!!  Thank you Courtney.  Next I may just try booking their preferred car service in our destination :)

review_title: Five Star Alliance Soars Above the Rest!
review_text: Five Star Alliance provides the best offers and a smooth booking and cancellation process. I do a great deal of research (I mean a lot!) before deciding on my best option. Time and time again, Five Star Alliance leads the pack (based on my experience with offers in the United States).In fact, Five Star Alliance has better offers than the offers provided by my American Express Business Platinum account. I've been so disappointed to find out the lesser value I receive being a Amex Express Business Platinum card member (especially as a Canadian card member). I am seriously thinking of cancelling my Amex Platinum card not only because across the board, Amex hotel rates are consistently higher for luxury hotels compared to Five Star Alliance rates but also because, the perks offered by Amex, are of lesser value than ones included in the 5 Star Signature package with Five Star Alliance. Given, I am paying a substantial yearly fee with AMEX Platinum, while Five Star Alliance Services are free to anyone, I do not see the value of booking through "Amex Platinum's Fine  Resorts and Hotels Program". I have used Five Star Alliance in the past and was very satisfied and am very confident in recommending their services to anyone who is looking for a 5 star experience from start to finish.Date of experience: December 13, 2023

This was my first experience with Five Star Alliance.  I had some confusion because I was unable to get into my reservation directly with the hotel and it concerned me.  The folks at Five Star were very responsive to me and my concerns and at all times of the day!  I now have everything I need and feel comfortable.  I am used to making all of my arrangements directly with hotels, thus having total control.   I got a better room and extra "goodies" for the same nightly rate I had gotten directly with the hotel.  Five Star put me into direct contact with the hotel too!My only complaint is that they referred me to their partner company Vitesse Worldwide for car service in Italy.  I got back quotes that were more than double anyone else for the same "Luxury Mercedes" transportation. Obviously, I won't be using this company for my transportation needs for my three weeks in Italy and I advised them exactly why.  Seemed like a total ripoff!

review_text: I had a wonderful encounter with Five Star Alliance. They were very friendly and answered all my questions promptly. Great service!Thanks!

I have always been looking for a luxury hotel/travel service; and Five Star Alliance is definitely the answer to my quest. Upon my booking, a Five Star Alliance staff called me to confirm my booking - she also offered me a "Signature Travel" package. The package includes a room upgrade upon check-in, plus a $65 voucher to food and drinks during my stay. She helped me cancelled my original booking and spoke with the hotel to upgrade me to the "Signature Travel" package. She was friendly, efficient and helpful. When I arrived at the hotel, I was offered the upgrade, as they promised. What pleasantly surprised me was that the upgrade was to a "Privilege suite" (Sofitel, Kurfurstendamm, Berlin) - the suite was simply amazing. I stayed in the suite for two nights and it was one of the best hotel experience I ever had. I also took advantage of the $65 voucher and dinned at the hotel restaurant (one of the best French restaurants in Berlin), which was also amazing.Overall, I will definitely use Five Star Alliance for my next travel. Very happy with my experience so far.
Very friendly and informative. Appreciate attention to detail.

I was fortunate to happen upon Five Star Alliance when planning a vacation to a foreign destination.  I don't trust many third party reviews as I have had a number of bad hotel experiences even when the reviews were glowing.  The team at Five Star Alliance took the time to understand what my family and I were looking for and made very thoughtful recommendations.  They were extremely responsive, patient, and answered all of my questions, both on the phone and via email.  They were transparent, honest, and never tried to sway me one way or the other.  My first experience was so positive that we just booked two more trips with them.  I feel that we now have a travel partner we can trust.  Thank you Five Star for your attention and consideration.  We look forward to planning another trip with you soon!

review_title: Great Way to Spend the Last Day
review_text: It was the perfect way to spend the day before a late flight! Pools we‚Äôre awesome and food and bar options were great too. Checkin staff was wonderful.

review_title: Not a Pleasant Relaxing Pool Day
review_text: The booking and check in at hotel for the day was fine. HOWEVER, the pool was cold as the heating element was not working. Noone was in the pool. I was unaware until I stepped in the pool with my toddler. Also the pool deck and chairs were not clean. Bird excrement was throughout along with a large gathering of birds flying around the pool and seating areas. Not a pleasant or relaxing experience.

review_title: Pool was rundown and nothing included like mentioned
review_text: The descriptions of what is included at each hotel when using a resort pass is incorrect. There was no wifi (needed a room number and password which wasn't provided), there was no food or drink available for purchase, and there was no option/discount for parking like all of the above was mentioned in the listing.

review_title: I booked two days at two different‚Ä¶
review_text: I booked two days at two different resorts in Palm Beach. We couldn‚Äôt make the first one. I think it needs to be easier to cancel and get a credit on the website.  It‚Äôs not so straightforward and I think 24 hours for refund is a bit much for cancelling a beach reservation.

Great space and room. I would have given 5 stars however they almost made me wait untill 4pm for check in for a day room. The clerk was able to get a room clean for us in a timely manner however they weren't ready for us when we arrived and hour after our check in time. Great experience over all. I would do it again.

Experience was great. I have to say little upset at Ritz Carlton they do not provide to use showers I‚Äôve used Resort pass in the past and all other hotels allow the use of Spa showersI think Resort pass should talk to Ritz on allowing Resort pass guest to have access to showers

review_title: They are my go to source for places to‚Ä¶
review_text: They are my go to source for places to go while on a cruise.  Their information is clearly laid out with proper directions, etc. Always easy to work with.  We recently had a death in the family of a couple from our trip and had to cancel their passes two days before. It was not a problem.  And, bonus, you can talk with a real person! Resorts are nice and these are usually a good value.

We came across Resortpass after leaving our cruise ship. Another passenger recommended it because they had a late flight and wanted to overcome that time waiting for their flight. So we look up resortpass and found wonderful hotels in Miami where we could stay for 5-7 hours before our next flight. We went to the rooftop and hang out on the pool. We got some food nearby and had some time to relax. Definitely recommend it.

I had a great, relaxing time I am most certainly going back to this resort The food and drinks was amazing, The staff and the bartender most of all the bartender yes they did a phenomenal job. A overall amazing experience.

Love the view, the amenities and the staff.  Have had a wonderful time every visit. You have to take advantage of the morning flute ritual and the hiking.   It is a must for guest agenda, we have laughed more in 30 minutes at the river float than we have in the last 6 months.  The spa is very nice and relaxing.  Yes, it is expensive, but you get what you pay for!

Easy booking, but some info is misleading. For example, Riu Plaza, looks great in pictures but in reality was very bad! I think that you should offer some of the money back if we leave the hotel within the first 30 min of checking in.
As my first time, I enjoyed it. It was different not having a room to go into but as a local I came dressed to sun bathe. So all is well. I will use resort pass again for sure !

review_title: First time user and upon arrival they‚Ä¶
review_text: First time user and upon arrival they did not let us in. I contact customer service and they said they had to verify with the hotel and did not believe me. However, being that the app does not have a scan or a way for you to track my interaction, I am not sure how this turns out.

Unfortunately, we really did not have a nice experience with our Resort Pass and would prefer a refund if possible. The description was inaccurate - there was no complimentary parking and no locker rooms. The hot tub, which was basically the only amenity we could use with this pass, was completely filled with people and not that large. Music was not working at the hotel. Not having a place to shower or change meant we had to use the public restrooms attached to the hotel lobby which were busy. We would not repeat this experience.

I tried to buy a ResortPass gift card as a birthday present. Very frustrating experience. My VISA is current and I double-checked for typos.  I tried three times.  Nothing happened. Tried the Live Chat. The Live Chat was automated. It referred me to their email "info" email.  Still waiting for a response three days later.

We had a great and seamless experience. We searched for the local resorts, the website clearly indicated what was included, purchased easily, and showed up at the resort to find wristbands waiting for us. It went so well we used it 2 more times that week. I loved the rankings and reviews that were included for the properties. It was spot on for the one we selected!  Thank you!

review_title: Good experience with a day pass purchase
review_text: We got a day pass to visit Club Med Ixtapa Pacific during a recent visit to Mexico.  The purchasing process was easy and everything went smoothly at the resort once we arrived and presented our reservation.  There was a discrepancy between the start time initially given and the actual start time of the pass once we got the confirmation email, but this didn't impact our visit because we wouldn't have gotten there much earlier than we did anyway.  I'm very satisfied with my experience with ResortPass.

Hotel could do more to improve the experience for those of us who had paid for an ‚Äòexperience‚Äô. It‚Äôs only thanks to arriving early that we got towels and beds; after 11 they ran out and nothing was replenished.Wi-Fi didn‚Äôt work outside and there are no showers. Fortunately the door to the gym was propped open from the pool area so we could get water and have a place to change once ready to leave.On the plus side, the pool area is bathed in sunshine and has a pleasant outlook onto the golf course. Also the bag stowage and shuttle to the airport was most convenient.

review_title: This was a great way to spend our last‚Ä¶
review_text: This was a great way to spend our last day in Maui while we waited for our late night flight.  Great pool & beach area.  Staff was very friendly, lobby and outdoor sitting areas were comfortable.  Filtered water in lobby.  Room was clean.

Last week, we were in the middle of the Caribbean on a cruise ship. I wasn't feeling well, so my boyfriend went to his ResortPass account and canceled the day pass, 40 hours before our reservation started at Sunspree (Puerta Plata). At the time, we didn't know that other texts, emails, etc. of ours would be dropped and lost because service is so spotty on the ship. This means that ResortPass supposedly didn't get our cancellation. SO..here we are, back at home. There is no credit (93.00) in his account. We have two cruises booked for this year, and had wanted to get anoher day pass through this company. We tried to call, but there is a canned message saying you have to email. So he emailed (by the way, he is a 71 year old with a PHD in Computer Technology!) and basically got the reply "You did not cancel, so you get nothing." Bottom line is, we don't even get a credit towards future use. Buyer beware. If you give them your money, they will keep it.

The booking was easy and the experience exactly as described.  We left the cruise at 9am but our flights were at 11pm -  having a place to lie down with shade, pool and beach access and come and go privileges was fabulous.  Highly recommend !

I received a day pass 15 coupon code. I applied it to my purchase and it said it went through successfully. On the following page I had to put name email address and payment information. When the purchase was completed it never removed the 15% as promised. I also called a one 800 number and left a message and no one has replied to me.
Liked the concept.  The hotel we chose was okay.  We really, really did not like the $15/per person charge to store our luggage for the hours that we were there.

The rates charged for a family of four for a day go use hotels amenities was very reasonable. The pool and surrounding areas were clean, staff was extremely nice and attentive. Spending an afternoon at this hotel has made us consider staying here the next trip.

The food was great. It ended up being a cold day so couldn't really use pools and weren't told anything else to do so we ended up leaving after 2 hours unfortunately . Nice place, not much communication from staff they weren't the friendliest.

Decided to try something other than the typical cruise excursion. Everything was as described. The check in process was easy and the staff was super friendly and helpful. It was a short walk along the dock to the beach. We had our pick of waterfront lounge chairs. The quality of chairs and lingers were fine. The area was not crowded at all, maybe 5-7 other couples. The bar on-site did open and served food and beverage, which was a surprise since we thought the amenities were closed due to renovations. Overall, It was the perfect beach day and certainly worth the price.

review_title: The pool was great and service was even‚Ä¶
review_text: The pool was great and service was even better.  Next time I would not get a cabana here as there are a couple pools to walk too and we felt stuck at the one because we paid for the cabana... cabana was super comfortable.... but it's not a crowded pool and gave us a place in between airbnbs when our plans were canceled (dry tortugas National park.).

review_title: Great way to start the day
review_text: Great ambiance & service! Even a good playlist to set the vibe. However, the food is over priced & mediocre. Didn‚Äôt even come out hot. I‚Äôd go back but I‚Äôll eat before I come. Luckily, they give you a discount at the restaurant next door.

review_title: Fantastic relaxing day at the Hyatt
review_text: Hade a wonderful daycation at the Hyatt Panama City Florida.Front Desk staff were great as well as everyone we encountered thru the day.  Very clean, and the lazy river was very relaxing.  Bar and food were very nice to have to break up the day. We will definitely be returning !

My fianc√© and I had a great time. Everybody was so welcoming and helpful. The pools were very relaxing. The hot tub was exactly what we needed. Definitely worth it. We wish we could afford to stay at Margheritaville but this was an affordable stay.
they were very accomodating witheveything we need. Chairs, umbrellas towels drinks etc. The staff was very helpful and nice, courteous.
I had a great time!!! Relaxing views and top notch service:  Virma, Chris made it special. Thanks.Already booked another date: Feb 4th ; see you thenStella

review_title: Easy to book and nice clean park
review_text: Easy to book with day pass for sure. toilets were clogged outside the pool area. Door hanging off the other,  been to a lot nicer Wyndham for sure.  Booked off a cruise for drinks and foods we‚Äôre about a 2 ‚≠êÔ∏è.  Viva Wyndham Fortuna beach I mean ya get what you pay for so hope you don‚Äôt pay much.

Resort never called to book, when I called day before to see what was going on, they said they were sold out and I would have to book another day. I could not cancel through ResortPass (since it‚Äôs tomorrow) and they have no customer service available. So I sent an email, I am out $100, and now have no plans for my last weekend day for this trip.
staff was friendly. pool was heated. everything was great. had the pool to ourselves. just a bit pricey. the things we will do for our kids :)

We enjoyed this resort.  Only complaint was lack of showers for day guests to use.  This would seem to be easy to add to existing restrooms.  We enjoyed the pools, whirlpools, wave pool and lazy River.  It was our day to head to the airport, and it would have been nice to shower before our trip.

Although there weren‚Äôt any massages available, we booked a spa day pass and spent a relaxing pre-flight day with swimming, hot tub, quiet room reading and a beautiful lunch at the hotel restaurant viewing swans in the lagoon.  Great showers and grooming facilities.

review_title: I loved my staycation and the option to‚Ä¶
review_text: I loved my staycation and the option to use the The Waterfront Hilton hotel facilities was amazing. I felt like a guest and was treated as one. The gym was closed so that was unfortunate, but I got to use the jacuzzi and lounge with the nice beachfront views. The hotel is conveniently located right by a shopping center so I walked not even 2 minutes away to Pacific City.

review_title: The experience we had at B Ocean Resort‚Ä¶
review_text: The experience we had at B Ocean Resort was not as advertised.  The Beach Day bed was not prepared for us upon arrival.  We had to wait for it to be set up.  This cut into our time at the hotel. The beach bar did not have all the items on the menu, drink and food selection was limited. The beach is advertised as private but there were many people staying on the beach who are not hotel guest.  There is no enforcement or security. There were no towel available after 3PM.  After the beach we wanted to swim in the pool but we couldn't get new towels.  We had to use the ones full of sand from the beach.

Overall it was fine. Just be clear and up front about property policies. We rented a daybed by the pool and were surprised when they made us vacate it at 5 pm. The reservation indicated that "cabanas" were reserved until 5 pm, but didn't say that "daybeds" were as well. I legit thought we would have the daybed the whole time. Oh well.

We got a house in Florida but we wanted to enjoy a resort and all the features, too.  I found ResortPass online and we booked two places.  It was excellent.  The staff is super friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed the resort and rebooked for this year.  We love it.
Great experience and service!!Front desk was very helpful and The Twin Fin bartender Matt A couldn‚Äôt have been more accommodating, we‚Äôll most definitely return because of him and all staff :))!

review_title: We had a great experience using Resort‚Ä¶
review_text: We had a great experience using Resort Pass. We came back from a cruise and did not want to hang out at the airport for hours. We used Resort Pass and found a very nice hotel close to the airport to spend our time. There was a pool, delicious restaurant and shuttle to the airport. Would do this again!

The hotel‚Äôs pool side staff was horrible, I waited 30 minutes for a drink. There wasn‚Äôt barely anyone ordering but me. I ordered a pizza that never made it to my table. And then they still had the audacity to charge it to me. The poolside staff should all be fired and replaced by actual workers that want to work.
Nice access for day use before our return home‚Ä¶. Only downside was that we could only use it till 5pm but enjoyed it while we could.Thanks

review_title: Did not have a good experience
review_text: Did not have a good experience. Would definitely not recommend. We booked this lodge reservation weeks ago at the W hotel in Nashville TN, and they apparently canceled my reservation but did not send an email saying they canceled it. Big waste of time and the manager that talked to us was very rude and basically blaming us for the reservation cancelations.

review_title: The food was average but the biggest‚Ä¶
review_text: The food was average but the biggest inconvenience was the lack of chairs at the beach and pools. Many people out there towels on them early and when we arrived at 10 am we had to pay additional money to secure a little hut with Chairs. We had already paid $262 US dollars. Coming from Canada that‚Äôs an expensive day.

review_title: Enjoyable way to wait until heading to airport
review_text: Enjoyable way to wait until heading to the airport for an 11:30PM flight.  Reserved a day bed and relaxed, ate poolside and enjoyed some great evening ambiance before heading out.  Staff was friendly and great service.

review_title: A great way to enjoy a staycation in town‚Ä¶
review_text: My family and I love resort pass when the prices are FAIR!!! What I don‚Äôt find fair is when the resort pass is $70 per person when the hotel‚Äôs resort fee is only $40 per person. So, who is making a huge profit??? In addition, I don‚Äôt like that the prices fluctuate from one day to the next. I‚Äôll see one day a rate that‚Äôs fair, but then I wait and then 2 days later the rates went up!!! This is unnecessary. I‚Äôve gotten lucky to find rates sometimes at the last minute. But I do think the rates are overpriced. The hotel staff will be surprised at the rates they‚Äôve heard and feel like resort pass is getting a big piece rage of money. I‚Äôd like to know more about this if I‚Äôm wrong.
Got a day pass. Check in and parking were a breeze.  Grounds were immaculate. Food delicious. Staff friendly. Would highly recommend!

Such a great experience! my first time using the day pass- easy checkin, beautiful pools, delicious food and friendly customer service - get blue ticket  for parking at checkout - plenty of towels given - love this place!

review_title: Hardly a resort and NO kids area
review_text: The whole reason we chose this ‚Äúresort‚Äù for a day was the kids splas area.  Well‚Ä¶.no kids area at all!  Far less than a resort.  So glad we never considered it to stay!  Total waste of money since as usual‚Ä¶no beach that‚Äôs ok for kids
Breathless was a great resort. The staff was excellent the breakfast buffet was superb with so many fresh options.Lunch was limited but good. Never had an empty glass!
Very nice cabana Would have preferred an ocean view but the experience was quiet with good level of service and food was great

I would give 3.5 stars if I could. Club Med is all inclusive for the time slot you reserve. Unlimited drinks the entire time, but are only able to eat at one of their restaurants Sharkies. They serve food from a grill - omlettes, pancakes, wraps, quesadillas, burgers, etc. they also have hours of operation (close at 12:30pm and open back at 2:30pm). All in all it was decent, I really mainly cared about the alcohol, which was truly unlimited (bottom shelf mostly). You do have to go to the bar and get it yourself, in a dream world people would come by and serve. Overall it was a good experience, lots of group led activities by the pool, so if you were hoping to relax, you‚Äôd likely be interrupted by the staff of mics with some form of water aerobics or racing event. You have access to the beach, too. I would go again, but part of me would look at other options for luxury places. Although for the price in Turks and Caicos you likely can‚Äôt beat it.

review_title: Stop reading and just book it NOW, you will thank me later!!!!
review_text: Aloha, so here we go. We are staying at a noisy Waikiki property. Nothing like the serene, quite Kahala Hotel & Resort. We booked the poolside cabana, well worth the couple of extra dollars because of the amenities. We rolled up about 8:30 am. Free valet! Are you kidding me in Waikiki! What a beautiful property, classic Hawaii beautiful. We walked down a fragrant rich orchid staircase to the lower floor. Elevators available. Walked past the dolphin ponds, which by the way you can have a dolphin experience, then walked into the pool area. Checked in at the little hut. Received validation for the free valet, towels, water, small insulated tote bag, choice of colors, very cool. The pool attendant had us pick our cabana, which he set up and we were off. The salt water pool was heated and very inviting. The bar/restaurant started serving at 11am. They dropped off a little device that you pressed for a server, they came, how cool. The drinks were incredible, ordered their Royal Pine, have your camera ready the drink is inside a frozen pineapple. Their signature drink. When in Rome... OMG. The food poolside did not disappoint either.  Delivered quick and hot! Very tasty. The entire staff were very kind, polite and shared their Aloha. Again jump on this ResortPass.com at the Kahala Hotel & Resort, you'll thank me later!

review_title: Fantastic experience and I would argue‚Ä¶
review_text: Fantastic experience and I would argue the best value in South Beach. We booked the day pass for my family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children). The cost was less than renting chairs on the beach. Several reviews mentioned that the pool as cold, that‚Äôs inaccurate. The pool was nice and warm and I believe it was a salt water pool. Food and beverage options were very good and service was attentive and friendly. The grounds were beautiful and the lobby was a nice sanctuary during the heat of the day. A couple of tips: if you want shade, grab a seat on the south side of the pool. The north side is perfect for direct sunlight. There is a public parking garage about two blocks away on 16th. That was $20 for a full day $10 for less than 6 hours. Great location for doing dinner on Espanola Way after a day at the pool. Check out the activity schedule, yoga and games are available/included. My only suggestion would be more frequent cleaning of the pool bathroom. It gets quite wet during the day. It‚Äôs small, but suitable for changing.

First off, I want to say that I've on the Big Island for over a decade.We have a five year old boy so we thought that we'd check out the famous slides at the Hilton Waikoloa resort.The set-up at the two slide locations is challenging because there aren't enough chairs for everyone. You are then forced to purchase overpriced cabana tents if you do not want to bake in the sun. And the areas around the slides can get pretty dirty since there is landscaping and dirt nearby. The food options are atrocious especially if you do not want to die of a heart attack. And of course, the options are grossly overpriced. I feel badly for folks who come here from around the country, have this kind of experience and leave thinking that this is Hawaii.Since moving here, I've been aware that while living in Hawaii that there are clearly two different experiences: the residential and the tourist. I've rarely dipped my toe into the tourist experience and now I understand why.Hawaii Tourism Authority wants to elevate the tourist experience and charge more, but with a resort like the Waikoloa that is going to be a big mountain to climb.

It was a gorgeous day and we were celebrating 20 years together, we were thrilled to celebrate at the Islander resort for a mini vacation on the last weekend of our holiday vacation. It was a perfect morning with our 3 kids and parents. We socialized with a family of newly weds from Ohio, and various kids from other places. It was the makings of a lifelong memory. Everything was going spectacularly until a group of 5-6 individuals arrived to the pool area‚Ä¶ loudly and boisterously going to the bar and ordering drinks, and later settling in an area by the entrance and in the pool. The individuals were speaking in Spanish (which happens to be our first language) in profanities and altering the atmosphere of the pool. Slowly but surely, families started leaving. Discretely, but in retrospect, they were listening to their instincts. Our two older children no longer wanted to stay in the pool, noticing all of the school-aged children had evacuated, and they went to play ping-pong and soccer with their father and grandmother. I stayed with my 2 yo, swimming in the shallow end. A young mother arrived with her 2 yo and our toddlers quickly started bonding. They excitedly exchanged names in toddler speak but the 4 men that were in the pool picked up on those names and started calling the little girls by their names. They called my daughter‚Äôs name and she trustingly started to swim their way. I quickly yanked her back but the other mom was visibly uncomfortable and pulled her child away and left. Seeing that we were the only ones left in the pool with these men, I pulled my little one out and went to find the rest of my family. We had a great time at the ping pong table and soccer area, but then I headed back with all of the children and their grandmother. My son jumped into the pool when my daughter and husband went to the cafe for more food. By that time my 2 yo had fallen asleep in my arms, so I sat on a chair by the pool. At that time, the men in the pool started taunting my son, asking him where he was from, laughing, and loudly making unwelcome comments. My mother pulled my 6 yo boy out of the pool and when my my husband came back I mentioned that the atmosphere in the pool had drastically changed. I mentioned the incidents and my husband went to request that they refrain from taunting our children. An altercation ensued. They screamed to my mother that if we didn‚Äôt want our children harassed we should not take them out in public. I called 911 because the screaming was getting heated and it was getting physical. The individuals were asked to leave as the police arrived. They were in the resort, without resort passes, were not hotel guests or customers and there were no consequences. The police that arrived interviewed my son and it was acknowledged that they were in the wrong for harassing a minor, while trespassing, and they had moment prior been bragging about being high and intoxicated. Apparently, a woman had paid for one resort pass and let them all in. The resort staff came and tried to smooth out ruffled feathers, but Stuart, the manager promised to rectify the situation. However, we waited, afraid of retaliation by the individuals, and were not helped or reassured further by the resort staff. After paying hundreds of dollars for the resort passes, and hundreds of dollars for lunch, we expected the ambiance to be a little more family friendly and decent. We are extremely disappointed and will be sharing our experiences on multiple online venues. The way the situation was dealt with was subpar and the service should have been directed towards the patrons, not the rifraff that came ashore. I gave the resort 2 stars only because it was so clean and pristine, otherwise I would have given it less stars.
Friendly staff.

review_title: We booked this as it was close to the airport
review_text: We booked this as it was close to the airport and a good price. Happy we didn‚Äôt pay more. The checkin was very clumsy. The reception desk didn‚Äôt know a lot of information and had to keep checking on each question (how do we get our included beverages, how to order food - we‚Äôd have to come down to restaurant. Very inconvenient given how we weren‚Äôt allowed free access of elevator use). We were not provided with an access card instead escorted to the elevator and the receptionist used her pass to press the pool floor. Once upstairs, the pool area was locked and we were unable to access it. Someone in the gym area let us into the pool area. Once there, the bathrooms were locked so my partner waited there while I returned to the lobby to inform reception. They called someone and once again I was escorted to the elevator. Eventually someone came to unlock the bathroom doors. Bathrooms were clean but can‚Äôt say the same for the pool area. There were left over empty drink cups and garbage on the ground. We understand hotels want to be secure; however we paid for the use and provided a diver‚Äôs licence so did not appreciate being treated as we were with elevator access. Bellman staff were fantastic. Very friendly and efficient.

Being a Marriott loyalist (Platinum Elite) and with 9 hour gap between the end of a cruise and our return flight, I was glad to have this option but found this Day Pass experience disappointing.  I have stayed at the same hotel three times since August 2022 so I figured it would be a comparable experience. We were treated like 2nd class citizens, had to wait for an hour for a key (for which they held my license hostage), could only use the pool effectively though they gracefully valeted our luggage.  Overall, the management of the property was also lacking, having fallen since August.  Pool was freezing cold (my kid called it 'Cape Cod cold' and I would agree!).  It was unswimmable, equipment was broken in other areas including the elevator.  We ended up eating lunch in restaurant (nothing included) which was lovely and our waitress fantastic.  But for the $30 person ($26 per child), it was a low value.  Next time, I will go sit at airport and not waste my money.

review_title: Not the experience we hoped for.....:(
review_text: The Hotel & Pool area were very nice. The staff was also extremely nice. It took a little longer to get checked in as nobody really had any idea what to do. Once we were seated, all was well until the F&B Manager came over & informed us that we would have to give up the cabana and move to a "table" at 4:30pm as they had a pre-scheduled event that evening & they needed time to get the area prepared. We said that really wasn't fair to us since we had paid $150 for the cabana for the day. He apologized & said they forgot to block the schedule since this was all new to them. He was nice about it but this was not the experience we were looking for so it cut our afternoon very short & definitely not worth the money paid by us. It was for up to 5 ppl & so we had 2 friends coming by later in the afternoon so we had to call them & tell the not to come.

review_text: Beautiful day.  Great set up with the cabana.  Food was delicious.  Our waiter for the day was outstanding!  Spa was lovely. We have used ResortPass here several times with adult children and grandchildren, and always enjoy it. Easy beach access, but if purple or red flags are flying, there are 2 outdoor pools (with small Lazy Rivers) and one indoor pool, 2 activity rooms (foosball, ping pong, arcade games), poolside games for kids in the afternoon, and plenty of lounge chairs and tables. We also like the layout of the decks, with shade or sun, and ease of pool entry with zero entry at one end. The Tiki Bar and Grill is slow, but you can leave and eat elsewhere, then return. They discourage coolers, but everyone seems to have cold drinks available. Plenty of free parking, and we appreciate the clean restrooms.

In addition, it‚Äôs a great way to taste test venues before friends and family come visit and want a hotel recommendation, or a activity while visiting. I‚Äôve discovered places I did not know existed, while also finding places that are not my style. Either way, there are always more to choose from. review_title: Day room at palmsprings spa resort
review_text: Booked a day room through resortpass at a spa resort in palm springs. Drove an hour and 30 to get there to be told that it's an adult only place ages 17 and above. Wasn't aware of that since while booking on the resortpass site (on my phone) did not specify that no kids were allowed. Spoke to the frontdesk and they kindly directed me to contact resortpass for a full refund and that they were willing to speak to the representative to grant the full refund. It was a struggle to find another place right away that accepts kids in a short amount of time after coming a long ways from home but glad the full refund was given back.

review_text: We had to cancel due to rain & lightening but the cancellation was prompt & hassle free. We will be trying again very soon.

review_title: Had a glitch with check in
review_text: Had a glitch with check in , but front desk was able to resolve within a few minutes. Hotel provided free champagne  which was a nice touch. Pool was very swallow. Hotel pool waitress was very attentive.  Food was very expensive. Between the pass (2 cabanas) and food we spent approximately $700 for a few hours. Due to price may not do it again.

review_title: It is one of the most scenic resorts in‚Ä¶
review_text: It is one of the most scenic resorts in the area. We had an amazing experience at the hotel; the customer service was outstanding, the food and drinks were delicious, the views were breathtaking, and the weather was gorgeous. The pool and slide were a lot of fun. Our day couldn't have been more enjoyable!

The main pool is beautiful, and there are two more from which to choose.  The main pool is just outside the lobby/lounge and features upbeat music (mostly 80‚Äôs) and a cantina.  The hot tub continues to be warm, not hot, as mentioned in earlier reviews this summer.  The hot tub at the nearby pool was  green and taped off.  However, the nearby pool was quiet (no music and no people) and features a very shallow kiddie wading pool.The cantina is at the main pool (open 12 to 5 or 6, I believe) and the food is not inexpensive.  But it is reasonable.  The food was good, but the fries were barely warm by the time they came from the main restaurant.  The facilities were very clean!  Every time I visited them, staff was cleaning and re-stocking.One sink wasn‚Äôt working and the staff apologized. The only problem was that the restrooms were up a flight of stairs.  Even the staff at the cantina has to make that long trek to the restrooms.  The pool is long and on the narrow side and so the walk can be long.  It isn‚Äôt a big deal if you are younger, but older people might find it onerous, and also families with young children might find it takes a while for a restroom break. I also want mention the third pool over at the tower.  It is a short hike‚Äî10 to 15 minutes.  But, the hot tub is hot!  The pool is smaller and older, but sort of elegant.  There are a few shaded cabana type areas.  I think there might be an additional gym there.Wanted to mention the nice touch of offering the free s‚Äômore kits.  We really enjoyed that.  They give away the kits in the late afternoon where the towels and water are.  They include sticks and have two fire tables available.Lastly, the parking validation didn‚Äôt go 100% smoothly for us.  If you are a given a plastic key card for the parking validation, stick that plastic key card in the machine.  (This is not the same thing as the plastic pool key card).  Do not scan your parking slip that you got when you entered.  Fortunately, a parking attendant materialized when we were stuck there for a minute.  However, you may be given a different type of parking validation.  Make sure you get clear directions and pay better attention than I did.  It was the price.  We had a great time.  My son actually spent the whole day in the warm-not-hot hot tub.  (The regular pool temp was fine, don‚Äôt worry!)

Once we were done, dried off, retrieved our luggage, changed into something proper for the airport and took a shuttle to the airport.Arrived at our gate just slightly before boarding time. ResortPass has been an exceptional business tool for me. I'm often visiting clients in places like Orlando or Tampa, which are both quite a drive from my home base. It's great to be able to purchase a day pass and have a hotel room to work out of while I'm in those cities. You can't beat the value.

Based on my experience, I would rate Resort Pass as a premiere booking site.  Their customer service actually lives up to its name:  "customer.  service."  In my personal experience, they have gone out of their way to accommodate me & my requests.  The only 'complaint' that I have has nothing to do with them as an independent company.  My complaint is has to do with the hotels & facilities that contract with them for their services.  Through no fault of Resort Pass, many hotels et al fail to deliver on the services/products that they advertise via Resort Pass.  For example, many facilities fail to inform RP (Resort Pass) of their specific policies, restrictions, black out dates and the like.  So while many of us complain to RP about a hotel stating that they have availabilities on a given date only to find that upon attempting to book, the afore-mentioned facilities are "unavailable" on the date in question, or have changed certain policies, procedures & most importantly, their pricing - if these facilities fail to inform RP of said changes, RP has to deal with the unhappy customers as a result.  Specifically, some of these facilities include:  The Beverly Hilton Hotel, the MDR Hotel among others.  Other facilities fail to note what is included in the price of the passes.  Namely spas/jacuzzies.  Personally, as much as I love the ability to use a particular hotels pool, it would be nice to know if said hotels have hot tubs etc.  Sadly, these places do not fully disclose to RP what is/is not offered at their locations and the customers must call the actual hotel to find out.  This leads to getting the run around by said hotels which subsequently breeds frustration for customers.  Is it so difficult for these hotels to list out whether or not a facility has a hot tub?  Especially if they have gone out of their way to describe in great detail all of the supposed amenities that come with the heft price tag of a day spent.  I guess I would only suggest that RP make it a priority to ensure that what the hotels claim to provide are actually provided so that when customers make inquiries, RP isn't forced to respond with a "not sure about that."  This type of bate & switch type of advertising seems to be more common these days than ever before, and is not only limited to day pass service providers.  It seems that this is becoming more wide spread among many 3rd party service providers who are not being provided with complete information, yet are forced to put up with angry customer complaints.

We waited for a couple of minutes until man came that was already off the clock asked if we needed help. There was no sign stating they were open/closed or off to lunch.  He went to check with the front lobby which he then came back to say they were ‚Äúclosed for the day ‚Äú. To check with the water park and they ‚Äúshould‚Äù have passes there. This was a bit of an inconvenience for us because had this been our first time there, we wouldn‚Äôt have known what to do or how far the front desk was. Or if someone in our group was elderly or handicap. Since there are quite a few stairs to go up with no elevator, this can be a huge inconvenience for some families. We did arrive to paradise springs about 10-15 minutes later. They did indeed have wristbands once we arrived before getting checked at the gate. We showed our email and were provided our 3 wristbands. Loved the fact that there was hardly anyone there. We figured it was due to a lot of schools already back.  We will come back but just wanted to provide this for future families interested in going just for day passes. Diana

review_title: It was easy to book our day pass‚Ä¶
review_text: It was easy to book our day pass online. My only problem was that the description of what was included in the day pass was confusing. It said "Daybed x1" and showed a picture of individual lounge chairs by a pool. There was nothing that indicated one daybed held two people. I asked online and they were not sure but checked with someone and said it would be "a shared Daybed for two guests" which still didn't tell me if we each had a place to lay or if we had to alternate sitting on the lounge chair. I asked again for clarification and someone else said "typically it is a large padded seat large enough for two guests." "Typically" didn't reassure me so I called the hotel directly and the woman I spoke with had to go outside and look at the daybed to see if it sat one or two people. She said two people will fit so we were good with that. I think the description could have been more clear - like Daybed x1, (accommodates two people). That would have saved me and three other people a lot of time and trouble. Other than that, I look forward to our outing.

review_title: I went to Chaminade in Santa Cruz
review_text: I went to Chaminade in Santa Cruz. Iffy, at best. When I drove up, I thought: OMG! The actual resort looks so generic and boring. I live in Seabright -- right at the beach, about 10 minutes away -- and I should have stayed there...or gone to The Refuge in Carmel Valley, which I usually do. I couldn't take that much time -- driving wise -- so, I took a chance on Chaminade. Wrong. First, I thought, they have this "amazing'' restaurant called The View, because of its incredible view (high up) of the water. The view is beautiful. The restaurant: save your money! I know it has been difficult, because of the pandemic, to find competent servers. Mine could not have been worse. I ordered something for lunch, waited about 30 minutes, and then was presented with half of my order, which was supposed to be scrambled eggs, country potatoes, and tofu instead of bacon or sausage. Instead, I received country potatoes and tofu. When I pointed this out, she said, "Oops, so sorry, enjoy this!'' I said, of course, she would not be charging me full price, and she nodded. The bill reflected otherwise, so I asked to see the manager, who never came and finally -- about waiting about 15 minutes -- was told the lunch was for free. The pool experience was on par with that. It was a Tuesday in August, and at 1 p.m. it was crowded with families with a lot of kids...who, apparently, took precedence. There are two hot tubs, to complement the two pools. Both had kids in them, without parents (under the age of 10ish). I asked the one I wanted to go in -- which had three young girls -- if it was "Okay'' to turn on the jets. They said no. I shan't ever get a Resort Pass again. And I had a friend who was thinking of having her wedding at Chaminade, and I said: DO NOT DO IT!!!!!!! They booked something, instead, in Carmel Valley:)Also, when someone gets a Resort Pass, how many children to they get to bring in with their Resort Pass or do they pay extra? THAT IS, I THINK, KEY!

review_title: Girls day out and it was just great
review_text: Girls day out and it was just great! Began at BBCM, then off to Montrose for day by the pool with day room, ended at Norah for dinner, then back to O.C.  The Montrose was awesome.  Small, beautifully renovated hotel in a darling neighborhood.  Much preferred to the larger resort style hotels.  Great location- safe, walking distance to Sunset fun.  The Montrose had great style and felt very upscale without the imposter syndrome.  The staff was great, the pool was small but plenty for the hotel.  Plenty of room for lounging and the bar and decor was spot on.  Dante' at the pool was a doll, going above and beyond to make us feel welcomed, even taking us to the tennis / game courts for an even more spectacular view- picture perfect.  Will definitely be back.  The room was very beautiful and well decorated- super clean everything.  Perhaps, if I were going to mention just one thing it would be that there were a few loud children at the pool I wasn't expecting, but all and all great day!
Booking was clear, easy and fast. No issues at all!
Loved it. Hyatt lodge was better than expected. Gorgeous grounds . Pool was amazing

The first visit was to the DoubleTree by Hilton in San Jose 2 weeks ago on a Saturday afternoon-evening and the second was today 8/6, mid day to evening. Hilton was good about 15 minutes before I wasn‚Äôt sure if we walked over poop or chocolate while trying to find pool chairs and whichever it was, it wasn‚Äôt cleaned up. The pool is way smaller than it looks and their was no one regulating so there were many kids in the pool and even hottub, very loud and splashing, including one with a diaper. There is no security and if there are, they don‚Äôt do their job. Hyatt we had a cabana so that was nice but what I didn‚Äôt like are the double standards. I was told by the server he was off shift and there would be no server to bring drinks/food any longer after 1pm. I ordered from the bar and after retrieving my food which was now cold, I saw a server giving tables there food, several of them. Even drinks being ordered and delivered, but no one ever came by to our cabana (there are 6). The worst part was the Truya Sushi, not for the taste but lack of customer service and etiquette. I asked if I could substitute one ingredient in the sushi roll (crab for spicy tuna instead) and with an attitude was told no by the Sushi Chef then ignored when I said it‚Äôs because of a seafood allergy. My family will never return here, $160 for a cabana and $100 for food/drinks (+tip) to be treated like this.

Overall it was well worth the money and we would definitely go again.

Because it was a party of 3 adults it was a beautiful quiet area. The bar and food service was excellent. We made 3 trips to the pool which was great. review_title: We had a great day at Balmoral Resort
review_text: We had a great day at Balmoral Resort, I just felt like it was understaffed. There were 2 servers to take care of all the cabanas and the restaurant. So you would be waiting for quite a while for that. Also, there was no one overseeing the pool area, there were children throwing the shells and mulch and whatever else was on the bottom of the palm trees in the pool, lots of it. We mentioned to one of the servers and no one even cared. Nothing was done about it.  But, it was not overcrowded, and a good atmosphere, my family had an amazing time!

The check in was great but different from the ones I've visited. Upon checking in we are given a list of rules to sign and a rubber band. I was unable to go into the water park the sun was completely blocked by the building. So that was disappointing. I think the fact that the pool is on 2nd floor should be stated prior to booking. Although the hotel cannot control where the sun is facing it is important to state this for people like me that truly enjoy a day in the sun. Also at the time of my visit no restaurants were open or bar and if they were opened I could not tell.

Worst experience ever, paid in advance to go to la costa spa. Arrived before 8:30 am for my 9:00 am, doors closed so waited. At 9:00 am I‚Äôm told they don‚Äôt have my reservation. So bloody pissed, beyond disappointed. Contacted various management nothing but a refund - day later. Waisted my entire day, still a bit miffed. I would give negative stars if possible.

My family and I came to this hotel after searching for somewhere that will allow single day passes for the pool. The receptionist was a bit rude. He seemed frustrated and overwhelmed with the amount of people checking in. We had questions regarding the day passes and could not get any answers. We proceeded to purchase the day pass with little information to find out we paid $500 for just an outdoor seating. Nothing included. It‚Äôs was a huge chunk of change and we wouldn‚Äôt have paid that much if the original receptionist who checked us in had patience to answer our questions. $500 with no food or drinks is way too much money. However, Winston was a great server and manager that went above and beyond. Pool is a bit smaller compared to the pics.

review_title: Perfect for check out days with late flights
review_text: Bought a cabana at the Fairmont Orchid for our last day in Hawaii after checkout.  Was amazing, loved to be able to use the pool and beach right up to the last moment before we needed to leave for the airport, and didn‚Äôt have to worry about the safety of our bags in the car (bellhop kept them).

Very happy with our resort pass experience at the Fairmont Scottsdale Princess resort. Everyone at the resort was very nice and welcoming, the pools were in great condition and the drinks and food were excellent. Parking was easy too.

review_title: Brilliant idea! Great pool day with amazing staff and amenities!
review_text: Brilliant idea! Just wish it was a little less expensive. I think we will just pay for a room next time to enjoy the perks but it was definitely a great time.Check in was smooth. Hotel was nice. I loved that Delta Hotel had free parking. The pool was clean and beautiful with complimentary cabanas. There was barely anyone there so it felt like we had the po to ourselves! Staff was wonderful roo. We ordered food and drinks at the bar. 5 stars well deserved!
Very nice facilities and staff. Would give 5 stars if there was a notice that the main kiddie pool would be closed from 9am-1pm.

Overall, good experience. We reserved the fire pit with s‚Äômores at the Omni Carlsbad and it was ready when we arrived. A beautiful platter of cookies/crackers, chocolate, and marshmallows arrived. They did ask if we wanted hot chocolate, which was included. The only negative was that my reservation email said that bottled water and sodas were also included, but that was never brought out. When I asked for 4 bottled waters, they ended up charging me $20. When I told the server that my email said it was included, she took it off the bill. Other than that, everything was great! Would recommend.
Excellent service, great prices and safe enviroment.

Beautiful property at Outrigger Kona! My group enjoyed some of the amenities during our short stay. We did have a hard time finding lounge chairs by the pool, getting pool towels, and service at the outdoor grill was slow.

review_title: I would have loved to give a five star‚Ä¶
review_text: I would have loved to give a five star but I couldn't. The facility is beautiful and the pool area itself wonderful. It's unfortunate that other guest create uncomfortable experiences for others in the pool area. I contacted the front desk for security and notified the representative at the desk myself that security was needed. Domestic disputes and inappropriate behavior around your own children is inexcusable. Children should not have to experience their parents behaving that way. It's a public space and unfortunately I would have felt more comfortable if security keep a closer eye rounding the pool area.
very good atmosphere, everything very clean and cozy!

review_title: Day pass at Beverly Hills Marriott
review_text: From reception to the pool all went well. Fair amount of drinks and snacks from the little shop area. The inside seating area was warmer than outside, so I advise setting the air temp lower. Parking procedures were a little unclear at first, but using the valet turned out well and fairly inexpensive. All said, we had a good day.
Excellent. Better than expected.

I got a chance to spend the day at Margaritaville Beach Resort here in Nassau Bahamas on Thursday, 28 Jul 2022.  It was an amazing experience.  The staff was so accommodating as well friendly.  The food and drinks were great (lots of different options).  The amenities provided were great.  It was such a relaxing day.  I loved the the children were able to enjoy the resort too. However, if you wanted to get away to an adults only area, they had that too. I got to enjoy the Infinity pool (adults only pool) on another floor later that evening.  I will most definitely be back to stay with Margaritaville when I return to the Bahamas.  And will be sure to let my family, friends, business partners, and clients know as well.  Definitely a 5-star kinda day!

I was also informed the hot tub was down and unable to use. This resort,  if you want to call it that, is incredibly dilapidated and disappointing. The pool was below level of water being filtered.  I informed the front desk of my disappointment and was told oh well contact resort pass.I contacted Resort Pass and received a reply from Zoey,  ResortPass Concierge that she would look into this matter, which Zoey did and making things right.  Although the resort was disappointing the company "Resort Pass" is not disappointing.

review_title: Resort pass and resort not in sync

There were enough people in the pool looking to drink that closing the bar was definitely a nuisance...To order a drink through the app was a long process to set up, and then a long process to have the drink delivered from the inside bar.Overall I don't think the resortpass app and the hotel we stayed at were in sync. It was just easier to walk inside to the bar and order a drink.

review_title: It was really easy to book and the‚Ä¶
review_text: It was really easy to book and the resort was a really nice way to spend our last day before a late flight. Check in was a bit bumpy (the first room we were given was not actually available) but they were apologetic and made it up to us by adding an hour to our check out time.

The bartenders truly made the experience heightened.The cocktails were so refreshing and the people behind the bar were really sweet and helpful.I attended last year several times where I hosted clients and also brought out of town family for the day. I was surprised the staff remembered me when I came back this year. The service just keeps getting better. We'll be back several more times this year for sure .

review_title: We enjoyed our day pass to the Holiday‚Ä¶
review_text: We enjoyed our day pass to the Holiday Inn Express in Orange Beach. The access to the beach was only a very short boardwalk. The pool had zero entry that was great for our small child and for me as an older person. The availability of the bar and food service was great. The food we ordered was hot and delicious-we ordered wings, pizza, nachos, and fries-all were better than we expected. My only negative observation was that pool was older although it was in good shape. It could use a good cleaning. I noticed the skimmer ducts has lots of mold and gunk in them and the top tiles around the inside of the pool had dirty residue visible. The water looked clean and clear but it was gross to look at that residue.

Resort Pass is my favorite!  Whether last minute or weeks in advance it's always easy to find a great deal on a daycation!  I've never been disappointed with my choices and cancelation or changes are easy to navigate! It's my go to when needing a break or just something new to explore.
