review_title: Used the app a couple times and love it
review_text: I have used Resort Pass a couple of times for day passes and have been pleased with the experience. Using the app to reserve your day pass is convenient and easy to navigate. Reviews of the properties are readily available. You are also able to cancel a reservation the day before for no fee.  This app makes it easy to locate and reserve your spot for a mini getaway.

review_title: ResortPass is such an awesome idea
review_text: ResortPass is such an awesome idea! We recently used it for a beach trip during July 4th weekend. We had free valet parking, beach towels, and access to their pool. No need to lug all the typical beach gear. I won‚Äôt do a day at the beach again without ResortPass.
This pool is great! Amazing staff, great drinks!
Fun day in the sun ! The process was seamless, enjoyed a nice day poolside with great food and drinks!

review_title: I used ResortPass for the first time‚Ä¶
review_text: I used ResortPass for the first time and cannot wait to use it again! My fiance and I had a friend visiting for the first time over the Fourth of July weekend and of course all of the pool parties were sold out or overpriced. I went on the ResortPass app and found so many fabulous and affordable options to allow us access to pools in the area. We went with the Senna House in Scottsdale. The property was gorgeous and the staff was kind and helpful. The check-in process was so simple: We showed ticket confirmation, IDs, and received a wristband. We had access to the bar, restaurant, and pool from 11-6. It was fun and relaxing. I cannot wait to explore other resorts/hotels with my fiance using ResortPass. I love that we are able to relax on these beautiful properties without booking a room.
Leaving 5 stars specifically for the ResortPass customer service. They responded to my request and provided a solution very quickly. The hotel itself was fantastic as well.

I had no idea this was even a thing so I quickly bought passes. We ended up at the hotel for the later half of the day. It was really amazing and nice. The resort shared pools with the hotel next door as well so we got to do some pool hoping. Really fun day & try something new. staff at the hotels we‚Äôre very nice and friendly. Will be purchasing again!
Staff was excellent! Fun hotel vibe. Only people at the pool. Great staycation.

The Hotel June was a nice place but the Pool itself, it was actually smaller in person.  From the picture, it looked much bigger.  Overall, there was a nice crowd of people, food and drinks were very good.

I like ResortPass, but they have a huge problem in Napa. People buy passes for the Vista Collina, which is more or less a kiddie pool, but their keys work across the street at the adults only Mertiage pool.  So what happens is people are given keys that work at the Meritage and they behave poorly, spilling alchohol everywhere and turning it into a spring break disaster.  The ResortPass has to be reset to only allow people who paid for the specific pool they've paid for.  My friend and I had our night ruined by what might as well have been spring breakers admitting to us they only paid to use the Vista Collina pool.   There were women about to puke and acting as if they were on Spring Break, not a wine tasting.  My sweet girlfriend ended up escorting a super drunk woman to the bathroom.  They need to fix this ASAP or risk ruining the reputation of what is otherwise supposed to be a nice resort.  Needless to say, we're not coming back until this is addressed.

Concierge was very friendly upon arrival. The staff at the pool however was another story. Not a single server came to us to take our order the entire time we were there. We asked two different servers and they told us to order at the bar or that they would go grab someone else. But were serving the people next to us with no problem. Definitely won‚Äôt be coming back after spending several hundred dollars for this type of service.

Took a new card fr a different guest as the one who previously gave her card was in the pool. She charged new card told us a new attendant would be helping us moving forward. review_title: The Best Way to Vacation in Mexico
review_text: I traveled solo to Tulum for a holiday, and struggled hard for several days. Food was expensive, people generally unhelpful, and the public beach essentially unusable ... especially after being told to move by an armed officer. So my friends gifted me a day pass to Club Med Cancun for my last day in Mexico, and it was amazing.  From the moment I got on property, they were helpful, welcoming, and kind.  And going from having to fight hard for the basics to just be able to enjoy the gorgeous beach, snorkel the clean water, have lovely people bring you drinks, and get to sample the glorious buffet at Hacienda was just the relaxing that I had been looking for.  The music after dinner was the best end to my day.  Club Med Cancun is worth every penny, and I will save all mine to come back and holiday at this wonderful resort.  Thank you for everything!

review_title: Vista Collina was lovely & I appreciate‚Ä¶
review_text: Vista Collina was lovely & I appreciate the ease of finding beautiful options to hang poolside in a cabana surrounded by nature. Felt transported to the mediterranean.We booked a cabana to celebrate both mother's day & a birthday. Unfortunately, you can't bring in outside drinks or food, which is totally understandable if service to receive these options was available, however, the bar closed in the middle of the day! We had to find someone to help us when we realized there was no one there ( & were advised it was because it was a quiet pool day) we were the only group of 6 with a few other people enjoying pool area. Cabana booking was from 8am to 10 pm, so imagine the total bummer of not being able to enjoy drinks, order a coffee OR food, throughout the length of time we anticipated to enjoy a full pool day.  WHAT!! Had to find the hotel manager to find out how to feed & accommodate our groups food & beverage needs. Definitely not a compliment to the poolside wine country pamper party we were trying to have. Resort pass should advertise there is a chance you WONT have a server & the hotel chooses to close 3 hours into your rental. Disconnect between Resort pass & the hotel obviously. If this is the case & there is a chance of closing early, notify your guests, # 1 & # 2, don't limit outside food and bev as an option. I would have given more stars overall for the facility & lovely staff of Vista Collina but unfortunately, the lack of communication affects the overall review. Resort pass should offera complimentary credit or make-up pass for the issue.
Great experience. Recommend!

To begin the experience the resorts valet area is very small and crowded, with that being said valet was some crazy amount of $35 or $45 dollars. Luckily there is a parking lot just across the street for $5. Once in the hotel it was very clean and check in was very smooth. The lady at the front desk very nice! The pool was fantastic and relaxing! Love the ocean view!

I have tried to get Resort Pass to call me but they‚Äôre ‚Äútoo busy‚Äù and I feel I‚Äôd like to explain my situation with a live person. Not only will they not return my calls, they have not been helpful in resolving my situation with the hotel.Not only did I use Resort Pass on Mother‚Äôs Day for my family, I helped my friend‚Äôs book a spot, too. When I got to the hotel, my cabana was no longer showing up on the App as ‚Äúupcoming‚Äù thus they had no reservation for me. I had proof that I had been charged for the cabana on 5/3 on my Amex. Since the cabana was in use, they apologized for their mistake and offered us a couch to sit at to enjoy since we were already there & to makeup for their mistake. So I thought. I never imagined, I would be charged for that couch in lieu of our cabana.  When expecting someone to pay for something, you must be clear. I agreed to  pay$495 for a cabana. When the hotel was unable to service that contract, they then need to present a new contract NOT assume I know I‚Äôm not being charged for something I would have never agreed to.My husband is sick. He needs shade and he wanted a tv, thus a cabana. I paid $495 for a cabana. I was never told I‚Äôd be charged for day passes in lieu of a cabana bc they had double-booked our space. I gave this hotel every opportunity to do the right thing and the manager wouldn‚Äôt even take my calls. After double-booking our cabana, not only did the manager charge us for this spot without telling us we‚Äôd be charged especially since it was their mistake, he has refused to refund my money for the cabana. We spent money on food & drinks. Had I known I‚Äôd be charged for sitting on their couch, thinking they were making up for their mistake, I would have NEVER stayed.I‚Äôm in the service industry and the treatment here was deplorable especially on Mother‚Äôs Day. Shame on you. I left multiple messages with this establishment , I‚Äôve written many emails to Resort Pass and only got a return call from someone at the hotel who recited some formatted response irrelevant to my situation.

review_title: Be VERY careful booking a pool day pass‚Ä¶
review_text: Be VERY careful booking a pool day pass through Resort Pass.  I booked a day pass for my wife and myself at the Hilton in Waikoloa.  Long story short, they advertised a day pass to be $50 with and additional $50 prepaid toward food and drinks.  That's not a bad deal at all.  However when I arrived a the Hilton Waikoloa nobody had any idea about the $50 in pre paid food and drink.  Hilton Customer service told me the day pass cost $100 and that they had no arrangement for prepaid food and drinks.  Obviously there's a bad disconnect between ResortPass and Hilton.  Additionally the Hilton C.S. reps and Manager were steadfast in their opinion that this was my problem and not theirs even though they acknowledged they had advised their I.T. department about this problem before.  I was told to feel lucky that I didnt also have to pay for parking on this particular day because they were servicing the parking meters and not charging for parking.  Lastly, at one point the Manager raised her voice to me.  Extremely dissatisfied and obviously I wont be using the ResorPass link again nor will I spend money at a Hilton brand hotel again.

On Thursday morning, wife booked a cabana with a local hotel. By the evening, it was clear that there is a monsoon in Scottsdale so she emailed Resort Pass to cancel her reservation. She was told that it was already pass the time to cancel and it is at the discretion of the hotel to refund us. I find that absolutely ridiculous. Tried to contact the hotel on Friday morning to no avail. RP charged our card that day. After not hearing from the hotel for 4 days, I decided to dispute the charge with AMEX and write a Yelp review about the hotel. The hotel rep promised to make it right and reverse the charge for us on Yelp. Fast forward 3 weeks later, my wife got a nasty email from Madeline S. Taylor, RP's account manager, threatening us to retract the dispute because the hotel was able to confirm that we were there or we did not cancel (both were obviously false at this point). I had to call her back on behalf of my wife to make sure that she would honor the charge back as promised by the hotel. Our experience with Resort Pass and Hotel Valley Ho were absolutely abysmal.

We live about 10 minutes from this property and since it's a Hilton in a nice neighborhood near the beach, we expected a friendly crowd. The crowd was friendly, but multiple people were smoking pot in the pool, the music was blasting from multiple independent setups and it was far from a relaxing pool day you'd expect from a Hilton property. review_title: I was trying to get some to go food for‚Ä¶
review_text: I was trying to get some to go food for me and my friends so I Inquire to the nice lady at front desk. She said the only one open is the buffet restaurant that's next to us and we can Check with the hostess if they can do to go orders or if I can go get 3 to go food from the buffet line.. the hostess noticed the Chef in charge (an African American woman with shoulder length hair wearing all black kitchen uniform). The hostess asked her nicely if I can get 3 to go orders since nothing is open atm. The Chef answered her in a rude manner and negative demeanor right in front of me and the front desk clerk with " No!.. we don't do to go's, it's a buffet! If he wants some food he can dine in and got to buffet line lime everyone else" and she just walked away headed to the other side of the building by the elevator. The hostess and the front desk clerk looked at me in shock and apologized on how the Chef reacted. I told them that the Chef was rude, unprofessional and acted like an ass and no one specially a guest should be treated that way. It ruined my whole entire day and I told them that I will never ever eat or book a room at any Hilton Garden Inn resort for the way that lady acted. I end up ordering food from uber eats and was given a much professional treatment from an uber eats driver.

review_title: EAU Hotel - 5 Stars all the way!
review_text: We used our resort pass for the EAU Hotel in Palm Beach, Florida. It was absolutely stunning and beautiful. There was a family pool and then around the other side of the property was the adult pool. Both pools were large with full amenities. There is also private beach club with beautiful lounges and umbrellas and full food and bar service at the pool and the beach. I think the highlight of the day and what was very unexpected was when one of the waiters came into the pool with what looked like a mini surfboard and on it were flute glasses filled with champagne.  They gave everyone in the pool a complimentary glass of champagne. The menu offered so many selections for lunch and all were delicious.  The waiters were very pleasant and the service was excellent. We will definitely be going back to that resort. This used to be a Ritz Carlton that was privately bought, but the look of it inside and outside still resembles the Ritz. 5 stars all the way!

4 stars because of misleading photo on ResortPass; but swift recovery and great customer service on the property. The photo of the "daybed" in the online description photo that we booked was actually picturing a "cabana." Turns out we wanted a "cabana" (which was the same price anyway) as it was covered/shaded, but we had no way of knowing we'd booked the wrong option (which didn't actually even have a photo on the site). The problem with this was that we are two very Irish skin-toned white girls and need shade cover, which the cabana provides (and the daybed does not--word to the wise). When we arrived and I showed our booking, the attendant basically said, "Oooh, that's the wrong photo, but sorry, we're all booked!" We were a bit alarmed, because we both burn in 5 minutes and the daybed wasn't going to work. Luckily though, they ended up having a no-show that day, and we were able to secure the shaded cabana we *thought* we'd booked. The pool was lovely; nice and warm, and located right next to Tiki's. The staff was unobtrusive, and the cabana was very comfy. All in all, a really great experience after a minor hiccup at first. Would do it again!!

review_text: I canceled my reservation through the hyperlink on my email regarding my reservation. I didn't screenshot the page but it said it had been cancelled. So i did not go. I emailed in to resortpass inquiring about my cancellation and refund.  They said there was no record of my cancelation. When i asked if i could be credited for the day i paid for but didnt use since i couldn't get a refund. They told me no... so I'm out $325 dollars. All they care about is money and nothing about treating the customer fairly. I will never use them again.

It was mediocre nothing to complain about but I wasn‚Äôt impressed too much with my server Carlos at SLS beach. I closed out my tab at 2pm and tipped him very well. He acted like it was nothing and I said to him after I closed out that I may order more and he just took my tip and never returned to ask me if I was ok or if I needed anything else. Never seen and never heard from again.It was odd and I‚Äôm a pretty big tipper and when I tip the servers are always appreciative ten times over. Other than that the experience was again ok they didn‚Äôt give me the two lounge chairs that go with bead day bed either.

review_title: What a wonderful day staycation for my birthday in Waikoloa, Hawai'i
review_text: What do you do for your birthday when you can't go anywhere, have to social distance, and you only have one day off from work to celebrate?Rent a $500 cabana on the oceanfront at Waikoloa Hilton in Hawai'i, hang out with one of your best friends, drink, eat, and be the envy of everyone who walks by.The staff were fabulous! Drinks and food were yummy, and we didn't wait longer than 15 minutes for each round. And there were many! ;)Oh, and bring your own pool boy (in my case, my hubby) who just wants you to have the best day ever! Thank you sweetheart! A day to remember for a very long time.

review_title: Great Deal on a Lovely Place, With One Caveat
review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our day passes - so much so that we booked another outing with family for next month. The pool, hot tub, Lazy River and beach were beautiful. However, their website still inaccurately promises the opportunity for food and drinks poolside. We arrived at 9:30 a.m. on a Tuesday and were disappointed to learn the restaurant/lounge didn't open until 3:00. We were forced to lunch elsewhere and return. No outside food or drinks permitted. Missed opportunity for the hotel for sure. Otherwise a very good deal.

Also, a heads up as there are no umbrellas and the cabanas weren‚Äôt functional while I was there.

I was shocked when I was told that there was nothing to be done, no refund or transfer of reservation. Might as well have just burned my money. I will never use ResortPass again, nor would I recommend to anyone. Stay clear and reserve elsewhere.

If you're in the hospitality business you deliver the service the customer has paid for; not scam artist your way to a higher rate.

review_title: I purchased a ticket and my young son‚Ä¶
review_text: I purchased a ticket and my young son became ill the afternoon of the same day I was supposed to use my pass. You have to cancel that morning, but I did not as my son didn‚Äôt get very ill until after lunch. I asked if I could change the date/ keep credit, and was no bc I reached out a few hours later, never having used the pass. They won‚Äôt even credit it to the account, just take your money. I found this an extremely bad business ethic, especially after a friendly email explaining the special circumstances. I had a group of 10 for. Work that we‚Äôre going to purchase these along with me next week to start as a weekly summer event, they are all so disappointed none will be using this in the future. These are the companies to stay away from and only want tour money and ignore customer service.
We really enjoy using ResortPass. They offer day-passes at high-end resorts where you can enjoy a nice pool and beautiful surroundings, close to home.

The photos of this property look nice. It is a very colorful and eclectic place. The front desk staff, Roman and the valet attendant, were very friendly. $25 self park is very steep considering the resort pass is also $25. Upon arrival, the pool is a lot smaller than it looks in photos. The water was a bit dirty, but the rest of the area seemed very clean. The bar staff, Juliet, was so helpful and provided pool side service, she deserves a raise! She went above and beyond to serve everyone at the pool. While eating, a group wanting to take photos for the "hotel's website" came around asking to move our things, rearrange furniture, and requesting us to "model" for their photos...all while NOT wearing a mask. There was also no soap in the restrooms on the rooftop nor in the lobby. We're still in a pandemic right? Masks and soap is literally the least we can do. Overall, the staff was nice, but everything else was subpar. There is little to no shade available all day, so be aware as you book since you will not be able to find shade unless you get a cabana.

It was closed the entire day we were there. We were hoping we would not have to leave to get food due to having children but we had to. Also there isn‚Äôt a changing room. There are only two single bathrooms inside ( one person at a time) so that is the only place to change into and out of your swimsuit. There was no soap or sanitizer in the bathroom which is disgusting, especially since I reported it and hours later there was still no soap. Luckily I had sanitizer with me due to there is a pandemic! I really appreciated the fact that the staff wore masks although the mandate had lifted. We also wore masks inside, not all guest complied. But overall I would and will visit again. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub and the beach access. It is a small place and the pool is divided in half so they say two pools. But I like the smaller less crowded places.

review_text: Easy to use- exactly as described, resort, Estancia was perfect!

I had a horrible experience using Resort Pass. I wanted to plan a fun birthday for my girlfriend so I booked a daybed at the Shelbourne Hotel. On Resort Pass they list the passes in the order of day pass, day bed, then cabana...so you'd assume the day bed falls somewhere in between day pass and cabana in terms of luxury. When we arrived however, the "day bed" was an ottoman 2 feet from the pool in front of the lounge chairs. It was so close to the pool that they were wet, weren't large enough to lay on, and had no backs. The covid safety was nonexistent and the music was so loud we decided to go to the beach instead. The beach chairs were spaced about 1 foot part so we were put in direct proximity to a handful of people not wearing masks and nowhere near the water. It was extremely disappointing since I was trying to pamper her and we would've had a nicer time just laying a blanket on the beach for free.

Making a day trip to Orange Beach, AL, we quickly discovered there were no parking spots available in the public parking lots. We didn't want to park far away and walk with all of out beach stuff. So, I hopped on ResortPass and quickly found reasonably priced passes for a beachfront hotel. I booked the passes literally while we were down the street. By the time we parked and checked-in at the front desk, my name was already in the system. Everything was as stated online. Having the hotel's amenities on top of the parking really made the day more enjoyable. ResortPass really saved the day!

I've used ResortPass a few times now to book poolside cabana days with friends. I am glad for the core features and I will continue to use it until a competitor does it better. Even though you can't cancel for a refund, you can cancel for credit that (for now at least) doesn't expire. So I feel like I can go ahead and book something I like and keep browsing to see if I find anything I like more.Here are some improvements that would make ResortPass better:- Filtering based on availability. I want to be able to filter to only see, say, 6-person cabanas that are available on a certain day. Right now you have to do a lot of scrolling and clicking to figure out what your options are. It takes a lot of time, and the search results list is clunky to navigate (sometimes resets you to the top of the list) so it's frustrating as well.- User experience browsing search results (see above)- Some listings are vague about what food/drink options are available on site. "Food and drink available at front desk". Okay but is it beer/wine/cocktails/small plates? Or is it Cheezits and Pepsi? Can I bring my drink poolside?- User pictures would be nice, to get a more realistic idea of what the venue looks like.

Pretty overprice for what you're actually getting. It's literally just access to a pool for around $50. I rather get a whole season pass to a waterpark. The cabanas going for $500+ with nothing but bottles of water included are pretty ridiculous. You can get a VIP table with a bottle of alcohol at any of the other daytime pool clubs and hotels.

review_title: I've used ResortPass multiple times now‚Ä¶
review_text: I've used ResortPass multiple times now to book pool time at a local resort. Very easy to search and book and have never had any issues when picking up my passes. My new favorite site, especially during the pandemic!
Our experience was great! We loved the atmosphere, the loungers were very comfortable, and the service was perfect.

Went on 4/24 from 11am to 7:30pm. We got lucky with close parking. Every single staff was friendly. The wait time  to enter was super fast. Even though the resort was very packed at 11am, there was plenty of seating available- we found great shaded seating under a tree, right by the lazy river entrance. The bar was packed every single time we got in line, but the bartenders were fast and the service was great. Alcohol beverages were good- We got a margarita on the the rocks, blended margarita, two pi√±a coladas and a Dos Equis. For food we got the chicken nachos, chicken tenders and a side of fries (bcs the chicken tenders do not come with fries). The food was good portions and yummy, but I would skip out on the fries. My partner went on the two fast vertical slides, and he really loved it. I enjoyed the serpent slide! Surprisingly for the reared park capacity, I barely ever waited to go multiple times down the slides. We stayed in the lazy river majority of the time, which was suuuper packed, so just a tip to wait for the bigger crowds to pass and find the little gaps of space where you can float in peace without bumping into people‚Äôs feet/head. We went into the wave pool with a double inner tube, and enjoyed it. There was a pretty good sized jacuzzi but we didn‚Äôt go in since there were too many bodies. The water park doesn‚Äôt have lockers, so we did walk back to the car a handful of times when we needed our debit cards or phones, but we did leave it with our belongings for periods of time bcs we felt safe by the families we were surrounded by. The sunset was absolutely stunning. We would definitely come back!

review_title: Wanted a day with friends to relax at a‚Ä¶
review_text: Wanted a day with friends to relax at a pool and beach. Loved the access to the amenities and also the adult only pool at the Omni HHI. Our server was fabulous. The food was fabulous. The grounds were clean and so was the pool. Easy access to the beach and it was a beautiful day spent.

review_title: Hotel really had no clue about Resortpass
review_text: Hotel really had no clue what ResortPass was or what i had booked (WorkPass and Spa pass), so arrival was confusing and frustrating and took a long time.  I was literally told ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt offer rooms for just the day so you must be incorrect and couldn‚Äôt have booked that‚Äù  It put quite a damper on the anniversary day surprise for my husband, because I had to argue with staff to have them figure out how to find the reservation and get the accommodations I was promised. I had to show them proof via the email confirm, which didn‚Äôt have all the details that the hotel said they needed.  Resortpass needs to do a better job partnering with at least this hotel to ensure staff understands the agreement. Finally, Resortpass said i get complementary self-parking with my Workpass. But when I got to the hotel they said they didn‚Äôt offer self-park and I had to valet for $10/hr.   I had to raise my voice and insist to a manager that I was not paying for parking that I was promised would be free. In the end the manager fixed the issue for me, but totally embarrassing to have to beg for this. My husband was embarrassed. Finally the hotel then double charged me and said they had no proof that I had prepaid with ResortPass. In the end, it took 3 phone calls to fix the issue.  Based on these issues I unfortunately would not recommend this service.  It was an embarrassing hassle and a pricey one at that ($250 for the daypass and $150 per massage). Not a good enough deal to have the hassle that it was.

There was no where to sit, they ran out of towels, and the bar service was supposed to open at 11 but we couldn't find anyone until at least noon. They didn't even have water available! We finally found someone to put in an order for food inside, as well as a bartender. We ended up at the other smaller pool, where we were lucky to find some chairs after a couple left. I understand the hotel industry has been hit hard due to the pandemic, but then don't offer resort passes to people if you can't even accommodate your guests.

My family had reserved a day bed for the five of us to enjoy a day using the facilities at Waikoloa Village.  The grounds were beautiful, well maintained and the staff were friendly and helpful.  There were a few things that were disappointing;  When we arrived we had no idea where we were supposed to go to "check in"  a map of the site with where to go would have been very helpful.  The instructions were very clear that guests must comply with their COVID safety precautions however most of the guests were not wearing masks or social distancing.  There was also a requirement that no food or drinks could be brought in to the facility, so even though we paid $400 to use the facility, we still had to pay $14.00 for a pre-made sandwich that would have been $5.00 anywhere else.   It is a beautiful resort with a great staff and facility, it just does not seem like you are getting what you paid for in the long run.

review_title: Great Option for a Fun Time
review_text: This was my first time using ResortPass. It was very easy to book a reservation for myself and my child. Later, we invited another child, and the customer service was excellent in helping us book this extra ticket. You do have to book an adult pass in order to purchase a child pass so you cannot just buy a child pass by itself. They helped me do this by purchasing an additional adult and child pass then refunding the adult pass back to my credit card. It was quick and easy! Our visit to the resort was just as easy! We arrived at the resort, showed them the booking # and ID, and off to the pool we went. Parking was free and they had poolside food and drink service. It was a wonderful experience and we look forward to checking out other resorts.

review_title: Booked a cabana for  around 100.00 for‚Ä¶
review_text: Booked a cabana for  around 100.00 for the day,  none available at hotel when I arrived.  Hotel said those were reserved for hotel guest with their rooms.  Then I was charged for 4 ‚Äúday passes‚Äù without my knowledge as default because I listed  4 names for the 4 person cabana per reservation requirements.  Only 3 of us went and never used the facilities.   Even if I had switched to day pass, they overcharged based on previous reservation.  Voicemail only available when I called to cancel on arrival.  Hotel said they couldn‚Äôt give me refund or cancel the reservation as it was booked through third party. So far I have not been refunded the day passes that I was auto charged even though I never requested or authorized the purchase.  I suspect they know cabanas aren‚Äôt likely available and this a way to get you to buy day passes.  Resort pass said it was hotel responsible to refund, Hotel manager  said error on resort end and has been trying to refund the false charge but having issues. review_title: I was a little unsure of this because I‚Ä¶
review_text: I was a little unsure of this because I had never heard of Resort Pass. Just in case I called the hotel to confirm they were participating, after they confirmed I went ahead and booked. I have since told almost everyone about it and how we don‚Äôt have to worry about sneaking into resorts anymore bec for just a small price we can go to the resort and still enjoy all the amenities an actual guest gets to enjoy. review_title: The service at check-in was amazing and‚Ä¶
review_text: The service at check-in was amazing and the atmosphere at the pool was nice but I feel like they shouldn't charge you the same amount for the cabanas on the freezing cold side of the pool. We could not get warm to save our life. I came to get a nice suntan for my birthday and ended up going home with windburn. The chairs were full before we got there right after the pool opened. Just seem like a high price to pay to sit in the shade and freeze.

review_title: It was pleasant and the pool was nice
review_text: It was pleasant and the pool was nice.  I'm only giving it three stars because the staff seemed confused about how to check-in resortpass guests.  They sent me to the restaurant to check in at first.  They didn't explain or mention the refreshments would arrive a few minutes after.  I had to inquire about it.  Lastly, we were there for six hours and no one ever cleaned or tidied up the restroom.  The restroom was a mess. Paper and towels, empty shampoo bottles, etc., left on the counters, on the floor.

This was a pretty fun day. It‚Äôs spring break and I‚Äôm trying to fill the days with my 8 year old. Due to the pandemic, our local pools are closed. But then I remembered Resortpass! I‚Äôm not sure why this property has such mixed reviews. Sure, it is not a ‚Äúscene.‚Äù But the pool area was clean, the pool was heated, the staff were fantastic, towels were provided, parking was free, food was good and very reasonably priced. Besides another friendly Resortpass family, we had the pool to ourselves most of the day. It felt very Covid safe. We had a blast! It was perfect for our needs.  I would absolutely book this pool again and try out some other options with Resortpass as well.

review_title: The website was easy to use and had no‚Ä¶
review_text: The website was easy to use and had no issue claiming the reservation.  Very impressed!

Booked a pool-side option. Arrived at hotel and staff was clueless about check-in/registration. Asked around with varying responses including "Not sure we are still doing that with Covid." Never got what was reserved. Upon telling ResortPass, their response was, "we'll have to see what the hotel says; this hasn't been an issues before." Not what I was expecting and no real apology about the impact on our day. Like the idea, not the execution.

Everything was wonderful except the website showed there weren‚Äôt any cabanas left and when we went to the resort there were 2 open the entire day . I even asked the staff and they confirmed that they were never booked .

review_title: Don't waste your money and time here!
review_text: The place was dirty, I set in the cabana and immediately got a bug bite. There is no sun shining in the pool area, everything was a shade, we did not even try to get in the pool. The jacuzzi was broken ... don't waste your money or time here!

NO ONE could be found by phone and my emails were ignored. I am furious ! DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE !!!!! I suggest dealing directly with the hotel property if you wish to book a day pass.

Good thing I was vaccinated at the time of going.  Also bags were not checked so you can sneak in anything from innocent to dangerous.  Lastly, I ordered a wine, a vodka drink and two small icees from the bar and it cost $46.00 plus tip! So we had to have someone from the outside bring us a bag of drinks since they weren‚Äôt checking bags. Probably saved us hundreds of dollars in drinks. review_text: My husband and I have been to many Ritz Carltons. We were expecting the beautiful ambiance that we have been accustomed to. We were very disappointed in the pool area and the pool, seemed moldy and not very clean. The girl who brought the towel and set it up didn‚Äôt even smile and the towel had holes all over it. I said to her, this is the Ritz? She looked at me and said oh I‚Äôll bring you another one. Like, it was an effort. The guys on the beach were friendly and nice, although their masks were pretty much pulled under their nose. I ordered a Cesar salad and it smelled like fish had strings of anchovies all in it. My husband said his burger was decent. I have to say this this Ritz Carlton was not like any of the others. We will not go back...

Perhaps this hotel is great for people that just want to stay on River Street area and go out, but this is not the place if you want to use the pool. DO NOT get a cabana if you are going to use the pool it's not worth it. The cabanas are barely two feet from the pool and hold only the tiny couch. They were all dirty, the cushions had food and stains. There was food, wetness, and mold all over the ground, my mom didn't want to take her shoes off. We only stayed for about 5 minutes before we decided between there also being not enough loungers, none left, kids jumping and splashing all around and the restaurants not being open yet that it was ridiculous to throw $200 away on it. Even the $40 resort pass would have been ridiculous since there would have been nowhere to sit unless we had prob gotten there at 8am to stake out a spot. They actually didn't argue with us at all about leaving and didn't even offer to clean the cabana or do anything. I think they must get this alot and they really don't care about taking care of the people poolside since they just are focusing on getting people in and out of the rooms. The customer service was severely lacking in the lobby. However, the valet guys were very nice and helpful..we tipped them well. Do not believe the photos of the pool online, it's not set up that way, the way the photos were taken also make it look way larger than it is.

BUYER BEWARE!!!Absolutely the worst experience and waste of money. The beach resort we bought 8 passes to had no amenities available!! There were no towels, no umbrellas, and a skeleton crew of servers to the point they discouraged us from eating at the restaurant due to the long wait time. This was in no way indicated as a possibility on the website. And it is a horrible business practice to allow day passes to be purchased if they cannot accommodate those guests. In addition, 4 of the passes we purchased were for kids who didn‚Äôt even need a wrist band on the property, leaving me to wonder why I had spent $20 on them each. We have used resort pass for this resort before so I‚Äôm completely aware of what is supposed to be available for use. We left the resort and just went to the beach to try and enjoy the rest of the day, thinking Resort Pass would refund our passes given the circumstances. review_text: Love the opportunity to get a pool pass. As a local, it‚Äôs nice to be able to swim for the day without having to reserve a room. It was dirty, the door wouldn‚Äôt stay closed, due to construction you have to walk outside to get to the pool, and the pool wasn‚Äôt very heated. The poolside food option must be only for outdoor which we called and asked but didn‚Äôt get a correct answer. I‚Äôd like to say I‚Äôll use this service again (for a different hotel) but I‚Äôll have to research each option better so we don‚Äôt end up at a dump like this turned out to be.

review_title: This was my first time using Resort‚Ä¶
review_text: This was my first time using Resort Pass (which is such an innovative and brilliant concept, by the way). I booked a Day Use pass for two at a hotel in Waikiki to avoid the weekend crowds and traffic at area beaches, and to enjoy some poolside sunshine, food and beverage service, and a cabana to get out of the sun when desired. Unfortunately the sun didn't show up. It was cold and overcast. We arrived at the resort still hopeful, but decided to cancel our plans. I expected that I'd just wasted my money on a non-refundable booking. The next day I saw that my entire payment had been automatically refunded without even contacting Resort Pass! That sort of service earns my repeat business.

Love, love, lover Resort Pass!!!   So easy to find the best resorts to enjoy aday of leisure and luxury at the finest resorts without the high prices of staying at the resorts for your entire stay in Maui.  Highly recommend and will use on all of or our vacations in the future.

review_title: A great way to spend the day
review_text: We had a great time spending the day at the Hilton Waikoloa.  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  They were masked, and spent time wiping down common surfaces.  The resort was not very full, so it was easy to distance from other guests, and access chairs and equipment at the lagoon.  Our only critique is that the pool (Kona) was extremely cold, which was quite unexpected given the great attention to detail in every other aspect of the resort.  Don't know if they have the the ability to heat it, which would certainly make it more inviting.  Even with that, the day there was great, and we would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a fun way to spend the day with family and friends.

review_title: It‚Äôs very disappointing that I have to‚Ä¶
review_text: It‚Äôs very disappointing that I have to write this review because I‚Äôve been using ur site for a while to for my day passes in beautiful San Diego. Woke up Friday morning very nice hot sunny day in California I saw that some pools were open on the resort site I purchase two tickets I know Covid is still going on and I know that every county is different so I made sure and checked the hours for BOTH pool and restaurant/bar it said pool opened at 10 am and food service/bar at 11:00 I got there around 11:45 checked in I usually get a key to go upstairs and use the pool to get in the front desk lady was confused when I let her know that I was checking in for the resort pass she finally checked me in she said I was all set and that the door would be open for me I got upstairs and the doors were locked went back downstairs and told we and she said she was sorry and she would call someone to open the door went back upstairs after 5 minutes we got in no one was up there it was just me and my boyfriend the bar/ food service was closed the only guy that was up there was the maintenance guy and we asked him if they were serving food and drinks and he said I‚Äôm not sure I think at 1 but let me ask to make sure he called downstairs and told me that the front desk lady said not today it‚Äôs closed. I would‚Äôve never showed up to this pool if I knew that was the case there was other options of course they lied about the hours online on top of that I called you guys no answer I emailed u guys 4 times got two emails back never got offer a credit or redound I‚Äôm usually not the one to complain I work in the service industry and I was very disappointed I had to leave within the hour and a half I was there it was so hot I obviously got thirsty hungry and no food not even a bottle of water was available all the lady said in email was that she called and she said that they told her that everything was open LIES anyways very poor customer service you guys must be struggling for 50 bucks or to even give me credit but guess what me too on my day off on a Friday very disappointing will not be using u guys again

My family and I stayed at a VRBO for the week. Checkout was at 10am and our flight wasn‚Äôt until 5pm. I thought spending the day at a resort pool would be a great way to pass the time. A room at this resort was $229/night (unfortunately I researched this after purchasing resort pass). The price per person for a day pass at this particular resort was $45 for an adult and $40 for children. I have 4 kids so that‚Äôs $250! I should have just booked a room! I also decided to splurge and rent a cabana. The resort staff seemed to disregard the fact that random people were using other cabanas. I paid a lot of money to use it! Also, there was a group of guests sitting right next to the children‚Äôs pool who were smoking. I politely asked them to not smoke and they proceeded to taunt me and continued to smoke. I mentioned the issue to some staff, who said they would keep an eye on the situation. But the group proceeded to act in a disrespectful manner. I also was interested in the cabana to take advantage of a server coming around and taking orders for food or drinks. Well that was not the case... This was not the high level of service or quality I thought I‚Äôd get for the money. Very disappointed.

For $50 a person, I was expecting a quiet, high quality experience. Instead, the pool was incredibly small, it was crowded, there were old discarded towels everywhere. It was a party scene that did not make me feel comfortable due to covid.

Positive: super fast check in, nice temperature pool.Negative: In the reservation and on the hotel's website, it is specified that the pool service is until 6 pm, but that did not happen, at 4:30 pm they will close the service and turn off the music, and to make some formal employees worse closing their nieces, it gave a feeling  that he wanted us to leave. review_title: Can I get my money back
review_text: Can I get my money back? Our first experience with ResortPass was not positive. We are locals and during a heatwave we purchased a pool pass at Shade Hotel in Manhattan Beach. The "pool" could hardly be called a pool. It was more of a medium-sized jacuzzi. In times of Covid it does not allow for 6 feet of social distancing. Ironically, The Shade Hotel di dnot provide much shade as there were about 4 umbrellas for 20 chaise lounge. What kind of show are they running? Even for hotel patrons, there was not enough room, let alone for outside guests. If there is any justice in the world, ResortPass will revoke Shade's affiliation. This was and is, a rip off.

Booked online cabana, received email confirmation, check in had no wait line. Spent a Thursday enjoying the pool at the end of August. The park barely had any people. Employees all wearing masks and they spaced out customers. Lots of Lifeguards on duty. The lazy river inner tubes were constantly being sanitized and only had a few people riding it. The slides were all open no wait!!! The wave pool had only a few people lots of chairs available. Easy access to the bar they were super clean and friendly! Food was good and was brought directly to our cabana. Overall we had a great time. Suggestions for the resort: close later than 5pm during the week, step up the groundskeeping, trees and debris need to be cut and cleaned!
Great service: fast, easy and a simple way to enjoy the day in your own city! Must experience the resort pass

Overall I had a nice day and will go back again, but was not happy about a couple of things.  I booked here over other options because there was an ADULT  pool. This ADULT pool has a section of it that allows kids therefore it is not an ADULT pool. The lifeguard at times also allowed kids to get into the ADULT section of the pool and did not say anything to them.  Only when a supervisor would come by did they make the kids get in their section.  When approaching the ADULT pool go to the far side if you do not want to listen to kids screaming in the ADULT pool. The other negative was that the bartender at the swim up bar was overwhelmed. She was by herself from 11 - 1 and it could take 20-30 minutes to get a drink.  It wasn't her fault.  She was hustling but just couldn't keep up with all the orders on her own. Now the good... it was a great pool with plenty of chairs and the cabanas looked great if you want to spurge on one.  In the pool they have several booth tables that are a lot of fun if you have a lot of people with you. I went on a Thursday and there were plenty of people there, but I always saw a few open chairs.  Plenty of towels available. No waiters unless you are in a cabana.

review_title: While the overall experience of the‚Ä¶
review_text: While the overall experience of the services is a good one and I can appreciate the challenge of running a service like this, there seemed to be some pretty obvious flaws in the system, which if addressed would earn a 5 star review from me:1) The site was inconsistent  how it would behave from time to time and therefore not very intuitive for the user.  I'm referring specifically to when I would enter that I wanted locations in Scottsdale, but half the time it would list out the locations in Phoenix first, and other times is would start with Scottsdale locations.  Because of this I accidentally took the time and booked a pool in Phoenix before I realized what had happened.  2) It's inconvenient that a user can't book multiple dates at a time and must start over for each date.3) A nice to have would be a "wait list function" with an email to users who are interested in a fully booked location in the event that there is a cancellation take place an a spot opens up.

I feel like they essentially sold me tickets to a free concert, and when I asked for an exchange I was given the runaround. I won‚Äôt buy another pass unless I know 100% that it‚Äôs actually needed.

review_title: Prices went up the day of!
review_text: Prices going up the day of were a bummer. We were trying not to have our vacation be over-planned in advance but knew that we wanted to take advantage of ResortPass to visit a cool swimming pool with water slides at our vacation destination. And at $15 per person, it felt like a bargain. We waited to book until the morning of intentionally - and wished we hadn't because suddenly the price went up to $30 per adult, $15 per child! I did not expect that sudden price increase and wished we had booked the day before. So, this is a warning to others to book in advance!Otherwise, it was great - the customer service at the hotel was wonderful and we had an enjoyable day. It was super easy to book and we are already considering using it again in other places we travel.

review_title: 5 stars to Resort Pass, NOT the Hilton's. So close to a 5 star but could not!
review_text: Resort Pass was awesome and was valuable allowing local businesses to partner with larger resorts.  This was a win, win for guest (discount) and businesses (kickback) alike!  If it wasn't for the discount with Resort Pass, then I might not have "found time" to venture over to Hilton Waikola.  (Big Island, Hawaii)  I am only giving the 5 stars to Resort Pass, not the resort.  Why?  Yes, it is Hawaii but Hang Loose was taken to a whole new level at the resort.  I get it, your on vacation and you have worked really hard to look good in Hawaii (not to mention tan lines are weird)....but a thong in the children's pool area?  (Kinda creepy, like PeeWee Herman's Playhouse) So this is where Hilton Waikola could be helpful and refer the guest who prefer dental floss up their butt and only a small portion of their tata's covered over to the adults only pool.  (I get it...they probably have paid a lot of money for those implants and want to share their "expense" with others.  I was super young once upon a time)  Just sayin.....  Family friendly would have been nice for those traveling with little ones or just prefer a family friendly environment.  Other than that, the resort is GORGEOUS and provides fabulous amenities and on site resources!  (everything from car rentals to the spa)  The resorts beauty, layout, and amenities get 5 stars, unfortunately, the vibe near the children's kiddie cove, the big slide closes at 5, and lack of signs to let you know what path leads to where is the reason for 3.4 review for Hilton Waikola.

We purchased two adult passes for October 1st. Our idea was to book 2 massages, take advantage of the Fitness area/pool, then get to the spa, take the massages, a shower and leave for diner nearby. Firstly, at the reception we had to wait about 10 minutes for them to figure how to actually activate the passes. Apparently the first person we talked with had no training in this area. Then the most unfortunate experience came when we got to the 4th floor, only to be advised that the Spa is closed for renovation until the 3rd and there is no shower/locker room access in the meantime. **at no point during the reservation we were provided with this information** So we kept our bags with us at the pool, stayed for a short while and left as we had to drive 60 minutes to take a shower at our place and get back to the city. We feel that we made a very poor investment and that there is plenty of reason to justify a refund. We made the concierge aware of this, but all we got was an apology. The amenities are actually nice, as expected, but the overall experience was quite poor.

The location is absolutely beautiful!  The resort and spa is nestled in the peaceful redwoods.   The facilities have a lot of amenities: friendly staff, workout room, spa, sauna, locker room, showers, plenty of towels, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, blow dyers, etc.  We spent a majority of our time at the pool. The pool area was clean, many lounge chairs, and umbrellas.  Since it was a 3 day weekend, the pool was extremely busy - , but able to accommodate everyone.  The only bummer was the poolside restaurant service.  We placed an order and they told us it would be 30-45 minutes... an hour later we called to find out the status.  They forgot to place the order.  It took another 45 minutes for our order to show up. In spite of this, I will definitely give this location another try.

review_title: I loved my experience with Resort Pass
review_text: This was the best idea as a local Austinite, I decided to try out a Resort Pass at The Fairmont Austin Texas. I purchased the Pool Day Pass and the Spa Day Pass. Totally worth every penny. I didn‚Äôt receive any special treatments the passes have everything you need to relax and enjoy. I was blown away by the professionalism and the 5 star treatment from the awesome staff,the customer service was superb, the food and drinks were amazing and being a professional local pool technician I was really impressed by the cleanliness of the pools, spas, saunas and steam room. The tiles at the pool are actually cleaned correctly and I was impressed being that‚Äôs my profession of 30 years so that‚Äôs saying a lot. I spent my day from noon till 7pm relaxing in the Spa lounges and the Pools. I had the tasty fish tacos and the sweet potato fries üòã I had a Great Mojito, and an Angry Gecko drink that was delicious.There was a slight issue at the end of the day involving a pool pump leaking in the women‚Äôs spa lounge, but these professionals handled this minor issue the best they could and went above and beyond to make me and others feel comfortable, They just let us take over the Men‚Äôs lounge (no men using it) and gave me and other women these awesome collagen gold eye masks and that lounge was awesome too. They really handled that situation like champs. The pool staff was also excellent great service and bartenders and also the Valet. Thank You for the best most relaxing day at The Fairmont Austin. It was awesome

The location itself is gorgeous too - surrounded by beautiful palm trees and Camelback mountain.One glitch (and no fault of our wait staff): I don't know who wrote the original Resort Pass paragraph for Royal Palms that states what you will receive as a guest but it should be corrected. The service people do NOT receive gratuity within your original itemized costs, nor do they hand out lollipops (lol!). So, be sure to tip them nicely as they certainly work hard for it. They were so kind they even supplied bday desserts for me at dinner when they found out my friends and I were eating at T. Cook's Restaurant on the grounds. It was very special.

review_title: Cabana at the Grand Hyatt at Poipu Beach
review_text: We rented a two person cabana at the Grand Hyatt at Poipu Beach in Kaua'i.  The covered cabana itself was centrally located with a beautiful view of the ocean and directly in front of the sand/salt water pool.  The Hyatt supplied soft cushions for the lounge chairs, towels, a cooler with cold water and juices and a small basket of so-so snacks.  We enjoyed all of the pools and just relaxing in the cabana.  Shipwreck Beach, in front of the Hyatt, is not a swimming beach for all.  But we enjoyed the views and watching the young people surf the waves.  It was a good and relaxing day!  Jeannine McEgan

review_title: I think ResortPass is a great service, but...
review_text: I think ResortPass is a great service.  I didn't know it existed until yesterday. I love that you can go and use the pool and spa facilities at hotels all over the country. It's fantastic. I give the service 5 stars.  One note, the price fluctuates. When I first saw the Hyatt it was $25/person.  When I went to book 10 mins later it was $35/person.  Also, you never know what you're going to get when you actually get to the pool. There were 3 of us and when we got to the pool, it was full.  There were no available seats.  The pool was full of kids in giant inflatable rafts.  Even though we were told no outside food or drink, a family of 8 got off the elevator with bags of food and a cooler.  I understand that ResortPass has no control of that, but it's a reality that you could get to a pool and there is no room, and it won't be peaceful or quiet. That's why I rated this 3 stars - the service gets 5, but my experience yesterday gets 1 star.

review_title: The worst service and experience at Atlantic Hotel & Spa
review_text: If I could give a rating of zero stars, I would because this hotel does not even deserve one star.  Let‚Äôs begin with the fact that I was celebrating my birthday on August 10, 2019 when we went to The Atlantic Hotel & Spa.  My friends booked this place and bought the Spa Day pass.  I would like to say that we were greeted with a welcoming smile but instead the ladies in the front desk for the Spa looked at our group as if we were low class people, which was very insulting.  The look of disgust that we received was uncalled for and rude.  Not even a ‚ÄúHello, how can we assist you?‚Äù.   It was as if we were bothering them with our presence.   When we stated that it was our first time there one of the front desk ladies said ‚Äúoh, you made it to the front of the class‚Äù another insult.  I am not sure if this hotel trains their staff to treat the guests like this or what, but this is not the type of service we deserved.  We are hard working women and on top of the disrespect we received, we were still polite.  We were a party of seven and they only gave us one tiny locker for the seven of us and told us they did not have any more lockers for us.  No towels were provided and honestly this hotel does not even look like a 4-5-star hotel for these ladies that work in the spa to be treating us like we were beneath them.  When in facts, we all make more money then those two women put together, yet we have manners.  Now, it does not end there, we go to the pool and a guest slipped and fell face first, bleeding everywhere.  No one from the hotel came to assist this poor woman, not even the manager or bartenders.  The guests of the hotel where the ones giving the woman ice for her face and assuring that she was okay, in case she needed to be taken to the hospital.  It still does not end there, we decided to order lunch from the bar‚Ä¶ worse idea ever.  I ordered the Signature Turkey Club sandwich, as I went to take a bite out of my sandwich, I notice a RAW piece of chicken on my sandwich.  Not only was that disgusting but it is also unsanitary and could have made me extremely sick.  Everyone at the table was grossed out, I ended up just eating French fries because who would want to eat after that.  The drinks were awful for the price and contained more sour mix than alcohol.  If this is how this hotel treats guests that buy a Spa Pass, then maybe they should not participate in the Spa Month events because this was one of the worse experiences and to top it off on someone‚Äôs birthday.  I wish I would have asked for the names of the women that work in the Spa so I could name them here because what they did to our group was uncalled for and extremely unprofessional.

It was so hot that day so we only stayed there until 2 pm. It got up to 117 degrees in Rancho Mirage so I do recommend getting there as early as possible. The slide was fun, I even got on it a few times with my daughters. We didn‚Äôt eat there as it is a bit pricey, we chose to eat right after we left. They have free towels to use for anyone that uses the pool. There wasn‚Äôt many people at first but then it got a little too crowded which was about an hour before we left so not too bad. All in all I recommend getting resort pass if you just want to go on a daycation and enjoy the amenities of a hotel for a great price

I did not receive any type of email confirmation or other correspondence about any of the waitlists I tried to put myself on. Does clicking on the "waitlist" option actually do anything?

review_title: We just learned about ResortPass while‚Ä¶
review_text: We just learned about ResortPass while out of town and wondered if you can get a "daypass" to a pool and lo and behold you can! The experience was seamless and we we so glad to have found this! Can't wait to use it maybe locally next time!
The resort was really nice, but the pool service ended at 6pm. That was too early.
Smooth straight forward easy process with clear info and details.  Thank you

Extremely limited (if any) availability for desired properties despite searching literally every date on the calendar. Was NOT clearly stated **prior** to making purchase that  purchasing the Spa Pass does NOT include access to the adult pool (where spa is located) at the Carneros Resort. Considering that the spa area is very small, nothing inside spa area aside from a steam sauna and small outdoor seating deck with no view. Seems outlandish to purchase an **additional $60 day pass** to use the pool, in ADDITION to the $75 spa pass (located in the adult pool area). There was also some confusion upon checking into the main reception upon arrival. They had us down for purchasing a Day pass, when in fact we had purchased a Spa Pass. Fortunately, all of the customer service at the Carneros Resort was top notch and that wasn‚Äôt a problem. However, reception assumed that purchase of the Spa pass included access to the Adult pool, but upon check into to the Spa area the staff assumed purchase of the Spa Pass included access to the Family Pool only (which is located on the opposite side of the property from the Spa) Fortunately, everything worked out. Not sure the value is there to warrant a repeat visit. Why wouldn‚Äôt I just book an actual spa service for the price of a ‚ÄúSpa Pass‚Äù and          ‚ÄúDay Pass‚Äù and have included access to spa area and adult pool as opposed to purchasing a Day Pass &  Spa Pass separately that essentially includes nothing?
Awesome ... good staff
Thought it was kind of strange that I could not book directly with the hotel and had to book online instead but it was convenient and easy.

I made my first purchase, all worked well , the purchase, the booking the actual visit. I am very happy with this arrangement. It gives me an opportunity visit places I normally would not able to. I wish there would be greater selection in North California, especially the winery region and mountains.

Wonderful bartenders, fair prices for food and drinks, and so many water options. The lazy river and swim up bar were my favorites. The only thing that would make things a little better would be if they had a way to clean the pool while guests were in there. I know it‚Äôs really difficult with so many people visiting, but I wish the water was just a bit cleaner. I think this place is perfect for a girls getaway or romantic weekend. My boyfriend showed me resortpass and it looked too good to be true to me. It was well worth the money spent , we payed $35 per person for the amenities at the grand Miami Beach hotel on the beach ! There were no hidden fees which i found surprising. Only a 7% tax which was expected and standards and the valet parking discounted to $12. We had towels , beach  access , 10% discount and access to 3 pools and 4 hot tubs ! Amazing site , we will book again and again :)
Staff was friendly. Amenities were great. Would definitely book again.
We had a great time, a fun staycation for the day!

Arrived at 12 noon still had to pay full days pass.  Was offered a Pineapple cocktail but requested bottle's of water instead which was warm and would not give us cold water.  Child prices only went up to age 13 so had to pay adult price for 13 year old.  Food was not included only a 10% discount on food but still had to pay 18% gratuity charge which is not acceptable.  Price for 2 turkey (processed turkey roll) sandwiches and fries and 1 burger and fries and one bottle for unlimited soft drinks $87.  The price we paid for entrance and food was more than one nights stay.  Would not recommen using this hotel

review_title: Day pass at the Hilton Waikoloa Village
review_text: My family spent the day at the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the Big Island of Hawaii. The experience was smooth and seamless. ResortPass provides instructions on what to do and where to go. We went directly to the Lagoon Desk where we signed in and the day was ours! When we had lunch our server fixed our parking pass so we did not have to pay for parking. We had so much fun we actually left a little early. My family was wiped out! My husband and I were married at the Hilton and enjoy visiting every year. I will definitely use ResortPass again! Highly recommend!!!

review_title: Amazing view made it worth it....
review_text: The venue and view were wonderful. Don‚Äôt think that this is an ‚Äúadults only‚Äù pool, as there were several children there the entire time we were there. There were also broken large umbrellas laying on the ground that ‚Äúneeded to be fixed‚Äù so we had to bake in the sun until the sun finally went under the clouds. The pool bar is definitely worth a visit, as the sunset views are spectacular. Our group voted to go again, but early evening is the best bet. Service wasn‚Äôt great at first, but got better over time.

Windsor Court New Orleans!  Our best hotel!  I live here! Great pool, drinks. Service. Ordered a chicken Caesar twice and chicken was inedible...like shoe leather. Finally just had the salad. My partner had the burger and it was perfect. Hey, Chef....how come u can‚Äôt get a chicken breast right??

review_title: I had not heard of this company before‚Ä¶
review_text: I had not heard of this company before so I was a little apprehensive about using them. I called the resort I wanted to go to and they told me that's the company they used and it was legit. I then went on and purchased 2 passes. It was the easiest site to use in  3 minutes I had the 2 passes and the email confirmation. I would highly recommend this company. I will definitely be using them again!!
